column13: Certainly a favorite place to get great quick Chinese food. Consistently tasty. Generous portions. Friendly staff. Reasonable and cozy ambiance. I try to maintain a veggie diet, and they have plenty of great options for me here. Seaweed salad. Kimchi yum! Buddhas's delight is my go to along with veggie drunken noodles. A great place for take-out. Easy and efficient. Always ready on time.

My friend and I ordered take-out from Wokano, and we both ended up with food poisoning. My friend called the next day and tried talking to an employee and letting them know we got sick from their food.  The employee was rude and basically said "No, you didn't get sick from our food, you are wrong" REALLY?! They tried to tell us their food is not the reason we BOTH got sick. OKAY, Wokano. Definitely won't return.

Stopped in for dinner last night with my daughter. The spot is tiny but cute. There wasn't a lot of folks eating in, but there was a steady stream of people coming in to pick up take out orders. We had friendly and attentive service, but she got both entrees wrong and they were served with the wrong proteins. She was quick to fix once I pointed it out. Our food was ready pretty quickly. The good - the shrimp in my daughters shrimp teriyaki were cooked perfectly. Her rice was sticky and yummy. The bad - the teriyaki sauce was way too sweet. It tasted very sugary and there was too much of it on everything. I had the drunken noodles. Everything was cooked well, but the sauce was very salty. I like my salt, but this was too much.In the end, I would go to other places first.

Our nephew wanted crab cheese wantons as part of his lunch.  Those aren't really in my wheelhouse of things I eat on a regular basis so I took to Yelp to find a spot.  We found Wokano and it happened to be within ten minutes of where we were at.  

We arrived at 3 p.m.ish which is a weird between lunch and dinner time hour to eat.  We got fast and friendly service.  We ordered the aforementioned wantons, along with dumplings for him.  I ordered the Korean seafood soup and the hubs went with crispy combo noodles.  The portions were HUGE!  We both got two meals out of our dishes.  The flavors were good, basic flavors.  My soup was spicy but didn't really have a complexity of flavor other than kimchee and seafood.  There was quite a bit of seafood though for the price.  The dishes  neither blew us away nor disappointed us.

Came to Wokano at the suggestion of a good friend and ordered some takeout.  It was a Sunday evening at 7pm, so while I didn't expect them to be super busy, I also didn't expect how fast they were!  After placing my order over the phone, I was told 10-15 minutes.  I arrived in 8 and the food was there waiting for me.  

On to the food: Usually I'm a little suspect of a restaurant that serves everything under the sun, but I decided to go with it.  While this place primarily serves Chinese, I ordered the pad thai.  It came steaming hot and in a massive portion that could easily feed two.  The flavor was sweet, nutty, and delicious, but not spicy whatsoever.  Not sure if you can request the food to be made with more heat, but I'll try next time.  

Glad this place is so close to my house!  I wouldn't drive across town for it, but with the convenience of Cap Hill, you can't lose!

I have been getting delivery for 10 years. I'm sad to say what I'm about to say. The food is divine. I ordered. They gave me a time. I watched the clock...unfortunately my phone was on silent as I had just gotten home from work. I missed a couple calls from the delivery driver. When I picked up the call I was being screamed at. Yes. The delivery driver was bitching me out because I missed the call to let him in my building. When I met him at the door he went on and on and on...I simply said " calm down" and when he wouldn't shut up I said "calm the fuck down". I tipped the little bitch anyway. I'm sorry you don't really speak English and can't get a job anywhere else but I don't feel I need to be verbally assaulted over 2 missed phone calls. I will order again and I challenge the same driver to show up. I'll be ready for round 2.

We have had lots of Asian cuisine from various restaurants but the food at the bistro rival any of the restaurants I have been to The menu varies from various Asian cultures with some nontraditional flair I had the fried calamari  which was crispynot gummy to be like some of the places I've been also I had the wokcano rice. jalapeños scallops Bok Choy was spicy and savory, The slice of pineapple help sooth the heat.

We were attempting to get lunch at another establishment in the neighborhood and after one look at the line we decided waiting was not on the menu for us this afternoon.  Wokano Asian Bistro caught our eye and we decided Chinese would make a nice lunch on a coldish afternoon.

The interior is what one would expect with a Chinese restaurant with basic tables and chairs and dark walls.  We were pleased to see that the lunch specials were available on the weekend and we both decided to order lunch specials.  For an appetizer we opted for the Crab Cheese Wontons ($5.95).  I chose the Panang Curry with chicken ($6.95) with Wonton Soup and he chose Sesame Scallops ($7.95) with Hot & Sour Soup.  The lunch special also comes with rice and a vegetable spring roll in addition to your choice of soup (soup not included for delivery). 

The Crab Cheese Wontons were a stand out and easily a four star dish.  Not a classic preparation that one would expect from most Chinese restaurants, these tasted tempura fried and were served with a green pineapple mint dipping sauce that kept my taste buds dancing and wanting more. 

My Panang Curry was very good; there was a nice heat level that warmed me from the inside with an abundance of chicken and vegetables.  The Sesame Scallops were more disappointing.  When the scallops were sliced the breading came right off in one big piece and the breading had an odd overall taste and was not pleasing to the palate.  Like any establishment it takes time to find a favorite dish and Wokano Asian Bistro is 50/50 on execution, some things are better than average and some items are below average.  It's not a destination kind of place but certainly meets a need and seems to be doing quite well in the neighborhood and seems to be the place to call for takeout.

So tonight must be the night of Murphy's Law. The first Thai place we tried closed at 9, and since it was 8:55, we decided to spare them the irritation of the last minute patrons. We looked online for the second place, only to learn that they too close at 9. So we try Wokano, and notice on the sign by the door that they're open until 10. Success! So we walk in, and one of the employees tells us that the dining room closes at 9, and that we'd have to order takeout. 

If you're closing the dining room at 9, advertise that. If you say you're open until 10, be consistent and honor that. End of rant. 

I have eaten here before, and the food is fairly tasty. But it might tell you something that this was the third choice, and after learning about the limited hours, it might have dropped another spot or two in the rankings.

I heard about this restaurant through one of my coworkers. I was quite surprised that it was a hole in the wall type of restaurant and not a big chain. It's quite small and has maybe about 10 tables. 

When you enter, you don't need to wait to be seated, just pick a seat. We had a child with us and asked for a high chair, which they easily grabbed for us.

After we put our food order in, we had to wait maybe 15-20 minutes. While we were waiting, we noticed the constant come and go of customers who ordered take out. It also looked like they did delivery as well. 

We ordered cream cheese wontons as an appetizer with their mint cucumber sauce because of previous yelp reviews. It did not disappoint, but the sauce did take a bit to get acquired to although it was delicious. I say cream cheese wontons instead of crab cheese wontons because there was no crab in those wontons. But I'm not complaining because I love cream cheese lol. 

For my main course, I had the combination pad Thai on a suggestion of my coworker. When it was presented, it looked appetizing. It was just ok. I was quite disappointed because the pad Thai was over sauced. It's so hard to find good, authentic pad Thai. 

It was my mistake of trying to order Thai at a restaurant known more for their chinese food. Other than chinese and Thai food though, they serve korean food. Service was good, but the woman taking the orders for the tables also had to take orders from the customers ordering take out. But since they were busy, we didn't get the personal touch of a server and was only checked up on once. 

I do want to come back so I could try their chinese food instead.

Our go - to Asian take out in Denver. The best Asian food my husband and I have had in the United States. I love the pho and he always loves the beef and broccoli and fried rice. Big portions- easily enough for two meals.
While I will only eat crab cheese wontons from this place, they are my favorite. My husband loves the food so it is definitely worth the visit.

Been going to this place for 9 plus years, that too atleast once or twice a week.  I have tried close to 15-20 Asian places in Denver metro region during that time and no one has measured up to this place. Without doubt, one of the hidden gems in Denver.

The food was OK. However, the service was really terrible.
The waiter spited some sauce from wasted dish. 
I asked them for some napkins.
They just thrown a dirty mop on my desk and said"Just clean it by yourself."
No comment on this event.

I was looking for an establishment which offer Korean Spicy Noodles Soup aka Joam Bong aka Jjamppong, hence to this establishment we went.  We opt to have our FOOD TO GO.  That recent visit was on Thursday December 18th 2014.  Time was about 18:43hrs ish.  Man at that time, this establishment is jam packed with other patrons alike and ALOT of TO GO orders.

From the Menu we opt to have the following items :

*  Kobe Beef Noodle **VERY SPICY** ($12.95)
*  Joam Bong *EXTRA SPICY* ($11.95)

Once at home, and I open the disposable container which contained the Joam Bong Broth and tasted it was just OK..  Barely OK, so its more like a "MEH" for me.  YES, they packed the Noodles with all the Seafood items such as Shrimp, Scallop and Calamari.  Maybe I ordered this dish TO GO, by the time I reached home, due to the "water condensation" and its packed while its HOT, the Seafood items tend to be OVER-COOKED.  YES, the Broth is SPICY but its NOT as SPICY as I requested it to be.  *SIGH*

As for the Kobe Beef Noodle, Hubs said it was OK.  The Kobe Beef Noodle, consisted of Ground Kobe Beef sautéed in some kind of gravy, and comes with several steamed vegetables such as Carrots and Broccoli.  Nothing stellar, nothing spectacular about this dish.  YES, this dish, the portion is doable.

Maybe we ordered the wrong items from the Menu.  Overall, it was just "MEH" in terms of taste and flavor for both meals.

*DOUBLE SIGH*

Wokano Asian Bistro is opened DAILY from the following hours :

*  MONDAY - FRIDAY : 11 AM - 10 PM
*  SATURDAY - SUNDAY : 12 NOON - 10 PM

Wokano Asian Bistro
1078 Ogden St,
Denver, CO 80218
Tel : (303) 831-8277

@12/2015

Wokano is truly amazing. Not only do they have super fresh food, and truly, I can't find a bad dish across the entire menu - but every single time I call for a delivery driver is prompt calls me in my shared workspace, and delivers the goods. 

I used to live near them but now whenever I can I find an excuse to order take out or delivery. Do yourself a favor and grab food here!

Great value, good flavors, and good service. I enjoyed the portion sizing and the overall diversity of the menu (from my experience, most of the dishes were well executed as well). Many of the other dishes others ordered were aesthetically pleasing but I did not try them. I would definitely return.

My only negative is that I wish they had online ordering and paying.  I would love to order from this place more often, but it seems like such a hassle when compared to other places nearby.  Their Drunken Noodles with Chicken is awesome, but eat it fresh.  It becomes too clumpy when served in a to-go container.  There carb cheese wontons have a little sweetness in them that make them a little too addicting.

I was hoping to find a good Chinese food place in Denver,CO and was let down yet again.
I'm really not sure how this place has a 4 star review, my only assumption is that there is a lack of good options for Chinese food in Denver, CO.

I ordered for delivery, here are the results:
#1 egg roll: was a thin, over fried and flavorless.

#2 wonton soup: was overcooked, mushy not al dente, and barely had any flavor until I dumped soy sauce on it.

#3 singapore noodle w/roast pork:  was over cooked, pork was dry like a cracker, rice noodles were also dryed out.

#4 chicken w/ mixed vegetables + white rice:  Thankfully, this was not over cooked, it was close to decent.  What ruined it for me was the sauce, it had a light scent of that reminded me of dishwasher detergent.

I will never eat here again, I disliked every single thing that I ordered.  There is no coming back from that kind of screw up.

Pros: I love how fast and to the point the lady on the phone is, very efficient. The Pho is Pho-cking amazing, the meat is super duper tender and the broth tastes good. The pot stickers are boom shakalaka and the Kung Pow chicken would make Batman cry.

Cons: cant loose weight eating it everyday.

Great vibe, awesome food. So good. 

We had the drunken noodles and Panang curry - both were amazing. I'll get the Pho next time since it looked huge and awesome. 

Egg drop soup was also on point. Price was decent too!
My favorite Asian food in Denver!! So good and fast! High quality food and a huge variety too.

This is hands down my favorite Thai / Asian Fusion restaurant in Denver! The food is fantastic as a vegan, I find plenty of great options here, ranging from the Pad Thai (ask for it without eggs and with the wonderful tofu. They don't use fish sauce) to the pho. You've also got to have the spicy edamame (best I've found) and the genmaicha. I live in Boulder and still make the trek down to Denver every two weeks or so to eat here with good friends, most of whom are not vegan and find a wide range of delicious options!

Note: it's a small spot, so you might have to wait for a table. Additionally, there's limited parking in the lot outside, so you will likely have to park on the street. Avoid parking in front of the bar next door or the 7-11, because you can get a hefty ticket / towed for that. 

They do to go orders and delivery too. 

I can't get enough of this place!

My boyfriend and I must have ordered the wrong entree from this place because it was borderline inedible. The restaurant is really small and drafty and the owner is a bit awkward. Take out is probably best. I guess we should have ordered the thai basil like she suggested. The crab wontons were really good though.

Always so, so, so, so, so good!!! 

Wokano is seriously a hidden gem in Cap Hill! The food is always delicious, service is fantastic, they have large portions, and the food comes out VERY fast! 

I love the sesame chicken, and any of the soups! 

Must try if you are in the area!

One of the best Asian restaurants in town. It's a small little place but the food is great! Whether you done in or takeout/delivery, you get a big portion of deliciousness! Staff and delivery drivers are friendly. I just don't like how they serve coca cola in a warm can with a cup of half melted ice. It tastes weird and watered down.
Found glass in my take out Friday night. EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK.

Solid spot. The Orange beef is a little too chewy, but I hardly ever see that dish anywhere else. If it was further away I probably wouldn't go.

We have a relationship of convenience.

Fabulous for dine in or delivery. Huge portions too so take out lasts a long time if you order reheatable things. Wokano does tofu really well, as well as chargrill bowls, all chicken dishes, and appetizers. Great egg drop as well. A true Denver gem and always fast delivery too without a delivery fee. Fried rice not as great as other dishes.

What's going on, Wokano? This place used to be my savory savior 5 years ago. 

My most recent experience was a near disaster. The kim chi soup was watery, sour, bland. The raw tuna in the tataki salad was inedible - it smelled, was stringy/chewy, and my cat wouldn't even eat it (and he eats garbage, for heavens sake). The pork dumplings were overly sweet and bland. Nothing tasted fresh and my friend and I ate less than half of what we ordered. What we did eat we ate out of pure hunger and desperation.

If this is the shape of food to come, I'm worried. I loved Wokano for its unrelenting freshness and wide range of choices. Now the food quality has me looking for another staple. 

That said, I adore the interior of this space. The restaurant is small and intimate, warm and inviting, dark and lush with some bamboo plant accents and tasteful lucky cats swinging their paws at you. Not a lot of seating so if you come during peak dining hours, you will likely have to wait, and there's no place really to wait in the winter.

Maybe the stir-fries and noodle bowls are the thing to stick to...

I've lived here for 9 months and have finally found my reliable Chinese delivery joint. 
Really like the General Tso's chicken as well as their lo mein.  I've found their dumplings to be forgettable and their pad thai to be a little too sweet (and doesn't seem like traditional pad thai).  Portions are massive and delivery is crazy fast.  They also have this cool system where they remember your address based on your phone number.  

So the next time you wanna veg on the couch and watch Downton Abbey, get Wokano. 

Wait.  By Downton Abbey I meant Football.

I don't know why they have such low reviews bc this place is by far my go to Chinese restaurant. I have been looking for this place since my sister took me here 4 years ago and finally found it again and honestly nothing compares (and believe me, I have tried many many places). If you're in the mood for good quality Chinese with reasonable prices I recommend this place with their spicy edamame as an app and their lo mein and fries rice :) can't go wrong!

It is a little hole in the wall and the English is questionable but honestly the best Chinese food in town!

This place is awesome, but also very busy! I usually find myself here on a Sunday night where the takeout orders completely take over the restaurant. It's a small place but the ambience is very lovely and decorated in traditional again decor. They have again fusion, so lots of things on the menu across the spectrum. Thai, Vietnamese, Japanese and Chinese dishes are all available and all amazing! I love their Thai curries and their house dishes are all phenomenal. Very appropriately priced as well, and depending on how hungry you are a dish with rice is enough to share for two people. They also have a great lunch special where most of the traditional dishes are discounted (a slightly smaller portion) but also include your choice of a soup or salad. The staff is so friendly and always recognize me making it feel like a real neighborhood spot. A must stop by in cap hill!

The food is always pretty good but your phones are TERRIBLE. Half the time I get a busy signal the first four times I call, the other half the person cannot hear me and blames my phone. Pretty sure it's yours as I've called from multiple devices.

I live around the corner in Cap Hill and this is my favorite Asian restaurant in town. 

Noticed some negative comments about Wakano's delievery process, but I only dine in and have great service everytime. 

Any dish can be made spicy upon request, and two of my favorites are mongolian beef and chicken with mixed vegetables. They also offer good egg rolls and egg drop soup for starters.

Atmosphere is very dark and relaxed to dine with the family, or even bring a date. Only reason I'm giving Wakano four stars instead of five is because they don't serve alcohol.

I'm here and it's delicious. The general tso chicken was for sure a winner. All white meat and a really good sauce.

Why 4 stars?

They were kinda rude.... O well. Great food.
To be fair they are really busy and 1 server is working.
Mmm...
The best take-out asian spot we've found in Denver. We love the spicy edamame and the drunken noodles.

Wonton soup is so good! Has great spice and flavor. Love this place! Pad Thai is my favorite thing on the menu. Spring rolls are delicious and delivery is so fast. They say 45 mins to an hour and gets to us under 20 mins every single time. Good family restaurant.

This place is really just an over priced greasy Chinese joint. These 5 star reviews are way too generous to put
It lightly. If this is the best Asian food in Denver like I've seen in a couple reviews, I feel bad for this city. I've eaten here 5-6 times, as I live down the street, and every time I'm left underwhelmed. I've had the Mongolian beef, crispy prawns (do not get unless you want that Chinese batter where it seems more like a packaging peanut), pan fried noodles, seafood combo and beef and broccoli. Every single dish seams to have the same greasy Chinese gravy that you can get at any mall food court for half the price. The portions are big, and it's not that the food tastes horrible, but I'd rather have something taste good because of its fresh ingredients, not because it's a sodium bomb gravy boat that tastes like a cheap Chinese buffet.

So sorry - they are drifting down in my esteem.  Tonight's delivery was just plain bad.  The Thai Spring Rolls had nothing (zero/nada) inside but shredded lettuce and rice noodles - no pork, no shrimp, nothing for $4.99.  The Sesame Chicken was mostly fried batter and little chicken plus it was supposed to be spicy and was anything but.  So, $16+ $4 tip for delivery down the drain - literally.  Even the garbage disposal wasn't happy.  Moving on.

Ate here today. I was super hungry so I ordered potstickers (were okay), won ton soup (flavorless and wontons didn't seem cooked), shu mai (cold and falling apart), chicken drunken noodles (cold). 

I tried a little of everything, ate most of the potstickers. Just started feeling incredibly ill and could not keep it down. Still feeling very nauseous.

Wokano is a place that won't disappoint me but it will also not blow me away.  That is fine with me.  We ordered the sesame chicken, chicken lo mein, and pork dumplings.  I was told the delivery would be within the hour so I mentally prepared myself for a long wait.  I was pleased when the delivery was only 20 minutes and the delivery person was a delightful older man.  He was cordial, friendly, and had a jovial tone to his voice.  The food was savory, well seasoned and well portioned.  As I stated earlier, Wokano will not disappoint.  The kind people at Wokano are not reinventing the wheel but their food is delicious.

Looks like a hole in the wall, but aren't those some of the best? 

Ambiance is nice, and the place smells fantastic.

We're summer roll fanatics, and this is the best yet. Big, full of goodies, and the peanut and sweet & sour dipping sauce rock! Tofu Summer Rolls -- do it! 

We also ordered the eggplant in garlic sauce dish. To die for. To die for. To die for. Massive portions, eggplant cooked to perfection! Sauce had some oil, but it wasn't overdone. Nothing was too salty (which is my issue with some Asian joints). Only downside is they charge for extra rice. 

Excellent all around! Can't wait to try the rest of the items on the veg menu!

I thought this was a great little restaurant until I woke up the next morning and threw up 7 times, experienced severe stomach cramps and other problems. (Also lost hundreds of dollars by not going to work.) I couldn't even keep pepto down. I called to complain and whoever answered the phone tells me he "just works there" and to go to the hospital. I said I called to tell you what I got sick on, so someone else isn't  served the same thing (I had pineapple crab Rangoon and the miso soup). He repeats himself. I ask to speak to a manager. I am then told there isn't a manager. Right. He then tells me again to go to the hospital and call the health department. Ok- you win jerk. Called the health department. Beware of this place-might not work out so well for you the next day.

Their fried crab cheese wontons are incredible. The hot and sour soup was really tasty and the peanut curry was pretty good. Could have used a little more spice, but all around, great place. The staff is super kind also

Hey if your gonna get take out , or just want to dine in , this is the best Chinese food joint in town . Deliver my is quick for the most part , and comes hot . Can complain about the price and quality

Wokano Asian Bistro is the best chinese I've found in Denver yet. Large portions, easy to swallow prices, and delicious food to boot. Egg Drop soup was incredible, pan fried noodle dishes and the sesame tofu are some of the best items on the menu. I'll be back over and over and plan to try everything on the menu; it's that good.

I've had a few bad experiences here that prevented me from going back.

First, they say delivery will take 45 mins but it takes an hour and a half! If they'd just tell me that up front, I'd pick it up myself or go somewhere else. I think they have one delivery guy and he won't bring your food to your door, you have to meet him in the lobby.

Second, last time I ordered beef and broccoli and they have me eggplant instead. I'm sure their eggplant is great but it's not what I ordered or paid for.

Their food is good but not worth the hassle. There are plenty of other Chinese places that are good too and not such a pain.

Wokanos has a terrible service. The food is ok but their service is terrible. 
They charge you for a pack of soy sauce, or a pack of hot sauce. When you ask why are you charging me for a pack of soy sauce they say our computer does the charge. I've never heard of a place that charges for soy sauce for take out when its free when I dine in. 
Support other local family restaurants where you will have a better service and not feel like you have been nickeled and dimed.
I immediately got a stomach ache from eating here... Too expensive for crappy Chinese food.

I ordered a Vegetarian dish. There was a piece of FRIED CHICKEN in my dish. When I called to inform Workano they put me on hold 4 times. The guy who worked there told me he didn't like my attitude. I was so sad because I love this place but now I can never eat there again. Know one cared! He transferred me to another person and put me on hold for the 5th time! WtF! I didn't do anything wrong. There was CHICKEN IN MY VEGETARIAN DISH! 
It would have been nice if someone had a cared and said sorry. NO ONE ever apologized! 



So sad

Denver, I love you, but you've got to stop lauding weak food spots for "the best _____ ever!!!"

I've had delivery, I've eaten in, and their food is passable -- the best you're going to find downtown on a budget, probably. That doesn't make it good.

This is by far the best Asian restaurant in Denver! I have tried many Asian restaurants in the Denver area and Wokano exceeds them all. They have a menu filled with a variety of dishes that never fails to please. Even if you order something not on their menu they will make it for you and it will exceed your expectations. Wokano also offers great, friendly service whether it's dine in or dine out! The atmosphere inside is wonderful and the take out is always fresh and hot. I honestly have nothing negative to say about Wokano. I will continue to be a loyal customer!

I love this little place. The food is consistently delicious and quickly made. The staff is thorough and friendly. I highly recommend the any of the stir fry dishes because the vegetables are crispy and fresh!

I've been here several times. The food is always amazing. I've tried several different things like the black pepper steak, kal bi, and Mongolian beef. Never been disappointed. 
Also they deliver in the Cap Hill area too!

Best. Take Out Chinese. Ever.

The General Tsao Chicken & Orange Peel Beef are to die for people. And if you dont order the crab cheese wontons, you are making a grave mistake!

Something has changed and not for the better.

The last two times we got take out it was very greasy.
We decided to give it one more chance last night,and not only was it greasy again,but we got a metal shaving in the hot and sour soup and also another in the combo fried rice.

I don't get the low ratings for this place, it's awesome. The husband and I have been coming here for 4 years now--we used to live right down the street. But even though we moved to Sloan's Lake, we still make the extra drive to Wokanos when we are craving Chinese. We just haven't found any place better! I usually get drunken noodles with tofu, and he gets the General Tso chicken, with an order of crab wantons---so good! Other favorites are the pork dumplings, pho, and black pepper chicken. And omg their portion sizes are enormous, we each get at least 3 full meals from an order at Wokanos. We never eat in though, as it is small and cramped inside. We pick up, and they are always prompted and nice.
They are the worst. Got sick as fuck. Do not eat here!!!!!!!!!!!  Thai Basil is worlds above these dirt bags!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Fast delivery,  I got a headache and stomached ache just hours after eating their food.

This is hands down my favorite Asian restaurant in the Capital Hill neighborhood. 

In six years of coming here, I've never once had a dish I didn't like. Their pineapple cheese wontons and green curry are particularly wonderful. The serving sizes can also be split easily into 2-3 meals. 

The dining room is small but cozy, and they do offer delivery with accurately quoted times in my experience. 

I will continue to eat here as long as I live within a reasonable distance, and suggest you do as well!

Best Asian food in Denver by far, from noodles to the original chicken/beef dishes. Personal favorites include General Tsou's Chicken, Fried Pork Potstickers, and the egg drop soup. 

In addition, the staff is incredibly nice and takes care of you!

best service i have experience in Denver thus far!

the food....oh yeah, delicious! 

cheese Rangoon...probably the best i have ever had!

As I wondered around one afternoon, I stumbled upon Wokano.  Walked in to have lunch. There was only one other table besides mine. 

I started with a wonton soup, nothing out of this world, but still tasty. Their kung pao chicken was really the highlight of my lunch. It was hot but not overbearingly so. It was served with veggies and rice and an egg roll. Everything was really delicious. The food was served quickly. I was in and out - not rushed whatsoever - and very please with my meal.

the Pho is pho-nomenal (pun inteded).  I order from here a few times a month and have for the last few years, the menu is extensive and I have never ordered something I do not like.  It is my go-to place when I want pho.  Highly recommend.
Just found my new favorite Denver Asian restaurant. Excellent food. Service was off tonight but I will overlook that since food was so good!

Oh Wokano. I miss you. 

When I lived in Denver, this was my favorite asian restaurant (and I looove Asian food). I was ordering from them constantly, and I never had a bad dish. The Chicken Lo Mein is absolutely amazing, but so is the rest of the food. Everyone that works there is super friendly, and, when I've gone in for a sit-down meal, I've completely enjoyed the interior decor. It's a top notch place!

HIGHLY recommend.

Great pan-Asian fare! We get carry-out about once a week; everything I've tried so far has been tasty.  The shiitake mushroom dish, however has huge uncut formerly dried shiitakes, which I sliced at home.  It was good, but, be aware.

I was visiting Denver back in January and I heard this was the best Chinese food in town, and indeed it was!

Okay, parking might be a small issue as there are only 2 parking spots in front of each store, but I think parking on the street is not that bad.

This place can maybe seat 20-25 people, so you will get fast service. The waitresses are very polite and attentive and give out great recommendations if you ask them.

The food here is amazing. We ordered quite a lot of food due to starvation mode right before coming here, but here goes!

- Hot and Sour Soup: I'm usually not a big fan, but the bowl was so big I had to try some just for the sake of trying it. It was actually really good! Not as sour as you normally would have elsewhere.

- Stir-fry Seafood Udon?: The noodles were really yummy and not super greasy, and they are VERY generous on their seafood.

- Crab Cheese Wontons: THIS IS WHAT PEOPLE MUST COME HERE FOR! I love love love crab wontons, and the portion comes with 8 perfectly crispy wontons...drool... double drool for their mint sauce.

- Pineapple Cheese Wontons: I've never heard of this combination, so I just had to try it out myself. It was different.. and a must try because you probably won't be able to find it anywhere else.

Now if you don't have time to make the drive out here.. don't you worry! They have delivery service right to your door, and might I add... Mr. Delivery himself is super hot. yum..

I get takeout from Wokano about every other week. Wokano is one of those rare gems that has an expansive menu and almost all of it is delicious. I LOVE their soups - I either get the hot & sour or the miso every time I pick up. I'm also obsessed with their spicy edamame. It's fiery and fabulous. All of their signature/house dishes are tasty, from the salt & pepper pork chop to the kobe beef bowls. Their prices are more than fair. The woman who runs the register is a sassy thing, but a little sass never kept me from a good meal.
Large portions of extremely high quality Asian dishes. Free bowl of soup with lunch. No booze, but good service. This is my favorite Asian in Denver.

Bad food (even by American Chinese food standards), no refills, and uncomfortably hot. The service was acceptable, which is the reason for the second star.

Update: My brother kept and ate the leftovers and felt ill afterwards. The meat is bad quality.

Just called in an order for delivery. The person on the phone wasn't very happy about it so I said nevermind I'll come and pick it up myself.  I ordered the lunch special and then was told it did not come with soup for delivery. I had to pay extra on the side.  I asked why don't  you  include soup and the host says the containers cost money.  I suggested  they charge a quarter more. She was clearly bent and walks off. Now the food.  It typical for Chinese  food but very salty. Drank  two bottles of water. Probably  will go back, most times I give places a 2nd chance.

This place a ok food and terrible service. They don't listen on the phone for delivery and don't listen person. This fat little kid that works computer is a complete jerk. He's a "psychology" major and has zero sense. The owner is a fool. We ordered pick up and they delivered to my old address. When they set the delivery order down our new order was ready. They the kid smarted off and the owner still didn't acknowledge that they were in the wrong. We live with in a stone throw and will NEVER eat there again.
This is my go to place for quick, amazing Asian food.  Everything here is outstanding!  I'd highly recommend this little hole in the wall.

The service here is terrible. I don't even remember the food, so I guess that means it couldn't have been that good either. My husband and I went in here for lunch once and the waitress was, simply put, abrasive. I tried asking her for something that I had forgotten while she was walking away and she turned around in the MIDDLE of the restaurant and said "what?" at me, in front of other customers. I then had to ask her if I "could just have another egg roll, please?" with her still standing in the middle of the restaurant. We then waited 20 minutes after we had finished eating, for our check to arrive. I then noticed, when I was walking to the bathroom, that the reason we were waiting was because the waitress was sitting and eating her lunch for the 30 minutes we had been sitting with no service. I was so appalled and embarrassed by the incident with the egg roll, that I didn't tip her (I work in the service industry and would not expect someone to give me their extra money if I acted that way towards them) she then proceeded to walk outside after us, light up a cigarette, and glare at me through my side view mirror.

I have ordered take out 10+ times from here. Every dish I have ordered has been delicious, the order is always correct, and when I go to pick up/get delivery it is always in the timeframe they give me. My personal favorite is the panang curry. It's a huge portion and typically is enough for two people.

Wonderful little neighborhood asian/thai stop.

All the dishes I've ordered have been stellar. Esp considering how small this place is. If you go ... Let me suggest a few of my favorite dishes that will have your taste buds going bonkers. The Bang Bang Chicken & Shrimp is one of the best things I've tasted. Get this. Also... The Calimari Lettuce wraps are out of bounds, perfect amount of heat and you can taste the calamari. Anyway, the food blows away the expectations you have for such a reasonably priced and modest place.

No. I will not be back.

I came here with a group of 6 and after our meal I wish we had walked a few blocks further to a far more worthy restaurant. My seafood soup tasted like the soup base was made out of cleaning chemicals and the seafood was nuked to a charred crunchiness. My lady friend had a chicken and rice based dish that also tasted like said chemicals. I took one bite of each and did not touch the rest. Being with a large group for a celebration, I just went with it since everyone else seemed content. Or were they just pretending?

When it came time to pay, despite mentioning to the waiter before ordering that we would be paying separately, our waiter make a huge fuss. I get that it is annoying to break out the bill for 6 people, but when asked ahead of time he said it would be fine. What the what.

/complaining

Their curries are great! Much better than anything else in the area! And, best of all, the food is always ready in 15-30mins come hell or high water. The girls up front are cutthroat, but they do so much business that it is completely justified and efficient.

So good!
Chicken Low Mein, Black pepper chicken, miso and hot and sour soup was great. Best Asian food we've had in Denver.  I wish they delivered to us down town!

I've been coming here for 6 years... It's my absolute favorite! The food is always good, in fact, I've never had a bad dish from Wokano. The staff are all very friendly. The last time I was in (day before yesterday) when I went to box my food I hadn't eaten (because there's always leftovers) the lady gave me a fresh new box of rice to take home! I now live in Hawaii and I can't even find Chinese food there that compares to Wokano! Plus I don't think anywhere makes hot and sour soup or wonton soup half as good... Eat here, be happy!!

I'm not pregnant, but I'm eating (enough) for two at Wokano.  Their dishes are perfectly portioned so that you can eat until you're full and then have enough for leftovers the next meal and maybe the meal after that.  Sweet and sour chicken for daaaays.

Despite the big portions, you cannot skip ordering an appetizer.  I'm telling you that their pineapple cream cheese wontons are worth investing in a pair of pants with an elastic waistband.  Their fresh mint dipping sauce that accompanies the wontons is quite literally worthy of being poured in a glass and drank straight.

I prefer doing take out over dining in because their booth seating is pretty uncomfortable (wood bench, meet my bad back) and their tables are kinda close, so I feel like I may bump elbows with fellow diners.  However, in the winter, it's kinda nice to dine-in and sip tea in their dimly lit, cozy restaurant.

Bang Bang Chicken  and Shrimp!  No reason for a six paragraph review....you don't write for Bon Appétit.  Fresh veggies, huge portions, great flavor.  If you don't eat here, you may be a communist.  Enough said.

I seriously order Wokanos once a week. I am a hot & sour soup FREAK and I love it a ton. It has the right consistency, flavor, spice, and veggies. So good. I did not give it the full 5 stars because some of their entrees are hit & miss, but I still love this place. One of the best asian places in Denver, hands down.
Huge delicious portions at a reasonable price. Guaranteed to satisfy your craving. I had the drunken noodle combo which had the perfect amount of spice. The honey glazed shrimp were also delicious.

Best pad Thai in the city!  

Delivery is quick and food is awesome! Great location or if you're looking to order delivery. The spice is just right as well.

I live 2 blocks from Wakano and I thought I'd give them another shot and tried their pho.

I called for a take out order and asked for a shredded chicken pho, they told me they cook their chicken and it wasn't shredded, I thought it was a little out of the ordinary, but ordered it. 

After opening the package the soup was HOT! I had to cool it down in the fridge. The chicken was cooked and as they explained. I guess I'm use to a more traditional pho and won't be back to order their version.
Awesome! Live just down the street and can't stop going in. Soups are great as well as the pad thai.

Visited Tattered Cover on Colfax with a friend of mine and we both were looking for a Chinese Restaurant. Him and I both did a search thru our phone (him thru yelp and me thru Google maps) We both ran across this restaurant. Found in a strip mall next to a 7-11 and a bar.. this place is a TRUE hidden gem. 

Walked in and loved the décor. The space is a little small I must say, but I'll wait if it's uber busy. Our waitress was extremely nice.  It was lunch time and the options they had on their menu where much more than your typical Chinese restaurants I have ever visited & the prices were good considering how much food you get.  Lunch meals come with your choice of soup, egg roll, rice and your protein. Most restaurants don't include a soup. I ordered the "Shittake Mushroom Tofu with wonton soup" along with a Peach Ice Tea. My friend ordered "Thai Chicken Curry with hot & sour Soup." Lets just say the food is "AMAZING" just thinking about it is making me drool. Everything was so fresh, the spice and seasoning were perfect. Oh.. I forgot to mention.. the "spicy edamame" is to die for, literally.  I wish I lived & worked closer to Wokano cause I would be here everyday. 

The 2nd time I came here.. service was a bit slower and our waiter was not very attentive but aside from that the food was just as delicious. 

If your around 11th & Ogden, and craving Asian.. don't pass this place up. I guarantee you will be happy.

No major complaints, best Chinese so far in Denver but that's not saying much.

I got take-out and got the hot&sour soup and the General Tso's chicken. It was ready within 15 minutes.  The soup was good, no complaints.

The General Tso's chicken is a pretty big portion, enough for 2 for sure. It seemed to be mostly white meat with a few dark meat pieces that were a little tough, unless they were small over-cooked white meat (hard to tell).  The breading was just right, and probably got a bit soggy on the way home. It was very sweet but not very spicy. There were a bunch of peppers in the sauce so maybe they just weren't hot but it should have been more spicy and hot. 

I definitely want to go back and try some of the other things. They have a big menu with lots of variety

Wednesday night dinner, quiet despite busy carryout/delivery business.  waitress very helpful. 
Fresh ingredients.  Flavorful dishes, ask for spice if you want it or siracha on the side..
Recommend the crispy noodles in brown sauce with tofu.  Companion liked yellow curry with chicken.  Leftovers for us both!
Great food and vegetarian friendly. The kimchi tofu was a read spicy, but otherwise great. Next time we come back we'll get the veggie pho.
Ordered food and they ran my card for delivery they call back 10 min after the card was already ran saying they can't go that far  get your crap together !!

Since discovering Wokano about two years ago, we've made it a once-a-week staple, and practically our only Chinese delivery. I haven't had a single dish I didn't think was great. The Spicy Edamame is hands down my favorite starter--fiery and full of flavor. Other favorites include: Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, Basil Combination Plate, Panang Curry, Wokano Fried Rice, Joam Bong Soup, and Buddha's Delight. The staff is super friendly and the space is quaint and well-appointed. Delivery is always prompt, and I don't think they've ever gotten an order wrong. What more could you want for neighborhood Chinese?

Absolutely love this place! This is my go to cheese steak spot. Thankfully it's extremely close to my house. 

I have tried a few of their sandwiches but I always find myself going back to the steak and bacon with whiz! I'm also a huge fan of their waffle fries. 

I will continue to go to this place at least once every couple weeks.

Groupon and Yelp are two of my favorite splurges. Yelp comes first. You didn't know that? I consult yelp when I see a great deal on Groupon. A collective impression of almost 152 reviews of a place like Large Marge and you will find the truth somewhere in there. 

Walking in to a clean, well lit place and a big list of menu behind the counter was somehow a relief to me. Such a stark contrast to the strip mall where it's located.

If you like Philly Cheesesteaks, I'm pretty sure you'll love this place.  To be honest, I haven't ever been a fan of cheesesteak sandwiches.  I just never "got" them.  But this place has really good cheesesteaks...you know, for cheesesteaks.  

I really like their mushroom cheesesteak.  My kid likes their pizza cheesesteak.  We have eaten here several times and it has been a good experience.  They're not quick, though.  Just FYI, they don't make it til you order it and they are almost always busy.
I come in about twice a month!! Super close to my house and always hot and tasty!! I recommend the works! The poo sauce is where it's at! Try the fries also they are so good!!

This is one of those hole-in-the-wall restaurants that I'm a huge sucker for; all of the decoration and posters are right up my alley. 
I came here for the first time almost two years ago and was totally blown away by the food, it's very authentic and absolutely delicious. The only other time that I had ever eaten a cheesesteak before I am here was several years ago when I was at a train station in New York, so I'm definitely no expert, though I do like to think that I know a good sandwich when I eat one, which in this case was their mushroom cheesesteak (if that isn't the longest run-on sentence of all time...) The waffle fries that they offer are also really excellent, just greasy and salty enough for me. I've been with friends before and also tried a few bites of the green chili cheesesteak, which sounded like a totally weird combination to me- but it turned out quite good.

A hidden gem really. I'm not a cheese steak type of person but they offered a unique sandwich that warranted all 5 stars. The most Colorado thing to do to a cheese steak? Put some green chili in it and you're in business.

So obviously I'm highlighting their unique mix that worked wonderfully well. It almost offered it a nice spiciness to a type of sandwich I'm mostly indifferent to. The bread and steak worked well, I just really enjoyed the sandwich.

So I also had an order of fries and some fried zucchini. I actually really liked the fries, nice and hot. I like my fried zucchini to be a little hotter and taste more fried than zucchini haha. The price wasn't too bad and my colleague loved her sandwich too. She also enjoyed the zucchini. This place comes highly recommended.

Ate here for the first time tonight after reading all of the positive Yelp reviews.  I can now say that I agree.  This place is awesome.  The staff are very friendly and the food is great.  We had the original cheesesteak and the mushroom cheesesteak as well as the onion rings and the crab fries.  All of them were delicious, although I'm not sure how the fries were "crab fries" as I didn't taste any crab.  The place was very clean (we checked restaurant health scores before heading over and they have always gotten good ratings).  Would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes cheesesteaks.

This is one of the best cheesesteaks shops in the Denver area.  I'm a little shocked I haven't written a review yet, since I easily frequent this place once every couple weeks.  And not just because I love all their posters of Frank Sinatra. 

They have a few dozen cheesesteaks on their menu, in addition to hoagies, wraps, crab fries and all kinds of delicious things.  Whether you're a strict believer in Cheez Whiz or not, you can find the exact combination that's right for you.  And they have a variety of sauces and dips you can add to your sandwich. I personally prefer American cheese on my cheesesteak with a side of either white cheddar sauce or their nacho cheese sauce. Freakin' delicious!

I think the only negative thing I can say about this place is the service isn't always great. There are usually teenagers working at the register, so sometimes it can take a little bit to get your food. But even though they're sometimes slow, they're always friendly.  

Yay for awesome cheesesteaks I'm Denver!

I want to start by saying that I LOVE Large Marge's. I love this place. 

I'm not from Philly, but I am from New Jersey. Furthermore, I'm from a town in New Jersey that is 45 minutes from Philly. Meaning I used to frequent Philly. A lot. And I adore cheesesteaks. A lot. 

So when my wife and I moved to Colorado, I was a little ambivalent. On one hand, legal marijuana. Major plus. On the other hand, where am I gonna find tasty cheesesteaks? For me, this was a dilemma.

Then I found Large Marge. Amoroso rolls? Check. Perfectly cooked ribeye beef. Check. And of course, at least for me, cheese whiz. Friggin' check. On top of that, the onions are cooked to perfection. By the way, I usually get the Original because I'm old school like that.

The fries are awesome. Thick, not thin like an anorexic teenage cheerleader like Taste of Philly. Ooooh! And the Poo sauces that accompany it are fantastic.

Final verdict, this place is top notch. Side note: try their fried zucchini. I hate vegetables, but they fry them up oh so well, so I love them.

I'm not a fan of this place, they put dill in the breading of their fried pickles, they use breadcrumbs on their onion rings, the spicy ranch gave me the hurly hiccups after 2 bites (Had to stop eating it before I vomited!) and their menu on the wall is basically unreadable from further than 4 feet away. (Face the front door to find take out menus) The advertisements for "poo" sauce also grossed me out. Didn't expect that... Their idea of "Crab fries" is a few specks of Old Bay, and you could barely taste it.

The cheesesteak itself was good, but I avoided the velveeta cheese sauce, so YRMV.

Took about 20 minutes to get my food cooked with 2 couples in line in front of me.

Decent food, okay service. Not really worth the drive, for me. Got the Philly Phanatic (with onions), and made it a combo with drinks and waffle fries. I've never had a really Philly cheesesteak, in Philly, so I'm not sure how it measures up to that. I have had other Philly cheesesteaks - Pop's in PB in San Diego, for instance, and the food was remarkably similar. It's been over two years since I've had Pop's, so it's not side-by-side, by any means, but they're very similar overall, each with their own distinctive thing, but this one was actually decently spicy, or I've gone soft in my Colorado-living. The sandwich was a decent size at large, I probably could've gone with less, esp since I got the combo, tho, I didn't finish my fries because...I'm picky about fries.
The waffle fries are kind of jo-jo like on flavor and seasoning, a bit too much grease for me. The sandwich at Large Marge's (sandwich) was thankfully not too greasy (the one drawback at Pop's was they were pretty greasy.)
The different sauces were...okay. The BBPOO sauce was probably the tastiest, didn't really like Batch 1, POO sauce was okay, Chipotle was okay. Spicy ketchup was not spicy, but it treated like ketchup, so whatever, did the job.
The service...well...that could improve, unless maybe they're trying to give us the East Coast Jersey/NY special attitude. The girl taking the order was not terribly friendly and kind of abrupt. The guys in back weren't too bad tho. She just didn't really seem to want to be there, which, whatever, it's a food-service job that probably doesn't pay very well and doesn't make much in tips, so I get that, but still, she had attitude. I've worked in customer service for yards, and it was just lacking. Other people got asked how their food was, I pretty much got ignored. I don't really care, because I don't really like people talking to be while I'm eating and whatever, but if that were important to you...I dunno, I have resting nice face, so normally I can't get people to stop talking to me, so it was strange that they really didn't say anything.
The tables could've probably used a good wipe down, which came after I'd already sat down, and they skipped mine, whatever. It was after the lunch rush by a bit, so...I just see that as a bit lacking. I may be grouchy tho, as I had to get up super early today and didn't get much sleep last night. I still like to think I'm giving a fair assessment.
It's okay, but not worth going out of your way for.
Great place to eat! So yummy and they use authentic rolls. PLUS, military discount on Monday nights.

Great sandwiches is all I can say!  The peppers are spicy as they they should be, and the bread is awesome. They even have Tasty Kakes. We have been back east many times, and this made me feel like I was back in Philly.

I'm from Philadelphia. Large Marge makes a decent cheese steak. It's not the best cheese steak I have ever had, heck it probably doesn't break the top 10 but it's by far the best representation of a "cheese steak" I have encountered in Colorado.

We went to LM today based on the reviews. It is also close to our house. We were so disappointed after eating there that we went to Taste of Philly right after to get a real Cheesesteak. 
The fried pickles were good and that is the reason for the one star.

5 stars. "Pat's", eat your heart out. Huge menu, great sandwiches, and (of course), Tasty Kakes (Butterscotch Krimpets, plus others)...oh,  and don't forget,  Poo Sauce. DON'T FORGET THE POO!

Check in for your free small fries.

Tell 'em Large Marge sent ya!
Philly phanatic is amazing. Along with crab fries, the cheese sauce is just cheese gold  worth the drive! Sorry no picture cause we ate it all

In high school I was a waitress at a hole-in-the-Wall Philly Cheesesteak joint. We served burgers and lots of fried food as well. The owner was from Philadelphia and he was Italian (plus I learned some colorful Italian words)! I said all that to say that it has been years since I have had a true yummy, mouth-watering, delicious Philly Cheesesteak. Oh my goodness this place is the bomb! I feel like I won a price when I found this place and let me tell you about the fried mushrooms - hmmmm... yeah... I could eat those everyday!

Yum! This place does it right. My usual go to is Pat's, but there aren't any locations on this side of town. I found large Marge with the help of Yelp and decided to give it a try based on reviews and I'm so glad I did. Takeout service was quick, efficient and friendly. I had the Philly Phanatic and it was the perfect combination of sweet and hot peppers. The waffle fries were crisp and gone before I got home. I'll definitely be back and will be sure to tell others about this place.

I've been going to this place for quite some time. The sandwiches are all excellent. Fresh bread, excellent seasoned meat, and customizations aren't an issue. Many of my coworkers are fans of other sandwiches, but I prefer to go with the original with provolone, tomatoes, lettuce, and mayo. The only negatives I have about this restaurant is that they do not offer fresh brewed iced tea and they really need to clean the floors and walls of the restaurant. Other than that, excellent cheesesteaks.

Huge fan here. Awesome food is a given. Service is steady and inviting. Have yet to try all of the appetizers, but have not been disappointed with the main stays (cheesesteaks, hoagies, etc.) in my four visits so far.

The meat inside the bread (or hoagie) is well stacked, not lacking much at all (least of all in flavor). I just tried their latest special (called something like the Bully) and it did not need any additional condiments (such as ketchup, spicy ketchup, or any of the other special sauces).

My wife would usually dip her food in the spicy ketchup but the Bully cheesesteak was of a different ilk and needed nothing else.

Glad to have a Yelp check-in offer to get some free fries each order. They make up for it each time with how much we get.

Always looking forward to returning.

I'm not from Philly, but a good friend of mine was born there. We have eaten Philly's in many cities in numerous states so I have come to be schooled in authenticity when it comes to Philly Cheesesteaks. Not that I'm an expert, but Large Marge's is the best I've eaten. The Sweet Hot is delicious. Just enough fire and just enough sweet. Also, the original is just like it should be, cheesy meaty goodness on the right bread. This is a monthly spot for our taste-buds.

My boyfriend and I live right down the street and are weekly sometimes twice a week regulars now! The lady at the front counter is always super polite the gentlemen in the back seem to be enjoying themselves, everything is cooked fresh to order and I've never waited more then 25 min on a busier night. Defiantly a hidden gem and a place to stop if you're passing through
Bought this cheesesteak sandwich at the taste of colorado. Not a good sandwich...small and no taste

Awesome specials, and never a bad experience front lady is always nice and gives good recommendations, Yeah she's cute too... But I have had a lot of there specials and every time it feels like it was made with same awesome expectation, a lot of places fail at this consistency with large marge's makes them the go to for a perfect sandwich with that awesome sandwich anytime!

You ever had the craving for a perfect cheese steak and fried awesomeness? look no further! Large marge has it covered! This place does it like no other, big portions, great pricing and a pretty decent atmosphere. Do not forget to try the sauce! and don't forget the fried zucchini!~

Growing up on the east coast I move here in 1992. The one complaint I had was that I could not find a good philly cheese steak.  I found This place by accident and I must say that this is the best Sammy place that I have found in Denver and the people that work there are very nice and love what they do.  Git sum!!!

Ohhh yes, I'm goin a full five stars for this one. The BEST cheesesteak I've had in Colorado! Denver Ted's has nothing on this place. 

The bread was soft and chewy, the ratio of meat:cheese:toppings was spot on, the poo sauce (hot sauce) was the perfect addition, the waffle fries were crispy and amazing. And they offer spicy ketchup. And Tasty Kakes!! 

The service was really friendly and I thought the prices were quite reasonable. I also like how you have the option to order a steak, chicken, or vegetarian Philly- there's something for everyone! They have a pretty extensive menu and although I just went with the tried and true "works" (cheese, peppers, onions, mushrooms) for my first visit, I definitely plan on trying some of their other options in the future... I've got my eye on the green chili Philly for next time. 

In a pretty random strip mall and you might not notice them unless you were looking for it. But you should look for it. Because it's delicious!

Read some other reviews that stated LM was WAY better than Philly Ted's. I respectfully beg to differ. In my opinion, it's not even close. Philly Ted's is WAY better. They are also a lot bigger. The sandwich at LM was very bland. I got the Works and there was very little cheese on it. The best part of the meal was the Frings although there were only 4 onion rings. Probably not going back for a second time.
Love this place feels like back home on the east coast where they know how to make real cheesesteak subs.

Just to clarify that this review is for real I'm from Philadelphia and know what a cheesesteak is supposed to be like and these guys have it right. I'm seeing more people here from Philadelphia at the Flyers and Phillies games so I know you're jonesing for a real cheesesteak. Check these guys out and you won't be disappointed. They use Amoroso rolls and have wiz!

Decent place to eat. I'm not normally big on cheese steaks but a friend of mine took me there and I had a chicken cheese steak and I have to admit that it was a very good sandwich. The staff were very nice and service was excellent. If I'm in the area I'm sure I will stop by and eat here again.
So much to choose from and we will need to go back. The fried mushrooms and onion rings were fantastic too. Just heavy on the gallbladder :) in a good way. Sauces were pretty good too :)
This place is amazing!   Great people, awesome sandwiches! And they now deliver.  ,,,,,,,!!!!!!!!! !
Stopped in for the first time. Got the broad street bully. Delicious! Employees were nice to everyone that came in.

Absolutely awesome food!  I'm not really a cheesesteak person, but I'll go back for this steak again and again.  Service was good, prices are good and the food is wonderful!  Both the fries and sandwich

I love this place, when I'm in need of a Philly sandwich... I've been many times and can't get enough. I always get the same sandwich the great green chili philly plus lettuce. I can't get myself to try another one because I'm hooked! I do plan to explore others when I'm feeling adventurous. I have tried a bite of a plain one and it wasn't exciting, in order to enjoy this place, you've got to get more than meat and cheese. I also love the fried zucchini with the spicy ranch! All there sauces are good. I just have to warn the folks that can't handle the heat, you better be careful! I'll return plenty more times, I need to conquer your menu. Love you large marge eat ya later!
As a Philly native - this is authentic and awesome! Thanks Large Marge for giving us a taste of home in Denver. Major yum!!!!
Delicious cheesesteaks! Pretty good service, fast food and they accommodated the different tastes of my whole family. The four of us filled our tanks for less than $25. Yes, please!

Finally stopped and checked this place out after driving by it for years. Tried the regular philly cheese steak and a turkey grinder. Also got a side of kettle chips. The order was to go, so didn't have a chance to chill in the decor of the place. It is next to a middle school, so I wouldn't stop by around 2:30. Good grub.
I have to say I have had a lot of Phillies and this place is the bomb. The cheesesteaks are fresh and very flavorful! Will be my new place for the Phillies!

Wow....I simply Googled a great restaurant near a certain location and this was #3 besides a Thai and Chinese place. So this means BEST American!

I had the pickled Phillypeno. WOW! Great tast. Lots of sides. The Poo hot sauce is great. The kitchen is spotless clean! Great ambiance. And Brook is the clerk/server. A true Goddess.

This is the place for a great Philly. Must visit!

Yeah, went here again after various other cheesesteak adventures in the Denver area...meh. The folks in there seemed tired and burnt out. The rolls where stale. The meat was chopped so small and in turn overcooked to the point it was like sand. They don't mix the cheese in with the meat. Just slop it on the bottom of the bun. No love. The deep fried pickles where good! Sorry Marge..... Just sad I guess.....

I had the pepper cheesesteak it was defiantly the best I have had anywhere around Denver. I had to try all the sauces, even the poo sauce lol. I will defiantly recommend this place to everyone I know.

One word. Obsessed.

The sandwiches are THE BEST and the side items are all awesome. I've never been disappointed with the service or the food. We pick it up to-go at least once a week. So delicious!
Very tasty and good size portions/meat and reasonable, highly recommend for lunch or dinner

I think the old saying is wrong because good things come in big packages too. Just look at Large Marge's where big chunks of beef and cheese spill out of hulking rolls. My hands could barely hold the sandwich, but every bite was delicious. So too were the delicious fries that overfilled its paper container. This place has some yummy sauces that you can add to your fries including a smoky/spicy BBQ sauce.

While Large Marge is unassuming from the outside, she makes a big and delicous sandwich inside.

How is this place so good? Everything.
Highly recommend the fried zucchini, crab fries and the hot bbq philly. Oh and the dilly philly + peppers.
Fabulous! Best cheesesteak ever, wonderful friendly service. I had the chicken BLT, he had their signature, both fantastic. Excellent value, highly recommend.
I grew up in the Philly area and LM has always been a taste of home. I've never walked out dissatisfied.
Not a cheesesteak connoisseur, but the stuff here is awesome! Reasonably priced, too! I got the supreme (or whatever the loaded one at the top of the menu is called) and it was killer.

Absolutely amazing. I have not had a single tying there that I don't like. My personal favorite is the broadstreet bully. And the wife prefers the green chili Philly. Amazing staff. Great food at a great price.
I've only been here twice but I should stop.  It's extremely good and will eventually make me very fat if I keep going.

Public Service Announcement.  

This place makes a DELICIOUS cheesesteak.  You can pretty much have it any way you want it,  with anything from mushrooms to peppers to jalapenos to grilled onions,  about 5 kinds of cheese (including wiz).  Order "one wiz with".....that's "with" onions,  and some onion rings,  you will NOT be sorry.  It IS right across the street from the Wheatridge Rec Center,  so it is unfortunately a great way to undo whatever exercise you did there.  Or should I say,  the Rec center is a great place to earn your cheesesteak!

One star dinged for the limp undercooked fries.  Sorry guys!  We DID order them on the fly,  so it can be excused.

If only they had beer.
I'm jersey girl and am always dying for good philly cheese steaks. This place does it for me! Try the fries and onion rings (frings) yum!

I have been working across the street from this place for over three years and never knew it existed.  I came here to get a quick sandwich for lunch.

A cheesesteak is a cheesesteak.  There's always the standard variations, and each place has their own non-standard ones, and they are pretty hard to mess up.  What makes Large Marge's more distinctive is the house made hot sauces.  I sampled most of them, for the most part they have good flavor but as you make your way up the ladder there's less taste and just a challenge to make it burn more.  However it complimented the sandwich nicely.  Also the kid behind the counter was extremely friendly, and the price is pretty reasonable.  I imagine I'll pop back in once in a while when the mood takes me.  It's worth it.

Went today and while the service was great as usual the food was absolutely terrible. There was hardly any meat on the sandwich and the oil the fries were cooked in was so old it made them taste awful. They want to expand their business, but at this point I would not even bother, the food has been a huge disappointment the last few times, so don't bother. Marge did a much better job than the new owners, it's just sad.
Very tasty.   Real nice girl at the counter.   My 1st trip in will not be my last.   The Poo sauce (say like "boo") is a nice kick to the taste buds.   Clean lobby.

I have been all over the Denver area looking for a good Philly...look no more!  This place is awesome.  I come here frequently and have never been disappointed by the service, food or atmosphere.  They have expanded their menu which is a nice feature but it's hard to beat the original Philly.  Thanks Large Marge for doing things right!
Great food but every time i eat here i get intestinal pain like no other if your tougher then me your lucky !
Constantly  good cheese steak and AMAZING fries. Small eating area, great  art on the walls, and always friendly  staff make this a must for lunch when we're  on this side of town.

This place is so good.  Every sandwich I've tried so far has been fantastic. My family met me there today during my lunch break and they LOVED it too. The kids had the Green Chile Philly (awesome) and my husband and I went for the Philly Phanatic (more awesome).  The waffle fries are the best we've had (my daughter says they put Chick-fil-a waffle fries to shame).  Dip them in the spicy ranch!  If I wasn't afraid of becoming a large marge myself, I'd eat here twice a week.

Soooo good!  I get the large, eat half, then save the second half for after my shift. The half that sits for a while is actually my favorite, there's something about letting a cheesy philly "set" that can't be beat. Always friendly staff,  highly recommend

What can possibly be said about a cheese steak place that will rock your world for $10. The sandwiches are over the top with flavor, and the bread is excellent. This is true comfort food especially if you have ever eaten a true Philly cheese steak. Genos cheese steak in Philadelphia has nothing on Large Marge.

Large Marge is in Charge! Seriously the best philly cheesesteak sandwich I've had in years! I got the Phanatic Philly which has hot and sweet peppers, caramelized onions, and cheese and it was finger lickin good! The bread was soft and chewy, the beef was tender, the hot peppers were HOT, cheese was melted and all the flavors married perfectly in every single bite. My date got the green chilli cheesesteak and he said it had great flavor. We also got the "waffle" fries which are like crisp cut fries and I love that they had a variety of ketchup's including spicy and chipotle. I wish I had more time to study the menu but the lunch crowd had just arrived and I was wielding a cranky sick baby. From what I saw, they have a full menu of appetizers, sides, and possibly over a dozen different kind of cheesesteak sandwiches. I got the small which is 6" the large is probably 10" or 12" I couldn't tell.  I can't wait to go back and try all their sandwiches and sides!

I don't always eat Cheesesteaks.... But when I do.... I prefer Large Marge's...

Great little hole-in-the-wall, though a bit remote. Authentic, fresh-made Cheesesteaks & hoagies made with care.

The kicker for me is their hot sauces-- Their original  "Flaming Poo", and now the uber-hot "Tumbleweed Tyler's Tell Me Tomorrow" sauce really get my chile-head juices flowing. Some of the hottest stuff you'll find anywhere in town.

Yum.

Cheesesteaks a delicious! The reason I gave them only 3 stars is due to their hours and closing early. They are suppose to be open till 8pm during the week (it would make more sense to stay open until 9 because the cheesesteak crowd loves to eat a little later), but they had the doors locked at 7:45. The cashier was cleaning up inside and avoided eye contact with me by any means necessary. Needless to say I didn't get my cheesesteak fix for the evening.
Amazingly good!

Love this place. First couple times was alright but tonight was on point. Got the Green Chili sammie. And it was perfect. Should have added jalapenos though. I ordered off grubhub and usually it takes an hour or longer was expecting it at 850 got here at 820. The delivery driver was so nice. Definitely will order again soon. :) don't forget to tip them well. Good work guys.

Who ever Large Marge is sure knows hows to make a good Philly Cheesesteak.  I'm not and expert in the Cheesesteak department but I've had enough to know the difference between a good and a bad one.  The LMPC is in the better than most area for me.

The bun was fresh, the meat was flavorful and the toppings were tasty.  They offer a handful of options on the menu and a few custom hot sauce options.  I like a little spice so these are right up my alley.

The place is a little divey but the staff is friendly and they make a quality cheesesteak ... that's all I need to keep coming back.

Those who've made the bold statement that this is the best Philly cheesesteak are not kidding.  This is a delicious little gem tucked away in the heart of Wheat Ridge that is awesome!  Their cheesesteaks are incredible, as are their Italian sandwiches.  I can't compare the new ownership with that of the original ownership, but these guys (the current owners) who run the place clearly know what their customers like and appreciate.  Reasonably priced, friendly service, and great food make for a most excellent combination in my book.

Oh, and their signature "poo sauce", i.e. hot sauce, has enough kick in it to make the sandwiches all the more tasty.  Depending on one's digestive system, the name for the sauce may be a little self-explanatory.  I love it though!

More like 3.5 stars. Pretty good cheesesteaks. Ordered a Philly Phanatic which came with a boatload of crispy onions, hot/sweet/jalapeno peppers. It's honestly not that different than the other "traditional Philly" places I've eaten at here in Denver - South Philly Cheesesteaks and D'Angelos in Boulder. Better than SP, but not quite as good as D'Angelos. Had a side of very crispy and heavily breaded onion rings which were pretty tasty.

All that being said, I've never been to Philly, so if this is the traditional style cheesesteak, it's not my choice for cheesesteaks - Penn Station crushes every cheesesteak I've ever had, but it must not be "traditional," as their subs have a much different kind of bread. They only seem to be on the east coast/Midwest, and it'll be the first place I stop when I go home.
LM does it again! Each time is better than the last. Try the broad street bully with chicken and bacon!

Great sandwiches! I mostly order their green chile cheesesteak which you can get with or without onions. They will ask you. Fries are great and they have some good items for kids. For at least the second year in a row they got an A or A+ from the health inspection department. That makes me comfortable and want to keep coming back to support this great local business.

Marge's Marge's Marge's....

I want to like you, err... I mean the food your offer us.. Err to be precise the Philly Cheese Steak you offer us here in Colorful Colorado...  Was here with Hubs on Saturday Afternoon November 12th 2011 after running several errands.  We were starving so I suggested to Hubs to head to Large Marge's Philly Cheesesteaks in White Ridge neighborhood.

Indeed the lady who took our order is welcoming and inviting.  If I am not mistaken Hubs order The Works Philly (LARGE) ($11.00) with the Whiz.  As for my order I opt for the Small Mushroom Philly ($5.25).  The food came out piping hot, and thankfully the portion was huge for my appetite that afternoon.  Its indeed messy and indeed we need several layers of napkins to just eat our food.  We also shared the Cha's Cha's Green Chilli Cheese Fries ($5.00) and Onions Rings ($4.00).  Hubs had the 32 oz Drink ($2.50) while I opt for the 20 oz small drink at ($1.50)

All in all, Hubs feel that his order is A-OK.  Hubs added that he is not into the Whiz thingy as part of the cheese thing.  I think he prefers his Philly Cheesesteaks with Provolone Cheese instead.  Hubs also said he likes the Cha's Cha's Green Chilli Cheese Fries.  Same goes to me, I also like the Cha's Cha's Green Chilli Cheese Fries and the Onion Rings.  I like it when our food is prepared hot since that afternoon was a little chilly outside.  Thankfully we have a place to seat at this establishment to enjoy our food.  All in all our experience is 3.5 Stars for the service, 3 stars for the food and the ambience of this establishment.

I also like the photographs and all the newspaper clippings which featured Marge and the celebrity she has come across with.  A small establishment to dine in if you choose to.

We tried this place for the first time today and I must stay I was really impressed. We came in about midway through the broncos game so it was DEAD! But the staff was all very friendly and extremely accommodating when it came to special orders etc. We will definitely be returning in the future because the food is very good and made to order, no nasty sitting around all day kind of stuff and the service was definitely neighborhood style. One word of caution is the hot sauce is Extremely HOT which may or may not be your thing. If it is this is the place to get it.

We came to this place hungry and left very satisfied! The cheesesteaks are authentic Philly and you cannot get a better one in Denver! The staff is friendly and the service is quick. I had the Mushroom Philly and my husband had the Pepper one. They were so great! We had the fries once and the jalapeno poppers. Poppers were to die for! Clean place, good food, friendly people. what else do you need!

My first time at this place was a few weeks ago and I was blown away. It was so good! i came back today and again it was delicious! Ian "turtle" was the guy that helped me both times and his service is very professional and helpful! My cheesesteak was spicy, just how I like it! The place is clean with lots of seating and a TV with the game on. I will be coming back here more!
This place was awesome. The rolls and meat are straight from Philly every week. Hella legit.

Holy Crap it's good!! The service was amazing, the gentleman who helped me today was super friendly and helpful and the food was served quickly. And the food....OMG. The fried mushrooms with the spicy ranch....man. So good! The sandwhich was delicious, lots of meat and cheese and flavor. This was my first time eating here and I will definitely be back!

Another great find from yelp search.  Was in the area and they had great reviews so I figured I givem a chance. So glad I did. Very clean place, friendly counter help. Went with the Philly cheese and fries. Both the Philly and the fries were excellent.

Official update: The fried zucchini is to die for. This is the only breaded and fried thing we ever eat, pretty much, and we adore it. There's way more in that breading than just bread crumbs and a lazy seasoning. It's a work of art.

Also, if you eat the Batch 2 and Tumbleweed regularly, it brings up your heat tolerance really fast!
