If you haven't tried this place because you're closer to downtown rather than out west, you're in luck -- I learned recently that LM's is establishing a presence at lots of home sports games. You should call them and find out if they'll be at the ones you're attending so you can get hooked!

Best. Philly. EVER. Do yourself a favor and try this place out. Your taste buds will thank you. Super friendly staff, delicious sauces, tasty fries, and a killer philly with soft bread and a perfect spice. We will be back for sure! Thanks Large Marge!

Bees knees kids...

I was in Wheat Ridge yesterday visiting the folks and had a little extra time.  I'd been wanting to visit LM for quits some time now and man...I wish I hadn't waited this long as it's simply incredible with the key word being simple.  There's not much in the way of decor with some tin signs and a lot of patron supplied stickers.  It's perfect.

I walked in and was greeted by one of the two new owners.  I gave my order which was written on a ticket (I sincerely miss that) and money was exchanged.  I was the only cat in there so we go to talking and the two guys are nice as can be and you can tell that they love this.

They have poo sauce which is a hot sauce and then they had a hotter one.  I was warned but I'm pretty adventurous (dumb) and used it for my fries.  It's delicious but it's hot.  Not hot in the way that people tell you somethings hot because they are afraid that you'll cry and salt your own tears with your tears.  It's legit hot.

The sandwich was sublime.  I got the mushroom and it was everything that I was expecting based on what I'd heard from friends.  Soft bread, piping hot filling and I could taste everything that was described.  Onions, mushrooms, cheese and beef all working together to make one perfect hot sandwich.


I will be back and soon but not just for the food.  It's refreshing to see to hard working dudes that love what they do and can't wait to share it with you.  

Good show boys.  You've got something to be proud of here.

Best philly sandwich ever. Bread is on point. Sauces are really goood. 

Do yourself a solid and eat here pronto!

I think this place might be under new management because I remember trying it a couple years ago and thinking it was below average.  I was right by it today so I decided to give it another chance.  Super cute, friendly girl took my order and my food came out fast even though there was four people in front of me.  Probably the best Philly in Denver currently and I think I've hit most of them.  I'll definitely be back!
The Philly hoagie melts in your mouth... The fries are great... Lots if dipping sauces... & the guy behind the counter is cool & very fast friendly service... About 5 min for deliciousness...

Very tasty, but only 4 stars.

The cheesesteaks are delicious with tender meat and vegies. A very good value.
Poo sauce is kick ass. I love it. Really good on the crispy fries.

Excellent service. We were asked if we were virgins and when we said: Yes, we were given perfect advice about what to order. These people care about helping their customers have an enjoyable experience.

Beer! Yea! Cheap beer. Yea.
Free W-Fi (just ask for the password).

I have some minor complaints:
1. While the bread is quite good with a moderate crust, it is not from  http://amorosobaking.com/ . Cheesesteaks in Philly use Amoroso's bread. Period.
2. No forks. The sandwich does not hold the mountain of innards so a fork would be handy.
3. I am a Provolone person. Just don't belong to the Whiz fan club. And, yes, it was my own fault for not scrutinizing the menu and ordering the desired cheese. I just went with the flow. Won't happen again.

I don't know 'authentic' Philadelphia cheesesteak from fried rice, but the ones here are pretty tasty and a good selection. They also make a killer Italian hero. Real friendly folks and good prices. Give it a try, you will be happy.
Super tasty philly phantastic!  Would hv given five stars, but meat was more gristly than I expected.

Delicious cheese steaks at a great price. The fries are awesome too. You would never expect the cool atmosphere in the strip mall location but it rocks. The homemade got sauces are delicious too. Fries are perfect and a large sandwich is able to be split. Plenty of meat on a delicious hoagie.

Just went to LM's again on short trip to den. As always large marge's kicks ass. These guys really know what they're doing so if you get a chance to go I would do it. It's great to support a local business and they are super nice guys. I always get an XL works and a fanta. The fanta is from Mexico (I think) so it tastes way better cuz it has real sugar in it. -ryan

Great find! This is a great mom and pop cheesesteak and hoagie place, best cheesesteak we've had in the area. Great variety from your average cheesesteak. We had the green chile one, combo hot and mild, and it was very tasty. Just a short jaunt south of I-70, east side of Kipling. Friendly and exceptional service. We'll be back!!

Magnificent! Definitely one of the best Philly Cheese Steaks I've had in Colorado, hard to say anything but five stars. No complaints, just great flavored bread, meat and  toppings.  Ordered the works and everything was cooked well and very affordable as well.  6 inch was $5 out the door. Will be back for sure.

Not a bad place to stop. Very no frills. I had the philly with mushrooms. Wasn't bad, not very cheesy. Meat was not overly flavorful. Staff was great.  I'll go back and give it a second try because I thought it had potential, but I wasn't sold on the first run.

Lovely place. It was a fast food place now you can sit or order to go. Large menu with options from real Mexican from American/Mexican. 

The service was good manager check on us as well as our waiter. 
Food was yummy I can't complain about anything 100% recommend it

Visit #3 with a friend for lunch. I ordered the Vegetarian Combo: 1 Cheese enchilada, 1 guacamole tostada, and 1 bean burrito, with hot green chili smother. I love guacamole tostadas. It is a true freshness test. I ate it all, so it wasn't horrible, but it was just starting to turn that funky green in spots. Enough spots to bring about the ick face here and there. The cheese enchilada was definitely a cheese enchilada. The cheese all gooed out and became one with the enchilada sauce on the plate...soup! It was good though! Their enchilada sauce is pretty darn good! It probably mixed with some of the green chili smother.
I took my bean burrito to go and ate it later. It was a basic bean burrito. The smother was supposed to be hot. It was not. It tasted good. 

Service. It is kinda weird there. They don't really "check" on you, per se...that I have experienced. But it's kind of OK. Spotty...service is spotty. In fairness, I think there was 1 lady running the whole dining room, at lunch.

I have ordered the street tacos, burrito supreme, crunchy tacos, enchiladas, and everything has been so delicious and fresh. I love their array of salsas! I always ask for the spiciest one. Lately my regular order is the beef street taco. They are very generous with the cilantro and onion and the plating is always very pretty. The service here is speedy, you seat yourself, and we always get a friendly server. Everything is very reasonably priced, so that encourages me to return frequently. I love that this restaurant is two minutes from my house. 

I feel like a few reviews on this restaurant are basing them on one bad experience. All restaurants have a bad day, we are human and people make mistakes. I have been here more than five times and overall it is a really great restaurant. Only give it a bad review if you've had more than one bad experience, otherwise you sound like a whiner.

All right everyone, it's time to rejoice, and shake your collective booties. What's brought on this display of mirth, you ask? The popular South Federal restaurant known as Fritangas has spawned a sister in Aurora, and here's the skinny.

Seeking just a little snack to ward off that hunger? How about some Molletes? This northern Mexican specialty consists of hollowed-out Bolillo bread rounds filled with refried beans and cheese, then grilled to just the right level of gooey-ness. You could also have a look at their array of cornmeal creations - Sopes are round and Huaraches are sandal-shaped but either is topped with your choice of grilled meats, veggies, etc. (Sometimes Fritangas even has Tlacoyos, which are also corn-based and a bit more oblong than a Huarache). Or why not try one of their quesadillas, stuffed with mushrooms and cheese, spicy chicken, pork rinds... (by the way, if you do go this route, please be advised that the quesadillas served here are the folded kind, not the Sincronizada (one tortilla over another) variety). Oh, those didn't fill you up? No problem! Here's still more to meditate over.

One of my most favorite sandwiches is the Mexico City wonder called the Pambazo - fried chile-soaked bread stuffed with chorizo and potatoes. And Fritangas definitely does it right - you'll be feeling the burn more than a certain Secretary of State after just a few bites. I've also always been a big fan of Alambres which, in the version offered here, presents no less than five meats (ham, chorizo, chicken, steak, and hot dogs) stir-fried with onions and bell peppers, then napped in thick melted cheese. Ah, you're in a more marine mood. Well, in that case, a big steaming bowl of mixed-seafood stew [Caldo de Siete Mares] will be just what you need, and then some. Another good choice is Carne Tampiqueña - grilled beef sided with a cheese enchilada, rice and refried beans. But it's all good, so why not become a regular at Fritangas, and work your way across the menu?

Color me surprised to find that a place that looks like an old Taco Bell is an actual Mexican restaurant! I've been eyeing this place for awhile upon the suggestion of my coworker that they not only serve huge portions at a low price but never really found the time to come here. Enter in a Sunday morning right after a killer workout and in need of some food to fill me up. They have a drive thru (because they used to be a Taco Bell??) so I pulled up and ordered a sausage, egg and potato burrito ($3.75) and bacon and egg burrito ($3) and a minute or two later, I was driving away with two huge burritos. They put green chile on their burritos and I got the medium but really didn't catch any spice from it. It kept me full for a good portion of the day and my fiancé loved his as well. We will definitely be back for breakfast or to get food to go before heading to Dry Dock!

I have been here a couple of times now and I really enjoy their chili Riano the crispy ones are absolutely scrumdiddlyumptious I get it with a mild chili the wait staff here is very friendly they treat you like family I really enjoy this place and it is very close to my therapy five stars all thumbs up.

Surprise, Surprise, Surprise, and this place has mostly good surprises at that.  I have watched this particular building for many years.  It was built to be a Taco Bell many years ago.  It has housed coffee shops, donut shops, more coffee shops, and was abandoned for many years.  When I saw a new restaurant opened, I figured I would try it before it was gone.  After eating here, I think they might just make it (after all). 

I have had the smothered shredded beef burrito, the smothered barbacoa burrito, and the al pastor tacos.  The shredded beef burrito had much more beef than I expected, and was flavorful, tender, and slow cooked to perfection.  The barbacoa had a rich deep flavor that I loved, and was even tenderer than the shredded beef.  Both come with beans, lettuce, tomato, sour cream, guacamole, and smothered in green chili.  I found a mixture of mild and hot green chili to be the perfect amount of heat, and the flavor is fairly good.  The tacos were above average, but the pastor was a bit under seasoned, which is heartbreaking as tacos al pastor has been one of my favorite meals since I was a kid and discovered them in Mexico.  The tortillas were (unfortunately) store bought.  

The staff is friendly (or at least smile a lot), and service is prompt.  The restaurant is clean, but stacks of unwrapped chips in bowls by the front door are a bit unappetizing (and unsanitary).  I skipped the chips.  I will return to this restaurant, and hopefully in the future they will fine tune their processes.  I think this place could be my new go to Mexican food restaurant.

I've visited on multiple occasions but now that their drive thru is open its SO much easier to grab lunch as you run errands. The lunch menu is a great deal that includes a drink!!  I've tried & loved their chicken salad, tacos, quesadillas.  Only downfall if you dine in....no alcohol.

Carbon egg burrito was amazing. So was the bacon egg burrito. Very friendly staff. My new favorite Mexican restaurant. Clean dining room. Clean bathrooms. Salsa just right. Chips were good and crispy, but not too oily. No complaints. 

Went in for a quick, unimpressive burrito to eat in the car with my daughter, but the friendly atmosphere persuaded us, so we stayed, sat down, and enjoyed a very nice lunch. Will be coming here regularly.

I wanted to give this place a shot, I pass by it often and there is always more cars in the parking lot than there ever was when it was any other business. Including Taco Bell! 
As soon as I walked in I was greeted by the young lady at the register and she was extremely helpful. I knew I wanted a breakfast burrito, I just didn't know what kind I wanted or how big they were. She probably could tell this was my first time there and she answered all my questions without hesitation. 
I ended up getting a bacon breakfast burrito and it was a good portion for the $4 I paid for it. It was loaded with bacon, potatoes, eggs, and cheese. There was plenty of green chili on the inside (you can never have enough of that) and it definitely filled me up. My daughters like them, I liked them, we will definitely be back. 

One suggestion, make sure you ask for salsa, they didn't give me any when I placed the order. This would have topped it off perfectly!

Mexican food and brunch always go well together in my books. We moved down the street from this place called Fritangas. The building used to be a Taco Bell back in the day and now has turned into a small quick dining joint. We finally tried it out and were not disappointed. I got a chicken fajita omelet with spicy pork green chili and hash browns. Brian decided on chorizo and eggs with potatoes, beans and mild pork green chili. What I learned was that their spicy green chili is on fire! The mild has better flavor and you can taste your food. :) The chicken fajita omelet was killer. The food and service were fantastic.  The only drawbacks for this place is that the seating area is small and they close pretty early if you want a late night bite.

Love their pork green chili!!! Love the shredded beef chimichanga..I could eat there everyday.
Service is friendly and place is comfortable.

Pleasant experience on Federal/Alameda and seeing this one opened up here, got me lil excited.  Its very old Taco Bell building and I was looking for no frill Mexican breakfast that packed good values and still tasted decent. I know the other location had plenty of breakfast specials and always packed.  However.. none of those to be found here.  Didn't even see the pan handler like the other place (hope not)

The interior was clean, newly remodeled/ painted   and friendly family staff working and I would definitely give positive points for that. 

breakfast I got (forgot the name but it was two strips of bacon, heaping portion of hash browns, other half of the plate filled with chips smothered with green chilli and topped with one egg scrambled for $10 with side of tortillas).  Tasted very meh bland and green chili was very sour and reminded of cheap jar I got from local grocers.  It was overloaded with carbs and served with more carbs on the side.  I would definitely not order this anymore. ...dont ever get this.

Paid over $13 including tip and I was very disappointed for today's visit.  my stomach still feels uneasy from overload of green chili.

I wish nothing but the best to the owner and the staff and thank them to for being courageous to venture out and open another restaurant.  However, I m hoping they will really see the feedbacks from fellow Yelpers and do the drastic changes if they want to survive at this location.  I really tried to give 3 stars but this location haven't earned it yet.

5/8/15.  Two smothered chorizo bfast burritos to go.  Let see how they turn out.  Better.
Great little place to eat at !!! Nice and clean and very very very sweet Service I was very happy with the food quantity and quality

Very authentic Mexican food and if something is not prepared correctly, they fix it. The other reviews sound like their problems are in communication with the mostly Mexican workers here. Be patient and kind and it'll all work fine. I found their food to be absolutely delicious and freshly prepared. Happy little place!! Living just down the street is nice too!!
Delicious, fresh, spicy menu selections. Sincere attentive wait staff. Bring the family, you'll all love this place for Mexican food.

Newly opened 02/23/2015.

Things are still a little confused, but service extremely friendly.  Dining room seats about 50-75 ppl both booths and tables.  Was nearly filled for Tuesday lunch.   Their menu is enormous and breakfast is served all day.  

No waiting area for to go orders makes things clumsy for sure.   I was also clued in by the owners son the drive thru would be open by April 1st.  The patio will be open over the summer.  Not planning liquor license for a few months or maybe end of summer at the moment.

I'm glad something new came to this location.  It needed some new life.  I'm awaiting my to go order.  If it's any indication of what's to come, it sure smells good in here!  

Updated:  I ordered shredded beef burrito with red chili.  I am so glad I did!  Shredded beef was tender and full of flavor, burrito was stuffed.  Big enough for a hearty appatite or to be shared with a neghibor.  Red sauce was also a nice surprise as it was flavorful and not just tasting like a bunch of cumin and chili powder like some places nearby.  Also shared  Queso quesadilla.  It was on the smallish side, but again stuffed with melty queso fresco.   

Nice addition to the neghiborhood.

I really super like this place so today had to be a hiccup. 
Went to breakfast this morning and I noticed that the food coming out of the kitchen was coming out sporadically. When we got our food one of the plates was VERY cold, like it had been pulled from the fridge. Mine was "ok" but not really up to standard. I'm guessing a new cook?

I've been driving by this place for over a year now and finally decided to stop in and see why they always seem to keep a steady flow of customers.  I ordered a smothered and been burrito that was very delicious!  I ordered mine to go but the staff was fast and friendly.  I will definitely be back.

Know your Spanish or might get something you don't want.  Thought this would be a place to get a good home cooked Mexican meal.  Instead I was handed a take out enchilada de mole and asked when I sat down to eat if I needed something.  I had wanted a home cooked Mexican meal on a hot plate. Also, I was told I could have cheddar cheese and what they thought anglos would like to eat.  This was not a good experience! Yucka-bucka! My take out portion was smaller than the plated portions.  The enchilada de mole was okay and beans so-so. Tasty  small portion of rice.  I ordered a papaya drink.  It was best of all.  I did get to taste the mole before I ordered.  I won't return.  I like to have a pleasant meal for my money.  There is some kind of sincere caring lacking.  AURORA LOCATION

Food is excellent. Prices are great for what you get. This is way more authentic style Mexican than a lot of other places nearby. The bacon breakfast burrito was killer, and the chicken mole isn't bad either.

Settle down yelpers with your 2-star reviews. No one cares if they didn't fill your water glass as often as you'd like or if the napkins were empty. The food tastes good and is very inexpensive. Give it 5 stars and spare us your novel-length reviews.

This is a great quick painless dining experience.  The prices are good the service is friendly and helpful food is above average and the breakfast menu is good stuff.  Parking is a nightmare - be patient.

Service is always friendly and their green chile is great. 

The reasonably priced breakfast burritos are a plus too.
Ordered 4 breakfast burritos from here yesterday and they were gross.  This is not the first time the food was horrible but we decided to give them a second chance.  Won't be eating there again.

Great place for a different breakfast place. The prices are good and so is the food. No issues with service. The menu is large with many options for breakfast. The bean sauce on my breakfast enchiladas was spicy and delicious!

The food here is outstanding though the drive-thru can take anywhere between two minutes and 45 minutes. 

They make all of the food to order it's hot and delicious but some of the options can be pricey and hard to find on the drive-thru menu (which should be rearranged).

Overall this place has great food and good service so I go there often.

The sad part is the food is good, but the people who work here are morons. The first bad experience I had was the waitress charged my card with the wrong bill. So over fifty dollars came out of my debit card when our meal was barely fifteen dollars. They acted like they didn't know how to fix it. 
The second time we ordered food to go, a number nine to be exact which come with a bean burrito with chicharrones. They forgot the chicharrones.
The third time we came in and ordered two number nines, they didn't bring our tacos. We had to ask for them. 
Annoying..........

Very disappointing with cold food and cold service.  I called ahead for a takeout order of tacos.  Two different people took the order on the phone and when I showed up an hour later as I told them...no order was present.  

I waited around another 20 minutes and then my food came out lukewarm.  Disappointed in the first bite, it went in the trash. Will not be back again. Do not try to call ahead to this place to order.  Terrible....

This being my second time It was just Ok. I ordered a #6 combo with hot salsa. It is not hot at all. We also ordered wings which were very small and disappointing. Some items here are good, but others need work.

Went to a new Mexican restaurant in our neighborhood. I was surprised to see one crop up since we have 2 other Mexican restaurants within a 2 block radius of this new place. They took over the old taco bell building that has one of the worst parking lots. We have seen several businesses fail because of that stupid parking lot design for the drive through. I spoke to the owner a week before they opened & he had mentioned they may offer a drive through if things go well. Watching over the last week or so when we drive by, they have kept steady & busy.

There's not enough places that will make mild food for someone like me. I can't have hot peppers, not because I'm a wussy, I just don't like having a swollen tongue. The menu is HUGE. All the food is fresh, no frozen or canned ingredients. I had Carnes Asada & my husband had chilli releno & a chicken chimichanga. Quite delicious!  This little restaurant starts you off mild on just about everything and you decide how hot your food will be when you order it. I finally can have a flavorful & mild dinner. I had to fight a few tears of joy because I have not had menudo in so many years and they have it. It smelled & tasted like the menudo the neighbors use to make and feed me on weekends. I ordered a large and took it home to have today. It was good eats and I appreciate that they gave me a free sample of the menudo before I decided to order some to take home. 

The portions were generous & maybe not as good as the home cooking I've had but it's damn close. Also some of the best service I have ever had. All the waitstaff share serving each of the tables. We will be returning since they offer a few things that our regular place does not offer. It's great for a small restaurant.

Was recommended this place by a fellow yelper. Unfortunately I wasn't too impressed with it so far. Granted I've only tried breakfast items so far. This review may change if I enjoy one of their non-breakfast items in the future. 

The people who work there are exceptionally inviting and kind to their customers. The inside looks very bright and vibrant and includes Mexico City posters. 

I've gotten breakfast burritos twice here now and neither have been too impressive. All breakfast burritos come with free chile and cheese and are a decent price for the size of burrito compared to most places around here. If you're ordering your breakfast burrito for take out then you can get a coffee to go for a dollar. Which isn't too bad of coffee. 

I got the machaca burrito and was sad about its blandness. The meat was cooked well and wasn't dried out and you get quite the helping of meat in there which is nice. But it overall was kind of bland, even with the green chile. 

The second time I got the chorizo and potato burrito since I love chorizo and chorizo is never bland. However I'm not sure if it was just today, but the chorizo was a bit over cooked and was mostly chewy and sometimes crispy where it had cooked too long. The potatoes are the freezer potatoes that are small and disappointing. I love potatoes miss the fact that they used fresh potatoes in everything  back home. This is pretty standard in Colorado have potatoes like this unfortunately. Even in some of the popular brunch places. 

I'm gonna try some of the meals next time and hope that this close to home Mexican restaurant has better lunch/dinner food.
Tacos de Asada plate was ok. Chips were stale. Most food was pretty salty. Fast service and friendly. Pretty clean. Affordable.

Bland. More flavor at Taco Bell. I really wanted to like this place because they have a drive thru. I got the #7 combo, mild. Pretty presentation but no taste. Perhaps hot would have been better. The meet had no seasoning. The tostada and Taco shell were on the burnt side. Not enough cheese to taste. Lettuce and tomatoes were fresh and that's the only positive thing I can say.

We came here expecting good Mexican food, but when we arrived, it seemed like a fast food joint. We ordered food and sat down, not knowing that it was actually a sit down restaurant. When we got our food, the enchilada was not even coooked. The cheese was still stringy and cold. The rest of the food wasn't very good either. At least we gave it a try. I'd rather go to Taco Bell.
This food is pretty gross I'm just gonna leave it at that. The only good thing is the horchata.

Great food.  Real Mexican food.  Had the carne as ads steak and it was amazing.  Cooked perfect. Beans and rice were also delicious.  Hard to find a good authentic Mexican restaurant in aurora.  Great service.

Not bad food.  Wanted to try something new but some if the menu items are not made yet. I will go back to try a torta or one of the other items I have not heard about. 
Margaritas would be a nice addition to the already huge menu.  Service was good and it was fairly
Crowded. Taco Bell it is not but the vibe is still there.  Adios till next time

Impressive! Salsa is good, perfect amount of spice, but the basket of chips and bowl of salsa they bring to you is tiny.....however, if you ask for more they are more than happy to refresh it. 
I had a cup of tortilla soup which was really good and a chile relleno and it was the perfect amount of food b/c the relleno was smaller than at most restaurants. I also got the half/half sauce and it was plenty spicy. 
My bf got the burrito supreme and it was big. We both thought the food had great flavor. The kitchen was kinda slow even though it wasn't that busy so our sweet waitress offered us a dessert for free. We had the fried ice cream, but it was strawberry ice cream, I've only ever had vanilla with fried ice cream so that was different but a super nice gesture. The staff was VERY friendly.
Great prices too. Can't wait to try breakfast!
If you like great Mexican food this is the place in Aurora.  Must try everything on the menu!

We live across the street from this Fritangas. We grew up in West Denver and didn't realize this is the same place near Alameda and Federal. Their chorizo breakfast burrito is awesome. The Carne Asada tacos are fantastic...even have huancaina sauce. Awesome!!

This place is down the street from my job so we order from here a lot. Ive only ever had their smothered burritos and they are soooo GOOD! All my other co workers enjoy their other entrées that they serve. Staff seems to always be friendly, ive never had any issues.
Solid menu, well executed food. Three of went, my daughter had the pastro tacos, my husband had tinga gordita and I had the sopa azteca and quesadilla de papa. All very good.

Passed by this place for a few months since they opened. Watched the progress of their build out.  They did a great job transforming such a small place! 
Sevice, very friendly and prompt.  Food quality,  very good. Value of their food, decent!  Only reason it's not a 5-star, I don't like Mexican restaurants that do not offer free refills on chips n salsa! $2 for a 2nd basket? Come on!! Plus the chips were very stale and salsa was very watery and weird flavor?! Almost tasted as if it were sour?? 
But all in all, I'd go back!  I can get over the chips n salsa, because service from all 3-young girls was very good and the food has good flavor. For  3 of us to eat, spent $31 including tip... One being a kids plate. Not bad at all. I'm glad to see a mom n pop doing well in that building.  I try to support family business.  
Give them a shot!!

I come here regularly and love their sopes, but this time I wanted something different.. Well I ordered the milanesa torta and the fish and rice for my kid, the milanesa was very over cooked, the bread was dry, and the fish was really mushy. Neither of us was able to finish our meal or enjoyed it at all...
The kitchen needs to be consistent!!

Great menu selection including breakfast. 
The portions are good. Everything tastes delicious. 
The best part is the very reasonable price and excellent service!
We will absolutely be going back!

The food is actually really good here!  its a shame that the service is so terrible. From the beginning I felt like I was walking into a chuck e cheese with the bright colors and gum ball machine in the door way. All fine with me. We sat at our rocky table and waited far too log for our food to come, when it did finally come, we were out of water and never once got asked for refills until our plates were empty and we were waiting for the bill. Our "server" had her hug school friends in, and was way more concerned with them then her tip. I'll be back, but only for pick up.
Our family enjoys coming here. Excellent food. Huge breakfast burritos reasonably priced, excellent tacos. Great customer service! We keep coming back for more.

The service is why I'm giving a 4 but the overall experience was probably a 3. Friendly staff and extremely attentive. The menu is massive! My son had the pastor hurache: this thing is ginormous, he loved it and finished the entire thing. Daughter had pastor tacos: store bought corn tortillas were disappointing especially with a taco shop pretty much across the street and tacos y salsa a couple blocks away. (Go to either of those for your taco fix.) Hubs had combo #1with taco, tostada, chili relleno and enchilada: he said it was goid but the chile relleno was cold. I had the combo #6 with a beef burrito, Chile relleno, and enchilada: the entire meal was cold... The manager offered to redo mine but we had waited awhile already so I opted to stick it out. He did comp 50% of my order and brought us out fresh Chile rellenos. Those were great! So for a first experience I'm glad they tried to redeem themselves. I'd love for them to work out the kinks and do well here. Side note: horchata was good. Sopapillas were just ok. I'll be back and update their progress.

We went to Fritangas the first week it opened and wanted to give it another try before writing this. On our first visit we found very slow, confused service. The food was decent (even though they brought my hubby a different torta than what he ordered).
We went again yesterday for breakfast and again found the service to be slow and confused. The place was about 1/3 full and there were 3 girls serving.
We waited close to 30 minutes for huevos rancheros and huevos con chorizo. My potatoes were undercooked and our food was cold. They do not butter the toast so expect a dry half toasted piece of bread.
I see potential here if they could coordinate between front and back of the house. Staff needs more training.

What happened to your website, Fritangas? One of the best parts about this place was their site. You click into it, and this sexy, booty groovin' R&B jam kicks up immediately. It gets your heart pumpin and in the mood for food. Tacos, pretty good. Burrito, according to my man, pretty nice. We only went there a time or two, and haven't been back. Maybe that says a lot, but I think a lot of it is the hours, too. But I'd go again.

Do this place! Obviously they are still working out the opening kinks but, the food was awesome, everyone is super friendly and from what I could see, food safety and sanitation is actually being practiced(right now). I think they've layed the space out well for how small this joint is. I think they'll add a few more tables(I could see 2tops). Get here and give a try. Tomorrow morning may be a breakfast stop to give it try.
This was delicious. My family wanted to try this place for a while. The one on Alameda is always full. The portions are huge. Overall this was excellent and most assuredly we will return again.

We always do dinner take-out from Fritangas and the food is delicious! We have never been disappointed with anything we've ordered off of the menu! Their combination meals offer a lot of food and I like that you can order food mild or spicy. Highly recommended for good Mexican food!

Update 3/10/15: made a second visit and have to downgrade. We ordered a steak smothered burrito, a carne asada smothered  burrito and a smothered carnitas burrito. The steak had no seasoning whatsoever and the frijoles had absolutely no salt. The carnitas burrito consisted of a tortilla filled with refried beans and some fried pork bits on top. Still love the salsa provided with the chips and salsa but they give u a very small basket of chips and a tiny ramekin of salsa and charge you $2 extra for more. My hubby still likes the breakfast burritos so maybe just for breakfast?

Wow! Mexico City fare in Aurora. Food is authentic and awesome. Staff is uber friendly. Had the Huaraches De alambre (diced steak). Glad me and hubby shared. It's a lot of food!
The breakfast burritos are delicious!! Big and cheap but flavorful.  Their tortas are delicious as well!!!

Wow! FINALLY a good restaurant in this neighborhood. This is my new favorite place. Went yesterday and came back tonight. 

The first evening I had the Fritangas Burger. Mind blown! Amazing flavor and unlike any burger I have ever had. This burger had ham, bacon, hot dog, pineapple, avacado, cheese, lettuce, and tomato. I am not sure what kind of cheese they use but it was very delicious. 

Tonight I had the crispy beef tacos. Without exaggeration these are the best crispy beef tacos I have ever had. They even make their own shells! 

Prices are good, Service is spot on and super friendly, food is amazing, and the place is very clean.

Not sure if just different or not but had the Super Fritanga 
Jamon, queso de puerco, salchicha, chorizo, huevo, milanesa, doble queso, y pina which sounded good but was very bland no real flavor.
Great Rellanos! Best waitress I've ever had. First time here but you can bet I will come back soon.

Superb, the chimichanga's are good.   Try to over order food over the phone I only have a single line couldn't get through went in to order food to go with the credit card machine wouldn't work so this point no longer a fan they suck

We love Fritangas. It's our new go to place...everything we've had has been great!  We tried the special tonight...Chile en Nogada...it was excellent...we've never had anything like it!   It truly was "special"!

The food is always great. I've had nearly everything on the menu at this point and I've never been disappointed. If they started serving margaritas there's a good chance they'd put Las Hadas out of business.
Breakfast burrito egg and bacon, hot chili sauce, great way to start the morning!  Haven't really tried anything else, but I like this burrito!

Prices are too high for the food quality. The cook forgot the chile on all four of our breakfast platters, then the server brought mild instead of hot. It was like begging for service, we finally gave up. I won't be going back.

Pretty decent. Had a carne asada and it was legit. My only suggestions are that this place shouldn't be a server restaurant. It could easily be an order at the counter and find a spot place. I also warn they don't have liquor so if you have your heart set on a margarita- well ya wont get it here. They do have fresh juices though....Its a new place so I will extend some growing pain grace :)

I absolutely LOVE this restaurant! Hands down the best place for Mexican food I have found in Aurora in years. The staff is very friendly and efficient and the food is delicious! I have already recommended this restaurant to most of my friends, and every one of them that has tried the food is hooked! I will definitely continue to bring my business and referrals to Fritangas, keep up the amazing work!

Waited 15 minutes before ordering and 30 more for food. All items on the menu should have taken five minutes to plate and serve.  Desserts looked good but after over an hour we just wanted to go home.  It was a Thursday and the food was average. Now I know why they always look busy, people are taking up tables for over an hour. Wait staff needs training and kitchen needs to speed it up. 
To be fair, there were a dozen tables filled (about 2/3 capacity) and three groups came in for take out. Take out was given priority, they did not wait longer than 5-10 minutes.
Breakfast is top notch, green chili is rich and tasty. We had good quick service. I will definitely try it again.
Fast and friendly... Stay in or take out. Their lunch specials are a particularly good deal- fresh ingredients and really yummy!

It's hard to find good Mexican food in Colorado.  This place is fantastic!  Having lived in SoCal before moving here, I miss the authentic style Mexican food.  This place has it in spades.

Staff was friendly and the place was clean.  Aguas Frescas for like 4 bucks!
Fantastic, delicious carnitas. Service was great, very clean, I'm so happy to have actual Mexican food close to home. Check it out

This is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant. Love everything in the menu and the staff is so nice. If you haven't tried this place you are missing out. Reward yourself and eat here, breakfast, lunch or dinner everything is delicious.
First time visit and we enjoyed our lunch very much I had the enchiladas mole and my wife had a carnitas burrito. They were both very good. Service was friendly and attentive. We will return.
Omg thank goodness this empty building found someone. ....the place is sooo clean & the food is sooo good,,,only thing missing is a margarita! Take out it is! Lol

The place and food were ok. When I go into a Mexican restaurant my expectations are to eat good wholesome food and feel great about the service. Very clean on the inside as they just opened. Chunks of onion in my breakfast burrito was a first, I recommend they be chopped smaller for enjoyment of food. Definitely something to test out, as they are new to this neighborhood my feeling was a tex mex and nothing to set them a part from other establishments. I would prefer a flavor or sauce unique to the establishment.

My new go to place for authentic Mexican. I have had their tortas(fantastic), tacos de lengua(my favorite), and the chile relleno burrito(huge and delicious). The service gets better every time and their desserts look fantastic, I just never have room.

Went to dinner here on a Friday night!! No chips!?! What Mexican restaurant doesn't have chips because they had a large party come in and take them all. Then food Came was so much grease it was sitting on the plate in the middle Flauta was soggy! Ask for some guacamole came out runny and look like baby poop. Will not be back and don't recommend you eat here!!!

Not to shabby for my first time the chips and salsa are a little skimpy but good the presentation, service and quality is right on I do recommend a sign saying dine in I thought it was a fast food joint but all is well it's not to bad will try again!!

This place is apparently tied to the Fritangas Mexican restaurant on W. Alameda.  At least that's the address on the bill we got.

This is about what we expected for a restaurant in a remodeled Taco Bell.  We ate in, as opposed to some of the other reviewers, and thought it was OK.  Our food was not cold, as noted in several reviews, and the service was great.  Very friendly and attentive servers.

Is this a 5 star restaurant?  Of course not.  Hello?  It's in a Taco Bell building!!  But the food was pretty good and the staff was trying very hard to please.  We'll definitely give them a couple of more tries before making a final decision, but I've had much worse food in much bigger and nicer Mexican restaurants.
We go there like 3 times a week. So authentic and such great food there. The carne asada plate and breakfast burritos are awesome.

This dive-y looking spot is super good. It screams 70's inside and out, but the food is yummy. The tacos dorados are really good with their homemade green salsa. Their street tacos are also good, would definitely try their many flavors. The breakfast burritos all day long are a convenient and affordable option, but be sure to ask for their green salsa. YUM!
Not bad considering this is an old taco bell building.. We didn't expect much, but it was clean, staff was friendly, food was pretty good.
The food was really good and the service very friendly and attentive! Great new restaurant in the area!

My son loves this place for their breakfast burritos. Agree with the no place to wait for take out orders if restaurant crowded but the staff are friendly and the breakfast burritos delicious. We bought some to eat during our camping trip and it was still good heated up the next day.

Let me just start by saying I really want to like this place, they have good hours and it's right by my house!! So far the breakfast burritos are pretty good, totally worth the money. But the service is not so great, ate in once for breakfast, food was good service was I guess okay, and I think it was the owner serving us. Dinner food was boring and bland, nothing special at all. And the two other times we've picked up breakfast burritos ive had to repeat the order 3 times for them to still get it wrong and if you want more than 1 salsa for 3 burritos you have to be very specific and practically beg for enough, and check before you go because they still try to get away with not giving you what you asked for, and yes I offered to pay for the extra salsa. Not so sure I'm going to come back :(

We went there today.  Overal it was a good experince.  Food was good and cheap. The place was about full when we left. We did not get chips and salas. I am so use to that at a Mexican Resturant but for some reason I did not miss it.  That way I ate more of my meal.

This location has not had a very good history when it comes to restaurants.  I was glad to notice that a Mexican restaurant opened in this spot as I pass it every morning on my way to work (there was a coffee shop there last and it didn't last long).

First impression is that the staff really needs training.  I never knew who was serving me as the server coming to my table seemed to be a different person each time.

I came here for the first time yesterday...since it's an old Taco Bell I thought it was a fast food Mexican place but when I walked in there were 3 waitresses standing around and I realized it's actually a sit down restaurant.  It's too small to be a sit down.  I decided to order a burrito supreme to go. It wasn't bad actually, but someone in the kitchen put a Styrofoam to go container under a heat lamp, so when I got my burrito the container didn't close because it was misshapen from the heat lamp.  By the time I got home I had a little mess because I spilled some green chili in the bag.  This is obviously a training issue.

I had noticed that they also had a breakfast menu, so this morning I decided to give it another try to see if my prior experience was an aberration.  Two different waitresses approached my table...I told the second one that I had already ordered coffee from the first waitress.  I should mention here that English is not the waitresses 1st language.  I ordered breakfast and asked that my eggs be lightly scrambled.  It didn't look like the waitress understood me so I told her "don't cook them too much".  When I got my eggs they were like rubber and the edges were crispy.  Although everything on the plate was hot, the bacon was cold.  The service was very iffy...a couple of times I got a waitress coming over to ask if I wanted more coffee when my coffee cup was empty and my food hadn't arrived yet.  I would say yes and they would run to the kitchen, grab the pot and come back.  I don't know why they didn't show up with the pot and if I needed it they can just fill it, if not they can move on (I see this as another training issue).  This happened throughout my morning breakfast.

When I was ready to leave I asked who I thought was my waitress (since she had shown up at the table a couple of times) for the check but a completely different girl brought out the check.  To tell you the truth I have no idea who I was tipping for the service.

Bottom line, they needs more service training or be assigned sections so there isn't so much confusion on the customer part.  I still think this should be a fast food restaurant, not a sit down service.  There's a lot of room for improvement.

I like it    yes the chips and salsa  are not the greatest   the food though has got good taste if you stay with the different pork and beef items.  A little pricey compared to casa vallarta lunch down the street   like its more central american flavors.  Give it a try  I think it is kinda of hit or miss for people because it is a different taste then the tex-mex type of restarauts around here

We did a takeout order to check it out. Got an enchilada platter, Taco, Tostada, Tamale and Burrito Especial. The Tamale and Enchilada was great. Rice and Beans that came with the Enchilada were good as well. Taco was kinda watery. Not greasy, watery. Still trying to figure that one out. The Tostada didn't have any beans on it but that's OK, The supposedly Beef and Bean Burrito Especial didn't have even a spoonful on meat in it. The taste was good but pretty damn expensive for a bean burrito. Probably wont be back.

This place is a hidden gem. Their food is always fantastic - the sushi is always fresh and delicious. This is by far best sushi in Aurora. The prices are very reasonable for the quality of food, especially the dine in nigiri/sashimi prices ($1 ea). The service is always on point. I've never had a bad experience in the 10+ times I've been here. I highly recommend this place A+++

The bento boxes are perfect for lunchtime, and supper. I didn't think this place would be formal but it is actually a romantic spot so be sure to take your special someone next time. It is very inexpensive to get a Bento box which is awesome because it comes with soup crab cheese wontons four pieces of sushi white rice ginger and soup. The servers are also very nice and also willing to listen to any concerns or questions I had , when I wouldn't want the soup. he offered extra white rice on the side. You can see the restaurant has a bar and a bunch of dining tables, so grab a chair and go. The whole Bento box was perfect if filled me up right away and I only paid about $10! You can hear a lot of formal music in the background and lots of formal conversations from lots of guests and the servers. 

I'm saddened about the dessert menu they completely demolished the tiramisu cake from their menu. Overall outstanding service and excellent food

Came to Saigon Tokyo on a Saturday night. It was more than half empty so that's great if you like to avoid crowds. We were greeted right away and given a booth. The booths are the type that you can move so our was far apart and we had to keep readjusting. No big deal since no one was seated near us. 
The satay chicken was a little rubbery. Tasted microwaved. Ordered five sushi rolls that nearly all involved some crunchy tuna or shrimp tempura. All five rolls were great. 
I'd recommend this place for the attentive service, available tables and good rolls.

We came here for lunch on our recent trip to Denver. It's located in a strip mall right after the U-Haul. The interior decor has that feeling of a japanese sushi place with the sushi bar right in front of the entrance. But the tables, chairs and other decor felt more like a chinese restaurant with it's plastic table tops and chairs. We were seated immediately since the place wasn't too busy at all. The menu just a classic example of "jack of all trades" in asian food. It literally has Chinese, Japanese, and Vietnamese inspired items. Being in Denver we weren't expecting too much since we are from LA so know what real asian food is suppose to taste like. 

Anyhow we had:
Tokyo love boat for 2: 8 pcs of sushi, 12 pcs of sashimi, rainbow roll and shrimp tempura roll. Hrm being in Colorado you absolutely don't expect fresh fish so of course this was your frozen fishes served as "sashimi". You can tell from the color and straight taste this fish wasn't super fresh but just OK. The nigiri sushi sashimi was cut thin. It was tailored more to the regional flavor profile obviously. It was not served with your traditional dab on wasabi under the nigiri rice. The rice was also not seasoned with your usual rice vinegar sugar. Overall flavor 2.5/5. Overall value 3.5/5

Salmon Teriyaki bento: served with white rice, 4 pcs california rolls, 2 pcs cheese wonton, 2 pcs gyoza, and miso soup. What to say here... first the miso soup was 100% guaranteed made from instant packets. Yes i've eaten and made enough instant and fresh miso soup to know the difference. The salmon for the salmon teriyaki was cooked abit over so the ends of the fish was very dry. The teriyaki sauce itself was pretty standard. The best part of this bento was sadly the chinese style cream cheese/imitation crab wontons in the sweet n sour sauce. At least it was crunchy with the right amount of sweetness in the cream cheese mixture. The fried gyoza was OK with a standard pork/cabbage mixture. It wasn't very flavorful and definitely needed to soy for that extra saltiness. Yes they tried to make the bento more presentable/cute with your heart shaped rice mold. YAY! This is one of those entree's you eat just fill your stomach and not really to enjoy. Overall taste 2.5/5 overall value 3.5/5

The service was one of the better points of this place. The waiters do speak mandarin/cantonese for those out of towners. Overall this place is definitely not a must try but more like a if you have no choice and absolutely have no other asian place to go to kinda place. It's definitely jack of all trades and a master of none place.

Tuesday December 1st 2015

  We went here for Dinner since its the closest establishment from where we were after work.  Time was about 18:50hrs.  At that hour, this establishment is filled with other patrons alike for the Dinner rush etc...

  We were seated at the left wing of the establishment.  Our server gave us the Menu.  From the simple Menu, I opt to have the Nigiri and Hubs ordered 2 items from the Regular Menu.

From what I recall these were the items we had that evening :

*  Cheese Wonton ($5.25)
*  Royal Chicken ($9.95)
*  Shrimp Fried Rice aka Tokyo Fried Rice with Shrimp Option ($9.95)

*  Hot Vietnamese Coffee ($3.50) for Hubs  

The items I have on the "Sushi" items were :

*  Ebi ($1.00)
*  Octopus ($1.00)
*  Tamago (Egg) ($1.00)
*  Squid ($1.00)
*  Flying Fish ($1.00)
*  Eel Sushi ($2.50)
*  Spicy Scallop ($2.50)

Take note the Nigiri ORDER ONLY comes with 1 item per Nigiri.

I ended my evening with Honey Dew Boba...

  This establishment was just MEH.  YES, maybe its popular with the Neighborhood what nots.  The service is OK.  The service to bring out our food is fast.  The ambience is OK.  But I come here to get some Sushi/Nigiri.  The Sushi/Nigiri were tiny.  I am disappointed with the portions let alone the taste of the Nigiri.  *SIGH*

  Nothing fancy, nothing stellar.  Nigiri QUALITY is NOT that good either.

  The Shrimp Fried Rice, was also MEH.  Come on, don't be like another establishment that just put those frozen vegetables like peas and carrots.  Create your own creativity or something.  Furthermore, the Fried Rice is tossed with those Black Soy Sauce, that I dont fancy that much.  *DOUBLE SIGH*  The Shrimp Fried Rice was a little greasy, uninspired and once again small portions.

  At 19:00hrs, they ran out of certain items when we want to order.  Maybe this establishment is very busy and popular with the Lunch crowd or something.  Even with the Boba I want for my Drink, they ran out.  *TRIPPLE SIGH*  The server said, they can put the "jelly" that they have.  Oh well...

  Hubs also said his order of Royal Chicken was just MEH.  Small portions for his liking.  The Royal Chicken is overly salty and too sweet at the same time.  The Royal Chicken dish is DRENCHED with too much of Dark Soy Sauce once again.  The Hot Vietnamese Coffee comes in with a TALL GLASS, that makes the Coffee colder faster in which Hubs does NOT fancy. 

We would NOT be returning anytime soon or in the future.

Left the establishment about 19:40hrs ish.

My apologies for this rant.

Saigon Tokyo
700 S. Buckley Road, Unit E & F
Aurora, CO 80017
Tel : (303) 671-8888

@79/2015

I love coming here this is maybe my best yet go to spot for sushi , I'm a classic girl I always get the same dish if I love it ,so I always go for the bento box and a large Sapporo too can never go wrong with that  !
This place has a great happy hour. 2 for 1 sake and $2 beer. We loved the kamikaze roll and the pirate roll!

Possibly the worst meal I have ever had.
Picked up takeout for 3 people.  Sesame chicken bento box's.  Inedible.
We always order from here! We usually get the bento boxes with chicken teriyaki, spring rolls, and the yummy roll which is super delicious!!!! LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!

The interior is so cute! They have lit up pillowy lights on the ceiling and a sushi bar as well as alcohol bar. I tried the coconut roll for under $12 (coconut shrimp, mango, cucumber, avocado, wrapped in soy paper w/ house mango sauce). This was not your conventional sushi roll! It was slightly sweet & pretty refreshing. I enjoyed the unconventional soy paper wrap & its presentation. I also had the Osaka roll (spicy tuna, spicy crabmeat, avocado, white tuna, mayo, eel sauce, rooster sauce, tobiko and scallions) for $12 thought that it was subpar to the coconut roll because it was too salty for me. I loved all of the ingredients but just wished there was less salty brown sauce (eel sauce) on top. There were tons of specialty rolls to choose from so I will definitely venture back to try some more. The combo fried rice (comes with different meats + shrimp) was really delicious & so were the Vietnamese egg rolls (that come with a little bit of pickled carrot/daikon, lettuce & noodles). I really loved how vast the menu was & how many dessert options they had (includes: mango sticky rice, mochi, fried banana with ice cream, chocolate cake, chesecake & key lime cake). They also deliver (free w/in 3 mi radius)! This is the 1st time I've seen a place where you can get both pho & sushi. It is a win win for me. They have a sister restaurant called Bangkok Tokyo that I'd love to try too.

YES!!!  The Boy and I have been looking for a good Asian restaurant to replace our dearly departed Chef Liu's and I think we finally found it.  I ordered sushi - crazy roll and a couple pieces of escarole plus a side order of brown fried rice.  Boy ordered Vietnamese fried rice with Asian sausage and shrimp.  We absolutely frickin' loved everything that came out.  The fried rice was right up there with best of them.  The sushi was fresh and the roll was big.  Prices are VERY reasonable - most entrees under $10 - and they offer bento box meals all day long for under $10 as well.  I am super excited to try more off the menu here.  

MASSIVE added bonus: they offer free delivery!
A little on the pricey side but very high quality sushi and food. I would definitely come back again

One of our favorite local sushi bars!! The staff and owner are wonderful and friendly! The food is reasonably priced and delicious! I'm even able to take my non-sushi lover friends to this place without trouble. Great Pho and Bento boxes! A+ in our book!

This place is a little gem in Aurora.

Delicious food, awesome service, and quick delivery most nights too. (The dining room is always very quiet when I've gone in to pick up food, they must do a TON of delivering).

I've asked them to modify or substitute items on their menu several times now, and it's never been an issue at all. Love it.

Must try on the menu: Gyoza, and Sriracha Chicken (listed as Sriracha Beef, I decided to substitute).

2 little quirks about this place:

~ closed on Monday. A little odd, but hey, we all need a day off
~ the portion of rice they give you with to go orders is pretty small. If you love your rice (or plan on having seconds) I would definitely order an extra side.

Go here, be happy.

The credit card I used for this online order for pickup was then used for fraudulent activity. :/ I got a call from the bank saying someone was trying to take $800 then $400 in New York! Very unprofessional!

Aside from the bank troubles...... This food was good. I ordered the spring rolls and Vietnamese soup.

I love love love the sushi and the staff here. During my pregnancy I couldn't eat raw sushi but the staff made specialty rolls for me and treated me with the utmost care! My husband and I have enjoyed going here for over two years. Our favorite rolls are the hot roll, fried California, and the Colorado roll!

This place is excellent!! Me and my roommate stumbled across this place after moving into the area. This place is clean, the customer service is great, and the food is awesome! Definitely would recommend you try this place out. I always get sushi and a sesame chicken be to box!

Fast delivery, quoted 45 minutes, got here in about 15. We ordered yaki udon, sesame chicken, wonton soup, calamari, a California roll and a unagi roll. We loved everything but the sesame chicken: It didnt taste good and it was rather runny with the vegetables that steamed out in transit. I really didnt want all the foliage(bed of broccoli, onions and carrots)... it made for soggy, dripping pieces that had a strange flavor and not really sweet. That should be replaced but I probably wont call them.
I thought the wonton soup was great but it wasnt the original type we're used to as it was pho broth based and my wife, who does not like pho, queued in on that right away... even though I didnt tell her when I initially tasted it, as I love pho. So the soup ended up being all mine. The calamari was made differently as well, from the styles you normally see(not a bad thing), and it was tasty and tender. Wife's yaki udon was very tasty but it was also very greasy. The sushi rolls were yummy. Some great stuff and some not so great stuff. Maybe just tried the wrong things from here since the ratings are so good?.
Meh! Food is ok not the best sushi. Staff is friendly. Interior is ok. Menu has a decent selection of food.

I got a beef tepanyaki bento box.

Beef dish was juicy and hot, well seasoned and rrally good. It wasnt greasy. Wontons were crisp. Gyoza was flavorful and crisp. Not greasy. Very very good.

Customer service was excellent. Took only about 8 minutes to get 2 bento boxes for takeout.

Miso soup was a huge miss, as we're the California rolls. They tasted fresh there was just hardly any filling. 

I want to come here and try more items. 4 stars for what it was. I didn't try the special sushi rolls so I can't comment on that.

Came here for lunch with a couple of friends yesterday after work.

Wait staff was friendly and kept up well with drink refills. When one roll took longer than the rest, they brought out the first batch so we weren't left hanging, and then brought out the last couple rolls a few minutes later.

Great variety of rolls to choose from-- we went with the Tornado Roll, Volcano Roll, Rainbow Roll, Philly Roll, Spider roll, and one I can't recall the name of. They all tasted awesome. I'm sad sushi doesn't keep well in the fridge, because naturally our eyes were bigger than our stomachs and we ordered too much food.

Decor is tasteful and fun, and if you like you can sit by the bar and watch the sushi while its prepared.

Wait staff is very polite, and kept up with drink refills and additional orders (we ordered the Spider Roll as an afterthought and it still arrived with time to spare).

Price was also pretty reasonable, considering how much we ordered. Location is extremely convenient to my work.

Staff is friendly, sushi is delicious and a very tranquil environment! 
My boyfriend and i have only tried the sushi. He prefers fried and i prefer fresh raw rolls. We have tried a variety of rolls and there has not been a roll that we did not like!!

Good food at a good price. The bento boxes are perfect for lunch, pick up or dine in.

Dislikes include the seaweed salad, should be made with cucumbers not lettuce, and the dineamite, witch has way to many onions and carrots (weird).
Yum! Bento boxes are great....and CHEAP. $7.50 for soup, four pieces of sushi, wontons, potstickers, and the entree? Insane. And it's all delicious.
very deliciousLove this place. The sushi is wonderful and the service is terrific. Everyone is always so nice. This is always our go to sushi place!

No complaints! This place now has my favorite Spicy Tuna Roll, it is slightly crunchy on the inside, not enough to make you wonder what the heck it is but enough to add some texture to such a plain roll. I'm in love! I had the volcano roll here too but it wasn't as pleasing as others I've had, no biggie.

A cozy clean dining experience with friendly staff.  You get good food at a little less value than some other Pho and sushi establishments.  A more refined and quieter dining experience with better service than than the brat and wings establishments next door for a couple extra dollars.

$2 beers all day, every day? YUP! When I asked them how they make money off that, they said "We don't. We just want customers to come and check us out." After getting the food, I can see why. Absolutely delicious. Not a single complaint on anything and I've ordered/eaten there multiple times. This place is my spot for Pho AND Sushi.

Excellent service, however, Egg rolls were not very good - way too much pepper (they actually comped my egg rolls). Wantons were really good, along with my Philadelphia roll. However, my yellow tail sushi piece was terrible; it had a very strange sauce on top that was really bad. I also ordered a unagi piece, but because the yellow tail (and typically, unagi and yellow tail are my fave) was so bad, I couldn't stomach the unagi. This was my first visit, and I am not sure I will return.

Had the green tea martini--was awesome. Best seaweed salad that I have had in a long time.  Also, the jade roll was amazing. Just the right amount of spicy kick to it. And the service?? Fantastic. My water was never empty and not only did I get attended to by two servers, but the sushi bar chef was also making sure everything he had prepared was enjoyable. Definitely will return. With friends next time!!

Fresh, authentic cuisine that is very reasonably priced! I have eaten at Saigon Tokyo 4-5 times over the past 6 months and never has it disappointed. I typically go during lunch with coworkers and there is always a table, convenient when you're limited on time. I typically order the Bento box which comes with 4pc Cali roll, 2 wontons, 2 Gyoza, a soup and there's about 20 different entrées to choose from. Prices are $7.50-$9.50 depending on your meat choice. So, when you are craving Japanese this is where you should go.

Oh hell yes!! I feel like the sushi selection in aurora hasn't been that good. This place is awesome! There were a ton of specialty rolls to choose from, will have to come back to try more. We had the miso, Brandon roll, 2 kinds of spicy tuna and spicy scallop rolls. The sake and beer are 2 for 1 at happy hour. The food was delicious and service was good. 
Would be even better with happy hour prices on sushi.

I've never dined in, only take out. Its usually 10 to 20 minutes depending on when I call and its delicious! The Western Roll and Futo Maki are great vegetarian options. I've ordered a few of the noodle dishes but they're really not worth it. Just go for the sushi!

Amazing food, excellent service, perfect atmosphere, very clean .. The wife and I decided to try it out and we were definitely not disappointed .. I think we found our new spot. . I would HIGHLY recommend trying this place out !!

$2 Beers?  You have my undivided attention.  
I must declare something, I am a sushi snob.  Having said that, this place has the best spicy tuna roll I have ever had.  I also had a specialty roll (Osaka?), that was assembled well and flavor packed.  The salmon roll was acceptable. The nigiri was all fresh and formed perfectly. 

The service was great, but there were only six customers in the restaurant so...

I would recommend this restaurant for sushi.  I may try some non-sushi dishes next time...with my spicy tuna roll.
Great food, great delivery times, great prices.  I love this place.  Their sushi rolls are all delicious.  Their yakisoba is great.

Loved this place. Ordered delivery, was really quick. The sushi rolls were fresh. I got the beef bento box which I really liked and came with gyozas, soup and cheese wantons Will definitely order from again.

My husband and I went here for the first time last night and it was so good!! Everyone was so nice, the atmosphere was casual and the sushi was delicious. When the check came we were pleasantly surprised, very reasonable. If you love sushi and live in the area, I highly recommend you try this place!

The service was absolutely excellent and the sushi was quite delicious. The only critique I had was that most of the rolls I got all had eel sauce on them.  I love eel sauce but it just seemed like too much and made me fuller faster than if I was eating plain nigiri.

My husband and I really enjoyed our bento boxes (chicken teriyaki and tonkatsu) - we paid extra for fried rice and wonton soup (only $2.50 each) and it was worth it. Everything in the bento box was great. We also ordered an avocado roll which my husband enjoyed, but I thought was just okay. Service was good and restaurant was clean.

I don't like their pho but I really like their hot food especially their bento boxes they are affordable and have a good quantity of food! Their sushi is better than most I have tried since moving to aurora but it just depends which ones you get ! It's a nice place to get a quick lunch or dinner nothing too fancy
Their box meals are amazing you get so much food for the price and the quality!! I will definitley be back!

Fast delivery, wonderful service and delicious food - what more can one ask for? My wife and I are new to the area and have been looking for a good Japanese restaurant nearby. Our search is over. We each had a bento box and had to save food for later. The sauces were flavorful without being overwhelming, the meat was high quality and lean, and the vegetables were cooked to perfection. We will absolutely be ordering from here again. Often.

Stopped in after reading a yelp review and havIng sushi on the brain.  First impression,  the restaurant is clean,  decor is nice and the staff is friendly. In reading the menu,  I had a dilemma.  Should I order sushi,  our should I have the Pho? Why decide,  I say to myself.  Have both.  First the sushi.  Fresh and yummy. I chose a Philly roll (tame, I know) and a few pieces of nigiri ( 5 to be exact). The result was delightfully fresh. Highly recommend. And now for the Pho. I ordered a median Pho Ga (Vietnamese rice noodle soup with chicken). It was tasty,  but I have had a better bowl at other places (outside Colorado). Don't get me wrong,  I will probably order it here again.

 If you find yourself in Aurora,  do yourself a favor and stop by for some sushi. Tell them that guy from Oklahoma sent you.
I enjoy the volcano rolls and the colorado rolls! Quite tasty. Then a banana boba drink for dessert.
Finally a good sushi spot in Denver. Service was awesome and the food and drunks were outstanding. I'll be back here for sure!!
The food was amazing and the service was fast and friendly. Some of the best sushi I have eaten. Place looks a little divey on the outside but don't let that stop you. Well worth the visit. :)
Me and my wife eat here about once a week and we love it I always get the curry lime beef bento box and a spider roll. There's sushi is very good. Fast and very friendly
Don't order the curry noodle for delivery. All they'll do is deliver you a tray of stir fried rice noodles with absolutely no curry. Brilliant!

This place is really good. I tried several sushi rolls and hand rolls. They were all fresh and flavorful. I've been to several sushi bars in aurora and I've always left with that gut feeling of " I should have driven to a better place in Denver". Not anymore, I found my sushi place! Plus, they have an awesome happy hour ($2 beers and $1 sushi).

Ordered take out from here yesterday. Their Philadelphia roll and cheese wontons were awesome. We also had an order of volcano rolls and spicy tuna. Both were very good but nothing special. The prices weren't too bad either. Didn't sit down but from what I saw everything was pretty clean and nice. It's close to the house so if we don't want to make the drive to Sushi Katsu, we will be back.
Awesome place!   Wonderful customer service, excellent quality of sushi and great prices.

Very good sushi!  The atmosphere is very nice and inviting and the sushi bar is great. The place was clean and the food was very good and was at a good price. It was also very clean. The service was great, my iced tea was never empty. I will return

Absolutely FABULOUS food, service n prices. I have dined in and also used delivery! Cant say enough how nice n smiles all the staff is and delivery man so kind!
I only have one issue....i think im addicted lol
Please if your looking for good sushi n chinese or asian food GO HERE!!! U WILL NOT REGRET IT!!!

This place is pretty good. Probably one of the best Asian Fusion restaurants in Aurora. Friendly service, great Japanese food (haven't tried the other Asian food like Thai and Vietnamese at the restaurant) the Sushi is good. This is probably my favorite Asian take out in Aurora. 

Sad that this place isn't too well known. This place barely has any waiting time. The place is very clean. It's just in a hidden location and the word needs to get out, that's all.

Sushi was sub par at best. They have great beer specials though. Unfortunately that was the highlight of our meal.

My boyfriend ordered the pho and said it was probably the worst pho he has ever had. I tasted it and it was quite bland with barely any meat. Also, the herbs that came with it were wilted and not fresh. We requested a set of fresher basil but were told all of the basil they had were like that.

Us and another couple were the only customers there,  and service wasn't good. Our server didn't check on us except for to clear our table when we were done.

Love this place, the delivery is fast and always on time. 

We have ordered several items off the menu, and all of it is delish. Its our go to delivery when we want a great meal in a hurry.

Lunchtime review, first visit.  Very good service, and authentic Japanese sushi restaurant atmosphere.

Salmon and tuna were great!  Crabmeat was fake, and the shrimp were not deveined.  Only had sushi for lunch, and the pieces were $1 each.  

Perfect for fast food, but average quality.

I just love Saigon Tokyo my boyfriend and I know everyone here by name and vise versa with them. We love them and their food. I don't like going anywhere else for Chinese,  Japanese etc food no where else tops this one. At one point my boyfriend and I ate here everyday for a week straight we absolutely adore them. Its a shame we moved about 5 miles further than them but we still make it for dinner here or take out they do delivery so that's a plus if you're in the neighborhood. Take my word don't eat anywhere else! Best place ever!!!

My husband and I absolutely love this restaurant. We usually order from the Bento box menu bc the value for the price is amazing. $8 to be completely stuffed and on delicious food is a steal(2 dumplings, 2 crab and cheese wontons, 4 California rolls, soup, rice, and a main dish). The staff is always very friendly and attentive as well

Recommended. 

Sushi bar type decor with full glass front and lots of table seating. 

Friendly staff that is fairly attentive. 

Still new so there were few people at 5:00. 
Extensive menu with many Asian noodle and rice favorites with many sushi items. 

I had pad Tai with chicken that was very good. Menu indicates that it is spicy but it is not. Sauce is on the table to adjust to your tastes. 

Joni had the royal chicken which is becoming her go to dish.  Extra rice provided upon request.

1 star is generous.  Food is mediocre and incredibly overpriced for the quality.  Next time I want greasy noodles sadly mislabeled as Pad Thai, I will go to the nearest dollar per scoop buffet.  As for the sushi, the ladies at the neighborhood King Soopers prepares better rolls and nigiri then Saigon Tokyo.  If I have to pay a delivery fee I expect delivery at least within an hour. It's sushi. It's not cooked. I live 4.3 miles away by the longest route. Please provide at least an entertaining excuse.  My tip, which, again, grossly generous for the quality and wait, do not offer more horrible food for free as a resolution to serving bad food from the beginning. 
Save your money  and time fellow Aurora residents. Never dine or order from Saigon Tokyo.  Little Caesers is less disappointing.
I just went here twice the last two weeks.  Good quality food, fair prices.  The Bento boxes are a good value.  I like the Sriracha Beef.

My new favorite sushi place!  Relaxing atmosphere and great service. Plus, excellent sushi and a beautiful presentation. Their miso soup is hearty on the seaweed and their ginger is the off white kind - not the sweeter pink kind. I will definitely be coming here from now on.

Delicious,  good sushi for $1 each,  beers $2 and great dishes.  Great mochi ice cream. Get the box meals with main dish, rice,  soup,  2 wontons, 4 California rolls and 2 gyoza, all for $8. Never disappointed.
Best sushi I've had in the metro area!  Spicy tuna and yummy rolls are amazing! Also has wonderful options for people who don't enjoy sushi! AND they deliver!

I really like their food here. I've eaten here many times with my family. We've never been disappointed. We've tried many of the menu items, except sushi. Delicious! The best part is they are close to home.

THE best sushi restaurant in the Aurora area, even better than Hana Sushi. As other reviews have stated, I also have to admit that I'm a sushi snob. I ordered the shrimp tempura bento box and a spicy tuna roll; and let me tell you, it was an orgasmic experience for my taste buds. The food was flavorful, fresh, and nicely prepared. What's even better is they do free delivery if you live within a 3 mile radius. The lady who took my order over the phone was polite, sweet, and competent (and if you do the delivery option, they take cash or debit card, an extra plus if you're like me and hardly ever have cash on you). I would definitely recommend.

I'm so glad to have this restaurant in my neighborhood. This restaurant has a great menu with good sushi. If you live around the Buckley AFB area, you aren't going to find anything like this without having to drive further towards Smoky Hill or Denver. And the delivery service is great. I order weekly and always receive my order in a timely manner.

They were good when they first opened, but they are slipping, ordered pho ....very little sprouts, five little pieces of meat. ... Not good... I was hopeful that they would stay in business... It won't happen if they continue to serve food like this... Disappointed ...... Come on guys get it together .... You were so good when you started..... Why did you stop caring?
This place used to be really good. Food ordered to go was awful. Spring rolls eh, noodle bowl with beef I literally threw out. The egg rolls were mushy and the beef smelled weird.

Got the Tonkatsu bento box to go for $8 and some change. Good value for the price.  The pork was thinly sliced and with the panko, it was crispy.  They punch holes in the togo containers so the steam can escape, so the crispy things stay crispy.  The 2 gyoza and wontons were crispy.  4 pieces of Cal roll were pretty small but tasted fresh, rice didn't appear to be refrigerated.  Scoop of rice was fresh.   They give you a tiny container of sweet and sour sauce for the wontons.  Small container of sauce for the katsu.  My only complaint is about the tiny container of soy sauce.  It tasted like it had vinegar in the sauce.  I noticed that after I already put the wasabi in.   So, what I thought was soy sauce was probably the sauce for the gyoza.  If so, I was missing soy sauce for the cal roll.  Maybe next time I need to ask for a soy sauce packet.  Oh they also give you soup but I opted to not get the soup just because it was already a lot of food and I didn't want to get full from the soup.  I don't think I'd get the Tonkatsu again because the pork was sliced too thin.

First time in today. It was a beautiful sunny Colorado afternoon and the wall of doors were open with a nice breeze. We shared 6 appetizers and had a nice glass of red wine. We did not try the pasta as we. We ordered the Brussel Sprouts, risotto balls, calamari, Stromboli, meatballs and an eggplant dish. 

All were good but the standouts were the Brussel sprouts and the eggplant. I'd order 2 of each next time for the 4 of us to share. The Stromboli was my least favorite. 

The restaurant was busy and our service was prompt, friendly, and attentive.
