We look forward to coming back another time.

Ambiance- fine. Service- fine. 

Food? Don't waste your time. We came in and I ordered a really basic pasta with marinara, meatballs and cheese. My pasta still had about 2 cups of water with it on my plate. Meanwhile, there was absolutely no marinara on over 1/2 of it. I found the marinara, eventually, but basically was eating angel hair in greasy water with cheese and meatballs. They also as this weird garnish of a baked pasta noodle flower on the side. It's not tasty. My kids ordered spaghetti and meatballs and pepperoni pizza. Everything looked good, but the spaghetti, according to my husband and son, wasn't good. My husband said it tasted like spaghetti O's. The pizza was good looking but didn't taste good either. It was pretty flavorless. I know kids meals are supposed to be basic with flavors, but this was cardboardesque.

While in Denver, we decided to grab some lunch before heading back to the airport. With an abundance of great local eateries in the shopping center, we had many choices along the way. Once again, we used the Yelp app to narrow down our choices. Salati Italian Street Food had an overall rating of 4 stars so we stopped by for a quick bite to eat.

Salati is located within The Shops of Northfield Stapleton. The nearest cross streets are Unita Street and E 46th Avenue. Most people find it easiest to enter the shopping center off of Northfield Blvd and work their way down Unita Street to find the restaurant. Just in case you need a frame of reference, Salati is just across the street from the movie theater. Ample parking is available in the public lot which is large enough to accommodate busy crowds.

Outside you'll find patio seating with a small awning for shade. Most of the area is exposed to the sun and the shadiest seats are closer to the building. When you walk inside, you'll notice a small bar area to the left. It has beautiful bricks behind the counter that cover the length of the wall. The arched ceiling is lined with wood panels, giving the entire business a rustic feel! Plenty of open seating is available in the main dining room as well as in a small nook near the kitchen.

When we walked inside, we were greeted by our waiter who seated us promptly. We sat off to the side, away from the main dining room. As I looked to my right, I noticed a  window to order take out. One lady ordered from there but ate her meal in the restaurant. So, I'm assuming that you can also place your order here and bypass interacting with the waiters/waitresses. 

Anyway, as we browsed the menu, our waiter came back and asked what we'd like to drink. I ordered a root beer but he said that it may not be in stock because they had a big rush of customers last night. Luckily, he found out that the stocked up overnight. I was a little confused because you don't go over the available drinks and then once the customer makes their choice, tell them it's not available. 

Once that was resolved, I moved on to ordering my pasta. First you pick your base pasta then add your protein (meat), sauce, and toppings. I wanted basic penne pasta with Alfredo sauce and mozzarella cheese. I wasn't too fond of the fish that was on the menu so I just had them service the Mahi-Mahi on the side. My husband ordered his meal and asked for mushrooms and lo' and behold, they were out of mushrooms too!!! This was also due to the large crowds that came in the night before. Somehow, they had not restocked their entire food supply yet! Needless to say, we were a little disappointed already!

Our meal arrived within 10 minutes of us placing our order. The pasta was well-cooked with a soft texture to it. The cheese, although appearing to be  well-melted on the pasta, was still a little thick. The flavor wasn't overpowering and seemed pretty basic on that it didn't have a lasting effect on me. The whole thing was pretty bland! 

Our visit started out a bit rough.  Remember the root beer was missing but then found later and the depleted supply of mushrooms??? I knew this wasn't going to go over too well. We were appreciative with the amount of patience our waiter had with us. It's not his fault that they had not restocked their supply for the day. I'm glad that we stopped by because of all of the places that were in the nearby vicinity, this one seemed most promising. It's possible that this was just an off day for the business but they need to be prepared by having all foods and drinks stocked for the day.

Had some the eggplant, meatballs, and fries. The food came out hot but it just missed the mark on taste.  I also ordered an Irish Mule, and Mexican Mule. The drinks were just ok. Couldn't really taste the ginger in the mules. They were made strong(that's a plus). The best part was sitting outside people watching under their cozy tent. The waiter was a nice young lady.

I really don't like giving one-star reviews, but I have to here.  If the owner/manager reads this, I'm happy to discuss further, because this place could be very good if things in the front of the house get fixed.  Four star food, one star service, but unfortunately those two things don't balance out at all.  I came in with a big group, with a reservation that I'd made three weeks prior.  I called in the afternoon to confirm and give them an exact number of guests, and they said great.  When we arrived they didn't seem to know that we were coming, and that was the beginning of the end.  As people arrived, we got scattershot waters and silverware.  Some people got drinks, others didn't.  They were in the process of revamping their wine list, so there was no beverage menu.  Some people ordered food, but we were told that because we were a large party, they wouldn't allow us to order off the build-your-own menu.  Wish I'd known that when I called them twice before we got there... A few other larger parties came in after us that night, but our food came out so randomly, and it was obvious that the other groups got their food long before we did.  Several people in our group were done eating before the last few had even gotten to order.  Once the majority of the group finally got their food, almost everyone seemed to enjoy it, so that was a plus.  But at least three people didn't get their entrees for almost an hour, and one couple only got their appetizer because apparently their main course order was never turned in to the kitchen.  While we tried to be patient and accommodating to the situation, it really marred the evening for the group.  After people started to pay their checks and left, the manager came over to ask us what the problem was.  I had seen her talking to a few people in our party, but it turned out that they had not been given any recourse or discount for having to wait so long for their food.  The manager basically told us they were understaffed and the waitress was new.  Well, sure, but we had a reservation and you knew we were coming, so there's no reason to have such a problem.  I was most disappointed that she basically made no effort to apologize or remedy the situation.  I'm pretty certain that nobody in our group will be returning, which is a shame because the food was quite good and there were several things I would have been interested to try.  But poor service and attitude from the staff will turn anyone off to a restaurant.  I wish this place had worked out better.

This place is a nice little addition to the growing Northfield area.. Decide to take the family here for a Sunday lunch.. The menu is setup in a cool way basically everything is between 10 to.12 dollars.. and the portions were good size.. Our meal was made fresh and staff was very helpful and nice.I had the flatbed sandwich which was well done a little greasy but good... Enjoyed will definitely try again for happy hour..

A small group of us tried Salati on a Thursday evening for dinner and drinks before heading over to the Improv to see some comedy.  This place is really pretty good for a number of reasons:

1. Very friendly and professional staff
2. Live music! Ok, it was just one dude and his guitar, but he was really pretty good.
3. A pretty decent happy hour with a full bar and enough options on draft to satisfy most tastes.
4. A variety of food choices from small plates to dinner sized portions.

Not a bad spot for a pre-movie or comedy show meal.

The restaurant business has got to be tough.  I wouldn't know, but it just seems that the slightest thing, whether it be bad hired help, a bad few days of poor food quality or a general cleanliness issue can derail an otherwise well-intention'd business.  

So seems to be the case here.  My first visit was a resounding success - I loved it, and promptly left a great review.  I went back, on 7/13/2016, expecting a similar, quality result.  When I arrived, the restaurant was empty, and I went up to the order-line.  There was a female worker, who, at first, did not acknowledge me, instead, scooped chicken from the food bar, into her plastic, Tupperware-from-home container of what looked like home-made Mexican Mole.  After she was done serving up what I would assume to be her lunch, she set her dish down and then turned to me to take my order.  I went for a flatbread sandwich, with meatballs and a little sauce.  She "shoo'd" a fly off of the flatbread before grabbing one to prepare.....  

The end product was flavorless, greasy and unfulfilling.  I sat in a booth with an un-wiped table, choked down what I could, and promptly left.  Sad turn of events.  Wish these folks the best of luck.

Delicious and fast.  Service is friendly and the risotto is some of the best in town!  Between the homemade vodka sauce and the real soda available, this place has I vales the big boy sits loan sit down eateries for sure!
Love this place!  The calamari appetizer, the Lombardy and the canoli bites were fantastic.

Great experience over all.  Lovely service.  

My husband really liked his penne with a mix of spicy and regular marinara, Italian sausage, peppers, onions, and cheese.  I got the penne with the white sauce, mushrooms, and winter veggie medley (red and yellow squash and brussel sprouts).  The medley looked weird - almost like meat, but tasted good.  I asked for the romano cheese, but it ended up tasting and looking much more like feta (which I don't care for).  I should have done the parmesan, I guess. 

My other two mix-ins I got on the side - an arugula/spinach mix and tomatoes.  I also got two dressings - a caesar-like kind that was good, and a homemade ranch that was AMAZING.  I seriously would have been better off with the salad rather than the pasta.  

I initially ordered the roasted brussel sprouts - actually one of the reasons I wanted to go there (I LOVE brussel sprouts)...  But, they had a super busy day and were out!  (Although we didn't find out until the pasta came out - they should have told us sooner.). I tried ordering the roasted corn instead, but they were out of that, too!   It is great that their business is picking up, though.  They make everything from scratch with fresh ingredients, so it's easy to run out of things when there is a huge rush.  

So, even though it sucked not to be able to have brussel sprouts or corn, it was awesome how they handled it.  We ended up being given some free minestrone soup that had a lot of good vegetables in it.  Also, the chef came out personally to apologize to us and ask if he could get us anything else.  I ended up asking for more spinach/arugula and tomatoes to go with that delicious dressing, and he gave me that, plus some cucumbers and red onions! ...my own little wonderful salad!  All the staff were super nice and accommodating - and they were having fun singing along to the Jackson 5 and other oldies.  

A few side notes - the corn syrup-free soda is interesting.  It's good, but you may need to stay on the server to give you refills.  I had to ask a lot of questions before I really understood what it was, as well.  

And, one of the toilet handles was broken...  I had to lift the back lid to flush it.  I told a staff member and hope they'll fix it soon.   

On the whole, a good meal with great service.  I would come back next time I'm in Denver!

Amongst the best pasta in Denver.  it is slightly pricey but worth every buck once it is in your mouth.  

You can make pretty much any pasta you want, from straight buttery noodles to penne with bacon and vodka sauce.   You can mix and match and get your pasta your way for sure.

Their calamari is also excellent which is my goto side, but there are a good selection of sides too.

If your craving pasta, Salati is sure to satisfy.

The best Italian food I've ever had. Such depth to the flavor of the food, very high quality, great staff and nice bar if you like sitting up and "chilling" for a bit like I do. You must eat at this place at least once.

Very solid meh. Happened to stop by during lunch hours which is a fast casual concept. You pick your type (calzone, bowl, salad), protein, sauce and toppings. My noodles were undercooked. The Vodka sauce was just OK - and the protein offerings meager. Also ordered the crispy brussels that were quite tasty (saved the meal honestly) and the curly fries, which were BARELY curley and more like pub style chips. These were also pretty good. 

Pricing wasn't bad, but I expected a little more. I would have preferred a sit down option. Italian as fast casual is very tricky and can border into Sbarro levels of quality if you're not careful.

Disgusting.  My husband and I stopped at Northfield on our way home from a long road trip.  I had a bad feeling from the moment we walked in.  What is "Italian street food"? I've been to Italy and none of this resembled their street food.  Other than that, the menu was just strange.  Against my instincts, we stayed for dinner.  We ordered the bruschetta for an appetizer despite the fact that it was topped with feta cheese which I consider Mediterranean or Greek not an Italian cheese.  Who cares what it tasted like, the meat (some kind of pork) was so off-putting in appearance that I couldn't get over it.  Who throws gross grey strips on top of their bruschetta? After my husband seasoned it for us and got past the visual displeasure, the flavor was ok, certainly nothing to write home about.  We both ordered pasta for our main entree.  I won't address his food because he ordered off the make your own menu so he was responsible for his choices (somehow, he ordered that nasty pork again which he actually just took out of his dish and set aside).  I ordered the Milano which was a Basic penne, chicken, mushroom In a cream sauce.  They clearly boil the pasta per dish but unfortunately, despite the fact that they were not busy AT ALL, they don't have time to properly drain the water off.  Therefore, my dish was a watery mess with the most flavorless chicken completely unseasoned.  I am pretty sure they pre-boil or bake the chicken totally unseasoned and then refrigerate it and just throw it in the pasta.  I couldn't even eat the dish so our server brought me the eggplant dish which was also inedible  due to the large amount of water the pasta was siting in.  Not even the little crostini which garnished both dishes were good and completely lacked any flavor
Other than the oil brushed on each side for toasting.  Gross.  Will never go back and recommend to no one.

We will be dining here often. Fresh ingrediants from CO, cooked to perfection.  Locally owned. NOT a chain! We had the Barbajuan fried ravioli to start off with. Highly recommend. I had the Chicken Milano which perfect. My husband had the meat lovers Piadini which he moaned groaned all the way through. That means he loved it.

8:45 on a Friday, closed. 

Yelp wants me to write more. But there isn't much else to say except that they should probably update their hours if they are going to close that early.

We had some dinner here the day that Star Wars 7 came out. The pasta is made to your specifications if you want, and that is good or bad depending on how weird you want to get. The best part of my meal here was the "Italian Margarita" which is a few parts tequila, a few parts lemon stuff, and pistachio! It was surprising that the drink was so good. 

I would thoroughly recommend this place if you're going to the movies and are a lot hungry.

I wanted to try a local Italian restaurant and found it quite difficult to find on in the area I was staying. I stumbled across this quaint location in the outdoor mall and was excited that I did not have to go to Olive Garden to get my Italian food fix. The restaurant was well lit and open but that's about all it had going for it. First of all there were roughly only 8 people in the place when the waitress told me to "sit anywhere" I did then the waiting began. Not even a hint that they recognized I existed. Finally someone came over and asked if I'd like a beer, no water was fine with me because I was considering bailing and cutting my losses. The waitress came back with my water then disappeared again. After what seemed like forever she came back and I ordered a pasta dish. She informed me that it would take 20 minutes to bake it and suggested I try something else. I told her I'd wait it out. Unfortunately it was not worth the wait. The dish came out sizzling hot, burned in some areas but pretty much tasteless. I guess it's my own fault, I should have bailed when I first had the thought to do so. It would not take much to get this lovely place higher ratings 1.Pay more attention to your customers 2. Provide a follow up after the food is delivered to see if everything was okay (I wanted another slice of bread but she never came back) 3. Expand the menu 4. Figure out how to get food out of the kitchen faster...

Had a good meal if it had been hot. Service needs some fine tuning. I don't like lukewarm pasta. Next time i go to the movies I'll find another restaurant. They were not busy so seeing my lunch getting cold made me a bit irritable.

So disappointed ! I was excited to try-was with a group ( appx 15). Not busy ( Tues night) I had to ask to have our order to be taken after 30m mins. Order apps & 2 sandwiches, got apps about 30min later and after being there for an hour &1/2 - everyone done eating.. I asked when will our order be ready and the waitress said WHAT ORDER.  ... Need I say more. We went   to another restaurant and told them about  this horrible experience and other customers came to ask what was the name because they had/ heard of  similar experiences here also. How sad because I loved the concept but, I will never go back. I hope this review will help them improve for others.

We came in and realized we are going to try something new and immediately felt the excitement of trying a different, Italian dish. The restaurant is really fancy and very romantic for a restaurant that is not as wildly noticeable from the outside. We saw large brick walls that looked like an ancient pavement and thought the dining hall was beautiful; almost like traveling back in time. We sat by the patio outside while still sitting inside and had a lovely server by the name of Kristina (or Christina) help us out and she was very knowledgeable, friendly, and fair of what to expect of each dish. We ended up eating the plate of "Meatballs," and the "Nutella Piadina." The main dish of meatballs was $10 and it came in a delicious little pot with a large portion of red sauce, melted white Parmesan cheese and vegetables. The dish was sure hot and delicious. The only main thing was I expected more meatballs and it only came with three. Three different flavors of: Sausage, Pork and Salami. It was that good. I wanted more the dish was kind off too small. The Nutella Piadina was awesome and very chocolatey. Thanks to the Nutella of course!!!!

This isn't a fancy pants Italian place, but a perfect place to become a neighborhood family favorite. We are so very happy to have them in the neighborhood and aim to visit at least weekly!

For dinner I would recommend Brussel Sprouts and the Mac & Cheese, but all of their small plates are delicious.

Good idea bad delivery. 
Slow service. 
Food had rubbery texture like it sat under heat lamps for hours. We got a chicken pasta dish with rubber chicken and cold hard crusty pasta on top and the meatballs that were unnecessarily spicy. 
Young staff set hot plates (not hot food, remember it sat under heat lamps) in front of my 11 month old along with plates and utensils. Yes the area in front of my baby was clear for a reason. 
Forgot our soup. 
Wanted to love this place so perhaps we will try in a few years.

Went last night for dinner, hearing good things in the neighborhood about the place. A little confusing when you walk in, as there is a soda fountain right there - thought maybe it was a fast casual spot and we would need to go stand in line, but the manager took care of us. They were fairly busy but we were seated right away.

Food was great, if the menu was a little confusing to navigate. Staff was very friendly in explaining it though. Got the roasted 1/2 chicken special and it was great. Risotto balls were very tasty, as well as the sweet potato tots. Saw about 9 things on the menu I wanted to try, so will definitely be back.

Only complaint was the service. Was a bit slow - took a while to get our check and then to get it picked up. All the while staring at dirty plates. Pre bus people! :)

Third time in a week! Great food and atmosphere! The build your own pasta combos are great. The blended wine (forgot the name) also very good. Appetizers great as well. Like we told the owner, we'll be making our way through the menu. What a wondeful restaurant!

Met a friend here for lunch with my 5 year old twins. I had the standard angel hair pasta with sausage. They weren't stingy with the sausage and it was crumbled in little bits throughout the pasta, which I loved. One of my kids had the spaghetti with meatballs and the other had the cheese pizza. Their entrees arrived before ours, which was thoughtful, but I was snacking on theirs because it looked and tasted great. I would definitely eat hear again the next time I'm in the Northfield area. Great atmosphere as well.
Big portions and the food is tasteful. The price is reasonable and the staff is friendly. No complaints, I will stop by again when I am in the area!

My work group has been here several times for lunch since they've opened.  The combo is a good price for the amount of food.  We've tried several menu items, and they've all been tasty and freshly cooked (hot).

I ordered the piadini flatbread sandwich and it was ok. It wasn't particularly flavorful and was relatively bland. I liked that I got to build my own, but it wasn't good enough for me to want to come back for another one. 
The menu was confusing. 
The service was friendly, but spotty. We emptied our water bottle and didn't receive a refill. Our waitress also never checked in with our meal once it was served.
Amazing food.  I had never had anything like it, and I loved it.  I am going back as soon as I can.  The service was good too.  The decor is nice too.

Very good! Unique, fun concept, GREAT prices!This place has very good food, and for the style of the design, you'd think it would be more costly! But, it is not. They have this yummy flatbread that can be piled up with all your favorite toppings, and salads made-to-order, along with other selections. Would like to go back for soup, as they were out when we were there, but other than that, we all enjoyed it! Very good, very fast, perfect for hanging out for a while, enjoying a beer or glass of wine, or a quick bite before a movie.

This is definitely not a traditional Italian restaurant, nor a traditional neighborhood Italian restaurant in terms of atmosphere.  It is more like a sports bar, but without so many TV's.  I had the Fazola (lasagna) and it was outstanding.  The shared appetizer (rice balls) was also quite good.  The curly fries were unusual in shape and quite tasty.  The food portions were ample and the prices quite reasonable.   We arrived shortly before the happy hour expired and ordered our drinks before the cutoff time but did not receive the discounts initially supposedly "because the computer erred."  That part of the bill was fixed, but not the additional dollar for the dessert that was higher than the stated menu price.  Service was initially good, but then dropped off as the place became more busy.  The air conditioner was going full blast with drafty cold air blowing around.  There were some flies buzzing around as well.   The outdoor seating was not being used and it seems to have been poorly designed.  Finding the restaurant was a little tricky because the street numbering system in the area us totally ridiculous.  Just remember that the restaurant is very near the Bass Pro shop parking lot, which is also a good place to park if one does not want to pay for parking.

I have been to Salati several times and I am never disappointed! The food has lots of flavor and leaves my palate wanting to try everything on the menu. They also have vegetarian options which is great. The location is ideal with being close to the mall and shops. I love sitting at the bar, Sean and Sarah are very attentive and their experience as bartenders shines. For only being opened 2 months I can tell this restaurant will be around for a long time. Thank you Salati!
Horrible, so much sugar in the lasagna sauce!   This is not true Italian!  Menu very small!  I never been to an Italian restaurant where you can not get Chicken Parmigian.
Great lunch amazing food. Great lunch. Best first experience at a restaurant. Will be back
Wonderful place to eat!! Get the steak!! Best place we ate in Denver wish there was more of these and the employees are great!!! 5 stars for sure

Brussel sprouts are amazing. Best I have ever had. Meatballs have great flavor with perfect amount of marinara and melted cheese. The Stromboli bites are a great blend of meat and vegetables and the sauce is scrumptious. Our bartender Sean gave great recommendations. Perfect girls night location for drinks and some shared platters.
Some of the best Italian food I have eaten in Denver, CO

Great atmosphere and service. 

Entree selection is limited, (the menu wasn't very big in general) and they were out of a couple of their appetizers. I know that's probably a good sign that they cook small quantities of quality food, but it was a little frustrating. If we go again we will be trying different entrees. I would consider it more of a lunch spot than dinner/date night

If you're in the area or even kinda, sorta, a little bit in the area, you should try Salati. They serve piadinis (Italian flat bread sandwiches). The best way I can describe it is a made-to-order open calzone. I normally get the gluten free crust and it is very good.  They also serve pasta, salads, have a kid's menu and dessert. The food is fresh, the staff is friendly and the price is right. I haven't been there for happy hour but I think we'll try it. Happy eating! Enjoy!
Ordered eggplant appetizer, was served with super sweet tomato sauce, almost dessert like. Wine was 5, for happy hour, that's a consolation. Place is owned by mom n pop, so we will try again.

What a delightful addition to our neighborhood! Service with a smile from our bartender, Truth and a wonderful sense of pride from the staff for their  new little gem. We sat at the bar for Saturday bloodies and had 2 small plates...which were quite big, for small plates btw. The meatballs were superb and the bruschetta was a unique and delicious take on an Italian restaurant staple. Friendly, fun and yummy...we'll be back often...unless they get sick of us. ;)

The choices of "make your own combo" of either piadini, (flatbread sandwich) salad or pastas with amazing sauces & dressings. Or, incredible small plates.  Along with great kid meals.  We will be back... studying the menu for our next trip.
Delicious meatballs, sausage, fresh flat bread and marina sauce to die for. Great price and Perfect recipies!!. Great staff! We will come back!

The food here was delicious!  I'd like to try it again.  The 4 star review is for 2 reasons: 1) they forgot our order of Brussels sprouts, which I was really looking forward to (but was ultimately too full to push for when we asked if it was on the way), and 2) it's confusing when you walk in.  I stood at the hostess stand for a minute and someone came and handed me the correct menu (why would they have the old ones out?), but they never told me if they would seat me or if I should just seat myself.

So great food, but a few kinks to work out in this fairly new restaurant.

Had lunch today a larger sized Flatbread fixed to order, and absolutely delicious! Cool organic soda machine, and best yet, I had an awesome meal for a very reasonable cost. This place has a great upbeat vibe, great location and staff! Would recommend to anyone!

Can't tell you how the food was. Put our name in to get seated and pretty much got forgotten about. They started seating others so we went and asked and was told they forgot about us. Not impressed!!! We left cause our 15 min wait turned into 30 to 45 minutes
Both pasta dishes we ordered were awesome.  Good ambiance and the bartender Shawn did a great job.  The happy hour drinks were a great deal.  We'll be back!

Had a great meal here the other night! The server was super friendly and helped walk us through the menu as it was our first time. We both went with the pasta, my friend got the gluten free and said it was great. The bread that comes with it is also gluten free. 

I loved my pasta, and we had the risotto bites as an appetizer. They were both delish! I had the regular sangria and my fried had the red sangria (mine was better). Go and enjoy a great spot before it becomes super popular and packed!

Has the feel of the traditional "mom and pop" Italian restaurant I remember from living near New York City.  A great alternative to the chain options generally available in Denver.  Food was terrific and the atmosphere and finish of this brand new restaurant were very impressive. Also loved the flexibility in the menu to customize a dish the way you like it.  Definitely worth a visit to anyone who likes to dine out on Italian food.

We tried this place three times hoping it would improve. The first complaint is the limited menu and beer selection. Tried the lasagna for the second time and determined it was one step above a Stoffers frozen lasagna. Hot on the outside and cold in the middle. The prices seem a bit higher than they should be considering the quality of the food. However, the service is always quick and responsive.

I'm always interested to try any new fast casual restaurant.  SALATI offers full service, but also Chipotle-style takeout.  I really liked the Piadina (flat bread loaded with sauce, meat, and vegies, folded like a big Italian taco), and have never had anything like it.  The food at this place is super tasty and reasonably priced.  I hope they do well.  I'll know I'll be back.

We were seated right away when we arrived around 5:30pm, and had no less than 3 servers come over to help us re-arrange the tables to accommodate our party (3 adults & 3 kids) and bring over high chairs. Our server was very personable and great with the kids, and he explained the menu (design your own sandwich, salad, or pasta). We ordered the crispy brussels sprouts as an appetizer, and they were delicious. The pasta and salad entrees were just okay. Next time, I'd choose more of the small plates. Portions are reasonable and prices are inexpensive. Overall, a great, family-friendly restaurant.

We won't come back here.  I do think the food was good and came out super fast but the overall dining experience was so rushed and unpleasant.  Our movie finished across the street at 7:20.  We walked over to the restaurant and took our time ordering.  The guy that took our order was very sweet and pleasant and our appetizers arrived literally five minutes after we ordered them.  We got the calamari and it was fresh and tasty.  Before our appetizer was finished our food arrived.  No kidding, not even half way through our meal the server came over (my husband had his fork in his hand and I was actually chewing my food) and asked if we would like a to go box.  We said yes since I was not going to be able to finish my meal.  The boxes arrived seconds later and while we were still eating the check arrived with the time stamp of 8:02.  We felt to rushed and since we rarely get to go out these days kiddo free, we won't take the chance and come back here.  We were literally in and out of the restaurant in 30 minutes (with appetizers and two main meals) and really wanted to have a relaxing evening together where we could unwind. So disappointing!

HOORAY!!  Three of us stopped by Friday late afternoon for some small plates and drinks.  Absolutely fabulous!  First of all, Salati is the "perfect" type of restaurant for Denver and for Stapleton.  It's cool, inviting, great ambience and has amazing food.  We had the meatballs, calamari and eggplant dish.  All were super generous portions, beautifully presented and just delicious!!  Sean was our fun waiter -- A++ to him!  This new restaurant which has been open for 6-7 weeks now, is exactly the kind of restaurant Stapleton needed.  Great prices, generous pours, actually good wines at a reasonable price per glass (try the Malbec).  A perfect place to stop for a drink but do NOT miss the food!  To whomever created and opened Salati -- a GREAT BIG THANK YOU!!!
Wonderful concept that is a welcomed addition to Northfield! Food was excellent and the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. We will be regulars for sure!

We stopped in for a bite after a movie last week and was very impressed. My wife had a create your own pasta dish and I had the Piadina sandwich and a side of rice balls(I forget the name). I loved that you could create your own combination of veggies, cheeses, sauces etc. Both dishes were excellent and the price was under 10$ a plate. Service was good and staff seemed very friendly. It is definitely worth a try if you are in the neighborhood.

Thus was my first time eating Senegalese food. I had high expectations and this place did not disappoint. I has the Yassa Poulet  (chicken and gravy over rice) and it was outstanding. From the outside looking in it doesn't look like much. Don't judge a book by its cover. The sever was extremely friendly and patient with explaining each menu item. I highly recommend this place. Beware of the hot sauce though. It was a lot hotter than I expected!
I thought the food was great and very affordable. And best of all they delivered it to my house!

Not a fan of this location.  Went in on a Saturday to try this location bc it's closer to my house.  There were probably 5 guys working there... They asked us to take our time and were friendly.  
1 star because it smelled terrible... Like raw sewage... They must have seen the looks on our faces but gave no excuse... We decided not to eat there.  Too bad though the DZ in the tech center is pretty good.

I don't know what subs in New York taste like, but they must be pretty darn good! 

Deli Zone offers a variety of subs/sandwiches that are tastier than subway and actually prepared with care!

I like the breakfast sandwiches ($3-$5) here because they're served on a warm, soft  kaiser roll. You can also choose how many eggs you want in your sandwich (I usually do just one).

It seems that the sandwiches' ingredients, in general, were carefully selected to complement each other in terms of flavor, as well as texture. They're also fairly priced (under $10 for a med. sub)!

The sandwiches at this particular location are prepared very well, and the service here is friendly! The tables are clean, and there are a variety of condiments available to sauce up your sammie.

If you're in the area, Deli Zone is the perfect place if you're in the mood for something quick and filling.

This place is new to the neighborhood, and I'm a sucker for sandwiches, so that's always a cause to try it. I wondered how tasty they'd be and if it'd be worth it, so I decided to dive in! 

When I went in to get a sandwich, the cashier seemed like a deer in headlights. The entire time he was acting sorta nervous and shakey; I almost wanted just wanted to pat him on the shoulder and let him know everything was okay. 

After several minutes of waiting around, I got excitement when the sandwich was made. "Here you go bro!" Said the sandwich crafter. My mouth was watering with the smell. It was warm, smelled fresh and looked scrumptious! Wiffs of unprocessed chicken and cured bacon whistled through the air. 

After tearing through the door to my home, I went to try the sandwich. Once I sank my teeth into the sandwich for the first time I felt one thing: mediocrity. The bacon was cooked to perfection, but the chicken, along with the bread and pesto mayo, was dry! The sandwich was incredibly dry! Every bite tasted mostly like bread, so the meat to bread ratio was off. 

I might go back and try a breakfast sandwich, that's where the rave seems to be at this place.

So I love this place and MOST of the employees. Lately this new kid has been an a**hole. I called today at 11:13AM 11/17/2015. I'll be calling back for this kids name, and updating this post after. This kid must hate his job, cause he doesn't know what customer service is. He said "The prices on the website are all wrong due to different locations" BLOW ME kid!!! This company can't format the site to change info when you click a specific location, just like every other store in America. TRASH!!!!

Not New York but a better spin on a sandwich, very creative creations and always great service. My go to for a warm sandwich! 

The gangster, f train and Jamaican are awesome.
Soooo happy that Deli Zone has returned to this side of town! Excellent sub as always! PS their breakfast subs have helped me get through many hangovers back in the day!

So they may not be like New York Style sandwiches, never had a new York sandwich, but they are one of the best sandwich places in the area.  New York deli has good sandwiches, and Jason's deli, but neither in the area.  In terms of flavor and quality on par with Jimmy Johns.  If I want a treat I'll drive to new York deli, or firehouse subs, for an awesome, close by neighborhood sandwich, this is the place.   Breakfast sandwiches as well.  I enjoyed the meatball sub, marinara is tasty, made the bread a bit soggy, and a little messy, but awesome!!  Extra cheese and black olives made it.  Enjoy
This place has great breakfast sub. Love the Kong.  Tried this place in Boulder, glad they opened a new place here in Aurora.
Great breakfast and amazing sandwiches if you want  an especially  amazing philly ask for the "uncle Phil" from the fine gentleman in the bucket hat you won't be disappointed!

$12 for a tiny sandwhich with no side. This might have been ok if it was high quality but it was mediocre. Not only that, it me so sick I spent all night exploding from both ends like a busted fire hydrant. I had eaten nothing else that day so there is no question this lousy sandwich is what made me ill. Boo.

Deli Zone is the best sandwich that I ever test it.These is I call FOOD.I love all the menu they have.They put all the fresh ingredients even the bun so fresh like homemade.And staff very very friendly.
Wanted to like this place; prices are reasonable and they touted New York style sandwiches. In the end, nothing like New York style - all bread.

This place deserves 5 stars no doubt.  Family friendly, we come with our kids to see the mariachi band on the weekend.  Tortilla soup is the best I've ever had!  Otherwise, the lunch buffet is always spot on, reasonably priced and great quality.

Having read several previous reviews I can understand the mixed messages. We dined here at the suggestion of relatives who absolutely love Las Hadas and eat here all of the time. We were warmly greeted by the owners and staff. 

But my husband, brother and I all had very different experiences. Compared to our relatives who would always give this a 5 star rating.

My husband had a beef chimichanga and said it was 4 star. My brother had cheese enchiladas and rated them a 3 star. 

But my food was awful and 1 star would be too high. I ordered a combo plate with a cheese enchilada, chicken burrito and a crispy chile relleno. My chile relleno had cheddar cheese inside that was very cold and not melted at all. The sauce on top was spicy and tepid in temperature. The chicken burrito was also cold inside and missing the cheese that had been requested. And you guessed it, the cheese enchilada was also cold. I didn't return my food because I didn't want to offend the relatives. But this was the worst Mexican food from my perspective.

Amazingly friendly staff - and the breakfast burritos are great to grab for an on the go breakfast.  The atmosphere is typical "dive Mexican restaurant", but I don't go for the decor.  But it adds to the experience.
The food is ok if you are just kinda in the area, on a low budget, and hungry. That's about it.

Las Hadas, The Fairys in Spanish...maybe that's how they came up with the decor? Eclipsed in ghastly hideousness only by the guacamole, it looks more like a fairy nightmare, or vomit. 

The multi-color paint job of orangey salmon on most of the walls, electric lime on the restroom doors, dark watermelon pink and grape medicine purple in the ladies room, is retina searing. Gift wrap ribbon tying sarapes, sombreros, various paintings, and fish replica cover the walls. Fake flowers and various other souvenir shop and  flea market finds populate many other spaces. The restaurant looks like a bad impression more than a vibrant and inviting dining area.

Maybe it's a bit harsh, but the decor is really distracting and unappetizing. I almost didn't go in, despite the neon open sign, the place looked dead. Thank goodness there was no live music (as advertised on the menu)!

The menu itself is overcrowded! So many combinations! I wanted enchiladas and guacamole (before I tried it on the nachos, more on that later). There is an option for 3 enchiladas, or one for deluxe enchiladas which includes sour cream and guacamole plus rice and beans.  I never eat rice and beans, but this option was cheaper than ordering the enchiladas and a side of guacamole, what sense does that make?!?  

As alluded to, the food is pretty bad. The salsa was watery. The chips were stale. The nachos were overloaded and soggy, you physically cannot eat them without a fork!

My husband's fajitas came out several minutes before my enchiladas. Unacceptable! The beef was chewy and tasted like teriyaki. My enchiladas were okay. I was shocked to find some avocado in the pale sickly pile that was passed off as guacamole! 

If eye-sore decor isn't a problem for you, try the tacos at tacos y salsas on Iliff, if it is, try La Loma in the Highlands.

The buffet was horrible.  The chicken tasted two days old,  the beef for the tacos was sitting in a pan of grease. The taco shells were stale,  you needed a steak knife to cut the burrito.  The enchiladas were piled in a pan on top of each other.  When we walked in the guy brought the chips and salsa immediately but the waiter stood talking to someone ignoring us. Won't be back ever.

Service was slow. The food was like warm. Not to exaggerate but 6 tables that were sat after us had left 20 min before we did. It was like because we sat towards the back our waitress didn't come by as often. It took way too long. I could not recommend nor would I return.

Chips and salsa- chips were not homemade and salsa was watered down

Tiny chimichanga for $7.00 that cost an extra .85c to upgrade to "shredded beef". Shredded beef was soggy and cold... Ugh

My girlfriend ordered a cheeseburger and we instantly regretted not going to burger king as the patty was the same size as a Jr whopper, only burnt

To top it all off, the bathroom wasn't clean

Look forward to my next meal....ANYWHERE ELSE

I've been going to Las Hadas for well over a decade. The decor is tacky to say the least and the live music can be a bit overwhelming so I stay away on the weekends, having trumpets blown in my face while I'm trying to eat is not my idea of a good time. 

Over the last few years the food changed and it isn't as good as it used to be. The food is just so-so nowadays. 

The sopapillas are good and you can get margaritas by the pitcher which is why I still go there from time to time.
Yummy Mexican food.   Great breakfast there huevos a la Mexicana is epic.   Pork chops with green chili tortillas bees sand rice is almost as good as my mommas.   Good cheap authentic Mexican.

The food is ok by there own admission it's a "white ppl" Mexican food place u can't get any hot(spicy) chili price is low until u add-on that when it's starts to kill u I continue to eat here do to how close it is to my job. I wouldn't go out of my way to come get the food

Yikes...nothing good to say! Waite..the ice cream was good. That's about it. The service was awful from the get. Waitress couldn't understand why we needed an xtra chips in salsa with 7 ADULTS. Had to ask multiple times for items before we finally got it. Took 2 hours total and never got offered a refill once! The waiter messed up my husbands order and argued with him about it. I would never EVER come back and definitely do not recommend it!

Well... at least the food is better than Casa Bonita? 

That's about the nicest thing I can say about this place, it's pretty bad.  Not the worst I've had, but it at least gets an honorable mention in that category.  It's one of those places that gets all the little details wrong.

Like most Mexican restaurants, they start you off with chips and salsa, which is to say stale chips and lackluster salsa.  It's not terrible, but it's by no means good.  We ordered a plate of "super" nachos, and then I had the fajitas and my wife had the cheese enchiladas (she LOVES cheese enchiladas... just not these ones). 

The nachos were also not terrible, but by no means good. Between the pickled jalapenos and the mediocre guacamole, they were so loaded with watery toppings that you couldn't eat them without a fork.  Even if the chips couldn't support the weight of the toppings, the beans kept everything nicely glued together in a paste that we almost finished.  I was pretty hungry, after all. 

The fajitas hit our table too quickly, but then we had a few minutes before the enchiladas showed up.  We were almost the only customers in the place, so I have no idea why the timing was so screwed up.  The fajitas themselves were... well, not terrible but by no means good.  So at least they're consistent.  The steak was overdone and not all that flavorful, but at least it wasn't tough.   The enchiladas were worse.  They were buried under a mountain of unappetizing slop.  I think it was beans, rice, and guacamole, but in any event it was the real star of that plate. 

Anyway, I strongly suggest passing this place up.  There's plenty of better Mexican food in Denver.

Amazing customer service and food ! We go here about 1-2x a month and never disappoints! Margaritas are on point and the food is consistent and fresh. They make a point to make sure everything tastes great and you're pleased with your experience . I would highly recommend ! I personally love their green chile !! Yummy !

Honestly, I hate doing this, but based on the service and the plates my boyfriend and I were served I need to at least warn people to never order the tamales if you are going to decide to eat here.

First we sit down to eat, and they bring this pathetic little dish of watery salsa with some cold, stale tasting tortilla chips. I would have preferred tostidos from the grocery store compared to these things.  

Next, we order, I ordered pork tamales with green chile and my boyfriend got a beef burrito. When my plate came out, I cut into the first tamale and saw no pork. I thought, "oh, ok all the pork must be in the middle?" It was not, as I kept cutting there was just thick, disgusting corn flour and some brown colored substance from what the pork was probably cooked in. At the very end of the tamale there was a tiny chunk of pork. I systematically went through the other two tamales looking for pork and had a similar situation. The waitress didn't once ask how we were doing or how the food was, only after she brought the check and we had paid did she look down at the mountain of shredded dough on my plate and said, "oh, didn't like it?"  


My boyfriend ate his burrito but wasn't a fan of the sides, I did not try his plate so I cannot comment really. All I know is I paid $7.50 for three small bites of pork and what was probably a box-mixed corn dough covered in some 505 chile sauce. I normally never complain about food and will eat about anything, but this was just a bit too much for me.

If I could give negative stars I would. The service was horrible. The servers were not friendly or helpful at all. My son's tacos were so soggy we had to ask for extra shells. Food was cold but the plates were hot? We were constantly having to flag someone down to ask for what we needed and by the end of the meal I just got up to get my own boxes which I don't know why because I'll just throw the food out. So unhappy with this place then the lady checking us out was like oh well sometimes this stuff happens. Ummm no. Not for $50 it doesn't.

Man, I love the chili bowl! This place is so good, I've been going here for 15+ years, and I've been well attended to by the owners, whose children I've watched grow up, and now grandkids too, all working in the family business! If you go and Miguel the owner is there, say hi! Hes a super guy!

We have gone to this place regularly for over a year and it has steadily gone down hill the last few times we've been.  Last night was the official last time I will give them any business at all. The service was terrible as we had to ask for water four times, food was luke warm and our burrito was missing cheese. When we mentioned it the server brought a bowl of cold cheese and never came back to check on us again until we had decided to stop eating. I got my check and saw they charged me $2.25 for a side of cheese which was actually an ingredient they forgot to include with our meals. When we addressed our dissatisfaction with the food and the service they were not receptive at all and refused to take off the charge for the side of cheese. Not only was the food terrible it made my boyfriend and I sick the rest of the night. Just a warning for future possible customers there are much better Mexican places in that area.
Salsa and green chili are amazing. Food was perfect. Waiter did get our drink orders wrong but other then that everything was great. They did charge for chips... That's rude
The chile rellenos are pretty delicious! Fast seating and service. I would definitely come here again. Salsa that's served with chips is hot....mediocre decor but friendly staff.
This place is amazing! So glad I found it. Delicious green chili and their breakfast burritos are unbeatable.  A must go to.

This is a good dependable location for good mexican food that doesn't require a major drop in cash. They are consistent and it is a location we know we can enjoy. We enjoy the food, the service, the margaritas. It just lacks a little more pizzaz to some of the dishes. Haven't found anything that was bad or anything that was outstanding yet.
my husband and I grabbed some breakfast burritos for on the go and within an hour we both had (still have) food poisoning

The boy and I went to try this restaurant last night, and while we both really enjoyed our food as well as the over-the-top decor, we both woke up in the early hours of the morning sweating profusely and feeling nauseous.  I'm not sure yummy enchiladas and a bean and chicharon burrito done right is worth the food poisoning, so it's unlikely that we will be returning to Las Hadas.
Best refried beans the world has ever known. Family owned. The ladies used to hold our babies while we were eating. Great lunch buffet also. You must try this place.

Find another restaurant. 
The service was unattentive and apathetic.
The food tasted like it had been microwaved. I had fajitas, they were rubbery/chewy and grey colored.
Queso tasted like flour.
My wife had a beef burrito and it looked like it came from a TV dinner.

We paid a premium for this meal and they gave us crap.

Do yourselves a favor and skip this place.
good breakfast burritos
I went in just for a margarita,  guacamole and chips. Every thing was great until I grabbed a chip, it had a hair fried to it. It was gross. Never going back.

I had a craving for Mexican food and had not had any in the area.  Well boy did we find the right place.

Went on a Friday night and it was packed (for good reason)  we didn't have a wait though.  Came in and a Mariachi band was playing (not cheesy and really good).

The margs were great and came out fast.

I had the Chili Rellenos (crispy) and it was fabulous.  I ordered it with guac (which theirs had some kick), the rellenos were just what I was looking for and cheesy goodness, the green chili on it was wonderful as well.

My fiance ordered a chicken Chimi Changa and the flavor of the chicken was wonderful. He did say the rice was a little dry though.

I only thing I wasn't impressed with was the free tortilla chips (salsa was excellent).  They seemed dry or overdone.  Other then that this was a fabulous place with great and fast service and I would highly recommend.

Enjoy!

So over priced for small portions. I have seen the owners' kids go into the kitchen to prepare their meals while holding babies. Is that even sanitary?
And almost always there's something wrong with my breakfast burritos.

I've been coming here for years. Food isn't fancy but very good family owned business with yummy green chile and the beans are very good. The chile rellenos are delicious. I like mine soft.  If you live close by, support a local family owned business!

I am going to have to try this place again; maybe for dinner vs. a Saturday lunch while attending a board meeting for a non-profit organization. When I try this place again, I may change my review, but for now, it only gets two stars

The food was decent, although the chips and salsa is not all you can eat as is pretty standard with most Mexican restaurants. Portion size was average. 

And now for why it only gets two stars: service was horrible. There were ten adults and about ten kids (can't remember the exact numbers of those, since none of them were mine, lol), and since we were having a board meeting, we were seated in a separate room (the room to the left as you enter the restaurant). I peeked into the other part of the restaurant, and it seemed to be an average lunch time crowd, and from my vantage point, I could see the coming and going of patrons, so I know they never got "slammed." 

With such a large group of people, it does tend to get chaotic, but we had at least three different servers wait on us, and the communication amongst them was slim to none. Of course, with such a large group of people, there is an automatic gratuity tacked on to the bill, so it seems to me, the wait staff didn't have to work that hard to please us: they were going to get at least an 18% tip. Normally I have no problem with the addition of a gratuity for a big party, but I do have a problem with crappy service because of the guaranteed tip, When I've been with a big group of people at other places, where we had great customer service, almost every single person added more to the automatic gratuity as a recognition of the great service. I wish we could've subtracted from the automatic gratuity for this place, it was that bad. 

Someone may ask why I would bother going back? Well, like I said, the food was decent and I like supporting the smaller non-chain type establishments. Watch for an update in 2014.

Edited: the gratuity was not only for the base meal/drinks, the gratuity was for the sales tax, too! That is wrong in so many levels. (sorry, I was reminded of this when I was looking at a tip thread on the talk forum)

Quick service. Terrible margaritas, not a good mix to start with and barely any alcohol. Dinner chicken fajitas don't have much meat and are plainly seasoned. Cooked well though. Carne asada tacos are tough. Clean establishment. Won't come back.

Ignore the 3 stars! I love this place. Consistently the best enchiladas in town. Great service and even a mariachi band on the weekends. Frozen mugs with salt for beer. Love the service and selection. If you like Acapulco style Mexican food, this is the place for you. Lots of seafood too.  Great environment and friendly faces. You'll love it!

Absolutely appalled with my last experience here and i have been a loyal customer for over 3 years but I will not be going back after my last experience. My mom & I went out to dinner because hey! I had a $25 restaurant gift certificate and thought it would be a cheap dinner. The fine print on the certificate was you had to spend $50 and then they add an 18% gratuity- i thought okay not sure how we're going to spend that much but we'll sure as heck try! 

First off when we originally got there- we were one of 3 tables, many others filtered in and by the time we were done deciding it was pretty full. Then it took fifteen minutes her to take our order and then people who had ordered after us were getting their food before us. Hey! We're hungry too!  

Then we ordered Patron margaritas- let me just say there's no way in hell they were actually Patron & they were so weak we had to ask for another shot so we could taste anything other than the mix. It tasted like they put watered down Jose Cuervo in them. Very disappointing. 

Now comes the wait for the bill, my first mistake was giving her the restaurant certificate BEFORE the bill- so then it took 25 MINUTES to get our bill....umm did you have to make the ink? Then we get the bill and our food was around $20 but the drinks were $40 dollars!!!! I understand Patron is extra (even faux Patron apparently) but $12 for a margarita and then $8 for a shot of it!  I was charged $20 for one of the worst/weakest margaritas I have ever had. Again I know Patron is extra but it didn't taste like Patron and there wasn't enough of any booze in there to justify that price tag. And to top it off my mom was charged $14 for hers. They're just making up their prices left & right to inflate the tab. 

I'm almost positive the waitress just made up the drink totals because all their tickets are handwritten but I have never been to an establishment that straight up robbed me like they did & took as long to do it. If you're going to rob me at least do it quickly, don't drag it out. I'm sure they were laughing thinking "stupid gringas" and indeed we were swindled. 

The icing on the cake is the next day I go to chipotle with my bff and they have a Patron margarita on their menu for $6.95 and not only was it a stronger margarita but was actually Patron! What a concept.

The food was okay and worth the $20 we spent but the drink debacle completely ruined my experience and left a bad taste in my mouth. 

The service coupled with the outright outrageous prices (which they don't list on their menu conveniently) and terrible margaritas- I will not be back and I will tell others the same.

My husband and I live within walking distance of this place so we thought we'd check it out. We won't be back. There are much better Mexican places in Aurora for a comparable price. 
 
First we went there for breakfast. The burrito was fairly unimpressive, bland and a bit soggy. We were disappointed in their main attraction. But we decided we'd try again for lunch another day. I ordered the chili rellenos (crunchy) but again found my food soggy and bland. 

How do you make chilis bland? It's a mystery for the ages but their chef accomplished it. 

We have no plans to return.

I tried this place thanks to Yelp.    I had the Shrimp soup.  

When I first got there I was with my date... my 6 month old baby.  SO they overlooked us and wanted to seat the people behind us first.  He's a heavy kid so I had to speak up and tell them we were there first :-/

That made me a little upset but they quickly sat us and apologized... after that the service was ok.  I noticed the other waitress, however, was quick and friendly and VERY attentive to her tables.  

I tried the Shrimp soup... S P I C E Y!!! I can handle spicy but let me tell you... that soup will make you, "jump up and slap your pappy!" as one of my friends says! whew wee!  Still yummy! I'd go back and have it again.  I want to go back and try more.  

I notice there were a lot of regulars there too... they must keep coming back for some good reason!!!

Good stuff!
I have only been here once, was not impressed. The food wasn't anything great, I'm still looking for a good Mexican food place in Aurora

The food was mediocre at best. The rudeness of the waitress really ruined our meal. We asked for separate checks after a couple of entrees were ordered and she flipped out stating we needed to tell her that in the beginning. 

Be prepared to be nickeled and dimed, charging for each basket of chips, really? Charging .25 cents a jalapeño, seriously? Watch the happy hour prices, because they say the advertise price got raised by $1.00 and they haven't change it. The waitress then gave my husband a guilt trip by stating in Spanish,"It's okay I'll pay for it." She's probably the owner. We won't be back!!

Look, is it the most spectacular restaurant ever? Heck no, but are they friendly, yes.  Is the food reasonably priced? Yes.  Is it tasty? We really enjoy this place and go all the time.  Its not the fanciest ever, but its just great mexican food.  Bon appetit!
It was okay food. Nothing that made me want to go back again though.

Do you know who goes to Las Hadas more than any one person should go to one place ever? This lady. I wouldn't say we eat here weekly, but it sure feels that way.

Let's break it down: breakfast burritos, pretty decent, cheap and I can't complain too much. Now they are not amazing but $3 for pretty good, I can handle that.

The buffet: get there early and it is great! Get there late, order of the menu.

Overall their food is good, not great but not bad either. Like you won't be saying best taco ever! But you also won't be throwing up in the back room.

Prices are decent, never felt ripped off or that I was getting a steal. Service is pretty decent, sometimes super good and sometimes it's just there.
I absolutely LOVE this restaurant!!! It is the only place I have found that makes a authentic coctel de cameron. I literally get the same thing every time I go because it is soooo delicious!!!
The service is fast and the food is good.  One of my favorite mexican restaurants!
Not the best Mexican place I've been to, not the worst! I had their chili reano and it was ok. My mom had their fish and she loved it! Service was good, they are nice. I would go there again!!

Worst!! If it was the last Mexican  on earth ? The food and service was horrible ! I never in my life had such a poor experience . I've always had good luck at finding new places to take someone , but this place was a mistake ! So bad that I know I can't give it a second chance . Some things just don't get fixed in any amount of time .

So glad I found this Mexican restaurant in Aurora! Before I ate here, I had yet to have found good Mexican food in CO. Flavor is on tact. Service is great. Will be coming here whenever I have cravings for chicken enchiladas. Plus they had live entertainment when I went (Friday night).

I have been going to Las Hadas near my house almost since it opened, and let me tell you, it is just as good as ever. 

The restaurant is charmingly decorated, with bright colors and a variety of Mexican-themed adornments on the walls. Shortly after you sit down, a basket of fresh-fried, piping-hot chips and rich tomatoey salsa in a little molcajete will be brought to you. As good as this first nibble is, don't get too carried away, because you still have to order from the large menu! 

Las Hadas was one of the first places I ever remember trying Chicken Mole. Although the state of Puebla boasts no less than *seven* (count 'em!) types of Mole, the one usually seen in the U.S. is the blend of nuts, spices and just a little dark chocolate ground together and simmered for ages until all the components coalesce. The version served here is exemplary, helped in no small part by moist chicken. 

But if that just isn't ringing your chimes, never fear. You have plenty of other options. Chiles Rellenos are here - soft or crispy! And both are great. Their Chimichanga (served with your choice of chicken or beef) is substantial and satiating. And if you go on Friday, Saturday or Sunday, you'll be able to sample their Carnitas, made with delectable marinated pork (and swing and sway to the mariachi band that tends to frequent the place at these times). 

After all that food, you'll wonder how you could ever fit in a Sopaipilla or even an order of Flan. But try, won't you? Really, you don't know what you're missing. 

But now that I think about it, that last line pertains to the whole restaurant!

Me and the wife decided we wanted to try a new restaurant. We will not be going back. The service was good. The people were nice but I have had Mexican food from Taco Bell that tasted better then this place.  The burritos were plain and tasteless.

We have been going to Las Hadas for 15 years! Family owned and consistent. My favorites, carne asada, enchiladas, chimichanga, breakfast burrito and the beans are to die for!!  The lunch buffett is a steal of a deal! The sophapillas with honey are a must.

It's twenty degrees outside and I wanted something nourishing. I found it in the Caldo de marisco's at Las hadas. They put half a snow crab in with shrimp, fish, and other creatures of the sea. It was wonderful. My only complaint is that they used imitation crab along with the snow crab. Stop doing that! The crab was delicious why do that? Add extra potatoes or white fish if you are concerned about cost. 
     The soup was excellent the shrimp were big and I was more than satisfied. As long as I'm in town for business I'll be back for more. I may even bring my colleagues.

My food was miserable - not etible - complained and management blew off my complaints, "too bad, goodnight." No response for an alternate plate of food or my polite request  for a refund. Meanwhile, our friends got food posioning and terribly sick. From past, former, customers we have learned this is not unusual.
One of my favorite restaurants in Aurora. A lot of good food for a good price, friendly staff and on Fridays they have a talented mariachi band perform, which makes for an added fun experience.

Terrible service. Terrible food. Took forever to get acknowledged, even though there were only 3 other tables being served while I was waiting. There was more gristle/bones in my burrito than chicken! Inedible... it literally made me sick!

Okay, so I was hungry for Mexican. We decided it is in our neighborhood, why not? Friday night and a really good group of mariachi musicians were playing!!!  Taking requests even!! Great voices and music. The patio was jam packed, we sat inside. They took our drink order quickly.. Yet took awhile for the waiter. He apologized and said they were busy! No worries, chips and salsa to chew on... We waited, chips and salsa gone... Music still wonderful... Waited... Waiter checked in and apologized again... What I didn't like, they charge for the second basket of chips........ If it is so busy and our food has been delayed offer us more chips complementary..... Food was pretty good for tex mex. beans were really good to my liking..  All and all, the waiter tried, he did check in..... The food was alright, the music was wonderful. I would like to go back and see if the service gets any better!

My family is from New Mexico . . . home of the best Mexican food in the US. . . . . so I am always just a tad skeptical when someone says let's go out for Mexican food in Iowa, Little Rock, NYC, Atlanta or Denver. 

But, I was pleasantly surprised at Las Hadas. Mind you, it is not "Tomasitas" or even "Daves not Here" in Santa Fe, but the food was good and the service was excellent!

Our server, Eva Adriana Navarro Torres, was friendly, smiling and made us feel like we were the most important table she was serving. Eva is one of those spots of light that make small strip mall restaurants shine. Food was good and we shall return; but most importantly we will be sure to ask to be seated at one of Eva's tables!
Had a very good meal on my visit to Denver. They had an adobada of pork ribs that was fantastic. It was a mexican type of bbq, better than the sweet american style.

The food was just okay for my hubby and myself. We have had better in Southern California.  For us, there was too much cheese and other unnecessary toppings to mask the food. We prefer when the undecorated food speaks for itself.

I wouldn't have known about this place if a friend hadn't pointed it out.  Buried in the shopping area on the southwest corner of Hampden & Chambers, I may have never stumbled across it on my own.

Last night, a few friends and I stopped in for dinner.  The restaurant is larger than some of the other places I've seen in the area.  Plenty of seating for a large crowd.  We were seated immediately and as per usual with most Mexican restaurants, chips and salsa were brought out quickly.  One of my friends ordered a beer.  It came with a frozen, frosty mug that had salt on the rim.  That mug looked so frosty it made me want a beer!  My one pre-dinner complaint is that they charge extra if you want more chips & salsa!  LAME!

The menu is HUGE!  Big selection!  I got a combo that included a chicken burrito, a relleno and a chicken flauta.  The chicken was moist and well seasoned and the flavors of the dish were well blended.  The relleno was also nice & crispy... so delicious!  My only complaint is that I ordered it spicy, and it was not spicy.  Regardless, it was really tasty and well constructed!

It seemed like an eternity before we finally got our check.  For the most part, our service was good but this was getting a little ridiculous.  Finally, the check came.  If my friend wouldn't have told me, I wouldn't have known this is the type of place you take your check up to the counter and pay.

I asked the hostess as she was running my debit card if they can make spicy food, and I mean truly spicy, not wussy normal person spicy but SPICY and she said no.  She actually laughed with me as she told me how they get complaints that the food is too spicy as it is.  I swear, the normal restaurant patron is a freakin' wuss... GROW A PAIR ALREADY!

Anyway, this was a great dining experience and a gem hidden within a sea of Mexican mediocrity in Aurora.  I am sure I will come back for some repeat visits... even if I have to sneak in spicy green chili to put on my food.

I hate to say it but I have a problem when I'm ask to pay more for a product just because I'm paying with a credit card. Even though they advertise that breakfast burritos are $1.50 you're forced to pay and extra $.45 for purchases under $10 which is HIGHLY illegal!!

They know that they're wrong due to the fact that when a purchase does come in under the "minimum" amount they ask if its OK. Is it OK? Of course its not OK! When called out on why, they either just say its the rule or remember that Spanish is there preferred language of choice. You're passing the cost of you're merchant processing on to your customer because you don't want to pay the fee for lower transactions! 

News flash, either raise your prices, or don't take credit cards all together. Its thousands of Mexican restaurants in the metro area and this is one of the many reason why this one just got lost in the shuffle.
Great music on fri nite? Great service and a good time.

The food is good, and the service is prompt and attentive. I have ordered both from the menu, and had their buffet. The only thing that detracts from another star is that it is too dark inside. Mexican food is flavorful, and festive, and the ambiance of the place says we might taste good, but we don't want you to see what we're serving you. 

Still, I have been eating there for ten years, and will continue to do so.
Been there a ton of times and it is always great. Authentic Mexican. Best in Aurora.

Las Hadas is located in an old little strip mall, which is becoming quite the happening place thanks to Dry Dock.  Pro tip:  the sweetness of the apricot blonde cuts the spice of any burrito.  

The servers are awesome.  I went here last year and came back the other day, and the server remembered my brother & I.

And you can't beat the $1.50 breakfast burrito.

Just meh overall. The service was meh: when asked what she would recommend or what dish was popular there, the waitress seemed confused and just read all the entrees to me. Okey dokey. After bringing out our food, we didn't see her again until well after we were ready to leave.

The food: meh. Not bad...but not good. The beans side dish was probably the best-tasting thing...but I'm fairly sure it was right out of a can. Even the pina colada was bland.

The best part, I suppose, is that it has a patio.

My wife and I have been going here for years and she is very picky about good Mexican faire. The staff is very friendly and have come to recognize us when we walk in. 

I personally love the Mexican style shrimp cocktail with a gespatcho style salsa that you can eat with a spoon. Tamales here are another favorite of mine as they are prepared in an authenticate style. 

This is a great neighborhood restaurant, with the most authenticate menu we have found outside of Mexico.
Too bad the service is so bad.. The food was good but we had to go find our waitress for everything!

Have been dining here since I lived in Aurora when I first moved to Denver over 10 years ago and since we live close again, it's a regular spot once again. The staff has always been very friendly and efficient, always greeting us with a smile every time. 
Chips and salsa are better than some and we usually get a bowl of chile con queso which is delicious with the warm tortillas to dip into it. The bowl is huge and I always get to take the remainder home to pour over hash browns or whatever! 
We usually order the same things respectively and we both enjoy our meals. I have been there during weekday lunch when they have their buffet and the choices are very tasty as well as it being very reasonably priced. Chiles have decent flavor and the rellenos are cooked just right. Have tasted the chicken for the fajitas and it also has good flavor and spicing. 
Can be loud on Friday nights when the Mariachis are playing but not for too long as they tend to stay in the front of the restaurant unless requested to a table.
I have been a fan for many years
Cheap and tasty. Not amazing, but satisfying enough and a really easy and inexpensive lunch.

$1.99 dollar pancakes.... no way!!  (see picture for punchline..)

Yelp has done another good deed promoting this place.  We went to visit our Grandma and all had a craving for some Mexican food.  I opened up Yelp and began the search.... Las Hadas is what we found.  The best reviewed and closet to our location.  

We went on a Saturday night.  The place was fairly busy and the staff was inviting and courteous.  

Everything on the menu looked authentic.  There was a good mix of 'classic-authentic' Mexican and yet still had the traditional 'safe' Mexican food.  

I wanted to a try a little bit of everything, so I got the Las Hadas Special.  A cheese enchilada, tostada, beef taco, tamale, beans, rice, green chilie and a tortilla.  The enchilada sauce was great, the rice was home-made and the portion size was muy grande!!  Overall as a group we all left stuffed and utterly satisfied!  

For dessert we tried the xango and the fried ice cream.  The ice cream had the perfect texture and enough whipped cream on it to kill a horse.... the xango was interesting, hint of bananas and cinnamon, deep fried.   

If you're in the area this place is definitely worth checking out!  I will add it my 'Mexican places to visit list'.  And next time we go over the river and through the woods to see Grandma, I hoping we're all going to be craving Mexican food again!

I thought it was OK, but nothing really blew me away as being amazing. My wife and I are always on the lookout for good Green Chili, so we tried their smothered burritos. Again, they were not bad, but not awesome. Their house margarita appeared to be just mix from the grocery store and a shot of tiquela. Seating arrangements were a bit tight, and they ran out of high chairs, so my wife and I had to eat in shifts while the other kept our kiddo entertained.

We'll likely go back since it's so close to home, but we'll only be ordering food to-go and eating it at the house.
Very good, fresh salsa and the chile rellenos are so crispy and delicious. One of my favorite mexican food places in Aurora.
This is pretty good authentic Mexican food.  Their breakfast burritos are good and you can't beat the price.  I can feed my family of four breakfast for $6 and change.  Can't compain about that!
Cheap prices, amazing food. Love the carnitas burrito! Only thing is the service is a little bad, the waitresses sort of ignore you and do their own thing..

I go here at least once a week. I have tied many different items on their menu and they have always prepared a good meal for my family and I. Try branching out away from the " American Mexican " dishes like enchiladas, tacos, burritos. Try the Diabla shrimp, order of chicharones and a beer. If they say it is a specialty item on the menu I recommend trying some of them,they have been delicious. The wait staff is always prompt and polite. For a local Mexican restaurant they are doing it right.. Keep up the great work !!

Really great food, want a to go cheaper play fight with your kid first.  

They have the best shrimp and baccon wraps in the area.  The beens taste like butter.  OOOOOHHHHHHH.  

Parking is great and they have great all you can eat taco bar....

Only one Mexicain food joint on the strip better, but not name dropping cause you are really good eats....

The food here is good but different if you like chili rellenos they have the best in the world, but the green chili is ok and the meat as a differrent seasoning to it then anyone has. I gave it 3 stars because it is different and seems to have to much seasoning in there meat, but who knows you may love it

Ate here again today.  Had the tacos de carnitas which is only available Fridays and weekends.  Corn tortilla smothered in grilled onions with fresh avocado and pico de gallo.  Also the free chips and salsa are excellent.

I have been going to Las Hadas for at least 5 years.  I have found them to be consistently good.  I get a enchilada combo and it's yummy.  You get free chips and the salsa is tasty.  Service is SUPER!!!

I actually went in for Dinner one night and can honestly say that I won't be back. The food was just OK and the band was so loud I could't even think let alone have a conversation. I am still a fan of the breakfast burritos which is why they get the 3rd star but I just don't think dinner is worth it.
