We had a horrible Mexican restaurant experience.  We made our reservation through Open Table.  The hostess never heard of Open Table.  We asked to speak to the manager.  He heard of them, but didn't know anything else. We ordered by selection number.  They brought the incorrect entree.  We ordered an appetizer.  It was served to us after our dinner arrived.  The fijitas were not edible. There were very few peppers and an adequate supply of burned onions. The chicken was OK. The guacamole had more sour cream added than avocado.  The check arrived with four errors.  We voiced our complaint to the management and were offered no compensation.  Why does Yelp have their sticker on the front door?  Please reevaluate this restaurant. I have trusted Yelp's judgement.

Great food, but tables down a single row, making waiting on tables serving chips / sauce / water you don't see the waitress for long periods. They really need to staff a person at the end of the row for folks raising their hand or something. We eat there regularly, but wished restaurant was laid out differently.

Don't let the strip mall location deter you!  In town on business and decided to give it a try based on the decent reviews.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  Had the enchilada, burrito, crispy rellano combo.  The enchilada was ok, the chicken burrito was good, but the rellano was super yummy!  Only tried rellanos a couple of times before elsewhere and always wanted more crunch to them.  This one had it.  Almost like it was wrapped in an egg roll wrapper. But it was the brown jalepeno sauce that made the dish...

Great Mole sauce. As the other reviewers have noted, the strip mall location shouldn't deter you. The wait staff is friendly and funny - putting up with cantankerous grandfather with good humor. Also, the sopapillas are amazing!!

It was OK.  The chili relleno was actually quite good, but the enchiladas were bland, and contained only cheese (no meat).  Also, after the waitress dropped off the food, we looked down there was no rice OR beans on our plates!  So we had to order them separately and they came on a large dinner plate.  With just average food, and a confusing ordering system, I won't be going back.
Food was decent, but I am always turned off when a place charges for chips and salsa.

We stopped here on our way from the airport after a long flight. We initially went into the strip mall for the liquor store, but when we saw Mexican food, we stopped here first! 

It was pretty empty; we were there around 10:45AM. I can't remember what Larry S. ordered but I had a bean burrito. The restaurant was clean, the waitress was friendly and the food came quickly.

The portions are enormous and not expensive at all. Two items with a generous tip came to $13,and we had leftovers. 

My only complaint was that I ordered my burrito with green chile sauce. I was expecting it to be covered in something like a green salsa, and what I got was a brown pork sauce with pork chunks! I do not eat pork! So I scraped it off but the porky essence lingered. Would have been nice if the menu disclosed the presence of pork!

I give an extra star for fast service.  They start you with chips and salsa. The salsa is very thin and tasted like Tabasco.  The food was very generic. I had a chile relleno, guacamole tostada and bean burrito.  The relleno was small, the guacamole was decent but not enough, the bean burrito was refried beans in a tortilla. 
My wife had a relleno, beef tostada and beef enchalada. She said the beef tasted like dog food, I tried a couple of bites and found it very unpleasant too. 
They almost forgot to give my credit card back.
We won't return.

Couldn't ask for more!! The service is better then the other one,  the food is great, all the new changes make it all better!! So happy we got one closer to my new place! This is real Mexican food done the right way! You can not go wrong going here! I'm so happy for Jr to finally come out and make their way into the world!! You go girl, do what you where taught to do best, daddy would be proud!! Don't ever give up!! Congratulations on your accomplishments, you deserve it!!
Unfair reviews abound. The service was great when I came and the food delicious albeit not exciting. The salsa was off the hook though. Definitely worth a try.

Dined with my family here last week.This location is newer and one of the only Mexican Food restaurants in the area. The staff was very nice but extremely unorganized. It took long periods of time to get out order taken and to pay at the end. This seemed to be due to us not having an assigned server. We didn't get our drinks refueled. 

Our meal was decently priced and came to the table promptly and hot. The meal was good bit nothing specular. Both my mom and myself ordered a combo with a crispy chili riano and the chili was small compared to other local places I have been. 

We will definitely return to give it another try. Hopefully management can get a better plan/training in place by then.

The service was excellent and friendly. The margaritas were perfect. We ordered traditional Mexican dishes and devoured them. Good salsa and delicious hot green chile. We have recently moved to the area and are pleased to have found a good Mexican restaurant to surely become a favorite!

My family and I ate dinner here on a Wednesday and got sick!  It is now Thursday and all 3 of us have been going to the bathroom the entire day!  We absolutely will NOT be back BEWARE!!!  
I wish I could take the one star off of this review...
Horrible food and horrible service. If you like sitting around waiting for cold crappy Mexican food then this is the place for you. If you want good service and edible food go somewhere else.
We loved the food. Prices are amazing. The chips and salsa are the best in the area. Everything was served quickly and hot.

Was happy to have a new Mexican restaurant open in the local area. However the customer service was horriable that we sat for 10mins and had to ask to be helped. The soda was flat never got to order food. We ended up leaving without being served. I would recommend not eating at this location.

Say it with me, BRU-SCHETTA! Now order a glass of wine, and instead of saying it, eat it! This is precisely what I did last Friday night around 5:45pm. The place was already getting packed. A glass of Red Zin really helped me adjust to the fact it was that early, pitch dark out, and I was already ready for bed. But hey- cheers to Friday. I couldn't have picked a better place with its soothing light and upbeat yet jazzy music. Plus, get there a bit early and glasses of wine are $5 before 5pm! 

I sat at the bar. The bartender wasn't overly friendly. I would say she could benefit from giving a smile or two, however, this place was so good I can't even give it a second thought. The wine is by the glass but you can also go shop in this cute little corner where they have all of their wine by the bottle. I heard Tuesdays are where it's at due to their Tuesday night bottle and bruschetta pairing for $20 (after 8pm). 

All of their food looked amazing and I could smell every time something new came out of the kitchen and swept past me.They have amazing looking cheese plates and apps, and even mouth watering sandwiches. They are known for their bruschetta thouhg, which is exactly what I came for. They have about 8 different kinds, and you pick four for $15. It is great for sharing with a friend. It may not look big but they fill you up. I like that they cut them up for you as well, so their is no mess, and you can keep an impressive date face with whatever beau you brought in with you. I recommend the artichoke, the salmon and lox (sweet baby Jesus that was good), the apple and brie, and the prosciutto and fig (yum)! 

I literally could eat here every day of the week. I feel cool when I am here because the music and atmosphere make it feel hip, the lighting will make anyone look good even on their gnarliest day, and the decor makes you want to go home and get pinteresting so your living space could look just as cute! I cannot wait to come again. It is perfect for date night!

Postino is one of my favorite spots in Denver - I'd give it five stars, but when it's busy, getting a server to pay attention to your table is so much harder than I'd expect. (I want to buy things! Pay attention to me!) BUT service on a quieter night was awesome, and the patio is so lovely during the summer. 

Wine selection is *on point* - it's a great place to try something new, because you know that all the recommendations are legit. 

And, of course, try all the bruschetta. I'd recommend going with a couple friends and ordering one of each of the 10+ options! :-)

Gluten free bruschetta! Bruschetta of every kind! Sometimes it's all you need. I like to order a variety and my very favorite is the apple and Brie. Tastes like autumn and spice and creamy beautiful Brie! And the GF bread is pretty damn good too. 

Other than the bruschetta, the wine list and ambiance stand out to me. It's a liiiiittle pricey for a restaurant that mostly serves salads and sandwiches and appetizers, but everything is delicious and fresh and pretty. 

The overall atmosphere seems very feminine to me; this is a perfect ladies night out sort of spot. The music is usually a little too loud for me (especially during lunch, for dinner it's not so overwhelming), but I have nothing else to complain about. The wait staff is so great. I recently visited and felt unwell and had to leave before I ordered anything, and the hostess brought me a ginger ale in a to-go cup!! So so sweet. I always leave Postino feeling happy and taken care of.

I really enjoy the atmosphere here.  Granted it's in hipster central aka LoHi, but you make it what you want.  The music is always interesting - one day it'll be 90s hip hop, the next EDM.  Good beer selection.  The make your own bruschetta board is my favorite -  yummy prosciutto for days!  Go there for happy hour which is until 5pm.  

Boom!

Oh Postino's you win again. 

If you're looking for the absolute best happy hour in the city then look no further and block off your Monday or Tuesday night because this bruschetta board and wine dive is killing it. 

Come in after 8PM and get a bottle of wine and bruschetta board for $20. Twenty dollars my friends - get involved!! 

I've tried every board and just about every wine. My favorite by far is the Zin. My favorite board is the spinach/artichoke and also the salmon and capers. They're not small either. These boards are mammoth - enough to feed two people.  Which, conveniently makes it the best date night spot as well. If you're feeling extra hungry, double up on the same deal and take one bottle home with you. They'll have to cork it but you'll walk away full on 2 boards and 2 bottles for $40!  Somebody, anybody beat this deal? No one? Anyone? Winner - Postino. 

If you can make it on a calm night then sit outside on their massive patio and ask your server to tell you about all their wines. You'll be surprised by how knowledgable all of them are. 

Postino, let's be friends. You have won me.

Wonderful bruschetta, great wine and beer selection, delicious variety of sandwiches and salads. I would recommend anything on the menu as our table had a variety of items and nothing was not extraordinary. 
Tip: features $5 wines from 11 to 5 
And beer specials as well before 5.

Full disclosure: I fully intended to go to a different spot for brunch but found parking in the shade across from Postino and tried it instead. I'm so glad I did! It was the patio that drew me in, but the food, the service, even the music was all excellent. I noticed Postino specializes in wine and has a killer happy hour deal for $5 glasses until 5, also on Mondays and Tuesdays you can get burrata and wine for a decent price (I cannot wait to try this!).

As for brunch, I ordered an open face sandwich with ham, gruyere, and an egg.  It came with a side of small cherry tomatoes in a citrus-y pesto.  My husband ordered a sandwich which was delicious as well.  I also recommend the tomato mozzarella starter.  The mimosas are good but I thought the bellini was too sweet.  

Service was very good, attentive but not oppressive and very friendly.  This is definitely a new favorite!

Postino is easily one of my favorite restaurants in Denver. The service is always amazing, all of the staff here is super friendly and knowledgable about everything. 

Reasons Postino is amazing:

1. They have happy hour 11am-5pm and they encourage drinking wine at lunch.

2. Monday and Tuesday nights from 8pm-close you can go and get a bottle of wine and bruschetta for $20. That's insane.

3. They have the best bruschetta I've ever had. There's tons of options and they're all so incredibly delicious.

Always ask what the seasonal bruschetta is because I guarantee it's going to be amazing.
Long wait but well worth it.  The bruschetta boards are yum! Great variety of wine and overall nice experience but casual enough to not feel out of place

This restaurant is the very essence of the quirky-cool vibe that defines LoHi. From the wall bricked with books to the (seemingly random) Star Wars wall art, this place had some colorful decor choices that left me scratching my head, but it just added to the charm. 

The restaurant was thriving even on a Tuesday night, but not so busy that we couldn't be seated right away--my kind of place. They had quite an extensive wine list, but being my predictable self I settled on a glass of rose to sip on during the evening.

Ordering the bruschetta was a no brainer. Come on, if you're given the option of ordering a plate of bread with delicious random toppings on it, you have to go for it. My favorites were the summer seasonal bruschetta which had cauliflower and a sauce that tasted like magic as well as the ricotta with dates and pistachios. The Brie and apples with fig spread was also very good.

If that wasn't enough, we also ordered all three desserts on the menu for the table to share. The sundae was notable simply for the inclusion of what we're pretty sure was chocolate covered corn nuts. So addicting and so tasty.

I never thought I would have a go to bruschetta place, but it looks like Postino fits the bill.

Excellent service.

Great selection of bruschettas and all four bruschettas that we ordered were great.

Their "Two combo" which is pick two of three choices: a half panini (many different paninis to choose from), small salad (also numerous to  choose from), soup of the day were really good and fair priced ($10.50).

Desserts were wonderful.

Good selections of wines.

Negatives: too loud however that's the only negative and when the weather cooperates there is plenty of seating outside.

Very nice experience overall.

Good wine. Wooden boards topped with four different types of bruschetta. Beautiful downtown views with outdoor seating. Needless to say, Postino has easily become one of my favorite restaurants in the Denver area. It's the first place that I bring all of my out of town visitors, and everyone falls in love. 

Personal bruschetta favorites: Brie & apples with fig spread, prosciutto with figs & mascarpone, smoked salmon with pesto, and ricotta with dates & pistachios 

I can't say enough good things about this place as it continues to be my go-to spot in the city. With a chic ambiance, friendly staff and phenomenal food, I highly recommended you to check it out for yourself! 

BONUS: If you're in the mood for a late night happy hour or dinner date, stop by Postino on Monday and Tuesday nights after 8 p.m. and get a bruschetta board AND bottle of wine all for $20! Double bonus... they have GF bread options as well!

Now, go eat your heart out.

I finally got to give Postino a try last night! I took my Dad there to buy him his birthday dinner and it was such a treat. We tried the Hannah's field salad, the olives, the mozzarella and tomato appetizer and four bruschetta's. The mozzarella and tomato app was probably the highlight for me - just SO good and fresh, every note of flavor was on point. The brie, apple and fig spread bruschetta was way too sweet for me -- but what did I expect?
I cannot wait to go back for happy hour. The service was fantastic too which just made the whole night complete. Thanks Postino!

You cannot go wrong with Postino!  When they opened last year in Denver it was like Hallelujah!  Being in Phoenix for 8 years, Postino was my staple.  Amazing happy hour with $5 glasses of any wine or beer.  Can never go wrong with the bruschetta.

My only gripe is the customer service.  Not the friendliest bunch serving your food and drink.

Came here on a Friday night- the place was crowded and ready for people to start off their weekend. Without having reservations I only had to wait 10 minutes- not bad. They even offered you wine while you wait!

This is definitely the go-to spot in the highlands for a night out with friends. Great, upbeat music, good finger foods, and the vibe here makes you feel as if you're in a big city and ready for a night out on the town! 

Food was good, I had the bruschetta board and my favorite was the green apples and fig. Recommended to us by the waitress, it was the best bruschetta on the whole board! We also got the regular bruschetta- not my favorite as I thought it was not very full of flavor compared to other bruschettas we tries. 

I recommend coming here during happy hour- wines are only $5 then! Otherwise they range from $9- $12.

Love Postino LoHi.  You wanna talk price-to-value ratio?  This place earns 5 stars.  Portion sizes are HUGE on the panini sandwiches, and they're like $10.  Get here before 5PM and you can get yourself a 32oz craft beer for $5.  That's one heck of a deal in my book.

Beyond the food pricing and sizing, Postino's also has a cool atmosphere to it.  They play trendy music and have a really nice ambiance.  Sit out on the patio and kick back.  They heat lamps outside for when it's cold out.

Postino LoHi is becoming one of my new frequent spots to visit.

Um I don't think I can say enough good things about Postino. First of all their wine/beer happy hour you can't beat. $5 for a glass of wine (good wine too) or a pitcher of beer. I always find something good on their wine list too, it's well cultivated. 

When you go, obviously you have to get the bruschetta. They have a bunch to choose from, they are all great.

I've also had cheese/charcuterie plates here and they all hit the spot. Big portions too. 

The patio is delighful, and also allows dogs. 

Wine + dogs + sunshine on the patio--it's the perfect happy hour.

Beautiful and unique decor . Very loungey . Good to chill out . It also has a good wine list and awesome bruschetta items . My personal favorites are smoked salmon pesto and almond hummus with chopped tomatoes . They also have many happy hour specials. For usual days ,11am-5pm $5 any wine or a pitcher of beer . On Monday and Tuesday , after 8 pm, you can get a bottle of wine and a bruschetta board for just 20 bucks.

The service here was great. We had a super patient waitress who came back to our table multiple times to check if we were ready to order (many time we were not). She suggested buying the bottle of wine rather than individual glasses because 1 bottle gets you 4 glasses for the price of 3. If you come before 5PM, glasses of wine are $5 each which is @ least a 50% discount. If you come after 8PM, bottles are $20. We got a nice Riesling that they put on ice for us at the table. They don't have a private parking lot so you'll have to find street marking (no meters). The interior decor of this place is very unique, modern and trendy. They played some Snoop Dog and Soul for Real while I was here (interesting!). I tried 4 types of bruschetta for $14. They included:

1. Brie & Apples with Fig Spread
2. Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato (my personal favorite because of all the tomato, the flavor was most closely like original bruschetta)
3. the seasonal bruschetta with an orange roasted pepper sauce and cauliflower 
4. Smoked Salmon with Pesto

I also tried the sunshine daydream salad for $10 (fresh greens with cashews, bacon, grilled corn, green beans, goat cheese, cucumbers, olives, and radish with herb vinaigrette). I loved the cucumbers and corn. The salad was a 6-7/10. We asked for recommendations with the paninis and went with what our waiter said was the restaurants' favorite: chicken and mozzarella. You can pick ciabatta bread or focaccia bread. Our waitress said she liked focaccia better so we went with her pick. Parts of the sandwich were super salty (I think it was spots where they just sprinkled more salt than others). I loved the large chunk of mozzarella cheese inside but it definitely wasn't my favorite dish of the night.
Great date night spot. Fun and intimate atmosphere. Bruschetta is flavorful and filling.
One of my favorite places for Happy Hour. The Bruschetta is a great deal especially for happy hour.

Monday and Tuesday nights are quite the deal! 

There is a good assortment of sweet and savory flavors for the bruschetta.  They do offer gluten free bread at an upcharge.  

The staff is pleasant, the vibe is great, and there is a fabulous patio.  Great for groups!

Big fan of this place! They keep it simple but delectable. I loved this place in PHX and I'm so pumped they opened a new location in Denver. They have $5 glasses of wine til 5PM all day everyday! And what a great selection to try from! Also their bruschetta is fabulous, and such a great value. My fave is the burrata one with tomatoes and bacon. The artichoke one is a close 2nd. If you're looking for a great happy hour or a place to catch up with an old friend, this is for sure the place to try!

Postino is certainly a nice addition to the LoHi neighborhood.  

The steal that will keep you coming back is $5 glasses of wine until 5pm.  This is quite possibly the cheapest drink in Denver.  This is not just on select wines, this deal applies to the entire wine list.  

Postino has a large and inviting outdoor patio that can easily work for two tops as well as large groups.  I could easily spend a sunny afternoon sipping wine on this patio.  

Their wine list has a nice variety and has a little something for every palette.  I enjoyed two glasses of white wine and was pleased with the recommendation from our server as well as the grassy Chardonnay I ordered. 

Now for the hiccup:

I was not a huge fan of the Bruschetta ($14) like all the other Yelpers have raved about.  The problems start with the unnecessarily thick slices of bread, the bread is good quality bread however it's sliced too thick and difficult to eat.  The flavor combinations range from classic to more creative.  

The tomato, mozzarella and basil combination was nice however it lacked flavor; I would have preferred heirloom tomato's for added juiciness and a drizzle of good quality olive oil.  The pesto and salami combination was lack luster at best, the salami was something I would buy at the supermarket pre-sliced and pre-packaged and took away from the nice tasting pesto.  The ricotta, pistachio, and date combination was better than the first two.  There needed to be more dates or the dates needed to be sliced smaller for even distribution and the same goes for the pistachios.  It was fine, nothing I would order again.  

The star of the Bruschetta plate is the white bean (puree) and marinated tomatoes.  This one packed some much needed flavor, the tomatoes were marinated with garlic and other herbs which made this combination a winner.  I would order this one four times, the other three were throw away in my opinion.  

The concept is great and I certainly love the wine.  The menu is limited in a good way and with a few modifications it could be craveable.  My hope for Postino would be for them to take more time with developing flavor forward (marinating, cooking, pickling, etc....) combinations and not just putting two or three ingredients on top of a piece of bread and pretending it's the best bruschetta ever, I've had better.  I wish Postino the best and hope they can survive the booming Denver restaurant scene.
Food was excellent.  Staff were friendly.  Ambience was perfect.  Neighborhood was great.  All in all, a good experience.

Great bruschetta! Come here Monday's and Tuesday's! They do a bottle of wine and a bruschetta board for $25 i believe.
Their wine selection is also solid.
Wonderful food and wonderful atmosphere. Went for a late afternoon lunch with friends. Service was great.

There are two words you need to know about this excellent place: bruschetta platters! We went expecting traditional Italian, and were surprised that their menu features bruschetta and paninis so heavily. Well, that turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. We chose several bruschetta on our platter...the ingredients sound like Tuscany: prosciutto, ricotta, figs, tomatoes, herbs. All of them are done on a wonderfully crunchy-soft textured bread that our waiter said was from Denver Bakery. 

We didn't get any wine, but saw dozens of people enjoying it by the glass. Their wine happy hour deal is $5/glass before 5 PM...I'll have to remember THAT one! 

One note, the "pitcher" of beer is equal to exactly two pints, not four. Oh well, you can't have it all. ;)

I was a bit disappointed with this restaurant. Came in on a sunday night, wanting pasta. However, they only had sandwich options and cheese board options for dinner. The ambiance is nice at this restaurant but wish that they had more options for dinner like pasta..

LoHi deck with wine! 
He visited this place just 3 days after opening with a running friend. At that time, it was already buzzing. He was really into spending time on the deck, so he twisted my arm and forced me to go today. Their food tends to be light and appropriate for sharing a small group. Of course solo would be fine. All items are great with wine!  As some reviewers have already mentioned,  bruschetta board for $14 was awesome! You can choose 4 kinds from a variety.  If you're a solo lunch customer, pick any 2 from soup, salad, and panini for $10.  Great service and excellent quality food, and nice deck entice us to come here again. Also, $5 till 5pm every day, wines by the glass & pitchers of beer is great deal!  Surely we'll come here again very soon!

My new favorite Happy Hour place and dare I say it? The best Happy Hour in Denver?  Happy Hour every day until 5pm is a wonderful wonderful thing.  $5 wines...any wine on their menu...and $5 pitchers of beer (the beer pitcher is smaller than a normal pitcher but still a killer deal)

Four of us got happily buzzed for $60.  Service was great too.  We sat on the outdoor patio, in the sunshine... enjoying great wines & beers.  What more can you ask for on a beautiful Saturday?  

Coming back here for sure to try the food next time since we focused 100% on drinking this time.

My partner brought me to Postino after raving about it and we were looking for a romantic spot to enjoy dinner and a couple bottles of wine. 

Our experience started out very pleasant, we were sat on the patio, and had a server who seemed knowledgeable and almost over attentive. 

After ordering a bottle of wine and an appetizer, the service seemed to disappear. We finished the entire bottle of wine and appetizer and there was still no sign of our server or anyone else that worked their that might have taken over his section. 

We waited a little longer, hoping to order the dinner we came for and at least one more bottle of wine...fifteen minutes after we'd finished what we'd ordered, still no one had come over. 

We weren't necessarily upset at this point, just annoyed that we had come for dinner and would have to go somewhere else. We left our table and walked up to the bar to close out our tab and told the girl  behind the bar, "we've been waiting for about thirty minutes since we finished our wine and appetizer and no one has come over, can we go ahead and just close out". 

It's at this point that we became upset as the employee started mocking us and joking that no one had come over I guess thinking that we were kidding or joking with her. My partner and I kinda looked at each other like is this happening? She continued doing what she was doing and didn't get us the bill so we asked again. 

She kept making jokes and this is when my partner kinda lost his cool and in a raised voiced demanded that we get the bill so we could leave. The manager must have been standing near as before I knew it he was asking what was wrong and we tried to iterate our story as the girl behind the bar kept going with her jokes.

The manager moved us away from the bar (and customers) and we told him what was going on, he very genuinely apologized, comped our bill, and offered for us to sit down and finish the meal we'd set out for. Despite his amenable response I still get stirred up thinking about the girl behind the bar and the whole experience up until this point. We went ahead and left as the experience had already become irreversible.

Bruschetta and a bottle of wine... Great way to end a Monday. Books and bottles, bread and wine.

Try the salmon pesto it is incredible. This is a great place for small food. Don't come super hungry... It's light fare

My husband says there isn't enough choice of foods but we love it.

Ambient atmosphere.

Postino has ruined happy hour for me.  $5 pitchers of beer and $5 glasses of wine from open 'til 5pm.  Every day, including Saturday / Sunday brunch!  I'm pretty much in love with this place right now; every food dish I saw come past me looked amaze-balls, so get here and check it out (ideally before 5pm).  

Went for brunch.  Brunch was awesome.  Pitchers are 32oz, so by my math that's $2.50 a beer...and it's not PBR.  We shared a pitcher of Funkwerks Raspberry Provincial, which normally runs ~$7 for 12oz.  If wine is more your style, they have a very nice, slightly quirky wine list.  

For food, they have a full brunch menu until 1pm on Saturday / Sunday, in addition to their regular menu.  We went with 1/2 salad / 1/2 panini for $10.  Puts Panera to shame...  We also started with bruschetta...don't skip that part.  Our favorites were the prosciutto / fig / mascarpone and ricotta / dates / pistachios...I plan to go back and try them all.  You may initially balk at $14 for bruschetta...but these are hearty, unique, and worth every penny.  

On Mondays and Tuesdays, they take their bruschetta game a serious step further; any bottle of wine and a full board of bruschetta for only $20!

An interesting experience. The wine was good when served correctly and apps were great. The staff kept mixing our wines by pouring different wine in our glasses that were half drank and kept trying to clear our app plates before apps came out. We started to feel like they wanted our table but decided to try to ignore it and enjoy our company. Don't come for a long stay as it is clear they like to turn tables.

A newly discovered happy hour place for me and mah girls! 

If you like wine (cheap but pretty good wine), come here. Until 5pm, each wine is only $5 and they have quite a bit of choices from Riesling to Chardonnay to Rose. That already is a great start to the perfect evening out with your girls or guys or date or family or whatever. 

The bruschetta. omg........so many varieties so many choices!! Each one comes with 4 types of toppings and each topping has around 3 pieces to share. The most notable ones were salmon pesto, apple and brie, and bacon and tomato. We had 3 girls and we shared two plates of bruschetta and also a chicken mozzerella panini. The panini is huge and they were nice and cut it into 3 pieces for us so it was perfect for sharing. We were pretty stuffed by the end and only paid around $21 each before tip. 

I also must commend Postino on their service. Many different people came up multiple times to clean our table and also came to fill our waters. It was like magic, water cup was always full. Our waiter was lovely and even put wine on hold for us since it was going to turn 5pm soon. 

Perfect evening and delicious food. I love girls night =)

When I first moved away from my home town, it was to the Phoenix area, which is where Postino hails from. I think they have (had) 3-4 locations in the Phoenix area and it was one of my go-to spots. So naturally I was pretty pumped when I heard they were coming to Denver. It took me longer than I had hoped, but I finally was able to make it there this week.

Bottom line, you should go check out Postino. It's in the LoHi neighborhood, which is one of my favorite places in Denver anyway, and I have to say that I like it even more than the original Phoenix locations. 

We went on Monday night, a little later in the evening, and they were running a special "$20 Board & Bottle." Now, for those that aren't familiar with Postino, their specialty is Artisan Bruschetta. They have like 10-12 to choose from, so the "board" they speak of in their special is a board with 4 different types of Bruschetta and then a bottle of wine. I don't think I have to tell you how good of a deal that is, so find out when they offer it and go cash in. 

I love the Brie, Apple & Fig Bruschetta, it's probably my favorite. A simple but great one is the Salami and Pesto, their classic Tomato, Basil and Fresh Mozzarella is awesome. I've had all of them, and while I like some more than others you really can't go wrong. 

Anyway, they are known for great deals on wine and good Bruschetta in Phoenix. They obviously brought the same idea to Denver, but the actual venue itself is better than any of the Phoenix locations. If you have a pulse, and you're in the Denver area, you should go to Postino in LoHi.

I've been to the Postino in Phoenix so when I heard that they were opening a location in Denver, I was so excited! A group of us (about 20) came in for a birthday celebration and with a reservation, they were able to seat us all in the back room/area! They're specials are $5 glasses of wine until 5 pm and then on Monday's and Tuesday's, you can get a bottle of wine and a board of bruschetta (it's a lot of bruschetta!) for $20!! Needless to say, we got a good amount of that special. You can order 4 different kinds of bruschetta on your board so you're not stuck with one variation. If you don't finish your wine, they cork it for you! 

The service was fantastic! Very patient and attentive which can be difficult sometimes with a larger group. The decor is very cool - books lining the walls, rustic wood lighting and great music. We're already planning our next stop in!

After three visits to Postino in the last month or so, they've deemed themselves worthy of a Yelp review.

Normally I'm much quicker to judge and do not require multiple visits before spouting off about a business, but like a fine wine, this one deserved some extra time to marinade. 

What I love about Postino:
+ Bruschetta, especially the tomato jam and goat cheese
+ $5 glasses of wine before 5 pm
+ Friendly servers and bartenders
+ It's a short walk from my humble abode in LoHi

Not my favorite, but not a deal breaker is the large groups of drunk, loud ladies that gather here for happy hour. I get it, Postino was designed for women. The menu of cheese plates, bruschetta, salads and paninis is catnip for those of us with estrogen. Throw in an affordable wine list and we come flocking. 

And with the flocking comes squawking. Did these gals not learn the expression "inside voices" in elementary school? I'm glad that everyone is letting loose and enjoying the offerings, but that doesn't mean the whole dining room needs to hear your personal business.  Wine doesn't make people quiet, that's for sure.

If you are smart, you'll arrive at Postino around 4-4:30 pm, take advantage of a glass of the $5 wine. Then stick around past happy hour to enjoy some romantic lighting and a much calmer atmosphere. Once the cheap drinks stop flowing, the rowdy bunch moves on. 

Yes, I'm officially old.

This is my new favorite spot in the Highlands.

The food is amazing, the bruschetta board is a must have there is no bad option. I personally love the smoked salmon and apple with cheese.

They have an awesome drink special where all drinks are $5 before 5, i highly recommend this. You can sit out on the beautiful patio and enjoy the views.

Spent the weekend in Denver and this was by far my best find!  Had the opportunity to enjoy the bruschetta and loved every single one of them.  My favorites: fresh mozzarella and tomatoes, smoked salmon and pesto, sweet and spicy pepper jam and goat cheese, and burrata, bacon, arugula and tomato.  Came during happy hour but unfortunately did not take advantage of their deals.  Would definitely love to make another visit soon!  A restaurant featuring vino and bruschetta? Brilliant!

Beautiful night at Postino!  Love the patio, great service...our water glasses were never more than half empty, and they made it a priority to seat us on the patio after a rain storm.  Perfect for girls night.  Great food and wine selection too.  Tried almost all the bruschetta samplers and they were all delicious!
Amazing atmosphere and view of the downtown skyline. The food is exceptional. I would go for the winelist instead of the beer next time.

I went last Friday night with some girlfriends. We had about a 25 minute wait, but it was so worth it. We split a great bottle of wine and ordered bruschetta. I had some of the best bruschetta I've ever had. Because I'm gluten free, the waiter, Tyler, assured me the GF bread is good. AND it was! We tried their seasonal bruschetta with cauliflower, bruschetta and bacon, tomato and motz, artichoke and spinach (amazing), smoked salmon (a+) and the apple and Brie (our fav). I cannot wait to come back and try some of the other food!

Fantastic spot for Sunday brunch on a patio! Lovely ambiance and decor, and great selection of brunch items - we got their lox course and delicious peach bellinis. They also had beer and wine options for just $5. Can't wait to come back for dinner and try out the Monday/Tuesday bruschetta and wine deal.

I love Postino so much that I flew to Denver just to check out their newest store. OK, not really. My sister moved to Colorado recently, and we hit up Postino for board and bottle during my first visit. 

The decor is great as usual. I loved seeing all the books surrounding the pass through and trying to figure which were mine (Last year you could score a $10 off coupon by donating books). There's a great patio that looks over the city. It will be a popular place when it gets warmer although there were some brave souls out there during my visit. I was also happy to see plenty of bathrooms. I mostly go to the Gilbert location which only has two for a very busy restaurant.

Service was great, and I was pleasantly surprised to see some familiar faces from Arizona. No need to mention the food and wine. It's the same as other locations, and the reason I dine at Postino so often.

Originally, my buddy and I were planning to go to Uncle for some Asian fare, but naturally, it was packed, even at 6pm. We wandered a bit around LoHi and stumbled into Postino. Right off the bat, the hostesses were friendly and welcoming. The ambience is nice, it could be romantic, classy or casual; something I love about dining in Denver.

They have a great selection of wine and local beer and I think a full bar. My buddy and I split a panino and a bruschetta plate. Wow! Both were packed with flavor and presented artfully. The bruschetta was incredible. Seriously, so good. Its also a steal at its price and could suffice as a meal in itself. What's more is that they have Gluten-Free bread (always looking out for my Celiac wifey)! For that, they will be added to my GF list. I highly recommend this place for any sort of night out and will be back without a doubt.

Just had an event catered by Postino Lohi. The most gracious and helpful staff. Catering that is laid back and can be arranged less than 48hrs in advance. Interesting yet practical options. Super impressed and will definitely use and recommend again.

Postino!

On Mondays they offer a house bottle of wine and bruschetta for $20.
Every day they offer $5 glasses of wine and pitchers of beer from open until 5 pm.

These are both great things.

But, good deals isn't what makes me a fan of Postino (well, it isn't the *only* thing that makes me a fan.) I order a wide variety of food - a cheese board, a Pub Board (soft pretzels served with chorizo, cornichons, aged cheddar and giant Spanish corn nuts), 4 kinds of bruschetta, and even a sunshine daydream salad (mixed greens with cashews, bacon, grilled corn, green beans, goat cheese, cucumbers, olives, and radish with herb vinaigrette) - all to share of course, and enjoyed all of it. The food was good as was the service. And I really liked the ambiance. It's a great place for a girls night or date night. I'll definitely be back for another visit soon!

Overall great experience and great food. Happy hour is from 11am-5pm and on Mondays and Tuesdays I believe it is, you can get a bottle of wine (would recommend the Zin) and bruschetta for only $20! Steal! I definitely took advantage of this. The couple of times I have gone I have ordered their various types of bruschetta and the mozzarella and tomato appetizer. I enjoyed the meal I ate so much the first time, that I wanted the same thing again. Was not disappointed. So simple and yet so good. Will be exploring the other options next time ;) Customer service was also on point. Thank you Postino for existing.

If you should go for anything - it should be the bruschetta platter. Planning on eating a full on lunch with high expectations - my friend and I were stuffed after only sharing a generous serving of their bruschetta plate. And my expectations were exceeded. 

The bruschetta app is prepared on thick brioche bread that isn't unbearably crunchy to the point of cracking your tooth on the first bite. It's thick and soft with the perfect amount of toasted consistency. You have the option to choose four bruschetta toppings. We went with mozzarella with basil and tomatoes deliciousness, artichoke deliciousness, roasted pepper and goat cheese deliciousness, and then the burrata, bacon, arugula & tomato deliciousness. But that's only half of the bruschetta choices! Never seen a bruschetta list so divine, and wonder why more restaurants haven't thought of spicing up their bruschetta options. It's expanding the basics, people!

The service was so polite, the place is beautiful inside, and there's even a fireplace and a wall comprised of books. Though the parking isn't ideal (I'm not where is in LoHi), the food, cucumber lemonade, and service make it all worth it.

Young business millennials rejoice! Finally, as if there aren't enough, Postino LoHi offers you yet another place to blow off some of that pent up office steam by conversing loudly over EDM in a dimly lit room to the splendid tastes of bruschetta and wine. I kid. Kinda. This place is cool. I tend to get frustrated at places like this, just because they make me feel like I'm the only upper twenty-something who doesn't have my crap together in the world, but, Postino LoHi was able to cut through all of my insecurities by offering some pretty amazing food and drink at a pretty awesome price. 

The wife and I went on a Tuesday night, so we were excited to try their bruschetta board and bottle of wine for $20. We waited a while for our server to notice us, honestly I think just because it was so dim in the restaurant, and it didn't help that I accidentally laughed and blew our candle out... Regardless, she eventually came and we ordered the cook's choice of wine (or something like that) - a Spanish Albarino. I had never tried an Albarino before, but I was so happy the cook recommended it on their wine list - it was so refreshing and tart. Another cool thing about the wine list is that it doesn't matter how much each glass or bottle costs on any other day or time, on Tuesday nights after 8 PM, the whole bottle is $10 (when you buy a bruschetta board for $10 as well). That's awesome. And the wines all seem like they would be good... yeah, I'm not a huge wine drinker, but I at least didn't recognize any of the wines to be the kind that the wife and I pick up at a gas station on our way home from Taco Bell some nights... So if that speaks to you, then good. 

The bruschetta was the best I've ever had. They let you get 4 kinds, so it's basically the ultimate wine snack. We shared the Brie and Apples w/ Fig Spread (awesome-the brie was melted and paired so well with the tart apples), the Smoked Salmon w/ Pesto, the Fresh Mozzarella with Tomato and Basil, and the Prosciutto with Figs and Mascarpone (my favorite). 

It's loud, but it's cool... try not eavesdropping to the sounds of dozens of people yelling over the music about their problems. Cheers.

amazing! love the staff, the decor, the natural lighting, the book case and the prices! oh adn the food is bomb too!!!
great for lunch or brunch or a light dinner for a happy hour time 
we ordered a bruchetta plate for the table (4 pieces for 4 people ) was perfect portion 
then i ordered the hannahs small salad which was great and lightly dressed
the seasonal bruchetta was by far my fave: butternut squash, capers, almonds, ricotta 
we also ordered the apple/brie, smoked salmon/pesto, seasonal, and mozeralla/tomoatoe
they have tv's and great brunch food, i really wanted to try the french toast but am trying to diet 
we also got the seasonal olives, not the best but were a variety

I love this place.  Bruschetta is elevated to an art form here.   I had to try (for lack of a better word) the bruschetta flight.  I had the Brie and apple with fig spread; the Mozzarella, Tomato, and Basil, the Prosciutto, figs, and mascarpone, and the Burrata, Bacon, Arugula, and Tomato.  All were fantastic, and the combinations were perfection.  I also had the butcher block (don't judge me).  The artisan meats and cheeses, Tuscan bean (hummus?), olives, nuts, and crostini were a great accompaniment to my Riesling, which was $5 a glass since I was there before 5 p.m.

The restaurant itself is in the former Denver BookBinding Company building, but it has been renovated to give it that LoHi edgy look.  The patio has a beautiful view of downtown with a fireplace, but if you must stay inside there are booths, tables, and couches to choose from.  The service was prompt and friendly.  Did I mention I love this place?

The only bad thing about it is the parking.   I hate parking in LoHi.  I will usually avoid the entire area, but for Postino, I would walk there if need be.

This place is amazing!!! We stop by because of the reviews and weren't disappointed. They have great wine specials. We had $5 glasses of wine until 5. The food compliments the wine very well. I will definitely be back.
Really good food and awesome service! Obviously known for their bruschetta but their brunch menu could is pretty good too. Maybe not the best of brunch spots but definitely a hit for dinner

Oh Postino, I love you so.  As a former Arizona resident, I became obsessed with this restaurant and would visit on every trip to the Phoenix area. How fortunate for me that a location opened up in Denver!   

They are known for their wine and bruschetta, and for good reason.  The wine list is well curated, and reasonably priced.  They even do a happy hour every day until 5 pm with $5 glasses of anything on their menu. The bruschetta is where it's at.  All of the choices on their menu are great, and the cheese and toppings are high quality.  My favorites are the artichoke spread and the burrata, and the seasonal is always great as well. I'm not a big eater, and with the richness of all the ingredients, an order of bruschetta is always/if not more than enough for me. 

The service is always great, and the food comes out extremely quickly.  The restaurant wasn't very crowded and we were seated right away on my visit, but I don't expect that to last.  Get here before you have to wait, as they don't take reservations!
Loved this place in phoenix, love that it's now in denver! Their bruschetta is a can't miss as is their happy hour - $5 glasses of wine (any on the menu) and pitchers of beer. We will be back!

Holy Moly. I may have a new favorite place in Denver! 

Seemingly elegant and fancy with such beautiful decor and tables, but this place plays amazing music, and has a very basic, yet delicious, menu. 

We ordered a sandwich, a cup of soup, and a bruschetta sampler. The bruschetta is a MUST! 

Postino also has a great wine list. 

Highly recommended!

The only reason this place gets four stars as opposed to five is because they leave you wanting so much more.

It's a wine bar with a wonderful selection of wines from all over the world and they also serve food. The appetizer menu is fairly expansive, however the entrees you have to choose from are simply sandwiches.

You can feel the potential of a full menu here and in not sure why they haven't expanded it yet. Hopefully it's to come.

If you skip the bruschetta, you are doing everything wrong. Yes, go for the wine, of course. But DO NOT miss the bruschetta. 

I love the happy hour; and the staff is both friendly and knowledgable. Also, great wifi - I've worked from a table there several times during a slow afternoon and it's been delightful. Great spot for a first date or a night out with the girls.

After reading all of the reviews I defiantly did not give Postino justice. 

I came here for lunch with a friend during the week and we were quickly seated. She had been multiple times and told me I needed to get mixed greens salad, which sounded blah and I wasn't in the mood for so I opted for the prosciutto panini. The sandwich itself was ok, REALLY dry (which is what I thought it would be). I wasn't digging it at all. I tried her salad which was awesome. 

With that said, I totally need to give Postino another chance, just based on the fact that my intuition wasn't great on my order and that the mixed green salad is great.

I love it! This place is in a prime location and has the service and quality food to match! I went on a Monday night, and was one out of about 6 parties on the rooftop balcony seating area.  The servers were extremely helpful and friendly.  We just went for happy hour, and will definitely come back.  It was a very relaxing atmosphere that was not too loud. 

$5 draft beer pitchers and wine glasses. Great beer list on tap.
Simply a fun place for wine and light fare. Meet up to relax with friends or family. Food and beverage choices spot on for most tastes

Postino was born in Arizona many years ago, but is at home in the Lower Highlands neighborhood in the old book bindery. Before I moved to Denver, I lived in Arizona for seven years and visited the original Postino often. I just went to their neighborhood debut night and can say it's already a well-oiled machine of a restaurant; definitely did not feel like opening night, except for the general buzz of excitement.

First, the libations. Postino has an exceptional wine menu, not necessarily in sheer number (they have perhaps 10 reds and 10 whites by the glass), but it is exceptionally curated. It's also the place to go to try a varietal you've probably never heard of (unless you're a sommelier or serious wine geek). I had a Spanish Monastrell (red) that knocked my socks off. If you're in the mood for beer, you're in luck. They have a great beer program heavily geared towards local brews, of course.

Now the food. If you go to Postino, you must get a bruschetta board. No, seriously. If you go to Postino, you must get a bruschetta board. I don't know if it's their secret goal, but I can't order bruschetta at any other restaurant because they have elevated it to (ahem) a mile-high (sorry) level. They start with sourcing bread locally from City Bakery. Then they get serious about the toppings. For $14, you get a bruschetta board with up to 4 varieties. I can't really say which is best, because they're all great. But really, get the tomato jam as one of your four. 

Salads that are more than just a bowl of greens? Yup, great salads here. Pick your protein if you want to make it a meal.

They also have some great paninis, either on ciabatta or focaccia. If you like tuna, their Tuscan Tuna will be your new favorite sandwich. It's like a Cubano, but with tuna instead of pork. 

You like drink specials? They have drink specials! Before 5pm glasses of wine are $5. They also have a great $20 special on Monday and Tuesday evenings.

Sit on the patio and enjoy a Denver evening at Postino. Cheers!

My fondness for Postino started 3.5 yrs ago when I moved to Phoenix. 

Now that I'm back in Colorado I am trilled they opened here too!

What I enjoy the most is the bruschetta!!  It is so scrumptious. Just taste it and you too will know what I mean. They have gluten free for $2 more. My favorites are salmon & pesto, prosciutto figs & mascarpone, ricotta with dates & pistachios, and fresh mozzarella tomato & basil.  Honestly they are all tasty. 

Wine- there is not a large selection but what they do have is great. Everyday before 5:00pm each glass is only $5.

Service- is always awesome! Friendly, courteous, attentive, without being overbearing.

Ambiance- modern, clean and innovative. Love the seating setup on the patio, along with the outdoor fireplace. They also have a great couch area under a chandelier that looks like it's made from old wine bottles.

Bottom line this place is awesome for drinks with friends or to hangout and relax on the patio. 
It is so great that even contemplated keeping all to myself.

I visited Postino for the first time while working in Phoenix and it was love at first taste. I had a full-scale melt down when I realized they came to the Highlands and called everyone I knew!

The Monastrell wine was recommended by our waitress when we asked about the Malbec... I wasn't familiar with Monastrell but it's my new favorite!

The food is perfect and I could eat the bruschetta for ever and ever!
Great party deck. Beers and wines are plentiful. Great place to chill on a summer afternoon.

Great value, great service, great food, great drinks. Postino is a huge development in my happy hour playbook. In case you haven't seen from the reviews: happy hour. Every day. All day, until 5. $5 wine. $5 bubbles. $5 PITCHERS of beer. 

But don't stop there. You should eat, too, you know? The bruschetta is the star of the show. You can mix and match from a variety of selections to make a bruschetta board, all of which were excellent. I am partial to anything fig (so hot right now, fig), but there is something for everyone. They also do a soup du jour, salads, sammies - and - a killer meat and cheese selection. 

Wait for it: heaters on a dog friendly patio. 

(Mic drop)

Decent food. Very much trying to be a wine bar with great tapas. But key word is trying. It's a great space with great staff. Their lemonade cucumber juice with honey was amazing. Aside from that, wine list was decent-good with great happy hour prices ($5 glasses).
I thought the food was good. Just... I don't know just how describe it, other than a place really "trying" to find its niche. Their chefs seem to really be trying to figure out their direction with the tapas menu. They were good and some very traditional. Like mozz, bread,basil, Olive oil/basalm but the others were trying to be original just not landing with their mixes. And I bring up the tomato basil mozz because even that tapas choice was bland. Oversized tomatoes just over bread neither toasted nor super fresh with a lil basil and small amount of cheese. I ended up just asking for balsamic and cutting up the tomatoes with a little shredded basil then salting them up and dripping some of the balsamic on it. Then really tried to spread and smeered the mozz on the bread and adding the tomatoe mix on top. Much better than their bland presentation, but then others are over done and not simplified breaking down the flavors of the ingredients and how everything complements each other.

Overall, pricey but pretty good. 
Come here if you're in your mid 30s to early 50s to feel fancy and be "seen" in the Highlands.

I'm updating this review because the GM was so kind to apologize and try to make it right from my previous review. She felt terrible and even offered to meet and buy us some food and drinks. 
Overall this place has a really cool vibe and its situated in a perfect area. I plan on returning to give it another try!

PERFECT for a quick bite either for lunch or dinner. They offer the Lova Lox on the brunch menu and it is great! Served only till 1 pm.. Also, their bruschetta and the beer / wine selection is very good. I have been here several times and it never disappoints me. Love this place.
$5 glass of wine till 5pm. ~$20-$25 feeds and waters you and you won't forget the meal. Mmmmmmmm

Underwhelming in service and food. The wine was good but options I could have found on my own. The cheese plate had three small selections of cheese literally piled on top of each other. I'm glad I tried it but I don't need to go back.

Highly recommend this for long lunch. Very nice welcoming staff. Excellent wine list by the glass. Don't miss the cheese and nuts tray. We will come back. On a hill side overlooking Denver. My wife and I really enjoyed a leisurely lunch.
We ate here around 5 PM on a Saturday and the place was packed.  Good wine selection; great food, service, and ambiance, and reasonably priced.  The views from the porch were lovely.
Perfect day on the patio. Happy hour wine for 5 dollars! The food is amazing, I wanted to try everything. I can't wait to return. My new favorite spot.

Hands down my favorite place in the hood. Amazing space, one of my favorite patios. Their 5 before 5 deal is amazing. Any glass of wine or pitcher of beer for 5 dollars. Their bruschetta, sandwiches, cheese boards, and salads are all delish. Everyone who works their is friendly and the service is always 5 stars. Will keep coming and bringing my friends and family to this cute little wine bar
Delicious food, great wine selection. $5 any glass of wine is great for happy hour. They also now offer gluten free bruschetta which is excellent.

This place is amazing! $5 personal pitchers until 5 pm and great food. Portions are very large , I had the bruschetta sampler and it was delicious. The rest of my crew had a personal pitcher each, a panini (with is huge) and my other friend had the pub sampler which is like a charcuterie and cheese board with homemade corn nuts (delish!). Definitely will return. They're also dog friendly, my little chihuahua joined us in the patio and we had a great time. Thanks Postino!

I have been back several times for bottle and board night on Monday and Tuesday nights and I am always so happy I did! The deal is amazing, the service is fast and the bruschetta is so delicious. I'm glad I have an excuse every Monday and Tuesday to down a bottle of wine.
Such a fabulous place! Food is delicious, great pricing on drinks, and customer service outstanding!

Last night I think my friend and I had the best bruschetta and service we have ever had. We walked in at peak dinner time without reservations and wanting to sit on the patio. The hostesses were more than accommodating and let us sit at the bar and wait for one. ALL of the bartenders were so friendly and attentive and helpful! We ordered some wine and a butchers block while we waited. I asked if we needed to close out our tab before we moved and they just transferred our tab! I guess they do tip sharing here which explains why all the staff is ON POINT! Busy and full but everyone was so friendly and calm and collected! Great job guys! The food and the wine was nothing short of exquisite and fresh. I would say you definitely get more than you pay for and then some. The atmosphere and patio is quite the place too. Would be fun for bigger groups I think. Thanks for a great night Postino! I love you! 
P.s everyone in your staff is extremely good looking

I had a great weekend lunch here! I especially loved the extensive list of wine by the glass for $5 before 5 p.m. I ordered a glass of prosecco, a mixed greens salad (greens with shaved pears, candied pecans, red grapes, gorgonzola and crispy leeks with poppyseed vinaigrette), and a great view of Denver. The salad came with a small piece of walnut bread. I enjoyed it and would have liked more! 

Its in LoHi, so expect trouble parking. Come before $5 for that glass of wine I was telling you about.

Very excellent and laid back neighborhood wine bar with some great food amd atmosphere.   The nine iron, chicken and bacon panini was excellent and certainly enough for two meals for me.  We had a few questions and what the server didn't know she found out quick for us.  I'm allergic to bromine (bleach) in my food and she lustened and said she would pass along to their management so hopefully they make the change at their bakery because the bread looked pretty good.  Prompt and friendly service and music round out this must go to hideaway for a lunch or light dinner.

We were looking for a place to grab a late lunch and relax before heading to airport.

We found Postino LoHi - looked just like the place to kickback and chill.  We walk in, the place is busy but we are warmly greeted and seated quickly. Patrons and staff all look relaxed and happy. 

Took a quick look at the menu and it appeared to be pretty varied however my eyes rested on the Bruschetta and i looked no further.  Loved that there was such an interesting variety that I could mix and match for our Bruschetta board.  Perfect match for my glass of wine, well, make that two glasses of wine - take the edge off the anxiety of flying.

Our server was lovely and knowledgeable.  

I am so looking forward to another trip to Denver
Their 2 for 20 deal is absolutely amazing on Monday and Tuesday's nights! The bruschetta boards are awesome, and I love the decor.

Just spent two hours with a friend having a wonderful tasty lunch at the new to Denver Postino Italian Restaurant. The service is the best and so friendly and polite, rare these days. I have enjoyed the Postino restaurant in Gilbert, Az in the past and am so pleased that they have opened one here in Denver. I don't know but the Denver location may outshine the rest. I will be back very soon.
Happy hour is a must.  Great size portions was able to split with my date.  Highly recommended!

Super cute & casual place to meet up with friends or have a nice date night. You can't beat the $5 before 5 happy hour! 

Really great wine list. I've only had a couple of menu items, but that's because I loved the sandwich/salad combo so much that I get the same thing every time :)

And don't even get me started on the Board & Bottle deal.....oohhhhhhhh my gosh. My mouth is watering thinking about the bruschetta - my personal favorite is the brie, fig jam, and apple. 

Can't wait to go back!
Please play classier music. I don't like to listen to pop hits while I drink expensive wine. Cool jazz or anything else would be cool.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! Came in on a chilly Thursday, and sat outside under the heaters. We had the bruschetta board (obv), the butchers block, leak + mushroom soup. Everything was divine-- we will definitely be back! 

Only thing I would change is having a touch more lighting on the table-- one tea light for four people made it hard to see what we were eating. 

Also, sign up for the mailing list and get a free board of bruschetta-- score!

We didn't eat dinner. 
But we ate lots of apps
That's the new way.
If your up with the haps.
I'd prefer just one entree
Or maybe just three
The last one can starve and sip on her tea.
Bruschetta was good, the fig-a delight.
Order another? Ok I just might.
We did, it was great. 
The meat was quite good.
Come here again? With the am discount I should!

Stars for getting us in quickly on a saturday night. Stars for a delicious bottle of wine at a reasonable price. And stars for feeding me the way that I like to eat which is all about the variety. I had the bruschetta platter and am not ashamed to admit that I ate all four all by myself (even after reading that some of you all managed to split one plate and left full). I ordered the Brie and Apples with Fig Spread (my favorite), Burrata, Bacon, Arugula and Tomato (piled high with bacon, yum!), Prosciutto with Figs and Mascarpone (love the sweet and salty), and fresh mozzarella with tomatoes and basil (just the right amount of salt to bring out all the flavors). The best part is that they all had their own very distinct flavor profile and were neck in neck on being deemed my favorite. I look forward to heading back soon to sample everything else.

We'll be back especially now that we know about the Monday and Tuesday night specials.

The Malbec is delicious and so was the Bruschetta.

Thanks for great service.

Great food and camaraderie.  Ray provided lots of suggestions and beer samples to find the one that suited our taste.  Ghost burger was delish and the all-you-can-eat wings were juicy and rich-flavored. 

Definitely a place we'll come to again.

A good friend of ours brought is over after grabbing brews nearby at a brewery. What a find!!! We happened to roll in on Sunday and their all-day happy hour specials are more than enough to keep the crowd happy. 

Food was surprising very good. We got a pub burger (nice grilled bun and juicy beef patty), the spaghetti meatballs (real, freshly shaved parm on top and real basil), and chili cheese fries.

If you need a bite and great value, stop by. Service was great! We will be back.

I'm not sure why peeps gave this 5 stars; maybe because of the location by Santa Fe arts district & the brightly colored building.. hmm, well my experience was not 5 stars. I came here for a late lunch burger and I was just the 3rd person dining, the other two SEEMED like they were homeless. The bar keep was friendly on the surface but didn't offer to refill my water and gave me back the incorrect amount of change. I got a 10 back instead of 10.25. My tip reflected my experience to say the least, under par. It's safe to say I won't be coming back here - cheers to that.

MONTHS LATER:
The owner, Ray is concerned about my bad experience at his establishment. He gave me his personal phone number and reached out to me a handful of times. Below, Ray wrote a response to my above review. I would like to take this time to say that the owner has made a genuine effort to correct the above incident. I had hoped that this review of the rudeness of the bartender got the attention of the owner, and that it wouldn't happen to another unsuspecting paying customer. I still don't think I will be back, but props up to Ray the owner who made a concerted effort to correct the situation. I raised the stars from one to three because of how Ray reached out. Cheers to that!

My first time in was on my birthday, as I work just down the road, and the drinks were strong and the shots were plentiful. Our sweet bartender comped one of my shots for my day. 

Since then I've had the burger and the fish and chips - the burger was huge, the fish and chips plentiful -  and both times the fries were seasoned and tasty delicious. 

The people are lovely and the rooftop lounge is amazing.
Chris (manager possibly?) apologized for bad service and bought us shots. Willing to give this place another shot ;)
How on earth anyone is giving this place a positive review is beyond my comprehension. Horrible service, disgusting smells, filthy bathrooms and terrible ambience. Save your money.

Wow a little hole in the wall type of place. It was lunch time on a Sunday not much going on. Was wondering if the place was open or not. DANI the bartender was a great conversationalist made us feel about home. She suggested a bacon PBJ with jalapeño's. WOW that was so good I didn't even stop to eat my fries. And the fries were so good as well. The beer on tap was fresh and DELICIOUS.  The owner stopped by to have a little chit chat as well. I really appreciate stuff like this. It adds a nice touch. An awesome place to eat. Thank you for a great experience

I went here on vacation to Colorado. After the plane ride I wanted a cold beer and a good burger. Everything we ordered tasted like it came straight from the freezer to the fryer. The service was great, super friendly. Sometimes the service makes up for the food but this time there was no chance of help.

I got the AYCE wings for Monday night. The garlic parm was my favorite. The owner was great and helpful. My husband had the spaghetti. He says it really hit the spot. We loved the energy that was neither too much or a bore. They had all the games on from baseball, hockey, and basketball with good music playing.  We've been traveling for 9 days and needed somewhere to sit for a while and have some good food. This filled that need perfectly. Thanks!

Got there as it closed but was able to stay for a drink or two as the bartender cleaned up. Not sure if it was our timing but she was very cool to talk to, very real. Kinda got that vibe from the whole place and its decor.

Awesome service and amazing food. Sports/ Dive bar atmosphere with great drink menu and out if this world food  menu. Employees are very friendly and welcoming. Fast and now they deliver. Mozz sticks and wings  are ridiculous. Please do yourself a favor and stop by for there 4-7 happy hour and see for yourself.

Sat at the bar and had some good burgers.  The food didn't amaze but neither did it disappoint.  I suppose it qualifies as a dive though that term is a bit elusive.  It makes for a nice local joint to get some drinks.  Parking is pretty easy to find at least when I went so even if you live a little further away it can be good for a meal too.  I'd wager I'll go back again the next time I feel like some bar food.

Ok I'm admit I was skeptical. I am from New Jersey so to finding a restaurant called Stone Pony seemed a little silly. Great news: 3 owners, on from Denver, one from Jersey and one from Italy. All in all the combo is brilliant.  Surely a bar atmosphere but the food rocks! I had the Italian sliders with sausage peppers and homemade gravy. On goodness what a treat. My husband had a weird choice but LOVED it, PBJ jalapeño bacon burger. You read right.,.weird but awesome.  We we come back again.

Not what I was expecting.

Food was ok, but really greasy. Service was extremely slow and getting an order placed was a challenge. Beers served in plastic cups. Felt like the kind of place you go to after you've already had a few strong drinks someplace else. Probably wouldn't recommend it though.

I love what the new owners have done with this great building!   Not only did they restore it, they have also made it into a great neighborhood bar.   Everyone come enjoy where everyone knows your name!

Great "Happy Hours" Food and Drinks!
Really good food!
Yummmmm burgers and fry pickles!
Perfect neighborhood place to hang out  ...pool, upper patio...& more!
Awesome service!
Good place for Sunday Family Football Day! ( even to bring kiddos)

Great new'ish spot here in town. Excellent staff - great games - and tons of room! That patio will become a great beer spot, come nice weather! If you're looking for food - stay south to the Interstate (their kitchen staff turns up amazing meals). . . Still bar food here at the pony. 

Watch out for stone pony - if they can dial in on a kitchen... This place will be gold.
Delicious burgers and fries, Death by chocolate cake. Lots of TVs, pool table, juke box.  Open late nights and has a  loyalty rewards program. I think I'm in love. LOL.  Check it out for yourself.

We stopped into this awesome establishment last night after the Rockies game and were so excited to find such a wonderful, fun new bar! We noticed it while driving downtown and made a point to check it out on our way back south. Right when we walked in the door we felt the cool, comfortable vibe. The staff as well as customers were smiling and welcoming, music was on point and the building is open and warm. The chef was sampling some new food for the menu and brought out a delicious Italian quesadilla for customers to sample, i know it sounds odd but everyone loved it! The owner Ray was there and was all smiles, telling jokes, and making sure people were having a blast all night. We will most definitely be back and recommend the Stone Pony to all of our friends and family!

Awesome neighborhood bar! The service was great. There's a roof top patio, pool table, and a full food menu. A must for checking out. The whole place has exposed brick, really cool vibe. Good luck to the owners.

Um. Wow. A damn good burger. Friends wanted to leave because they didn't like the atmosphere (They like a more, upscale experience with cloth napkins and butlers...) I am so glad we stayed and had the food. It's so damn good. One of the best burgers I've had, in a LONG time.

On both weeknights and weekends Stone Pony is my go-to local bar for a solid drink, good meal, and game of billiards.  The staff takes care of you and have always been very kind and friendly.  I am relatively new to the area and the Stone Pony has been a catalyst to meeting other locals.  I hope to see YOU at the Stone Pony soon.
Great happy hour selection!  The bartender was very friendly and helpful. A must try for yourself. The meatballs were delicious

Love this place. Awesome
Happy hour, really cool owner and staff, and has a sort of divey feel but offers way more (pool, pinball, awesome rooftop).
Absolutely awesome food, service and drinks! The burgers were great and you can't forget the mozzarella sticks!

This place is your classic neighborhood local bar. I have really enjoyed each bartender here, they are fun and friendly. $2 craft mystery buckets on select nights is great . Karaoke is fun here, and there are some games to play. I also love the view upstairs on the balcony.
Coolest bar / restaurant I've been to in awhile. Very friendly service and great bar food. Gave us a great deal on well cocktails. Try the death by chocolate cake and one of their burgers.

Great service! Bartender did it all. Got us drinks and food in an amazing amount of time. Excellent for happy hour. Couldn't believe more people weren't there?! The rooftop patio is great for a causal dinner/drinks with friends.

This place was awesome. No wait on a Friday night. We sat right down and we're waited on almost immediately. There was a little bit of a wait for the food but it tastes like it was made to order with real ingredients. Well worth the wait. We'll be back.

This bar is somewhere between a dive joint and a loft bar. Brick walls, two levels with rooftop, and fabulous Italian food! One of the owners is Sicilian and his mom cooks all the Italian dishes including meatballs and chicken parmesan. Perfect neighborhood bar that you want to become a regular at. Will def be back!

We loved this place before we got here for the free bud light with a check-in. We sat upstairs at a super cute patio. Our server was not super eager to help us up stairs but the manager Chris was awesome and super friendly! We loved the food-we ordered a pub burger with onion rings, spaggetti with meatballs and a pear salad. All were super tasty! You could split the spaggetti or burger. I'd definitely come back!

Major upgrade from the last few places that have occupied this space.  HH snacks and drinks until 7pm.  The meatball sliders are homemade and delicious.    The owners have all seemed very nice.  Welcome to the neighborhood!

I've been here several times now.  I've seen it busy and I've seen it dead, but the common theme for me has been the service, especially from Jen and Chris.  Whether it is busy or slow they've treated me very well and I've noticed they seem to know literally everyone that comes in the door and treat everyone the same way.  Total joint at first look, but eat something here and be happy.  I've had the burgers, fries, tots, fried pickles, cheese sticks (hand made?) and the meatballs.  Somebody must be using grandma's recipe for those things cuz they are killer.  And seriously, if there's an off menu daily food special... order it.  I got this pork sandwich one time that was just insanely good and another time it was tortas.  Portions are plentiful, prices are more than fair.  Service is great.  Rooftop is great.  The new ownership is doing something right in this neighborhood and even though I don't live in the area I try to stop in if I know I'm going to be nearby.  Great place to start your downtown nights for cheap and get a belly full of good food.  I also hear they do trivia, karaoke and even host special events.  Thank you to Jen and Chris!

Such a gem on Santa Fe! Great staff and cool vibes. It's the kind of bar you want to make your Cheers.  Multi-level with different sitting areas for whatever type of group you want to bring around. Skip the lame bro bars in Denver and come where the locals enjoy.

You want a hole-in-the-wall casual place with great drinks and awesome food? Look no further. Homemade sausage in the Sausage & Pepper sandwich (amazing) and the burgers are delicious. Definitely will be back!

Delicious food, courteous staff, relaxed atmosphere... Everything I want in a neighborhood hangout.  One of the owners Mom helps with the menu and makes the most amazing meatballs!!  Best new neighborhood bar in my opinion!!

Kind of a dive bar but don't let that scare you off. Food is VERY good. Nothing we had was frozen/re-heated bar food. Chicken wings were flash fried, Jalapeño poppers in bacon were actual Jalapeños and green chili was excellent. Service was outstanding and she was serving and running the bar by herself with an influx off football game patrons. WELL DONE STONE PONY!!
The bartenders are super friendly! Really good food and great happy hour prices.  Definitely  tilt sit on the patio upstairs
Dive bar ambiance, but an impressive non-bar food menu and great happy hour drinks and prices. Winners from their menu: fried pickle chips, happy hour burger, and meatballs.

Went back here with a couple of friends for lunch and to give them another chance. Music  was perfect for time of day a ND there customer service is perfect.  The fod was marvelous.  Will be coming back soon.

What a jewel.
Plan to return often!
Met with both owner and chef, great conversations about restaurant's history and families.
Decor amazing, an airbrushed mural done in 1996, by an artist that now lives in Paris.
Both of us ordered hummus, tanjines (lamb and vegetarian) with couscous, and the best flan we have ever had.
Give this Moroccan eatery a try, just west of 225 on Mississippi, corner Uvalda.

This was my first experience at cafe paprika, and it turned out to be a wonderful experience. Right when I walked in it was empty and a lot smaller then I had imagined, however it gave off and cute and homey aura that I loved. The owner was super friendly and made small talk with me while I was waiting for my party to arrive. The place had been here for 23 years which really surprised me. 
We ordered mint tea which gave off a nice herbal scent which was enjoyable. We started off with the Chicken Bastilla, which was amazing we devoured so fast that we forget to take a picture. But the savoriness of the chicken and the powered sugar on top surprisingly made a great combo, and I loved the flakiness of the dish.
