Right when I came out we were worried that it would be a little dry but I was perfect, def my fav part of the meal.
For the main course I ordered the Chicken sandwich with a side of seasoned fries, this is not your typical sandwich as it came on warm fluffy pita bread and the cucumber yogurt that came with it was great. Lastly we ended with baklava and mhencha. Mhencha was so yummy I actually enjoyed that more than the baklava which surprised me.
Overall my experience was great, and when we were leaving they were getting packed so I suggest going their around 545pm ish, if not you might have to wait a little.
Def be back.

Bummer! It LOOKS so good but the taste is so BAD. Here's the gist of it:

We stopped in and were charmed by decor and the owner. What a wonderful friendly man. Everything on the menu looked great. Mint tea was great. 

We started with the Middle Eastern combo appetizer. The falafel was good but the hummus was MUSHY and the baba ghanouj was pasty and tasted something awful. Really AWFUL. Bad eggplant maybe?

The chicken couscous was DISAPPOINTING. It had no flavor. Both the chicken and the vegetables. I know! How could it be? The vegetables were surely cooked but they didn't taste stewed. You know, the kind of stewed that seeps into the couscous on your dish? I think it needed some sauce to round it out. WORSE? The couscous came out COLD. I think they just prepared it the day before and then heated up some chicken on the plate. I mean, this couscous came out temperate COLD like straight out of the freezer. The apricot chicken was pretty alright. 

I'll spare you the..um..bathroom aftermath.

Yeah this place just deserves 5 stars.  Food is always delicious, service is always great. 
They are not open late like some other places, and have some things not as good as other places... BUT!  Consistent, and still delicious!  I really enjoy the falafel and that is a tough dish to please me with, but they do!

I came in with my coworker for lunch and it was absolutely amazing. I'm planning on coming back this week :) 

We got a couple of appetizers, the bastilla and baba ganouj. While the baba ganouj was lovely, the bastilla stole the show. I can't recommend it highly enough.

For lunch we did lamb gyros and seasoned fries. 
Every part of the gyro was perfect. The pita was warm and soft, the vegetables were crunchy, the tzaziki was refreshing and the lamb was spiced beautifully and tender. 

The seasoned fries were also excellent though with the appetizers a little bit too much food. In the future I would do one or the other. 

Overall, the entire experience was fantastic. The only low point was being too full and unable to finish all of the delicious food.

This place is an absolute hidden gem. With an unassuming storefront, don't be surprised because when you open the door you are transported to a new and beautiful world. The decorations are lovely and the painted walls make you feel like you have stepped out of Aurora.

I went last night with my SO to celebrate some good times, and we were both blown away and look forward to coming back to try more items on the menu. Our first taste of Cafe Paprika was the Chicken Bastilla. A flakey plastry filled with savory and sweet flavors, we would have been enchanted if that were all we got to enjoy as we savored each bite. Next we got the apricot lamb and a Plum flavored lamv tajine. Soooo goood!!! We shared so that we could each get a full experience of both dishes, and they were both equally amazing. Lastly we tried their made-from-scratch baklava. It was similar to the Greek dessert but incredibly different as it was less syrupy and was served with a light syrup made of a combination of fruit flavors. Absolutely delicious!

The owner was our waiter and he was wonderful. You could easily see his pride and love for Cafe Paprika. The service was great, the food amazing and the presentation perfect. I can't wait to go back and try some new items!

Everything was delicious. We started with the chicken  bastille which could be a meal by itself.  It's sweet and savory. (Could be a dessert too!)
The owner is awesome! We saw him walk an elderly customer to his car and he took time to tell us a story. Very personable.
Dinner was great. We both got a different lamb dish and we made every effort to finish them. The portions are generous. 
Great place that you should visit.

I cannot review the food here because we never got around to even ordering it. We were sitting there for 15-20 mins and no body even bothered to talk to us. There was one guy who was serving the table next to us and also was bringing food "to go" to another table. Didn't even bother to say that they will be delayed, nothing. We just left, probably would have been better to have said something to the guy.

While trying to find "something different", we found this great jewel of Moroccan and Mediterranean restaurant. Enjoyed everything, from the personable greeting to the delicious dinner. Try the falafel appetizer; the most fresh and delicious. For main fare, try the couscous supreme. 
Promise you will love this place.

I am a Mediterranean food addict, so I make it a point to try any Mediterranean restaurants if I am in an area I'm not often in. This restaurant didn't disappoint. I ordered the Apricot Chicken, and everything from the chicken to the couscous to the veggies was perfect. The flavor was so perfectly balanced. I cannot wait to go back. Also, the mint tea was very good. To add one more thing, my fiancé, who rarely enjoys Mediterranean food loved the kabob plate. 

Service wise, the staff was friendly and welcoming. It was clear they were truly appreciative of our business.
Fabulous food, great service, everything fresh and homemade! Homemade baklava was some of the best I've ever had! We came from Utah and I can't wait to come back.
Was fantastic. Great food and service. Would recommend to anyone looking to experience authentic Moroccan cuisine. Family owned with a quiet peaceful atmosphere. Love the mint tea

Just had the best falafel ever!!! The green mint tea was perfect for the snowy weather. I also tried the Bastille for the first time which was an amazing blend of savory and sweet. The owner/chef was really friendly as well. Plan to come back again hopefully!!

What an experience! 
Whether you are a seasoned Moroccan / Mediterranean eater or you are adventuring - this little gem is a must try. 
It's a small, family owned, quant establishment that has been there for 23 years! 
The food is AMAZING and the service is even better. I would recommend ordering the Lamb Tajine, or the Couscous Royal. Don't forget dessert - the Baklava is unlike any other - in the best ways! 

Thank you, Cafe Paprika for a delightful experience. We will definitely be back. Yummy!

We ordered a middle eastern combination(MEC), a falafel salad, vegetarian couscous and a guava juice. The best was the MEC and the presentation was amazing. (It was too good to keep my hands off of it to even take a photo). The couscous was ok and it was my first time trying it. The falafel was great on both of the other dishes. My gf liked the lemon in the salad and throughly enjoyed the experience.

The service was good and the waiter was really friendly and polite. The ambience is good and feels very homely . 

Overall - 4. 5
Food - 5
Service - 4.5
Cost - 5
Ambience - 4.5

Very nice atmosphere with intimate comfortable seating around the margins of this authentic Moroccan cafe. The owner, Chakib Marrakchi, was very attentive and informative and we had an excellent experience. We recommend the Bastilla as a starter, and found the lamb kebab and the salad Madison to be very good.

One of the best middle eastern restaurants I've been to (Fyi I'm middle eastern ).  Their appetizers in hummus and baba ghanoush sampler was so light and full of flavor.  The main entree was also scrumptious, we ordered the Kabab entree with lamb shank which were out of this world.  All the food had the right amount of spice and flavor.  For dessert we ended up ordering the flan, it was perfect.  Not too caramelized on the top but just the right consistency.  Will definitely come back!

Went here for the first time on a Wednesday around noon. Its a cozy little place, maybe 10 tables.  My coworker and I were greeted and seated right away. 

We ordered hirrarra soup, salad, pita bread, a gyro and fries. Food was delivered timely, hot food hot and cold food cold! The soup was a first for me and it was great.  Vegetarian and the combination of lentils with cilantro was delicious and refreshing! The hummus was fresh, pita bread soft and warm, fries perfectly seasoned.  

I think my favorite thing about eating here was the cozy atmosphere and personable staff.  We were waited on by the owner.  He chatted with us quite a bit and made us feel welcome. 

Just a note. Tea and hummus is offered but is not complimentary, don't get sucked in!  He started pouring the tea before we even said yes, creating the impression that it was free. We said we didn't want hummus but then he brought it anyways and charged us for that as well. Either way, i recommend this restaurant for the good food, cozy atmosphere and personable staff but be careful with the up selling.
Amazing!  Quick stop for lunch. The kindest people and the yummiest food. Definitely recommend this place!

Cafe Paprika is one of our favorite spots in the metro area for eats.  The food is homemade and delicious and the friendly owner is always at the restaurant.  We love the tagines, especially the Meatballs and eggs.  We always start with the Salad Maison.  Everything is delicious. You can't go wrong.

Quiet.  Delicious! 
Ordered Bastille as an appetizer and it was addictive! So good! 

My husband got gyros and they were perfectly cooked.  My lamb shank was falling off the bone-tender and flavorful.  Wonderful food. The only flaw-I couldn't finish! Generous portions made the prices very reasonable.  

Definitely returning!

Seriously yummy food. I chose items I was familiar with and wasn't disappointed. I'll venture out and try different fare next time. And there'll definitely be a next time! The owner made me feel welcome with fantastic service, too.
Enjoyed the food and the hospitality of the owner.  Looking forward to coming back again to continue my exploration of their menu.
Excellent authentic Moroccan food. Great service too. Try the lamb shank (house special)!

Three words. Tasty. Scrumptious. Mouthwatering. 


As a child I have always passed this place, probably some odd thousands of times. I never knew exactly how it would taste, because it always looked empty. Turns out that I was always progressing through the neighborhood during their closed hours. Determined, I decided to give this Mediterranean locale a try. 

WOW! And that word is an understatement. The decor wasn't up-to-date, but it was lavished in a painting with a desert, clean floors and PACKED with patrons; some were regulars! As I walked in I was approached by the owner, who was quick, prompt and timely. 

I ordered a Gyro sandwich and this was some of the most exquisite, flavorful meat I've had in a Gyro. Instead of the habitual square slices that I have experienced, this meat was cubed, which allowed it to be packed into the pita tightly. Absolutely elegant, and it was F-I-L-L-I-N-G! Something that isn't always common in this little mom-and-pop shops. 

I'll definitely be back for another Gyro sandwich very soon! Thanks for the incredible food!

This place is one of a kind. Definitely a place worth checking out if you're in Aurora. I had the kabobs, and my husband had the lamb. We started off with the hummus and Bastilla. We left happy and satisfied!
Delicious! Owner is lovely as well. Had the chicken couscous, kebabs, and falafel, everything was great! Glad to find this place.

I had their Bastilla appetizer which I though was really good. I also had their meatballs with fried eggs with rice which tasted great. I did find the fact that the tagine did not come with neither rice or bread strange but I don't know much about Moroccan food. This place is a close second to Restaurant 'Tagine' in San Francisco. You will not be disappointed!

Worst hospitality I've ever seen. I don't have the option to give 0 stars else I could give that definitely. I went and sat by my self no one to receive. The waiter came after 10mins and took my order and he din't even put a glass of water on my table for the next 37mins till I ask and later after 51mins I got my order of appetizer and a juice. This is the 1st place I left without giving even a cent for tips. 
Worst place. 
And to be frank the food was ok. I would give a rating of 3 on 5 for the food compared to other meditation restaurants. Over all F.........

Bastilla and Falafel...nuff said.  Took the whole family there.  Nice atmosphere.  Good food.  Always great to hear the owner personally greeting all the returning customers.  I had the lamb shank, but sampled off of everybody's plate (Kebab, Tajine, etc).  Looking forward to our next visit.
Yum! Great restaurant, cozy atmosphere, delicious food. Owned by the same family for over 20 years. Try the lamb shank and baklava!

We ordered the hummus, a pastillo, kabob plate and a gyro. All were mediocre. Slow service. Overall Yelp in Colorado has been spotty at best. The pastillo was the highlight of the meal. The pita and hummus did not taste homemade. The gyro was oddly sweet and the fries are frozen, covered in paprika. The kabob plate was meh.

Had the lamb gyro and it was perfect, served with paprika fries (yum). The owner actually talked to us and said that he doesnt advertise but through referrals and online venues like yelp, word has spead. It is definitely worth the trip!

Service was great!  I believe the owner personally served us, kept refilling our tea and waters, accommdated us with every request.  We forgot one of our phones there and they waited of us to come back to get it. Definitely will come back to visit.

The food is fabulous! Wonderful traditional Moroccan cuisine. The spices & flavors are beautifully subtle, delicious.  The Bastilla was a taste to savor.  The owner, Chakib was gracious & delightful.  We were welcomed with true Moroccan hospitality! Thank you Chakib!

Gyros, Kabob, Wraps with rice and vegetables and soups too? Now that's a compliment to the Mediterranean restaurant title. This particular restaurant serves Moroccan food too with many popular cultural dishes. I love to try new things and the I tried the Kabob plate which was incredibly delicious and so full of life. It looks similar to Israeli food but with more vegetables and rice. The Gyros are a multicultural thing, but this restaurant does pull it off pretty swell and smoothly. They are popular for their seafood, chicken, falafel, and bastilla. They serve sides of French fries too! They have a variety of seafood like oysters, scallops, shrimp, and fish. They serve their food with hard shell taco and with the veggies and fries! Let's not forget the amazing fact that they don't leave out dessert for anyone. They have their popular Moroccan cultured pastries, tiny, miniature cakes, bread with powder and cinnamon sticks. It's a good cafe which serves all these different variety of foods, snacks and desserts. They also serve their traditional coffee, tea, and chai. They obviously don't end their menu from here, these are just things noticeable on their chalkboard menu, I'm pretty sure they have wayyy more stuff to sell besides my point, but I'm eager to go back again and pay another visit!!

This is our first time at a Moroccan and we were BLOWN AWAY!! This place is amazing!
My wife had the Apricot Chicken and I had the Tajine Marrakesh. 
We will definitely be back and often!

Phenomenal Hummus
Friendly service and cozy environment
You have to look for it to find
It but you won't be disappointed

I started with the pita, hummus and Harrira soup. Then I had the kebab entree with three mouthwatering marinated & grilled skewers served atop a bed of saffron basmati rice accompanied with sautéed veggies. The flavor was great! A perfect balance of spices and cooked to perfection. Already planning my next trip back here since I'm only here for a week on business. Apparently, they've been running this restaurant for over 23 years. The owner was a very sweet and hospitable guy. Talked to me while waiting for my food and had a great conversation about him, Morocco, his business, family, etc... Felt welcomed and that's how a business should always be run! You will enjoy the food and experience!

Delicious food: Mediterranean Platter as starter and Kebab Combo as entree, with a great mint tea to wash it down. Could not be more satisfied with my lunch. Very friendly owner, quick service. Again, 5 stars are deserved.

I was delighted to discover that this non-chain restaurant was fairly close to my hotel. The positive reviews are not deceptive; the food is good and Chakib is friendly and helpful. I ordered the hummus and falafel appetizer and the Moroccan tea per Chakib's suggestion to go along with my meal, and I was glad I did. For my entree, I ordered the preserved lemon and olive tajine with lamb, and I was pleasantly surprised at the strong flavor in the lemons, but they were not overpowering. All of the ingredients shined and mixed well. If you're not in to lemons, then this dish won't be for you, but there are plenty of other delicious looking items to choose from. I will happily return whenever I am back in the area.

This restaurant is the best Mediterranean/ Moroccan ever!  I haven't taste anything this good for 15 years. I have been to many different Mediterranean restaurants and this one is incomparable. I would highly recommend this place!  It's our first visit and we haven't decided which dish is the best at this time. We will keep coming and explore through out their menu.

Their desserts and coffee are to die for!

This place was awesome! Very cozy and relaxing. I've been wanting to come here since I moved to Colorado and boy was it worth it. Our server which I think may have been the owner was very helpful and funny. He helped us with any questions and gave his suggestions which were delicious. Starting from appetizer through dessert, everything was just super yummy and flavorful. This is definitely a hidden gem and I'm glad I finally discovered it! Can't wait to go back.

Very good lamb shanks! The owner is quick to greet you and truly makes you feel welcome. He always talks me into trying something new each time I visit. Herbal Tea, falafel or baklava whatever it is that he suggests I try-  I am always very satisfied with his recommendations. Decent prices for the large quantity and great quality that you receive.

These reviews have to be paid for. This was the worst gyro I have ever had. My pita was hard as a rock and the lamb cubes were the exact same way. Dry, tough, old. Just a bad experience. My dinner mates food was the exact same way. And to top it off the service took forever. I highly DO NOT recommend this place.
Intimate Moroccan restaurant with tasty food, friendly owner and pleasant ambiance. Cous-cous and lamb was especially well spiced. Bastilla and baklava not to be missed.  Good value.

My wife and I were in Aurora for a couple days and came to Paprika because of the heat yelp reviews... And yelp did not lead us astray!!

The food was incredibly flavorful and delicious. We split a bunch of appetizers (falafel, hummus, baba ganouj, soup, bastilla with chicken - an absolute must) and then also shared a couscous royal, which came with every kind of delicious meat imaginable. The ambiance of the restaurant was great and the service was top notch. 

Will come back for sure next time I'm in Aurora!!
I just said to my husband, "I haven't had a meal like that in a while".  What a find!  The food was amazing from the hummus to the desert.  We will be back often!

If you want to try authentic Moroccan food try Cafe paprika in Aurora Colorado, the staff is so nice food is made with love so tasty so delicious my favorite dish is the chicken bastilla. Make sure to try the delicious soup Harira, myself my wife and kids when we miss Moroccan food we only go to cafe paprika 
There's a reason why this place has been around for 19 years

Bastille fabulous. 
Tajine lamb shank delicious.

I'm from SF where there is excellent Moroccan food. This is phenomenal
So happy we found this place through the other yelp ratings. This place has great food and awesome service. We will definitely be back!

We had a delicious meal. The Bastilla and the Baklava were the highlights, both of which our 10 year old devoured. The owner greeted us warmly and took great care of us. Will definitely be going back!
Such an amazing place and great hospitality. Must try lamb tajines! Oh the coffee is amazing as well ! If you are in Denver try it otherwise you are missing out !!

Tiny place in a strip mall but HOLY COW the food is DELICIOUS! Everything is made fresh, it honestly feels like you walked into someone's home and they made you dinner. The seafood Bastille was to die for. The appetizer sampler and the fish tajine was also amazing.  Very friendly staff. It's a 40 min drive but we will definitely be back soon.
Very good. Friendly staff and wonderful  falafel. Loved everything i tried. Will definitely be back. Highly recommended.

It's Like Taking A Trip With Your Tastebuds!
   After having Cafe Paprika bookmarked for months I finally came here! I don't know why I waited so long!!!! It was such a great experience for me and my mom. She lives in Hawaii and doesn't have things like this so it was a treat for her :) I found that the whole time we were welcomed and attended to by the owner. He was so nice. And pours tea with a very long, impressive flourish! I would say almost the length of my body lol baller status!!!!
   For lunch we shared the Bastilla as a app. It's like if you took a baklava, kind of, and put spiced chicken inside and without the honey. Or if you could make a Hot Pocket edible... This was crazy good! The powdered sugar dusted on top makes it look like dessert but it is something even more special :D After we had the Lamb Shank and a Fish dish (I think it was sole...) Nice portions, not too big and enough for small leftovers! Both lamb and fish were just so tender and full of hearty flavor. 
   I want to go back again and bring my partner!
Very friendly staff the food was made fresh to order nice portion size highly recommend the owner very nice they have been their 23 yrs and hope many more

The good:  The staff was nice, attentive, and filled the mint tea about a zillion times.  It was clean, well lit and quiet.  The falafel was really good, and I normally don't like falafel.

The meh: Nothing had much flavor.  The gyro meat was dry.  The hummus, baba ganoush and tziki sauce all tasted about the same.  EVERYTHING had too much cinnamon on it.  It wasn't a little bit for an exotic flavor boost, but saturated the rice, the potatoes, the meat, and I believe it might have been sprinkled on the hummus and ganoush.  I think the cinnamon could have been balanced with salt, which was sorely lacking in everything and not readily availble on the table.  

All in all, a mediocre experience.  I'd drive the distance and go to Jerusalem's over by DU if given the choice.
Excellent food. Superb service. Great atmosphere. Order the lamb for sure! I will be back! Thank you for a wonderful experience!

Had the apricot chicken and it was delicious. Along with a greek salad and a friendly waitstaff - this place deserves a high rating.
We'll be back.

Our first time here was wonderful. We arrived about an hour prior to closing but there were no signs that they were in a hurry to have us leave. The server was very helpful in answering our menu questions and our Mint Tea (delicious) was never empty. My partner got the couscous with the Moroccan sausage and I got the combination kebab.  Both dishes were delicious and presented very nicely. The seasoning was not over powering but rather it m complimented the dishes nicely. The atmosphere was intimate and inviting. We will definitely be back!
Food was ok. But fairly bland compared to places like Jerusalem's or Ali Baba. Definitely worth trying though

Fabulous food! Great atmosphere! I've been to many restaurants that serve Mediterranean cuisine in Denver. This is incredible! Impeccable service. The owner is diligent and attentive. I will definitely be back!

I was in town for business & wanted to try something out of the ordinary - I'm SO happy that I did! The service was fabulous and friendly - they really make you feel at home. I took another person's recommendation & ordered the Chicken Bastilla appetizer. It's a must try!!!! I was impressed with my apricot chicken also. Absolutely recommend coming here.

The best Moroccan food this side of the Atlantic. I've have lived in Fes, Morocco and Cafe Paprika has recreated many of my favorite dishes. You can't get a better Moroccan meal anywhere. You must order the bisteeya!
The food here is very good and the owner is super nice. Great spot.  We'll be back.

Absolutely delicious!  Highly recommend the lamb shank with saffron rice. Perfectly spiced!  Owner was an absolute delight and put me completely at ease while dining solo on a business trip. Wish I had room to try dessert. Don't miss this absolute gem tucked away in Aurora. Worth the trip off of the interstate.
Solid Middle Eastern grub!

Cozy, tucked away place with amazing authentic food. Driving up, the strip mall location was not quite inviting, but totally worth it. The owner said they've been in business for 20+ years, and I believe it. I went to Morocco last summer and the taste was surprisingly comparable. Very filling, with complex flavors and amazing spices.
Great, family run little restaurant. The food is delicious and the service is wonderful. Definitely get the bastilla! And the mint tea is perfect.

When I want to eat the best food available I always hit up Yelp.  Yesterday I yelped best lunch in Aurora, CO, and Cafe Paprika was on the top of the list.  I hadn't eaten Moroccan food before but thought it would be good and with the high yelp reviews my wife and I pulled the trigger.

I have nothing but high praise for Chakib and his staff.  We were treated to some of the best food I have ever eaten and the most welcoming hospitality I have ever experienced.  We have eaten thousands of meals in our lifetime most of which I can't remember.  I promise you I will never forget the delicious meal and conversation we shared with the owner of this establishment.  We will go again soon.
The food is great, the service is better, and the location is very convenient. Very good dinner for a reasonable price.
Food was good not amazing. Had the hummus plate, Greek salad and the couscous with mixed meats. The lamb was gamey. If you're in the hood stop by.

The food was great, especially the hummus, falafel, and baba ghanoush platter, which was recommended by the owner. We also had the falafel sandwich and fries (yum!), and the vegetable tangine (pretty good, could have a little more flavor).  My only real complaint is that they forgot my baklava in the to-go order. I was really looking forward to it.

My wife and I come here as often as we can. We usually start off with the bastilla which is remarkable. You will want to devour it. 

My wife usually orders the tangine dishes which burst with flavor. I usually order the kabobs. 

We have yet to be disappointed. They vegetables they use are fresh. They make their own hummus, which is mouth watering. 

One of their best dishes is the apricot lamb. They do not use canned apricot and you can taste the difference. 

Great place, great atmosphere.

Not much to say that hasn't already been said...but I promised the owner I'd write a review, so here I am. I didn't specify what I was going to write, though, so don't worry, I paid for my meal just like everybody else ;)

Surprising little place. Inconspicuous location and unassuming exterior...but excellent food. First time eating couscous in forever! Everything was delicious, including the mint tea. Very small dining room (don't have your family reunion here without making prior arrangements) and a decent crowd for a Tuesday night. Great service, too. Would definitely go back!
It's okay.  Took forever to get seated.  A little overpriced.  I've definitely had better Mediterranean food.  Nice if you like a mom&pop shop, hole in the wall sort of place.

I've been here twice and am not that adventurous, but had the chicken bastilla and still, months later, it makes my mouth water. Writing this review makes me want to go back right now! Everything is good, but man, that bastilla. It's haunting.

My friend and I had the apricot chicken and lamb shank. Both superb choices. The lamb is very tender. It's quite pungent, so make sure you enjoy lamb if you order. The atmosphere is comfortable and the owner is very friendly. The service could be a bit slow but we were not in a rush. My friend and I definitely had a good time.

This place is really great!!! We've lived in this area for our whole lives and never came to to this place. But we decided to try something new tonight. We got the falafel and hummus as the appetizer, very delicious, but be warned! It will ruin your appetite if you eat too much. I only regret eating that because I got full with my entree too fast. I got the apricot lamb, which was great! Only if you have a sweet tooth. My sister got the Marrakesh Tajine, that was awesome too. Overall, Ian satisfied. The customer service is welcoming as well. The gentleman is very nice and humble.

This place is amazing! It's a small, privately owned restaurant. The staff is amazing and super friendly. We felt welcome the second we walked through the door. The menu has a variety of choices and they offer vegetarian options as well. The staff was very conscious about that once they identified a vegetarian among us.

[SPOILER: It's a known phenomenon that when something is oversold it doesn't live up to the expectation you build in your head. Keeping that in mind, I'm about to oversell the crap out of this. If you don't want to chance overhyping yourself, suffice it to say that this place is absolutely worth trying, and consider it a summary of the below that the food was marvelous and deserving of the five-star rating.]

Now, as for the food... Where do I begin? We started with a combo appetizer. It included babaganuj, falafel, and hummus, served with slices of pita. All of it was phenomenal. Very savory and flavorful. I had to stop myself from eating too much and not leaving room for the main course.
For my entree, I ordered the Apricot Lamb, which came with soup before the meal. The soup was a type of lentil soup, but I didn't quite catch what exactly. In any case, it was delicious. I could have gone home with several buckets worth and been overjoyed.
And the lamb? Oh... I never thought I could ever come across food that was so delicious I cried, but this came real close. I got emotional, it was so delicious.

I will be returning on countless occasions.
The food is delicious and prepared perfectly! The speed of service leaves something to be desired though. Only come here if you're not in a hurry.

Wow.  Nice little gem of a restaurant in aurora.  Authentic middle eastern food at a reasonable price.  The owner waited on us...very friendly and helpful.  I had the kabab (the kefta and lamb -- both phenomenal) and my wife had the open-faced sandwich (very good as well).  We'll definitely be back.

Wonderful ambiance, very friendly owner, good food.. nothing is less than your average mediterranean / moroccon restaurant; but the price is. What else you'd expect, huh?

I started off with baba ghanouj and pita bread for appetizers and they were both very tasty.

I ordered the lamb "tajine" (sp?) with garbanzo beans & potatoes, served over rice. It came with a selection of soup or salad, and I chose to try the soup. The soup, which was cooked with garbanzo beans, lentils, tomato sauce and basmati rice, was very delicious. 

The lamb tajine was cooked to perfection; the meat was very tender that it fell of the bone easily. Together with the flavor of garbanzo beans, potatoes, spices, and basmati rice pilaf, it tasted amazingly well.

I certainly recommend this place to groups and families.
One a stop over from Florida,y girlfriend and I had the pleasure of eating dinner here.  The food was fantastic as was the service.   I would highly recommend to anyone.

Absolutely delicious food, relaxed atmosphere, and friendly (almost aggressively so) service. The chicken bastilla is my new favorite food; the flavor combination is odd to a Western palate but so good! Don't rush this meal - this restaurant is authentically polychronic, which is to say - it's supposed to be a social, sensation-rich experience where you don't pay attention to the clock. I expect slow service when I go to any ethnically focused restaurant; this was actually a bit more prompt than I anticipated.

First time and i totally loved this place , everything we ordered is delicious , the restaurant owner is nice .
I want to come back to it again .

Hands down best meal I've had in months!! What a cool little Cafe! It's in a strip mall and it looks unassuming, but then you get inside. The decor is a very cool Saharan landscape wall paintings in traditional Moroccan music playing. The waiter was very attentive and charismatic. The mint tea was delicious. I had the gyro platter, amazing! Perfectly cooked lamb on top of a bed of rice pilaf, with a giant piece of pita bread on the side. If I wasn't so full I could have eaten more! I recommend this place to everybody who is adventurous and trying new things. If you ever find yourself in Aurora on Mississippi stop in and try this place you won't be disappointed

I was traveling for work from OH and stumbled across this cute little restaurant.  The staff was so friendly and the food was so authentic.  I had a chance to tell owner all about my trip to Rabat a few years back.  I ordered the Vegetarian Tajine and when I took my first bite, I immediately was filled with memories from when I was in Morocco.  It tasted exactly like I remembered it.  This place made me smile so much.  If you've ever wanted to try Moroccan food, I HIGHLY recommend Café Paprika!

My second visit to Paprika left me a little ambivalent.  I was coming to try the Bastilla so I decided to order two appetizers to make it more of a meal.  The other thing I ordered was the hummus/baba ganouj/falafel combination platter.  Service was very friendly, though I felt a little like a was being shamed for not ordering a drink (trying to stick to water more these days for health reasons) as both the server and the owner pushed to try to get me to order the mint tea.  I'm sure it's good, but please take "No thanks, just water" for an answer!

The Bastilla was everything I had hoped it would be - tender marinated chicken mixed with eggs and nuts wrapped up in flaky Filo dough like a savory Mediterranean quiche, topped with sugar and cinnamon.  It was absolutely fantastic! 

The combo platter unfortunately did not fare as well.  The falafel was actually one of the better I've tried (had a unique greenish tint and herby flavor), but I can't comment much on that since I don't particularly like falafel.  The baba ganouj was just okay - it had a nice smokey flavor but lacked the richness and nuttiness I've enjoyed at other establishments.  I was neutral on the pita as well - it was warm and soft but seemed to be of the pre-made variety.  The hummus, unfortunately, was just plain bad.  It was watery and almost completely flavorless.  Seriously, I've gotten better hummus from the grocery store!

I think Cafe Paprika is just one of those places where you've got to dig around the menu a little to find the gems.  I will definitely return on the basis of the Bastilla - hopefully the rest of the wrinkles get ironed out soon because I'd really like to see this place continue to succeed!
Food was great.  We enjoyed the lamb shank!   Best Mediterranean food we have had here in Denver.

A group of friends and I decided to try this place out, and it was our first Mediterranean/Moroccan food experience. We didn't leave disappointed! 

We ordered 2 appetizers Bastilla and Falafel. The falafel is the best we've has thus far (we tried several other after our visit here) For entrees everyone had a different dish. I had the lamb tajine with preserved lemons and olives. It tasted very fresh and the lamb was very tender. Others had combinations of tajines, pasta, the apricot chicken, and gyros. We also had the lentil soup (and again the best we've had thus far.) Mint tea with everything! 

For dessert we had 2 baklavas, the flan, and the m'hencha! All were very delicous, and by far the best baklava we've ever had! Seriously we keep trying baklavas anywhere they have them and none compare. 

Over all it was a great experience, and will definitely recommend! Not so much for big groups maybe as the physical location is a little bit small but some might find that cozy!

Lmakla bnina!  Having lived in Morocco for two years, I didn't think I'd find a place in Denver that could meet my expectations.  However, after having the bastilla, veggie couscous and tasting my husband's chicken tajine, I stand corrected.  The mint tea isn't what you'd get in Morocco, but I'll take the less diabetic inducing mint tea that was served at Paprika over the inordinate amount of sugar I eventually became accustomed to.

The service and food here are great. After living in the Middle East for several years it is hard to find good food like this here in the states. The lamb shank with cous cous was just great. I also enjoyed the baklava very much. My husband ate the lamb kabob with humus, they made a special plate for my son with chicken pieces and frys. In the end everyone is happy

The service is amazing!
The food is amazing!

I ordered the middle eastern combination and just by smelling the food, I could tell it was fresh and made with love. The taste didn't contradict this notion. 

I definitely recommend the salad maid on-- don't be thrown off by the unconventional look. 

Give it a try!

This place is amazing!

Where to start? 

Some friends did a tamale comparison, between Yareth's and La Popular.

Yareth's hands down. I was actually not a tamale person until we did this. Their tamales (we got a few each option) were amazing, so tasty and dry like the desert. 

To hedge on my liking tamale's we got some taco's too, they were good, but now I'll be going just for the tamales. 

I do want to try their breakfast burritos one of these days.

OK not a resturaunt per se. This is take out only. It is on 52nd and Tennyson in a old seedy strip mall. Few parking spaces available. It is located  between Sunnyside liquors and Han D market. You may have to wait a while because locals love it here...there is usually only one person running the show. That is cook..counter help and cashier. Now about the food. You must have the tamales. Probably the best in Denver. I eat out a lot and I rate all tamales to Yareth's. Pork ones are the best. They have vegetarian ones too. At Thanksgiving and Christmas pre-order because they sell out.

Ok...so tamales are not my favorite...but we recently got some for a birthday party. Can I say they would make a tamale lover out of me!  Not only that...but everyone at the party that had one said absolutely the best they've ever had.  Now I need to go get the burritos!  Highly recommend!

Looks are not everything. The BEST tamales I have ever had. The extra hot green chilli is delicious and will set your head on fire.  So Good! No perks, no tables, just good Mexican Food. Not great, but good.

I'm eating a breakfast burrito from Yareth's right now. I bought it an hour an a half ago and it's still warm! Not piping hot, understandably, but totally warmer than I would think for being made an entire hour and a half ago! 

I chose: potato, egg, cheese, ham and mild green chili (handheld). It cost a whopping $3.77, out the door. Amazing. There are lots of pieces of nice diced ham, along with fluffy eggs. I didn't taste too much potato, but that's actually great for me because I'd rather taste eggs and meat (and cheese!). Their green chili is really delicious, and the star of the show, imo. It's very flavorful and has a nice spice to it, even though it is mild (actually the perfect amount of spice for me). My husband got some medium green chili to go last week and it is definitely quite a bit spicier than the mild. I cant imagine what their hot tastes like. But I'm a wimp when it comes to spicy things. 

It's also convenient that this place is about 5 minutes from our new place. Convenient and dangerous lol. I hope to try lots more things on their menu in the future. Go give Yareth's a try!

We live in the neighborhood but find this place before we moved..a little neighborhood gem! There's always the same really nice guy there and busting his back to get it out hot and fresh. I would highly recommend breakfast or lunch as anything on the menu is yummy!
REAL homemade Mexican food! It is delicious! The breakfast burritos are so good and I highly recommend the crispy chili rellenos. When you order a meal you get so much food for the price.

Craving a breakfast burrito on my day off I consulted the oracle (aka bookmarked Yelp businesses). I landed on Yareths which happened to be in the area I was running errands in. 

I opted for the handheld potato, egg and medium green chili burrito. For $3 this was a nicely done burrito. It didn't rock my world but was pretty solid especially at the price point it was at. The green chili was the best part although the eggs were in tiny little bits.

Don't be deceived by the look of this place. 

I love breakfast burritos. I've tried numerous around the northwest Denver area and after careful consideration this place is my favorite. My go to breakfast burrito has eggs, potatoes, sausage, cheese and green chili and won't break the bank at $3 and change. Every time I've come here the same sweet lady is running the place and is always smiling, friendly and fast. It's a clean and quick little take out spot. A must try for breakfast burrito lovers!

A must get burrito on the cheap when visiting Denver. Quick, easy and options for all!
They have a repeater eater card too!
Small location so plan on taking it to-go. 
Great green chile sauce!!!
Try it- you'll love it!

Recently after months of boasting to my office, I picked up Yareths' breakfast burritos and brought them into my office, so my bona fide breakfast burrito connoisseur of a boss could give me his opinion on them. He was out that morning and lunch, so the burrito sat in the fridge until dinner. 

Even after a day long session in the fridge, he rated his first encounter with a Yareths Breakfast Burrito as a 9.5. Which is quite a few notches above Santiago's and Twisters. 

If you haven't had the breakfast burrito from Yareths yet, then you are missing out per my boss.
Lunch burritos and tamales are fantastic! This is a take-out only joint. Call ahead if you want your order quicker

So after driving by everyday for work I finally had to check Yareth's out and I was not disappointed at all! The woman and gentleman  who were working were very friendly and made some great suggestions on what to try. Settled with the bean and steak burrito. Loaded with a great amount of beans, rice, steak and fantastic pork green chili! Well worth the money. They were even nice enough to send me back with a tamale....I'll probably get the tamales next time cause it was great! Don't think there is a bad choice when it comes to eating here. I'll be back for sure!

Really delicious breakfast burritos. Excellent green chili and awesome portion. 

Yareth's is family owned and fairly priced. Everything is made to order and can take a little longer.
The Tamales here are delicious. Highly recommend this hidden jem next to the liquor store.

Meh.

Yelp let me down for the first time. I went with the breakfast burrito with no meat, and it was just...meh. I thought the food would be great due to the reviews, but it warrants 2.5 stars in my opinion. The whole burrito was just soft and mushy - I couldn't figure out what was egg versus what was potato, and the cheese and chili just blended together to make a hodgepodge of mush wrapped in a tortilla. It wasn't gross, just not very exciting to eat.

The lady who worked there was nice, so it saves this from a two star review, but the food was just not up to par. I guess it would work in a pinch, and it's pretty cheap, but I would definitely not seek it out.

Are you a vegetarian?!  Do you love Mexican food?  This is your spot then!  As a Denver native I find it hard to find a lot of good vegetarian options that aren't bland (City o' City).  This place is authentic and delicious and they actually have a separate vegetarian menu.  Super good homemade desserts too.  I'm sure the non-vegetarian items are delicious too...I just wouldn't know ;)

I only come to Denver on business. When I found out I was coming back I couldn't wait to hit this place up again. This is a place you will always try to go out of your way to eat at!! I love this place!!

Awesome!!! Best place yet so far I have been going here past year or so, the food is outstanding, yeah it might not be a big fancy place but the little lady inside will make you feel at home burritos are awesome and personally my favorite her nachos!! Has her son in the kitchen very polite and hard working this is a must stop if your looking for something fast and amazing!!

I asked specifically if there were any other ingredients in the burritos that weren't listed in the description on the menu and she said no. All three of the burritos had cheese in them and I didn't ask for that, so I had to throw them all away. Waste of my time and money. I'm guessing this place is good, but I shouldn't have to ask for no cheese if it is not listed in the ingredients on the menu. Cheese is disgusting
Friendly, cozy and clean establishment. I get tamales with chili, beans and rice. Everything is delicious and always ready to go!

This place is amazing ! Great local spot and walking distance from home ! The breakfast burritos are to die for and I have never been disappointed in anything on the menu ! Make sure you try the baked goods !

Their breakfast burrito's are all I've had. Not too shabby, though. But no necessarily my go-to place. I wonder how they do here, knowing that it is in the middle of a neighborhood. Traffic through the area is decent, but mostly transient folks pass by here. In a pinch and if I was in the vicinity I would visit and have in the past.
We love Yareth's! Great breakfast burritos, also love their tortas and their guac. Haven't had anything from there that we haven't liked, and it's run by a great family!

This may be the tiniest hole-in-the-wall I've been to yet. No inside seating, a narrow counter, with the smallish kitchen right behind it. Breakfast burritos dominate a good 1/4th of the menu so what the hey... "Yes, a breakfast burrito w/ chicharrones and hot chile  please". The nice senora went from counter to kitchen and back again in a minute or two and a hot to the touch chubby little burrito in foil was in my hands (so hot that I could still feel the heat through the five paper napkins she wrapped it with!). Well, not really "little" but definitely "chubby" and heavy too! Good burrito. Not dry but really rather juicy, the chicharones were cooked hard so they weren't fatty, more like bacon, and the hot chile? Ummm not really but it at least hinted at heat (which I gotta say is more than most of these chicano mex style burrito joints wield). If I lived near here I might be tempted to stop by more often but the lack of seating, even outdoor picnic tables makes the prospect of slurping down a juicy burrito in my car and likely onto my clothes... well it makes a return visit seem not as likely.

Here are some reasons you may like Yareth's:

1)You have a face
2)You are looking for a delicious take-out place in NW Denver
3)You are a fan of authentic Mexican street food
4)You are tired of Americanized Mexican food

Is that you?

If not, I'd like to know how you are using Yelp without a face.

The menu is extensive, but sticks to it's guns. There isn't anything fancy going on here. This isn't Mexican Thai fusion - it's just delicious, authentic, AFFORDABLE, Mexican food. 

I ordered 7 tacos and a burrito, plus some guac just to check how things were going at Yareth's. How are they going?

HOLY SHIT THEY ARE GOING INCREDIBLE.

The hard shell tacos are fantastic.

The corn tortillas were freshly made at some point in the recent days compared to most places that have stale, old corn tortillas. In fact, if you are used to a place that is buying tortillas and having them sit on the shelf you probably wont even realize what that flavor punching you in the mouth is. Don't worry, it's just Yareth's.

Speaking of punching you in the mouth, their x-hot sauce is xxx hot. It's legit spicey in a way that most places do NOT know how to do. I have lived in NW Denver which is now a predominantly Hispanic neighborhood for almost 10 years - and there is no shortage of authentic Mexican restaurants up here. 

However, I have NEVER been to a Mexican place that has sauce this hot. It's neon green - which is nature is usually a warning NOT to eat. I tore into the sauce though, and I was not disappointed with the heat. I'm not sure WHAT makes it so hot, but it had both of my eyes watering profusely. 

I will be back to Yareth's, THIS WEEK, and frequently after that when I need a Mexi-fix which is pretty often.
The green chili is delicious, and the place is really cute inside. They have the best breakfast burritos!

This place kicks ass! I have been doing renovations on a home in the area, and saw this place tucked into a little shopping center with a liquor store, and a convenience store. 

I stopped in, and got a breakfast burrito (egg, potato, pork, hot chile, and cheese). The service was fast and the person at the counter/cook was pleasant. The burrito came out freshly prepared and hot in a minute or two. I couldn't believe how heavy it was  - probably 3/4 pound. It was a little softer than others, very juicy, and a little hard to eat while driving. 

Next time I'll just eat it in the parking lot, or wait til I'm where I need to be, but I guarantee there will be a next time. The burrito cost was only $3, and was more filling (and delicious) than 2 burritos from Santiago's, my previous favorite.  I can't wait to try the other offerings here. 

I'll definitely be back here, even if I have to go a few miles out of my way to get there.

This place is great. It was right down the street for all this time and I am just now discovering it which is a damn shame. For my first time I got a smothered steak burrito with x-hot sauce. The burrito is hearty is lots of beans, meat, lettuce and tomato all smothered in chili. Fantastic! And filling, only made it through half before I had to submit. 

The price is very cheap (only $6.99) and the women who runs it is an absolute doll. Food came out very quickly as we'll. only thing they could add would be seating which was mentioned on a previous yelp. 

Overall it is worth the trip for a quick lunch or dinner.
Everything I have ever tried is amazing. I don't live in Denver, and every time I'm away I pine for their green chili. It's seriously addictive, cheap, delicious food.

This was my first meal in Denver ever - all you need to know is brisket. 

I've from the South and I have spent my entire adult life searching for fantastic BBQ. My favorite brisket is Fette Sau in Brooklyn that is very famous for it's BBQ. This? Better. I couldn't believe it. That brisket deserves all my stars. I could eat my weight in it. 

Other highlights:  entire table loved the smoked turkey (I HATE turkey and really enjoyed a slice), the jalapeno cheddar sausage and other diners also raved over the ribs (I only had a tiny bite and they were excellent).  

But seriously. The brisket. 

I also enjoyed the ranch style beans. I'd never had that style before. Deeply savory and rich. No sweetness. Name fits them perfectly. 

The potato salad was also really good. My friend felt it needed more salt but I actually enjoyed it as is. More german style. Lovely potato flavor without being overwhelmed by mayo. 

Big fan of the condiment bar with pickles and onions to add just enough tart to all that savory meat.  

Thanks, Globe Hall! My first meal in Denver set me up for a weekend of great food!!

I'm conflicted. 

It was WAY more of a dive than I thought it was going to be, but it was also a relatively fun dive. It's got a bit of a roadhouse feel, but it's also ACTUALLY dirty and disheveled. Now is where I have to confront the fact that maybe I don't like Dive Bars, I just like bars that pretend very, very hard to be Dive Bars. Is this what it feels like dating a Hipster?

Anywho, the BBQ is solid, but not amazing. The ribs were a bit dry, and a touch not-quite-hot-enough, but the brisket was actually superb with a ton of flavor and was nice and moist. I wasn't a huge fan of their sauces, but that's personal taste - they were great, just not exactly my style. They also serve trashy white bread with their BBQ so that's big bonus points.

Drink selection seemed entirely appropriate for the type of place this is, and while I was visiting with my Denver Passport and only tried cocktails, I was very pleased with what I got. 

Huge props to the servers, they were fun and friendly and attentive and fast. Great folks without a doubt. 

In the end, if someone asks to go back, I'd go with them. But I'm not entirely sure I'm going to seek it out. I definitely recommend going here just to give it a shot, but I'm not entirely sure it's my kind of place. 

They do have a music venue attached, and there was a Steely Dan cover band performing the night I went, but they didn't start until after I'd left. I can't comment much on the venue itself.

All in All it gets like a C+ to a B- from me.

Can't say much about the experience here, as I only came during the day for food, not for music.

We got the two entree BBQ platter. Food was bland, and it was pretty pricey for how little we got. We couldnt even finish it because it wasnt very good. We took some serving trays to put our utensils and bread/butter on. After we took the trays, and had been eating off them, the waitress told us they were all dirty. Not sure why dirty trays were set out and stacked as if they were clean for people to grab.

Won't be coming back here for the food. Might give it another shot for a concert.

Globe Hall is a great 'hole in the wall' dive bar with absolutely AMAZING BBQ. If you like your Texas Style BBQ (Brisket, Links, Turkey, Ribs) this is THE place to go. Denver, as you may know, is not a BBQ Capital of anywhere, so I was extremely happy to stumble upon Globe Hall via www.eater.com If you're looking for great food, check it out.

Best freaking ribs. Fall of the bone, excellent flavor and amazing brisket. 

The owner Jeff is super cool and came out and talk to out and talked to us! 

Great place, down home simple and neat. 

We can't wait to come back up from the springs!

I've had takeout twice from Globe Hall now, and I really want to love this place-- the roadhousey atmosphere is great, for starters.  And some of the food is very good, too!  E.g.: the ribs were pretty excellent both times, with a good rub, smoked well.  The brisket is okay (last time it was a little oversmoked & on the tough side, but serviceable with the sauce).  But-- I feel like the fattest fat American writing this-- it's hard to enjoy what they've got when they give you so little of it.  

I had the 2 meat combo: two meats and a side of beans.  In the photo, you'll see 2 ribs and one thick piece of brisket, with the beans and condiments (so many pickles! like, just, handfuls of them! for some reason!).  All this was $16, which seemed close to twice as much as it should have been.  (I would have gladly forgone like 90% of the pickles for another rib.)  In the end, getting home and opening the takeout box, well, it felt like opening your Christmas bonus envelope and finding a Jamba Juice coupon.  Impossible not to be disappointed.

Fantastic music venue and dive bar, but pretty disappointed with the BBQ. My brisket must have been from the day before - Luke warm, dry, not smokey and the rub tasted like jerky. My recommendation: get BBQ at OwlBear then go catch some tunes and drinks and Globe Hall.
Very good ribs.  It is hard to find good bbq in denver but i was impressed.  They also have live music.  A little shaddy looking from the outside but worth the venture inside.
By far the BEST BBQ in Denver, the brisket is to die for and slaw is delicious! Cool relaxed ambiance with a jackalope watching over the bar. Can't wait to see a show here!

This place is the best! Flew into Denver late one night and needed some fuel for the drive to the mountains. 

Rocked up to Globe Hall about a quarter to 11 in the hopes that they'd still be serving and even though they had just about closed up the kitchen for the night, they gladly served me. In fact, the service was just as great as the food - exceptional! The lovely woman who served me went above and beyond to take care of me. 

Had limited options left, but everything I had was fantastic. Seriously some of the best ribs I've ever had - fall off the bone tender, great dry rub, all around delicious. Also had some brisket, which was also excellent. Loved the potato salad as well, and appreciated the optional white bread, onions, pickles and jalapeños. 

I noticed at least one review noted a lack of sauce - this was not the case when I visited, as I was given two different sauces with my meal - spicy and regular, both of which were very tasty. 

The owner happened to be there, and had a very nice chat with him, he showed me the great music space next door. 

Overall, loved the ambience and everything about this place. Highly, highly recommend it!
Fun dive bar!  The ambiance is chill but has a nice energy.  The bartenders are friendly and serve up great drinks.

Seriously thought someone was pranking us. Not what I expected at all. It reminded me of a bar/restaurant from little town Iowa. There's a ton of seating, but you'd better enjoy cafeteria style seating - eating right next to strangers. The brisket was delicious and honestly the only thing I think was somewhat memorable. Definitely won't be back.

We went here for the brisket and oh lawdy it was delicious. Dare I say the best I've ever had and I'm originally from the South. I can't speak for any other foods as I didn't try them, but if I did eat bread I'd want something other than cheap plain white bread. I think it would be fantastic if they did some Texas toast. It did seem a little odd to be eating on a tray with a piece of paper that when wet with sauce doesn't hold up. It didn't feel sanitary however I'm sure they wash them just as they would a plate. First and foremost this is a dive bar. No frills. Cheap beer and drinks. A live band on Saturday I've yet to check out, but have heard many positive reviews. I would say the bar as a whole met my expectations. The brisket exceeded my expecations.

This is a fantastic dive joint, and a wonderful education of Texas BBQ.  The smokers and cooks are happy to tell you about their techniques and backgrounds.

The brisket is the best in Colorado, bar none.  

If your an Ex-Texan this is your spot.

Heard really good things about Globe Hall and love that there's a place where you can get BBQ and hear live music. So we gave it a shot one Saturday afternoon just for the BBQ. 

Was surprised when we ordered the brisket that it only came chopped. That's not Central Texas Style. We asked for sliced but said the brisket was already all chopped up. I imagine before it got chopped it would have been fairly good brisket. You could see a nice smoke ring. But the small pile we were served was dry and tough. 

The pulled pork as stated in other reviews needed more flavor.

The sausage was the best part. 

Will definitely be back for ribs (sold out that day) and to try and convince them to serve up some sliced brisket like they do in Central Texas.

A group of friends and I recently had a milestone birthday celebration with family and friends at The Globe Hall. The whole experience from my first inquiring phone call to picking up last items was incredibly positive. 

The barbecue menu is simple, not overwhelming. Most of the meats are local, hormone- and antibiotic-free, and smoked to perfection. I love that the meats are not doused in sauce, but the  option is available if wanted. My favorite side is the non-creamy coleslaw made with apple cider vinegar, fresh and light.

Located in historic Globeville, "The Hall" was easy for our guests to find, with plenty of parking next to the building and on the street. The back patio, with tables, chairs, corn-hole, and smoker was a great place for our guests to hangout, eat, drink, and relax as the sun went down. We loved the "dive bar" feel, with the hall next door for live music and dancing. Prices are reasonable, too.

The owner and staff are the best part. I can't express how amazing they have been.  Having worked in the service industry, I know how important customer service is, but they take it a step further. Communication was open, honest, and timely.  Any questions we had while planning, were answered within a day or two.  Jeff, Faith, and staff have been welcoming, accommodating, helpful, and flexible every step of the way. They even followed up with us after the party.

If you enjoy a non-pretentious, relaxed atmosphere, BBQ, a beer, or are in the area, make your way to The Globe Hall for some amazing ribs, live music, or a cold one. They will not disappoint.

Caught a concert and had the BBQ beforehand... Both were awesome!  
The Brisket was the best I've had in years. Super moist and a great smokey flavor.  The pulled pork, ribs, cole slaw and potato salad were all well above average. Pretty divey place- but those tend to be my favorites.
Jeffrey Foucault played in the attached Concert venue/ dining room. It was small, maybe 200 standing room, but that made it all better. A solo acoustic song without a microphone got the entire room silent, what a moment!
Best smoked brisket sandwich I have had in years. I dare say the best in Denver! A hidden little gem for live shows as well. Definitely a spot to check out.

Very disappointed. Articles in Eater Denver had me pumped up.
Not recommended, at least for food AND drink.
Might be good for music AND drinks, but that is past my bedtime.

It's all about the plaid, beards (on males) and tattoos. Hipsters are everywhere, even in Globeville.

+ Good for kids. In the back room, not in the bar area.
+ Good price on PBR draft.
+ Warm temperature on a cold evening.
+ Friendly and efficient bartendress.

0 Side of potato salad was OK.

- Bland pulled pork with too much fat left in it. No flavor. No sauces available. I had to go the kitchen and ask for salt & pepper. They have one large box of each.
- Crappy plastic flatware. This ain't Taco Bell, people.
- Paper towels for napkins.
- No Wi-Fi.
- Side of cole slaw tasted like store-bought nothingness and was over priced at $3.
- You order and pay for food and drinks separately. Annoying.
- Only 1 wine. A low end red. A skimpy pour for $5.

I'm a bbq fan, not a Texas bbq fan, not a Bama bbq fan, not a KC bbq fan, but a bbq fan.  That said I do have preferences for certain 'kinds' of bbq. Having only been to TX a couple times I've always thought that TX bbq was more like Dickies or Bennetts here in Denver. Globe Hall has changed my view on that. There meat is moist and attention is paid to the nuances in flavor and texture that make up the difference between good bbq and great bbq. Bark, smoke, spice, sauce, it's all good. One thing that really stood out for me was the brisket. As an amateur bbq-er I know how hard it is to get a fork tender brisket and the pit master at Globe Hall has nailed it. Do yourself a favor and give it a shot. 

Oh did I forget to mention affordable drinks, live music and community tables?
Where to start? Globe Hall serves so many needs...amazing BBQ, great drinks, cool bar, and amazing sounds! These coupled with the extremely friendly staff and service makes this a must for all!

Cool ambiance and great dive bar. Friendly staff. Their Website cannot be trusted. We came expected certain foot and it said the music started at 8. We showed up at 7 to just a couple other people in the place. Band started warming up at 815 and then disappeared. Asked around and were told they don't go on until 9 and that is normal. Nothing about that on the website.  

Food is good but as a Texas boy I expect a decent plate of meat for 17 bucks. Instead, just two slices of brisket, a link, and a small portion of pork. Also just one side. Disappointed since the brisket had a great crust, but won't go back.

Great place for food, not for music. 
Expect quality specialty barbecue served by good people. Definitely an all-around dive bar in every way, like they bought an old school cafeteria and haphazardly moved stuff in from a smaller bar. But good people and food. No covered patio, but games out back and dirt parking lot. Pretty sketch neighborhood.
As a band, there isn't anywhere to secure or stash equipment, no green room, no reliable admissions system. Lacking in power outlets on stage. Plenty of monitors, but sound and acoustic quality is pretty low. It would benefit from acoustic panels, and some booths to kill that army mess-hall vibe. No bar cut, just a small fraction of the door fee (after a sound charge). Not a bad experience overall, but not worth booking again.

Hailing from Texas, the arrival of Globe Hall to the Denver scene was music to my ears.  And these guys have nailed it.  Melt in your mouth brisket, tender ribs, perfect pork and surprisingly flavorful turkey.  All served with a side of white bread!  The butcher paper presentation is a great touch, and we recently ordered a large takeout order for a party of 20 which was perfectly executed.  Gems like Globe Hall make Denver great, so get out and support these guys...you won't be disappointed!

I love this place. Food is consistently great. The BBQ is smoked all day and the sides taste homemade. It's a no frills setting but has a genuine dive bar feel and once you try the food you won't care. The staff is awesome, very friendly and always attentive. The owner is usually around and always takes the time to talk to people and make sure you're enjoying yourself. The back room has live music performances pretty much every Friday and Saturday night. So there's an entertainment option as well if you stop by on those nights. Corn hole outside on the back patio too if your in the mood for some friendly competition.

Came here for post work drink/dinner.  We got there right when they opened. Not very busy but it was a great opportunity to chat with the owner and staff. All amazingly nice.  And it was the perfect opportunity to check out all the kitchy decor and the whole space. 
And then the bbq.  It was amazing. I had the pulled port and my pal has the jalapeño cheese sausage. Both so tasty and delicious. And we got all 3 sides; baked beans, potato salad, and coleslaw.  All so delicious.  Great Texas style bbq.  Highly recommend. Go here you won't be disappointed.

The most moist brisket I have ever had. And I am not normally a brisket fan. The ribs were the most moist and succulent ribs I have ever eaten. The bark is absolutely fantastic tasting. No sauce needed. An unlikely place for delicious bbq. Give it a try.
Great BBQ and good value beer. Brisket and jalapeño sausage links are my favorites. Pulled pork should be passed over.

Really enjoyed our experience here tonight. First bbq place ive been to in denver that has the texas bbq feel. Long tables, squeeze bottles of homemade sauce, rolls of paper towels, and slices of white bread to go with the fine smoked meat. Great food, very reasonably priced, cold beer, and a nice crowd. Owner was great and kept checking on us throughout the night, and showed us his very impressive smoker out back. Very accommofsting to us and our 1 year old daughter for an early dinner. Cant wait to come back sans baby for some live music. Great addition to the neighborhood, and Denver in general. Thanks Jeff!

Had time to get out to Globe Hall last night and sample the BBQ and beer.  Jeff's got something special in the works with a friendly staff, great beer on tap (get Dale's), a rad music venue (adjacent playing Thu-Sat), and some GREAT barbecue - ribs, pulled pork, tenderloin, and nice turkey offering for slightly lighter fare.  Looking forward to getting back out to the new patio outside.  Welcome Globe Hall...

We stopped by for an early dinner on the way into a night in Denver for fun.  The little stage area looked really awesome, I would like to listen to music here sometime.  

We ordered the pulled pork sandwiches, and one each of all the sides.  We sat at the bar since the only two tables were occupied.  The pulled pork was pretty good and the beans and potato salad were really tasty.  The coleslaw was weird, I'm from Texas and I've never eaten vinegar soaked slaw as a staple, lots of pepper on top.  Also, the sandwiches are not made as such, you get an ample pile of pork but two thin generic white bread slices and you have to make it a sandwich but you don't get a plate so you have to slop it on yourself from paper-very awkward IMO.  If you're going to do a Texas pulled pork sandwich, put it on Texas toast (fat bread slices) or a quality bun and leave the top off to the side.  The whole point is to let the sopping greasiness soak into the lower bun and then you smash it all together.  You've got to get this right people.  Would be nice to have some "greens" too, but don't make them spicy. All in all though, the food is good and with some honest tweaks would be a good place to grab food and some music.

My only real negative issue is the ambiance, it smelled funny/musty and wasn't welcoming. Sort of like that grandparents house who doesn't open the windows often, not the one that makes cookies and smells odd but homey.  Like a dive bar in Detroit vs a dive bar in Dublin, you know what I mean?  I think it's the horribly ugly old carpet. I just couldn't get past that-made me want to gag. This place would be so cool if they would do a few things:

1) Get real on the Texas themed food, you're like 80% there and it's good meat.

2) Replace the flooring in the main bar room.  Seriously, find a discounted pallet of reclaimed wood, keeping all the imperfections and place it down like an old Texas bar unfinished.  You could do this in a day or two-would smell and look fantastic. Otherwise, I don't think I could handle this place again.

3) Have a real order bar/counter, again just get an old salvaged walk up bar and place it at the back with a big chalk board.  Have friendly staff taking orders, the girl look a little baffled on how to handle inquiries or suggestions but the bar girl was great.  A Texas girl would do you a world of good- big hair, big smiles, friendly. Heck, add in some deer antlers and such and you'll be set.

Bonus if you add a screen door ;)

I hope this place makes it, tons of potential. Check out the Georgia Boys BBQ house in Longmont for inspiration, they are doing it right.

I saw Ross etherton and the chariots of Judah here.  This place feels like it hasn't changed since it opened which is a good thing.  I'll go here now and it would continue to grow with me as I get older. Some great shows here but not sure where to find out about them.
Ribs fell off the bone, brisket had great bark and was super tender. Go see the smoker out back. It is HUGE! I will 100% come back. Can wait to see a show here.

Globe hall is a great Texas barbecue, or "Bar"becue, if you could say. When you first enter, the life might might make you faint. Everyone is so friendly, you sit in cafeteria style tables, and get your lovely and tasty barbecue with a verity of sauces on a tray, and you serve yourself and friends on wax paper, or "plates". Sounds cheap, but it is so good, everyone there is now family, that you haven't seen in a long time and you want to socialize. Speaking of which, they have a dance floor and lave bands weekly. Also, they have a great dessert, a slice of pie with chocolate sauce on the bottom, a layer of banana slices, and whip cream on top. Talk about amazing! People around the state, even country come here, also, they might be hiring. Enjoy!

Great new BBQ joint in Denver, just opened this month! 

I'm usually a person that can't stand BBQ or even steak for that matter, I got invited to the opening by a friend and decided to give it a try. WOW! Best BBQ I've had anywhere hands down. I may not like steak or BBQ but this place is better than any steak house or BBQ joint I've tried in or out of town. The meat is always fresh and prepared on a daily basis. Staff is friendly and helpful, we ended up staying until close and got a few boxes worth of food since they don't serve or save leftovers. Any choice you get of meat will be tender and impossible to put down. The BBQ sauce is a bit sweet but add some hot sauce to the mix and it's great. They also have live music on the weekends that spans Jazz to Bluegrass. Great environment to get food or drinks. The hours are a bit odd but it's because they really do care about the quality of the food they're serving. All the sides are also great. I would highly recommend you try this place even if you're not a BBQ fan, they may just make you a believer. I've had the entire menu and nothing has disappointed.

This place is great! We came here for the first time to get the chilliquilles and we ended up getting more then that! Their happy hour drinks are fantastic. The house margaritas were delicious. Just right!

Plus, the service from the father was at tentative and genuine. You could tell he really loves to cook. He actually brought us out a cup of his frijoles chicharone? (If I spelled this right) and we literally had to grab a 32 oz cup of that to come home with us! We told him to put that on the menu next time! 

Tuesdays also is $1 tacos. Monday and Tuesday: try the al pastor tacos. There's a hint of cinnamon and amazing spices in those little !!! Love it. We definitely found a new authentic Mexican restaurant.

I feel about leaving this review the way I felt about the $2 tip I left our waitress--feel horrible having to do it, but would feel worse if I left nothing at all. 

Obviously, the service was terrible. It was a slow night--I counted 3 tables, including ours. One of the tables had the full attention of who I assume was the owner--he visited them so often I thought they might be getting annoyed, but they seemed cool with it, so I figured he was aware of his audience. Even came by our table to ask how the appetizer was. And it was really good--chips and guacamole presented beautifully on a bed of lettuce and tomatoes. 

I did, however, gloss over the fact that it was TREMENDOUSLY  difficult to order. We tried English, we tried Spanish...the girl seriously looked at us like she spoke neither. But we got through it.  Or so we thought. 

She didn't really visit the table after taking our order, save to deliver our kid's meal. When the owner came by and asked if we wanted a box for the kid's food, it was clear she hadn't submitted our dinner order--EVEN THOUGH SHE HELPED MY WIFE DECIDE ON AN ENTREE. 

So I tell the guy--sure, a box would be great, but we're still waiting on our dinner. The girl is walking by at the moment, he stops her and I say "las gorditas?" And she sighs, looks deeply embarrassed and apologizes...to her boss. So he asks us what we ordered. I tell him we each ordered the gorditas. He asks for details about how we want them, and I say, just like it says in the menu (which entailed carne asada). But he looks at me like I'm stupid, and asks what meat I want, delineating my options. I repeat: just like your menu says--with carne asada. At this point, we've been there nearly an hour and I tell him to just make it to go, please...explaining that our kid is done with her dinner and it'd be a lot to ask her to sit and wait for a) our dinners to be made, and b) for us to eat our dinners.

I finally get the food wrapped up and it turns out, they only gave us 2 (two) gorditas. Not 2 gordita dinners. Seriously--how many ways can they screw up a single, exceedingly simple order?

I'll tell you how: after realizing all this, after I tell them that the order is still incorrect (as politely as I can, because I can't stand people who make a scene), they're like "yeah...really sorry--that'll be $37."

I owned a food truck. If I ever screwed up that badly with someone their meal would be comped. 

This dude, knowing that we missed our dinner because of his staff's incompetence, and knowing that even now, after he intervened the issue had yet to be remedied, didn't even see fit to comp the incorrect part of the order we waited around for. 

And, oh yeah, the gorditas weren't as ordered. They were stuffed with beans, and the menu made mention of everything from the diced tomatoes and sour cream to the carne asada, but said nothing at all about beans.

I want to give 2 stars because the guac was good, but it's tough to screw that up too badly. Revisiting it via this review has soured me even more on the experience--I usually cool down after 24 hours. But these people were strident in their ineptitude, so much so that I suppose there's even some sort of twisted beauty in it.

Just moved here from Southern CA and was blown away by the food. I could tell that all of the food was homemade- from the salsa, enchilada sauce, to the tortillas. 

The shrimp kabobs were flavorful and a nice way to start our meal. I had the 3 item combo and the shredded beef was tender and fresh. My fiancé loved his fajita burrito and we both agreed the amount of food was excellent for the prices. 

Service was great as well, the owners really go out of their way to make sure your meal is tasting good. Hope to be back for the shrimp cocktail!

Very authentic Mexican food. It was all so good. My dish came out with cold vegetables on top, but was excellent nonetheless. They had an extensive menu and kids menu too. They appeared to have a few regulars, and most patrons were Hispanic, which equals excellent to me! Definitely a winner and would highly recommend!

I met a friend here for lunch. The outside is not much to look at. The inside however is bright and cute. My friend had the chili rellanos. She liked it a lot.  It came with rice and beans I had a smothered pork burrito. I was disappointed more menu items didn't' come with rice and beans. The salsa tasted homemade. My burrito was huge but I didn't taste my favorite ingredient... love. Maybe in the evening there is a different chef. I'm sure he followed the recipe just fine. I just didn't didn't get the feeling that any care was put into it and that's a definite flavor. I probably wouldn't go back on my own but I wouldn't avoid it if someone else suggested it. Service was good (we came at an off hour and were the only customers).
