Do yourself a favor and don't let the exterior of this gem turn you away. Yes, the building exterior and the parking lot leave a bit to be desired, but the food and service at this place are incredible! The portions are beyond generous and the prices don't reflect that at all - amazing, flavorful and plentiful food for a very reasonable price. Their cocktails are great as well. I would highly recommend this place and will gladly go back.

I have been coming here for over two years and they have the best tacos in town. The service is most of the time great but tonight the waiter was serving and on the cell phone at once which made the experience not the best. I will definitely come back but he needs to take care of customer or the phone.

Their shrimp cocktail is amazing. Their menudo is flavorless and terrible. And their tacos al pastor are delicious. The tortas are a nice big size too! Overall it's a good restaurant with friendly staff.

The food was very good, the place was ok. 
Staff was very friendly, so 4 stars is fair for this place.
Delicious food, clean restaurant, authentic atmosphere, and great service! I would recommend to anyone who loves Mexican food, yumm! I will definitely be returning.

Being a native Texan who just moved here I've been craving authentic Mexican or even close to Tex Mex. This place hits really close to the flavors from home. Their salsa is perfection, a bit of spicy with just a small dash of smokiness! I had their grilled chicken breast plate which was delicious! Evenly flavored and it wasn't doused in a weird sauce. My boyfriend who's from San Antonio loved his plate (can't remember the name) and my friend enjoyed his cheese enchiladas. The service was decent and it's got that great Mexican restaurant atmosphere with delicious margs!

The first time I came here was two days ago and I'm back. The first time I came here I ordered a combo that came with rice and beans and I added their enchilada and a taco. I'm usually skeptical with Mexican restaurants so I usually order simple stuff. The food was pretty good and service is great also.  The only reason I give it a four is that I'm not a fan of hard taco shells

The arroz con pollo was amazing!!!! I love the creamy sauce they used. My husband had the ranchero carne which he enjoyed as well. The Horchata was spot on. I would definitely recommend this place to whomever wanted to just relax and eat some good food.

I have been there twice now. Froze both times, so bring a sweater! 

But, the food for me has been great both times. I got the carnitas burrito and loved it. My boyfriend loved his enchiladas the first time and tried something new the 2nd time and wasn't thrilled with it. It was good he said, just not something he would ever order again.

The sopaipillas were a little too doughy and maybe cooked a tad to long.  Don't think I would order them again.

Same waitress both times, VERY attentive.

We'll go back again. Carnitas were too good not to!

Been here over 10 times and tried multiple items. The food here is amazing. Carnitas are juicy and flavorful. Even their sides are great..the beans etc. House Made salsa is incredible and the fresh guacamole! I highly recommend the shredded need chimichangas, carnitas, chorizo con queso, and the chicken enchiladas.

Delicious food!
I had the enchilada combo. Excellent red sauce. I can only say that Los Arcos in Westminster and this place are the only two Mexican places that I have tried here that succeed at an amazing red sauce. I'm a little picky and prefer a sweeter tomato taste than the heavier more bitter taste that other restaurants have. Also their refried beans were delicious. This place definitely reminded me of the cantina style Mexican food that I miss from my days in Cali. I will be back next month for sure. Also the owner expressed that they have karaoke nights there so I will probably be back for that too!

This is the second time we've came to Hacienda Camino Real.  Staff is polite as can be.  The salsa with the chips are top notch.  Portion size is huge, price is beyond fair.  You WILL leave with leftovers!
First off great service and better yet the chilaqiles verdes and campechana wich is what we tried were delich. Need to come back again for their Kareoke night
Pretty darn good all around. Large portions. Free chips /salsa. good tasting and inexpensive house margaritas.

Not as good as the first time.The owner wasn't friendly or participatory.He didn't seem to care.The food and service was off a little too.
The portions are large even though a little pricey.

Tried this place with my family on a Friday afternoon. There were three tables occupied, so not overly busy. It took close to a hour to receive our food. From the time we received the first two plates to the time our last plate arrived was 35 minutes. We had to ask for silverware. Two of my children ordered breakfast. The scrambled eggs were browned to the point just shy of burnt. My wife's shrimp was over cooked to the point it was rubber. I ordered a beef burrito without beans. It, of course came with beans. The beef in it was bitter to the point of being inedible. We had to call out to the waitress to get refills on our drinks. All, in all, poor service. Bad food. Won't ever go back.
I love this place. My go to place here on S. Havana. Hope they make it as the place surely could use more customers.

Received this message from the waitress:  

"For your review of: Hacienda Camino Real

I would like to take a minute to defend myself... The second you walked in I was friendly.. You didn't see what was going on obviously didn't care that I was the only person running the front.. As in waitress hostess bartender bidder and cashier I had to go orders to bag up and send out not just tables not to mention I was answering the phone but that's not all the cook was not the regular cook and was running behind therefore it was hard to please everyone but thank you for this wonderful review :) have a blessed day"

No, we saw you were the only person doing anything - mostly waiting on the table with two gentlemen behind us.  The manager - or whatever position she held - was doing the same thing as well.  

I am sorry if your feelings were hurt by my being frank, but I felt others should know about our experience.  I appreciate a heads up by others when my money and time will be ill spent.  Perhaps what you should have done during our visit, was explain, apologize, something.... anything..... would have been better than what you did and did not do.  

Indeed, have a blessed day!

My husband and I have come to this restaurant many times and are very pleased. every time that we come here Lindsey is our regular waitress  and she is absolutely wonderful and very attentive , even when she is super busy she pays attention to us no matter her situation.

I'll start by saying the margaritas were poured from a bucket mix you can buy at Costco or Sam's. They were horrible, nothing but syrup and zero tequila. The food is horrible. I can't even describe how bad the food is. Everything is from a can, processed, unseasoned, zero flavor. Even the rice and beans were bad, how does a Mexican restaurant mess up rice and beans? The service was also lacking. Spent $50 for two adults and a child at happy hour and walked out not eating our food.

Walked in a month ago and ordered my food To go. The lady who helped me was pleasant. She gave me their business card and told me to call ahead next time so I won't have to sit and wait for my food. Since then I have called on three different occasions. Every time a person who speaks very little English answers the phone. I keep trying as the restaurant is close to my house and I love Mexican food. I come from Southern California where you can find good Mexican food on just about every block. Well tonight was the last time I will try. I ordered something off their menu, pazzole, and was hung up on as the woman could not speak enough English to communicate and understand me. I even spoke broken Spanish to her, I know pretty decent spanish, as I have worked with Spanish speakers for over 5 yrs! and still I got nothing in return. She sat on the phone In silence for two minutes before hanging up. Clearly they don't need the business. I won't try again. Good luck!!! Unless your dinning in.

This place is awesome. Really friendly the moment I walked in. Ordered 4 of the best street tacos I've ever had: carnitas and carne asada. And their happy hour is awesome. Definitely check this place out if you're in the area. They apparently even have karaoke on Fridays. But it seems chill, not like a crazy loud bar or anything. It's really nice.

Update: I went in for breakfast this morning, I had their Chilaquiles breakfast dish - fantastic. Oh and they make their own horchata! How could I resist.

I am a huge fan of any restaurant that has bacon wrapped shrimp on the menu. Their seafood dishes are fairly priced and delicious. The chips and salsa they serve is spicy and amazing.
The restaurant itself is clean and welcoming. The service is quick and friendly. 
 I wish I had a picture to share, but as soon as the food arrived we couldn't stop eating.  We had a lovely dinner and will definitely be returning again!

Had a pick 3 combo. Beef enchilada had a great sauce and was really good. Beef taco was pretty good the ground beef was a bit greasy. Beef tamale was awesome and was smothered in a decent green chile sauce. At my surprise the combo came with rice and beans!! Rice was average and the beans were very tasty. 

Service was great also. I'll be returning for sure!

Just for starters they have some of the best salsa that we ever have had!! The service was great, Flora was our waitress, and the food was fantastic!! We have found a new favorite Mexican Restaurant and will be back over and over!!!!

Can't understand why this place is always slow because the food is good and affordable. I drive past everyday and there is very few cars in the parking lot, as a business owner this saddens me when I see a good business struggling. 
Service is good and fast as well.  Will be eating there more.

To start I came in a Wednesday night. The waiter was AMAZING. (I'm terrible with names so I cannot share his name) he was very outgoing and charismatic. Who doesn't love a good waiter. Well lets get to what really matters. . . . Food. Chips and Salsa to start (as expected) this salsa was the most authentic salsa I've had since my abuelita (grandma) Luisa from Mexico that never once set a foot in the U.S. I proceeded to order the 3 combo of chile relleno crispy and it was exactly what I had in mind.

The service, the salsa, the food was wonderful!!!
I will be back

We just discovered this little place, it's excellent!  Our waiter, who I assume was the manager was great.  He was super friendly and very attentive.  We went for happy hour and had a few beers while waiting for an order to go.  They served us chips and salsa while we waited. I will say they have the BEST salsa I've had at any restaurant in Denver.  Everyone was super friendly and they even gave us more chips and salsa with our to go order and a free dessert!  We ate the food once we got home and it was delicious.  We will definitely be going back and will plan to bring friends next time!

I have driven by this restaurant many times and never really noticed it. Today, while craving Mexican, my hubby suggested we go here. Very clean interior and super friendly staff. The chips and salsa were addicting. The margaritas were decent but the horcharta was delicious. Now to the food...the most authentic and delicious Mexican we've had in Denver.  Will definitely return.

I apologize this post was going to  Hacienda  Colorado  on  Mexico  and Colorado. Not sure how to remove it from this restaurant. So I live nearby and we walked to get a bite to eat here at Hacienda on Colorado/Mexico and not to my surprise it had a wait time of 45mins....My party of 3 wanted to eat at the bar but it too was standing room only! we noticed that one side of the patio had a party of about 10 eating and the rest of the tables empty....so I enquired why and was told they didn't have enough staff to service anyone else..needless to say I asked for the manger( Angel Casillas) who listen to my suggestion of me going to eat on the patio and getting my food from the bar myself because they were short staffed. He in turn said that even though they are short staffed he wouldn't have a problem with sending a server to get our order and drinks. He sent one of his best servers Chris who was a delight and very quick we getting our order placed even though there was a wait outside we walked in as if we were VIP and got seated order the drinks and our appetizers and on top of it being so busy Angel stop by to see if everything was okay and it was perfect. His customer service skills was top-notch I even mentioned it to the president of Hacienda Darrell how impressed I was with the service today! On top of that the president of the company gave us a one pound chocolate delight dessert it was amazing and delicious. This is my favorite Hacienda and I will always dine here. Thank you so much for making myself my nephew and my friend feel like we was your VIP for dinner. I always felt that if you give great service you will be rewarded for it(so please never forget to reward the people that keep your company growing) and I have always been in this type of industry and I'm so glad that this type of service has not been lost!
I ate here one and it's ok...I had an authentic Mexican dish and it tasted mediocre. It's not horrible by any means and the staff is great....just not in the top of my places to go

Excellent! We were in the area and unfamiliar with restaurants nearby but this turned out to be really great! Portions are large and very tasty! Will definitely be back if on this side of town. Owner is very attentive making sure all guests are greeted and happy.

Huge menu.
I ordered a vegetarian biryani: rice, raisins, eggs, cardamon, cinnamon, fresh ginger, hot chili, onions and almonds.
Huge portions.
My wife had Nepalese momo, dumplings.
Just east of Havana on Alameda

We order delivery from here pretty regularly.  It's most definitely the best of the options we have for Indian food to be delivered in our neck of the woods.  The food doesn't disappoint, it's a little on the slow side when it comes to the delivery itself, but we do find ourselves enjoying a bi-monthly meal from here on the "I don't wanna cook" nights.

Our usual order is garlic naan, samosas, lamb vindaloo, and chicken korma.  I always have a gripe that things aren't hot enough for me, but their extra hot seems to be enough for Jess to avoid, so I'll take partial blame for that part.

We ordered delivery through Eat24. Our entire order was incorrect. Instead of garlic naan, we got whole wheat plain naan. Our onion kulcha was just missing. Chicken tikka masala was missing, replaced with another dish in a red sauce with a non-chicken mystery meat, carrots, and green beans. My saag paneer was replaced with saag with breaded fish.

So, these things happen- but when we called and asked for a refund or a replacement, they insisted that they had checked with the driver and we "had everything." They offered a refund for only some of the dishes and did not offer the option of a re-delivery. 

Eat24 customer service was amazing and helped us talk to the restaurant, who ultimately authorized a $20 refund (which was not the amount of the full order). The food did not taste good, but, to be fair, these are not dishes that I ever would have selected.

Disappointed in the food, even more disappointed in the service.

Two stars for their buffet.
I came here about a year ago and I was super delighted with their buffet food then, and today I was just disappointed. 
The entire buffet line was tasteless. The chicken was only dark meat no white meat. I am aware not everyone likes white meat but come on have at least a one chicken dish with white meat. 
Despite that I decided to give a try to all their chicken dishes and it was a total let down, to get a better perspective the naan was the only good thing I had there. 
Really sad, I was planning to turn this spot into my fav - now I gotta search again.

Gross! Don't do it! Saag Paneer, Chicken Jalfrazie, and Mangi Lassi were all nasty! Bad karma here!

You ask how why? Let me tell you.

The SAAG PANEER looked and tasted like a half package of frozen spinach hand mixed with just a few cheese cubes. I'm used to this type of dish whipped and creamed to a smooth warm consistency with a lot of cheese cubes. Worst Saag Paneer ever!

CHICKEN JALFRAZIE sauce actually had decent flavor. I ordered it medium spicy but it came mild. I was put off by the overuse of frozen mixed vegetables. Then I bit into the chicken...YUCK! The creepy soft and chewy texture didn't feel right which was visually confirmed when I saw the chicken was pink and not fully cooked!

Since when are MANGO LASSI'S made with sour cream? Oh, that's not sour cream? Well you could of fooled me because this was the most sour lassi I've ever tasted. Couldn't even tell there was mango in there. This Lassi was clearly spoiled and could not be consumed after a few sips.

I hate giving 1 stars reviews but when the food is inedible...... when the food is not fully prepared, raw, or spoiled... I have no choice. I hate that I felt bloated and sick to my stomach after eating this food. I hate spending more than $40 and getting ripped off.

I'm sending bad karma from my aching sick gut to the reckless and indifferent owners who serve this as food. Shame on you. I hope your crap hole restaurant closes down!

I stopped by after seeing a friend's recent review. The service was friendly and attentive. The buffet was well-priced. Here's my breakdown of pros and cons.

Pros: They had a mix of vegetarian and meat dishes. I was pleasantly surprised to have a nice, fluffy basket of naan. This was really a nice touch. The carrot halwa was delicious. My favorite dishes were the saag planner, vegetable biryani, and chicken korma.

Cons: They appeared to have a limited selection of dishes. The tandoori chicken was a bit dry. I felt that many of the dishes could have used more spices in them.

I still miss my old go-to Indian buffet, and my journey continues to find the perfect one for me in Denver.
Always delicious!!! We order delivery about once a  month and it is fast, friendly, and yummy!!! The tandoori wings are out of this world!

Overpriced for the quantities you get. It's nice of them to offer a Yelp coupon, but it creates a  bad customer service experience when the Yelp coupon is a tease.  It says 10% off if you check in, valid only from dinner menu. But they mean dine-in dinner menu. The check in coupon doesn't work for delivery or take out. Annoying to find this out the hard way.

Awful food. We came here for the lunch buffet around 11:30 and were disappointed. Every single thing they had out was cold. The rice was even cool and there was no serving utensil for the rice so spooning it took forever. Even if the food wasn't cold it tasted awful. The dal was thin, runny, and bland. The pakora was made using old looking vegetables. The vegetable curry tasted like it had chicken stock or was made using canned soup. This is the worst Indian food I have ever had.
We should have known when there was no on else in the restaurant.

We had a $30 Groupon for dinner.  They were located on East Alameda Ave east of S Havana St in Aurora in the Highline Villages strip mall.

The booth was very uncomfortable.   The table was too far away and the person sitting behind me kept on leaning back and pushing me forward.

The water was luke warm and tasted funny.  The Mango Lassi was good and I would order it again.

We started with the Coconut Shrimp with Korma Sauce appetizer.   There were 3 battered shrimp covered with sauce.  I didn't taste any coconut,  but the sauce was tasty and I saved it for the naan.

The Chicken Tikka Masala was average.   It came in a pretty metal bowl.  The basmati rice was garnished with 3 peas.  The server said to let her know if we wanted more rice.

The Garlic Naan was okay, a little flat.

The food was solid.  We would be interested in coming back for the lunch buffet if we were in the area.

I ordered the following via Yelp...

Chicken Tika Masala
Veggie Biryani
Onion Naan
Rice pudding
Samosa's- For free after spending a certain amount.

I read many reviews saying food was hours late or never arrived so I was worried, ordered my food on a Wed night around 6...received it in 30 min so I guess I was one of the lucky ones! 

So now to the food...I got mine medium (spice level) & it was perfect to me but I do love very spicy food! Honestly everything was tasty & flavorful, not the best Indian food but still very good! EXCEPT the samosa's they were literally raw dough!! (See the pictures!!)Yes they were free, but I almost did pay for them til the coupon popped up! Maybe that's why my order was on time? (unlike other reviewers)

They would have received a 4-star rating if all my food was actually cooked. But the delivery guy was nice & I did enjoy 99% of what I ordered! Would I order from here again? YES! But if I continue to get raw food, or late/no show as others have it will be my last!

I think these guys know how to make great food... they just need to take the time & get organized!!

A vegetarian's paradise! Eight dollars for lunch, really? I had everything on the buffet that was veggie friendly. Honorable mentions...Veggie Biryani, Buttered Plain Naan, Mango Chutney, a HUGE salad, Rice pudding and Veggie Samosa.

My my my I was so satisfied! What a jewel in Aurora and sweet on the wallet. Great for groups, great during lunch and dinner. This is the BEST indian food I have had in Denver. Do check it out!

Taz is a great restaurant with a yummy lunch buffet and neat interior. I have had their off the menu items as well as the buffet before. Their chai is phenomenal! Waitstaff is courteous and prompt. I am a return customer and am lucky this restaurant is not too far from where I live.

Scam Alert!!! Read why below.  If you ate here before check your statements. 

So we fly into Denver and pick this place.  Call them to place an order over the phone.  Their site said Lunch Special is $7.99 with rice and naan.  We ask for the total and she states it comes to $72 for three things, two apps, lassi, etc.  when we ask why, she said its dinner price.  I end up telling her it's 11:00 AM how are you charging me dinner price?  We then go down line by line what we order to make sure everything is correct.  By the end of the call our total came to $30.  Yup, $40 up charge for some reason.  Ok mistakes can be made and we were hungry. 

Once I get there order was partly filled because they forgot make few things and it will take another few minutes to make.  So I purposely at this point don't leave a tip. 

I check my card statement the next day and saw two transaction... One for the actual bill and one for a generous tip.  Yup, they tried to tip themselves without my authorization.  Of course I called back and the same lady tried to play games until I mentioned my lawyer, my bank and a lawsuit.  Had her call me back by the owner who also at first tried to play games until the same threat of a lawsuit... Now they are refunding me the money, but I strongly encourage everyone to stay away or even check their bills.  

Sad thing was their food was actually good.

I always order the Yellow Lentil Dahl and my partner orders the chicken tikka masala or butter chicken. The dishes are good, but aren't as flavorful as other Indian restaurants in town. 

Also, we've ordered from them multiple times and a handful of those orders were made way too spicy. We specifically requested very mild and all the dishes came back very spicy. When we called to let them know, they re-delivered the meals with no spice added at all. 

I would love to order from them again since they are one of the few Indian restaurants near us and they are very friendly, but it's just so hit or miss here that I find myself ordering elsewhere because it's less of a hassle.

Very very dangerously bad meal tonight. Butter chicken had something maybe like jerky in it. Meat?? Another dish was old tofu instead of shrimp. Lot of sauce to disguise the fact there was no meat in anything. They refunded the butter "chicken' but grub hub had to refund the rest. When I called the restaurant directly there was an argument so that didn't help. A total breach of trust, this place is banned. I'm waiting to see what happens 'in the end' so to speak. Sad, I liked this place.

We came here on a night when we didn't have much time and the service was slower than expected, especially since there were not many people in the restaurant. That being said, the food was great!! The portions were pretty big and we had quite a bit of left overs to take home. 

We got the biryani and tikka masala. Both were delicious. Sometimes biriyani can be oily but it was not at all here. Next time we are going to have to try an appetizer. They look so good!!

When we first ordered Taz Indian we were very happy, the food was great and so was the delivery time. Then the second time we ordered, it was completely different, the chicken tikka was a lot less flavorful and the women who answered could not understand a word my boyfriend said to her so she would have him repeat our address over and over. This has happened every time we placed an order since then. 

Today after spelling a simple street name to her about 5 different times, he asked for someone else so they could get our address and she refused. The phone call took 15 mins before we could even order the actual food. 

Bottom line they went downhill and are incompetent and now also very rude.
I have eaten hear 10 times. I find the food consistently good. I normally get the food to go, so I can't comment about the service. This is my go to Indian restaurant.

This place was not bad at all. Food was luke warm but ill give it to them, i did order kind of late. Taste was great. Rice dry. No naan came with the order. Wishi would have known that i would have ordered some. I know this review may sound a little harsh, its not meant to be. The taste was REALLY good with all the sauces and curry. I would try them again.

What a delicious surprise!!!

Tikka Masala was ridiculously flavorful with many spices and seasonings. The basamati was light and fluffy. 

The ambiance was rich in culture and the staff very nice.

Yesterday I was craving Chicken Tikka Masala something fierce, so I decided to order from Taz Indian Restaurant.  I ordered online and picked up at the restaurant, so I can't really speak to the ambiance of the restaurant or the service, but the woman who gave me my order was nice.  I did notice that the restaurant is pretty small, with a row of about 5 booths along one wall, the buffet on the opposite wall, and a few tables in between.

The Chicken Tikka Masala was excellent, and I was impressed with the portion size.  For just over $10, I got enough rice and Chicken Tikka Masala for three servings!  The lunch special also came with two large pieces of naan.

I really enjoyed my meal and will definitely come back.  I would like to try the buffet sometime!
This place has Decently good food, decently flavorful and much better than the bigger named Indian places in Denver.

Friday November 14th 2014.  Time was about 19:15hrs ish.

This establishment is situated in the Highline Villages strip mall.  We came in, greeted by 2 staffs, and seats ourselves.  We sat ourselves near the Entrance, on the Right Wing of this establishment.  Hmmm, I guess, it was slightly chilly since the weather outside is WAY CHILLY then anticipated.  Inside, was rather chilly too, since maybe its our "fault" seating near to the Entrance of Taz Indian Restaurant.  *SIGH*

On the Left Wing of this establishment is the BUFFET Trays or BUFFET Section, which on this evening, REMAINS Empty..  *DOUBLE SIGH*

After having some conversations with the Chef's Daughter, with regards to certain items from their Menu, such as the Samosas, Vindaloo and Madrash.

From their Simple Menu, we opt and ordered the following items :

*  Vegetable Samosa ($5.99)
*  Taz Special Naan ($3.99)  The Special Naan is stuffed with option of Lamb, Chicken, Garlic, Cheese and Chilli (Choose 3 Combination)
-  We opt to have Lamb, Cheese and Chilli
*  Lamb Biryani ($14.99)
*  Lamb Madrash ($14.99)

Beverages :

*  Chai Tea ($1.99)
*  Coffee with Milk ($1.99)
*  Water

The staff gave us Complimentary Papadum which somehow was a little "stale", NOT Crunchy, or NOT Crispy, aka to our liking aka NOT FRIED that evening, or have been kept in a container for a long time.  *SIGH*

The staffs ask if we want the Vegetable Samosas either in 6 mini pieces or 2 big pieces.  We opt to have the 2 Big Pieces.  That is good, if they offer options of the kind of Samosas based on Patrons decision.  First came the Vegetable Samosa.  YES it comes out piping hot from the fryer but its was a little bland and under-seasoned.  YES its FRIED in crispy pastry with Mashed Potatoes with some Peas.  It comes with 2 dipping sauce, the Tamarind and Mint Chutney.  I like the Mint Chutney coz its a little spicy and very "addictive".

Then comes with our order of Lamb Biryani and Lamb Madrash.  Hubs did not fancy or did not like his order of Lamb Biryani.  *SAD FACE*  The Lamb Biryani get a "MEH" and it lacks some of the essential spices that we are familiar with Biryani.  I guess Taz Indian Restaurant Biryani its just one tone, one dimension of flavor aka DO NOT WOW us at all.  *SIGH*

As for the Lamb Madrash, its SPICY to my liking, though they can be MORE SPICY.  Hence I think this Lamb Madrash is my next mission to compare to other Indian Restaurants in town.  YES, it comes out BRIGHT RED!  Maybe with the " food coloring" or the SPICES that they put in the Madrash dish itself.  For this alone, it received 3 stars in my personal taste buds and personal books.  Hmm, now I am intrigued on how to cook Madrash dish from scratch!  

With our order of Taz Special Naan, the Lamb that we opt for, came to a minimal at best, though its stuffed with Cheese and Chilli.  For this Taz Special Naan, I wish they could increase the Lamb "pieces" and make it more "fluffier" kind of Naan.

Overall the service from the staffs are indeed inviting and they answered all our questions in terms on what they offer.

May return when needed since they offer LUNCH BUFFET everyday (Monday-Sunday) though unlikely... but I may just have to convince Hubs, the next time we come for a visit, maybe that Vindaloo dish can "win" our hearts, err in this case our tummy.

They are in the midst to have things running smoothly, more like with a Bar and other dishes to offer during LUNCH Buffet in a couple of weeks..  3 stars at best.  Left Taz Indian Restaurant at about 20:30hrs ish.  From their Paper Menu, or TO GO Menu, its stated that they offer DELIVERY.  Taz Indian Restaurant is opened DAILY from 11 am to 10pm.

Above anything else, we wish them well in their future Business undertakings and may them prosper with many more years to come in this part of Neighborhood.

TAZ INDIAN RESTAURANT
(Indian & Nepali Cuisine) 
10731 E Alameda Ave, Unit G
Aurora, CO 80012
Tel : (303)-366-3011

@212/2014

We had lamb biryani (mild) and lamb vindaloo (medium). Mild was very mild, medium was just about the level of spice we both prefer. We were very happy with the food, which was ready for pickup promptly and tasted delicious. Price seemed reasonable. Two entrees will come to just about $30, add in 2 naans and 2 mango lassis and you'll be at $40 for two.

There was apparently some coupon confusion on pickup -- we had the $20 for $30 yelp deal and they didn't want to honor it because we'd also received a free rice pudding due to the size of our order. In the end they did though, which was nice. 

So just a tip, pass on the free rice pudding, buy the Yelp deal, save $10, avoid arguments.
Worst biryani ever it's an insult to the term biryani never step in if u really like to have decent food just buy chips and survive

I gave them the benefit of the doubt after the first visit (when we were stomach sick) and went today because it is close and convenient .....but that was a huge mistake!

We (my coworkers and i) ordered chicken curry. 
The chicken was definitely uncooked/raw!!! 
When we got the order they apologized, said they would let the cook know and would refund us. Won't be going back again unless I want the risk of food poison. Now it all makes sense why all 3 of us had stomach pains last time.

I'm a sucker for good Indian food. I actually work for an Indian webhosting company right now, and always am getting good suggestions from my coworkers who are at an office in India whereas I am the off-shore worker in the states.  (Reverse outsourcing is interesting eh)

I've had delivery from this place numerous times, many times during my workday from the home office, but last week have finally had a chance to visit the place in-person with my roommate.

The food here is AMAZING! The staff are wonderfully pleasant, and almost got the order right the first time; however the bread order came out wrong the first time. 
We ordered 1 regular naan, 1 garlic/herb, 1 cheese, and 1 roti. We ended up with an onion kulcha, and 3 plain naans. They fixed it right away though! The cheese melted inside the naan is SO delicious when fresh out of the oven! The garlic naan is also supremely tasty! 

Of note: they have _never_ messed up even the most insane online orders. It was only the waitress who decided to use her head, and not a pad and paper, to record our moderately complex order at the table for lunch.

They offer complimentary papadam, which is delightfully crispy and cuminy, to crunch on as a small appetizer before they bring any other food out as well.

The appetizers were great: You never can go wrong with a vegetable samosa, especially with tamarind dipping sauce! I also enjoyed a salad with their house yogurt dressing and it was also quite tasty and hit the spot before the gut-fire that followed. 

Now don't get me wrong: I love hot food. I _love_ hot food. Starting with the pickled jalapeños on Nacho Day from first grade onward, graduating now to ghost pepper sauces and eating raw habañeros without even so much as wincing (a little sweat is good!) I have asked them to make me a firey hot chicken saag.  They did NOT disappoint! It was both extremely flavorful, as well as filled with the body-warming spices and peppery punctuated heat I love so much.  They also do a great Vindaloo of any style; I've tried chicken and fish and the fish is actually better than the chicken for its flavor and moisture content. The sauce either way is great!

They have a ton of other things I've not mentioned, as this is only 1 review; I'll add more later as I sample the whole gamut of their selection - I live close, and will DEFINITELY be coming back time after time to this amazing restaurant!

Go there and do yourself a favor!
Ordered delivery - curry was 90% vegetables for a chicken curry order, 2 Masala were meh - not very impressive overall. Next time I'll go Little India, better choice.

Worst fucking situation ever, call place a order at 9:15 p.m I literally  live 1 block away. 11:00 comes no food still and the store is closed wtf I will be in there first thing in the morning. HORRIBLE
Chicken Momo/dumpling is very bad here. Please do not even bother to go there for this item. The cover of dumpling was very dry and it was cracking. Chutney was horrible and stinky.

We ordered 3 main dishes, 2 Naan, and 2 orders or Samosas. The total bill was $60.91 plus we tipped 20% for a total bill of $73.00. The main dishes were very small (16oz) and the Korma had 4 shrimp in total (14.99). Each of us put in $15.00 and there was not enough food. The food was tasty but basically it was ruined by us not having enough.

Have gotten delivery here a ton. I like some spice (obviously, with Indian food) and the Butter Chicken extra spicy is awesome! The Korma is insanely good too. Great naan. Delivery takes 45 - and hour but they tell you that. Customer service has been great. First time I ordered we got an appetizer that we forgot about and it wasn't in the bag, they came back and brought it to us without us even asking!! This is our Indian spot!

Great service.  The hostess immediately set us up and was very nice and even kidded with us.   The interior is modern but retains a warmth.  We did the lunch buffet. There was a nice selection.   The vegetables seemed much fresher than other places we've been.   They also had a nice alternative to the tikka masala standard and offered a tasty chicken korma.   Slight complaint that the flavor profile was a little blander than we would have liked.

Delicious new Indian Restaurant opened a month ago.  I wish this place was closer to my house, but near my Mom's which is not too far away.  They offer delivery which works out great for her.  There was only one other table occupied at 6:00 PM on a Wednesday, but seeing the good Yelp reviews eased my worry.

The food is really good here.  I had the Lamb Korma spiced medium and it was truly tasty and no ghee floating around.  My Mom ordered the Bharta Makhani     (eggplant dish) which even though my Mom ordered mild had plenty of flavor and a great constancy.  We also ordered the Taz Naan (which gives you a choice of three fillings) we did cheese, garlic, and lamb... again very good and not greasy.  I also had a cup of hot chai tea which went well with the meal.

All around great Indian food (I need to try the Nepalese someday) and where Indian Restaurants have been lacking in my neighborhood, this one will be worth the 15-20 min drive...and again I am jealous for my Mom who is within delivery area.

Definitely check this place out!  So much more for me to try on the menu....I went with my favorite of Lamb Korma and they did not disappoint.
I love Indian food. Their food is 3.5 star but i'll give them 4 star since they are very nice people.

This is my hundredth Yelp review! Ok, now back to business. My husband and I found Taz on Grub Hub one night when we didn't feel like cooking or going out anywhere (which is very rare, let me tell you). 

Grub Hub had a ton of options, but we chose Taz because of the high reviews and no delivery fee. 

The food was delicious! The Tandoori Chicken was surprisingly moist, the peppers were perfect. My husband enjoyed the Seesh Kabab as well. 

Not to mention, our order arrived well inside the estimated delivery window. I try to stay out of Aurora as much as possible, so I might never see the restaurant itself, but with delivery this good, I don't have to.

Ordered wings, calamari, 2 indian salads, stuffed bread, saffron rice, chicken jahangir, saag paneer, rice pudding & carrot pudding.

First the confirmation said it would be 45-60 min food was delivered in about 40 min and there was enough food to feed two more people.  My girlfriend and I will be eating this for lunch tomorrow.

Everything tasted fresh and was perfectly prepared.  There is nothing bad to say about this place.

The food is amazing! So, why the two stars?

I ordered via Eat24 and wanted to inform Taz that the driver was incredibly rude. I am mobility impaired and provide clear instructions as to how to get in my building no matter where I order from. No one buzzed the apartment number outside the building as stated each and every time I order from anywhere, especially if my husband or son is not here to answer the door.  A neighbor apparently let the driver and his companion in the building. I received an email from Eat24 that the driver was outside my door. I got up and opened the door about one minute later. I heard my husband's phone ring and apparently, the change I made to my contact number last night after an unsuccessful order to El Costeno (they closed early, but the phone number on my account was wrong even though I changed it well over a week ago as I got my new phone).  On my way to the door, I checked my account and the number was still incorrect. I then opened my door and two men were there. I apologized and explained why it took me a couple of minutes to get to the door as I am sick and disabled and about the phone number on my Eat24 account. I went to reach for my food and it was withheld. The shorter of the two men rolled his eyes and quite rudely said he rang the doorbell four times. I told him that's part of the reason I state to buzz the apartment number downstairs as the doorbell is hard to hear, in addition to my mobility issues. I was then told (again, rudely) that if I ever make him wait again, I would not get my food and I won't get a refund. I was then handed my food by the second man. I then shut the door loudly.  The driver was waiting a total of four minutes. Had he followed the instructions on the order, it could have been avoided. My mobility impairment often leaves me partially bed ridden and I put the same instructions on each Eat 24 order as well as Pizza Hut, Delivered Dish, etc. to make things as easy as possible on the delivery drivers. I haven't had an issue with ANY other driver from any other restaurant or service. In fact, Taz has been here before with no problems. While Taz was my new favorite Indian and Nepali restaurant, I won't be ordering again.

Food is decent. I don't love the buffet but the menu options are great. Buffet is a fantastic price if you're not looking for anything specific. It is small though so if you just want a bunch of a few things and don't care what they really are, go for the buffet. If you crave something specific like I do then order off the menu. I've only ever eaten in so I can't say if their delivery is good or not.
Really delicious dishes made with fresh ingredients. Quick service, loved my saag paneer & mango lassi! And the $20 for &30 deal was 100% worth it.

Very pleased! This place is only a block from home and I'm not sure why I hadn't visited earlier. About a week ago I left work super late and after not having eaten anything all day I just "NEEDED" Indian food. With a lot of places hitting closing time I got on Yelp and found Taz and remembered it's very close by. They were also open later than I expected so I called in and spoke with a very nice lady and ordered chicken tikka korma with garlic naan. My food was ready very timely when I arrived 15 minutes later. The restaraunt was very calm, inviting and clean. I took my meal to go but am looking forward to eating inside there on my next visit. My chicken tikka Korma was delicious! The tecture and spice consistency was thicker which I prefer and it had the right amount of coconutiness. The only thing I forgot to ask or wish I was asked when I placed my order was level of spice/heat. It was a very very very mild dish and I do prefer a kick though the flavor itself was very good. The garlic naan was on the thinner side but tasted great! I'll definitely be going back here often!

ordered food at 6:15...two hours later, no food. made contact with restaurant and was told my order for mixed up and they were redoing my order at 8:30 PM. An hour later still no food. I cancelled the order, was refunded my money. They lost a customer.

Some of the best shrimp tikka masala I've had. Perfectly flavored and spiced sauce, fragrant rice, tasty naan, and big, delicious vegetable samosas. The service was friendly and the restaurant is nice and clean, though we just popped inside to grab a takeout order. Highly recommend. Delicious!

This was overall a bad experience. Starting with the delivery guy, who was incredibly rude. He got lost (I order delivery from other places often and live by major intersections--- easy to find) and called me 5 times asking for directions. When he finally found my place, he proceeded yelling at me that I gave the wrong address (yet he found me) and was agitated and  rude. Needless to say the food was very cold, and once I finally warmed it up, everything was so salty, I threw it out. Waste of $40. I called the restaurant to complain about the delivery guy, but did not get anywhere....people kept putting me on hold. Don't waste your money!

Pretty good! I ordered take out using a groupon and they were very friendly. The chicken tika massala was good. The sagg paneer was a little oniony but not bad. Nann was delicious! I ordered medium and it was the perfect amount of heat. This isn't my favorite Indian restaurant but I would most definitely eat there again.
Great food! They let you choose your level of spicy also. If you love something that will make you sweat or can't handle the heat, they can accommodate.

after an hour and a half driver calls me, says shes in front of my house. Shes actually a mile a way from my house. She refuses to drive any further I have to go get it, while I'm walking she calls to hurry me up. Then when I call the store to make a complaint first they tell me the manager comes in at 4pm, call was made after 4 pm, then she does the I dont speak english routine. Food is cold, horrible customer service, they just want your money.

I found this place to be both inviting and clandestine. I'm a fan of a good Indian buffet and I often need to have secret, strategic lunches in places where I won't be surprised by colleagues who pop in and want to sit close or, worse yet, join my lunch meeting!

I love Indian food and this place is great.  I come here often.  The lunch buffet at 7.99 is a value with numerous dishes, dessert and naan included.  Very authentic.  Friendly.  Don't pay attention to those bad reviews.
We ordered food to go . Momos are pretty good . Tandoori  Chicken curry was okay (too spicy) but you gotta try their bhuna paneer. YUM !

Friendly staff, great food! I had the chicken tikka masala and my husband had the lamb vindaloo. We shared the vegetarian samosas as well as the garlic naan. 

Absolutely loved the food, and it seems like it's going to be the next big thing. Definitely recommend coming here! Plus we got 30%  off for some reason.. Still not sure why but well take it :)
Great Indian and Nepali food! Solid selection of vegetarian and vegan options and super tasty. I will continue to make the trek out to aurora for this awesome food

I was from different state passing through Denver and thought grab some Indian food. Name of the restaurant sounds great but the food was so bad. The lussy was spoiled and it had bad smell. I have tasted pretty good chicken biryani from Indian restaurant at my place, however the biryani was so bad I had to throw to dustbin. I would never recommend this restaurant.
Great food - good price and good service. Love the Bollywood music videos they always have on too!

I've eaten here a few times and they always have amazing food. They make an amazing Briyani that is filling and wonderful. Every other dish I've had has been wonderful.. a teeny warning to those not used to spice in traditional Indian cuisine: make sure to tell your server to make it mild if you aren't used to it.

Was craving Indian food one evening and decided to check out a place close by that my boyfriend and I haven't been to before. It was a quiet Tuesday evening (we were the only ones there) and were seated immediately. Our server was prompt and friendly. Ordered the veggie samosas to start-- fried fresh and piping hot; perfectly spiced and delicious. I ordered the fish vindaloo and my boyfriend ordered the chicken curry (I think...) The vindaloo was real deal! Super spicy and flavorful. Got a cold? No problem! Their vindaloo will clear those sinuses right up!
Place is a huge rip off. I paid 35.00 barely got half a meal.  It was all rice which I don't eat. I've never complained about a restaraunt
Did take out for work. It was so good! One thing that took away the star is the delivery time he quoted was wrong. Other than that the food way perfectly spicy and the rice soft and light!

Food is ok. Inconsistent. Sometimes chicken is delicious sometimes it is cooked beyond belief and tough. Ordered tonight and time was 45 to 60 minutes....it has been an hour and 40 minutes and no food yet....contacted Eat24.com and restaurant called saying it was on the way and would be here in 10 minute...that was 15 min ago and waiting..
I was pleasantly surprised. We ordered take out and the food was very flavorful and everything was well prepared and tasty. Will definitely try again.
The lamb saag, garlic naan, and kir were delicious. Delivery was prompt. Definitely ordering from them again.

I am obsessed with Indian food. It is the reason I have to have a gym membership. Taz did a wonderful job of fulfilling my Indian buffet craving.

Normally, I am a chicken tikka masala addict, so I was disappointed it wasn't part of the buffet. As I sat in my pout, I begrudgingly grabbed chicken vindaloo, which I usually don't like. It took one bite for me to realize I am wrong. Their vindaloo is off the chain. It might be the only vindaloo I have ever had seconds of.

Beyond the awesome vindaloo, they gave me a huge portion of some of the best naan I have ever had. They also had excellent dal makhani, which other places in the area tend to make taste like red chili. I also generally think gulab jamun is gross, but these were buttery and had the most balanced honey on them. So good!

I am only giving them a 4 because the saag was lacking the paneer and the lack of tikka masala. 

I look forward to ordering take out from them in the future.

Now, I am going to the gym.
Food is great.  I love their chicken saag. I like that they give the option to choose the level of spicy.  The delivery driver is always nice and on time.

I've ordered from the menu and had the lunch buffet.  Both are excellent.  The lunch buffet was 1/2 salad bar and several chicken/vegetarian dishes composed the other 1/2. All of it was mild and delicious, although I would have liked a dessert option or a red meat option included.  The menu is incredible. It's the best Indian food that I've had here and even make the trek from Englewood to have it.  From the menu, I've had and vouch for the tikka korma with any protein, and the chai.
Just ate here .  Service was great and the food was even better .  Fantastic and affordable Indian Food , enough said !

Stumbled upon this place by accident - originally I was headed to Massino's but it is no more.  Place was empty - was seated quickly - waiter (?) was very friendly and helpful with suggestions.  I ordered the Butter Chicken and an order of garlic naan.  What surprised me was that he did not ask for a hotness scale.  Food came out relatively quick.  The naan was delicious.  However the Butter Chicken was a little on the bland side - maybe next time I will ask them to kick it up a notch in heat.  The portion size was large enough so I had lunch for the next day.  An added plus - they deliver to my abode!

This is my second time to this place and I simply love their food. I ordered chicken vindaloo and mutter paneer, both of them were perfectly cooked and tasty. I usually get spicy food in Indian restaurant and most of the vindaloos tends to lack the flavors but their vindaloo was just right delicious!! And Flavorful. My friends liked it too. 
I have to say try Taz Indian Restaurant, you won't be disappointed.

I'm relaxing at home tonight watching documentaries, enjoying Taz delivery! Hands down, Taz has become the best Indian Food in town. The flavors are fresh, multilayered and healthy. I often find much Indian Food too oily. This is not the case with Taz. Our favorites are the Saag Paneer and the Bindi Masala. The delivery is always prompt and still piping hot. I can't wait to check out the actual restaurant. Great job!
The food is delicious!  I have never eaten in but when I get takeout I think they could be  just a tad more attentive.. Their service could improve..  But like I said the food is good!

Since I just reviewed Bites of China, it would be remiss of me not to tell you about a similarly yummy find in the exact same stripmall - namely, Taz Indian Restaurant, whose Nepalese owners are sure to have a delectable dish just for you!

Personally, I always like to start my meal with an order of Momo. Originating with the Newari people from the area around Kathmandu, these dumplings feature either cabbage or chicken lovingly tucked into a white flour wrapper, then steamed to perfection before being served with a simply stunning sesame/tomato chutney. Alternatively, you can treat yourself to an order of the flaky fried turnovers called Samosa, or the moist fried fish nuggets known as Pakora. And who - really, who? - can forget the plump coconut shrimp served with fragrant cream-based Korma sauce? But make sure you don't gorge yourself too senseless, because you still have some choices ahead of you.

Noodle lovers will go agog for the Chau-Chau or Chaumin, whose wheaty strands are quick-fried either with chicken or seasonal mixed veggies. (Interestingly, many eateries in Nepal use the Thai-in-origin instant noodles called "Wai Wai" - available at many of Denver's Nepalese and Bhutanese markets - for this dish). Vegetable fans will be similarly enamored with Bhindi ko Tarkari (sometimes also called Bhindi ki Sabji) - chopped okra simmered with dried mango powder, turmeric, and the spice blend called garam masala until it reaches maximum succulence. Oh, you're looking for a little more heat? Try some salmon with the chili/vinegar sauce called Vindaloo - but don't blame me when you spend the rest of the night going "owwwwwwwwwwwwwwww" - I did warn you, after all. Another great item is the dark, decadent Handi Chicken (the name refers to the earthenware pot traditionally used to cook the dish) whose subtle notes of cardamom, cumin and coriander will send you into culinary conniptions.

I know you want to stuff just a bit more in, so why not finish things off with a little carrot pudding (Gajar ka Halwa), pistachio ice cream (Kulfi) or even creamed rice with almonds (Kheer)? Then you can plan your next meal there, because I know you'll want to return again and again once you've tried what's on offer at Taz.

The service was exceptional and the food was stupendous. My girlfriend and I came in at the beginning of the dinner hour, and were seated imediately. The pricing is very reasonable, we had the chicken tika Masala and the shrimp tandoori and made it out for just over $30 without tip, which was remedied due to the outstanding service. I highly recommend Taz and we will be returning soon.

I ordered dinner for delivery at 9:15 PM and was told to expect delivery in 45 mins-1 hr. Delivery never arrived, and neither the restaurant nor the driver called to let me know there was a problem. It's 1 AM, and my lunch salad evaporated 10+ hours ago...

So pumped to have a new Indian place close to Lowry. They are very nice folks making delicious food. We called our order in and it was ready on time. We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Chicken Korma with a side of garlic naan. We ordered them spicy and medium, and they were both really spicy. I guess the spicy one was a little more spicy than the medium, but not much. Regardless, great flavor and lots of food for leftovers. Looks like they are applying for a liquor license. Until then, it's probably best for takeout/delivery. They still need to decorate their interior a bit more. They are running AMAZING deals right now, will be back soon and ordering medium spicy level next time.

After eating some leftovers I had to bump up my rating to 4 stars. Tender chicken and really rich sauce. So good.

Fantastic Indian food! Glad to have a new Indian place in the area and these folks seem to be eager to please. 

We had the chicken saag tikka and the chicken tikka korma. Both were fantastic, looked/tasted fresh, and they had them on the table pretty quickly. Our glasses were never empty and the wait staff were very pleasant.

We love the buffet and service is always warm and friendly. Their Naan is warm and cooked freshThe tikka masala is my favorite but their saag is also very very good. The only thing I would change about taz is the fact that they serve Pepsi products(I'm a coke person).
We've eaten here several times and have been very pleased with everything, every single time!

This is an overdue review.  Having living in the Bay Area for many years, which is famous for the most delicious Indian food.  I was very surprised that there was a little restaurant that we stumbled upon totally by accident would surpass our expectation.  The food was spiced very delicately with very little oil but tasted so delicious.  My children absolute favorite is chicken tikka masala and sag paneer, they asked to eat there for lunch and dinner everyday for three days straight.  For adult, please try their fish curry, and I have no idea how they made their dal but it was so delicious beyond words, even better than my-in-law in India. 

We found this restaurant during Christmas time of last year, this restaurant was just opened and the only restaurant opened during the Holiday.  We wanted to leave a review asap after getting home to spread the words.  I am so happy that they got 4 stars rating.  

Thank you for your hospitality.  Our children keep asking to go back to Colorado just to eat there again.  I am not sure when I can drive 1000 miles again.
In a restaurant less than 10% full the two servers were unable to manage... Poor service. Very good food hence the 3 stars.

Tried this location with a Groupon I had bought and their food was amazing!!! I had some cheese naan, lamb naan, chicken tikka masala, and their vegetable samosas. Looking forward to trying new things off their menu!!!

I think the food is great...have been there twice now and have not been disappointed...the first time was for their lunch buffet and thoroughly enjoyed it...went last night for dinner and once again the food was very good....the only thing that I would say is keeping me from giving Taz a 5 star review is the service...it wasn't bad at all, but I think they tried too hard, which can also be a negative...need to find the in between of not being attentive and being too attentive and once they find that, this is a 5 star place
Great food. Great service. Is definitely my Indian food standby for delivery. I just hope more people order from here.

Definitely give Taz Indian Restaurant a try if you like in the Stapleton or Lowry location. They offer free deliver to both Stapleton and Lowry. Their food is fresh and delicious. We ordered the garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, combo biryani and the seekh kabobs. All were amazing. The standout is definitely the chicken tikka masala. We asked for very spicy and it had the perfect amount of spice. If you are looking for some good Indian food, definitely give them a try!

I love this place. I have both dined in the restaurant and have ordered delivery (through grubhub) and have been extremely happy every time I eat their food!

First, the restaurant experience. They are a fairly new Indian restaurant to the area so I wasn't surprised that the atmosphere in the restaurant was not the best, but the atmosphere is not why I eat here. It's the FOOD and it's incredible. Their chicken Jalfrazie, naan, chai, and samosas are to die for. Their service is very on-point, very attentive without being too much. Very neutral, which I find refreshing.

The delivery experience was amazing. I'm always hesitant to order delivery because my apartment complex has multiple buildings and most drivers get confused so I usually have to go hunting for them, BUT this guy was waiting IN my lobby IN my building. It was SO EASY. The food also came in 30 mins when usually GrubHub estimates an hour, so it was very fast! The samosas were still hot and crispy. 

I LOVE this place. Highly recommended. Ignore the negative reviews, I'm convinced that they're planted by the competition.

The inside of the place isn't all that but you are there for the food which is what counts, I've had better Indian food but everyone's taste buds are different, came in for their lunch and it was a really good price , the staff is amazingly attentive and nice .

I live close by and always get take out. This place is always consistent and yummy. Very friendly staff and I'm sure their buffet is totally worth it. I recommend all of their apps and mainly their saag even though everything is great. I recommend this place and I'm picky.

I have... Maaaybe been going to lunch here multiple times a week. It is so good! The lunch buffet is loaded with delicious, authentic food. The samosas are buttery and delightful, the curry is the right level of spice, the rice is fresh and plentiful. Their chai is hot and sweet and spiced just right. The price is a steal for an all you can eat lunch. And their regular menu items are definitely a great bargain and a fun mouth party. If you're looking for a place to become a regular at, Taz is open for business. Hopefully forever.

Not a fan. I ordered in on christmas, they had absolutely no problem with it.
The naan was great, both he garlic and regular. The curry and samosas left a lot to be desired. In all it was very flavorless.
Again, as to what always happens to me, the driver forgot the sodas. He at least brought them back in a timely manner and was very apologetic. 
Not my favourite indian place by any means but they do have great service.

The food here is really great. I've had Indian food that was too salty or lacked flavor before, but this is just wonderful. We had dishes consisting of chicken, spinach, homemade cheese, masala, samosas, and others and everything was just wonderful. I used Yelp eat24 and that was great too.
Fast and tasty. Really happy to have them nearby.

Tried Taz for the first time tonight with my husband and a friend. We had the chicken tikka masala, lamb korma and garlic naan. The food was flavorful and delicious, each sauce unique. Glad we didn't get anything hotter than medium for the chicken as it was just a little spicy as-is but the chicken was tender and amazing. Delivery was quick considering the weather and the food was fresh for being nearly 10 at night. Will definitely order from this restaurant again!

Lovely flavours! I went there with my mom for her birthday and the flavors were on point. The lamb madras  did not disappoint. Very peppery just as promise. The lamb Ronan Josh came out and i fell in love. The flavour blew me away. The rice was perfectly cooked. The waiters were very polite and patient. My mom loved the food and so did i. I will be definitely be returning with friends and family.

Food is actually really horrible. I gave them three chances and the last time it was really bad. Rice was undercooked and had burnt pieces. Naan, undercooked and doughy. Not good for indian food and this last meal was particularly disgusting. If you know Indian food, you'll know how poor it is! (I'm married to an Indian and come from London - Indian food is a staple) Oh delivery is bad, too. Could be that they were so busy standards slipped, on all three occasions.
Great place! Found a hidden food gem.  Had the buffet and everything was really good and the price is right!!!

Silla is one of my favorite traditional Korean restaurants in the area. I love that right when you come in it is full of Koreans which makes me feel i def came to the right place. I usually love going for lunch as the prices are only around $8 dollars pre entree which also includes like 8 side dishes. Totally worth it.
They def have the best naengmyeon  which is cold buckwheat noodles deal. For $13 dollars you get the noodles and short ribs or giant kimchi dumpling. This time I went I got my mul naengmyeon which is the buckwheat noodles in a icy broth with the short rib and I also got a shimmering soup called taro gookbap, which isn't actually that spicy with a side a rice... I was super hungry
The noodles were great and since I was sharing that I asked for another bowl they were sweet enough to give me. Another bowl with broth in it so I didn't have to pour the broth from the original one. However we found hair in the short rib which was gross... they gave us a new one and apologized and gave us free giant dumplings. I was actually going to give them a lower score however they were so apologetic and there service was actually better then usual hence it is four stars... but if I could it would have been 3.5 stars
All in all I will still be back

Service: 4.5 / Food: 3

Let's talk service - the staff was absolutely amazing!  After getting seated, our server came back with 2 hot and 2 iced teas. My older Asian parents, my brother and I were all amazed. That's top service that she knows older Asian folks prefer hot drinks and brings them out without us even asking for it! We also loved that she was so tentative to our food, helped us cook most of our meat, and even served us too! I rarely get a server that's willing to fully cook your meat at KBBQ. If they weren't so understaffed, I would give a full 5 stars for service. 

As for the food, it was good, but I wish I saw more. The meat was marinated well and the flavors came through. However their side dishes were slightly lacking and not as extravagant. They have the basics - kimchi, seaweed salad, tofu, fish cakes - but none of the fancier dishes - macaroni salad, candied sweet potato, or anchovies. The kimchi in the kimchi pancake was also very small.

I think for the wonderful service, I might make Silla my regular KBBQ!

I am from NYC here on business and have been here 3 times and still the same. 
The food here is good but can't compare to NYC. 
The service is by far the worst and the management don't care or just oblivious. 
The decor is something to said, time warp back to the 80's with tall booths that the staff can't even see you. 
The service is terrible, even though I'm Korean!
You don't get any preferential treatment. 
Waited a long time to get check. Had to hail bus boy to get attention from staff. 
The staff was all sitting in a booth eating,snacking or something. 
Tables with dishes from previous customers still waiting to be cleared just sitting. 
If you do go be prepared to wait or you just have to yell for service. 
Would have given more stars if the service was better.

I got a veggie dolsot bibimbap and found it to be pretty tasty. It had lots of veggies, but also had a lot of oil too...

My friends had the BBQ chicken thing and found it to be pretty tasty (they ate it). There were some funky chewy pieces in it, though.

Sills used to be known for their cold noodles, and it looks like they still serve pretty yummy noodles! I didn't try it, but it looked good.

There were a pretty good number of side dishes, and they were all good!

Your bill can come out to be pretty high if you're not careful, but in general, I'd say this place is $15-$20/person.

Been here a few times
Everything is pretty great
Portions are huge and lots of baanchaan

This restaurant had decent food... definitely not the best I've had but certainly passed.

However, their service was atrocious.

Our waiter (male, brown hair, glasses) behaved disgustingly. He slammed our plates into the table and dropped all of our plates on the ground. He ignored us whenever we needed help. He seemed to not care one bit. And it's just unbearable. I was super disappointed with the way they acted.

I work in the restaurant industry and I know that there are times when work is stressful, but don't ever put your anger on the customers. The customers are always right, no matter what situation. 

And to make matters worse, when we got our check, him and the cashier in the front gossiped about us in Korean and laughed. Luckily for them, we weren't able to understand what they were saying. Let's be real, that's childish. Adults shouldn't gossip in front of the customers or in general. Very unprofessional. 

I hope this staff somehow ups their service game, because their service isn't doing them any good right now. Definitely not coming back.
I eat at Silla often when I'm in Denver.  My photo is of korean bbq (sam gyub sal), which was delicious, but Silla is known for their cheap but delicious LUNCH galbi+nengmyun combo.  Try it!

Small restaurant tucked away in a strip mall. Hands down the best "Authentic Korean BBQ" we've had since moving to Colorado! Service was what you'd expect from a Korean restaurant; not too much talking, place your order, your drinks come, then food, eat and pay. Nothing wrong with that. I wish they had more sake options but hey that's okay just order 2 at a time as each sake only pours 3 1/2 shots so if you're there with someone else do yourself a favor and order 2. I'm not a big meat eater but my husband and daughter love bulgogi. The Mandu is just okay. The kimchi pancake is so yummy, you just order that. The kimchi stew is also very good. Piping hot good. So glad we found our go to Korean spot. I'm not sure why this place only has 3 stars. 

....until next time!

Got there and first table to be seated!
Then they kept coming in!
Only 3 other tables were English speakers, rest were Korean.
Now only a 5 mile jaunt from the new home in Stapleton.
Had tofu stew, did crack the raw egg into it, and it did cook thoroughly, The little cast iron pot is VERY HOT.
I wonder if there is a You Tube on the complexities of eating/menu choices in a Korean eatery?

Bancha was exceptional! 
Order the Khal Bi , (althogh a little pricey) very tender and marinated to perfection. 
Service was attentive and quick. 
I'll be coming back.

Food is great. 

I would recommend the mandoo (which is like dumplings. It can come in soup or just without) and the  (which translates literally to potato soup, but really it's all about the meat). The service can be spotty depending on who the server is but Mrs. Lee has to be the nicest Korean server in the area.
Great sides, perfect for groups of 3-6 people!

Very authentic Korean restaurant!!!!   Wonderful service and food.  I had cold noodle and fish stew.  This is on par with the best restaurant in Los Angeles.   I would definitely come back next time I am in Denver!!!!!
Workers were rude and portions were small. Attitude was given, and they do not deserve the tip.

In a city not exactly lacking in options for Korean cuisine, Silla Restaurant nevertheless rises above the pack with an assortment of dishes which will educate and satiate you - sometimes in the same bite!

Begin with an order of the North Korean favorite Kimchi Wangmandu - large pillowy dumplings stuffed with spicy, fizzy fermented cabbage. The seafood fans among you will find the sultry, slithery oyster pancakes called Gul-jeon to be another good choice. But then, the tables do have those little grills for a reason, so why not follow your starter with one of their many barbecued items, like short ribs, squid or even beef tongue? You control the meat, you control the heat - hmm, maybe that should be their slogan. But hey, I'm getting a bit ahead of myself. Don't forget that each main course comes with a metal bowl of steamed rice and an array of the ever-changing side dishes called Banchan - which ones will be waiting for you on your next visit? There's only one way to find out...

If the idea of doing your own cooking just isn't appealing, never fear - there are a number of other options to be had. The fish selection alone includes monkfish, cod, croaker, and a couple types of mackerel, so you're sure to find one that will push all the right buttons. Then again, you can't go wrong with the spicy soft tofu stew (Soondubu Jjigae), especially since it comes in four different levels of spiciness. Alternatively, you could try one of their casseroles, like the one with beef tripe (Gopchang Jeongol) or the one with large chunks of ham loaf (Budae Jeongol or "army casserole" which was indeed created for American servicemen in South Korea during World War II). With this many possibilities, the only thing you can be sure of is that you'll never leave hungry after a visit to Silla.
Food was terrible and overpriced, the waitress then had the audacity to approach me outside of the restaurant parking lot and ask why I only left a 1 dollar tip. Nuff said
Went here yesterday with my parents to have galbee bbq. The food was good. We enjoyed. I was going to give a 4stars re-review. But at this time, they only deserve 2 stars. So disappointed.
First time here and everything was really good. We waited for quite a while but Iguess it was worth it. I would come back here again :)
Silla is one of my favorite Korean restaurants in Colorado. You don't eat bbq here their more known for soups and cold noodle.
Silla is pretty nice. The food is good and the service is quick. The Galbitang (Beef Short Rib Soup) is fantastic!

The food is almost superb.  Loved the candied sweet potatoes and the bancha.  The service could have been better.  I wasn't sure if the staff didn't speak English and maybe that's why they weren't overly friendly or if they just weren't overly friendly.  The kimchee jeon is super yummy.  Light and crispy with just the right amount of kimchee.  We didn't try the Korean BBQ we'll come back for that.
This small hidden gem is amazing! You wouldn't know it's there unless it was referred or a friend took you. The service is great the food is awesome and the price is right!

Let me preface that we have been to Silla many times prior, but I need to express our disappointment in the service we encountered last Sunday evening. Silla is typically a great Korean restaurant; great ambiance, service and exceptional Korean food. We quickly realized as we entered the restaurant that it was very busy, probably unusually busy for a Sunday evening. Every table was booked and the host/waitstaff were flying all over the restaurant trying to manage the chaos. 
Seating took a while and we quickly realized we were being ignored by the entire wait staff. Menu's were not presented to us until about 15 minutes after we were seated. We wouldn't have had an issue if the staff informed there would be a 20-30 minute wait so that they can manage all the busy tables rather than trying to sit every single person that came through the door. Rather than that, we were rushed the entire time. 
Once we got our menus, we were pressured to make decisions on our dinner choices. The young waiter tried to snatch our menu's away and we were not finished ordering. All of us could tell he was very stressed and agitated. I even made a point to ask him if he was feeling okay. 
We remained patient despite all of this up until waiting for an additional 40 minutes with no response from the wait staff. Every time we pushed the "waiter button" at our table, we realized table 2 was ignored on the screen and even deleted. 
It's a shame that a restaurant we have come to love over the years provided unprofessional and dismal service. It may have been a bad day for them, and we hope that they can work that out with hiring more staff or even managing the tables.  We left after waiting for 45 minutes with no food and drinks. 
We anticipate coming back in the very near future, your kimchi ji gaes and bibimbaps are delicious.

What can I say?  Silla has become my Korean BBQ place. Love going there - the staff is awesome and the food is great. Unlike other BBQs in town I can drop by on a Saturday and get a table no problem, no wait. Recommend Silla when you want Korean BBQ!

Went there with my family for my birthday. The food was not bad. We ordered BBQ ribeye and duck and they tasted good. But what really disappointed us was the service. Only 3 people waiting tables on Friday night. Food was late and we waited a long time to get extra napkin and chopsticks. There was a   chubby waitress who was very rude. Took away my sister's chair without asking!

I've been going to Silla since I was a little girl with my family and now as an adult, I still have very fond memories of Silla. First thing is first, the interior design has always just been TERRIBLE. It is not cute or quaint or attractive in anyway. It's just terrible. Anywayyyyyy ahha back to the good stuff. 

Silla honestly is getting 3 stars from me mainly because of their awesome lunch deals, meaning they have a good deal on their soup during lunch and I am such a soup girl. Their soups are always fantastic, I love the Yukgaejang and any of the Soondubus. Their Mool Naengmyeon is still on point. 

But other than that, there is nothing too spectacular that it has to offer. The side dishes are not as good as they used to be and I don't really go there to eat KBBQ anymore. It's overpriced for KBBQ in my opinion and the quality is about the same at other restaurants. But like I stated earlier, their soup is enough to always bring me back, especially for lunch when it is on the cheaper end!

I'd say it's a shame this place was so tucked away, but that really doesn't seem to stop them from getting all kinds of business. 

It was packed when we went with a group of seven that had to be divided into two tables of four and three (the large tables were newly occupied), and we suffered from the same slow service that so many other reviews report. Part of it can be attributed to slow staff, but a bigger part just seems to be they're understaffed. Saturday night around 7pm, and there couldn't have been more than three different people working up front for a full restaurant. They wandered to whatever job needed to be done, which you would think would speed things up, but nope. Need a host? Sorry, he's cleaning a table. Waiting on your check? No dice, he's cutting meat at another table. They'll get to you eventually, but whether or not you're high on the priority list is luck of the draw.

So why the four stars? Well, the food is damn good. We ordered bulgogi, kalbi, and soondofu, but before any of that came out we dug in deep on the side dishes. They didn't skimp on any of the servings and everything was excellent, though I will say I was disappointed they didn't have the little sweet fish I was accustomed to getting at Seoul and other KBBQ joints.

The seafood soondofu was tasty and plentiful. I wish I had remembered to put my egg in earlier before the soup cooled down too much to cook it, but thankfully I'm not squeamish about eating it raw. All the meat was fresh and without too much fat. I only wish there had been more.

It was a bit on the pricey side, but I've been spoiled by cheaper establishments. 

Just a few quick sidenotes for those who may not be acquainted with the Korean style: 

1. To get service, push the button on your table. They might take pity on you and visit even if you don't push it, but you'll be exacerbating an already long wait.

2. Don't be afraid to walk up to the counter with your check. They'll generally come to your table at Silla, but, again, you won't be doing yourself any favors if you're in a hurry.

3. Don't be afraid to ask for refills on the side dishes. They're free and awesome, and included in your BBQ bill.

4. Don't plan on going here if you're looking to hit up a bar or club afterwards. The smoke gets "all up ins" your clothes and hair, and you will smell like a walking bulgogi. If You're looking for chicks/dudes who dig that kind of thing, go nuts. Otherwise, plan accordingly.

In my opinion this is the best-kept secret in Aurora and Denver, except maybe it's not such a secret anymore.
