This is a small local Korean BBQ place, and the BBQ here is the best and most authentic I've had anywhere. They have individual Korean BBQ grill stoves at each table, and you can grill your own food. They also bring out a bunch of Korean appetizers to accompany each meal, and at the end bring you a cold rice dessert drink, which is really good. My favorite BBQ dish here is the pork bulgogi, I also like the marinated duck.

Rating on the Bibimbop
No flavor, cold, and barely any meat. First place to make this style. Other restaurants, have made it much better. But my rating is primarily on this dish as they do have nice service.

Nice little place near Peoria & Parker. I've never had Korean BBQ before so it was a little confusing for me. The staff here are really nice and try to help as best they can. 
We ordered marinated short ribs BBQ style & they bring piles of fresh lettuce and all sorts of sweet & savory accompaniments. We also ordered fried dumplings and bimbibob. Our fave was the dumplings. I would definitely go back - bring a small group & just enjoy a leisurely social dinner here..

I liked the food ... True korean food 
Service 3 stars!
I ll totally recommend it and I m coming back whenever I can.

They were on the local news for having rat feces and roaches
Last time we went like 3 months ago, no one was there for lunch and no one 
Came to greet us, it was real weird.

Service was good. We were seated very quickly. We ordered a fish stew (can't remember what fish) and it tasted like they put 2 huge scoops of MSG in there and all of the banchans tasted like that too. Won't be going back.

Newly remodeled, Silla offers $6.95 lunches. Love love love the bulgogi here, my bento box meal came with the rice, meat, some vermicelli noodles, vegetables, an orange, soup, and a few side dishes to accompany my palate. The mister of mine ordered the spicy chicken, which was quite delicious as well. 

Unfortunately, I haven't budgeted myself to allow myself to dine here during the dinner hours, so I can't quite comment on all of the dishes. The service was expected because they were quite overwhelmed with the lunch hour rush, so they were not as attentive to certain customers' needs. For a quick Korean fix, I'd recommend you try this...

This place has kick-a.s.s. Soondubu or Soon Tofu...  I think the Koreans actually pronounce it like the first word.  

I have had Soon Tofu at many places and this one is the best in Denver so far because it has the most selections I've seen, not only can you get pork, you can also get beef, combination, seafood, oysters.  You can pick your spiciness too, which I love.  Hey, after all, the only thing I can read outside were the word Tofu, that should tell you that they're known for their tofu soup.  ;)

They add an egg at the table so you get an almost poached egg in your tofu soup.  I don't like my egg too runny so I would scoop up tofu to cover the whole egg and let it sit in the bubbling soup to get cooked more.  The side dishes are always delicious and I think the Soon Tofu is definitely worth the lunch price of $6.95.  

Also ordered the kalbi the first time I came here thanks to other Yelpers.  It was one of the best kalbi I've had.  Very tender and juicy, but also very expensive at $25 for 1 order.  I feel it might be worth it to just go to an all-you-can-eat Korean place because I pay that much a person and I can eat all the kalbi in the world I want.  I must say the quality of the meat is really good though.  

All in all I'm a fan of their Soon Tofu and also their kalbi.  I would only really recommend paying $7 for the soup rather than $9, which is the dinner price.  It's the same exact thing. 

Can't wait to come back and try something else, but their Soon Tofu is just so fantastic!  Yummy broth!

Looks like a dive in a strip mall, but dont be fooled!  The food is amazing!  And I'm super picky about my Korean food.  Excellent service.   The waitress's English wasn't very good, but she went to great lengths to make sure we were happy!  Worth our drive out from Littleton

The service is pretty terrible. I would not even recommend this place to frienemies. 

We could've ate our meal and walked out the door without paying the bill and without being noticed..
 that is how much they pay attention to you. Zero.

I lived in South Korea for 1 year and ate "korean BBQ" almost weekly. This is one of the most authentic Korean restaurants I've eaten at! From the buttons on the table to call for service, to the menu offerings, to the rice drink after dinner, to the banchan...it was all fantastic. If you are concerned about the service, just locate the button to call a server on your table. It makes things a lot easier. 

The only disappointment was the sam-guyp-sal (bacon). We did not enjoy it at all. It was flavorless and like cardboard. All the other meat was out-of-this world, though.

Can't believe I haven't written a review for Silla yet.  I've been coming here for years upon years, and it's still the most reliable Korean place in town.  They do their meats very well, both Kalbi and Bulgogi and pork.  You can grill yourself at your table but I like it cooked in the back.   The nengmyun is a great spicy cold noodle dish during the summer; and their bibimbop is legit.  During the winter, nothing beats a tofu jigae, a molten spicy soup overflowing with kimchi, meats, and tofu.   Special mention has to be made of their bento box for weekday lunches.  They come out with a huge meal--your choice of grilled meats, rice, chapchae noodles, a bowl of beef broth, vegetables, and then half a dozen banchan small pickle dishes to sample--all for under $7.    That's by far the best lunch deal in town.

The service is OK; some of the wait staff are extremely nice motherly women; some are a bit curt, especially with the non-Koreans.  The owner is usually there, and he keeps service brisk and efficient even when they're busy.   The decor is modern; they just did an interior remodeling which leaves you feeling like you're in a Beverly Hills heiress's horse stable.  (Go, you'll see what I mean.)

Another MAJOR Success dining out with a big group.  Made a reservation for FRIDAY February 18th 2011 for a PARTY of 15 .  The restaurant provide us the 2 rooms their ONLY BIGGEST rooms in the establishment.

Half of my friends opt to BBQ their own food, while half of my other friends opt for the kitchen to cook their food.

This time around,  I opt for 1 appetizer of Fried Oyster Pancake, 2 main entrees; 1 order of Galbi and a order of Spicy Sauteed Squid.

I like all the food that I ordered, though I so wish there could be more of them especially the Oyster Pancake.  The Squid though NOT as SPICY as I want to, was A-OK.  I think to make the Sauteed Squid better, if only they put more spice, vegetables and more Squid for that entree.

The only downside about SILLA is the service.  Though they tried to accommodate to all our needs, I do hope they can provide more waitstaffs in the future for big groups.  So the other patrons would not wait for a slightly longer time for the food or their beverages or water to be filled up etc etc.

All in all, my friends and I have a good time feasting away our Korean food.  Above anything else, I still dont mind returning when needed to SILLA.  Thank you SILLA.

So after church i came here for a late lunch, to my suprise this place was actually pretty busy around 3pm.  

First thing i learned when ordering is that lunch specials are not served on the weekends, so its pretty much regular menu items only.
I ordered the bimbimbop and the bin tae tuk.  I was a dissapointed with the bin tae tuk because i felt that they dont  use enough mung bean and substituted a lot of pancake mix.  It was also a little greasy.  The sauce for the dish was good but overall not too impressed with this dish.  The bimbimbop was ok but really how can you mess up bimbimbop, its just rice and a bunch of vegetables.  
The banchan was ok but the variety was not as extensive as seoul bbq, also some of the dishes like the fish cake and seaweed had too much oil on them.  

Dishes here typically average $10 bucks, in my opinion seoul bbq was better.

In the all-expensive San Diego we have a place that does all you can eat--yes, all you can eat--high quality Korean BBQ for two different prices ($20 and $25 per person depending on if you want to spring for the seafood/ribeye option included). None of the Korean places I've found in Denver or surrounding areas do this so from what I can tell, the best you can do is go for a "Combination" A, B, C, D etc. for somewhere between $40-$120 depending on how many people it serves.

That said, this place is genuine. It can be hard to decide what to order for two of you if you are trying to get nice bang for your buck but I recommend one of the smaller combinations. A la carte BBQ items can be expensive (though I imagine the portions are plentiful). Sides are great as well and I'll definitely go back.

Not a lot of English spoken in the restaurant so read up on some Korean dishes if you're new to this kind of thing.

2012 Review #174:
After I had to go to Aurora for the 2nd time in 3 days (and my 4th time there, ever), I once again thought I'd better get some good food out of it. This time it was at Silla. Now, I am no stranger to Korean food. However, I normally eat it in social settings; taekwondo potlucks, gatherings in a Korean household, etc. I'm not as used to going to a restaurant and reading from a menu, but oh well, it was worth a shot. 

I came here in the lunch rush and was pretty much ignored by the patriarch except for him to mutter "hana" (one) to one of the waitresses. I should point out here that I know just enough Korean to be very polite, and count to 20. I also know that I was the only white person in this restaurant, and I was the only person that wasn't greeted upon my entrance, or my exit. Every other person was greeted by every single employee. Just thought it was a little odd- most Japanese restaurants, for example, have people practically screaming "irasshaimase!" at you ever 30 seconds. 

I decided to go with the daelgi bulgogi (grilled, marinated pork) that comes much like a bento box with rice, pickled bean sprouts and broccoli, and chop chae (glass noodles). In addition, this lunch special comes with some simple soup, and plentiful banchan (sides) of pickled/preserved: radish, green bean, eggplant, cucumber, and of course kimchi. This is a lot of food for one person, and even better when the lunch special costs $6.50. Most importantly, to me, my pork was excellent. A bit spicy, very little fat or cartilage, and very well seasoned.  I really enjoyed the banchan because I really had no idea what went into most of them and just had to go with it and try them out. It also kept me eating lots of different vegetables and flavors, as opposed to just eating my mound of white rice because it was there. 

Service, if you are not Korean, is OK at best. I had water and then was given a refill of "water" except this water was brown. Everyone else was drinking it so I just jumped off the cliff and went with it. It actually was quite good, but thinking it was water was a little unnerving. I had to try to get my check 2-3 times but once the message got across it was fast. There wasn't any language barrier with any of the servers at my table, so it just seemed like a weird miscommunication. My meal ended with sikhye (sweetened rice "juice") which was really refreshing and was just sweet enough to satisfy me at the end of the meal. There's a ton of Korean food in this area, but if I wanted a reliable, quick, and very affordable lunch option, I'd definitely come back.
Fantastic Korean food!!! Although my mother in laws is better ;) I always have a great experience at Silla!!

Food is great here! I'm Korean and the side dishes and entrees are very good! I use to go to Seoul BBQ but this place is far better. One plus is that they don't charge for extra rice like Seoul BBQ does! As far as the service goes, sometimes it's great sometimes it's not, so it's a hit or miss. Ambience is pretty chill, nothing super fancy. I feel like they should expand! Pretty small space for the amount of customers they get. Definitely recommend if you like Korean BBQ!

Nice place for Korean BBQ.  I'd only had Korean BBQ once before and it was very comparable.  Love all the side dishes and being able to wrap them up in lettuce leaves with tasty freshly cooked, right at the table little pieces of meat just makes me happy all over.  I originally ordered the wrong thing and when our server brought out two giant steaks I knew I'd made a mistake.  All was quickly remedied when I explained to him what it was that I did want.  The staff was quick to please, the food delicious and the atmosphere at bit dumpy.  Will go back for sure.

The wait is bearable...however! Their service needs work! We were only checked on once! The food was meh~ naeng-myun was good but we also ordered ton-katsu and that dish came out burnt and covered with sauce. Once we finished we went up to the counter to pay for the bill the server just sat there counting her tips in front of us, she sat there counting her cash for 5 min.

 This place is trashed with horrible wait staff!
Girls night out! Just finished a very fulfilling Korean bbq dinner. My mom's Korean and this is her favorite place to bring friends for an authentic meal.

I honestly don't have a lot of experience dining in Korean restaurants, but I certainly enjoyed the food here. My boyfriend knew of this place, and am very glad he took me here and broadened my horizons. 

They had remodeled the place since the last time he was there...apparently more of a contemporary look now. Okay, back to the food. If I was rating just the food, I would give them 4 stars. We had the "hangover" soup (sorry I don't remember the Korean name right now). it was a huge bowl that came with lots of fun dishes of assorted sides....kimchee, fish cake, black beans, etc. The soup was a little spicy for me since I am a bit of a wimp in this area...but I still liked it quite a bit...it was a good spicy...and look forward to getting it again!

So why the 3 stars. During this visit the service was not as good as it must have been in the past, it was a bit cold temperature-wise, and their remodeling effort added a 'cold" feel to the place versus a 'warm' bubbly place.  

I hope to continue going back to see if the service and overall experience improves, so please don't let the 3 stars rating of my single experience deter you from going. Do check it out yourself 'cause I know you will enjoy the food! It was very good. :)

Dec 2012: I recently went back for a second time. Their Bibenbob (sp?) Was excellent. I will even attempt to post a picure of it.

This is my go-to place for Korean cold noodles, which is the best in town. But other than that, everything else is pretty mediocre to me. The side dishes aren't as good as the other Korean places around town.
Very bad service, don't feel welcome there at all. Food were late. Potion size were small. Don't let the picture fool u. Don't recommend at all. Soul BBQ or Korean house are way better.

This place is delicious! I've been coming for years (somehow forgot to write a review for it earlier). I like how they redecorated. The food is so great. I usually only get lunch here as I'm not in the area for dinner, but this place is awesome!

UPDATE:

The restaurant has come under new management. Thankfully the food quality has not changed! The interior has not changed much either. The only noticeable difference is that the service has definitely gotten better. The staff speaks more english and is more attentive to their tables.

The food is really yummy and the prices are pretty good too. I've been here three times and the first two times were great, but the third, not so much. The last time I went the service wasn't that good and neither was the food. I'm only giving it 4 stars instead of 3  because I had a really good experience the first two times.

WORSE PLACE EVER, 
Meat and seafood in all dishes smelled to the point UNEATABLE, can't believe they serve nasty old meat to customers,   WORSE KOREAN food I ever had.  
Waitress apologized and gave me $1 discount on my meat dish I could not eat due to old meat smell. 
The nasty way they cook their food reflect s on their nasty we don't care service ! 
Just eat the food and pay , we don't care if our meat smells, others shut up and eat ... 
This place should not serve food, public health concern serving old meat & seafood, 
You got to have pretty strong stomach to take their nasty food, YUCK ! 
I should've known better when I saw their empty parking lot on the weekend, I was their only customer on Sunday night... Terrible,  horrible,  disgusting Food I ever put in my mouth !

I went to Silla for dinner with the family for a nice New Years eve dinner. I've been to Silla plenty of times and this place is actually one of my favorite places to go to.  When we came into the restaurant, the atmosphere was pretty nice but the room was pretty cold so it was pretty uncomfortable at first. We were seated right away. Our waiter was pretty and attentive. Every time we pressed the button he came pretty fast.

So let's get to the food. SO I love Korean food! One of my favorite types of food! So for someone to ruin that experience for me will make me very pissed and so angry! Anyways, we ordered the beef tongue, karubi, and the yukejan. The meat came pretty fast and the side dishes were came with our meal. They weren't the best looking side dishes but they were pretty delicious and we got extra side dishes that we liked without charge.  The beef tongue was delicious and I wrapped them in lettuce and miso. DELICIOUS! The karubi was juicy, nicely cut, and the marinade wasn't too sweet, so I liked that :). The yukejan was very spicy and warmed me up pretty quickly. They gave us a lot of yukejan so that was nice :) 

Overall good experience! I will come again :)!

Went for lunch today. Ordered the lunch combo with nang myun and kalbi ($9.95). Best nang myun I've had in a while. Kalbi was good too. Came with three small side dishes (kimchee, pickled radish and seasoned bean sprouts). The sweet rice water was a nice way to finish the meal. Seafood soon dubu (tofu) is also legit. 

Overall, tasty korean food close to home but still not as good as Mom's cooking :)

It turns out, not all of my co-workers consider Olive Garden "ethnic" food.  Who knew?

I was in a meeting with two other co-workers just prior to making the decision to go out for lunch.  One knows Korean food very well as she grew up with it and kept talking about the "spicy Korean soup" she gets at P & Y.  Less than 15 mintues later the three of us were en route to Aurora....and P & Y was closed.  So we headed to Silla.

When I saw the words "Tofu Tofu Tofu" on their window outside, I knew they'd have something for me.

I went for the mushroom tofu soon which was on their lunch special list.  Our meals came with various sides for sharing (eggplant, zucchini, broccoli, kimchee, wakame.....and I can't remember them all) as well as a scoop of rice.

Having absolutely no experience with Korean food outside of kimchee and the H Mart, I was a bit befuddled as to what to do when my boiling hot bowl of soup came out.  I followed my co-workers direction and cracked the accompanying raw egg into it and waited for it to cook.  Once the egg got to a desired thickness and it cooled off just enough, I dug in.  The stew itself was laden with a very generous amount of silken tofu, lots of juicy shitake mushrooms, and the perfect amount of heat (I ordered mine extra spicy).

The meal was topped off with a cup of sweet rice juice (this is what co-worker called it...who knew you could juice rice).

Our server was very sweet but they got a bit backed up when it was time to pay.

Definitely one of the better meals I've had during the work lunch hour and cheap too!  $22 for three of us and we got to taste tons of different things.  So glad to learn I have some co-workers who know what's up.

Great Korean restaurant here with good food and prices!
the bibimbap is great but I am unable to compare it as I've only had it here twice now.
I do enjoy all the little dishes that come with your entree's to sample different Korean apettizers. I agree with one review that weekend does not have lunch menu so going in alone is a bit much when you have to order a full dinner size entree for yourself. But, there are worse things than leftovers!
The staff could be a bit more on the helpful side with ordering and answering questions for us that are not fully knowledgable of Korean cuisine.

I ate here 9/1/13  and here is my experience.

My dining partner and I decided Korean would be the best meal to satiate us after our rafting trip.

The food was good and did hit the spot, however the price and service left a lot  to be desired. When we arrived, we had to wait to be seated for about 7-10 minutes, no biggie. Once seated, we were told that we had to move to accommodate a party of 4 since the booth was bigger; FYI, just about all the booths in this establishment are the same size! We move to the different table and what do you know, the booth is the same size as the one we were seated initially. My take, the server did not want to serve us because WE were the most diverse customers in there aside from the dominant Korean clientele in there.

We, or shall I say my dining partner was checked on during our dinner only once. No refill on water and we weren't even asked about a drink order from the start. $27.95 for galbi aka kalbi, $18.95 for bulgogi....ridiculous! 

We weren't even offered the complimentary tea,we saw others get, after their meal.

Bottom line, if you don't go with a Korean associate or are not Korean yourself don't expect service with a smile or any service at all!

Every year we celebrate my sister's arrival day from Korea.  Long ago, we started with Seoul Food on Washington (now closed).  Then we went to Korean Heritage Camp (food cooked by Korean mothers & grandmothers) and could never go back to the Americanized version of Korean food.

We've spent the last 10 years on and off at Silla.  It's always good and reliable.  I don't think we've ever ordered something that was not good.  There's been better in Denver but nobody seems to last longer.

But get your gumandu fix off of Havannah and Jewell.

Friends and I came to Silla for Korean bbq.  There are big booths and tables that can comfortably fit parties of 4-6.  We tried sirloin, marinated pork and marinated duck, and each meat was flavorful and tender.  The portions are large.  Our waitress was attentive and helpful, and the rice drink at the end of the meal was tasty.  I'd like to go back to sample more of the menu.

Service includes setting dishes and picking them up, that's about it, no real complaints though, kind of expected. The food is average, boolgogi wasnt amazing and the soon tobu wasn't anything special. There were plenty of side dishes and the price was fair so if you are looking for any sort of meal this place will get the job done. But I wouldn't want this place to be your first or representative experience of a quality Korean cuisine experience. Hence the average score.

Went with the boyfriend's family, and all of our entrees were huge, hot, and delicious.  We even ordered a beer, and because their fridge was broken, they didn't have their full selection, so the owner went out to buy the beer he asked for.
Awesome place, good service, and nice atmosphere.

So amazigly good. We had the tongue, duck and octopus. Everything we had was delicious. The staff was super friendly and patient. Everything was clean and bright. Highly recommend this to anyone who likes Korean Bbq!

Trust me on this favorite Asian cuisine-- I am indeed Korean. Although many people might argue that fact. I'm more "American" than Korean, but 1) I grew up with  home cooked Korean food and 2) I've tasted the finest Korean food in the one and only City of Angels.

To first put things into perspective, on a scale of 1-10 (1 being scarce), the Denver/outskirts area is a 3 on the abundance of available Korean food/restaurants. With that said, one can only compare within that caliber.

I'm also a little biased when it comes to service because my friend's friend works here and she's a doll. 

But, first thing's first. I came here twice for the same thing: nengmyun noodles. They try to imitate LA's nengmyun and it's pretty accurate. Not too sweet. 
If you come for lunch, the special is nengmyun and kalbi or dumplings (less than $10). I got kalbi (duh) and it was delish. It's a great Korean combination, those two. 

At the end of your meal, they always serve the rice drink (sheekkae) which is made to PERFECTION. I love it and ends the meal right.

Can't say much about their other menu items but if it's summertime and you want something cold, come here for nengmyun and kalbi :)

*warning: I finished everything (except for the soup) and I literally was in so much pain because I was so full. SO. FULL. Becareful.

I loooveeee Korean food.
Silla delivers.  I feel like their flavors are so...home-like, authentic, rich, tasty, I could go on and on...

The only other Korean restaurant I've been to is Seoul BBQ on Havana (I think Havana).  I thought they had delicious food, but after going to Silla, I feel that it does not compare.

I've noticed that a lot of Asian restaurants have toned down the intense, "Asian" flavors for the general populations' palate.  I admit that our flavors are often strong, intense and spicy, but that's what makes Asian food so good!  It's gotten to the point where I find some of what I thought were the best restaurants, bland.  Silla is definitely NOT in this category.  

Everything we had was so flavorful and delicious.  

I recommend: (I don't remember any names so I'll do my best to describe them)

Stir fried potato starch noodles with cabbage and mushrooms (No words can describe my love for this dish).. chap jae? 
Spicy tofu soup (So goooddd!)
Galbi- the best ever!

Go hungry, that way you'll want to try everything and you'll be uber satisfied with everything.  Haha!  :D

I am a big fan of Korean food. There's no better place to start off my reviews of Korean restaurants series than with Silla - it's been around forever. Unlike most of my Korean friends, I only get to eat Korean food if we go out to eat, but let me just say that there is nothing as good as a home-cooked Korean meal. Unfortunately, the only way I will get that on a regular basis is to get adopted into a Korean family or find myself a Korean wife - from my experience, the former is more likely to happen for us non-Korean guys... Never mind that though, on to Silla!

I believe this was actually the first Korean restaurant I went to. It was pretty good the first time from what I remember, but it gave me a strange initial impression of Korean food - spicy and lots of vegetables. I didn't really care for the stuff much in the beginning since I was raise up on an very carnivorous diet. I was extremely elated when our servings of Korean BBQ came out. It was kalbi-riffic! Since then, Korean BBQ has always held a strong place in my heart.

So why 3 stars you ask? Everything else I've had there over my many visits has been alright - yes, just alright. As I started becoming more of a Korean food fanboy, I discovered other places that are much better. Since Silla has had multiple owners over the years, I've noticed it to be a little inconsistent. My most recent visit was a little bit of an upset. We were seated, but it took a while before we got served. When I got my kimchi jjigae, I was so excited only to find a very pitiful serving of meat inside. Although Korean food has taught me to love my veggies, I was very disappointed. Would I go back? Possible, but unlikely. Stay hungry my friends!

The food is getting worst now. I went for the lunch special and there so less sides. The soup taste so plain like not seasoning or taste just like they just put hot water in it. There were barely any meat. They use crappy chopstick. One more thing is they raise the price now.

Went here for lunch while on a business trip based on the previous reviews here on Yelp and that it was close to my hotel. As someone else mentioned, their lunch special is a very good deal. I had the Daeji Bulgogi which is a spicy pork meat. The lunch came with soup, rice, bean sprouts, and I think some noodles that are called Chap Che. Of course there are four types of Kimchee. Everything was really good. The service wasn't the fastest, but the place was rather full. The biggest drawback was that there isn't a lot of room in the booths because the tables have a grill underneath so my legs were really cramped. This is really just a minor detail, but if you have long legs, be aware. Overall, great food, and I would be back for lunch. Not sure about dinner, as the prices on the menu seemed expensive, maybe you get more then.

We had planned to eat at Korea House yesterday afternoon but it was closed.  Their loss was Silla's gain.  I had looked up reviews for Silla and wanted to try it anyway.  Were we glad we went there.  Yummy!!  This will be my new "go to" place for Korean food.  

We ordered the seafood pancake because my friend has not been to Korean before.  I wanted him to try it.  It was perfectly cooked, crispy and not the slightest bit greasy.  My only complaint about it was the octopus (or squid/not sure which it was) was way too chewy.  They either need to leave it out or make sure it doesn't get cooked more than 1 minute, max.    We took half of it home for today.

We also ordered the kimchee soup w/pork and a beef soup with veggies and egg.  The flavors of both were just divine.  And the many sides were also quite tasty.  

I only have 3 criticisms of the place, which is what kept me from giving them 5 stars:

1. They don't serve the sides unless you order certain items.  Every other Korean place I've eaten at in NYC and the Korea House bring the sides out to everyone when they sit down.  I think they should do this.
2. Our waitresses were lacking in their English which created a bit of a language barrier.  We ordered 2 waters and 1 hot tea.  They brought out 0 water and 2 hot teas.  Then when we asked for water one of the waitresses filled the tea glass with water.  3. They didn't clear our plates at the end of the meal, which is a big deal for me.  No one wants dirty plates all over the table when they're finished.

I love this place.  We travel a good 40 minutes to get there.  My boyfrined was stationed in Korea, and he introduced me to this restaurant.  A week ago we took my Mom, Dad, and daughter and we had a wonderful meal.  I must say that the best deal is to go during the week for lunch, much more reasonable; same food.  My favorites are probably the Kimchee soup (I'm sure I'm spelling it wrong:  Kimchee Chigea--something like that) and good old Golbi.  Yum.

First visit for lunch. Nice, clean decor. Not a big place and it filled up quickly with the lunch crowd. Since the majority of customers were Korean, I knew that the food must be fairly authentic. I ordered the miso soup and my friend ordered the pork bulgogi. The side dishes were plentiful and delicious. My soup was quite good although I thought they had overdone it a bit on adding potatoes. The soup also had tofu and zucchini and dried anchovies.. My friend loved the pork that was served with rice and chop chay noodles. We were quite pleased and decided to return some time soon to try the dinner menu. The awful tinny radio playing through the speakers was annoying and unnecessary. Service was swift and the price was shockingly cheap in that we both ordered beers.  It was a good experience and worth the drive from central Denver.

I took my family to this Korean restaurant on a Saturday for my wife's birthday. The first thing I learned was they don't serve lunch on the week-ends. Lunch dishes are typically around $10 bucks and diner dishes are around $20 bucks. My youngest daughter and I had the bulgogi, my oldest daughter had the BBQ chicken and my wife had the miso soup. I found the food to be very good. I have eaten in many other Korean restaurants and I would say Silla would be among my top 5. The staff was busy but found the time to check on us. There didn't seem to be assigned tables because different staff members checked on us almost every time. Overall, I found this establishment to be one of the better Korean restaurants in this area. I would definitely go again!
Taste good and price ok!

I judge the authenticity of a restaurant by its number of monolingual servers.  For Silla, there were no English servers that they asked a random Korean teenager to wait our table...  Having had superb Korean food in California and from Korean friends' homes, I must say that Silla's food is mediocre comparably.  That being said, it is one of the better Korean restaurants in the area.  The BBQ items are your best bet: bulgogi, kalbi, and daeji bulgogi.  The bibimbap and soon tofu can satisfy a strong craving, but nothing to wow over.  They do give you a ton of side dishes with your meal, so whatever you order, you will leave with a full stomach.

When I have Korean food, I can't help but be reminded of the scene from Along Came Polly, when Jennifer Aniston introduces bulgogi to Ben Stiller, who ended up with an irritable bowel syndrome flare-up.  No worries, Silla would not give you any irritable bowels, inflammatory bowels, or any other form of bowels.

1 star off: no free brown rice tea
1 star off: had no idea what the drinks menu said, it was all in Korean
1 star extra: so authentic that they had to pull a random teenager to wait our table, maybe they can get her to translate the drinks menu too

One of the better Korean BBQ places in town. The service is pretty good but the food is great. As always, you get complimentary side dishes in the beginning and they are plentiful. The main course for me is Bibimbob and it is flavorful and delicious. At the end, they give you complementary rice dessert drinks as well. Cheers!

I've been coming to Silla's for quite awhile now, and I have to say the quality of the food and the service has gone down hill.  I had as rice plate with bulgogi, egg, a mixture of vegetables with some barley tea.  I really was disappointed on a cold night like this one, that the tea wasn't HOT!  Not only was my food mediocre, but it really lacked flavor. 

As for the service, we've experience so much better there.  The ladies were attentive, but they weren't very nice.  I had to use the little doorbell buzzer thing a few times.  Maybe it was just a bad night, I hope next time it will be better.
Excellent food and great service. Don't know why this place isn't rated better! We had the duck was delish. We will return many times!

Korean food in Denver?  This is the place go!
BBQ is awesome! Try the stews. They have different kinds and they're all pretty damn good. =)

I haven't had much Korean BBQ in my life but the food and service at this place was super! We ordered a combo ($70-ish) for 4 people and left absolutely stuffed full of bulgogi goodness. Marinades on the meats were outstanding. We all took home leftovers as well. Plus I think it's kind of fun and entertaining that you get to cook the food yourself on the grill on the middle of the table -- keeps the men occupied that's for sure. I tried many many different sides of pickled items and enjoyed it all. All said and done, a wonderful meal. Downing a bottle of soju is a must! (not by yourself of course).

Having grown up eating Korean food almost everyday of my childhood, I crave home-cooked Korean food ALLLL the time. This is definitely my go-to place for authentic and delicious Korean food, whether it's BBQ or lesser known dishes, such as Seolleongtang (Ox Bone Soup). It's also a go-to place for several of my Korean friends. 

My partner and I eat here a minimum of 2-3 times a month. We've not once had a poor meal. 

The rating should be 4.5 for two critiques: 

First, they have a pretty wide menu and great offerings for group meals, but it's not quite as developed as I would like (No Dukboki?!?!? What?!?). 

Second, while the food is always good and the service friendly, they are less consistent on timing and quantity of banchan. If they get too busy, they may take a wee bit longer to visit your table and you don't always know how many different banchans you'll get (banchan=mini korean side dishes that arrive before the meal).  Ranges from 5-12. 

However, even with the critiques, Silla will always be my first recommendation and my favorite Korean restaurant in Denver. Yummy!

A dissapointing experience. The place is a bit pricey but for high quality korean food this would have been worth it, however it just wasn't that great. The food tasted good, not great, but not bad either, I have had worse. We had Tonkatsu and Galbi Dang and it was just ok. The service was non existent. Their were about 8 banchan and they were tiny, ok tasting. We ate them all and were never offered refills. Our water went empty and never got refilled. I had to grab one of the workers attention (who was cleaning the floor) to ask for more kimchee, a few more pieces came out. A tasty rice drink at the end put me up to 2 stars, but without that I might have given 1 star. FYI I am white american and so was my company so perhaps that influenced the service we were given, although I have no direct evidence to support that suspicion.

I took my wife here for her birthday last year and oh man the food was good! kalbi Beef was just awsome! Everything was fresh and crisp! The resturant was very clean.The service was just...WOW!!! 
I will be taking my wife here again this year cause she thought it was that good as well! 

Thanks for the great food and service!
They are ok.  BBQ meat dishes came out thinly sliced.  Looks good, but after cooked, there is almost nothing there.

My favorite Korean BBQUE!, There are a number of good Korean BBQUEs in Denver (are there any bad ones??....Hmmm...I think not!) but this one I always enjoy the most! The place is set in a snug and cozy spot in a strip mall in saudi aurora. The staff is serious and intent on getting what you need for a good Korean BBQUE experience. This place makes me smile!

This is likely the best Korean restaurant in the Denver area. If you come here, you have to order the BBQ items like kalbi, bulgogi, etc and then grill that shit yourself on their little round grills. Sure you'll end up smelling like bbq meats, but seriously, just picture what will happen when you go brag to your friends or try to impress some girl about your meal at Silla:

Dude: I had Korean last night at this place called Silla. Man, I had these banchans and kalo-bees and stuff. It was out of this world.

Dudette: I haven't had Korean that often, so I don't know much about it. But I know you can BBQ your meats at the table, so it must've been a blast.  How was the grilling? Did your hand get tired? (ha-ha)

Choice A: Dude: Nah, I didn't use the grill... (wrong answer!!!)
Choice B: Dude: Yeah, the grilling was tougher than it looked... (stop it!!!! you'll be exposed because you're lying!)

Don't let either Choice A or Choice B happen to you. Just grill it your own damn self. Please.

The food here is ok. Not the greatest. They have good lunch specials that's one good thing. The only problem i have here is the lack of servers. Honestly they need to train their servers with better attitudes. I come to eat happy and i leave here all pissed off because they usually don't know how to serve. Probably the rudest servers i've ever come across. Not as bad as Korea House but they coming in 2nd very close.

I'm not sure what's so special about this restaurant.  It seems a lot of Koreans go here but the food is just ok.  One way I like to determine how good a Korean restaurant is by inspecting their banchans (the side dishes they serve that help you eat rice).  Needless to say, their banchans need a serious OVERHAUL!!! Their banchans are low grade, at best.  Just yesterday we ordered Daegoo Mureejim (hot & spicy steamed cod fish head with vegetables).  You have to order this a good 45 minutes in advance because they have to soak the fish head; we ordered over an hour before pickup.  The dish was still somewhat undersoaked so some parts of the fish head were still dry.  Ok, so their side dish is so bad I'd love to say, "I don't wish to take your banchans so would you give me a discount on the food instead?"  How is it so bad, you ask?  Well...What Korean restaurant serves seasoned Italian parsley as banchan????  Italian parsley, reallllllllllly??????  This crosses the line for me!  Last I checked, this was NOT an Italian restaurant!  It's completely just a filler.  I don't even mind authentic Korean filler banchans /or cheap banchans but Italian parsley, really?????  My parents and I both don't understand why people keep going over there.  A couple of days prior, we had ordered ttug bog gi (spicy rice cake) and it was SOOOOOOO spicy with way too much red pepper paste (go chu jang) and red pepper flake that it became unflavorful, yet way too spicy.  Also, I think this is done only in Korean restaurants (at least at Silla) where all the banchans are served in aluminum foil wraps for take out.  They are so cheap that they can't even buy the small sauce containers with lids to put the banchans in!!!  Seriously, really???  This could seriously cause more food smell to travel outside of the package and spill if you are not careful.  On the positive side, I will say they do a pretty good Yu-Chun Chik Mool Nengmyun (cold buckwheat noodle dish in beef broth served with egg, cucumber, radish and sliced beef).  Silla, if you are reading this, PLEASEEEEEEEEEEEEE change up your banchans; get rid of the Italian parsley banchan and substitute it with actual Korean banchans, even if they are "not expensive" banchans!  Thank you!

This restaurant is why I avoid Korean food!  I remember when I was a kid this place was busy and delicious...  Boy does 16 years ruin a place. I was gonna treat my mom to jjangmyun since we were at hmart and p&y was close but she wanted their lunch special at silla...  Apparently they end specials at 2:00. Who does that?! We arrived 15 after but they're strict..  So my mom didn't order anything and ordered my galbi tang.. While waiting, they gave us below mediocre ban chan! Radish and regular kimchi was extremely sour!  Yes I'm half Korean and even my full Korean mom didn't like it.  The potato salad and the cucumbers were so so.. Deff no sae Jong kwon.  When my food arrives the soup was still boiling and for the rice, it was not so nice!  It was room temperature and dare I say frdgerated the microwaved...  The soup was far from special tasted like water so I had to put a ton of salt for some flavor.  Two star is strictly for the shikay

This is the best Korean BBQ place in Denver in my opinion.  There may be other restaurants that do better on individual dishes or ban chan (side dishes) but I think the BBQ here is the best.  If you're in the mood to party Korean style (aka 1. Gorge yourself on various meats that you grill yourself 2. Wash it down with bottles of soju 3. Go to the noraebang [karaoke] and sing embarrassing songs you would never admit to liking while sober) you can't really go wrong by starting at Silla.

As I said at the beginning, the BBQ is always good here.  For those who are unfamiliar with Korean food, the menu has pre-set meals that you can order.  These meals include various combinations of meats you can grill, soups, and various side dishes, entrees and appetizers.  Ordering the right one of these pre-set meals (depending on the size of your party, should be 4 or more) is usually the best way to get the most bang for your buck at Silla.  Oh and a little tip, if you don't like one of the items on the pre-set meal, you can usually substitute it for something else at no charge.

The meat is always really good here and they give you a lot of it.  Sam Gyup Sal (thick cut bacon), Galbi (marinated beef short ribs), Bulgogi and Ju Mool Luk (marinated beef) and spicy chicken are all on the menu and included in the aforementioned pre-set meals.  Maybe I'm biased because I'm Korean but I think there's something about grilling the meat yourself that makes it taste better than just having it someone cook for you.

The other thing Silla does really well is Naeng Myun.  Naeng Myun is a cold Korean noodle dish served during the summer and it's awesome at Silla.  It's a refreshing mix of a bunch of different flavors.  You have the sweet and spicy go chu jang (hot pepper paste), sweet and crisp pear slices, the pungent mustard and cool cucumber all mixed up in a cold broth with noodles and a hard boiled egg on top...  Mmm...  If you're a fan of Korean food but have never had Naeng Myun you owe it to yourself to try it here.  I don't traditionally like Naeng Myun, but this place made me a believer.

The other dishes are pretty standard Korean fare, the Soon Doo Boo (spicy soft tofu stew) is good and the Kimchi Jjigae is good.  Not exceptional but it will cure a hankering for Korean food any day.

Finally the service is not that bad for a Korean restaurant.  I have no problem saying that that the service at a lot of Korean restaurants really sucks (even when their guests are Korean!) but other than the minor annoyance of them not splitting up the bill for several credit cards, I can't really complain about Silla.

Overall, I give Silla 4 stars.  I've had better Korean BBQ at my Mom's house and also at other restaurants in LA so it doesn't quite get 5 stars.  Having said that I will say you'll have a tough time finding better Korean BBQ anywhere else in Denver.

WARNING!!!!!   DO NOT EAT HERE!!!  We tried this place about a year ago and I got sick.  I had not returned or pinpointed exactly how or where I got sick, but after the second time visiting this place just a few days ago, I got sick again, I will never return to this establishment.  I contacted the owner who acted as if he did not speak English and hung up on me once I announced that their food was tainted.  It has been concluded that I had sever food poisoning, either from their beef or recycled vegetables.  I wish all future patrons that did not read this in time the best of luck as you are playing Russian Roulette with their foods.

The customer base was mostly all Korean when I went; that's a ding-ding-ding in my book. I don't know how good the Denver area is for Korean food, but by NYC standards, it is pretty darn good. Lots of banchan came before we got our soondubu, fried mackerel, and naengmyun. Apparently the BBQ is good too.

Definitely the worst restaurant, not even the worst KOREAN restaurant, but the worst restaurant I have ever been to. The service was absolutely terrible. I came in with a group of around 8 people and we were all excited because we were celebrating a birthday. We ordered 2 different combinations of meat. The waiter didn't even rub butter/or any type of oil on the grill so when we grilled the chicken, the chicken came out burnt. We assumed that, like most Korean Bbq restaurants, they would grease the grill for us. Not only that, but they completely ignored our group. Normally waiters/waitresses check up to see how the food is and if there was anything else we needed, but not once did they check up on us. We always had to get their attention by sending someone to signal for them. Also halfway through our meal, we realized that they had not given us rice. When we asked for rice, they didn't deliver it until we were nearly finished with our meal. How hard is it to serve rice?? By far the worst service I have ever received and would not recommend to anyone even if the food there is decent.

We saw some good reviews on this place before we went to this place, but man oh man it was one of the worst mistakes ever. We have been to plenty of better korean restaurants than this one. The presentation was god awful, the service was terrible, there were bones in a side dish, a piece of ripped bag in a soup, etc... the quality if meat was disgusting.  Never coming here again.

My favorite Korean place in Denver!  It's an all around good Korean place.  Everything is really good, but the galbi (marinated short ribs) are the most popular!  When I'm missing Korean food from back in LA, this is my go to place.

This is a new place in the neighborhood, so I thought I'd check it out.  Came here today for some late breakfast.  Walking in, it is a welcoming layout where you line up to order your food and drinks, which they will deliver to your table later.  Interestingly they have a trinket sales section in their store, sort of like a mini-cracker barrel.  Mostly girl stuff but contemporary and interesting nonetheless :-) 

Ordered a coffee and a fruit tart.  The bottomless coffee is Lavazza and was excellent.  I would go back just for that.  The fruit tart was also very good.  They also have sandwiches and salads for lunch which I may try later.  The staff were all very friendly.  I would definitely recommend this place (just not when I want to go there, it is already getting crowded after two weeks)! Thank goodness they are here.  We have been needing something like this.

This place is good but over rated. Too expensive for what you actually get. First time I paid $9 for a chicken pesto sand which, only a sand which no side or drink. Was tasty but not worth $9 and I waited 15 min...


Went back for a large iced chi... Aka a small cup filled with ice and a shot of drink. Next time I'll go to Starbucks.

I'm not sure why this place has so many 5  reviews... They are slow ....
....as.....
..... Helllllllll....
The foods good, but not anything special & they skimp on meat & cheese on sandwiches... When you have 2 slices of inch thick bread, you need more than 2 slices of meat & a slice of cheese. And it took 15 minutes to get a bowl of soup, which they do not serve in the bread bowl (they're separate). 
The pastries? Pretty good... I was UBER STOKED when I saw the Napoleons, but they overturn their cream so it's borderline butter... Was still good. Also tried a cookie, decent, zucchini walnut bread = really good...

I went here tonight, and the service is awful. 

After waiting 20 minutes for a sandwich and pastries, I asked why it was taking so long. Turns out the to-go order was sitting out on the counter, and the girl just picked up the sandwich and put it in a to go box. Bare handed. With the hands that were handling the register and people cards and money. Nope nope nope.

We ordered 6 pastries. Instead of putting the pastries I *had already paid* for aside, they sold a couple to other people. They tried to offer me 2 'free' desserts to make up for it. Not in the I'd get 8 pastries total way, in the they would give me 2 different desserts to make up for the ones they sold from under me. That isn't free, that's the bare minimum of how to fix this, stop making it sound like you're doing me a huge favor when I'd be paying for 2 other desserts I didn't want in the first place.

Then when I asked to cancel the order and get a refund because I was just done at this point, the manager tried to convince me not to. I eventually got the refund and went on my way. Never going again, if I could they'd get a 0/5.

First time coming to a Kneaders after everyone told me to try it ! It was so busy but worth it ! The place is nice, clean? And has so many pastries !!!!! The staff was very friendly and encouraged me to sample the pumpkin muffin they had ! 

The portions are big and there is a wide variety of selection as well! They do cater and make bread baskets as well as sell regular kinds of bread and sweet loaves. The pastry case has anything from chocolate mousse, to bundt cakes, cupcakes and cakes ! As well as a wide variety of breakfast pastry. 

I got the oatmeal which came with brown sugar and then I could choose from one of three toppings so I did fresh berries ! 

It was overall with it and I will for sure return to try more !

Oh. My.  My new favorite place.  The food is fresh and hot.  The restaurant is clean and the employees very friendly.  The menu is short but full of delicious choices.  Watch out Panera ...there's a new kid in town

Well... All the hype.  Not impressed.  People super nice however.  

Kind of a smaller menu Panera... Been twice and the food is a little better I think.  Funny moment when I wanted a couple pastries and the pastry cabinet was a ways from the cash register so I was talking over the top of a line of people to order.  Then when I thought someone would just grab my scones and hand them to me... Like in a coffee shop.... They handed me a number like I had ordered sandwiches or something.  I waited almost ten minutes to get me scones.  Almost walked out.  I was thankful the scone was good :)  

Not a great set up, a bit confusing, not a bakery, not a cafe, just another place to get a sandwich that is a little smaller than other places and a bit more expensive.

WHEN I LEFT I THOUGHT:  Average but nice.  Didn't meet the hype.

This place is so nice!  The selection of treats and baked goods are vast and everything I've tried so far has been delicious!  The service is always friendly and helpful!  My new go to place for anything yummy!

The food always tastes good. Their breads are great. Everything is always fresh. The restaurant is always clean and comfortable. The staff is always polite and friendly. But the reason I marked this place only a 3 is because they never get a full order correct and the service is always slow. 

They never run two registers simultaneously, especially if it is not a main mealtime. They would rather let a line of people build up. No one ever takes the initiative or thinks to ask the customer that just paid to step over to the large table by the drinks to wait for their order so the next person can be waited on. Their excuse is that they are not a fast food restaurant. That may be true. But I expect faster than slow food and service.

It is as if they don't notice or care that wait times are high. And when I politely said something, the woman behind the register started to cry and ran into the back. If you can't take constructive, polite criticism, get out of the restaurant business.

I don't normally post Yelp reviews but had to post one because I just had great service here. I got something through the drive through, and because they were closing up they forgot about me after I ordered. This isn't a complaint review though, because when the manager noticed that I was still waiting she was super sweet about it all... gave me a full refund without me asking for it, and loads of extra free food. So just wanted to let people know that the management here is superb! Some of the best customer service I've ever had!

Tried to get breakfast there for the first time and the line was at a stand still. While waiting, we missed breakfast and were told that even though we were in line there was a hard stop for breakfast?? We tried to ask why the line was taking so long but the guy just walked away. We decided to stay since we had been in line for so long, still hungry and tried ordering lunch. The cashier had no idea how to put "no croutons and cheese on the side" in the system and she seemed timid to ask her bad attitude unhelpful coworkers that ignored the increasing amount of customers in line and their clearly struggling coworker. I didn't think that was too much to ask? The tables were filthy and the lettuce was wilty and not cold at all. The server had a rash on her right hand when she handed my food to me and when I asked about my drink, she blamed her coworker for not giving that to me in the first place instead of just taking care of it. Very poorly ran. The next day we went to Rory's diner and it made up for the debacle we experienced here at Kneaders. I debated writing a review but they really should figure that out. I was embarrassed for them as a chain. Lesson learned: shop small business and don't deal with being treated like cattle. Check We won't be back.

The food was quite pleasing. I ordered the cranberry turkey croissant, and it was exceptionally fresh. The bakery seemed ideally clean, and the atmosphere was very warm and pleasing. Over all, Kneaders cafe and bakery is a great place to stop by and have a quick bite!

Very excited that they have opened in our neighborhood. We have been at least 10 or more times and everything we have ordered has been very good. I would agree with the other reviews that the wait time seems too long. We are usually sitting and chatting with friends and family so time goes by, but if I was on a time crunch, not a good option. The French toast is amazing. Very friendly and clean.
This is the DMV of restaurants. I swear they lay in bed at night and think of new ways to ruin the customers experience! If I could subtract a star I would.

This place recently opened up here so we decided to give it a try. It's great. The food is fresh and delicious and you get a lot food for your money. The staff is friendly and nice. Everything is very fresh. Great place to go if you like sandwiches, bread or desserts.

Honestly this is one of my favorite sandwich places I always get a BLT on country white and every time it comes the exact same way and it is perfect every time. This restaurant is always clean and the staff is very kind and friendly.

This morning when we arrived the place was packed. They ran out of everything. People waiting 30 mins for food, and then told we are out. Why are they taking orders for food they don't have. I don't see this place lasting if they can't turn over meals faster. In our whole stay, there was no customer turnover. Everyone just sitting and waiting til a worker tells them they don't have any food. And I feel sorry for the one Asian kid that worked here. Had to walk around and deliver bad new to everything. That is the managers job to let everyone one in the restaurant know he ran out of food not being prepared. Complete disaster.

Love this bakery!

The food is consistently delicious. Service is excellent: staff are friendly and helpful. 

Relaxed atmosphere with fun music: very upbeat place to grab breakfast, a cup of coffee, or a snack. 

The raspberry cream cheese croissants are to die for; the pancakes come with a delicious sauce, strawberries and whipped cream. Heaven!
Sharing sweets with my sweets.  Wish I like coffee more. Enjoyed their german chocolte brownie...Judy loves their almond twice baked croissant.
We purchased some pastries for our Labor Day weekend BBQ and couldn't be more pleased!!! They looked and tasted amazing! In addition, the order was ready upon the agreed date and time.

I'm not a fan of the Kneaders model, but this location is much better than the one in Parker, simply because of road access.  The food was fine and the wait was average the one time that I was here.  Panera just does it better and faster.
This place switched ownership which was needed desperately!  Food its much better than it used to be.  The inside just seems so dingy and not updated.  I still like this place though!

I enjoyed the fact that I was able to pick a tv to watch my Chiefs play as I could not watch it from the comfort of my home.  There is nothing Irish about the menu but the Green Chili Nachos are fairly tasty.  This is a typical sports bar with a decent selection for food options and there's quite a bit of space for everyone to watch all the different games.  I wish they had drink specials for football Sundays, but beggars can't be choosers. We will probably be back to watch football if I can't watch the games at home.

Interesting joint. I think the best way to sum up my experience would be a list:

Ambiance. Typical sports bar. Lots of TVs, tables and chairs not in great condition. The name, along with the green clovers on the exterior sign, elude to it being an "irish" place, but nothing about the decor or menu would back that up. When we first got there, they just had music playing over the speakers which was fine. Eventually, a live band started playing. The bass was so terrible that I could feel it. I couldn't tell you if the singer was any good, because I couldn't hear him over the feedback. I also couldn't tell you anything my husband was saying, because it was so loud. Overall, 2 stars.

Service. Had been at the table for about 10 minutes before anyone came by to wipe it down or even welcome us. After that, the server was friendly and decently attentive. Overall, 3 stars.

Food/Drinks. We started with the boneless wings with the sweet chili sauce. I disagree with the word "wings" when describing this item, as it was really just chopped up chicken covered in a sauce. However, the sweet chili sauce was really good, not too spicy but had a little kick. I then had the Santa Fe Chicken Wrap with fries. The wrap was very good (I also added guac) and you could tell the fries were homemade (but a little soggy). My husband had the French Dip which he said was pretty standard but could tell the beef was not freshly sliced. He also said his beer was a little flat. Overall, 3.5 stars.

Misc. There is ample parking. Seemed like a good crowd of people there, no one getting too rowdy.

If we lived closer to this place, we'd consider going back again, but not sure I'd make the journey for this.

This place is a place you go when you're a 50-60 year old bar hopper with no life and no family/broken family. That's the vibe I get from here. The food sucks because it's a bar and it's kind of old looking and out dated like a grandmas house.

If you are looking for drinks, a more mature crowd, and loud rock music, this is your place.  There us plenty of parking out front.  The 2 for 1 happy hour ensures the patrons are indeed happy.  The food is hit and miss.  
I was told the burger was very good, but my French dip was lukewarm and so soggy.  This was before I dipped the sandwich in the au jus.  I attempted to dip my sandwich, but the bread fell apart before reaching the au jus cup.  I figured the bread was wet enough (with what, I don't know), so I took a bite.  I regret few things in life.  This was one.  I will stick to drinks in this place.

We were looking for some good bar food when my girlfriend remembered she had been to this place and they had an awesome cheese steak. 

We went in and the Packers game was on so we sat by one of the many tvs to watch.   Our server came over right away and got our drink order.  She came back right away with our drinks. 

We ended up ordering the chili cheeseburger and buffalo chicken sandwich with fries.  They came it within a reasonable time. 

The chili cheeseburger looked amazing.  It was smothered in green chili and had pickles,  onions,  and cheese on it.  I had to eat it with a fork,  but it was good!  The burger was juicy and the chili not too spicy,  but just right. 

The buffalo chicken sandwich had no words to explain how good it was.  The chicken was super juicy and the Buffalo sauce plentiful.  We added some cheddar cheese and dipped it in blue cheese dressing.  All I can say is WOW!

This is the best bar food I have had in Colorado. I hope this wasn't a one time thing.  We will be back and hopefully not disappointed.
Decent place for bar food. It is right across the street. During bands drinks are way over priced for little to no alcohol.

Charming place... its charming if you like dive sports bars... its a dive and it's awesome. Great bar food, cold beer, and a lively crowed. The one thing I hate is the live music.  It's to loud and not very good. I say not very because some of these bands may sound good in better venues.

If you want to have a beer or cocktails while meeting someone,  this location is probably one of the better place around here.  They got plenty of seating;  many pool tables and friendly employees. 

Last few times I was here,  the wait staff always been fast and friendly,  knew what was going and very professional and checked on me continuously to make sure i will spend more money on beer.  Haha.

If you are hungry for some quick bite to eat and want a drink at the same time;  this place might quench your thirst and fill your stomach.

If you heard about the health code violations,  I'm sure it's all fixed.  They can't stay up this long without fixing it.

They have free HH taco bars during Fridays afternoon.

Servers are awesome, prices are decent, large beer selection.  The Mexican food is pretty good, others are hit-or-miss.  Good stage and (usually) good bands.  It's nice because you can go into the bar area and still hear/watch the band - without getting blasted if that's not your thing.  They do a lot of weekday events too - poker, bingo, trivia, etc.

I went to McCarthy's last week with my dad in law. We heard the food was good and atmosphere was laid back. It delivered on both. 

We decided to order chicken wings and two burgers. The chicken wings are great, you can get them battered which makes them extra crispy and put the sauce on the side so you can decide how much you want. The burgers were HUGE and cooked to perfection, the fries were nice and crispy. I'm the only one who ordered a drink - a tall coke and rum. I didn't come during happy hour, but the bartender mentioned they were two for the price of one from 3pm - 7pm.

While we were there, the staff was friendly and personable, the manager even introduced herself and checked on us, the bar was clean (and may I mention this place is huge). I think we have found our new lunch hangout spot.
We really love this local bar.  Is it the nicest? Nope, but food is pretty good and staff are really nice.  Really like coming here... only complaint are drinks are kinda pricey.
Don't drink anything from the tap here and you will be fine. Everybody I know that has drank from the tap has gotten sick.

Closest bar to home and can look a little intimidatingly busy at times with the bikers parked outside but the minute you walk in it opens up and has a large dive bar feel. Dark enough to have a drink in peace or lively enough (pool table, juke box, etc) on the other end of the bar to let loose a little. No judgement feel here and the wait staff are friendly. I like this place!

I was pretty disappointed with my experience here. I went on a Thursday for karaoke and this place left a pretty bad taste in my mouth. The wait staff was VERY SLOW and the food was pretty bad. I wouldn't go back.

Met up with friends after a round of golf who claim this place as their "18th hole".  Dustin was our server and was very attentive and friendly.  It's hard to find good service these days and he certainly is a gem there.  The chicken strips were really good as were the fried mushrooms.  The wine selection is sub par and is a cheap boxed brand that is difficult to stomach.  Go with a traditional mixed drink and you'll be happy.  Bathrooms are clean.
Decent food and reasonable prices make this one of the better bar options in the area. The service can suffer a bit during the busier times but all in all I've never had a bad experience here.

Average bar, average food, and a big cafeteria feel.  If its weekdays be prepared to wait for service.  And be prepared to look at a bunch of empty tables aligned like a highschool cafeteria.  All in all its ok food, ok price and ok service.  Nothing special, bad or good.

This place gives me the creeps. It's one of those places that has its specific regulars and they get a smile and better service and the others get to sit and wait. 
Weird smell of the place, it was super dark in there to hide how ancient it seems, and food wasn't very good. I've heard some SCARY stuff about their health inspections as well...

Recently failed food safety inspection and was highlighted in a local news report. Raw beef stored on top of ready to eat foods. An employee was handling ready to eat food without gloves. Another employee was handling dirty dishes then food without washing his hands. Ground beef, salad dressing and cheeses were held at unsafe temperatures.

Worst dive bar in aurora. Owners dont care only if youre a regular in which they over pour and over serve their guests. Dont bother with the jukebox you wont be rembursed if they play "trivia".  You just have to wait it out i feel bad for the servers l, stretched too thin with a owner that doesnt care. This place looks HORRIBLE call jon taffer ASAP

I had high hopes for this place as I drive by at least once/week.  Finally I had a chance to stop by for a bite and a beer.  The beer was good.
The atmosphere was yucky...yes, a childish word, but the only one I can use to describe the place...dark, boring....
Food...dark...boring...

I have no plans on returning. (Two Stars only because my son liked the nachos)
One the better bars in Aurora for sure. I always have a good time.

This place is huge! Lots of TV's- Sunday Football! 
I ordered a glass of wine and it came in a big huge glass-almost full, not sure but I think it was at least two glasses in there- and it was $6.25
The service could have been better- super nice, just really slow. We had a table of 13- and there is plenty of room here to pull tables together and still be able to watch a football or hockey game.
The wings were great- for those like me who can't stand blue cheese, they have the good "bar" ranch dressing- yummmmy! 
If I lived in the hood I could see going here for games. 
They also have poker and pool tourney's here weekly.

I hear about McCarthy's at least 3 times a week. This is the bf's neighborhood hangout and I was finally brought here on Friday for a double date. Definitely your neighborhood bar, packed with locals and neon beer brand signs. Lots of neon signs. 

Happy Hour just might be one of the greatest things in the US. 2 for 1 drinks and raging drink specials. Add in a little buffet of free chicken wings and tater tots, and you have a prime spot to have drinks and for some, a free meal. I had a glass of white zinfandel, to take advantage of their '2 glasses of house wine for $6.25' deal. I'm not sure what the brand of wine was but it was dry, tasty, and the glass was about the size of my head. To top it off, it contained half a bottle of wine and our wonderful waitress joked that another glass would have me consuming the entire bottle. I opted not to go for that. 

With cheap drinks, plenty of tv's, and tons of loyal regulars, I'm considering this the 'Cheers' of Aurora. After a round of karaoke, I'm sure even the guy in the back corner will know your name.

There are two things this place has going for it:  Ample parking and they serve Magners cider.  Magners is the only Irish thing you'll get here.  The clientele is sketchy, the bar staff is really slow, and the inside is a bit dank.  The service here needs some major improvement.  Besides being slower than molasses, our server was as smart as a box of rocks. Make sure to double-check your bill when closing out.

I'm a little conflicted, being as my boyfriend loves the place. We went for a date night and sat at a high table away from the bar. I asked the waitress after waiting 15 minutes of sitting if they had a blender. They did. Great. I ordered a strawberry daquiri. It was so strong and so absolutely disgusting I took 2 sips and I was done. Gross! Geoffrey had Amaretto and Sprite, so he was pleased. We ordered fried pickle chips, wings (mild and naked), and soft pretzel bites with cheese. The mild wings (mine) were actually pretty good. They were a little small for my liking. Geoffrey didn't care for the naked wings much. I am not much of a pickle-eater, but I generally like fried pickle chips. The pickle chips were too thick and this rendered them not very crispy and a little greasy. I couldn't eat too many of them. They were too strong of a dill flavor for me (thickness also plays a part here). Geoffrey and I have a thing for soft pretzels. I ate most of those because I was pretty dissatisfied with the fried pickle chips. The waitress did not check in enough and I found myself waiting for a refill with a scorching tongue. We are looking elsewhere for a good pub. Sorry.

What I like about this place the most is that I feel, at 42, I'm still somewhere "out" and fun (bands, karaoke, poker nights, pool, etc.) but I definitely am not the oldest person in the bar.  I jokingly call it "cougar paradise" because the women there (I'm one of them!) are older than the downtown crowd, but still fun, fabulous, and just out to have a great time. The men seem to be friendly, chatty, and not overly clingy.  Just a good, salt-of-the-earth mix of locals.

Food has been great to me but some of my friends are not the biggest fans...I've never gone wrong with the standards (burgers, tuna melts, fries) and the portions are big.

Drinks are good!  Happy Hour wine comes as a 2 for 1 in huge goblets, so you feel like a lush, but also?  Yay!

Joanna (aka "Jo Jo") is about the sweetest and most proficient cocktail waitress/bartender I've ever met.  As a former cocktail slinger myself, it's hard not to be critical of service, and there's not a single thing I can say about her other than AWESOME.

Top o' the mañana to ya, amigo!

Optimus is confused by Mexican menu items in an Irish-style pub that's really just a sports bar with a stage. Yeah, this place is about as Irish as the chili relleno I ate here last week. But hey - it was not a bad chili relleno.

Karaoke Thursday is a hilarious time to watch drunken humans 'sing' - most of the time EPIC FAILING just as much while singing Highway to Hell as they are trying to get back off the stage (OMG is she alright??)

Also, there is always this one older drunk chick that talks to Optimus and Sideswipe like she's got no one else to hang on to, but... well, let's just say it was visit # 3 to this place that we even figured out she was a she. Ladies who smoke: be aware, your voice is going to get deep and scratchy, and your face is going to shrivel up faster than a dog's ass at the vet. This chick could have played Ghost Rider as Nic Cage and the  Spirit of Vengeance all at once - with no make-up! Lady, do yourself a flava and suck on a Chantix once in a while, will ya? Foulness.

Libations abound. Not the best prices, the service is meh, and the scenery as well. But heck... it's right down the block.

Optimus OUT

The food was actually pretty good. The service was awful. And it was dead in there. The server/bartender gal was snarky and rude and didn't come back to our table once after giving us our food. We had to go up and ask for our bill and a box. 
This is definitely NOT an Irish pub or bar.  They had mostly Mexican food on the menu? 
Even though the food was good, I'd never go back because of the piss poor service.

I have had some great times at McCarthy's. Its in "A-town" and its about the best variety of Atown folks you will get on this side of town. Sometimes you will feel like you stepped back 20 years in time during the days of tight rolled jeans and hair scrunchies but hey I'm not complaining, its just more fun this way! Anyways - on a "bloody mary" challenge (followed by a whiskey taste test!?) we found that this place has really decent bloody marys! Most restaurants and bars fail miserably when trying to create a bloody mary mix so the smart ones (like McCarthy's) just use a pre-bottled mix and that works out great!:)
PS: Karaoke night is awesome if you need to laugh!

Towny bar.  What more can I say.  Gets packed on a Friday night - relatively inexpensive happy hour drinks (2 for 1 beers, etc) and some free munchies such as wings, veggies, and chips.  Nothing exciting about it - it's a place to go hang out and have some beer.  You don't go there for the atmosphere, or the décor.  You go cause it is close and relatively cheap.

Got super smashed here last night. 3 pitchers of PBR, buffalo burger, and burritos ran us $38 which is not so bad considering.

Food: I was kinda drunk at this point but the buffalo burger was quite delish. The fries, NOT delish. At all. I don't know what kind of fries they are but they are the same as fresh fish company and they blow. Please get better fries.

Drink: $7.50 for a pitcher of PBR. I got 2 sides of green olives with them with no backsass from the bartender.

Atmosphere: The atmosphere here is sweet. They had live trivia and trivia on some tvs as well. A million tvs with all variety of sports. We got the channel changed on one of the prominent tvs no problem. 

Overall, I liked this place. If I weren't moving this weekend I would consider coming here weekly.

This bar has the most dysfunctional decorations ever- a sports bar with a few four leaf clovers intermixed and a biker crowd that screams their better days are behind them. If you like bars where you can see a 50 year old woman with leathered skin and a beer belly in a tube top then this is the place for you. The service is meh and the food is bleh. It just feels dirty in there and I like dive bars. The music is wayyyy too loud but it's probably that way because of the older crowd that frequents this establishment. I would not recommend- if you want to go to a good bar just head down to Emerald Isle that's less than a mile away but miles ahead of this desperate place.

Not too bad.  I could not find a waitress for a little while in the pool area and had to seek one out but after that everything was just fine.  They have Coors Original on Tap which I like :) 
Pool is actually pretty cheap too if you are smart enough to read the sign... lol  3 games for 2 bucks! There was a band setting up for what I am sure was a great night!  I lie the set up and the Menu looks great and I heard from more than a couple patrons that the Nachos are yummy! 
Not to far away from my new hood :) Ill be back for some Nachos for sure... we shall see if the service gets any better :)

I find myself saying more frequently that "we should go to McCarthy's" tonight. Every week they have a different band providing a different sound. Their bar food is decent, though I haven't tried it all. The drinks are decently priced, the wait staff are friendly, and the mix of patrons is welcoming. I haven't had a bad time yet! If you're in the area and are looking for the neighborhood bar feel - McCarthy's is a great place to try.
Love this place!  Great place to watch sports, eat, play pool and even bring my family early in the day.

since i havent hit too many bars around here in aurora/denver, this was a treat. had pool tables, darts, abundant seating and a nice atmosphere. service was okay. nothing outstanding. only had to wait a couple times for refills. price for beer was not the best. ive had much better happy hour deals, especially on pitchers. they did have a live band. a little loud for the size of the place, but good music (rock covers) overall. they did start a bit late for me (11:15pm). the crowd was a little on the older side, but it did get busier as the night went on and the age seemed to even out a bit. only had french fries for food which were okay. homemade, real fries. kept the munchies at bay, but i could have really used some in'n'out fries, know what im sayin?

i will probably go here again but maybe not til i try a few other joints. i really prefer the real DIVE bar scene

Always made fresh to order and is always delist when I go there. They have an all day lunch special that comes with fried rice and their portions are pretty big. It is one of those hole in the wall places that is good.
