I've been coming to China Chef Express off and on since the 1990s and I've seen customer service go down hill, the good thing is there is always more places to take your hard earn money to buy a good meal and better service.

The food has never been bad in my times from picking up here, but it's what you can expect for such a cheap little Chinese place. Plus their culture is lacking, I tried to see if chow fun was available & the employee didn't even know what it was. What kind of Chinese place is that?
not good quality food and unfriendly service. I wouldnt recommend eating here.

I have been a customer of this place for 20 plus I ordered chicken phad Thai was terrible when I called person on phone refused to believe what I was saying  like I didn't know what it was to taste like  people save your money low quality crap customer not first very disappointed lost a customer for life. They get no stars tried to post with no stars  and terrible terrible terrible one star to much praise for this place. Very upset
Pad Thai was pink and tasted like sweet and sour, LoMein was ok, but the chick was rubbery. $20 down the drain.

They have your everyday Chinese food staples. Not amazing but not bad. They do get orders wrong sometimes, but what restaurant doesnt. But their Crispy Spring Rolls are the best. And they are always fried fresh when you order them. They aren't sitting around under a heat lamp. I usually go with their Small Combo Fried Rice and Crispy Spring Rolls. Its a pretty good lunch for about $10.
My experience there was the chicken was overcooked really hard the egg foo young was runny

To start off we got our food delivered and all our stuff was mixed up and food was missing. We were missing a soup and sesame wings. The teriyaki chicken was primarily vegetables with 5 pieces of actual meat. The pad thia had an incredibly strange tasting spicy pink sauce covering it. We very nicely called and said we were missing sesame wings because we decided we would just do without the soup. The lady that answered told me I was wrong and both orders of sesame wings were there cause she remembered putting them in there. As I proceeded to explain that we were in fact missing it she said "oh Ya we only charged you for one so you only got one." But then why would she say she remembered putting two? Then we realized we had ordered sweet and sour chicken but got a side of teriyaki rather than a side of sweet and sour sauce. When we called the same lady she told us it was sweet and sour and that they just put food coloring in it to make it brown. We told her okay, never mind then and just waited on the wings to come. But when I got my second order of sesame wings arrived we got the exact same sauce that had came with the sweet and sour wings. Then I found a huge hair in my white rice which completely made me lose my appetite. It's obviously not well organized and I will never order here again.   Absolutely no customer service nor did they even apologize for anything. In fact the lady had attitude when I first called about the wings. I wish I could give 0 stars.

We ordered 3 entrees and sides for delivery around a week ago, and wow I wish we'd stuck with our standby local delivery picks.  The Pad Thai (maybe I should have known better than to try Thai here) wasn't edible by me OR my husband, and neither of us are picky about it.  I enjoy it with browner sauces or red ones but NOT pink as this was.  What sauce was that - ketchup??  

Either way, there was nothing enjoyable about our dinner even with all the different food options we ordered.  I later tried to salvage the leftovers with our own fish sauce, but when the Pad Thai touched the pan the odor in the house was unbearable.  Shockingly bad.

don't buy any food here, the food is terrible, i ordered the sweet and sour pork, the pork was old,it was mainly breading that was hard as a rock,the egg fried rice tasted like it was sitting all day, the egg rolls were soggy. when i returned the meal, the owner lady refused to give me a refund or a replacement lunch, she got angry and told me not to return again. chinese people are the most selfish,stingy people in the world, she would rather lose a new customer than fix the problem,little does she know one bad review will hurt her pocket down the road.

Wow, I can't even describe the shittiness that is this place, how it's still in business is beyond me....The egg drop soup had 2 gnats, fucking BUGS in it!!!!!!! And I ate like 10 bites before a saw it...OMFG!!!!! Also their food is complete shit and they gave me the wrong order that I drove to get. When I got home and saw the dish was wrong I asked that they deliver me the right one. Not only was the dish wrong, I asked for them to be extra spicy and they tasted like paper. They refused to bring me the right ones and said I could come all the way back to exchange them. WORST food AND customer service I have ever experienced in my life. I really hope everyone will read this review before coming here. Please save yourself.

Bad food and worse service. I ordered Kung Pao chicken right before work. I was given king Pao beef. When I called and explained that I was already working and requested my proper food be brought they told me all I could do is drive back to have it replaced. I live less than a mile away but could not leave home due to work. I ended up having my girlfriend have to drive their mistake back to them for a refund in which they attempted to try to remake the order without even asking what she wanted. Obviously will never be ordering from here again....
orange chicken is my favorite chiniese dish. Had it at so many restaurants. But the orange chicken here had by far been the best.

Husband and I come here for Chinese take-out about once a month on average - and have been doing so for the past several years (since living in the area). I will say that there are not many options for good chinese food in the Denver area (I'm from Washington State where options are plentiful) but for chinese take-out, this place hits the spot. We typically will get orders of veggie fried rice (our favorite), Happy Family, Sesame Chicken (my favorite), veggie lo mein and don't forgot the crab cheese wontons! 

We always pick up ourselves because I know the wait times for delivery is usually an hour plus and since we live within 5 minutes, its just easier to pick up. I hear bad reviews based on delivery times .... so skip delivery and get it yourself. Your experience will be so much better.

This place is an Aurora staple! 

If you want some inexpensive Chinese food that is good, just stop by and get some grub! 

I am sure (know) that their staff deals with some relatively challenging people at times, so they seem to have a wall up when dealing with customers. If they (the cashiers) were more pleasant, I am sure they would get more business. Their customer experience is seriously lacking - but I take it for what it is. I order ahead of time and go pick up my food and leave. I keep it simple!
Was not good food was discussing my chicken fried rice was burnt and every thing else was to took a bite out of it and tossed

Very poor service, been going to this place for years with hope that it will change. No Change! Food is good, not worth the treatment. Ordered delivery and portion of order was missing, promised a credit twice but received Zero Zilch NADA! Very disappointing to a loyal customer! Had to drive at 1025 pm with young baby to get my $$ back ... Defeats the purpose of delivery. Check your order before the driver leaves!

The hubby and I ordered from China Chef express for the first time tonight and if I have my way, it will be the last. Orange chicken was overdone and had large pieces of cartilage. My spring rolls were apparently shrimp spring rolls (menu should really make this clear...) and my chicken fried rice was... BBQ pork, shrimp, chicken fried rice. Seriously? I HATE SHRIMP. Thank the gods I had leftover pizza in the fridge.

Ordered two entrees and crab and cheese wontons. An hour later, entrees arrive, no wontons. Call and tell them. "Well, what do you want?", they say. I want the wontons. "They will be delivered in 20 minutes" One hour later, no wontons. Call again for refund. "We cannot refund your credit card. Have to send driver with cash." Thirty-five minutes later, driver arrives WITH WONTONS! I want my money back. Shoves five bucks at my husband and bag of greasy cold wontons. Two and a half hours to receive the total order and IDIOTS providing "customer service" Never again! Never, never, never, never. Learn your business folks! If you didn't bring everything I paid for, you should be rushing to get it to me.
My favorite take-out joint.  I like the food here and the counter help seems pretty friendly to me.  Great place for picking up dinner on the way home from work.
Great Kung Pao chicken and wontons!!! If you dine in the portions are huge and it's quite convenient to get your own to-go box. The place looks small and sketchy but the foods great!!!

Had the worst experience of my life at this place!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Hubby and I have ordered from China Chef many times. I believe we average once every 2-3 months ordering takeout. (Note: We have NEVER eaten there.)

I place my order (we'll call her Caller #1). There was emphasis on a particular item. Caller #1 states item will cost extra. I advised that was no problem. Caller #1 advised it will be 35 minutes - 1 hour for delivery. Caller #1 hangs up before repeating my order back to me. *****PROBLEM #1 *******

An hour passes. Food is not delivered.******* PROBLEM #2 ****** I call back after 1 hour and 6 minutes.  Sounds like a different caller so we'll call her Caller #2. Tells me driver left 5 minutes ago.

Food is delivered.  About to plate the family's food and I notice I'm missing the aforementioned particular item. ********* PROBLEM #3*********.

Again, I call back. Sounds like Caller #2. Advised my item was missing.  Caller #2 tells me to hold on but she doesn't place me on mute. I can hear her asking someone about my order with an attitude. *********** PROBLEM #4 *********. Caller #2 comes back and firmly tries to tell me I NEVER ordered the particular item. ********* PROBLEM #5 ************.  I'm furious at this point especially because I had an in depth conversation with Caller #1 about food item.  I asked to speak to a manager.

Manager comes on line. Doesn't say her name. *********** PROBLEM #6 ***********. I advise her of my issue which is China Chef forgot an item in my food delivery.  She must have told me about three times I wasn't charged for the item. Seriously....that's not my issue and she wasn't even trying to hear me.  ******* PROBLEM #7 *********. I told Manager very firmly she needed to deliver my missing item. Manager hangs up on me.   ************PROBLEM #8 ***************.

I pack up all the food and hubby & I drive to China Chef. Place is about 17 minutes away.  My game plan is strictly to confront "The Manager" and get a refund.  Manager is on phone being syrupy sweet with a customer which totally irritated me because she offered no customer service to me.

Manager gets off the phone and immediately tells me "I am just going to issue you a refund because I don't want to deal with you."  WHAT WHAT WHAT!!!!!!!! ************* PROBLEM #9 ********.

I ask Manager it's ridiculous she would not even try to hear my concerns and doesn't even care about true customer service. Manager feels like everything is my fault because her account of the story is "I yelled at her."  We went back and forth and she refunded my credit card. Told me to leave her establishment.  No problem....but I needed some information first.

I asked for Manager's name. She would not give it to me. ******* PROBLEM #10 ********. I asked her boss' name.  She would not give it to me. ********** PROBLEM #11 ********. I asked for the owner's name. She would not give it to me. ********* PROBLEM #12 *************. I asked for the owner's phone number. She points to the window. *********** PROBLEM #13 **************.

I guess I should have just walked out and parted ways forever. However, I need to make sure my credit card was refunded appropriately.  Owner was supposed to call me but that NEVER happened.

I'll admit, their food is good but it was never "consistently" good. So sprinkle some horrible customer service with that and I will not be going to China Chef ever again.

They've got a very full menu. Lots to choose from. Prices are very reasonable. I really like the lo mein. The sesame chicken doesn't have much in terms of veggies, which was disappointing. Their sweet and sour is top notch, the crab and cheese wantons a little heavy on extra dough but still good. 

Problems:
-The white rice was very mediocre.
-No veggies with the sesame chicken??! What a bore.

I come here because of their prices, their food and the fact that they have vegetarian options that actually taste good. Its hard to find a vegetarian meat place for friends without going downtown. Their service isn't great at all and the place is pretty awful looking but if you ignore all of that and just want cheap chinese food that is actually good, then this place works.
The food here is pretty good and cheap. If the atmosphere was a little better it would be nice. Great Kung Pao and sweet and sour chicken.

My absolute favorite. I've been to many cities wanting  TRUE FRIED RICE as a complement to my main entree in a combination plate, and have NEVER found it. This is the only place that will add egg, onion, bean sprouts, etc. into your side of rice with your combo (none of that white rice with a touch of soy sauce mess you see at other places). 

Sweet and Soure Chicken, Lo'Mein, Sesame Chicken, Won Ton Soup...you name it, its good!

I LOVE this place and for the price, gluttony will remain (just kidding).

I was craving Chinese food very bad and wanted to try a new place. I read the reviews for China Chef Express, and most were good reviews. Their online menu prices need to be updated as they are a little more now. I placed an order and they called to tell me it'd actually be six dollars more after online ordering, no biggie. But the food it's not horrible but it's not good either. My girlfriend and I has the egg drop soup and threw it out fast. The rest of it wasn't bad but didn't have much flavor. Cheap prices though so I guess you kinda get what you pay for.

This is one of the best inexpensive, fast food Chinese restaurants I have eaten at.  I had the Kung Pao Chicken and Appetizer Combo.  The Kung Pao was great with its sliced chicken, something different from other restaurants and it came with fried rice which was also great.  The combo, I loved the egg rolls, spare ribs and the cheese wontons.  The fried shrimp and chicken wings were kinda bland, but dipped them in the spicy hot oil which helped out.  The portions were huge and I ended up taking it home and enjoyed the left overs.  Had a chance to talk to most all of the staff and they were very friendly.  I most definitely will be back for more.
Hands down the BEST Chinese food in Denver.

Inexpensive and great food most if the time, every time the soup changes. I always order a hot and sour soup and it never tastes the same. Okay now this is not a restaurant to come and bring your family or spouse to dinner with. This place is very ghetto. This is a nice place to go to dine in for lunch or to take to go for business or personal matter. Highly recommend their crab cheese wontons. :)

Enjoyed this place for a long time, when I lived near enough to come get the food myself.  Trying to place a delivery order with them is an exercise in bad attitude that I can't abide anymore, it used to be one particular girl giving bad service, now it's everyone who answers the phone.  They don't know basics about the surrounding area, even seemingly 1 major street up, I gave them my cross street as Alameda and Havana (insanely close to them) and they seemed absolutely baffled as to how far it was from their location. They began a side conference between people there as to who would go out to make the delivery, only to have it end with them refusing delivery altogether because I was "too far" away.  According to Google maps i'm less than 3 miles from their listed address, so I have no idea what their problem is, I just don't intend to deal with it again.

This place would be a 5 *, if the eating area was more "chinese" Culture. But more importantly the FOOD and the Customer Service Was VERY Good. Was a little unsure if we were going to be seated or if we needed to put our order in 1st. But we will Defitnitly Be back for More! Been in CO for 2months and have finally found a great chinese food place..

Pretty good food, a little greasy. Crab cheese wantons at a great price and tasted good. Good vegetarian menu. The Kung Pow mock beef was delicious, and mildly spicy. Awesome portions, and overall nice prices. I had take out, so customer service experience was limited, but pleasant. We have been wary of Chinese restaurants, finding ones we will return to are rare, but this one turned out pretty good.

My wife and I went out to dinner last Friday night and wanted Chinese food from a different place. Really glad we went here! We ordered Orange Chicken, Sesame Chicken, Lo Mein and Chicken and Veggies. Got this all for $20. 
My favorite was the sesame chicken with egg fried rice. The chicken wasn't spicy but had lots of flavor. I really enjoyed the egg fried rice. And they served a ton of it. 
The orange chicken was okay. I thought it was a little tough and stringy, but it could have been because I ate that the next day. They gave me so much that I could eat the orange chicken for 3 meals. 
My wife likes Lo Mein and the chicken and veggies. She enjoyed both very much and liked China Chef much more than our usual place, Joy Asian Cuisine. We will definitely come back here!

I've been to about three chinese restaurants in town trying to find good crab meat wontons and I've finally found them - here!  The dipping sauce they give was delicious and not as red/bright as other restaurants.  I also got the shrimp lo mein combo meal, which includes the entree, fried rice and an egg roll.  Total bill was under $12, which was the cheapest I've had so far as well.  The shrimp and lo mein were delicious, nice and big.  The fried rice was great, but bits of onion in case you aren't into that.  The egg roll and wontons again were yummy.  Yes, a little greasy but for that price and the amount, I will be going back again and again.

Their price is very reasonable for casual dining and takeouts. The food is descent. With cheap prices of about 4-6 dollars, you can be very full from the quantities. I also tried their salt+pepper chicken wings, and they are delicious!! The only drawback might be their rice (it's hard and not as soft as I would like). This is a great place to go for a fast Chinese food experience. Their staff is always friendly, by the way. I really enjoy going there for a late-night snack or quick lunch.

Stop #2 with the parents on the bar hopping adventure through Platt Park.

I've been wanting to try this place, ever since I walked past it a few months back. So when dad suggested a drink on the patio - I was game! After sampling a bite, and a drink - I'd return already.

PRO'S: 
+ Location is killer and is embedded with other amazingly good restaurants worthy of a try.
+ Pearl street is totally walkable and fun to bar hop!
+ Food is great - we sampled the crab beignet's - which were stuffed with crab, corn and perfectly fried. SO delicious and hit the spot :)
+ Venue itself is insanely nice - with a full oak bar, rooftop and patio. It exudes a relaxed yet upscale vibe, without the snootiness. 
+ Drink menu is vast and offers so much to choose from. Mom and I opted for a classic red wine blend, while the boys stuck with a local brew and mixed beverage.

CON'S:
- Staff is nice but slightly awkward. Rob, our server, actually said he wasn't  confident in the menu, but suggested a few items we might find tasty. He also glowed about his previous workplace (another restaurant), which I found to be odd and not complimentary of our current location.
- Parking is a nightmare in this area - as it's all street parking, but I've always found a spot just a couple blocks off Pearl.

I'd like to sample more of their southern fare, as everything looked delicious, fresh and full of seafood - my favorite!

Easily one of the best places to eat on pearl. A strong recommendation if you are a fan of carrot cake - yes .... one of the best (add coconut). Wow. 

Dinner was excellent - service was great - there was no wait. 

We opted to go here after leaving the tavern because of noise = a smart move. 
Wow.

What a charming spot on South Pearl Street. Amazing decor on the first floor (the rooftop deck wasn't open so I didn't get a chance to check it out which was a bummer because it was a beautiful night at sunset)

The waitress was very nice (and I completely forgot her name although she told me). So I'll admit it, we probably came off as difficult because there were a few things we didn't like and a few things we liked:

Fried Green Tomato Caprese  - great flavor & nice crisp on the fried tomatoes

Bacon & Scallops - This was a misleading dish. As you'll see from the pic, the bacon was like a big huge slice of fatty bacon. Not even pork belly ish, just bacon. It looked like a pork chop but was mostly fat. My friend took it to task and picked out all the meat but it was just not what we were expecting based on the menu description.  The flavor was good though! The server was sweet enough to take them off our bill.

I ordered the Vinho Verde wine which was delicious. Then I switched to prosecco which for some reason seemed flat even though it was from one of the smaller individual bottles. It was a mystery.

To continue with me being difficult, when I went to the restroom, the toilet wouldn't flush and had no water in it so I had to come rolling out and tell them and they all felt badly.

Overall a good experience, just would change up the description on the Bacon & Scallops

Something great happened when I ate at Fourteen Seventy Two last night . . . the Broncos won their opener against the Panthers in a cliff hanger. The restaurant? Not a winner.

Sat at the bar which I usually love and ordered their corn and crab beignets, a wedge salad with the blue cheese dressing on the side, and a glass of a nice Oregon pinot noir. The wine was reasonably priced and delicious. The beignets were neither. Waited for well over a half hour for them to arrive and when they finally got there I searched in vain for any taste or even small sign of the advertised "lump crab" they were supposed to contain. None to be seen anywhere in the dish. They tasted like corn hush puppies that cost a ridiculously high $13. Left half of them uneaten. The salad while served with a very nice blue cheese dressing had it slathered all over the plate instead of being served on the side as I requested. 

Bottom line? Won't go back. Lots of great places around these days so no need to settle for mediocrity. Sorry. I wish you good luck, but . . .

Sign me,
David "not a fan (of 1472)" M

Uh can you say CHICKEN & WAFFLES?! Yes, please!!! Went for a couples date night and heard that chicken & waffles were on the menu, so naturally I had to try them! Coming from the south, I know good fried chicken and this place nailed it! The chicken was so moist and the exterior was fried to perfection!! Oh but that's not it, the waffle was incredibly fluffy! Add a little syrup and enjoy! Can't wait to go back and try their meat loaf! If you're looking for southern food, this place is worth your time. Charming spot - especially at night!

Went back again today and I've decided to bump the rating up to five stars because the peach bread pudding is simply divine and there were no service issues this time around - in fact, my server even noticed I was shorted a shrimp with my grits and took the initiative to fix it right away - something I certainly wouldn't have noticed.
Went for brunch on the patio. The mimosas were good, fried green tomato benedict delish, and the service was friendly.

The patio is by far the best part of the experience! I'd actually say by itself it's worth 5 stars. Denver loves a great patio and I'm no different. I've actually been waiting to come here for a few years, it's just if I'm going to incur the calories I want them to be worth it. Spoiler alert: they're not. 

I'm not saying the food is bad by any means! Just that it's not the culinary equivalent to atmosphere. South Pearl has a lot to live up to with Gaia, Izakaya, and even Khaos on the block. While Fourteen Seventy Two definitely fits in terms of style, the food could use an upgrade.

My husband and I came here for brunch last weekend. There was a farmers' market on Pearl with a booth directly in front of the street level patio. We got there right at 10 am and were told the patio waitress wasn't there yet.

We waited a few minutes at the bar then promised we'd be low maintenance if they let us go upstairs. It was well shaded and exactly what I wanted. I can't say the same for the bottomless mimosas or bloody marys.

The fried green tomato caprese appetizer. Had it not been drizzled with balsamic vinegar it would've been good. The bread for breakfast sandwich was massive! My husband's biscuits and gravy was more like chili and gravy. Both entrées were okay, and due to previous reviews I wasn't expecting better. As long as you're aware of that going in, you can still enjoy brunch.

In the mood for some SHROOMS? Go for the mushroom burger. Seriously. It's delicious. I can't speak for the other dishes, but this one was a winner. 

Stopped in here for a quick lunch. It happened to be a nice day, so we got to sit on the patio and watch the passersby. The mushroom burger wasn't some processed mass put on bread, oh no it was not. It was chopped up mushrooms formed into this delicate, HUGE patty. Topped with some goat cheese and some beautiful leafy greens, and it was heavenly and very fresh. 

All I could think while eating it was, "How can I make this at home?!" Truly a mushroom masterpiece.

Amazing food, great menu.  I agree with the service on the other comments.  For the atmosphere, the service doesn't match. 

Still love going though, amazing FOOD!

Yes Yes Yes!  Fried chicken, shrimp and grits, fried green tomato caprese, chili rellano - everything we had was great and we are definitely going back.  The drinks were big and good!!!  The staff was so nice and the place was clean.   The door is in the back on the side of the coffee shop next door to the restaurant (Stella's).

I was surprised to read the negative reviews on this place. We checked it out for the first time this past Friday and had excellent service with even better food. The chicken and waffles were the best I've ever had. I can't wait to go back and try the Mac & Cheese!

Hosted a girls dinner here (12 people) and they accomdated us really well! It's a small space, so when I walked in I was a little nervous (and thankful I had called ahead with a reservation).

The staff was friendly and flexible (my group went from 16 to 12 in about 15 minutes and they were totally ok with that). The service was nice, and in fact, kind of funny. 

The food was delicious. I ordered the chicken and waffles and it was very tasty. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their food. There was a lot of macaroni and cheese ordered and consumed! It was delicious. We even got a couple desserts and split them around the table. Tasty!

I will be back here again in the future!

Here for the first time. Asked server to wait on putting the  order for the ribs until I finished my salad.  Salad done she announced that the ribs were ready. They arrived colder than room temperature- the bones were actually COLD. I doubt they even got near a grill!! Luckily they are precooked!!

Oh my God!!!!  Best nachos ever!  The seafood salad has about 3 portions of meat including salmon, mahi mahi, shrimp and scallops (big ones too).  Incredible slaw.  The deal of the day is the wedge salad and pulled BBQ pork sliders during happy hour for only $5 each!!  Quiet ambiance.  We will be back soon.  My thanks to the staff and chefs.  The pulled BBQ pork and homemade slaw on the kettle chip nachos really surprised us all.  Very nice evening.

Another perfect night at one of our favorite neighborhood patios. The sun was shining, service was fantastic and the food delicious as always. It was really hard not to eat the chicken sandwich because it's so so so good!! But doing the low carb thing. Soup and salad - yum!

Great alternative from the usual (but good) brewpub, pizza scene. All the dishes are great. Fried chicken is phenomenal. Cocktails are alright but nothing to write home about. Service can be a bit slow sometimes so just relax and people watch on south Pearl.

Worst service ever!!!! I couldn't believe the place was empty! I don't think anyone was working except the bus boys. The bartender didn't even give me the time of day. No Hi or Hello I will be with you in one min, nothing. Server never even showed up at our table! We sat there for 15 min. Came over to Kaos and had the best service right away and this place is packed! 
I was really sad because when I saw the menu online I was sooo excited to try. I will never know and never be back.

Smoked Reuben on Ciabatta topped with this delicious relish.  Friendly story sharing staff.  Great beer menu (craft).  Did I mention the Smoked Reuben.  Meat is so tender and flavorful.  Right amount of smoke flavor without feeling like a briquette is in your mouth.  Finish with a rich slice of Carrot cake.....oh my!  Scandaloso!

What a wonderful brunch spot( bottomless drinks for $13 w/ entree) with a great patio. The food here is good ol' comfort food.. Mac'n Cheese , chicken an waffles.. Or some wonderful salads. Never really disappointed with 1472 unless they run out of items or their Host is off hanging with her friends chatting . 

Been here on multiple occasions where we waited forever before seating ourselves and seeing the host chatting with her friends. Anyyyyways....Back to the good... 
The bartender Veronica is wonderful! (Along with the other waitstaff) everyone is so attentive ! It really is a wonderful neighborhood restaurant and bar that often has fun dinners that are paired with certain beers or whiskey! Super fun! Check them out, you won't be sorry.

I was really surprised to see the 3.5 star rating for this restaurant.  We went for an early dinner on a Friday night, got great service, and loved our food.  I always taste my four-year-old's food to make sure it's decent and his mac and cheese was delicious!!  My husband and I shared the wedge salad and it's a good thing we did -- it was huge.  I had the pulled pork nachos as my dinner (because sometimes that's how I like to eat when I decide to come off my clean eating norm) and it was so good I'll order it again: pulled pork and jalapeños on top of -- wait for it -- homemade potato chips!  Top it all with cheese and coleslaw.  I know, I wasn't totally sold when I ordered but after one bite, I was in love.  Really really good...I want to do a healthier version with baked sweet potato chips and remove the cheese and coleslaw...or try a healthy version of the coleslaw...hmmm

Short story: come try the food.  And eat out on the patio or on the roof deck if you can.

Excellent. ordered appetizer of corn crab beignets 6 large balls delish. dinner I got the boneless fried chicken, Mac cheese and au gratin potatoes. Again all delish. Service excellent, manager asked how I was enjoying the crab beignets, hostess Mallory was friendly as well. Free WiFi too. Obviously I took half my entree home. Large portions here.

We stumbled upon this place whilst searching for a new place.  We now make it a weekly ritual of going to the farmers market on Pearl St. and this place in conveniently located in the middle of it.

I really have nothing bad to say. Tylee was our server and she rocked.  Funny, friendly, and advised us well on the menu.  They have southern food with a little bit of a twist.  Jess got biscuits and gravy, but the gravy was green chili (pretty damn tasty too).  I had possibly the best chicken and waffles ever.  The portion was too darn big to finish off and still feel good about myself so I made Tylee take it away as I cried a little.  

The decor reminded me exactly of what I've seen in New Orleans, the patio was nice but a bit cramped.  This is probably in our top three favorite brunch spots now, you can bet your sweet bippy we'll be back!
Totally mediocre dining with awesome location and fabulous patio.

Nice, quaint, classic South Pearl restaurant with comfortable, shaded patio. Pretty inside with older wood floors and nice setting, romantic. Had the Blackened Catfish Sandwich which was absolutely delicious. Several different flavors combined with fish to make an unexpectedly delicious sandwich. Well done. Same experience as previous reviewer about toilet. Had to take back off toilet to fix their plumbing in order to flush toilet!! Really? Fix the dam thing. Other than that, I would return to try dinner as I was impressed with the restaurant setting, atmosphere, and food.
Unique and fun drinks! The patio was comfortable and the service was great.  I didn't have an opportunity to try the food.

Great southern food kicked up a notch with excellent recipes, flavors and ingredients. The fried chicken with or without waffles is amazing, one of the best I've ever had. The seafood features are awesome. We highly recommend the corn & crab beignets - think hush puppy round and pure awesomeness. Our server, Jamie, was fantastic and helped us with the menu and suggestions, was spot on with the table and the water. We will be back for brunch for sure!

I like this place!  I have been here twice now, about a year apart, and the fried green tomato caprese was excellent each time.  I love fried green tomatoes, so it's always nice to find a place that serves them and serves them well.  They also have a unique twist on scallops and bacon, instead of being bacon wrapped the scallops sit on top of thick slabs of bacon.  Yum!  They also have good cocktails.  Cool place!

This is my go-to brunch location for the weekends. The rooftop patio is often too busy or reserved, so I am eager to try that still. The food is yummy and served hot, which is always a thing to report. Mediocre warm food happens more often than not in most places, but not here! The chicken and waffles is pretty good, but it's the Breakfast Sandwich or French Toast that really knock my socks off.

And let's not forget the bottomless breakfast beverages! Best Mimosas on Pearl street, and I love that you don't have to stick with the same drink each time you order. If you get 2-3 drinks, than its more than worth your money. Just remember to show up before 3pm! Will definitely be going back again and again.

While visiting with friends in Denver we went to this place for dinner. They have been to this place before and said it was good. We ordered the nachos and they were outstanding. We didn't have a meal but the service was good and the location was great. We had a great time.

CIGARETTE & CIGAR SMOKE is routine from their terrible neighbor Stella's next door.  I wish I could rate this a place a four, which I would gladly do, but the systemic Cigarette and CIGAR SMOKE from Stella's Coffee next door simply ruins most clients' meals again and again.  1472's owners have got to find a solution with their terrible neighbor Stella's.  FYI, I've had the seafood salad at least three times and it's always a delicious, fresh, huge meal.

Amazing, I can't explain how good the food is here...but be prepared, it's not in the traditional form you may be accustomed..... The Chicken sandwich, Rueben and ribs are my favorites.....give them a try...you will find yours!!

Restaurant Fourteen Seventy Two has some of the best Southern comfort food I have ever had, even in the South.  From the fried chicken to the country barley salad to the grits cakes to the fried green tomato caprese to the shrimp with grits, all the dishes I have had there have been superb.  The service has been first rate.  This is perhaps my favorite American restaurant in Denver.  Highly recommended.

Wanted to try something new last night, ended up here! Really liked the ambiance and liked the split level aspect. We sat in the bar area, which was intimate and inviting. Was a little chilly outside so wanted to start with a soup. Got the She Crab soup and it was really delicious. My husband ordered the rack of ribs, which very easily came off the bone and had great flavor. I had the fried chicken, which as a whole, was exactly what I was looking for. It came with two boneless chicken breasts, perfectly breaded/fried. Sides were macaroni and cheese and asparagus. Both were delicious, though i thought the macaroni was a tad too cheesy and the asparagus was the really skinny kind, so i couldn't pick it up with my silverware. However, was overall very pleased with our meals and am intrigued to go back for brunch.

We came in for my brothers 30th birthday, and upon arriving were told there was only one server and it was getting kind of busy. Seeing the amount of business we were a little nervous to sit but thought we would give it a chance, and it was fantastic. Although she was very busy, our server Jamie, was on top of everything and very friendly. Everyone at the table enjoyed their food as well!!! Definitely will be back.

We went here after a girls night workout session and promptly very happily ate all our calories back. The owner made us amazing martinis and then went and above and beyond ordering us the corn beef meets brisket sandwich which was delicious.  The jalapeño ranch dressing was also just what everyone wants to dip their fries in. We did eat our salads too.  The barley salad was light and filling. overall a wonderful patio experience. we will be back.

1472 is a nice brunch place. We had bacon and scallops for the appetizer and they mostly serve you scallops. I'm Southern, so I had the blackened catfish with the mashed yams and Key Lime pie for dessert. Very good eats!!

Roof top deck is great with a big covered area ... highly recommend the upstairs ... but the downstairs inside and the front patio don't disappoint either.  Had a great burger, but another said the Mac n Cheese was more than a little bland. Very comfortable atmosphere, but prices are a bit more expensive than average
I have to say, the service was 5 star, the food wasn't bad, but some of it was a bit on the confusing side

As a southerner i love the cuisine, and i had very high hopes. However this restaurant feels like it is already out of business. The staff doesn't care. The food mediocre at best. The drinks weak. Put a fork in this place, it is done...from "chef" to "bartender," ain't no one care about anything.

Stop in with a friend after a dance performance at The Fleming Mansion for a night cap.  Place clean and service staff was warming and friendly.  Cocktails were great and enjoy meeting manager of the restaurant.  Great stop for brunch, lunch and dinner with friends and family.  Looking towards to their taste menu.

Loved the food! We got the fried chicken, pork sliders, and the blackened catfish. All amazing. The Mac was great, fried chicken perfect (ask for their BBQ with it) and the best was the pulled pork mixed with the Mac n cheese! So good!!

Our server was great. However, the food was totally uninspired. I had the salad with seafood. I will say the seafood portion was generous. However, the greens were barely passable as fresh. The seafood was bland. Totally mediocre. My date got shrimp and grits. We both love shrimp and grits - make them at home too. These were also so bland. No flavor, no southern flair. We were disappointed to be sure especially given the price point. I really like the location and ambience so we may try again some day.

We went last night for a friend's birthday dinner. After looking at the menu, I was excited to give it a try. Let me start by saying that our server was awesome. He was attentive, funny and was the only positive thing I can attribute to this restaurant. 

If you are starving, DO NOT GO HERE. Their service is slower than molasses. I'm happy to wait for food when the server tells you certain menu items will take a certain time to make, or if the place is packed. The restaurant wasn't even half full and it took about an hour to get our food...most of us ordered salads without protein. We then waited another 30 minutes to get the dessert we ordered for her birthday.

When we got our salads, one of my friends noticed there was MOLD inside the raspberries on her salad. Raspberries can go bad really quickly, but really? At a restaurant? I should have ordered the dressing on the side because it was SOAKED in it. A wilted salad with moldy raspberries for $12? I decided to add shrimp to my salad for $9....I got 3 medium sized shrimp.....for $9?! Unreal.

I won't be going back here. You can get better food, at a better price, that doesn't take an hour.

I also stopped in with the Living Social deal.  I thought the atmosphere was cozy upon first walking in. There were only 2 other tables of patrons there so it was pretty quiet, and with a whole place pretty much empty we were sat at a table right up against another group and up against a door which at first seemed a bit odd. Thankfully, the table didn't end up to be drafty and we weren't completely bumping up against the other table, though it might have been nicer to have had our own space for conversation since there were plenty of tables, but I guess we could have asked to be moved too. I made a reservation online, but they had to set the table up once I got there...when they weren't busy.

Our server went down the menu commenting on various items as "#1 seller" which applied to many of them and seeming was his way of making an interesting recommendation. 

We went with the fried green tomato caprese as an app which didn't disappoint (though I don't think it was a #1 seller). The tomatoes were cooked very crispy with out being greasy. 

I am from the south and LOVE shrimp and grits, but sadly have found most places that serve it out here to be disappointing, especially Lucille's.  That said, the shrimp and grits here was outstanding.  I had it on the goat cheese grits.  It had a very strong smokey flavor that was different but delicious. There was way more sauce than grits and shrimp so I asked for some bread to go along with it so that I could enjoy more of the sauce. We were brought a small 1/2 of a cibatta roll that was about the size of a pop tart, but it helped hit the spot. 

My friend had the salmon; the presentation was great and she said it was really good. 

Our service after the initial part of the visit was appropriately attentive as not to be overbearing but to allow us to enjoy the food and our chat. 

If you haven't been in this area before, it's right by Sushi Den. Just go ahead and park 2 blocks away and walk over. It is not worth the headache to try to fight for a spot close (which isn't likely anyhow).  I made the mistake of circling around for 15 minutes trying to find a spot and never saw anything just for this place and it wasn't a big night for dining out.  You also need to make sure to pay attention to the parking signage in the area since it is heavily residential. I saw several DPA's out issuing tickets. 

That said, I would definitely visit this place again & would really like to check it out in the warmer weather to get to enjoy the patio.

Came by with a LivingSocial deal and was secretly fearing an over-priced / overly-complicated-but-too-small dishes, but was pleasantly surprised by what we had. Think southern fusion cooking.

I had the lamb and bison meatloaf with vindaloo sauce - wow! I ordered meatloaf, and with vindaloo sauce you ask? Yes. It made me completely rethink how meatloaf should be served. The zesty vindaloo went perfectly with the lamb and bison. The seasonal veggies were extremely flavorful as well with plenty of garlic, and the bourbon sweet potato mash was tasty too, though I would have liked a bit more influence from the bourbon.

The lady had the southern fried chicken, which was out-of-this-world good. The chicken was cooked perfectly, and the batter was so well seasoned that I joked it had crack in it. She got it with the mac 'n cheese and the bourbon sweet potato mash, and I have to say that their mac is some of the best we've had.

Service was very nice too, and the decor is very nice. So why not 5-stars? There are two levels - the upper which appears to be more quaint and quiet, and the lower which is still a dining area but has the bar and can be very loud. We could barely hear each other across our table due to the Saturday night crowd at the bar. However, I will say they have a nice little craft beer offering that I was not expecting. No Falling Rock or Freshcraft, but not too shabby for this type of establishment.

In short: awesome food, and next time we'll try to sit up top.
The chicken and waffles are amazing!  Great place for brush and amazing staff!

I wasn't terribly impressed by this place on our first visit which has been almost two years ago and probably would never have gone back but there was a Living Social deal out there - $13 for $30.  So, I thought we'd try it again on a nice day.  And, today was a very nice day indeed - especially to sit out on their little patio.  So, off we went.

Pretty quiet today but not totally deserted like on our last visit - front patio was full.  The owner gave us a nice table for four (just the two of us).  Very comfortable and just enough sun to keep the chill off.

I still have somewhat of an issue that they don't have a "lunch" menu and if you are paying full price (sans coupon) it's probably more expensive than we would normally do plus you cannot be in a hurry.  Service is not what you'd call quick.  Can't imagine you could get in and out in an hour.  No problem for us and we didn't mind the slow pace.

As she almost always does when they are on the menu she had the mussels - blue PEIs, andouille sausage, sweet onion, white wine and ciabatta (not house made) - $14 but a generous bowl full and she ate every one with gusto.  I couldn't make up my mind but their 1472 house burger sounded tempting - 50/50 venison and beef, fried green tomato, caramelized onions, red eye gravy, melted swiss on a brioche bun - $14.  It was cooked a perfect medium and as big as my head.  Had to whack it in half to begin to approach it and only managed to dispatch half.  Really excellent fries on the side.

I thought the food was amazing and with our "deal" we only shelled out about $15 plus the $13 for the coupon (she had a glass of wine so that bumped it up a bit).  They hype their open to 6pm "happy hour" which I don't consider happy at all.  A Bloody Mary was $5.95 on HH - cant imagine what it costs at non-happy hour prices so I passed.  

Netting it out - nice location, lovely patio on a gorgeous Colorado afternoon, and excellent food.  I'd go back in a heart beat - especially if a "deal" comes around again.

To be fair, before writing this review I reached out to the manager and head chef of the restaurant and amazingly they chose to ignore me. So here's what happened: On Sunday, my boyfriend  and I were visiting the farmers market and stumbled upon your patio. We
 figured it was the perfect place to break and enjoy brunch before  walking back through the market. It was a beautiful day and absolutely perfect for patio brunching. The hostess was awesome and sat us  immediately. After we were seated we were completely forgotten about
 and then blatantly ignored. We smiled and made eye contact with every employee that came near us thinking maybe we were just sat in a bad location. We were looked at by a blonde female server and a dark haired male server twice on two different occasions yet no one
 approached or even smiled back. We began to feel as though we were a problem that no one wanted to deal with. The restaurant was not busy by any means and there were open tables. After sitting there for about 15 minutes the hostess came and sat another group right next to us.
 She looked at us, asked to take one of the chairs from our table and then left. We didn't have any drinks so it was pretty obvious that no one had helped us. We then started to question what in the world was going on. Everyone knew we were sitting there yet no one wanted to
 help us. After sitting there almost 20 minutes we gave up. We approached the hostess stand and asked for the contact information of a manager. This is honestly the best part of the story. Not only did the hostess provide your information but she provided a card and explained how to contact you and that you are also the chef. What she didn't do was ask us why in the world we were asking for this information. The blonde server was standing right there as well.
 Neither of them even bothered to ask us what was going on or what happened or offer to help. I've never been so disappointed in service. I've had bad service but never a complete lack of service. Needless to say, we won't be going back and after being ignored by those I contacted; I hope no one attends this restaurant.

Presentation  of food was top notch. Should have read menu description before ordering. Arrived between Lunch and dinner- so only apps/soup/drinks available. Hmm not too good for a Saturday afternoon, but- lots of yummy sounding appetizers- so we stayed. Fried green tomato capresenappetizer is a 5++ amazing! Tuna tartar- (where perhaps the menu would have enlightened us)- not a fan at all, the lemon overpowered the entire dish, it was difficult to tell the quality of the tuna the way it is served- def a disappointment. The bacon/scallops ehh- not a huge fan of the bacon back, the scallops tasted amazing though. Pork nachos were good (BBQ pork also amazing)- just the chips left much to be desired. Such a shame the food was a disappointment they do get 5 stars for the awesome waiter and ambience. 60.00 for one beer (also amazing) and 3 apps? Hmm won't be returning again.

Tries really, really hard but I think it's hit and miss.   

Came with friends and they loved everything.  I was a little bit more on the "it's okay" side.  Two of them split the low-country boil.  It looked good and the portion was generous.  Three had the shrimp and grits, which received raves.

I had the steak sandwich, which was flavorful but so, so tough.  From the bread to the meat, I felt like a big dinosaur ripping apart a smaller dinosaur with my teeth and my tiny, tiny forearms.  The potatoes that came with it were a cold, greasy lump.  I don't know what they were but after two bites I was done.  

The corn and crab "beignets" were really just overly fried fritters.  Not sure what the fuss is about I thought they were greasy and tough.  Devilled eggs were the blandest I'd ever tasted.  Totally forgettable.
  
Service was very good.

Probably don't get much low country cooking in Denver so it's worth checking out.

Sunday brunch with my friend. Let's start with the good stuff. The manager and servers are really nice.Patio seating was soaked with the sun. They also were OK with the free flow champagne rather than the mimosa.

But when it comes to the order, way below average. Mine and the friends's order was mixed up and they gave me the exact opposite than what I wanted. Somehow my vegetarian omelet was pathetically half a plate with 3 pieces of bacon. I had to order two sides because the food was not enough.... who knows each side of coleslaw costs $5. For all of these we waited forever. 

It made me feel like that I can cook better at home myself.

This place has good ambiance, has outdoor seating, and mostly quality food. That is the good. Service is and had always been very, very slow. Our sangria took a while (server mentioned it might, not sure why) and it was just average I would say. Ordered fried green tomatoes, server missed an opportunity to mention you only get 3 since we had 4 people. Not a huge deal but it would have been nice. Wife enjoyed her shrimp and grits, my po boy was pretty good. I was missing the remoulade and I had to ask for it. Bread made eating annoying, would prefer a roll. It was a sloppy mess. If service wasn't so slow, I'd go back sooner than later.
Not impressed with the place. The service was subpar. The bartender was more interested in talking than serving and asking customers what they need

SUNDAY August 25th 2013

We came here for Brunch.  The time for the Brunch was at 12 noon.  We were seated immediately coz we had a reservation for a Party of 7.

We were seated "inside/outside", next to the Bar.

We shared and ordered this items :

*  Steamed Mussels ($12.00)
*  Corn & Crab Beignets ($10.00)
*  Conch Chowder ($10.00)
*  Seafood Salad ($17.00)

My friends opt to order these following items :

*  1 Seafood Salad Bowl ($17.00)
*  2 order of Grit Cake Benedicts ($22.00)
*  1 Gator Benedict ($13.00)
*  1 Chicken & Waffles ($14.00)
*  1 Biscuits & Gravy with Option of Scrambled Eggs ($10.00)
*  1 Bottomless Mimosa ($9.95)
*  1 Key Lime Pie
*  1 Coffee ($2.50)
*  1 Bloody Mary on the Rocks ($6.00)

There were plenty of Alcoholic Drinks, that my friends consumed which I lost count aka to note.

Our lovely Server her name is Lori.  I think and feel that, that morning/afternoon, this establishment MIGHT BE Understaff.

It took awhile for our food especially the "SHARED APPETIZERS" of Steamed Mussels, Corn & Crab Beignets and Conch Chowder to be ready.  ALMOST Like to about 45 minutes from the time we were seated and order our food.  When the food came out, ALOT OF FLIES SWAMPED TO OUR Table.  I so wish that the Staffs or The Management can do something about those FLIES.  

We took notice that the Bowl Of Steamed Mussels, ALOT OF the Mussels were LEFT UNOPENED, hence we voice our concerns, and our lovely server rectify the problem immediately.  After a few minutes of waiting, we get a FRESH NEW BOWL Of Steamed Mussels which, the Broth Tasted Way Better than the First Bowl Of Steamed Mussels and the 2nd Batch/2nd Bowl, ALL The MUSSELS are open, aka GOOD To Be Consumed. 

Everyone like what they ordered and shared.  The SEAFOOD SALAD, was indeed plenty to share around.  The highlight dishes were the Corn & Crab Beignets.  EVERYONE Likes the Corn and Crab Beignets THE BEST.  Though I think at first glance, the Corn and Crab Beignets were "Over-Fried", the Corn & Crab Beignets were Crunchy outside, lots of "Juicy Shredded Crab Fillings inside with plenty of  Corn.

The Conch Chowder, though the broth is flavorful, UNFORTUNATELY there are NOT Much of Conch inside the Chowder, more to dice potatoes and other vegetables in it.

I was VERY Disappointed with my order of Ceviche ($13.00).  Too much of Citrus aka LIME in the Ceviche.  The Tuna tends to be "over-cooked" by the time it reached to my table.  DEFINITELY NOT ORDERING THOSE AGAIN.  My Bad...  NOTE TO SELF : DO NOT ORDER THE CEVICHE, from a "Southern" Establishment...

All in all, its AN-OKAY Establishment to dine in.  To RETURN its a MAYBE, BUT NOT IN A HURRY.  Since it was a BIRTHDAY Party for a friend, 6 of us, shared the cost and each of us paid about $35 which includes tips and tax.  

Take note they included the 20% Gratuity in the receipt since we have a PARTY of 7.  

GM : Dave Chmura & Rob Young

Fourteen Seventy-Two, LLC
1472 S. Pearl Street
Denver, CO 80210
USA
http://www.fourteenseventytwo.com

Left this establishment almost at about 15:00hrs ish.

@183/2013

We came here with a Living Social deal, and we really enjoyed our food. We got the Corn and Crab Beignets, which we were told was the #1 seller of the restaurant. They were very rich, but my partner loved them. I then ordered the Southern Style Chicken, which was a huge portion of chicken, mac n cheese, and broccolini. Very good, and I make my own fried chicken. My partner got the smoked pork sandwich with ham and gruyere, and this was the really stellar dish. We saved most of the sandwich for dinner, after eating there for lunch, because we had so much food, and it was STILL AMAZING. Even after being re-heated in the toaster oven. Now I want to go back and just get that pork sandwich. My partner and I are both good cooks, and we cook our fair share of southern food, so impressing us is hard. That pork, though, was phenomenal. 

Surprisingly, my least favorite things were the mac and fries. The fries were a bit hard, as in, undercooked. And the mac was good, it just wasn't the star of the meal. 

The price is a little high though, so this will have to be a special occasion restaurant.

I am pretty darn impressed with this place. We stopped here for brunch before heading to the farmers market. The place itself is really nice. It looks like a place you would see in the French Quarter. 
We sat outside on the patio to enjoy the 20 minutes of sunshine that graced Denver last Sunday. Our server Tylee was really friendly and fun. We ordered bottomless Bloody Mary's. 
Jeff had chicken and waffles. It looked amazing. From my couple of tastes I almost developed food envy. Lucky for me my biscuits and gravy were amazeballs so food envy was avoided. I liked the spin on biscuits and gravy. Instead of heavy white gravy they use green chili with bison meat. And the ginormous cheddar biscuit was so good!
We noticed on the menu that they have brunch appetizers. We didn't order any ourselves but I think this is a genius idea! Everything on the menu looked amazing. 
I will be going back to try the gator benedict and the fried green tomato benedict. 
Everything was affordable. Portions were huge. Everything was tasty. Fantastic service. Yup, we'll be back.

Bartender told us tables are for "reservation only". We were the only people in there at 5:30-6:30. Really tacky. Ended up just getting drinks because she rubbed us the wrong way. Decided to eat at sushi den instead. Nice atmosphere though.

Decent food. Nice to try somewhere new! 
My Benedict eggs and shrimp were over cooked. Good flavor! Would probably come back.

The food is always beyond delicious and the drink selection is great. The fried chicken is a staple and always hits the spot. Tried the mussels for the first time last night and it took a lot of will power to not drink the sauce from the bowl after the mussels were fully enjoyed because it was so good. Definitely recommend to all of my friends, especially for date nights.

Just had dinner at this place. Classy interior, great patio, non-pretentious attitude. My friend and I split the macaroni and cheese and the chicken and waffles. No complaints. The Mac and cheese had Panko crumbs topping it and had a gooey cheese mixture. The chicken and waffles - fried chicken, off the bone, not-too-greasy white meat layered on top of a fluffy buttermilk Belgium waffle with maple syrup and bacon bits. Phenomenal. Happy hour until 6, so we each had a $5 glass of house wine. Huge portions. Could've had one entree and split it and been contentedly full. Instead, we are everything. And as full as we were, very pleased. Attentive waitstaff as well.

I went here for my birthday brunch yesterday and it was awesome!! 

I think it is so cool how they have bottomless breakfast drinks (although they need to update their online menu, it is $12.95 not $9.95). Also, you can switch up your drink. So if you want a bloody, mimosa, cape cod, or screwdriver, or several or all of the above, you got it!

There was a TV close enough for us to watch some of the game which was nice, glad it wasn't a bunch of in your face TV's but was there for those who were interested. 

I was originally going to order chicken & waffles but the fatty in me just couldn't do it when I found out it was a pulled chicken and not fried. That sounds gross on a waffle.

I had the breakfast sandwich and the fancy potatoes, forget what they are called. They were out of sausage though, bummer. Most of my table ordered the breakfast sandwich and everyone was pretty happy with it. Hubby had the steak & eggs which was so good! Someone else had a burger and it was just okay, nothing special. The deviled eggs had a great flavor.

Lauren did a great job, she had to take care of several tables and managed to pull it off. Although drinks did take a while, it was just because she was swamped. Good thing they have food runners.

The bill wasn't too startling, but it is a nice place so don't expect cheap. There was a 20% gratuity added to our bill since we had 9 people there.

Highly reccomend!

I went with a friend last night for dinner.  It was cold and rainy; perfect weather for comfort food!  I had the fried chicken with macaroni/cheese and veggies.  YUMMY!  I'd say it was the best fried chicken I've ever had!  And the mac/cheese was VERY tasty!  My friend had a sandwich (???) that she LOVED and the goat cheese grits, which she said were pretty good.  

Our server was great!  He didn't rush us and was very attentive.

I'll be back!  Hopefully on a sunny day to take advantage of their awesome deck!

Had a living social offer. Good, friendly but slow service. I ordered a blackberry basil cocktail-not too sweet, good. The fried green appetizer was delicious. The crab corn beignet was pretty good, a little on the cold side for our taste. After 2 of them you get your fill. The fried chicken with Mac and cheese was tender and tasty. Mac and cheese was average+we think its always relative to your taste. 
It's a restaurant worth checking out. I would give it it 3.5-4. Overall good just not a wow.

Giving this place one star strictly due to location, ambiance, and the fact that they serve alcohol.  I've been three times now and can't say that any one thing will get me to go back or recommend this place to anyone else.  The customer service is terrible - plan on waiting.  The food only subpar - had The Fourteener Burger which was very bland.  Memos are all juice.  Moonshine for every mixed drink to keep a southern vibe...not all that good.

We went yesterday and the place looked packed - we were told the wait was 45 minutes despite seeing four tables open.  My friend went in to ask about them and we were all of a sudden sat right away.  So much for 45 minutes?  Once we finally sat at a table in the bar, we waited over 20 minutes without a waitress stopping by...despite asking for service.  We also tried to order drinks from the bartender directly who disappeared for just as long.  Needless to say we got up and left without spending a dime.

Each time I've gone here it seems so disjointed, the food is lack luster, and no one seems to care.  I'm honestly surprised this place has stayed in business so long.  Don't waste your time or money...unless you simply want a cold beer on a warm day, it just won't seem worth it.

What I like about 1472: Unlimited breakfast drinks. You can have a mimosa, bloody mary back to mimosa and so on. The patio is to die for and the location is great. 

The fried green tomato Benedict is just okay and mashed potatoes and breakfast just didn't work for me. 

The biscuits were good. 

I will probably be back just for the patio and drinks.

Had dinner with friends last night, and Rob (one of the owners) waited on us. These guys are as friendly as they come, and the food was incredible. They actually went to whole foods to buy chocolate chips to put on a desert!! Incredible service, food...I will be a regular...
Only had drinks and appetizers but the apps were awesome. Had the heirloom tomato and mozzarella one and the crab and corn beignets. Nice patio too. Will be back to try dinner.

Busy Saturday night.  We went to wait at the bar.  The patio area hostess was completely MEH.  We were never given menus at the bar.  The mojito was okay, but it seemed sweetened with something besides simple syrup.  Like maybe some chemical sugar substitute.

We were seated at a table in the pet area.  No one ever came to the table after that.  I had to get up and snag a guy.  He seemed surprised.  What a joke.  He was a good server once we got him, except he never brought the BOTTLE of wine to the table.  It seems they have a huge disconnect between the server and the rest of the staff....

Food was pretty good EXCEPT the pathetic scallop and bacon app.  They actually took a couple of scallops, sliced them on the round, and then tried to pass them off as several scallops instead of two--not to mention horribly over-cooked.  A totally lame app.

The fried chicken was terrific and so was the mac and cheese.  I also really liked the catfish.
This is a quality restaurant with a good atmosphere located at the cute South Pearl Street area. Overall very consistent food and drinks. The steamed mussels appetizer is amazing!

Went here with my brother in law and his daughters, 19 and 21.  We were very pleased.
  The scallops with bacon appetizer and the green tomato caprese were both big hits.  Rather than the expected bacon strips the scallops came with large smoked bacon chunks.  I thought the bacon might overwhelm the scallops, but no.  The fried green tomato slices came atop generous rounds of fresh mozzarella atop a ripe red tomato. A delight.
I ordered the beef ribs.  It was topped with a small lobster tail, sided with potatoes gratin and asparagus.  All perfect, though more potato than I wanted.  
C liked her order but half her plate was shell macaroni in cheese, twice as much as she could eat.
R and S both had the shrimp and grits.  Large shrimp, tasty grits, but twice what a person could eat.  They would have liked less but with some sides.
Dessert was the peach bread pudding.  Delicious.
They were out of Zinfandel, I had a Pinot noir.  R had a Lagunitas.
Service was superb.  Tab was $160 for four with appetizers and drinks.

The place is really cute, the music was jazzy, and we sat on the charming patio. The owner was walking by the door when we arrived so he greeted us and was very welcoming. My husband and I are from the south and we recommend the shrimp and grits here, as well as the crab beignets. Mind you that the dishes here are not authentic southern dishes, but they are southern dishes with a twist, which makes them unique but still delicious.
The fries green tomatoes caprese was such a surprise! Light and super tasty. Try it!
Our server was very efficient.
I'm usually not into dessert after dinner but the chocolate chip cookie made to order on a skillet with a scoop of chocolate ice cream was to die for!!!!!!!!!!!!

What a great place to have brunch! This place is big on Southern flavors. Portions are great and they also serve bottomless drinks: mimosa, bloody mary, screw driver, and a cape codder all of which are interchangeable. You can definitely get your fill of booze and linger over breakfast.

The building the restaurant is housed in is great. They have a roof deck, an outdoor patio and an indoor patio as well which is where my friends and I dined. Perfect on an overcast day. 

At 11am when we stopped by this place wasn't busy at all which I was shocked by given its location and also it's very delicious menu that's different from what all the popular places in town offer.

My friends and I enjoyed the Fried green tomato egg benedict, chicken and waffles, and low country skillet. I personally enjoyed the low country skillet but wasn't crazy about the way the crawfish were cooked, but the chicken and waffles dish i tried was so good. A great combination of sweet and savory.

My friends and I said that we would decidedly come back here again.

I only gave 4 stars as there is a little bit of lack of attentiveness by servers.
Really slow and bad service. Tried it twice and was let down both times when it took 45 minutes to just get a drink and half the groups food came out cold.

Still great food but have made some changes to the menu that are not for the best. The original chicken and waffles were a pulled chicken roasted in a maple syrup glaze and now it's regular fried chicken and waffles. So if you go check out the crab beignets and the pecan waffles. Also on the weekends bottomless beverages for brunch including mimosas, bloody Mary's, and screwdrivers.

This is now a go-to for my brunch needs.  And while it's not quite in my neck of the woods, the food and the service were enough to get me to venture a little further.  Also, they take reservations which can be a lifesaver when not trying to wait around for hours, thus wasting your whole weekend day.

I met up with some girlfriends for brunch on a Sunday and was more than excited to be able to sit out on the patio (and be warm) in the fall. They have a great patio--perfect for dining and people watching. Two stories of patio, in fact.

I started with a Bloody Mary, because that's what you do.  It's brunch, ya'll. We shared the barley salad which i promptly tried to recreate at home the next week.  Arugula, barley, cranberries, apples and goat cheese...yum.  Then, I ordered the grit cake benedict and was more than pleased.  The grits were good (although I'm no expert) and the shrimp and the creole sauce were on point. 

Service was attentive, but mellow.  Which is exactly what I want on a warm sunday.

Phenomenal scallops, great black cherry old fashioned. Excellent service, and fantastic physical space. The hustle and bustle of Pearl Street just adds to the great experience while sitting outside at 1472- giant patio area. I would definitely go back next time I'm staying in Platt Park or visiting Denver.

Not super gluten free friendly for brunch. I had the fried green tomato Benedict with a plane tomato. I felt like the hollandaise was a little disappointing. The wedge salad was amazing and my husband raved about the fourteen we burger and sauce. I may need to give it another try for something other than brunch.

I had a lunch reservation earlier this week at 1472, used to go all the time since I live in the neighborhood... When I arrived with my guests, the doors were locked and not a soul in sight. This was my last straw with this place. I wont go back.

don't let the "denver decor" fool you, it's dee-licious!!! saddle up to the bar and let those cute brothers wait on you. they will ensure you are happy with a full belly. they also make a mean(proper) irish coffee. i've been there multiple times for brunch and they nail it every time. my boyfriend is crazy for their fried chicken sandwich. i personally have loved everything i've tried. go there

There was a large group of us that came for a birthday brunch celebration. When we had called we had requested the rooftop patio. We get there and there is a sign that says patio closed, and it was just for our group, which to me was awesome.

Our waiter, Tom, was outstanding. Went through the entire menu with us, told us what he liked what he didn't care for, things to substitute other things for. He awesome and attentive. We did the bottomless brunch and he brought out pitchers for our table to share. They were never empty, he was always replenishing them. 

Now the food was AMAZING. We got the fried green caprese to start it was amazing. We had also asked how the She Crab soup was and he ended up bringing us a sample just to try it. Everything looked great, their green chili with biscuits and gravy was delicious. I got their breakfast sandwich, also really good and huge as well. Nothing I would complain about at all.

It does take a while for you to get your food, but with endless mimosas in your face and great company you can't really complain at all. I am definitely going back!

Patio dining in January in Denver - we got lucky
Started with sangria & Monte Cristo roll - plentiful.
Blackened catfish w/ sweet potato mash was excellent.
Meatloaf was good, perhaps too much sauce but flavorful.
Key Lime Pie was delicious.
Daniel was unobtrusive, there when needed - thanx.
Will return for brunch on a warm day...
Tried the restaurant on a Sunday morning and food/service were sub par. Food was cold and drinks were never refilled. We also only saw server at end of meal with no quality control during the meal.

My sister and I were visiting Denver over the weekend. We searched brunch places for hours when we came across the menu here. Everything sounded amazing with it's Southern twist. We were also very excited to enjoy bottomless Blood Mary's. 
I called at 10 to see if we could make a reservation. The host was very sweet and gave us the good news that there was an opening for our requested time. When we arrived we were seated in the little sun room area towards the front. It was a bit chilly, but in less of 5 minutes of being there the general manager Josh moved a heater closer by because he noticed we were still wearing our jackets inside. Such service! It only got better from there. Josh helped us out on deciding what dishes to get. While we were deciding he kindly brought out a generous sample of their house made biscuit and chili. He said we had to try it! It was absolutely amazing. The biscuit was a perfect pairing with their flavorful meaty chili. 
We ended up choosing the French Toast and the special which was a slow roasted Pork Benedict. 
The bloody Mary's were perfect but lacking a garnish (celery, olive etc.) I had suggested pickled okra as a garnish and they brought some out for us. Then later as I was looking around I had noticed that others were now receiving the pickled okra in their bloody Mary's!!! 
The French Toast was so good, it had a coconut and frosted flake crust, topped with rum soaked pineapple. 
I will be back the next time I'm in Denver. Thanks for a wonderful experience.

I had high hopes for this place. The atmosphere  is nice, clean, and cozy. Unfortunately that is where the good part of this review ends. I was having lunch with my mother before my flight.

We arrived at 12:30. The place wasn't busy at all, and we were seated right away. Our order was taken 30 minutes later. This amount of waiting time is ridiculous.  

We ordered beers at the same time we ordered our food. They arrived about 15 minutes before our food did. 

We waited an hour for our food. 

I ordered the 1472 burger, medium. When it arrived it was a bit over cooked, and little dry. The flavor was good, but would have been amazing if prepared correctly. My fries were leaning toward the cold side. This is a big failure. 

My mother ordered the shrimp, and avocado salad. This too was very disappointing. The salad came with 4 shrimp, and very few thin slices of avocado. For $16 there should have been a half dozen shrimp and half an avocado on this salad. 

All in all we wasted over 2 hours for a mediocre meal. 

Our server was pleasant, but very slow. The overall experience was bad, and I won't be recommending this place to anyone. 

It's getting 2 stars because the burger has potential.

Big fan of this joint.  If you like creole/Cajun food in a relaxed atmosphere with good jams you should come by.  Conch stew, collard greens, grits, and so on. I live in the neighborhood and its an easy go to.  The service can be on the slow side sometimes, but if you've ever been to the south you'll know that's the norm so chill out.  Don't be such a foodie diva.

My aunt just bought a house in Denver on South Pearl, and scouting for a tasty place to eat in her new 'hood brought us here.  The blue crab and corn beignet were ridiculously rich and delicious; I'll be thinking about them 'til I can get back for more!  The fried green tomato caprese was OK, but there were large slices of red tomato at the bottom that were out of season (and so fairly tasteless).  This dish could be tasty in the summer, I'd give it another try.  The bottomless, mix-and-match cocktails at brunch (bloody marys, mimosas, cape cods, screwdrivers) were awesome.  Our server Rod was friendly, funny, and professional.  We loved it, and when we're in Denver, we'll definitely be back!

I've had brunch here three times, and none of the experiences have made me think of this as a go to place.   This is where we go during "brunch rush hour" because Gaia and the other restaurants have a 45 plus minute wait, but 1472 always has a table.  Which says a lot.  

The pros:  Attractive facility, friendly staff, great patio and balcony, a unique twist on the standards - meaning their chicken and waffles is roasted chicken, not fried, and their biscuits and gravy are not with sausage white gravy, but are with green chili.  

The cons:  The friendly staff is slow, their bottomless mimosas have a bottom that I found many times - and have had to ask for a refill, and have had to wait quite some time for said refill.  The WORST though, was when, FOR BRUNCH, they couldn't provide coffee.  COFFEE!!!  We had to go next door, stand in line forever at Stella's and buy our coffee there.  :(  They don't offer up the children's menu unless asked for, even if they see a 7 year old in the party.  

We will go back, mainly because of the location and the convenience of being able to seat a large party instantly.  I will give dinner a try sometime too.  South Pearl is a tough block though - and you really have to bring it a step up if you are going to compete with Gaia!

Awesome food... Great service... Intrresting story on the building... Love the laid back atmosphere. I had the lamb/bison meatloaf with the sweet potato mash and my lady had fried chicken with mac-and-cheese. Both them were a delicious fresh take on a comfy old favorite. I would recommend this place to anyone. It's a nice place that is not in downtown. Waiting for my fresh peach bread pudding desert. ;-)

Had their portaveggie burger, and let me tell you......   YUUUUUUMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!!!!! The atmosphere is unique. Solid service, great location. Check it out if your looking for some casual eats in the wash park neighborhood.

Recently took a client here for lunch and was extremely disappointed, so was my client. They have a great looking place in a prime location with friendly staff but the food was just plain bad.

It reminded me of something off of Kitchen Nightmares when Gordon goes in and the Chef says his food is a "10" and then Gordon finds stuff rotting food in the freezer. The food was poor, all of it. I had the blackened catfish, as did one of the other in our party. It was greasy and just bad. One of the others had a burger and it was over cooked and dry. The potatoes were like something you would find in a cafeteria. All in all I'd avoid this place.

Sorry for the harsh review but with a place like this you need the honest feedback, your food is no good. I'd post a help wanted sign and find a new chef.

I normally do not review, but I had to on this trip.  I dislike wasting money on shitty service and meh food.  Started off with Veronica the tender of the bar giving my pal cream for her coffee.  The cream curdled in the coffee, not normal and The tender, in a condescending tone brushed it off.  Food was mediocre and The tender added gratuity on our 5top! I spoke with Dave and he was cool, but we will not be venturing here again.  Meh

Great food, awesome patio, understaffed.

I went here on a date. We were seated immediately on their street-level patio. They have an upstairs patio too - so much outdoor seating. It then took at least 15 minutes for anyone to come to our table. That was a complaint with this place. They seemed to be very understaffed. The staff were very friendly but they need to hire more people.
