We started with drinks - their beer list was pretty good. We went in mid September and they still didn't have Pumpkin beers or Oktoberfests so I settled for a Porter. We also ordered an app to share - the Roll of Monte Cristo. SO good! 

I wanted to have the Goud Soup but they didn't have it yet - mid-September, you'd think they would. Instead I had the Bacon Wrapped Jumbo Scallions over sweet potatoes and apples. That dish was really good! The bacon wasn't as cripsy as I would have liked, but the rest was great!

My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles - very tasty and a very large serving.

Definitely worth stopping by. The food is all Southern and the patio is lovely. Be flexible with the menu and you'll love it.

Went here with friends for brunch on a Sunday and was very impressed. Staff was all very friendly, outdoor patio seating was perfect and we all enjoyed our meals. I ordered the French Toast and I have to say it was the best thing I've eaten in a long time! A bit pricey but worth it in my book. Will definitely return!
I ordered the Fried green tomato caprese- Delicious! The tomatoes were so fresh! I have had a lot of fried green tomatoes in my day from Charleston, SC. And this Chef was spot on!

My girlfriend and I were in Denver for a day of art museums and figured we'd look for a craft beer and a bite. We asked The Google for guidance and were led here to Lowdown Brewery. 
Our server, Danny, was awesome. I had a great Milk Stout and Julie had the namesake IPA. Ok, ok, we each had two. We had a smoked trout app plate and, as intended, it just made us hungrier.
What the hell. We ordered the Taos Pizza and built another from the build your own list.
The pizza was great, the beer was better and Danny, the self described Concierge of Denver, even helped us plan our Palm Springs trip in February.

I arrived in town late Monday evening and was craving a drink only to discover that most Denver breweries close early. Luckily close enough to my hotel was Lowdown Brewery, and they didn't close until 11pm, which allowed me enough time to check into the hotel drop off my bags and head out for a drink. I arrived to find a rather empty taproom, with only about 6 others which is to be expected on a Monday evening around closing time. Anyways we took a seat at the bar and were greeted by the friendly bartender who gave us a quick rundown on their beers. Much to my surprise they had over 10 beers on tap, so we decided to order two flights and just do a tasting of each.

My favorite was the Lowdown IPA, with a subtle ruby red grapefruit, tangerine, and pine flavor. I also tried the Nitro Lowdown IP which in my opinion which wasn't as good as the regular LowdownIPA.  Other greats were the Fest in Show (Oktoberfest) and the Tripel which were light and refreshing while delivering an excellent taste. My least favorite beer of the night was the Patio Pounding Pilz & the Tuggie Milk Stout, however I won't say they were bad, just not my taste. Dirty Shame was a pleasant surprise, as I usually don't like darker beer, however it was much better than I had expected. In addition to great beer there is also a pretty extensive food menu available serving up a variety of items, however I didn't manage to order any food this visit.

Overall Lowdown is a quality brewery, with extended hours that have you covered until at least 11pm, even later on weekends. Even with all of the breweries in Denver Lowdown is worth checking out, they have beer to fit anyone's taste!

I came here on a recommendation from our hotel (here on a visit). The food that was served to us is farm to table concept (which was amazing!) I especially enjoyed the fresh vegetables that we got and the homemade sauces that came with our meal. 

But the service on the other hand, was a complete bust. The older guy that was waiting on us wasn't the greatest. The place wasn't busy at all. There were a couple of tables and a couple of people at the bar. Ended up having to go up to the counter just to ask for the bill and to go boxes (waited for 20 minutes for him to come by). Then another 15 minutes went by until he came and dropped off the items. Then ended up taking the bill up to him in order to get our bill paid. If I didn't take it up to him, we would have waited even longer to get everything done.

Unfortunately I can't stand by a five-star rating anymore. I feel like the food and beer have both slipped in the past year or so. The kitchen seems less inspired than it was in the beginning. I've been underwhelmed with the food the last two times I've eaten here, and feel like Lowdown is probably more in the 3.5-star range. Good for a beer and bar snacks/pizza, but probably not a destination for dinner in the future.

I went to this brewery tonight and I had a fantastic experience! I got the pilsner beer and it was delicious. Also, the bbq chicken and the margarita pizza were both incredible. I think that his brewery should get more attention than it does. The brussel sprouts as an appetizer were also tasty and you get a good bang for your buck here.

All of the food looked great too and the waitress was very attentive of our group the entire time. They also have darts there so its a great place to bring friends!

Great experience at Lowdown. We came on a Sunday afternoon and found a spot on the patio. Great service, shade, chill music, excellent patio. 

We had both beer and food and both were great. Definitely get the Devils on Horseback!  The pizzas are pretty good also. Everyone in our group tried a different type of beer and was pleased. 

Add this to your list of must go breweries when in Denver!

Initially, I gave 3 stars, but changed to 4 because our server was outstanding. Very pleasant, helpful and quick. (I believe his name was Dan..?!) 
We went for a late night dinner, and was happy to see the menu had much more then your typical bar food. (sadly, only the apps and pizza were available when we visited..). None the less, I was able to order a pizza with goat cheese and prosciutto and it was delicious! A little pricey, but I would come back to try out the brews they carry!

Excited to check this place out last night since it was my first brewery experience here in Denver. 

My beer was good, not great. Maybe I'm just not a beer snob and can't tell the difference or something (and I fully admit my beer palate isn't that refined), but my white ale was nothing spectacular. I feel like I could've gone to the grocery store and gotten a Sam Adams white or some version like that and it would've tasted just as good. 

My pizza (I got the Lowdown) was sub par. It was good, but again, something I could've gotten in the freezer aisle at target. It was filling and tasted alright, but I would recommend you eat before you come here. 

I will say, I really liked the place though. The inside has exposed pipes, you can see the giant things they keep beer in (whatever it's called) and there's a lot of wood which gives the place a cool vibe. 

They nailed interior decorating, just wish they had nailed everything else too. On to the next one i guess.

Big patio, open dining area inside, loud inside, friendly service (if you haven't wondered where they've disappeared to), lots of beers, variety of food. I've been to this place quite a few times and am usually pretty happy with it. A variety of beers and food make it a good place to come to - not many breweries also have a full kitchen! The chicken sandwich, chicken thunder thighs entree, and hummus are all good options. I was pleasantly surprised with the Moroccan spices on the chicken entree. They have a variety of beers for all palettes - dark, hoppy, fruity, rich.. As well as a few guest taps and wine.

Great food- friendly staff, lively scene.  All around good time. Beets by Nick salad was tasty.  Also really liked the Black Saison.  The bartender was super friendly- lets try a few beers before deciding on one.

To be fair, I went here for brunch only, so I can't comment on their beer. However, their brunch is AWESOME! I got the Egg Meg Muffin pizza, which was soooo good! 

I took a look at their dinner menu, which was really impressive for a brewery, and my friend who is a frequent customer said they are always updating and changing the menu with great things!
AND to top it all off, the waiter (can't remember his name) was wonderful! So friendly and helpful!
I'll definitely come back for dinner and beer!!

This is a great Colorado brewery and local pub. The beer, atmosphere, and staff make this brewery and restaurant a joy to visit. I love the place the most when I sit at the bar and the wonderful Adam is pouring. His wit, charm, and good memory make you feel very happy with your decision to join  the other relaxed and hip customers at this convenient Capital Hill spot. 
I usually leave with a growler of Selfish or the IPA. The Golden Shower was an early summer favorite and a fun beverage to order. I love the ability to order beer in different sizes because the selection is really worth exploring. 
The kitchen does a great job with the pizzas and especially with the unusual ones such as pulled pork and scrambled eggs. Some of the other item I've had left something to be desired. The aluminum plates don't help.  But it's clear they care about food as well as great craft beer.

Holy cow! I've loved breweries for their craft beer selection... For their location (aka how close they are to home!) and for the atmosphere, staff and the place itself. 

We've had LowDown on our list of places to visit for close to a year, right before moving from Broomfield to Lakewood. Met a couple at one of our favorite breweries, NightHawk, who RAVED about Low Down. Ok, ok, we said. We'll go. 

Thank goodness for the iPhone reminder app!! Tonight was THAT night. 

LowDown has connection - the beer-tenders are awesome: immediately friendly and generally awesome. Very attentive and with great energy. 

LowDown has great (no, fantabulous) food... We had Devils on Horseback as an app (we could've eaten 59 more) and then we ordered the Beetza pizza. Anatomy? Crisp and thin crust, beet pesto, prosciutto, kale and goat cheese. Interesting combination on paper, and really tasty in your mouth!!

Atmosphere? LowDown is a great space - the feel reminds me of a bit industrial, simple and clean wood bar... Exposed piping above, well placed colorful prints interwoven with black and whites... Games galore behind the counter. We heard sounds of laughter behind us.... You sunk my battleship! Auuggghh.... Jenna blocks hitting the floor.... Rancorous laughter! Not too loud though, rather a nice mix mingling with the Will Smith Pandora radio station (think Ice, Ice Baby... And the song that played in Dangerous Kinds (side bar - great movie!) 

I know you already wanna go... And I haven't even gotten to the beer yet!! Take a look at the pics of the menu from other Yelpers... Really cool names! We both orders "The Ale Otherwise known as..... Porter" (re)named in honor of Prince's recent passing. Prince had some skills on bass.... He has a solo posted on YouTube - very impressive. Who knew? 

Back to the porter.... Only a few words needed here: 9.0 ABV. SMOOTH. Chocolate notes with banana and apple hints. Yep, I could have had 59 of this one too.... Good thing we had to catch a movie, otherwise, might've had to call a cab instead, lol. 

Don't be stubborn like we were. Stop reading and head that way :)

Nice brewery with great atmosphere. We came during the day so it was not too busy. We both got samples of 4 beers (all fantastic) and got a meat and cheese plate to share... our server was awesome and told us what cheeses to pair with beers!

Great decor and atmosphere. Friendly staff. Excellent beer that's true to style with many different styles. Food is on the eclectic side but delightfully presented and flavorful. Great music. Nice easy outdoor open seating. Not the biggest sports fans, but they're more than happy to put the game on for you.

Listen,i've been coming here for several months. I i've brought so many people here to this bar. Every single time it's the same experience over and over again. All the servers are smiling, the food is consistently great, the vibe stellar. After the months that I've been here I have consistently had exceptional service, a special shout out to Adam.

The food is top notch! I love how they have vegetarian options. The beer is good, but if you are a beer snob... not yet, not yet enough. I like how they have cornhole in the back. Also parking in the crazy-to-park area.

Today is 8/20/16. I was bummed when they didn't have the squash sandwich. I normally don't like portobello sandwiches, but this one was top-notch! The veggie food is great! I also highly recommend the side potatoes! I could have those for every meal.

I have been here now a few times.  The beer list isn't huge but there's something for everyone.  I usually get a wheat beer but they turned me on to a brew called "Sinister".  I really enjoyed it and actually feel like I could use one right now as I'm writing this review!

We had lunch here and really everything looked awesome.  I ordered the the Beets by Nick -Roasted beets, goat cheese, herb-roasted carrots, spicy pumpkin seeds, pine nuts, red onions, arugula, herb vinaigrette.  I added chicken which was a good protein choice.  I'm a huge fan of brussle sprouts and so I can't wait to try the Kurt Brussel.

Happy hour menu "small plats for $5" looks awesome and so we're going to check that out today.

The bartenders are friendly, our waitress was super energetic and friendly which was cool.  I like the atmosphere of this place. So many cool spot in Denver, I wish there was a LowDown in Delray Beach,...that was be awesome.

Been to a lot of breweries in a lot of states.... 

This one is amazing. The beer is fantastic, the food is on par with the beer. Flights are the way to go. The sinister is the best beer, refreshing and not too heavy. It's got a TON of flavor. 

You can't go wrong with any of the beer or food here. Also perfectly priced for their locally sourced and brewed philosophy.

Lowdown Brewery was our first stop during a week long Colorado trip and the experience really set the tone for the whole week!

We arrived on a Saturday afternoon hungry for lunch and thirsty for beer.  The waiter was super attentive and at our table within seconds of us sitting.  He quickly got our beer orders and passed out menus.  It was tough to decide but I went with the open faced chicken sandwich and tomato bisque.  My husband tried out one of the pizzas.  Others at the table all ordered pizzas, salads, and sandwiches.

Everyone was really pleased with their meals and the beer.  We all took bites off of each others plates and there was really nothing to be unhappy with!  When we asked for refills of our beers, we were given them really quickly.

Lastly, I'd like to talk about the atmosphere.  What a great one!  We started off inside as it was raining and the inside is very fun.  After the rain let up, we really enjoyed our time on the beautiful outdoor patio.  There are board games to play and lawn games set up on the patio.  If I lived in Denver, I would surely be a regular at Lowdown!

Awesome service and great beer! The waiter was really accommodating to our needs. I really enjoyed my wine, forgot the name but it was champagne. 
We had also gotten the pizza, which was a bit salty but still pretty good! I really enjoyed coming here to check out the brewery! 

Also for parking, park in their lot!! They have their own parking lot so don't be like me and pay for parking at the meters!

I have been here twice now. Only  for the beer, so I cant speak to the food. Service has always been great - very friendly and informative. Beers are great, nice selection of different types of brews. Its a big place, with a nice outdoor patio (unfortunately I didnt notice this until we were leaving the second time). Will be back to try the food, as the menu looks good!

Came here for a happy hour after work that turned into dinner. Their patio is cute - nice tables with a small dog-friendly section if you want to bring your pup. There's also a corn hole set up there, if that's your thing. Inside gets super loud, but the service both inside and outside was great. The beer is delicious and the pizza was fab. If you're looking for a casual place to sit outside and enjoy a cold one, this is a solid choice.

We like Lowdown a lot.  We've come here about 5-6 times now and it's always great.  The bartenders are so over-the-top friendly they just make our day.  Even if they didn't have great beers we'd continue to come for that alone.

And speaking of beers - I usually warm up with the patio pounding pilsner, which is appropriately named.  I could drink this all day long.  So I usually switch to the Lowdown IPA or a milk stout.  Oh and you can order a Golden Shower here.  Just sayin.  Nobody even gets mad.

The only food I've had here is the hummus plate and that's delicious.  I'm interested in trying the pizza sometime, and I want to have brunch here just for the names of the plates alone.  It's also extremely spacious and has a gorgeous patio that needs to be seen not described.

I'm always excited to come here and I love the warm and welcome way that we are always treated.  Keep up the excellent work!

Cheers!

Came here with some friends to watch the Broncos game.  The interior is really cool and trendy which is typical around this part of town.  They have a good amount of TVs to watch the game.  Since I don't drink beer, I stuck with their house gin for around $5 a drink.  When I order talls, I expect them to come in pints.  This was more like a juice tumbler.  

They have an outdoor patio area where there's lawn games and such.  That's pretty cool.  The service here is average and parking is a nightmare.
Didn't find too much redeeming here. Beer wasn't very enjoyable and the LowDown specialty pizza was downright bad. Cannot recommend.

I attended a bridal shower here yesterday and had so much fun!  I tried a beer that had grapefruit undertones.  It was light and delicious.  The food was awesome, too.  The menu is extensive, with everything from appetizers to burgers to salads.  I'll definitely be back.

What I like: the menu has a vegan option, which is a yummy butternut squash sandwich. The roasted potato side is good, although you never get enough ketchup (or whatever the provided sauce is). Brussels are good too. I had a very tasty dark ale there as well.

What is lacking is the service. I recently went with a friend who arrived before me and had to flag down a server to get a beer. Can't remember how long it took to order. We got our food in a reasonable timeframe. However, once delivered, the server didn't pay much attention to us. We waited and waited for the check. Eventually we got his attention and were able to pay and leave.

I went by myself yesterday. I had a different server, but similar experience. I got a vegan happy hour plate and the roasted potatoes. Then, the lack of attention began--and this was around 4 p.m. and it was not busy. I ran out of water and was very thirsty after eating the salty but tasty potatoes. Eventually, the server refilled my glass. Then I waited and waited to get the check. I tried to get another person's attention and failed. I thought my server would stop by after he dropped off food two tables over, but he didn't. So I waited some more. 

I needed to get on with my life, so I just left some cash on the table and walked out. 

I really want to be able to go this place, but the service needs to improve.
Great service, great and interesting food options. Indoor and outdoor seating, great hang out spot. Thy have plenty of beer options, wine and cocktails. Something for everyone.

Swung by Lowdown a month or so ago with some friends for pizza and beer.  This was my first time here, so I was really looking forward to trying it with said friends's recommendation. The weather was gorgeous that evening, so we headed straight to the patio and shared a picnic table with a couple at the other end. The environment was a cross being backyard-y and beer garden-esque, and very comfortable for a casual weeknight dinner. 

Being IPA lovers, most of us ordered the Lowdown IPA, which I found to be very crisp, refreshing, and well balanced. The four of us also split the large pizzapodopolous (did I spell that right?), which was so delicious we nearly licked the pan. 

If you're looking for a chill evening hangout in the Golden Triangle area, check out Lowdown. You won't be disappointed.

This place is kicka$$.  Came here last Wednesday night for a late dinner and some beers, and both were fantastic.

I had the delicious house salad with grilled chicken, arugula, figs, jicama and toasted pumpkin seeds.  It was huge, filling and so tasty.  Often a house salad is a lame combination of lettuce, a few boring veggies and some gross cheese, but this was anything but.  

The beers we had were good too.  The pale ale was my favorite, with good hoppy flavor.  The Belgian white was also good (just had a taste), and nice and dry.  My husband's Golden Shower Belgian strong ale (not actually served warm directly poured into mouth) was excellent.  My least fav was the pilz, which tasted ok at first but the more I drank, the closer it tasted to Miller Lite than Stella.  But everything else I'd say was above average for a small local brewery (not that there aren't a million really good small breweries in Denver, and most better than a lot of the larger ones).

Our server was super helpful and cool, and we hung out until they closed at 11.  Word of warning, the kitchen closes earlier (I forget if it was 9:30 or 10), so make sure to get your order in.

Subpar beer and subpar food.  Prices a little to high for the actual amount you get.

I was dragged in here as a party of a welcoming party for an in-law.  Maybe I'm a craft beer snob, but aren't stouts supposed to taste, you know, stoutlike?  I had theirs here and it honestly tasted like a Fat Tire with molasses in it, there was really no richness or depth of flavor at all.  I also had some kind of ale, which also had underwhelming flavor...so much so that I don't even remember what it was. 

But what really brings them down is the food.  I got their Korean ribs and green chili pork tacos and my wife got their chicken parm sandwich.  First off, the chicken parm sandwich was nothing like it was described; it was a chicken club.  Which would be fine, but the bread to filling ratio was so high it's a miracle you could taste any filling at all.  My ribs were DRY.  Like, bone dry.  Impossible to eat without allowing first to soak in BBQ liquid for a solid 30 seconds, and even then were uncomfortable to eat.  The only thing really worth eating were the tacos, and they were average at best.  They had green chilis, and they had pork.  Done.

The worst thing was the fact that I spent 60 dollars for this meal with two drinks.  Way overpriced; they're pricing themselves in a market where I couldn't possibly give them three stars.

The downtown crowd loves this place, however.  They were packed to the gills when I went in.  So who knows, maybe I just picked the exact wrong things.
I really enjoyed both the beers I had here. The pizza I got was also good. They have a great atmosphere and a dog friendly patio with yard games.

My coworker and I went during our lunch break and we had a great experience. Both food and service was excellent. For appetizer, we got a half plate of meat and cheese. There 4 different of cheese to try and 3 different meats to select from and both of us really enjoyed it. We both got the half chicken sandwich and it was amazing. 

They had a wide selection of beers and the ones we tried were very good. 

If you like beers and to hang out with friend, this would be a great place to go for either lunch or dinner.

I can appreciate a brewery that also serves a full menu of food, but I think they might benefit from picking one or the other and doing that one thing expertly.  The space is pretty cool and would actually be a good place for a larger group to eat and drink and I did like my beer (Treason) but the pizza was just okay.  I don't really know how to explain except to say that it looked like the Amy's pizza I pull out of the freezer.  Small, thin, not as cheesy as I wanted it to be.  I'd go back if invited, but this probably wouldn't be my first choice.

Beer was solid not fantastic but the food is amazing. Definitely a cut above your average brewery and gastropub food. What pushed this over to 5 stars for me was the exceptional service and awesome atmosphere and venue.

Stopped in for the 2nd time last night with my sisters and cousin for a little impromptu get together. The space is nice with plenty of seating. There is really nothing to break up the noise though, so it gets very loud when it's a full house and it can be difficult to hear your party.

I need to add a disclaimer to say, I am not a beer drinker. My sisters love their brews and had good things to say about the selection and their orders. My cousin really enjoyed the sour beer in particular. 

The food. We ordered the hummus plate to share. Meh. I love hummus, I consider it to be a food group all on it's own. The "Big plate" offered 2 kinds of hummus with a selection of crudites. The hummus choices had too rough of a texture like it wasn't blended long enough and was very bland. Generous portions, but very bland. There were 4 of us and we didn't finish it because it just wan't that good.. I ordered the Vaca Sagrada which is an Indian dish of spiced veggies stuffed into a tortilla served with mixed greens and quinoa. I was immediately disappointed when it arrived. It sounds like a substantial dish, but it was a fairly small portion of the "stuffed tortilla" and the greens & quinoa were lackluster. Almost no dressing, very little quinoa. Booo. I was sad. I think it can be difficult for some places to really pull off vegetarian or vegan offerings well and sadly this was the case here. I do appreciate the effort for inclusion, but flavors were lacking. My sisters are not vegetarians and had regular sandwiches (chicken parm & the Havana) which they both raved about. So for them, this place was a big win! For me, not so much..

I dig me some Lowdown. The beers are good, and I feel like there's something new to try on every visit. They also seem to always have a crooked stave on draft, and I absolutely love sours. Every item on the menu is basically a pun, which kept my boyfriend and I entertained for while. We were there to watch football and do some drinking, so food wasn't the main event, but we did split the margherita pizza.  The pizza was very flavorful, and the crust was the perfect thickness for me.  Our server was super attentive, and kept us stocked with drinks throughout the game.  It was a great place to spend a Sunday afternoon.

The beer was really good as was the service from the bartenders.  We split an app that I thought was overpriced and just ok, they got a little too fancy and missed the mark in my opinion(The Devils on Horse Back),  I would not order that again.  

That being said we came here to drink not eat and they really delivered on that note.  We all enjoyed our beers and the bartender was affable and knowledgably.  I will be back to try more beers...Maybe next time just get a pizza as they looked really good.  Also so the patio is really spacious and good if you have a large group.

Superb service on a sunny patio? Okay!

Pleasantly surprising healthy and hearty salads at a brewery? Even Better!

A solid line up of brews? Now, you're talking!

This somewhat new local brewery is busting at the seams with a lot of opportunities of fun. The inside space is expansive with plenty of seating and standing areas by the bar. Overhead, there are flat screens for those sports fanatics out there. But the real winner is the patio. Perfect for those ubiquitous sunny Colorado days - it's complete with corn hole, bike racks, picnic tables, and dog friendly folk with their furry friends! 

The beer in which I indulged was tasty and went down smooth. I had the staple Selfish pale ale with grapefruit, tangerine, and pineapple complement and the American Red Ale. Both were delicious. But not as delicious as the House Salad: a medley of dried apricot, toasted pumpkin seed, tomato, jicama, shaved carrot,
mixed greens, gorgonzola vinaigrette. So good and an unusual find at a brewery. Good beer and healthy food. It's a win, win

Great beer and great food! We always go on Sundays to enjoy Beer Goggles (the BEST biscuits & gravy in Denver - coming from a Kansas girl who is dead serious about her B&G) and a pizza. The Taos and chopper are among our favorites.

Had dinner with friends and family on Monday night 12/1/15. Everything was wonderful. 

The beers were right on. Everyone got a different style, all were happy. 

The starters were great, ate every piece on both plates.

5 out of the 6 got different dinners, All were very pleased with the meal. All enjoyed it very much. My woife went on and on about the lamb stew. 

Trust me, this one you can't go wrong. All homeruns.

This place was awesome! We came here for my boyfriends birthday, he loves checking out new breweries. We saw online that they had TV's and the Broncos were playing that day, perfect.

We had plenty of space to spread out, the place was not too crowded (for some reason Broncos fans don't frequent breweries I guess). The beer prices were standard craft beer pricing, expect to pay over $6 for a pint. It was a much better deal to go for a pitcher.

The pizza was a great value and very good! We will be back!

On vacation, found this awesome brewery since it was in walking distance from the hotel we were staying at. Girlfriend and I had the pizza which was the best the both of us ever had. Crust was thin and crispy and the toppings they used were very fresh and delicious. We both had their Rye Porter Nitro Stout and was one of the best nitro stouts we've have as well. Really cool vibe inside, didn't make it up to the patio though. Definitely recommend this place if you want a great mix of food and beers.

"Sternn!  He's nothing but a low-down, double-dealing, backstabbing, larcenous perverted worm! Hanging's too good for him. Burning's too good for him! He should be torn into little bitsy pieces and buried alive!"
--Hanover Fiste (testifying about Captain Lincoln F. Sternn in the film Heavy Metal)

I am not sure how relevant that quote is, but it comes to mind every time I walk into Lowdown Brewery.  And, I have walked in here several times now.  There are several things to like about this place.

1) An actual parking lot!  I cannot emphasize enough how much I enjoy this.  One winds up paying for parking in so many nearby places.  It is nice to pull into a free parking lot and walk right into the patio area.

2) The space.  Lowdown is roomy, with large community tables.  The patio is significantly nicer than at most places.

3) The beer.  I am pretty happy with most of what I have tried.  They have a few beers that always seem to be around, like the Selfish (Grapefruit, tangerine, and pineapple complement this pale brewed with all Pilsen malt). And there is typically something new for me to try on each visit.  And there are guest taps as well.  The non-happy hour pricing is now $5.75 a pint (which seems a touch high).

4) The food.  I have had mixed experiences on the food.  Some things I thought were quite tasty, and others I found to be just okay.  The food prices might seem a bit higher than one expects, but you cannot beat the convenience.

5) The staff.  Friendly people, solid service.

Not your typical bar food. this place has an awesome variety of great food. I highly suggest the Devils on horseback and Brussels sprouts. The sandwiches are all great and the pizzas are amazing. they have a good selection of beers to try as well.  This place is very large, and the setup is nice.

Servers are friendly.  It's like a bar, with upscale food.  Instead of your typical hamburgers and fries you get some great dishes that you would expect to find at a more upscale restaurant, not the local brewery.

We came here on our beercation. This place is fantastic!  Our waiter was extremely knowledgable about their beers and recommended nothing but fantastic beers along the entire spectrum from their Lowdown IPA to the coffee rye porter (jeez that was tasty). We got two pizza, shrimp pad Thai and the beetza, and they were great too and I'm no stranger to amazing pizza!  Perfect crust and unique toppings.  This is an instant Denver favorite for me!

This place is awesome! They have great beers and great rustic American food.  I love their sandwiches and the character of the outside patio area.  They even have a series of bike racks to lock your bike.  I always bring friends from out of town here.  The potatoes that come with the sandwiches and homemade ketchup is amazing!

Brewery defines this place, specializing in beer not food.  Had the pizza and it was dry, hardly any cheese and the toppings were scarce.  The meatballs were dry and lacked in flavor.  Beer was tasty.

Awesome vibe and they actually have a small parking lot on the side of their patio.  I ordered the lowdown pizza, small et tu brute and a beer.  So worth it!  This was a random meeting spot but my friend David had been here before and wanted to meet here for lunch so we did.  Service was fast even with the place filling up as we were seated.  I'll come back again.  Parking is a bit of a hassle on the weekend but this place will calm your nerves.  Grab a pint, a bite and enjoy the vibe!

Lowdown is a pretty nice little brewpub. They have a nice patio outside (half of which allows dogs) as well as a good sized restaurant inside. The thing I like most about Lowdown is that they have both good beer and great food. We started off with the beer cheese dip and it was fantastic just like last time. This is one of those I wish I knew the recipe so I could make it at home, but I kind of don't because I'd eat it every day and be fat. It goes great with the homemade pretzel bread they serve with it. For our meal we split the beet pesto pizza. The beet flavor was surprisingly not too strong which was good, and you could really taste the goat cheese and prosciutto. To wash it all down I ordered the American Porter which I liked because it wasn't overly heavy, and didn't have any smoke, so you could taste the chocolate notes. This is one of the good ones, maybe next time I'll bring my puppy along too!

We stopped here for brunch the day after Halloween as we were looking for some food to soak up the residual alcohol. We were able to sit outside as the weather was beautiful and they're outdoor seating area is huge. I got the biscuits and gravy and my boyfriend got the breakfast sandwich. The biscuits and gravy were the best I've had in the 5 years I've lived in Denver. The sandwich was a bit boring and could have used some spread to add flavor. The service was great and there is off street parking for free. We will be back for more food and beer soon!

I love this place. 

1. Brewery-Great beer for all palettes; I am partial to their IPA's. Heaven.
2. Vegetarian-friendly. Omnivores are also pleased.
3. Always a rotating menu.
4. Perfect for a date night, or for a dinner out with friends.
5. Non-pretentious place. My kind of place.
6. You can gift pints to friends here.

So, rule of thumb of any restaurant... go where the crowd is.  We barely found a seat, but there's reason in crowdsourcing.  This brewpub featured not only excellent beers, but also excellent food.  Everything was delicious, staff was attentive, and it was a great experience over all.

I'm glad we got a rental car in Denver so we could explore some of the neighborhood joints. Very pleasant patio with great local ales, a delicious creative house salad and cumin-spiced meatballs. Pizza was thin with a nice char from the oven   Super friendly service.

Enjoy my visit with a friend while in town for work. Had a few beers (Belgian style white and Irish red ale) and shared some apps (butternut squash hummus, salad with dried figs and the half cheese/charcuterie plate). Good spot to catch up and sample some tasty local brews.

The look and feel of Lowdown is exactly what I'm looking for in a brewery experience. From the bartenders (who are very knowledgeable about their beer) to the GM, to the owner, are all great and very friendly!  

The menu has a lot to choose from with very hilarious names for their dishes.  Their beers are phenomenal and I certain can't wait to return!

I have been to lowdown a couple of times due mostly to friends in cap hill requesting to try it. 
I will start by saying I think it is a comfortable, beautiful space. I am glad to see a space like this in cap hill being utilized. 
However, beyond that it really does nothing to grab my attention. Denver is filled with great brewery and restaurant options. I would suggest Lowdown try to be goof at one or the other, instead of just ok at both.
  
It is not like the food is bad. There is just nothing creative about any of their dishes. Everyone is doing wood fired pizza. It's like the third place I have been to with devil on horseback( bacon wrapped whatever). Also by doing a weird variation on Gumbo you completely (deconstructed if you will) made it unrecognizable. It's a simple dish that is not broken and doesn't need to be fixed.

Now the beer. 
Oh you have an IPA that lacks hoppy flavor, a white ale that tastes like a flat blue moon and really not a lot of others worth mentioning. This is Denver. My suggestion is bring the creativity, and flavor or don't plan on being open much longer.
The best pizza ever! The Mr. white was amazing but make sure to bring your own ranch.  This place does not have ranch but everything else is amazing!

Beer was good (obviously) but I was not impressed with the food. I had ordered the big cheese and it was just plain terrible! I couldn't even stomach the rest of it. I ordered the happy hour green chili pork tacos hoping that they would make up for it and they weren't that great either... they were just so so. I generally like the ambiance of this place, it's great for drinks with friends. But I wouldn't expect to have a good meal here. However, the staff was awesome.

I can't believe I haven't written a review of this place yet! Maybe it's because I foolishly don't come here when it's cold outside. That is an error I will have to fix in the winter, because Lowdown is too good to not come to regularly.

That being said, their patio is my favorite in Denver, which is why I can often be found here when the weather is nice. Plenty of room with a cornhole game area, bike parking, and nice big umbrellas at every table!  Servers are all fairly attentive and friendly, even outside away from the bar. They also tend to be easy on the eyes...

Their menu is seasonal, and that includes the beers. I haven't had a beer I dislike here yet; the White Ale and Selfish are two that I always enjoy that are usually available. It should be noted that this is a brewery, so most of the beers are made in-house with a guest beer or two in the mix. Plus, if you like a particular beer, they sell growlers. If I have one complaint, it's that I miss beers I've tried previously that haven't made a reappearance, like the Sinister. First-world problems, right?

Everything I've tried on the food menu has been delicious. The Devils on Horseback appetizer and Chopper pizza are two regularly-appearing items that are definitely worth a try. Seriously, why aren't you here yet?

Great summertime brewery. Here are a few of the things I like about Lowdown:
1)They have parking. In a town where parking is becoming a premium. This makes it easy to go to and not have to circle for hours or park a million miles away.
2) They have an awesome patio. Great for summertime. Lots of tables and also some spaces to play games on.
3) They have food! Not a food truck. An ACTUAL kitchen. Two thumbs up. My favorite thing to come out of there so far is the Kurt Brussel. The boyfriend would probably say his favorite is the devils on horseback... but Kurt Brussel wins because so much bacon and so much roasted brussel goodness! Pizza is always good although be warned the Salty Dawg really is VERY salty. I probably wouldn't order that one again.
4)The beer. Always have a good selection. Something new to try most times we're in there and bartender is friendly and willing to describe beers. Last time a server brought us a round to try after we found out about a beer that was available but not listed on the menu. Great customer service.

A great neighborhood brewery with a good bar menu and good service!

Damn what a helluva meal we had at a brewery. The beer selection is plentiful but not overwhelming. The descriptions are exactly what you need to make your decision. Still not sure? Ask for a tasting as the waistaff is more than happy to oblige. 

The food--pizzas are amazing. As a petite asian girl I can easily finish a personal pan pizza and have room for a few bites of dessert. I got to try the Lowdown and Smurfette pizzas. The thin crust was on point (not cracker thin). Boyfriend tried an entree. Looks like all the entrees are seasonal. He had the buffalo braised short ribs which were a knockout.

I would describe this place as easy: easy to park, easy to dine, easy to chill in my very casual attire.

I am really glad our friends who live in Denver took us here. It was a real treat before heading back to Texas.

My 12 year old chose LowDown pizza for his bday dinner!  When the wait staff found out it was his bday they all stopped by to wish him a happy bday!  He felt very special. I tried the beet salad which was delish and as always, the homemade dressings are the best!!  My husband had the "pork drumsticks" which sounded odd but were unbelievable!!!  They are a must try. The kids of course loved their pizzas and there were no leftovers. 
There is something for everyone in the family, at Low Down.
Just updating to say Lowdown is still killing it! The beer is still great and the pizza is still amazing. Extra star for consistency!

Squeeeel! So happy about this rocking brew-pub hitting it out of the park immediately!

First off, I am tickled that this joint is located in my hood. Secondly, they did an AMAZING job prepping for their opening. They had a very successful soft opening and I can't wait to frequent this establishment in the future!

Family friendly, this place has a kitchen that serves fun foods with some vegetarian and gluten free options. Their low down potatoes were great and the raspberry chocolate dessert was mouthwatering! 

The beers were really good! I loved the pilz, the Scottish style Lonely Sheep, and the Bessie stout, also available in nitro. They can be enjoyed in samples,  1/2 pints, full pints, and growlers. They did a great job of having enough product for their very busy first week! 

The place is designed well. There are a bunch of seats at the bar, some free standing high top tables and a lot of large community tables. Which are cool, but not my ideal. I anticipate this place becoming very successful and think they might need more standing room for those just wanting to perch and drink.  The best parts of the design include the high wooden ceilings, the concrete floor that I think is left over from MapsCo, and the ladies bathroom! Seriously, I LOVE the restroom design! 

The staff was fabulous! We met a few of them and they were so friendly and welcoming. You can tell that a lot of thought went into developing Low Down, and it has resulted in quality! Thanks for enhancing the hood LD!
Came in for dinner with a friend. Everything was wonderful. The food, the service, the ambiance. 5 Stars!

Stopped in here for dinner when I was in town mainly because a lot of other breweries don't seem to serve a full menu, and we wanted dinner as well.  The vibe of the place is pretty cool, there were some people playing board games when we were there and a variety of sports on the TVs.  Almost everything on the menu is a terrible pun or just plain ridiculous name.  

The beer was just ok.  My pilsner was fine, but was a bit lighter than I expected.  Most of the beers are fruity, which may or may not be your thing.

The food was excellent, though.  This would be 5 stars if I was only talking about the food, but I sense most people come here for the drinks.  I got the tomato mozzarella basil pizza (Marge-Simpson).  My friend got the Hatuna Matata, which is in open faced seared tuna sandwich that also looked delicious (and also came with some delicious looking roasted potatoes)

This place was unique- communal tables downstairs were cool and the upstairs seating was fun. Never got a chance to play cornhole. The food selection was awesome. My boyfriend and I shared a salad and pizza. We were blown away with how fresh our meals were. Beer selection was also great. Only reason I'm not ready to slap the 5th star on is because our waiter was a fucking weirdo. Zero social skills, very disengaged for a dude that works in the service industry.

I've been to this place a few times and I have mixed feelings about it.  I'm not a fan of the sports bar layout with 15 TV's hanging from the wall.  I have tasted several of their beers and have never been blown away by anything they have served.  I will continue to visit this place because my wife and I can count on them serving us a better-than-ok meal.  We prefer to go to breweries that have food trucks parked outside, but it's hard to depend on food trucks sometimes.  

Again, their beer didn't seem like anything special to me.  I didn't leave feeling like "I need to get back here to have a pint of that!"  like I do with my more preferable breweries (e.g. TRVE, Great Divide, and the new Alpine Dog Brewery).

How have I failed to review this place until now?!  I love it here.  The long bench seating gives it a fun social vibe and the beers are very good.  The bar food here is well above average and for me at least, the bigger draw.

Once for sunday brunch I remember having a chorizo breakfast pizza.  Sounds weird, but trust me, it is worth that extra work-out you are going to have to do to burn those calories.  Fantastic flavor, and a pizza you will not soon forget.

Great spot. Awesome food. Good beer. Friendly service. Can't really ask for anything else. The bar tenders are knowledgable. Tel them what kind of beer your like and they will find something to suit your fancy. For example, not too hoppy, extra hops etc. had the tacos off the appetizer menu tonight and they were great.

This is a good, standard, neighborhood bar to frequent on any day of the week.  They have a good selection of beers that they cycle out seasonally and decent food.  I've tried a few things over my visits there and it is all pretty good food.  Pizzas are one of their more popular dishes.

They also have TVs playing sports games live and yard games such as Cornhole on their patio.

The servers are all nice and professional and will give good recommendations of beers and food for you.

The ambiance is very casual and friendly.

One of their bigger draws is their variety of board games.  Come hang out with your friends and play some fun games that you can turn into drinking games.

All in all its a fun place to hang out for a casual night out and offers good drinks/food, but it doesn't really stand out from any other bar.  That said, I continue to go back.

This is a newly opened brewpub in downtown Denver, and although we were on our way somewhere else, when we saw that it was open, we gave it a try...and I am so glad that we did.
We were able to sample all 11 of the beers that they brew in house (the waitress was great about making us a sampler try, even though typical tasting flights are not on the menu. It turned out that each one was around $2.  The highlights were the Tripple (super apricot-y and rich), The Russian Imperial (very rich, almost raisin-like) and the Lonely Sheep Scottish Ale (very nutty).

This place is not only a brewery though, it also has a full menu. My group of 3 shared 2 of the small-size pizzas-plenty for us all. We got the Papa Smurf (pancetta, blue cheese, brussel sprouts, onion, hummus) and El Blanco (mozzarella, artichoke hearts, garlic, arugula, goat cheese).  Their super crispy crust and plentiful toppings made these a great addition to the beer.

The atmosphere was nice--very spacious and cool, although we arrived right when they opened for lunch, so we were the only patrons (at first). The service was great and I am totally ready to go back, next time I am in town.

We have only gone here once and we will definitely be back. The service alone was fantastic. Our server was so friendly and knew the menu really well. She told us about their special pizza they have right now- brats, pickled cabbage, and an IPA/ mustard base sauce. It was so yummy, as was their Tuggie stout! The overall vibe and atmosphere was great too! Can't wait to come back!

Sat at the bar for some beers and dinner. Bartenders were friendly and helpful. Beer was pretty good. The food was out of his world. Highly recommend the chicken sandwich with tazeki (sp) spinach artichokes red pepper and feta. Can't get over how delicious it was.

I am a fan! Lowdown is in a big roomy space right down on Lincoln. The atmosphere is pretty laid back and the bartenders are all really friendly and knowledgeable.  They know how to explain each beer and aren't afraid to give honest opinions on any of them.
I have tried all of the beers offered and I have to say that all are tasty. Dirty shame is my favorite in the current line up. 
They have a big patio out back with lots of seating and corn hole. It's a great sunset watching patio for summer nights. 
I have tried their hummus plate. It was good, the hummus was flavored well and they didn't skimp on the good veggies.
Last time we were there I noticed their brunch menu. Everything looked great and was creative. Sadly we had just had brunch elsewhere but we will be headed back soon to try out the breakfast goodness. We also saw that they have bottomless mimosas for brunch, a must have for any self respecting brunch spot!

This place came highly recommended and I would second that.  Nice menu, nice selection of beers, and very helpful server.  They explained and introduced me to 'nitro' versions of beer.  I am now a faithful follower.  

We weren't hungry, but others were enjoying what looked like decent pub food.

Nice vibe, nice group of customers.

Lowdown Brewery is yet another restaurant that I've passed on my way to work every day for several months without ever going to. I do have to say it's looked good, as I'm always about trying out a new brewpub.

I finally got my chance to go for a co-worker's birthday lunch, as I work just a few blocks away.

I will freely admit that although I liked the vibe when I walked in, I wasn't sure of the menu-it was like a lot of brewpubs menus, but maybe a little smaller and not quite as much traditional fare-for example, I don't think they have fries on the side?

Before you call me stupid for judging them on whether they have fries, let me assure that by the end of the meal, I was calling myself stupid for doing so.

Ultimately, I decided to make my own pizza, a 10" with ham and pepperoni. For beer, I ordered their staple pale ale. Both were excellent choices! My pizza was ridiculously good, and the perfect portion-I was able to eat the whole thing without feeling overstuffed. The pale ale was great as well-very balanced and refreshing. My co-worker got a flight of the majorities of their beers and also said each was great.

The cherry on top is the service-very friendly, very attentive, and very quick. 

We ended up coming back the next week again to have lunch, and I think this could very well turn into a regular lunch spot. The food is delicious, the beer is great, and the staff is very welcoming and friendly.

If you work or live in the area and are looking for a good new spot, look no further!

Ok the beer here is sooooo good, which I kind of expected. What I didn't expect was how good the food would be too. If you like craft brews and good food, this would be your jam too. Also get the "you're f***ing welcome" for the table. It will blow your mind.

Went here just looking for somewhere with a TV. Ordered the gumbo per our server's recommendations and it was very average. Service was not great either. Very disappointing as I had heard good things but I won't be returning.

We got a sampler of each of their beers. They don't have a sample platter per se, but we were able to get sampler glasses (~$2) of each of their 11 beers and 1 visiting tap from Crooked Stave.  

We hadn't been planning to come to Lowdown, but I'm glad we did! We were cruising down the street headed to Argonaut liquor and passed this place. Yelp had some good reviews (only 4 of them since the place was rather new), but it was lunch time and we decided to give the place a go...Starting with a table full of sample glasses, we enjoyed all the brews but the barleywine and tripel were the stand-outs.  We also got the blanco pizza, which was really tasty.  

I think Lowdown is a great addition to the craft brew scene in Denver and I look forward to coming back!

There is a good variety of brews here and most of them are pretty good. The bartenders and wait staff have been really helpful in explaining them to me, which I appreciate it. What I love about this place is the patio in the summer. It has a lot of energy and really is a great spot after work. The inside I can take or leave but a definite must for the summertime outdoor patio!
The food here is delish, and our waiter was perfect! He was so patient with our big table and 2 small kids, and made sure our orders came quickly. Great service!

I don't know how to explain this, but the Caesar dressing tasted like vanilla cake icing. Exactly like sweet, cake icing you buy at the grocery store. My fiancé ordered this - the most laid back person ever with food - and he couldn't stomach it. I also tasted, and it was nothing like Caesar dressing. The waiter was nice and confirmed it was their Caesar dressing - he even comped the salad portion of the meal when he realized we weren't eating it, which was generous. But I've never experienced something advertised as one thing and then presented as something so completely different. We both thought we were going crazy. Good atmosphere, great food otherwise, but if someone can confirm this bizarre Caesar dressing experience, it would be great.

This place is pretty great. When we got here at about 8pm on a Friday it was pretty crowded so we ate outside even though it was a little chilly. On a nice night, the outside area would be perfect.

After a couple of pitchers it was cold so we asked our waiter if we could move inside and he went and got us a nice table inside for the 7 of us. Overall, the service was great.

I drank the hefeweizen and it was delicious. The Sasquash salad was also great. The warm butternut squash was delicious with the pear and Dijon dressing.

Went here on a Friday night, it was packed but they seated us before we finished our first beer. The waitress was really friendly and so was the hostess. The beer was really good, I recommend the White Ale. The pizza was alright, it wasn't the best I've had but it was unique along with the rest of the menu.

I would give this a 4.5 as the experience was great but it was not the most amazing meal I have ever had. I had a nice curry Thai dish with chicken breast and two slices of pizza. It is a nice thin crust and good. We were there for happy hour so $1 off all of our beers were great. Our server Tim was so attentive and really fun! Brava!

I wanted to give this place more stars but I couldn't. We started outside but after 15 minutes of no service we moved inside. Another 10 minutes and a waiter came to take our order. The food and beer was ok (ribs were a little dry) but the service was ssssllllloooooowwww. The waiter was standing around chatting with coworkers and we had to wave him down to order food. It wasn't bad but could have been much better. I'll come back if I'm not in a rush.

Wow! I stopped here before my hair appointment at Rita B's. The service is excellent, the patio area is very open & very relaxing. I had the White Ale of which they offered me to sample first. I had the You Drive Me Caprese sandwich, with Roasted Potatoes. The potatoes came with housemate ketchup, which I fell in love with!!! 
Definitely coming back!
Pizza is great!!!! Always good vibes, people are friendly and the food is consistently fresh!

I really like the experience I've had here. I don't usually order food. The wait staff is attentive. They have a lot of longer bar tables so if you don't want the experience of sitting next to a stranger, maybe look elsewhere.

Their drink specials are decently priced for happy hour. I would consider this a gastropub for sure since their food isn't the typical burger, fried foodapalooza menu you'll get at any old local neighborhood dive.

I cannot wait to come back when it gets warmer outside again. When I was there the day after opening, it was winter and their patio was under construction. Last time, it looked like there were lots of tables and space outside so I'll definitely be back here.

I really liked this place a lot.  I've been there a few times now and have always been able to find something on the menu & beer menu that was exactly what my stomach wanted -- food is good, beer is great, and the whole place is just friendly, mellow, and well-run.  The names of the dishes and beers make me laugh - and sometimes that's exactly what you need. I wouldn't go when it's superbusy (that's a great way to get bad service/food wherever you go)  but on a Saturday/Sunday afternoon it's a great place to sit and watch the world go by with a great beer. Wish there were more places like this.
Fantastic bar with excellent food. Joe the bartender is friendly, personable, and knows his clientele. In fact, the whole staff there on Sundays are great!

I'm a BIG fan of this place. Huge! All around it's an awesome place to be. What's not to like? Slammin' beer, great food, awesome service, inexpensive, local, roomy, fun...it's like perfection. Let me give the Lowdown...pun intended.

When it comes to salads one doesn't usually think a brewery would have one of the best in town but this place does. I love the Et tu, Brute salad is my favorite and it's awesome. Add some pancetta to that and you're golden! The selection of sandwiches is also great and they are tasty and huge.

The beer is very good and they offer great rotations of certain brews. No matter what your flavor there is a solid beer waiting here. Plus, they have cocktails available for the non-beer drinkers who are always dragged to breweries. On the weekends this place can get really packed but that's because it's got an awesome location.

In Denver it's all about having a great patio and Lowdown has succeeded. Not only is there plenty of room, a great view and ample seating but there are fun games to play as well. Never a dull moment at this joint!

The inside is awesome as well: bar seats, high top tables, community style seating and your basic sit down tables for families. Yes, kiddos are welcome and to my surprise they don't annoy me at this brewery. The atmosphere is laid back and really cool. I don't think I would ever turn down the opportunity to stop in and enjoy some goodness.

Love this place have been there at least 5 times already. Only thing I will avoid is rawa dosa it was soggy white not nicely roasted n rawa dosa is supposed to be crisp golden brown.
I have had their buffet n really enjoyed it.ordered from their menu n loved it.
The idly is jumbo sized after a plate of idly I wasn't able to finish my dosa :). The cooks/ server are really generous with ghee on top of idly/ vada sambhar.

My only issue is the restroom. Needs very through cleaning.

Terrible oily food! Have been here today for lunch buffet and couldn't have expected anything worse. Oily bread, oil flowing like as if they got it for free in the paneer chetinad (btw - that's not the way a chetinad curry is made in the first place) and oily Chana Masala. 

Will take a while to get out of this nightmare!

All veggie restaurant, $15 (incl tax) weekend buffet

Small dosa w/ masala
veggie pulao
Medu Vada
Idli - (not good)
Sambar
Rice
Rasam
Paneer Tikka masala
Chilli gobi Manchurian
Okra fry
Mirchi Ka salan
Noodles
Puri - South Indian bread
Papad
Carrot halwa 
Coconut burfi 
Tutti frooti

Good food.

After going here a handful of times, the last few have not been that great. The lack of flavor and amount of oil in there dishes leaves a sick feeling.  

There dosa is amazing, each time amazing. Fresh and not oily.

I only wish they offered more variety and not as much oil. They could update there utensils they are old and bent.

Went here for the lunch buffet without realizing it was a vegetarian spread! Despite this I managed to find a bunch of good food so I was happy with my choice. I did not find the food to be oily, as other reviewers have said. The buffet was well-attended by the waitstaff and looked very fresh.

Five Star, best of the best Indian Fare in Denver! 

This is exceptional Indian food-and- VEGETARIAN alert!  This is authentic vegetarian Indian that would make most folks give up bacon forever....

The food:  Other reviewers swooned about the DOSAs- so we of course tried some, having never heard of these delightful Indian crepes made of rice and lentil batter.  Naturally GLUTEN FREE, peeps, these dosas will knock your socks off.  They are the biggest damn crepes I have ever seen, literally rolled out longer than my forearm, and stuffed with yummy things.  Try a Dosa.

Also notable were the Coconut Chutney, please draw me a bath...I dipped everything into mine.  Delish.

The British Boyfriend, slightly dubious about the vegetarian thing, was so ecstatic about his dinner that he actually showed emotion by smiling- so this place is clearly his new favorite.

A wonderful wonderful hole-in-the wall gem found in a strip mall in Aurora, the only teeny downside was the interior/menus/floors could have been a teeny weeny bit cleaner.  Then this would be 5 stars, strip mall and all!

Hopeless service, sat on the table for half hr before I had to go and fetch glass and water myself as the kids needed to have water.
Ordered food and 45 minutes later no sight of any food.
I had to go and remind them, and still no sight.
Finally food starts to arrive, buts no spoons; I believe they want us to go the Indian way and dip hands all over the place.had  to go again to the reception to ask for spoons, and they promptly give me spoons; guess they forget that customers need napkins also. Had to ask explicitly for it as well.

Finally chinese food arrives, I had hoped they get me fork; I was probably in other space hoping for it. So I ask again and get it.

Then keep waiting for 15 minutes for my final dish, see most of the customers moving out. I had hoped after all this nagging they would have mended ways, but no I again need to goto the reception to remind them of the last order; and get the response - Oh sir, you didn't get it!!!!

All in all a horrible experience. I was with another family who advised me not to go here as there previous experience was baf and I was optimistic that they would have improved. Hoped for too much.

At the end get the answer, sir we were short of resources today!!!!!!!

Never again......

I tried out Masalaa on the 4th of July (American, I know). One thing to know is that all of their food is vegetarian, but don't let that in any way stop you. I was a little hesitant at first, but when I saw their lunch buffet and tried the food I was hooked. They have a lot of different things (I'm really not sure what they all were), but more than anything I was amazed that they could make vegetarian food taste that good. They had a few items that had a good kick to them (that were also my favorite) and the rice was also very good with the tomato chutney. For dessert they had a pistachio cake and dough balls marinated in honey. The dough balls were by far the best of the desserts. I left feeling very full and happy, and will have to come back again.

Wow don't order their Chinese! We had the fried rice and gopi Manchurian and it was baaad! The minute I tasted it I immediately regretted my decision to go with Chinese..should have ordered something Indian. But I also tasted my husband's dosa and it tasted really oily. Service was okay. A little bit slow though.

Brought my sister here to introduce her to the wonderful flavors of Indian food.

We came in around 7:30pm and were seated right away. It was fairly quiet -- there were around six others in the restaurant, but we were ready to chow down.

The Channa Masala was incredibly flavorful and spicy! I'd say it was about an 8 out of 10 on my spicy level. It was comparable to Mexican hot, or jalapeños in Korean soup spicy. (Does that make sense? Ha.) In any case, the masala was excellent.

The Paper Masala Dosa was HUGE. My sister and I both dropped our jaws when we saw it. We had never encountered such a thing before. We didn't even know where to begin, so we started picking away at the ends and dipped the bits of dosa in the chutney and other sauces, and it was good. Really good. The dosa was crispy, yet soft and stretchy. There was also a slightly sweet taste to it as well. There was a warm sauce (I think it was sambar?) that was spicier and we thoroughly enjoyed it.

Portions were large (for us). We ended up eating half of the dosa and a third of the masala before we surrendered and boxed those babies up.

The service was not so great. The server came by three times throughout our time there. Once to take our order and two other times to bring over the food. We had to go over to the reception desk three times to ask for boxes and ask for our check. So, we ended up skipping dessert. The two guys working didn't stop by or even look at us ... Wut. Slightly upsetting and disappointing; hence, the three stars.

But, don't let the skimpy service keep you away! Do stop by, if you're craving some yummy Indian food!

Lunch buffet is the only option. Service is quick and efficient but would not call it friendly.

Buffet had plenty of options all very good full of flavour. Spicy paneer was delicious as well as the chickpea curry.

Two people, all you can eat buffet for a Total of $22 wasn't bad. I am glad I didn't see the other reviews about cockroaches before we went.

I'm taking a star off my previous review because I've been back to Masalaa 4-5 times and the service has been uniformly terrible.  I still go because the food is just that good, but I've never felt so unwelcome in a restaurant in my life!  I don't know if it's because I'm not Indian or if they treat everyone this way, but the servers often act annoyed that I am there, service is never friendly and always slow, and last night, my server got my order wrong and then ARGUED with me for several minutes about it rather than just fixing it.  I was half expecting to get charged for the wrong order the way he carried on about how it was all my fault (they didn't, thank goodness).  But man, the food was so good I still have to give Masalaa three stars.

Bottom line, amazing food, terrible service.  I recommend going for the buffet or takeout to avoid having to deal with the surly waiters.

So fellow Yelpers I'm disappointed. This was not good. Nothing about this place was good. The waiter pushed the AYCE buffet as the best dinner choice. The food was not good. Overspiced unrecognizable mush for the most part. The dosas were good when delivered to the table and hot but they were short lived as they cooled off and got spongy. The floor was sticky and my shoes stuck to the floor as I went back and forth from the table to the buffet. The pitcher of water left on each table had room temperature water and the waiter disappeared never to ask about drinks again. We did have a diligent busser that cleared dishes but didn't speak. We left promptly and indulged in a huge fro-yo as we were still hungry. We will not be back, ever.

Attention dosa lovers; I think I have stumbled upon most likely the best dosa place in all of America, yes, all of America. I am going to go ahead and say it; this place has even got Saravana Bhavan beat! At this point, I can compare with dosa places I've tried in Houston, Dallas, SF, Seattle, Paris, Amsterdam, and even some places in India. I think this is the best I've ever had. This is a little nondescript place in a strip mall in Aurora suburb of Denver. 
We liked it so much, we had two meals here over consecutive nights in Denver. Ambiance is simple but clean. Loved that they served in all steel and no paper or styrofoam. Place was packed on Sunday and Monday night. Staff is friendly but shy and usually swamped. 
Now, Who has an awesome spicy Andhra dosa? They do. Who can make an awesome pav-bhaji dosa also crispy? They can. And best of all, ever heard of Rava Mysore Masala Dosa? They have it. Oh my god, my mouth waters just thinking about it. A crispy Rava dosa with a dry rub Mysore masala and potato filling. 
Sambar was hot, had lots of vegetables and chutneys were very tasty. We also tried the idly and Medu vada - again, best I've had in the U.S. Crispy on outside, gooey inside - just perfect. Above all, their prices were so reasonable. For these prices, I'd never get table service, real plates, let alone this level of taste and freshness anywhere in Texas.

For South Indian food novices, here is a key : Dosa is a complicated and difficult to make item. It's like baking, all the ingredient balance has to be perfect else they turn out soggy or thick or tasteless. So are chutney and sambar. Anyone can make samosa or chicken tikka masala. Dosas are thin crepes made from a lentil based fermented rice flour. Above all, they are full of protein, vegan and gluten free. Sambar is also lentil based, chutneys are coconut based - again super nutritious, take tons of spices and hours to make. For those who think vegetarian food doesn't have enough protein, idly, dosa shuts them up. So even if someone charges you $$ for a dosa, pay up- it takes a lot of hard work. 
I'd say if the world appreciates American pancakes, admires French crepes, the Dosa should be worshipped.
This was absolutely amazing authentic the best I have had in many years lots of flavor and many choice's. I will be coming here again. Especially for Denver/Aurora area.

The food here was amazing. I had the tikka masala, and shared the samosas. Both had incredible flavor. As for the tikka, watch out if you do not like spicy because it was very spicy and I am not particularly sensitive to hot food.  It was less creamy than other tikka too; this was not a bad thing at all it was just different than what I've had elsewhere.  As for the environment, the restaurant was seriously lacking decor. The walls were bare. It would be a nice touch to see some artwork on the walls. The restaurant was small but not too cramped and it was very clean.  As for the service, it was not good.  I hesitate to include this in my review though because I think they might have just been understaffed  and incredibly busy to make it worse.  But, we literally had no server and no one came to our table for the first 45 min we were there.  We had to track someone down to order an app and then to order our entree and then to get our check and then we finally walked to the front to pay. I was on a date, and the lack of service made it slightly less enjoyable  than it would have been had we had a great server.  I have to say judging by the number of people there, and how good the food tasted, I'll probably give it another shot.  I'm hoping it was just an off night.

Delicious South Indian Vegetarian food!! The food is amazing, the prices are good & the staff is great!! Can you please open a location in Longmont so I can enjoy this great food more often?!?! We ordered the Masala Dosa & the Vada....so delicious. We also ordered 2 Vegetable Biriyanis to go. I can't wait to go again!

I've been coming here for several years... currently, the state of affairs there are not optimal.  Upon arrival you'll see a sign letting you know that you should wait to be seated - as the only individual in the entry area, I watched as someone swept the floor a few feet away from me... after some time, my presence was finally acknowledged.  It was 12:30pm on a Friday - buffet nearly empty - no idlis/papadum down to the last 3 pieces and the rest of the buffet had been polished off save a rice dish.  Having the consistency of a poorly set sand castle, the idilis eventually appeared.  That aside, the dosa was alright - hence, the achievement of one star.  One star for being good in the past.  Please figure out the customer service thing - it costs nothing.

If it had been 2:15pm, I would not have been so irked by the lack of food in the buffet.  As I left and paid my bill, I was given incorrect change and stared at as if I should just leave...

Best Indian food in Denver! The food is absolutely the best. My husband is from India and he says the food is almost as good as back home in India. 

We greatly enjoy the chana masala, vegetable korma, and dosas. The buffet is unfortunately not vert spicy (I am assuming to account for many non-Indian customers) therefore we prefer to order off the menu. The masala chai is made fresh to order so expect to wait about 20 minutes; it is worth the wait! 

Before going you must realize that this is an Indian restaurant therefore do not expect excellent service or hospitality.  For an Indian restaurant they so have fairly good service and the staff is pretty nice.
Very authentic south Indian food..it's definitely the spot if u like idly dosas but the service is kind of bad.

Great South Indian vegetarian food at good prices.

Today I enjoyed a spicy Rasam (soup) followed by a Mysore dosa.

The dosa was crisp and hot filled with spiced potato.   The dosa cane with sambar and coconut chutney.

Low key surroundings with pleasant staff.  Seems a great place for families with children.
Many vegetarian, gluten free, and vegan options. Food is excellent and great value. Very courteous st
Masalaa is the first place which comes to mind when it comes to south indian veg food in Denver metro. I have tried almost all their dosas. They have never compromised their reputation.
This is the best Indian food in metro denver. Great seasoning and offerings. I am not vegetarian and don't miss having any meat options on the menu. I love their dosas.
Friendly staff, cozy environment, delicious, hearty vegetarian fare. I love having a flavorful vegetarian option so close to home. Highly recommend the Masalaa dosa.
Chaat was cold and horrible. They charged us for the chaat we dint even eat. We ordered for soup and they got hot sauce mixed in corn starch .Staff was rude . My last visit

Have been here 3 times now. First 2 times- no big complaints, service was good, food was good. But the third time was very disappointing. This place is understaffed. 2 of our orders did not come even after an hour of waiting. Service was really bad. We just had one dish and had to cancel off the remaining. When enquired on why it was getting late we got a very rude reply. The management has to look into the negative side of less number of staff. Only upside- food is good.

This is the best food I've had! I can't eat gluten, dairy, or meat. So to have a place I leave feeling full and satisfied is incredible. The Masalaa sampler is exceptional. It is like a rollercoaster of flavors. Even the fact they use metal water glasses lent to the whole experience. The spicy flavors in your mouth when you put the cool metal up to your lips for some water is exhilarating. My kids like it to. The staff are so thoughtful and I just can't stress enough how amazing this food is! I literally had dreams about eating here again.
Excellent dosas! Some of the best I've had outside of Dosa Corner in Columbus OH. Also homemade rasam and good South Indian dishes that aren't too oily
We had Masala dosa, Rawa Masala dosa and samosa chat. Everything was good. We liked it a lot and will go again.
Great dosa and Chana bhatura! Excellent wait service. Loved the options. Hard to find anywhere else.
Great food. Great service. Serve Tawa chapati which is rare. As the name goes, the food tastes very indian with all those masalas. Buffets are also nice.

My dad picked me up from the Denver airport and said we must stop by here! He comes from Colorado Springs just to eat here and it was totally worth it! Super friendly staff and the food is delicious! Perfect spice, very flavorful and authentic

Masalaa. It's fantastic. My wife and I have been stopping in to Masalaa for a couple years now and it is hands down our favorite restaurant, let alone our favorite Indian restaurant. Other Indian places are good, as far as Indian restaurants in Denver go, sure. However, I have to think Masalaa is one of the rare Indian places that would be considered great in India itself. The place is run by a fantastic group of people who are friendly and passionate about the food they serve. The food is authentic, flavorful, and delicious. Try it. If you don't like it, you don't like Indian food.

I was searching for Indian restaurant after a long trenous drive and the first name that popped up was Masalaa. First need to appreciate the location, even in the not so prime locations we could find a good Indian Restaurant. 
The South Indian cuisine (dosa/uttapam), Chole Bahture are delicious. Could do away with the quantity of oil used. 
Service is slow and ambience needs to improve drastically.

One of my friend suggested this place. Very good taste. I loved their chettinad Dosa a lot, very authentic(chettinad is a place in southern part of India, i am from there.). Little high on oil but the spices are very different and tasteful.

This is the best Indian food in the Denver area. The dosas are crunchy and flavorful. The lunch buffet is not to be missed. The staff is nice and the new renovation looks beautiful. They also have several good Indian beers to choose from. The carrot pudding dessert is a must.
Food is very good and i would recommend to my other friends and especially the service is good and they are friendly unlike other indian restaurant.

A friend took me here for the buffet lunch and it was one of the BEST restaurants in Denver. The food was exciting, filling, interesting, and plain old delicious. For the price ($8 per person) i can't think of a better place for a causal lunch. I'm not a vegetarian, and this is still an easy favorite. That says something.

I have friends and family coming into town to visit and Masala is at the top of the list or must go places while they are here. Its worth the drive from the Wash park area.

I went to Masalaa last weekend and wow! Southern Indian food is my favorite type of Indian food because they have dosa, a stuffed crepe like dish, the crepe being fermented rice and lentil, stuffed with veggies, potatoes and amazing spices. They had the largest selection of dosa's that I have come across so far, and I think the best I've ever tried. My wife had the masalaa dosa, which is pretty traditional and probably what the restaurant is named after.
