I had one of the specialty dosa's, can't remember the name, but it was like a curried masalaa dosa, and both were incredibly good. We'll definitely be back. Just wish they were closer to my neigborhood! 

Also, this was the first time I had been there, but apparently they have recently remodeled and reopened (within the last 3 weeks!). It was very nice ambiance inside, with hanging lights, and these cool metal cups and water containers, beautiful artwork and nice color choice. Staff was very nice and helpful. Just thought I would mention that.

Best Indian food in Denver hands down!!!! Amazing food!!!!! the staff was so friendly to me and every time I come in their food is authentic and fresh and different. I'm a vegan and I enjoy coming here :)! I would recommend this place to anyone who enjoys  a different and authentic Indian flavor!

We were returning to philly after a nice vacation in Aspen and decided to stay in Aurora for a night before we catch the flight. In our one night stay in Aurora thought to had an Indian dinner. This place is amazing...very good kids menu...extremely clean. Deliciously cooked food. After traveling worldwide and eating at this and of Indian restaurants...this would make the list of first 5..outside India..

Keep up the good work guys...

Very flavorful and varied dishes.  I love the incense and cool platters. I'm not vegetarian, so, I would only visit occasionally because I always feel sort of full/yet hungry if I don't get a good amount of protein.  I did kind of feel like I filled up on bread.  Perhaps because the breads were delicious ..Dough!
Good South Indian food. Medhu vada and dosa are best. Rasam and hot sour soup are spicy and tasty

I have been to many so-called Indian buffets in my life and they are generally lacking substantially in authenticity, variety and spice. Masala is a different breed and in a class all of it's own. First off they are vegetarian which is amazing! Their use of spice is superb and tickles the tongue like nothing I've ever tasted. Their complimentary dosa is phenomenal as well. 

If you are looking for the typical inauthentic, Americanized, stuff you gut Indian buffet then this place is not for you. If you are looking for authentic Indian taste and perfectly nuanced notes of spice then this is for you. You will leave a better person and you will come back many times.
Hands down best Indian Food I have ever had, no lie! The buffet is always phenomenal & well worth the price! I'm  addicted & can't wait for my next visit!!!
Had evening buffet with my husband . The place is nice but the food is very spicy . No much food there for evening buffet which is a little bit disappointed for us

We found this restaurant listing on yelp when we were on our vacation .We had ordered all South Indian dishes as that appeared to be their forte . And we loved it here . We had ordered mini idly ( it had a little ghee on it , treat for a Punjabi ;) ,raha masala dosa , veggie biryani and ofcourse madras coffee . Everything was flawless , we loved their sambhar in particular . The place was clean, decorum was nice and servers were very courteous .We would love to go there again in our next visit !!

I wanted to like this place but can't. I'm spending a night on toilet after eating here. The place isn't sanitary. Don't go into the bathroom. I think the health inspector should give the place a visit.

I used to love this place for its amazing tasting south and North Indian dishes. Having visited this place almost every week after I moved to Colorado, I can say that something has gone wrong with the chefs. We had bad experiences two times in a row. The first time my family opted for the Thursday night buffet which is usually amazing. This time all the curries were soaked in oil and all the items felt stale. I didn't want to give up on masala yet, but, I wish I had. The second time was a nightmare. We ordered two curries and the heat level asked was spicy. We got the curries after almost an hour and it was tangy as hell. We send it back and what do we get? The same curries now very hot! When I told the staff I cannot eat it as its too hot, they say I asked for it. We did get a couple new curries after some argument but those tasted stale too. Being a South Indian I know my curries and dosas. I am not going back there! It's a shame they had to go down this way:/

THIS PLACE RIGHT HERE!!?!?! Best secret ever!! Came with some co-workers for the lunch buffet and they had to pull me out! VG, V and GF (ask for menu) options across the board and the flavors are hard hitting. Activate your senses when you walk into Masalaa and you will never leave disappointed!! Very filling and enjoyable!
Quality is food is about 3.5, the quantity of food is a 5. Excellent service, decor and cleanliness. Really enjoyed it!
We came to masala with much higher expectations. The paneer tikka masala was just paneer in tomato purée. Mirch ka salan had no spice or taste. Pretty poor service. Didn't provide plates to eat.
Tried this place for the first time and was very impressed.  The food was excellent and the service was very good.  Would definitely go back again.

Pl try the malga bajji and onion spinach pakora - they are my fav 

Amazing buffet  - with vegan options

i dont eat ghee or butter and its very difficult to find an indian restaurant.

Well Masalaa caters very well for Vegans 

SO all Vegans out there - pl do try this place 

Sairam

Have been here thrice for the lunch buffet. They have a veg buffet, so it is quite a good place for vegetarians. They have idly and vada as starters. They were good the first time I ate here, not so the second. 
The side dishes usually taste good, though on the oilier side. 
Reduced one star for keeping pooris on the buffet instead of getting some naan at the table. The pooris(if any left on the tray) are usually dripping in oil or have the feel of a papad. 
Had to reduce another star for the way the place is maintained. It's not clean!!

Nasty bathrooms!!!!! Looks like they have not been cleaned in weeks. The food tasted quite good and the service was friendly.
If the bathrooms are in this bad a shape I do not want to see the kitchen where costumers can't be dissuaded of coming back again looks like though. Also displaying your 7 year old awards in a place that obviously does not deserve any at the moment is weird to me. Don't think I'll be back. (2 stars for the good flavor and service)
Great dosa ..better coffee than Starbucks ;) I wish they wouldn't serve in steel plates though :) and I wish I could get some sauce for my noodles next time.i hope to comeback :))

I have been here 3 times. I would love love love to give Masalaa 4 1/2 stars because their food is delicious! That is why I have been there 3 times despite the fact that the service is the absolute worst I've had anywhere. I probably wouldn't have gone back after the first awful experience--imagine not being acknowledged when you walk in, being seated about 10 minutes later even though there are two other parties in the restaurant, then being ignored at the table for over 15 minutes. Drink orders not taken, naan not coming out with food then being cold when brought out, I could go on and on. Quite a bit of time passed between the first two visits (almost a year) and we'd forgotten how bad the service was and remembered how much we loved the food. Went back a second time and after getting inside immediately remembered how awful the service had been. Above experience was repeated except for the second time they were not only negligent, but also rude. Mind you we're pretty easy to please people.  Third time had company in town who requested this restaurant specifically, so we went even though we mentioned the service sucked.  Same awful service. Love the food, but will never ever go back.
I went to Masala first time and I liked the food very much. I tried Mysore Rava Masala and chilli mushroom, and it was ver yummy.

First impressions are lasting impressions! I tried this place last week for the first time and this is the LAST place I thought I would have been craving again. I'm not a vegetarian, I LOVE meat, and it took a while before I let my boyfriend convince me to go here.

We ordered a few items from their take-out menu and OH MY GOSH it was amazing!!!! Everything was full of flavor and I LOVED their curry entrees! I'm obsessed with curry and this is one of the best that I've had. And that takes A LOT for me to say, especially for a vegetarian dish! Their mango lassi is also perfect if you have a sweet tooth! And one of the most memorable things about this place was the staff. I was greeted by 2 gentlemen when I picked up our food and both were SO generous, kind, and very polite. I will definitely be coming back!
Been in Denver a year now and have eaten at 10 different Indian restaurants at least. Masala is by far the best I've had. Going back for seconds right now!!

Great South Indian vegetarian food.  They serve dishes that you don't normally find at other Indian restaurants.   The Thursday dinner buffet is a good deal. 

The restaurant has been renovated recently and the decor is much better than it used to be.

This place ONLY serves vegetarian so meat lovers be warned. The Masalaa sampler is a good call for first timers. 

Lunch buffet is $8 weekdays and $11 weekends with a free Dosa (Crepe with potatoes inside). My fav from the Sat buffet was Channa Masala (Chickpeas Cooked In Rich Creamy Gravy)

Most Masalaa dishes lean towards the savory side, the only sweet dish was Gulab Jamun (small donut ball in sugar syrup). The oily deep fried stuff can really put a dent on your stomach so be careful eating too much.

I should preface my review with a disclaimer that this was our first experience with an Indian restaurant (we only recently moved to CO from rural AR,) so maybe I wasn't as wowed as the other reviewers because it isn't my thing?  I'm still giving them 4 stars because I think they serve good food at a good price.

- Very reasonably priced buffet where you can try all sorts of Indian foods.  

- Clearly labeled buffet items, although I don't recall reading whether items were spicy or not, which was important to me.  Some items were labeled as gluten-free though.  

- Be sure to KNOW your common Indian entrees, curries, chutneys, etc. before dining here.  As others have stated, it's a strictly vegetarian buffet, so you can be adventurous without regard for unknown meat/seafood.  I suppose I was spoiled to the level of service I received at the local African Grill, where the owners individually assisted every customer in understanding the flavors, spice factor, regional variations, etc. of every dish on menu.  Of course, their prices reflect that additional service.  So if you know what you want, you can't beat the prices here at Masalaa.

- Being newbies, my husband and I both ordered "tea" when asked for our drinks and expected traditional black iced tea.  A pitcher of water is brought out to every table, so that should have been our clue that maybe fountain drinks weren't offered, but oh well.  Our server came back to our table and tried to clarify what we wanted, but we simply did not do well communicating with him - we didn't understand what he was saying and he didn't understand us.  He brought us two unsweetened cups of chai tea (sugar was on the table.)  Even though we didn't order exactly that, it was a nice treat to have authentic freshly prepared chai tea along with our lunches.  I'm not sure about the prices on those, but both of our lunch buffets + chai teas + tax was right under $30, so no complaints there.

Overall, this place deserves a try.  If I return I'll order an entree, because the buffet items didn't appeal to me.  I know I like Palak Paneer, so hopefully they offer it on the menu here.
Great place for South Indian food. When I visit Colorado again, I wi go again. Thanks for my making my stomach happy :)

I decided to try this place out while in Denver on business.  I like Indian food, but don't get to eat it very often.  I decided to give this place a try after reading a number of good reviews on Yelp!  I'm so glad I did!  Everything I ate was delicious.  It's funny because there isn't a lot to their buffet, but it's all so good!  They had this strawberry & pistachio dessert when I was there, too.  It was SO good.  I would go back again in a heartbeat.  Wish there was one of these in Salt Lake City.

The only thing that could've made this meal better is if the restaurant had a working A/C unit. :)  It was a little warm in there.

This vegetarian Indian place is located in a strip mall next to a Indian grocery store. The masala dosa and the vegetarian uttapam is delicious. Service is friendly and quick. The default sambar is a little spicy. You can ask them to make any of the appetizers is varying degree of spiciness.

Excellent south Indian food. We were visiting from Virginia and this was a gem of a restaurant find. Clean, prompt and very tasty. I had poori masala and bisibelle bath which were both excellent. Keep up the good work guys.

first off, Yelp doesnt let me check in here - even though i can check in at the place next door that has the same address. I dont know how this stuff works, its like computers are working against me to ruin everything, but I digress.

ME LIKEY. that's all i can really say .. ok, it isn't all i can say. this place was awesome. non descript strip mall restaurant with an indian market next door. parking lot has lots of sketchy '15 min parking' spaces that i hate. buffet was spot-on yummy and since it is a vegetarian indian place i could eat everything and not worry about goat getting in my gobi. interior isnt all fancy schmancy, just your average restauranty setup with a medium sized buffet when we were there. food was all delicious. korma was a stand out (but some were a little burnt on the bottom - maybe an issue with their buffet table) .. buffet dosa was small, but delicious. bread on the buffett was kinda blah. no spoon for the pickle, but i guess everyone just uses their fingers (or a spoon from something else) .. 

worth checking in if you like exploring vegetarian indian spots (and it wasnt too far from dry dock brewery which was why we were in the area for their vanilla porter)

Very good vegetarian Indian fare in suburban Denver.  No, as a carnivore I did not need to be coerced to visit an all veggie and mostly gluten free place.  I came of my own accord with a sense of adventure.

Masalaa is located in an unassuming strip center between a Dairy Queen and a Saloon.  So if the vegetarian thing isn't for you there are options...  I am open to new things, however.  That's a good thing, as Masalaa will please.

The interior decor is not fancy.  Simple tables have individual paper placemats and silverware wrapped in a paper napkin.  Interestingly, a full water pitcher greets you at the table with metal water glasses.

Samosas are my first vegetarian course, doughy and tasty dipped in the mint or tamarind chutney.  

Masalaa is known for its dosas, but I bypass the dosas for a potato and cauliflower entree.   Mmmmm.  Called Adraki Aloo Gobi, the sauce has a hint of ginger in a tomato based stew with onions.  It comes with white basmati rice.  With no Naan on the menu I add Chapati, a roasted flatbread that falls just a little short of the slightly-burnt-crispy-soft-tandoor-fired Naan I am used to and love at most Indian restaurants.

For less than $20 including tip I have crossed over to the dark side, a vegetarian for a night.  Masalaa is so good, however, that even a carnivore like myself can forget that there is no meat to be found anywhere in this restaurant.  

If I lived closer I could be a regular at Masalaa.  Don't tell that to my wife.  She might have me in Doc Maartens or even worse...  she may suspect I am trying to impress a vegetarian girlfriend.
There is NOTHING that doesn't taste amazing on this menu!

The food here is amazing,  I've been coming here for years.   The place has always been dirty,  buy i was fine with that because the food was so good.  However,  today I was greeted by cockaroaches in the bathroom,  came to sit down only to hear my neighbor jump up and scream, there's cokaroach on my table.   I was disgusted,  unfortunately,  unless they do a major clean up, I will not be coming back. The place is absolutely filthy.  If it's this disgusting in the sitting area,  I'm horrified to think what might be going on behind the kitchen walls.

Wow.

Just wow. I love Indian food, especially south Indian. Dosa...

This place does it right. Vegetarian all the way, but the flavors sing. The chutneys and raitas are a just right.

My friend and I over-ordered on purpose, partly b/c we were hungry, partly b/c she was taking dinner home to her husband, and partly b/c the prices were cheap. We got two appetizers (gobi and pakora). Both were very flavorful. The only complaint was that I was expecting more veggie per fry bit. I was expecting something more like a patty of spinach and onions. What was served was more like kale chips and onion rings. (not that this stopped me from eating them). The gobi were deliciously spiced.

I ordered a paper masala dosa (the huge one). I brought half of it home. We also got the chana saag (ooh, saag, how I love you) and the veggie korma. Both served with a nice big bowl of jasmine rice. 

I just wish it weren't so far away from home. Luckily, it's not so far from work. 

tip: it's kind of cold inside, so ask to sit closer to the back and away from the door.
DOSAS were the Bomb!!!! Four stars if you can't handle Spicy, hot doggity they like the food spicy hot but the flavors are spectacular.

Fantastic Dosas!   Sambar and chutneys were good too.  Definitely try the Masala dosa, if you want something extra spicy try the Mysore Masala dosa.  We also enjoyed the South Indian coffee and mango lassi.
Superb vegetarian cuisine ... Classy southern Indian and more!  A little gem on Parker rd  and Peoria (225 at nine mile station).  Do try...

Exceptional food !veg cutlet is really good over all id rate the food excellent ! Especially the bisi bela bath is a must try ! Usually indian restaurants thru out America don't have a good ambience . Same is the case with this place . Decent surroundings with outstanding food is what i would say abt this place !

Don't let the building's exterior fool you. This ace is amazing! Excellent prices and great portions of Southern Indian cuisine. If you like things spicy, they've got you covered. Try the Idly and the Lemon soup.

I found it to be a cool Indian restaurant in the area. Food was fabulous. I pretty much liked everything there and their rava masala dosa was amazingly delicious. Sam was very impressive. He took the time to explain all the dishes we had questions about and gave us good recommendations; truly, a very knowledgeable and friendly manager! Our party of 4 had a good time.

Delicious, delicious, delicious. Even if you eat meat, you will be full amd fulfilled here. I'm Indian and once, when my cousin came for my wedding, we came here. He'd been traveling a while and felt he was enjoying homemade food, it was that great.

This is the best Indian food I have ever had. 

The dosa is more than enough to feed two people.  I ended up ordering entirely too much food ( I couldn't help it....I wanted to try everything!).  If I lived in Denver, I would go out of my way to eat here regularly.

The gobi (deep fried cauliflower appetizer) is absolutely amazing.  Trust me on this; go to Masalaa and order it now.  

Everything is vegetarian, and they are willing to make anything vegan.

Went here after looking at the Yelp reviews. Started off decently with Gobi 65 though I've had much better elsewhere - but the Pav Bhaji was out of this world, so delicious!! That alone deserves a visit to this place. I have had Pav bhaji more than 100 times at different places but this is easily the best.

Malai Kofta and samosas are always perfect! I also love that they give more than enough rice with each entree. I love my meat and seafood but with the complexities and deliciousness of everything that I have received from masalaa I don't even miss the meat!!! Nom nom nom!!!

We weren't even that hungry, but we just had to stop by when we saw that they specialize in vegetarian cuisine. The restaurant itself was kind of dingy and run down, but the selection was good and the service was friendly. The buffet featured items that we had never seen before. Most of the entrees were super spicy (just how I like it!), but there were plenty of milder, starchy options to balance the flavors. The best part was the dosa (rice pancakes)--soft on the inside, crunchy on the outside, and served with a hearty helping of spiced lentils. I was a little disappointed with the desert selection (just ras malai and some sort of mango paste), but both were tasty. Overall, a fairly satisfactory visit (especially since it was all vegetarian!).

Bottom line: DISAPPOINTING!  I'd give them ZERO stars for their business acumen and customer service skills, but alas I had to give them a one because yelp made me.  The food is great,  if you can order off the menu that is.  Unfortunately, if you go on Saturday or Sunday and they have a buffet, then you HAVE TO get the buffet.  They should just say that up front on their door  that says SAT/SUN Lunch= BUFFET only, because when we wanted to order the tasty dishes on their menu for Sunday brunch (They don't even open til Noon on Sunday mind you), they gave us all a really, really hard time.  No, like really - a tough, tough time.  They kept trying to get us to eat the buffet which was $4 more than the dishes we each wanted.  We were not hungry for the buffet. They made us feel so bad (all five us including my elderly parents visiting us from out of state), for not ordering the buffet.  We had people with dietary restrictions.  Totally inappropriate for a business to operate in this manner.  I will never return and I had vowed the same 3 years ago when we last went.  Alas, we were meeting a friend in South Denver who is VEGAN and we decided to see if they had changed their horrid ways.  WRONG!  They are still horrid.  I do not think they should operate a business in this manner but then again, I took my business and money elsewhere- I did not stay this time.  I refuse to be treated like crap. Bottom line- you don't treat people in this manner.  

Okay, all you folks out there who love South Indian food, fret not ,and give Tiffin's in Boulder a try - tell them GET CLUED IN sent you.  They will treat you with respect.  But seriously, no need to be abused at this place.  Unfortunately, this review will not shut them down because Indians love this vegetarian place and their $11 buffet on weekends.  I just wanted one dosa and was told I was a second class citizen because I did not order the buffet, and had to wait 45 minutes PLUS even though they were serving dosas to the people who did order the buffet.  Not cool.  Again, if you want good dosas, and idlis, visit my friend J. Patel at Tiffin's... great food, and great service.  They are closed Mondays. 

A good mark of an Indian restaurant is the following:  Nice greeting when you enter, the presence of some (not all) indians, and a good healthy mix of people, and clean bathrooms.  This restaurant exhibits neither-  all Indians when we go, and their bathrooms are nasty - No toilet paper at all all three times I have been in my 12+ years of living in Denver.  No wonder they change ownership so much.

I hosted a 10-person vegetarian dinner here last Thursday.  A bit of trouble due to a language barrier making and confirming reservations but we had a table all set up when we arrived.  A very no-frills place but decent enough.  Tablecloths are covered with a heavy, clear tablecloth not unlike plastic slipcovers from 70s jokes.

Service was really good and there was a $10.95 buffet that night.  One of us asked the server how spicy it was because she has a very low tolerance for heat.  He told her it wasn't too spicy because it's meant for a wide range of tastes.  Okay, that sold me, too.  Lots of choices and so awesome that I can eat everything without going though all sorts of questions.  Many items were labeled vegan and/or gluten free so a very easy place to go with everyone.

Food is very different from Northern Indian menus I'm used to.  Good, but different.

Turns out it was too spicy for both of us so watch out if you're also a big baby. ; )

They were so nice to do separate checks, too.

Fair Ambience. Fair Value. Good Food.

Nothing special to offer as compared to other Indian eating places and restaurants.

Recommended with Reservation.

Mmmm...an entire vegetarian Indian lunch buffet?  For me?  Yes please.

Blink and you'll miss this place, tucked in a little strip mall of off Parker Road where all the shop signage is the same.

If you want a departure from your typical saag/naan/daal buffets, head here.  The cuisine is south Indian, so there are some items you won't find elsewhere (or probably weren't even aware of - I wasn't) such as dosas.  And you know what?  If you haven't had a dosa yet you're missing out.  They bring out one per diner and it's like a big, loosely rolled fried crepe filled with spicy potatoes.  Melt in your mouth goodness, and another vehicle for scoopin' up curry.

When our Yelp group went, I think our unanimous favorite was the gravy and cheese.  I'm taking a real stab at it here, but judging from their website, it was the Paneer Tika Masala.  I also liked the curried chickpeas and the little fried balls (I tried to interpret what "fried balls" were on the website, but it looks like there's more than one fried ball variety).  Also, a great variety of chutneys.

They also have mango lassis and they don't ice them down like some places.  Nothing says "stuffed to the brim" like a cool, sweet mango yogurt drink to top everything off.

Pretty decently priced at $9 and not jam-packed busy.

I've been once before for dinner when I lived closer, but it was a few years ago and I'm not sure what we ordered.  It seemed like one of everything.  I need to make my way back down for dinner sometime soon and order eggplant off the menu.

If you're looking for an Indian food experience a bit out of the norm, look no further.
Our favorite indian restaurant in Aurora! A little pricy, but the food is always top-notch.

3star Because of the staff there who are Not at all concerned about student customers. But food  iS not bad. I would have rated 5 star if the staff were pollite to me. I donno whats d problem for them if I sit where I wish to. They always want me to change my place. I faced the same prob 3times out of my 4visits.....!!

The only vegetarian Indian place that I know of near Denver. They have a lot of great menu items that they simply don't have at other more trendy Indian restaurants. This appears to be a favorite of many Indian families so I'm guessing the food is quite authentic.

This place is in an ugly strip mall and the decor is equally ugly once you're inside. The service is always perfectly friendly, though.

We went Masalaa for lunch buffet, food was great and good price (less 8 dollers for one).      But I can't give 5 stars cause this place was so cold ( no heater) and freezing ..... All other customers kept put their coat on while eating......and one more thing... They use metal plates which is good but it's also cold so food gets cold really fast!!!

ANAZING! I've spent time in India and this is like a quick trip back. The food is FABULOUS, the staff is kind, professional, and caring. Go. I can't say enough great things here. It's authentic and the best in the state.

This is a hidden away gem on the top level of B concourse. Comfortable chairs with power nearby. Delicious food and good beer selections. I had the pork shank appetizer and a flight of local beer. The service was great and it is a little quieter than most of the other airport options.

After a looooonnnnnggg day of dealing with just awful people at United, I desperately needed  a drink. I stopped by Lounge 5280 and oh my god, so glad I did! Des was my bartender, and she was so incredibly nice and helpful. I had forgotten what customer service actually looks like (seriously - screw you, United). The cider was delicious, she had 90's music on, and it's up on the 2nd level so you don't have too much traffic nearby. They have comfy chairs with electrical outlets

I'm giving it four stars because it's definitely pricey, but it's the airport, so I expected that.If you have a layover in Denver, definitely check this place out!!

If you're looking for a semi-secluded spot out of the hustle and bustle of United's terminal B at Denver International Airport this fits the bill. 

Lounge 5280 is on the mezzanine level above the gate level. You can people watch without actually having to partake in what can sometimes be chaos.

Pre-flight drink of choice for me is the Bloody Mary and Lounge 5280's will not disappoint.

The mix is homemade and they come with a variety of garnishes. One is a pickled green bean. They are crafted especially for Lounge 5280 by a nice little old lady.

The secret ingredient to their mix that will have you wondering???  Some of that pickled bean juice.

Oh... and for those not from around here, the 5280 in the name is a secret reference to the altitude.

Now you know!

Happy Drinking!!!

Perfect place for a pre-flight light meal. I had the seared Ahi Tuna entrée and it was just on point. Well-seasoned and very tasty. Des was my server and I told her that I only had 20 minutes so she acted very fast to get the order in, get the drink ready and have the bill!
service was good. the food was good to and seems well prepared. I ordered the sandwich with ciabata bread and the bread was too hard. all at the end was good.

This is my go to spot at DIA. They always have a great rotating beer list and whoever is curating the wine list does an excellent job. For an airport it's not that expensive and, for what you get, it's a great value. I like the flights which give three 2oz pours and let you try something different. I have also had the chicken sandwich which was delicious with artichoke hearts and roasted red peppers. There's a top shelf of scotch if that's your thing, either way this is better than some restaurants in Denver.

So, I'm in the Denver airport during a blizzard and they literally shut the place down for the first time in a decade...time for a Bloody Mary.
I was lucky enough to snag a table for two in the bar-great comfy seats, a plug for my electronics, and free wifi-so I settled in for the long haul. Service was great, especially considering the staff were stuck in the airport too, and they still had a great attitude and worked their behinds off for all of us crazed customers.
The Bloody Mary was great, good size with a nice spice.  I also got the ahi tuna appetizer, which was quality tuna with a good cold noodle salad.  It was perfect for me, but really pretty small for the price.  In general the prices were quite high, even for "stuck in the airport" prices.
I ended up spending more than 30 hours in this airport and wish I could have spent it all in Lounge 5280, but alas, I did have to leave eventually.  I would return here, except I sincerely don't plan to route through Denver again if I can help it....

Top notch as far as airport food and service go! Had the Moscow mule made with Breckenridge Distillery vodka (delish) and the burrata plate with lavosh crackers. The burrata was so so good; I really wanted to order a second one! I didn't, cause that would just be overly gluttonous (as if eating a whole ball of burrata on my own isn't....). The service was great and the chargers at the table are super handy!

Totally chill spot at the Denver airport.  An upscale hang that's 2nd Floor out of the way of traffic.  It has great lighting, which means easy to read, easy to work, easy to work on laptop or ipads.  Best yet, lite bites, great glasses of wine (a big menu), smashing cocktails, and many brews.

The service is really nice and friendly.  The couple of times I went, 2 girls with an African accent were working.  If that's not cool, I don't know what is.

I like.  I really like.

This place is greAt if you like your meatballs petrified and your meals prepped days before and then microwaved to perfection.  
Smoke and mirrors rip off.  UHG
The very well reviewed bloody mary is now in a smaller glass. But everything else has beeen fine, probably more expensive than before though.

In the B concourse:

Nice place to kill time during a layover.  I had a 2.5 hour wait between flights and I was happy to find this spot.  Free WiFi, outlet under the table to charge electronics, and a very nice drink menu.  I give them credit, the custom drink menu had some very intriguing items, not just simple vodka sodas or G&T.  Server was friendly and attentive.

While I didn't eat, I was extremely happy to kill time here while at DIA.

Always come here during my lay overs in Denver. EXCELLENT Bloody Mary's...ask for habanero stuffed green olives...yum!! The smoked salmon plate is quite tasty as well. 

Docked one star because I have been once when the Bloody Mary was "off". Must have been a cruddy bartender that day.

Was parked here for a good 4 hours when arriving to Denver, waiting for my friend to arrive on her flight (bad planning on our part).  I had wanted a nice quiet place where I could sit, charge my phone, watch a world cup game, and get some food and drink.  Lounge 5280 did not disappoint.  

I sat down at a table with 2 chairs which had an outlet on the underside.  Was greeted warmly by my waiter and given and iPad that I could peruse some of their food items, even though there is a menu booklet on the table. He suggested a Bloody Mary that was on the spicy side and suggested bleu cheese stuffed olives.  I said sure, bring one of those suckers over!  He came back with the drink AND a glass of water since he thought I would probably need to sip some of it.  The drink was so...good.  There was an asparagus stalk and green beans in the glass; a meal in and of itself.  It was indeed spicy but not so bad that I needed the water.  I sat there for a long time and was never bothered or pressured to order more drinks or food.  I did end up having another drink and did order a cheese plate as well as some olives.

The cheese plate was a nice brie that came with some walnuts and some yummy bread in a separate cup.  The olives were tasty as well, seasoned with I have no clue, but it gave it a nice flavor.  However, I didn't realize just how many olives I would get, and probably only ate half them - they're sized to share.

After my 3.5 hour wait, relaxing here, my friend arrived and off I went.  This is a great place to sit and chill if you need a nice quiet space to do so.

Just had a fantastic experience at this full-service 2nd floor bar in the Denver Airport. (Great location for people watching while chilling with a drink ... or two.) 

Bartender was able to make us classic cocktails and delicious Bloody Marys (they have 6 different kinds to choose from, including spicy and dirty versions!) He went out of his way to tell us about the olives and locally pickled vegetables that came with the latter, which was delicious. 

Exceptional service, good drinks, nice location. Will be back next time
we are passing through.

I came here based on reviews of awesomeness on Yelp when I had a few hours to kill at the airport.  It was pretty busy the whole time I was there, and the service could have been better. 
I had a wine, a beer, and a sandwich. Everything was pretty good. I liked being able to plug in all my devices and have a comfy chair to read in while I was killing time. The service, though. It took a long time for someone to come over (as in, I had already read through the menu and decided on everything I was getting and put the menu down and still sat there and waited). Then it took a while for everything to come out. After my meal I still had some time so I asked about the beers on tap. The server said "Oh they're all Colorado beers, what type of beer do you usually drink?" as if  there was no way I would know any of the beers they had. I know that not everyone is into craft beer and probably the airport is a hard place to talk about them, but at least mentioning the names when someone specifically asks might be good...Anyway, I was just sort of put off by that, but I did end up with a good double IPA (although I don't know who it's from).

A small bar, but it's quality not quantity here.  Nice selection of local beers. Also a decent wine selection.  The scotch selection is very solid for an airport bar. There's about 12 seats at the bar. However, there's plenty of seating adjacent to the bar. A quiet oasis in a very busy airport.
Love the moscato here anytime I'm in the airport for more than 30 minutes I come here!!! I keep forgetting what terminal its in, but it's terminal B!!!!

I wanted to find the beer list of each place at the airport that extends beyond your airport classics.

They bring you an iPad with their menu which is pretty cool. 

I selected the Avery IPA at $7 on tap. 

Other beers
Avery IPA
Avery Out of bounds Stout
Left hand polestar pilsner
Tivoli
Breckenridge agave wheat
New Belgium fat tire
Beer flight - $12

So, I tend to find I'm passing through this airport when I do my annual trip to Montana/Wyoming and this lounge/bar/eatery is an oasis away from the thousands of people running from gate to gate.  The servers are very engaging and great conversationalist.

The menu is very good with some neat selections, but not too large to weigh one down running to their next flight.

Throw in a nice little selection of wine flights and this place is my go to place in Devner International Airport.

Lounge 5280 is an attractive, airy, central location within DIA terminal B.  It's got almost everything a boy or girl could want: lounge chairs with power plugs, micro brews on tap, big screens for the game, a good wine and cocktail list; they've even got a nice mezzanine view of the terminal B hub.  Hard to pick a better location. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3-JFnH1dcVmOc2WlvYjpmQ?select=zUK0xQtLCN1DZEsC_NdB0g)

I started with an excellent milk stout (from Avery) in my lounge chair and then began my draft of this review. Of course it was difficult to "check in" since the location was off by 18 miles, in downtown Denver  (Fixed that!)

They have food too - but just apps and small plates.  This is where they first fell short: my burrata app came with decent quality cheese, but the tomatoes weren't fresh, the herbs were wilted, and the rosemary bread was stale. $14 for this; Jeez.

But the main issue: The wi-fi signal was surprisingly bad; Such a damn shame with everything else they've got going on; I became so annoyed with all the drops and re-connects that I decided not to linger longer.

Note: Lots of useless pics of this place on Yelp - mostly closeups of wine bottles or cocktails.  I did my best to add more useful ones.  With that and the aforementioned location update, I felt my Yelp maintenance duty was done for the day.

This review begins with the seats. Nothing else. MAN looking, for a comfortable place to plant my butt. Nothing else Jim, nothing else..... So..... Nowhere in the airport can your rear end truly accommodate a long 7 hour layover like this place. I'm not talking about the trivial appetizers, or typical drinks, IT'S ALL ABOUT THE RED BEHIND CRADLING SEATS when you're in 14 hours of flight time. I. Love. It.

I'm so glad I moseyed over to Concourse B.  On a long layover to Seattle, I found myself needing a place to peacefully do PowerPoint while charging my various electronic devices.  I stumbled upon Lounge 5280 after pigging out on Chinese food at City Wok.  I really wish I had a smaller meal so I had room to try the cheese plate and/or duck confit salad at 5280.  

1) They have 53 wine by the half glass, glass, and bottle (a little odd that they charge by the half glass, I've never seen that before?) 
2) They have Colorado-made or owned alcoholic products.  I had the Doctor Leopold, which is not as strong as I'd like it to be, but still good.  It's made with Leopold American small batch gin and Leopold orange liqueur.  I was contemplating a second drink, but then remembered that I was coming home to Seattle to see the parents, so... even the slightest hint of intoxication will be frowned upon. 
3) Friendly service and cute, quiet place that makes you forget you're at an airport!  I like that they leave you alone and don't give you a hard time for sipping on one drink while staying... forever (okay, 2-3 hours).   

Don't be fooled by the limited menu they post on the sign outside, there's actually a more extensive food menu.  My only complaint is that they're doing last call for food at 7:45pm - what?!

I had a beer and a prosciutto and egg salad sandwich while I was here on a layover. The sandwich was bizarre and the beer was beer. Service was great. I left my laptop charger there and the manager had it Fed Exed to me. So nice!
Wish I would've stopped here before the Mexican joint downstairs. Great drinks, great service and plenty of seating so your not all crammed in a small space like the other bars in the airport.

Sometimes when I travel I want to feel like a high class baller. Lounge 5280 lets me fulfill that dream by crafting up my pre-flight drink of choice... a bloody mary.

This is not any ordinary Sunday discount brunch bloody mary, with watered down house mix tomato juice. The bloody mary here has body and full flavor. Get it with an infused jalapeno or bacon vodka, but if you are a traditionalist, they have several different vodkas you can get. 

I try to arrive a little early to the airport to get one of these. Even if I have a flight at a different terminal. This place is the place to get a drink and do some great people watching. It is becoming a go to place for me when I am departing out of DIA.

lounge 5280 - Concourse B (Upstairs)

'Had about an hour before boarding, yelp*d - 'And up came "lounge 5280."
(Translation - "The mile high lounge") 'Like the name!
If you happen to be passing through here, do yourself a favor & drop in for a visit.

As soon as I took a seat at the end of the bar, I was asked by a very friendly lady if I would like to charge my iPhone... Really? 'Absolutely, mahalo! (I believe she may have been the manager.) Date: 03/01/13 @ 10:30am
Photo - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lounge-5280-denver?select=zUK0xQtLCN1DZEsC_NdB0g#Mm6kCIgbyrUXKyAFmVZlpw

Since I recently learned that just about every airport has a Signature Bloody Mary and in addition to being one of my favorite libations... 'I ordered a diet coke w/a lime.

What, are you nuts?!... 'I need breakfast!

The Bold'er Bloody Mary - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lounge-5280-denver?select=zUK0xQtLCN1DZEsC_NdB0g#m5SXkPCDgE94-27Hp8gXgw

In fact they offer seven different Breakfast Cocktails that fall under the "Bloody" variety.
Menu - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lounge-5280-denver?select=zUK0xQtLCN1DZEsC_NdB0g#DCyQSBIczCwF7Uwi2ZZzNA

You may also see this guy seated @ the bar...
Andy B. - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lounge-5280-denver?select=zUK0xQtLCN1DZEsC_NdB0g#PFTWyzwqZAQ6M47iizOgCQ
('Look closely, Andy's wearing a pixelated, camouflage hoodie... 'Makes him hard to see.) 8)

This was the third place that was serving bacon infused vodka on my short, four day trip... 'Hot item. Colorado loves its bacon. Yep, I could live here.

Andy B. also mentioned that I should try the bacon infused bourbon. I was ready to buy us a couple of shots but when I asked Liz if they had any in stock... 'No such luck. 
Liz - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lounge-5280-denver?select=zUK0xQtLCN1DZEsC_NdB0g#hw2c5o_S4xwWkG-nqHgWYg

'Also, ask Liz about "The Crested Butte'th" - 1 1/2 oz vodka; 1/2 oz peach puree; equal parts cranberry, oj, & club soda
Photo - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lounge-5280-denver?select=zUK0xQtLCN1DZEsC_NdB0g#oG_c_iitJZxQWUtfHuo-zA
(A drink designed by none other than Andy B. himself.)
I'm sure it would probably be great w/champagne as well.

I really need to get back out to Colorado sometime soon, very cool place.
 - Big Aloha!

Food/"Breakfast Cocktails": 5
Ambiance: 4
Service: 5
Value: 5
This would be the ultimate airport bar to get stranded at, I'd actually welcome it.  Amazing menu, and beautiful ambiance, well lit, spacious and free wifi.  Nice crowd also.  Highly recommend it.

Uh....don't go there to eat.  If you want to eat, go to Elway's downstairs.

***** (5 Stars)- Amazing, zero flaws, a must go! (Not given often)

**** (4 Stars)- Memorable, strongly feel you should visit

*** (3 Stars)- Above average, worth a visit

** (2 Stars)- Average, some pro's and some con's

* (1 Star)- Opinion is do not go, below average
Great cocktails! Open airy environment. Perfect respite from airport hustle. Also delicious beer. About to get the ahi tuna - photos to come.

Tons of wine, listen on an iPad. 

Cornichons with the hummus & veggies

 Comfy seating with power for my dying phone. 

Cool name, represents the altitude of the mile high city. 

 I hate flying through DEN, but this place makes it bearable.

Has long layover at DIA. Had the burrata - it was very good. You get sundries tomatoes. Recommend the rosemary bread.

They have outlets under the tables ! Nice.

It's always nice to have a great selection of locally distilled spirits. It seems as if Lounge5280 prides themselves for this. As always, take care of your bartender and they will take care of you. I call it "The Mile Hi Spirit". Cheers!

Love this place.  Went to the United Club and they were packed in like sardines there.  Blew that off and went to Lounge 5280 Wine Bar.  It is a little hidden on the upper level in concourse B but that is fine by me.  Plenty of comfortable seating and quiet.  it is cool to look at all the people below coming and going in this busy airport.  they have my favorite Sav Blanc - Mahua.  so much more peaceful than the loud, packed United Club.

This is a good spot to wait for your flight if you're not eating, or rather if you want some alcohol and some of their food. Their food selection is where they fall short, nothing jumped out at me and it was pricey. 

The wine that I had was great but it was also pricey. I realize we're in the airport but I don't think I'd go back and pay $16 for a glass of wine again! 

Service was good, everyone was friendly. Probably would be more fun on my way to a vacation with someone!
Great selection and pretty good craft mixed drink selection. Must try their Manhattan. They use a lot of local spirits and the bartenders are generally sociable and attentive.

Highly recommended airport restaurant.  
They have amazing drinks and a huge variety.  Not your typical well drinks with an extra shot for 2 dollars airport restaurant.  Not at all!
Upscale feel and very friendly, thoughtful service.
I wasn't extremely hungry so just had a drink and some olives.  
Menus are on Ipads which is a fun touch.
But I will be back to try everything else!
Outstanding service, quiestest locale and upper level of Terminal B, drinks fav and Burrata was perfectly perfect ;). Jony did an excellent job in recommendations. Thank you!

The location is great, and the BMs are first rate, but I don't get all the five star reviews. The bartender was just "there," doing her job, with zero personality and no friendliness. I wonder why they don't carry Colorado liquors or wines from Palisade. I was going to ask the bartender but she was such a drip I decided not to. The big HDTV behind the bar was showing blurry stretched standard definition. They will ding your card for 20% no matter how much you tip. It's nice, but nothing to rave about. They don't have their own wi-fi here and the airport wi-fi sucks and is unusable at this location. Somebody else mentioned this to the bartender and she said, "Yeah, we get that all the time."  Maybe I didn't drink enough?

Lounge 5280 is a nice little place located in Terminal B of the Denver airport. It has an upscale look. It's bright and has clean lines. I had the Duck Confit priced at 16 dollars and it was great. They have a limited menu, mainly cheese and breed trays, but if you are looking for something more than a burger give 5280 a try. They also have local beers and a good selection of wines!

Stopped here for something to eat and drink. Unfortunately there was not much of a food selection that we noticed. 
The wine was good. We each had a Pinot noir wine flight that we enjoyed. i would definitely stop in again before another flight.
Great drinks. Nice atmosphere and plenty of outlets. Pretty much the perfect airport bar.

Great place for an airport drink- comfortable seats good beer and cocktails. I thought the cheese plate was great - 3 quality wedges at an acceptable temperature - ie not so cold you can't taste it. Great meal!

So I recently found myself heading to Florida on vacation, with a two hour layover in DEN one morning. I had eaten breakfast and still had some time to kill, so I was walking around the terminal. I saw this cool looking wine bar, and I saw that it was open. (This was about 945am). 

So I'm like "Ooh, I heart wine!" and then I'm like "But it's 945am, I don't want people to think I'm an alcoholic." But then I was like "I'm at the airport; nobody's going to care," so I sat down in a delightfully comfortable chair and perused the list.

Because I am indecisive, I went with a flight containing a chardonnay, riesling, and a brut sparkling wine. The really friendly bartender gave me extremely generous pours of everything, saying I was lucky cuz all the bottles were nearly empty, so he just emptied them out. I loved all three of the wines. The riesling had a nice (but not overpowering) sweetness, and overall a very complex flavor. The chardonnay was rich and oaky, and the brut was just perfectly flavored. I sat there reading a book, sipping my wine, and really enjoying my layover. 

After I was done, the nice bartender guy came by to ask what I thought of the wines and we chatted about different flavors, like people do at 945am, like it was no big deal at all. I gave him an extra good tip. 

Check this place out if you're in DEN, even if it's at 945am.
High quality food, though not too much of it. My stomach thanked me. Some beer too, with a lot of local flavor.

What do you do when you land at Denver International Airport and learn that your three-hour layover is extended by a four hour delay?  You drink.

Normally I would spend time between flights at the smoking lounge, but I quit smoking earlier this year.  Lounge 5280 isn't listed on the directory in Concourse B, so I found out about this place when another lounge closed at 10, and one of the employees there recommended it because they are open late.

I would have much preferred spending the entire evening here, rather than the first place and its $14 martinis and boring Chili's-like atmosphere.

Lounge 5280 is stylish, comfortable and staffed with friendly, attentive people.  Their drink menu offers some inventive specialty drinks (Colorado Corpse Reviver anyone?), but I didn't stray from my usual vodka martini ($11), with a Diet Coke inserted every once in a while to ensure that I remained vertical until my flight finally left at nearly 1:00 a.m.

You'll find me here for the duration anytime I'm stuck at DEN again.

My favorite place to have a layover. Comfy chairs with trendy decor and an outlet at the tables for laptops. Friendly service and some great drinks. Only reason it isn't a 5 star is it has typical high airport bar prices... to be expected.
Great place to hang while waiting waiting for a flight. Great selection of wine and appetizers. A must when you need some pampering. Yum yum !

This place is overpriced (even for an airport), and the service is terrible.  I also experienced a fraudulent charge on my credit card when one of the employees added to the receipt. Avoid this place.
Cool for an aiport place to grab a snack and a drink.

Lounge 5280 is located at the airport. Upstairs with the remainder of the restaurants. However, what is unique about lounge 5280 is that it is stylish, quiet, and barely anyone was there. (Exactly what I needed at the time of my layover on a Tuesday morning.) The decor is classic and clean with red touches. I love the comfy chairs with mini lamps at the table overlooking the lower level. My waiter, also the bartender was super friendly and knowledgeable. I mentioned that I am vegan, and he immediately suggested the hummus entrée. Arrives with veggies and pita. I was in the mood for a bloody mary, and he offered 4 types of vodkas. I chose the jalapeno infused vodka. I like spicy! And, if you do too you won't be disappointed. Plus, they have a large selection of wines as well as a full bar. I give the lounge 5280, 5 stars for their decor, service, and delightful drink and entrée! Thank you! 

Disclaimer: This should have been posted on 12/18/12. That is when I was there. My apologies. Finally catching up from the Holidays.

Just found the quietest place in the DIA. Nice cold beer and great people watching. A little deceiving though, there is beer on tap but no taps visible. I had the Agave wheat, which was not bad.  The seats are comfortable but they lean a little too far back, like you were at the dentist.  There is a giant selection of booze though.  Nice service.  Must make a stop if in Concourse B.

A good place to stop in the Denver airport. I was there in the morning so it wasn't too busy but the service was good. I enjoyed my bloody mary and the actual space itself was comfortable. I will probably be back on my next layover.

Amen. 

I didn't eat here, as I screwed up and ate at the disgusting French place below here in Terminal B. There's a proper wine list by glass or flight. Nice bar staff and..well I could miss my flight for this!

If you have to spend time in an airport, I can't think of a better place. Great cocktails. Good beers. Nice small plates. The Salumi Misto is a must order. Can't say enough good things about this refuge in a sea of mediocrity. Go there to the exclusion of all other options.

Unexpected Surprise in Denver!  This area used to host a Crock Store.

It's upstairs in the B Concourse.  Great place to unwind, people watch, and catch up on emails.

4G here so I tethered to my phone. Not sure if they have internet.

Great Wine Selection though and very friendly staff !

This place is legit.

Tucked away, so no frantic people sprinting past you with their kids and or luggage.

Second floor, so you can stare down at said frantic people.

Best bloody Mary I've had in a long time...if not ever.
Free wifi and comfy chairs. Perfect place if you need to kill a couple of hours at the airport. Great wine and beer selection.

Lounge 5280 is a sanctuary in the sky at DIA!  You sit in an elegant and comfortable open air lounge area with a sense of being in an eagles nest.  Cocktails and wine are the focus though they have a good beer selection too. Their well gin was Roundhouse ... a Boulder micro-distillery that has won numerous awards.  Imaging that, a Double Gold winner at the 2013 Denver International Spirits Competition is in the well!  Lounge 5280 knows what it's doing.

I've only had the beer here, but they have a decent local selection of brews.  This is the best place to hang out before or between flights if you end up in the concourse B.  Lots of natural light, ESPN on the TV's, great view of the teerminal, and nice seats to relax in before your flight.  The staff is always very friendly as well. Plus, you can't beat the Colorado beers.  Check out Lounge 5280 next time you are at DIA.  I wish they had one in the other two concourses!

I'm a sucker for cocktails with top shelf liquors that aren't mainstream (think Buffalo Trace Bourbon or Hendricks Gin). Every cocktail here was well thought out and and made with really high quality ingredients. With that said though, each cocktail was only 90% great, which is still 30% better than anything else you can get here in the airport. The wait staff was also uniformly polite and knowledgeable about the menu. If you're looking for an inviting place to spend a long layover, this is it.
They charge you for bread when you can't understand what you're ordering because the waitress can't speak English.
A lovely place to wait for a flight.  Grab a drink and a snack, open up that laptop and enjoy the free wifi in the airport.  We love hanging out here!
Waited awhile for service. Service was then slow. Waitress seemed like she couldn't care less. The beers were OK. Solid Meh for this place.

Great selection of wines, full bar, delicious small plates made right in front of you! I wish there was a lounge like this in my home town! as a 1K flyer, i'm in DIA often and Jony behind the bar is always as friendly as can be. Great Job 5280! TIP-try the Buratta Plate and ask for the free wifi password.

My wife picked this as our stop in Denver on our way to NYC due to the reviews and she even heard about this place in a magazine.  Disappointment was the only thing we got here.  

My wife decided to get a flight of wine.  The server forgot which glass was which upon delivery, being they were all whites... my wife had no idea which wine she was enjoying with each glass.  I opted for a bourbon on the rocks, that was after my server also couldn't tell me anything about the 4 cocktails off their list I had questions on.  I will admit it was a good local bourbon.

We opted not to get food after our server mentioned that it would be so fast because everything is microwaved quick... ewk. I know restaurants use microwaves but, I don't want to know my duck was zapped... no thanks!

I think I have my wife convinced to try a beer stop on the way back!

I liked the layout of this space and the fact it was elevated above the main gate level.  Every table has an outlet which is almost a requirement in today's day and age.  They will also provide you with login credentials for their own WiFi which is quite fast and much better than the standard Boingo hotspot - you just have to ask.  Being early in the AM, I enjoyed smoked salmon with egg salad on a bagel and while not NYC quality, enjoyed it much more than your typical Egg McMuffin.  The coffee was rich and not watery which I appreciated since I drink it black.  Service was terrific - no hovering but never gone for long either.  Prices are typical for an airport, so no surprises here.  I can think of a lot worse places to spend a layover.

Definitely the best spot to hang out on a long layover.  Great cocktail list, friendly staff, and lots of places to plug in (even at the bar).  

Easily the best spot in the airport.

What Dan B. said.  Open, airy, bright - wonderful place to enjoy a glass of wine in public and watch the world go by.  If you have a layover in DEN, make a beeline for Lounge 5280 if you like wine.  Very attentive server who even offered up their outlets behind the bar for us to charge up our iDevices - great service!  I know exactly where I'm going next time I have a layover here . . .

Huge selection of wines, cocktails and beers to choose from when you have some time to relax before your next flight. Friendly staff but the space does get a bit crammed but hey, the more the merrier.

During a layover in Denver we stumbled into this place for a drink. Our server Becca answered in the affirmative to my request for a Sidecar. It was hand squeezed from fresh citrus and fantastic. We discussed mixology and decided to have a few more cocktails. Then we ordered from the tapas menu and it was wonderful. The foods were locally sourced and very fresh. Becca was very knowledgeable about the drinks and the food. I thoroughly enjoyed it. The only real drawback to this place is that it is in Denver and not local to us. We would go every week.
For an airport wine bar this is tops. They have even added some higher protein menu items.

The liquor was excellent and only moderately over priced, the food was not worth the money and I would have been better off at one of the countless chains that populate airports. Eat somewhere else and drink away your layover here.

Hey 5280...I'm a fan, and you certainly bring it up a notch compared the other DIA eateries.  I find it odd that we have a world class airport, but the shops and services are just so-so.  5280 does stand out here...  Staff is friendly, and the menu/drinks is geared for the quick bite crowd.  My only gripe is some menu tweaks...I had the mozzarella with balsamic glaze the other night...  The ratio of mozzarella to the other bits (tomato, bread, glaze) was off, leaving you with too much mozza at the end.  I know that 5280 will provide a remedy here..

Ended up in Denver with a long layover and found this spot. Fantastic! Nice little appetizer menu, very good wine selection by the glass, each table has an outlet for laptop or cell charging, but the best thing was the wonderfully friendly waitress named Rachel. She was terrific!!! Very comfortable banter and went out of her way to engage with my 13 year old daughter. It was the best airport experience I ever had. Whatever Rachel is getting paid it's clearly not enough.

Agree with other reviews that this place wouldn't stand up outside of an airport. But here's the thing - you ARE in an airport. So given that, this place is great. They have high tables and low tables. Not sure that the high tables have outlets but all the low ones do, which I don't think should be overlooked. That plus the free wifi makes this place pretty darn handy. Not a beer person but the wine selection is quite nice. I had the duck salad, which was definitely good but the duck is served on the bone (leg), which I think is really not ideal for a salad in any case and definitely not when you are cutting it with plastic knives and forks. I highly recommend to them that they cut the duck and that they also add one more salad option, maybe with seafood or just totally vegetarian. If you need a place to charge and get online in DIA then I def recommend!

This place "does not suck," as my co-worker just put it.  Surprisingly sopshisticated cocktails and wine that you'd expect to find at a trendy bar in a cosmopolitan city rather than the Denver airport.  I can vouch for the Bloody Mary, made with their homemade Bloody Mary mix and including a spear of asparagus and picked green bean along with the standard olive.  They offer small plates of cheeses and meats, but the portions are a bit skimpy.
Nice place. was bored hung out for a while.

We first visited Senor Ric's when looking for a new place to eat at near our home while we had family and friends in town. We had no idea what to expect in going and we were a bit surprised when we arrived that it wasn't too busy given its size, and the fact that the parking lot seemed pretty full. However, fear not, Senor Ric's is one of those underappreciated restaurants that, because of its lack of appreciation, is unpretentious while also having great food. Those are few and far between in the Denver metro these days. The food while being great, also comes out in generous portion sizes, which makes it a great value. The service is also spot on. Senor Ric's is definitely worth a visit.

Holy tamale what a dump!  The interior hasn't been updated since MASH was playing in prime time, and the place is covered in grime from top to bottom.  I came here with my family for lunch last week and was blown away by the fact that this place is still in business.  It took our waiter thirty minutes just to take our drink order, then another twenty minutes to bring us our drinks, then another thirty minutes to take our order.  1.5 hours later, our food arrived.  

The food is on a completely different scale of unknown origins and disgust.  I ordered a smothered burrito with a beef taco and a chicken flauta. The only thing edible on the plate was the flauta.  I couldn't even get through two bites of the burrito and had to give that up because the taste was so awful, I just couldn't bring myself to eat it.  The taco was made up of mystery meat that did not taste like beef at all.  I have no idea what they used for refried beans, but they were not refried beans, more like strained bean mystery concoction.   

To top it off, me, my sister and my niece were sick not long after we ate the food.  My niece was nauseous all day, I had stomach cramps, and my sister had prescription-strength indigestion.  This seriously has to be the absolute WORST Mexican food I have ever had in Colorado!  I am from there, so I grew up eating some of the best Mexican food in the country, but Senor Ric's is not Mexican food at all!  Taco Bell has better food than Senor Ric's.  

Do yourself a favor and avoid this place at all cost.  It is overpriced, the service is terrible, and the food is disgusting.  Check out La Casa del Rey in Commerce City or Las Delicious in Denver....both have amazing food!

Best authentic mexican food.  You'll be met first with chunky, delicious salsa and hot tortilla chips.  I highly recommend Senor Rics Chimichanga filled with pork green chili.  Be careful no to hurt yourself, their portions are HUGE!!  But that's why God made doggie bags right?!  Delicious food, friendly and prompt service, inside of restaurant is pleasing to the eyes and nose (no weird smells).  My friend and I went on a Tuesday afternoon, so I'm sure thats why our food came so fast.  I can't imagine this place isn't packed on the weekends, its just so good!

Haven't been here in years but decided to go today for lunch. The restaurant was not busy at all. The service was good and staff was very friendly and attentive. The chips and salsa was good, and menu had a big variety. There is gluten free as well which is also appreciated. The food was quickly out and good. Very authentic and generous helpings. The beans and rice are excellent but the guacamole is not very good. Overall it was a good experience and would return.

The first impression is that its a huge space with super dated decor. There were lovely live plants all over the restaurant, that part was pretty impressive!
The restaurant was clean.
The waitress however, didn't seem to be. She has food all over her shirt and smelled like smoke. Not the best way to represent the kitchen! We also had to wait literally about 20 minutes until anyone even noticed us. There seemed to be a ton of staff but, I think we were interrupting their conversations and texting.
The happy hour menu is a joke. There is ONE margarita available and it is buy one, get one free. We ordered them and GOT THEM BOTH AT THE SAME TIME! So, we tried to drink the first one as fast as we could.....who likes watered down tequila? I guess if your water glass didn't get filled as much as it didn't here...anything liquid would help.

The food: Unremarkable and unmemorable. The best I can say is that no one got sick. We came, we tried, we won't be back.

A clean environment, decent value, good service and slightly above average food.  

Walking in the door was a "Back to the Future" experience as it was obviously an old Chi-Chi's.  That's neither good or bad - but, wow!  I haven't been to a Chi-Chi's in two decades but it was all so familiar.  

The rice in beans were rather tasteless, the chips were ordinary, and the salsas were good.  My chiles rellenos were very good with lots of cheese.  They were the Thursday $7.99 special.
Food was Delicious. I looked over half an hour for a good mexican restraunt and this one hit the spot. Service was good and Fajitas were the bomb!!! lol if im in town again i will surely be back :-)

Haven't been here since 1994. Seems literally nothing has changed and that's not a bad thing. Good food, very well prepared, but a little too hot at first temperature wise. Overall a strong 4 stars and we will be back. Staff was very friendly and attentive.
First Mexican restaurant I tried since moving here. Loved it. Nice service and great food.

We both had their lunch size cheese enchilada. It comes with rice and beans. We also had a cup of their cheese queso, was yummy as always! I think their service is pretty good. They have people wait on you but also have people who keep your chips and salsa full as well as your water. This is a big plus for us.

This is my go to place for Tequila Tuesdays in Aurora. A pitcher of the house margarita is $10, which is fantastic because not only is it seriously tasty but it satisfies my group of three. The queso appetizer is amazing, in my opinion it's the best item on the menu. The rest of the menu consists of cheesy, fried, americanized Mexican food though.. so not exactly my cup of tea but my friends love Ric's Platter.
The service is fast and friendly, one of the waiters recognized my friends and I after two visits even though the restaurant always seems to have steady business.
Overall, I mostly enjoy coming here for their Tuesday Margarita special but it's a great place to grab dinner for family and friends.

We had a private party for 50 of our relatives and friends to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday.   The food was great, reasonably priced and the service was top notch.  I would recommend Senor Ric's for any occasion.

This place is awesome!!! I have an addiction to Mexican food, and it's a wonder I'm not a tortilla filled balloon by now...but we were there on a weeknight, and the place was decently filled, but there was no wait time. I really like the layout, and they had plants everywhere so it was very inviting. Our waiter was really attentive, and the food comes out super quick! The food....oh the food was SO good!! I had a grande burrito, and it was HUGE. Decent prices, and you get leftovers-win/win! They had margarita madness going on on Wednesday-$10 pitchers. Now what's better than that? Not much. Not much. I will be going again, if I can trick my husband into going (he's not addicted to Mexican food like I am). Maybe I can try telling him we're going for "ice cream":)

Tried this place for the first time. Out dated, but regardless the food and service was great! Has a chip and salsa bar. I had the Sonora chicken...it was so yummy! Husband had a smothered chimi! Overall, great! We will return! Our server, Tracy, was fantastic. Thanks!

Love this place! The staff is always welcoming and nice and the food is pretty tasty. I go here with family a couple of times a year and always rotate ordering the pollo magnifico or the chimichanga. 

This is a great place to go for yummy decent priced Mexican food!

Love this restaurant! My family and I have been going here for ever! The decor is a bit outdated... But the food is amazing! The Rics Platter is the way to go! So many fun sample sized items from the menu! The staff has always been respectful! The restaurant is always clean too!

Ugh.  I really can't think of a positive thought regarding this restaurant.  Casa Bonita's food puts it to shame.  I'd rather have tacos from Jack in the Box, not kidding.  I took two bites of a burrito, tried the beans and left.  Beyond redemption.

When the highly-recommended Cafe Paprika turned out to be on two weeks' vacation, we went next door to here.  Wasn't expecting more than your basic Anglo-Mex joint, and got what we expected.  Decent food, tasty salsa, good service.
Not too busy, always friendly. Good deals on drinks too. Dated interior but apparently clean kitchen and positive staff.

So I ordered 3meals from this place. I don't eat pork. So for each meal I specifically asked for ground beef. When I made it home by my surprise, even though all the meals were supposed to be ground beef there was a pork chimichanga. When I called to let them know that I had a pork chimichanga, Jeff whom says he is the owner says that he was there when the young lady read the order back to me and she never said that I wanted all ground beef. Never will I ever go back to this restaurant. They don't value the customer at all. I should have never had to pay for a meal that I do not eat.

We decided to go here since we had heard such great things about this place. The food is not authentic Mexican food. It's more Americanized food. The enchilada sauce tastes like can sauce and very tomatoey the fajitas did not look like what fajitas look like and the rice was not good at all. Very disappointed. We won't be back but will keep looking for something authentic

I had such high expectations for this place.  The parking lot was crowded and that is usually a good sign.

The service was good, but the food was very bland.  The margaritas were strong but TOO sweet.  Salsa is ok, like something out of a jar.  The "spicy" sauce on the enchiladas was not at all spicy.

Overall, this is a Mexican restaurant I would take my grandparents too and they would love it.  Bland and not spicy.....they would be fine.

We have been going to your restaurant for
years, but, it was my recent visit that
has finally made me realize that the food
prep, quality, and service will keep me from
ever going back. The Caesar "wrap" was soggy
 & fell apart. (We had asked to substitute a ranch wrap vs. Caesar, but, 
was charged 1.29 for a bowl of ranch dressinginstead). The 2 soft tacos - ala carte, - were served with brown lettuce and
the tacos were soaked in liquid. The mini
chimis were lukewarm. 
goodbye....will never return.
caveat emptor.
Service was great, people friendly and I could see how this could be a fun happy hour. Had the Ricks's chimichanga with green chili which was marginal.

My family and ordered takeout from Señor Ric's three nights ago and it was fabulous.  The food was great, the kids meals were substantial and everyone had leftovers for the next day.  We've eaten at the restaurant a few times as well and were always very happy with everything.  Now that my family has tried a few different Mexican restaurants, our official favorite is Señor Rics.  So good!
Great food. Great service. Great environment. Thanks for everything and would highly recommend.

Oh man. I've been here once and I won't be going back again unless I have a guaranteed hour to myself in the bathroom afterwards. Great value for the food and tasty! Gave me serious bathroom problems a few hours later and i usually don't have problems with Mexican food, but one day I'll be back!

I am only giving this 1 star b/c I have to give it at least 1. If it were up to me I would not give it any!!!

The chips and hot sauce were okay. But, the food was terrible!!!! I will NEVER eat there again! YUCK!

Awesome food. We've  been coming here for years
 A little out of the way for us but worth the drive. We usually get the Rics platter. Plenty of food and the green chili is to die for. Great margaritas as well.  Plenty of space to relax and enjoy your food. Keep up the good work!

I used to love this place! I still really like the food but enough is enough. It's so sad that every time I go in for take out over the last several months and I have to deal with the owner, Jeff I believe is his name, he is such a jerk! It's not necessary to be rude to people just because you feel like you can! I haven't had this kind of experience with the other people that have helped me, they are actually quite pleasant. He seems irritated to help and take my order (which by the way, is incredibly simple. Mixed mini chimichangas). Furthermore, he acts as though it's a problem that I know what I want when I come in. I thought the last couple of times, he may have just been having a bad day, and hey, I get it! Everyday is not your day. But after today, I am over it! I can certainly find somewhere else that I get great service from someone that can offer more than a scowl and an attitude, especially when I'm spending my money. This particular individual is just so rude and so disrespectful, I'm no longer willing to give this place my business.

It is a nice comfortable space and I can see how this might have been a daring adventure in mexican food 20 years ago. I don't know, they obviously have a very established client base, and I suppose if you like margaritas and nachos this is the place to go.

However with all the widely available mexican food literally all over the place here, I don't see any reason to ever go here, except maybe to host a child's party or something. Go for the space, i guess, or to get drunk on tequila mixed drinks, do not come for the food.
Service was okay. We had to ask a few times to get hot sauce, and never did get an extra napkin or a new fork.  Salsa should be way better for a mexican restaurant!

Food is very respectful,but greasy and all alcoholic drinks are shorted in liquor I hear from the employees that this restaurant is awful to work for. The managers have no respect for their own employees and there customers I would have to not recommend this to anyone as a go to restaurant
Honestly the worst Mexican food I've had. I just took all my food home and trashed it.

This place is delicious! We went on Tuesday and had a $10 pitcher of margaritas between 3 of us. The chips and salsa were pretty good and we all had the stuffed sopapillas (chicken and beef) and they were very tasty. I loved the flavors in the rice and black beans.

Welcome to Colorado! I love good Mexican food and Ric's is the spot. Just flew in from Miami and once again, using Yelp, not disappointed and Ric's hit the spot.

They have two happy hours, which I've been told are common in Denver but either way, awessssommeeee!! Had a 2 for 1 beer and is I ne of Ric's signature margaritas. With the combo of Ric's special and his margarita, I want to shake this mans hand. Not only was the food great but the building itself reminds me of hanging in Santa Fe, loving it. 

What they could do better: (1) the chips should never look or seem like they came from the bottom of the bag, ours did; (2) just bring me a beer. If I walk in, your slow, just grab me a beer right when I order it, just real fast, solves so many things you (server) might fail on. 

Overall, awesome, we're bringing the boss in!

Food and service is always good when we go here. Also Happy hour after 9=2for1 margaritas. But Yelp has them listed open til 11pm. Thats a bit misleading. Dining room is open til 10pm. You can get appetizers at the bar after that til 1030pm when the kitchen closes and the bar closes at 11pm.

This is my all time favorite Mexican restaurant! I've been coming here for more than 20 years and they have never disappointed me. They're always consistent which is a huge factor in finding a good restaurant. The staff is always friendly and welcoming, the food is always hot and prompt, and the pricing is very reasonable. One of Aurora's hidden gems. Give them a try! You won't be disappointed!

Steak fajitas are mind-blowing, and the portions are ENORMOUS!  Enchiladas seem pretty standard, but I've only ever seen what my friends ordered.  Seriously, get the steak fajitas.   Their happy hour is great, and they have $11 pitchers of margaritas all day Tuesdays.  My classmates and I often go here after a big exam, and even when showing up in a large group, the service has been nothing but polite and attentive.
Consistently good food.  Decent service, but not outstanding.  The guy who brought around water and iced tea was a little lecherous-seeming, but harmless.
The mango margaritas are strong and delicious.  And they have spinach enchiladas!

Senor Rics has been a family tradition, passed down by my step-father, since 1994. They have never disappointed me, not once.
