They have the most awesome Margaritas and the Mexican pizza is amazing, Going on 15 years now as a faithful Senor Rics customer. I had my daughter's 21st birthday here and I have introduced the place to all of my friends and loved ones. Love it!!
We've been eating at Senor Ric's for many years. It has never disappointed us. Good food, reasonable prices and friendly atmosphere. Would definitely recommend it.
I have gone here for years and have never been dissapointed by the food or service. Great Mexican restaurant,

Good service,  bit run down, food meh at best. Too much good Mexican food in aurora to waste my time going to it again for a dinner but will stop for happy hour margaritas.  Servers are very nice and attentive.

Still my fav after many years! Love love LOVE the traditional chicken chile relleno!! 
Still my fav!
My favorite!! We go here once a month even though we love kinda far! I recommend the spinach enchiladas, crispy rellenos, queso, and lemonade. My husband gets the number 10 if you like a LOT of food.

The salsa was very boring. Tasted like it came from a jar. But the rest of the food was fantastic. Service was great. I was the only one who had the green chile which was delicious but landed me in the bathroom with a terrible tummy ache

This place has decent Mexican food. I loved their sampler plate that offered me a little bit of four items. It was great for my vegetarian kiddo too. The service was excellent but we were out in a spot that was crowded and hot. The heater or something was right by us and it was making us all so hot. The busser tried to help but had no success.

I have been coming here since I was a kid! My parents have always come here for happy hour. I love the reviews stating this isn't authentic and this is blend it obviously isn't that bad if it has been an aurora favorite for years. 

The Margs are ok.. Wish they were a little stronger but 2 for the price of one isn't bad. NACHOS = best in Colorado! Can't beat the piled high non sense of senior Rics. The decoration are defiantly out dated but I don't really drive to senior Rics for the decor! management and staff are friendly and you cant beat the "serve your self chips and salsa bar" that is ALWAYS available. 

Tuesdays are $10.99 margarita pitchers and that in it self is an awesome reason to come here! check it out. I LOVE it.
Moved from Texas so it was so nice to find some some dang good tex mex. We will with out a doubt be back soon!

It's Americanized Mexican food. The inside was huge! The decor was very stereotypical.  The only saving grace according to the other reviews is their happy hour, that I missed. 
 
The salsa tastes like jarred salsa. I was very unimpressed by this. It was free though so that's good.

Had the green pork  chili burrito and it was terrible. The pork is chopped up into tiny pieces, so I couldn't really even tell that there was any meat in my burrito. Then they smother it in the same green chili. (The smothering everything in pork green chili is a very new thing to me considering I live along the border of Mexico my whole life and they only do this in Colorado) My "burrito" was basically a rolled soggy flour tortilla in a bunch of bland sauce with little bits of meat. I highly recommend not getting it.

My friend got a combination of enchiladas and tacos. From the looks of it the enchiladas didn't look to appetizing. My friend said their margaritas were pretty good. The tacos come in taco bell shells.

The staff was friendly enough. Overall not too impressed. Definitely not a redo place. Note to self, don't go to Mexican restaurants with English names.

Not terrible but not out of this world either. Service is Fantastic though, and really friendly.
Happy Hour is the best time to come, two for one drinks from 3-6- chips and salsa are OK... the salsa is a little too tomatopasty for my liking but it's still decent. The green chili is alright too. Good Margs! My favorite dish is the fajita steak tacos.
Amazing food!  We came in for a late lunch around 3 expecting another non remember able experience and we were pleasantly surprised. Everything was melt in your mouth delicious!!!!!

This place has solid food, but needs to hire more servers.  I would love to give this place 5 stars, but the management needs more help to take care of everyone. Most nights when I go, servers have 7-10 tables each.  Food eventually gets to you, but takes 15 more minutes than it should.  Dishes come warm instead of hot which is not pleasing for fajitas.  

Drinks are great and the bar good too...this place could be a lot better than it is now.
Had the chili rellenos. Little on the spicy side. Wouldnt order them again. Had better elsewhere.
Awesome food, reasonable pricing, and great atmosphere. The service can be a little hit or miss (I waited for my check for nearly 40 minutes one time), but that is my only complaint.

Always amazing service, even in a rush. Food is amazing and menu is easy to understand.  Plus its affordable for family lunches and dinners. A very authentic environment and I love their burritos! So good!

I come here about once a year, because I have a friend who absolutely loves this place. The food and atmosphere are ok; I've only been in the bar area of this restaurant and never the dining room. The last few times I went (so in 2013 and 2012), we somehow managed to miss Happy Hour (bad on us), but they do have good happy hour deals. I will have to try to schedule my 2014 visit during Happy Hour to take advantage of the deals. 

In this general area of Aurora, I much prefer El Parralito

The chips and salsa are what saved this place for me- and it's not the chips and salsa they bring out at first. I'll explain more later. We were in Aurora and craving mexican food so my friend suggested we eat here. She hadn't eaten here in years- but it was worth a try.
At first they brought out a salsa I didn't care for- very chunky and out of the jar tasting. I asked for another spicier salsa, and they brought me out a pureed SPICY salsa that tasted home made, yum! I ordered a chicken dish and my friend ordered a burrito and both were decent. The decor is tacky, I definitely get a 90's vibe. Would come back maybe in a couple years, but nothing I'll crave.

Hands down this is my favorite Denver Mexican restaurant. The is always served hot and the portions are big enough for my wife and I to get a second meal for take home. The margaritas are big and really good.  If you got happy hour then it is 2fers - not half price seconds like some happy hours. Great service and great foods at reasonable prices. What more can you ask for?

Above average food. Below average service.. The atmosphere is good.. The service was lacking yes I was seated and given warm Chips and salsa that was great. But after given our food we were never asked how the food was.. If we needed refills and didn't see the waiter again until we were finished eating .. Food wise it was average .  The fajitas were good... nothing special.. all of the trimmings (sour cream and guacamole, etc) were all thrown in a tiny bowl on top of watery lettuce Ame I had to dig it all out onto a plate to build my food.. The tacos were not at all good beef was greasy and the chicken was watery... Especially for $3ea. The chicken Quesadilla was mostly a pepper jack/cream cheese filling not much cheese or chicken. But was still a good size and was good overall. A quesadilla 2 tacos, steak and shrimp fajitas and 2 drinks about $35 not bad price wise .not good food wise.

This place is one of my favorites!!! Friend and I are here about once a week if not twice a week! I love their Grande Chicken Burrito with green chili, their shredded beef tacos, and their taco salad (i get mine with no greens add rice). Service is great, and quick. I also love their happy hour! I remember even a few years back celebrating a birthday there with a giant group and still nothing but the best service and food. Hands down one of the best Mexican American restaurants in town!!! Highly recommend it.

I have been here several times and the service is always sub par. This was the straw that broke the camel's back. Got seated by the hostess... waited...waited .. waited.  Ten minutes later no greeting, no waiter, no water not even an hello. Many waiters and bus boys present,  Probably more staff than customers and yet no service. Finally my husband and i decided to get up and leave. What a  bummer. I tried to give your restaurant yet another chance,  sadly I won't ever be coming back.

The food here is indescribably terrible. We went in with a party of seven people and all of our food was awful. The chicken chimichangas tasted like chicken pot pies. The chips and salsa was flat out tostitos and pace picante. The green chile tasted like brown gravy. The guacamole was essentially avacados puréed. This place got high accolades from coworkers and yelp, so this inspired our venture. After making the same people who gave such high acclaim to this place try some of the leftovers I had boxed, they quickly changed their opinion. To their defense, they all seemed to say something in the food must have changed since their previous visit. I didn't know it was possible to mess up Mexican food so bad until I came here.

This was my first time here. I have to say I was quite impressed with the food and margaritas. Of course, I only had alewives but they were delicious. Their wings were excellent. For those of you that like spicy wings, I definitely recommend these. There frozen strawberry margaritas were great as well. I will be coming back soon.
Love this place!!! Has great happy Hr specials great service and a fun environment!!!
It's been many years since we have visited Señor Rics.  We just moved to the area and went back. It was better than we remembered! Great service and delicious food !!

Relaaaaaaaaaax, people. Chill out already! 

I am not about to try to convince you that Señor Ric's is even remotely close to an authentic Mexican restaurant. 

What I *will* tell you, however, is that it nevertheless offers up some very tasty food within its pretty peach walls, with eager staff flitting this way and that, ready to please. 

The Pollo Magnifico takes tender chicken and encases it in a deep-fried (I can hear your lips watering from here!) shell, then tops the lot with cream and melted cheeses. Or how about those spinach enchiladas, dense with vegetal healthitude?

Wow, how did dessert time come around so fast? Well, of course the fried ice cream always has tongues wagging. And the decadent chocolate mousse pie will have you juicefasting until 2073. 

It is any surprise that this place is so popular?
I love the fajitas. I wish the tortillas were a little bigger but all you have to do is ask for more. Excellent place to eat at a reasonable price. Margaritas are yummy too.

After reading the glowing reviews and driving past the place numerous times and seeing the parking lot packed, we figured it has to be at least decent, right?...Right?!  Um, no.  Chips and salsa were meh.  We got the chile rellenos and cheese enchiladas.  Chile rellenos were your standard (for the area) canned hatch chile and greeeeaaasy, cheese enchiladas were bland.  

The beans...let's talk about the beans...who puts bacon in their refried beans?!  I don't think I've ever even had that anywhere and it was not a tasty combo.  I suppose if you're on the trendy bacon bandwagon that's running rampant at the moment you'd like them...but all I could think was that it wasn't Mexican, it wasn't even Tex-Mex.  I don't know what it was.  

Interior of the place was out dated and looked like it hadn't seen an update since maybe the late 80s early 90s.  Service was just ok.  So very disappointed.  It seems like the people that really love the place all rave about the pollo magnifico, but I don't feel like wasting another $30+ to find out.

This is not Mexican food. The food there is just awful. Their food is just an imitation of what Mexican food is. There menu is very limited in offerings, their employees couldn't pronounce the names of the dishes. Ketchup is spicier than their so called hot sauce. I'm embarrassed that this place calls what they serve as Mexican food.

I visit Senor Rics 2 or 3 times a month. The happy hour is great with the free chips and salsa. The 2 for 1 drinks are awesome! The prices are very reasonable with good portions. The service in the bar is marginal but in the restaurant area is very good. The staff is well trained and very friendly.
I enjoy visiting due to this establishment is very predictable. I have never had a poor visit but above average to good.

My family and I have been eating at Senor Ric's for at least 20 years. I have never been disappointed. Lets elaborate a little.....

The owners and the staff are all very friendly and very good at thier jobs. We are always greated and treated like family. The atmosphere is cozy and quite appropriate. Stucko walls, tropical plants, authentic music, what else could you ask for? The bar is very nice as well. TV's always tuned to local sporting events, great happy hours (2fers) endless chips, salsa, bean dip and queso. A great place to watch a game or gather for a work or family event.

The food is always spot on. The best description is Colorado Mexican. It's not authentic mexican by any means, but it doesnt claim to be either. And to call it Tex-Mex wouldnt be approprate either. They have a unique style of food and I really think that is what they are going for! Kudos!

The Green Chili is like none I've ever had. I consider myself an authority on Green Chili. I make my own and have tasted just about every varity there is to try. SR's Chili is a pork chili, very thick and very tasty! I always begin my meals with a bowl and two tortillias. I only wish it was a little hotter as I like my chili very spicy! The Salsa is very good as well. Always fresh, chilled and plentyful. Again though, I wish it wee a bit spicier. The Guacamole is excellent as well. My wife and I really enjoy the Quacamole tostadas! Yum!

The drinks are always good and the variety of Margaritas is superb. IMO, The folks at Senor Ric's have hit a home run. and the best part is that it is always consistant. You canalways count on your favorite dish tasting just like you knew it would. 

For all you doubters and negative reviewers, lets face facts here, you dont stay in business for as long as Ric's has by serving bad food. The parking lot is always full for a reason. Do yourself afavor and go back with an open mind. Dont go there with a preconceived notion of what you want it to be, enjoy it for what it is, delicious!

-MK =]
I really love these guys fajitas. I  have been eating there since I was a kid and will continue to eat there
Worst Mexican food I've ever eaten at a restaurant. I only gave them one star because they're making me  give at least one star to post a review.

We were really craving some mexican food and our usual spot was closed so we decided to try this place out.

I would say the service and atmosphere was average... Nothing special, but nothing bad either.
The food was what killed it. Salsa was a little on the Light side. Tortilla chips seemed like they were out of a bag. What really killed it for me were the entrees... They came out and looked very good. Every bite was bland and flavorless. What ever you do, do not order anything with shredded chicken... It reminded of cat food... looked like it was pureed in a blender... texture and flavor was horrible. Shredded beef was bland... Didn't even have quesadilla for kids menu. Instead, a cheese crisp or a  tortillla with cheese on top, = my 2 year old wouldn't eat it because it was dry and hard. 
Was sad and filled with regret we decided to eat here..

This is a gringo-style Mexican restaurant which is just fine for dining in the neighborhood. The pollo magnifico is sooooo good but I usually won't order it myself as it's deep-fried, covered with crema and then cheese, but really is a delight for a splurge. Chips are good, both gringo and egg-battered rellenos are good, guac tostada good, hubby loves the green chili burrito. Not a fan of the spinach enchilada. 

I suggest going during happy hour, beers are 2-4-1. Sometimes they'll set out bean dip in the bar area (which is quite large by the way and not too "bar-feeling").

It's not a 4 star restaurant, but it satisfies the need for greasy Mexican food.

We lunched here yesterday. I love the big dining area...the Mexican music and the cleanliness. The service was great ! Very attentive. Our drinks ,salsa and chips were replenished without asking or waiting. I nearly filled up on those alone because they were so fresh and tasty.
Everyone at our table ordered the Ric's platter...I ordered the taco salad. Some members of our party felt the green chili was a bit spicy...but I tasted it and I thought it was very good.
The salad was huge and good. I will be back. Love this place!
Food is yummy and the happy hour is super affordable!  The enchiladas can't be beat and the grande burrito is exactly that...grand.
Always have good service! Everything I've eaten has been great! Seems clean too! Will visit again!

Visiting family in Aurora, our uncle wanted to bring us here for lunch. He has said this is his second favorite Mexican restaurant. So eight of us had a very good meal. When the waiter found out we were originally from So Cal, now from Phoenix. He chatted with us and maid us feel welcomed. Our food was very good, not the best but nothing to complain about. Place has a very large dining room, very cozy and the service is very good. I noticed they are on a first name basis with a lot of their customers. If I lived in the area, yes this would be a place we would regularly visit.

Had a wonderful experience tonight great service! i had the chicken magnifico my regular i've been coming here for a long time and I tell you the staff are not thieves customers should pay attention to where they leave their belongings before pointing fingers!

I have such fond memories and food cravings from Senor Ric's. I think I have gone there for over 10 years. Other Mexican restaurants have come and gone. These are the main reasons why Senor Ric's is the place for Tex-Mex cuisine.

1.You get bottomless chips and salsa as soon as you sit down. The chips are warm and you can tell the salsa is homemade. I like that the salsa is fairly mild to get you started on your meal.

2. Their mini chimichangas as appetizers are magnificent. They are like fried eggrolls of chicken or beef. It comes with a cream cheese that has a hint of jalapeno.

3. Their combos are great. They have become more expensive over the years, but I have yet to find a replacement. Their tacos, taquitos, enchiladas, and burritos are all tasty. The dish comes with refried beans or black beans and spanish rice.

I rarely have room for dessert. I'm a little disappointed with the fried ice cream. It isn't fried, but has a corn flakes covering. The soapapillas are tasty but could be cheaper.

This restaurant is not the place for authentic Mexican food. Also a complaint I get from friends is the lack of spicyness. I actually like this aspect of their food.

I hope you give this place a try.

My wife and ate here while visiting Denver last weekend. The food was bad enough that after about 3 bites, we left. The food is presented well, but it lacked flavor and the servings were not balanced.  For instance, the Spinach Enchilada had one leaf present inside a good sized tortilla and a very small amount of cheese. The Chile Relleno  consisted of the smallest Chile I have ever experienced used in the dish. It was less than 2" in length and the cheese used was minimal. The Chimichanga we ordered had less than two oz. of chicken inside and it lacked flavor. It looked great smothered in chopped lettuce and tomato, but so does waxed fruit. I would not give them a second chance.

I love this place. I mean, it's not a "home-made tasting" Mexican food restaurant which is why I only gave it 4 stars, but it IS tasty none the less. I love the mini-chimis and the prices are very reasonable. The decor is nice as well.

But one thing that really takes it over the top is the wait staff. I've been going here for at least 4 years or so since it was close to work and I've never had a bad experience. Whether I sit in the bar area or the restaurant, everyone is always nice. 

So if you ever want a quick bite to eat with a Mexican food flavor, definitely stop by here.

My family and I only went here because we were desperate for Mexican food and kind of lost in Aurora. So, we settled on Senor Ric's. I kind of wish we hadn't.
If anyone remembers the restaurant chain called Chi Chi's, then you will be familiar with what this restaurant is like - faux stucco, paper parrots, mexican polka, dim lighting, white people everywhere.
On the back of the menu, there is a small section called "gringo favorites", which includes a chicken breast sandwich and a hamburger (both served with fries, oh boy!). What's ironic is that almost everything on the menu was mexican food for gringos anyways. The salsa was funky, as it had huge chunks of green chile in it; the chile con queso tasted equally weird and like it had been reheated; and I can only presume that the lighting was so dim so that no one would notice things like how brown the guacamole was. 
At least my crispy rellenos were tasty, although I did have to put a lot of spicy salsa on it.

Bottom line:
Bad food, and bad service. I'm as white as they come, and I make better mexican food at home. Yikes.

Ok I've been coming to Señor Ric's for 15 plus years and always enjoy the food. We have a favorite waiter Miguel he is always friendly and remembers what we like and is very attentive. Now for the not so good, the last couple of visits we went and Miguel was not in so we went in. There customer service was well below acceptable the male owner/manager walks around that place like his stuff doesn't stink. He can be very arrogant and stand offish. Even though we've been regulars for 15 years he's always been to good to come and talk or acknowledge our loyalty he could learn a thing or two from Miguel. Like a previous reviewer stated the parking lot is always full but what goes up will eventually come down and I'm not wishing bad on anyone but I think there needs to be some customer service training. If the owners read there reviews which I hope they do realize there are lots of good restaurants in the area that would love to acknowledge customer loyalty. In ending a BIG A++++++++ for Miguel as long as he's there we'll be back
If you don't like Senor Ric's, you're just weird. Or you're not from Aurora. One or the other.

This has been our favorite Mexican restaurant for over 20 years. All their food is terrific, especially their crispy relanos. Margaritas are the tops, happy hour 3-6 and 9 to close are 2 for 1. mmmmmm good!

Senor Ric's is Mr. Mixer and my biweekly date night place. Not that we have a schedule. But we kind of do. And often, we end up at Senor Rics. 

First of all, you can sit in the bar area. No big deal, right? Except you get all the self-serve chips and salsa you can eat. And I can eat a lot of salsa. Because of this laxity with the salsa, Mr. Mixer and I usually share a Ric's platter and a pitcher of margaritas for dinner. Bonus points for a cheap meal! 

The Ric's platter is good, though. Two mini tacos, two mini flautas, two mini beef chimichangas and three miniature pollo magnificos surround a little bowl of green chili. OMG-- EVERYTHING IS SO FREAKING TINY AND ADORABLE!!! Ok, now that's out of my system. Everything is pretty yummy, too. The chili is spicy and peppery. The chimis are topped with melty cream cheese. Guac on the flautas. We like it all. I haven't had anything else there in a very long time. 

One recommendation: get an upgrade on your margaritas. The house margaritas are just too full of sweet and sour; they make my tummy hurt. The Baja margs are good.

The kids meals are too spicy and when you voice your opinion to the manager or the server, they just write you off like you don't know what you're talking about.  The manager had the audacity to tell me he was going to take the meal back but he was going to taste it in the back to see if we were telling the truth.  He didn't apologize once while our 4 year old said the food was burning his throat and our 1 year old was holding his tongue out and crying.  We won't be back.

It's a shame you can't divide the reviews between food and drinks. Ric's happy hour and margaritas are of note, but the food is really not very good. If you're just going to meet up with friends and have a few drinks, the pitchers of margaritas are a good deal and tasty too, but once you've had your fill.. it's time to find another place to eat. You would be better served at the Taco Bell drive thru and for a quarter of the money! The food is pretty low quality. Everything is deep fried (and not fried well half the time) and smothered in oily cheese (and I consider cheese to be it's own food group). It's a shame really because you can only drink so many margaritas before you need some food to soak up the tequila!

The drink specials kinda rocked. Margarita goodness with some variety to boot. The food was pretty good (not quite as good as my LA fav, Don Antonio's but good). The parking lot is almost always packed, and that is always a good sign. They do have a separate bar and restaurant area (big plus), and a nice little happy hour. The chips and salsa seem like they are made there and not from a bag or a can. I suggest ordering from the pick three platter dealy they have. The portion for that is good.

I come here for a burrito, EVERYTIME. Granted, I do switch up the guts & innards of my rito's. Seriously, Chipotles got Nuthin' on these guys. 

I'm sure other menu items are great too but these guys are my goto when it comes to "Chipotle style" burritos. 

This is a Boulder Hallmark. If you're ever thinking about Qdoba or Chipotle or even Big City Burrito, forget about it, actually, slap yourself in the face for even thinking about committing such reckless behavior and get your arse to the nearest Illegal Pete's. I believe they have 3 locations these days but I could be wrong.

The wife and I stopped in for dinner, as we were looking for good Denver Mexican food. Illegal Pete's seemed up our alley - quick service, full bar, funky setup. 

What we experienced can only be described as Chipotle meets dive bar, which isn't bad, per se. I had a burrito, the wife got a burrito bowl. Everything was pretty tasty, but I wouldn't say it was the best burrito I've ever had. 

I got a beer from Avery Brewing, my wife got their house margarita. She said it was too strong, and I saw the bartender making it, she wasn't lying. 

Overall - not bad, but we'll probably go more traditional next time we want Mexican food in Colorado.

If you want lunch or dinner, skip this place and head to Qdoba or Chipotle.  There is nothing special about the lunch and dinner fare.  It's kind of blah, but it fills me up when I get hangry.

But if you want a monster breakfast burrito or bowl, this is the spot to be.  I tend to go for the breakfast bowl with chips on the side.  Lots of scrambled eggs, potatoes, choice of chorizo or bacon (I go for the bacon), and load it up with salsas (corn and the extra hot are my go-tos), cheese, sour cream, and guacamole.  Dip my side of chips into that cheesy goodness and all my troubles are gone.  Work problems? Off my desk.  Hangover? Dissipating as we speak.  Relationship woes?  What relationship, because I am in love with this burrito bowl.

Load it up with some Cholula in the back (which every bottle always seems to be running low) and I am feeling fantastic.

The staff tends to be a little sassy and act as if some people are a nuisance (I tend to order my meals online, and I always tend to get some attitude).  But that's the way that it goes in the fast casual atmosphere.  I ain't paying for service.  I am paying for that bomb ass breakfast burrito bowl.

This location tends to be packed no matter the time of day, but the line seems to move quickly.  Be prepared to wait.

Solid food. Was a little disappointed on my last visit opting for the burrito bowl. VERY skimpy. My original visit I got a burrito and was thrilled. 

I'm a veggie so lots of options. Potatoes. Peppers. Broccoli. Rice. All that. Nachos, tacos, various proteins. Solid place with a cool vibe. Full bar against one wall. A must see when in Denver. You're already doing something on 16th street mall anyway. Bring your out of town friends in here for a real taste of Denver.

Super tasty Mexican food right in the heart of "touristy" 16th Street. I had a great veggie burrito with guac (free without dairy!) and delicious fresh chips and salsa. I had a great $2.50 Coors Light beer for happy hour while watching the Broncos on TV. A great low-key hang out.

It's only right that when coming here I would be comparing it to Chipotle the entire time. They have similar concepts and for the most part have the same food offerings.

That being said, I don't believe that Illegal Petes trumps Chipotle. The one Huge plus they have is that they have queso which is awesome. Other than that I would say the food is a bit of a step backwards from Chipotle.

The guacamole here is easily forgettable and I would not recommend getting it. They do have a lot more options here than Chipotle which is awesome, but the overall flavors in my opinion were not as good. Anyone in Denver, does need to check out Illegal Petes to make your own comparison

UPDATE: I gave Illegal Petes another chance and this time tried the chicken instead of the steak and BAM! that change was key. The chicken here is awesome and the go-to play when selecting a protein.
I received an apology message from management, which I greatly appreciated. Definitely bumps my rating up one star :)

Pete, you're a cool dude in a loose mood and I like it. I like it a lot. 

My husband wearing our baby, a few rad buds and myself popped in for some fast eats and brews and had a delicious time. Getting a burrito perfectly to order made in front of you without hitting one of the chain gang is super rare. I love it. I love pointing to shit and having them mix it up all perfect and then getting to drink alcohol with it. It's awesome. 

The ambience here is super casual, but nice and lived in and drawn on, so it's not stuffy or sterile. No matter who you are or who your crew is, I think you will feel comfortable here and you will certainly enjoy the treats smothered in green goodness.

Late night. Hungry, in Denver. Where to go??? Illegal Pete's! This place was so clutch after a Cabaret Show in the Clock Tower. It's straight forward Mexican "street" food with a stocked bar and funky atmosphere. The employees were so friendly, even though there was a crowd. They kept the line moving and did it with a smile. I ordered three beef tacos and was pleased that they offered corn tortillas. The quality of the food was fresh and flavorful! Will be back again.

Very good food good atmosphere quality food with good choice of beers I tried chicken Brito it was very delicious and local craft beers are top notch 
Music is loud so you are in party mood . If you are in downtown in Denver make sure you have a meal hare
Good value for your money

A late nights staple in Denver. Many options including beef chicken and vegetarian. Prices are reasonable and the staff is always friendly. Open late, so that's a plus! They even have beer if you're in it in a reasonable hour.

The fact that this place exists makes me very happy. 

If you're in the mood for a breakfast burrito on your way to work / while traversing downtown in general, you should make a point to swing by this place. Suggest the chorizo and green chile salsa!!

Three things:
1. Food was fast. They've got making a burrito down to a chipotle-like science - they asked me 4-5 questions about how I wanted to customize my burrito and prep was done in a minute or less.
2. It's cheap! I got a decently large burrito (not nearly chipotle sized) for less than $5 with tax
3. Decor is fun. If a dive bar and a fast/casual restaurant had a kid, this would be it.

The staff were also talking to one another about being enviro-friendly, so brownie points there :)

Great spot for a quick morning bite -  highly recommend!

I've finally found my go to item here!! I usually get soft tacos, but opted for a burrito bowl this visit. Who knew that adding queso would be such a game changer! And that if you skip adding cheese and sour cream, you can get guacamole for no charge! The 16th street location is right around the corner from my office and union station, perfect for downtown! I came during the lunch rush, there was a good amount of people both inside and out on the patio and the staff was on top of everything, very friendly and the line went quick.
Great Mexican food, happy awesome service providers and very generous drink portions. Atmosphere is festive and laid back.

I've always loved pete's. My boyfriend is the most peaceful man I've ever known and some raiders fan was talking shit and my boyfriend said "hey it's all good, good win" and the cunt ass bartender said "don't be rude to my bar clients" and kicked us out. Ask any of our friends, in 26 years he has never started shit... you want to be a cunt? Fuck you, I'm never going back there. Choke on a dick. Ill fuck you up.

Burritos and booze. What more could you ask for??

I'm not necessarily the biggest fan of fast casual restaurants. They usually seem cold and bare and not entirely welcoming, but Illegal Pete's has a comfortable "come and stay" sort of vibe that makes me feel at home. 

I love the loud music, the crazy stickers covering everything, and all the colors and warm lighting. Like chipotle, you approach the counter and ask for a burrito, bowl, tacos, or salad. I did the steak burrito bowl for $6.99 with cilantro rice, black beans, pico de gallo, sour cream, cheese, lettuce, salsa, and extra cilantro. I thought it was goooooooood. Plenty of food for the price and all the ingredients looked and tasted fresh. I also got plain corn tortillas on the side, which were nice and hot.

Having a full bar and actual bartenders is what makes Illegal Pete's pop. The bar was packed at 10:30 PM on a Monday night, so they're doing something right. It's definitely a really fun atmosphere that'll cheer you up (and fill you up) when needed, and they're open until midnight during the week. I'm a night owl so I'm always on the hunt for legit late night food options. :) Thanks, Pete!

So we asked our Uber driver what's a staple in Denver he said you got to get green chili. So I asked where's is the best place to get it he said Illegal Petes so here we are. I noticed it's a Colorado based company kinda like Chipotle just smaller and local. They do custom burritos but obviously better than chipotle. But compared to burrito joints in Texas there's not a whole lot of options. So I gave them 3 stars because it's good just not amazing. Staff is very friendly food looks fresh and clean. Just not a lot of flavor maybe if the salsa had more flavor it would be different.

Been to this one and the one on Broadway. 

I have NEVER had good customer service. It is hipster people that don't have an ounce of customer service in them and are completely sarcastic and rude when you Come in!

Unless you order beer the drinks aren't good either! I would suggest to go somewhere else! He'll go to chipotle they have better customer service.

Illegal Pete's is hands-down my favorite fast-casual eats in Denver.  I LOVE getting a giant salad with chicken, and loading it with veggies, toppings and salsa.  So good, and so filling.

Also, everything in there just seems so coool... the staff, patrons, atmosphere, even the copious amount of stickers everywhere scream "this is chill place".

My only complaint is that IP's is so popular, the parking can be tight and the line to order can get long (especially at lunch and dinner times).  But luckily I've never had to wait more than ~10 min to order.  And of course your food is prepped right as you go, so there's no wait after you pay.

I wish they would open up more locations, especially up in the Cole/Whittier neighborhood!

So good.

I'd read the great reviews for Illegal Pete's on Yelp and tucked them away as an idea for good food later.

The vibe definitely lived up to my expectation and the Pork Carnitas Nachos that I ordered exceeded them.  Ingredients were soo fresh, prepared right in front of me and they piled them high on top of the bed of chips before covering them with glorious queso.  

How often does it happen that you run out of chips before you run out of the "good stuff" while decimating an order of nachos late night?  It happened to me at Illegal Pete's!

Great local spot!!! Very hip interior, if your lame, step into and be made new. The food rocks.

Read my reviews to know that I rarely praise restaurants with a five star review but they earned it. The big fish burrito changed my world. 

And if I didn't love it enough... This obnoxious woman was asked to lower her voice because she was yelling into her phone.

Imagine Mexican food prepared like Chipolte but inside an edgy bar. Great fun. Lots of choices with all the fixings. Very casual. Pefect for pre or post game fare.

The staff claimed their chocolate chip cookies are "best ever"... good, for certain,  but best ever? Not quite.

This place is a fun time. Decent prices, good selections for both beer and food. Great happy hour deals. Only qualm I had was I ordered 2 beers, my fiance was holding a table for us, as it was very busy and the bartender wouldn't give me both beers without seeing my fiance's ID. I get it.... but after waiting 30 minutes in a line to order, it was just annoying. But staff was friendly and funny. And food was good. I'd go back.

Bump Chipotle, Illegal Pete's is the way to go for Mexican food in Denver! Simple Tex-Mex food prepared cleanly with always fresh ingredients. My sister and brother-in-law took me here on my last visit to Colorado. I love Mexican food but am sort of picky when it comes to preparation. I abhor greasy food that lacks flavor. Illegal Pete's is just the opposite. Quesadillas, burritos, nachos, or salads. They have it all boasting killer flavor and reasonable prices. I mean holy guacamole, it's fast, fresh, AND simple. My kind of place for sure. If I was a Denver native, I'd frequent this place on the regular!

The food: 4/5. It's a no frills Mexican spot. I tried pork, beef and fish tacos, the meat was a little dry and the fish fillet was on the smaller price, but still pretty good. However, I loved their margaritas, which were cheap and not overly sweet. 

The service: 5/5. The guys working there were friendly and answered all of our questions.

Overall: Can't beat tacos and a margarita for $12.

It's just like chipotle but only better! The fish fry burrito was delicious and freshly made. It's was quick service, funky, and we had 2 burritos for $16. The burritos were big but they weren't the best burritos I had. It's a good spot to grab a beer and go on your way around downtown. Craft beer on happy hour was $3.50.

I stopped by for a snack on NYE. My friend had sung the praises of Illegal Pete's for some time, and I was super excited to try it. I had a carnitas taco and a chicken taco. The tortillas were fantastically fluffy. The chicken and carnitas were perfectly flavored. I loved all the fun topping options. The guacamole was perfectly flavored and creamy. The staff were super friendly, and the service was fast. I had a good time and will definitely be coming back!

Chipotle and Pete's have a few things in common..both are Denver based. They serve burritos that have rice. They both serve food in a line where you add what you want etc. Now let's tell you where they differ. Pete's is expanding at a slow rate so the quality is good (no one poisoned yet). They don't nickle and dime you for extras. The food is good and full bar is there. This place is hip..don't be surprised if you see hair nets on the men's beards. Chris D. Shift manager rocks. Try the nachos. But burritos here rule.

I used to frequent the Illegal Petes in the DU neighborhood- but now I frequent the one downtown. The staff at the downtown location is far less friendly, rude and to be honest violate a ton of health codes. The food is always great- if I was rating just based on the food it would be four stars. When ordering my burrito another guest came to the counter to ask for hotter salsa, the cashier began to talk over the guy making my burrito and myself to talk with this gal about salsa in an INCREDIBLY loud voice to the point that I had to repeat everything I was requesting. The fella making my burrito proceeded to tell him he was way too loud and I say yeah that was loud. He went on to talk about himself and his loud tendencies. Dude, if someone says you're loud maybe you should quiet down a bit. 
Then I asked for limes with my burrito...when asked how many I responded with "like four." In my mind this meant if they are less juicy limes how bout six, if they're on the juicier side how bout three...the cashier decided to mock me and say "here's your like four limes, if you need like six let me like know." Can you say condescending? His attitude ruined my entire experience. 
While eating my burrito I look to my right and see the cashier pulling the trash can out of the receptacle. I will say he does have gloves on. He starts pulling the "slop" out of said receptacle with his hands and throwing it into the bin. No broom? No dust bin? Hands?! What I see next made me want to purge my entire lunch...he wiped his wet trash covered hands up and down his apron multiple times. What's worse is he didn't take this apron off when he jumped back behind the counter. 

I will not be back.
Combo of qdoba and a more traditional Mexican taqueria. Good queso and really like that tortillas and chips come with entrees. Steak was excellent quality. Cheap margaritas too.
Cheap and delicious! And a really cool vibe.

I've been coming to this location for short of year now and albeit the lines can get pretty long at times (especially late night weekends/downtown events), the wait is WELL worth it once you take your first bite. 


The employees, bar or food, are quick and courteous. If you catch them at slower business times they are very friendly and welcoming. Even at high volume the service is quicker than you'd expect. 


I cannot speak for other locations, but on behalf of this one, you will not be disappointed. I will continue my patronage here as long as I am in this area, and after then I intend to visit when I feel the need for high quality food and great service. 


On a side note, if any of the staff sees this, I would like to thank you again for your service; you folks work hard and never fall short. Keep it up, all!

The food gets 4 stars ..customer service less than that.  I was waited on my an impatient man with a condescending tone.  Made me feel super rushed ordering and just overall seemed unhappy with his life/job..I don't appreciate being made to feel stupid while ordering something as simple as a damn taco. There are plenty of other better Illegal Pete's locations.  If you want good service go to the one on S. Broadway.  I won't be back to the 16th street mall one.

I have lost track how many times I've been here, from perfect fair-weather days to snowmageddon.  If you like Chipotle this place is like Chipotle, except the food is way better, the venue is way cooler, and there's a bar inside.  I don't have to convince you, pay Illegal Pete's a visit.
Just flew into Denver and boy are my arms tired.   Ate the shredded beef burrito / drank a cold beer on a 95 degree day as the speakers blew out Alive in Chains.   Highly recommend the food.
This place is the bomb.com fam. Come get lit with super dope prices on beer and margs and if you go too hard in the paint why not RIP with a sick burrito. Probably the illest queso in all the land

This location fits right in on the 16th Street Mall.  Cool atmosphere, friendly employees, consistently good food.  I just love Illegal Pete's!  Pro tip for those of us who can't (or shouldn't) finish an entire burrito, they will totally let you order a kid's burrito and it is just the right size.

I'll start out by saying that IP's isn't my favorite place for a giant lunch burrito, but the breakfast can't be beat.  For $4 and some change I can get a breakfast burrito (in lunchtime size) and it spans the length of two meals.  That's $2/meal.  What?  Especially for the downtown/Union Station area where a coffee and a pastry'll run you $8, or a yogurt parfait will set you back $6, it really can't be beat.

Breakfast is served till 10:30 but I'd recommend getting there a bit earlier so they aren't scraping the bottom of the barrel for eggs/potatoes.  Meat or veggies are extra but green chile (your choice of pork or veggie), cheese, sour cream, and salsa are all included.  If you need coffee, they have a carafe of Pablos.

Hits the spot and you won't need to leave your desk for hours (except to go to the bathroom, of course)

We went for lunch. The line to order was long, at least a good 15+ minutes of standing.  We ordered the chili verde, queso, guacamole, chips, a chicken quesadilla and a carnitas burrito, plus margaritas so a fair sampling of the menu was had.  The margarita and queso were the stars of the show, followed by the carnitas burrito which was loaded with carnitas and the pork was well rendered, not fatty at all.  The quesadilla was lackluster and lacking on chicken as was the chili verde which was flavorful but had very little pork.  Being from California, the guacamole was fine, neither great or bad.  I would come back again for here for drinks but probably wouldn't go out of my way if the line was that long again.

I love you guys because I can substitute guacamole instead of cheese and sour cream!! I love you guys because you are consistent as hell and your ingredients are super fresh and your house hot sauce is the bomb!!! Yeah occasionally there is a worker who is a jerk and tries to skimp me on my cilantro, but I overlook that because the majority of your employees kick ass. I have never come here and had slimy ingredients, undercooked stuff or over cooked stuff, or any bad food.

Every time someone says the name "illegal petes" I enthusiastically interrupt them to say "I f**king love that place". I only wish that the line at lunchtime was shorter. I try to go before noon or after 1pm. I accommodate because you're worth it! You're a gem.

Did you know that they have breakfast too?! For like $5. Seriously. Get in my mouth.

Inexpensive, healthy, gringo, Mexican food. The burritos are bigger than my forearm. I will say, I wish it had more meat! I have eaten at several Illegal outposts, as they are a local chain, and they fill the void. Not my first choice, and not something I turn my nose up at. The guacamole is pretty tasty. The queso is orange, and was kind of salty, but I still kind of enjoyed it.  I ordered a carnita burrito, which was tasty overall, and again they have the option of putting all kinds of extra veggies in it. You can get adult beverages too. 
Is this my favorite Mexcian food-no! Is it suitable for vegetarian and vegans- Yes. Is it affordable fast/casual downtown- yes. For this area in Denver -it is a good option if you have a hole in your tummy, and 10$ to spend.

This place is great... don't get me wrong. But, WHY is it that every morning I go into this shop to get breakfast the employees all look and act like they are in some sort of hung-over induced coma!?! They don't say hello, they mess up your order, they have 0 F*cks to give. 
That being said, the food is still great. :)

5 out of 5, hands down!  Illegal Pete's is probably the best quick Mexican food you will ever eat.  I would frequent the location in Boulder when I was a student at the University of Colorado and more recently this past month when I was visiting Denver with friends. 

The set up of the restaurant is much like that of a Chipotle.  When you enter the restaurant you order then proceed down the line letting the employee which toppings, meats etc you would like on your meal.  Its very quick and easy.

All of the food is fresh.  My favorite things to order off the menu are the breakfast burrito, literally the best one you will ever eat and the burrito bowl.  I like to switch up between chicken and steak so I won't get bored of one or the other.  They have endless options and so many great meals! 

If you are from Colorado or visiting and have never eaten at Illegal Pete's, make sure you do so ASAP!
Great food!  I like to go here every time I come into Denver.  I would highly recommend a Big Fish burrito.  Happy hour drink specials are also great!

Like chipotle but better.  Local vibe and some tasty ways to make your Mexican eats.  Went here around 1am on a Saturday and the line was very long, so that was really my only issue.  Solid drunchy food.

Got take out here for the first time. There was no honey for the Sopapillas, and I asked for 4 salsas ON THE SIDE. Instead it came doused with ALL the salsas on my entree. I will not be back.

Update: They refunded my money, so I'll definitely be back to try it again. This time I'll check my order before leaving :)

Illegal Pete's beats Chipotle. Boom!  Illegal Pete's offers character, booze, and burritos of better quality. It's always my #1 choice when looking for a fast-casual restaurant to stop in & grab a quick (& fulfilling) bite.

I'm a sucker for the chicken pesto burrito - I get it every time. There's something special about sitting out on 16th street on the patio with a beer & burrito in the evening, you should try it.
Fun mix of people. Good taste of what Denver has to offer. Great food and drinks - don't miss happy hour.

Had a REDIC burrito bowl for breakfast here yesterday.

The chorizo was delish, the eggs fluffy, the green chili perfect, and the chips were so friggin' tasty. 

I'm sad I can eat this every day...and $4 for a whole breakfast?!?! Whaaaaa????

My family and I ate here one evening during our vacation. The atmosphere was great. Very relaxed but fun. They were playing trivia games that night. The food was excellent at a good price. This is definitely a place to hang out with friends and have fun, but was also enjoyed by a family with three kids
Great food! Chicken burrito definitely trumps Chipotle. Service was quick, despite the long lunch line.
An edgy Chioptle with beer and liquor. Great cheap spot to go to before an Ave's game.
Big fan of this place.  They're generally pretty generous with there liquor pours and the burritos are p. great.  I take this place over chipotle every time.

I always thought that I liked chipotle but, after visiting this Illegal Pete's location for the first time I know that I was mistaken. Everything is extremely fresh and there are so many options! Literally the burrito choices put every other chain to shame. I choose the shredded beef burrito with pretty much every veggie topping and salsa. They also gave me guacamole complementary since I asked to forgo the dairy condiments. 

The staff was friendly and knowledgable they even mix up the contents of your burrito cold stone style. This gave me the perfect flavor and consistency with every bite. The best part of all is that the tortilla was fresh and not soggy. This made the burritos contents shine and kept things from entering a mushy state. 

I will definitely be back to this location the next time I'm in Denver! And I'm eager to try other locations in hopes that they provide a similar experience!

Ps the happy hour deals are great!

Good, casual spot on Broadway when you're craving fresh Cali-Mex. Vegetarian, Paleo, and GF options. All the veggies are super fresh and he meat is somewhat local and organic. Score!

I usually get the "basic" nachos with the red veggies as opposed to green. It's a HUGE portion. The corn chile salsa is extra delicious on top.

IP also has a full bar, and luckily for moi they serve a super strong marg. 

The only thing that bothers me is the service. It's a bunch of late 30 somethings that act like its their first job and its interrupting their personal conversations to serve you. Don't get me wrong, the people who put your food together are usually great and super attentive. It's the cashiers that can be a little lame.

This is one of my oldest haunts on the 16th St. Mall, back from my days working right downtown. 
I don't come here as near as much as I used to, but it is always a good experience. I love that they are open later than most places in Denver and they put on great shows. The only thing I ever watch out for when coming here is the crowd; there is limited table space and it's always a bummer to stand around trying to eat a massive burrito with one hand and drink a beer with the other while you are shoulder-to-shoulder with hipsters.

I really want people to stop saying this is "like" Chipotle. Or that they're copying Chipotle. They both opened in Coloradoin the mid 90s. Chiptole opened just 2 years ahead of the first Pete's in Boulder, but they're both based on Mission Style Burritos (Which are a California thing, so there you go). So of course they're going to share some similarities. Personally I prefer Pete's menu offerings, ambiance, character, and support of local and independent music through their Starving Artists program. Besides that:

1) Queso.
2) Full bar.
3) STILL locally owned and managed.
4) Treat their employees amazing.
5) Queso.
6) Did I mention the queso?

My favorite location is the South Broadway one, if only for the space and it's a little more comfortable, but I work downtown so having a spot to grab tacos for lunch is amazing. I walk by 2 Chiptoles to get here, so take that as you will.

The Denver Urban Chipotle!

This restaurant is the Denver's version of Chiptole, with a bar. The atmosphere coming in feels very urban and hip. There are TV's to watch sports events and the food is good. There is a lot of room to sit.

The setup is similar to chipotle. You enter and proceed down the line with meats, toppings etc. Very quick and efficiently. The food is fresh, and there is even queso!

07/2016 UPDATE: Came back in to one of my favorite Denver establishments with a business associate in town for a few days. Met him at Union Station, then we walked right over to Illegal Pete's for a beer and a burrito. Behind the counter a young woman named Brittany was really helpful to my friend who was unaccustomed to the options of the restaurant. Brittany was patient and funny the whole time dealing with my novice friend. She suggested a green chili burrito with half chicken, half pork. It was delicious, we couldn't have asked for a better choice! Over at the bar, Coren was friendly and outgoing, offering my friend all kinds of ideas on what to do and where to go in Denver, and suggesting some fine beer options as well. I've interacted with this young man on a few other occasions, and always goes above and beyond for customers; I'm never let down any time I go to this place- always a fun time with a great staff, I was so happy my friend had such a wonderful first impression of Denver! Thanks again!

This place was delicious and had a great vibe going on.  We were in the mood for some mexican around lunch time and stumbled into the best pick!  

You order at the counter and take your food as you pay (similar to Chipotle).  They had a variety of options from nachos to tacos and burritos to salad.  I settled on some nachos.  Smothered with queso, salsa of my choice, beans, guacamole, olives, and whatever other toppings you choose.  My dining partner went with a chicken burrito and was very impressed by the flavors.  

They also have a fair selection of bottled drinks/beers as well as a fountain machine.  The restaurant also has a bar, which appears to have a nice local/regional selection of beers on draft.  

We both wish we could frequent this spot again.  If you live in the area and haven't triedit do so NOW!
This place was great we come to Denver to catch a broncos game and we ended up down town. Come across this place and the food was good but the service was better I'll eat here again for sure.

I've been on the hunt for the best breakfast burrito in Denver, and while decent, this is not it.  They do everything assembly style and I do think the quality suffers from that.  Eggs obviously taste better when cooked to order rather than being scooped from a bulk bin.  They also seemed to go really light on all of the fixings.  I felt the burrito should have been much larger than it ended up.  I did appreciate that they had vegetarian green chile though, as that's pretty hard to come by.  I would come back and try some of their lunch/dinner offerings, but my search for a good breakfast burrito is still on.

I'm from California but currently live in New York where there is no good mexican food.

This place looked pretty legit and had some good reviews, so we checked it out, but overall were pretty disappointed.

Fish Tacos - fish was good, but that was really it.  The sauce was too creamy, tortillas weren't fresh, limes were dried out - so you didn't even get any lime juice when you squeezed the lime.

Quesadillas -  this was literally the worst quesadilla i've ever had.  there wasnt enough cheese, the meat was tough [beef] and flavorless, and the tortilla wasn't even crisp.

Hard Tacos - taco shells tasted like they were from Safeway.  got the shredded pork, which was better than the beef - but still not very good.  

There was a Salsa Bar - but you had to ask the person behind the counter to get it for you.  The Salsa and Guac was the only thing that made the food eatable, but it still wasn't very good.  

I would not recommend this place, and i would not come here again.

I am not a fan of Chipotle or Qdoba - but I think i would go there before eating here again.

Also, for Mexican food, these prices were pretty high.

The primary differentiator between Pete's and the big brands like Chipotle is the care they put into making their food. They take the time to mix their ingredients together to make the taste experience more consistent. 

The location itself is pretty much what you'd expect from fast, quick Mexican. Tons of local support and stickers decorate the walls. Loud music blares over the speakers.

My one complaint is that when we arrived, the line was out the door, but after tasting the food, the wait was well worth it.

I was looking for a wonderful spot that serves purely Mexican dishes. Through the help of yelp I found this place. I have tried the Carnita Burrito bowl and it was really good. Chips with flavorful sauce were totally legit. Great local beer on draft, must try the Pabst!

I am changing my review because I have tried illegal petes a few more times and It was great.   
Best queso in Boulder

With a plethora of options to choose from, this Chipotle-esque has a one up on the variety and the hours--you can get your burrito bowl in the wee hours of the night. 

The food has a LOT of flavor. Carnitas and shredded beef are "thebomb.com" while their oatmeal cookies are lemmegorgemyselfwithglutenplease.net

The staff is efficient, kind, and gave me free goodies for being polite (score!).

Yep, it's good, so much better than Chipotle! Fish burrito sounds weird to me, but it was great!! We loved it, but just a heads up, loud rock music and very "hole in the wall". Will definitely go back when we visit Denver again.

As I have been searching this city for actual Blanca Queso....they are pretty close....
Steak Taquitos were dry but my boyfriend really enjoyed his burrito..
Happy hour specials were good, but just don't ask too many questions to the black girl with dreads and piercings in her face (yeah pretty sure that's also a health code violation) because she was very rude (dare i say kind of a bitch) when asking if she was going to take my bf's order on my ticket or a separate one....if she would have ACTUALLY listened to the question instead of just rushing us through the line, this review would have been a bit different. 

On a happier note; the guy with the big gauges turned the customer service experience around! Kudos dude!

ill try another location most likely....but to each its own...this was my experience.

This place did not disappoint, went on a lunch recommendation from a friend while visiting Denver. I went with the Green Chile Burrito and a 16oz PBR and can't complain about the price. The line was huge, but these pros relentlessly kicked out food to knock it down.

Best part: when the burrito fillings are all selected they take time to mix it all into a consistently tasty burrito before the final wrap. This is not a practice I'm lucky enough to experience back home.

Overall a fun atmosphere and great food.

Highly recommended by a friend, said it's 10 times better then Chipotle. 

Here's my feedback

Food: Great food for the price! I go a steak bowl and izze all under $10. Portions solid, ingredients very fresh!

Atmosphere: It pretty much a punk rock version of any Mexican fast casual restaurant. Decently busy at 3pm on a Friday. Crowd is majority the "punk, rock, emo" type. Lots of hard rock music, everyone's wearing black. I feel a bit like an outcast were beigh pants and a blue shirt collared shirt. 

Cleaniless: could use some serious work. Stuff on the floor everywhere, sauce spilled all over. Gives you that slightly grimy "I might find a roach" feeling.

Staff: fits their theme, they don't smile. They are all "low key, chill" type. 

Overall decent a solid 4 stars!

Breakfast burrito? Just wanted a breakfast burrito. What I got instead was a chipotle themed attempt at a breakfast burrito. Chili wasn't hot or even remotley close to being a chili. More like tomatoes with some green sauce. Would you like any toppings? No it's a breakfast burrito. Potatoes, egg, chili and cheese. Everything with the way it was made was modeled after chipotle. It was even portioned as chipotle would. Little damn scoops in a big pinche tortilla. Breakfast burrito is basic, simple out the door. 

Pros: I ate this morning. 
Cons: need some chili, something hot, need to pack the damn thing with the food. 

Of course this is downtown and it would be hard to find a place with good chili. (Breakfast burrito)

I don't know if it may be an overall "illegal Pete" thing but every time I get a breakfast burrito, it's always been made poorly. For instance, I got a bacon burrito and I guess I ordered right when they were making fresh scrambled eggs.. Anyways the lady asked me if it was "ok" if they mixed the old eggs with the new eggs.. Why on earth would I want old scrap eggs, when you're making new eggs? They ended up giving me only old scrap eggs and were barely present throughout my entire burrito. Then the best part -- it was significantly, SIGNIFICANTLY smaller and they ended up just loading the toppings in my burrito.. WHY would anyone eat a burrito of toppings?! My burrito had folds and folds of tortilla that literally made it a condiment burrito.. 

A message to Illegal Pete's: Get your shit together -- whether it be making consistent portions per burrito or just use a freaking smaller tortilla....

These guys deserve my applause for exercising the art of 'mixing' the burrito fillings before wrapping it to help infuse the desired taste. They also obliged to swap cheese and sour cream for guacamole at no extra cost. Except the overcooked meat spoils the show and relegates them to just another joint (la Chipotle) to me. Better luck next time?

I love this location.  Downtown with a bar and decent food.  I had the fish tacos and they were every bit as good as the over priced ones at a sit down place.  My Wife enjoyed her burrito bowl and the queso was yummy.
Great selection, combos are great, nice full bar. If you have the time stop in for lunch. However, its very busy so don't go if you are in a rush.

The burritos here are delicious, especially if you add green chili inside.
The bar is why I come though...
Great happy hour deals 3-8
One of the best bartenders in Denver, Devon is amazing.
She is great at math, nice as the summer sun, listens to all the dumb words leaving your mouth hole, and lastly gives great medical advice.
Get here, get full, get drunk (or buzzed at least)

Chipotle smoked a joint, took a shot of whiskey, and started making queso.

Pretty cool vibe for a burrito spot. They have a full bar and a much larger menu than the other burrito chains.

In honor of Cinco de Mayo, I'm eating here during daylight hours. Illegal Petes has long provided me the drunken fulfillment of a poo-inducing burrito during the wee hours of the inebriated morning. Turns out during the day they're pretty not bad either. The Big Fish is pretty good. It's like a giant fish taco. The restaurant itself is Chipotle meets Baja Fish Tacos, but it's not a chain, which is a plus for me. 

Only downfall is the bartender's beard. SO sick of beards that fit nowhere in someone's occupation. Chopping any wood back there, Chief? No, you're not. In fact you're just spreading the poo that has already collected in your birds nest you call a chin into a plethora of cocktails joyously consumed by countless hipsters. Hipster killer! Keep up the good work, Sir!
From my experience in Denver, this is the king of late night food. Delicious quesadillas and nachos. My future late nights in Denver will end here.

The chips and queso are fabulous, probably my favorite queso in Denver.  The burritos are much better here than Chipotle or Qdoba.  I like that I can add olives and cilantro to my burritos here.  The bar is a good place to grab a drink as well.

Decent tequila selection, quick pace of food delivery even in lines nearly out the door, and indeed this is a funky place!  I liken it to burrito bars in San Francisco but not quite as high quality or diversity.  It is a must try if looking for casual and fun when eating lunch.  I'm not sold on evening value but if a quick bite is what you seek this will more than deliver, especially compared to most lunch spots in Downtown Denver.

Oh no! Say it ain't so!!!

I've been a die-hard fan of illegal pete's ever since I first tried it a few  years ago. The quality of their burritos and additional fixings make it some of the of the best TeX Mex in Colorado and their portions made it an awesome value. 

That being said, my burrito's have gotten progressively smaller over the last year while the price has stayed the same. I don't mind changes but over $10 for a burrito that doesn't even make me full when 1 burrito used to be a days worth of food is insulting. If it's your line cooks, tell em what's up. Until then I'll be getting full and satisfied for cheaper at Chipotle and tipping their staff generously. 

My recommendation would be to not make the same mistake as D.P. Dough. No one I know eats there anymore because of the same kind of stuff.

I'll try back in a few months.
I've long been aware of this place but never actually tried until recently. Excellent burritos, much better than Chipotle.
I've only been here once before.  Pretty tasty.  The steak was very good, and I liked the mixed veggies.  I may have to return.

Love this place! I love that there are a ton of options to please every palate. They also let you sub out guac for cheese/sour cream which makes me oh so happy! They have the typical white/brown rice, whole wheat/flour tortilla, etc. I haven't tried anything other than the burritos, but I've heard good things about the other items on the menu.

One of my favorite things is that they have lots of options for vegetarians/vegans and they have an awesome happy hour. I think it's 3-8pm daily and all day Sunday. 

It can be a little on the small side, I went on a Thursday around 615pm or so and we were lucky to get a table but that's my only complaint. That and parking. But this is downtown, parking stinks, you already know that.
Mediocre food, chipotle is sadly better. We had the chicken burrito and the meat was cold and kind of burnt.

Solid Mexican food, full bar, an easy going atmosphere and great bar service!

We were a big group and went in intending to have a quick meal before heading to the bar. We ended up having so much fun that we decided to stick around until closing instead of moving on. Devon and Camden crushed it behind the bar! I'd go back again just on account of them... They took great care of us.
The queso! That is all I need to say :)

2 stars for food. 0 stars for service. Guy that started my burrito was full of passive aggressive comments. He makes half of a burrito for a living and fails at it. I can get a mediocre burrito anywhere. Never again.

8 years ago I wandered into an Illegal Pete's and was really excited to return. But like many local locations that expand into a chain, I think the quality has been effected.

Honestly, it was overwhelming and underwhelming at the same time. It does have a much more fun atmosphere than Chipotle but I'm more considered with the food I'm about to eat. After getting through the line, I was asked about the food I wanted... Going through the line didn't really flow. I wouldn't have layered my food that way. I got a burrito but the guy putting together kind of slapped it together.

I wasn't impressed by their green salsa either. Maybe it's because I am from Texas and know tex-mex.
 
I hope it was a one off experience but I think I need to find another place in Denver to be excited about.

Interesting spot, unique both in terms of it being a dive, and the way they run the assembly line like kitchen. The food here is good quality and extremely inexpensive. The bar in the place is interesting too, lots of people drinking during the week for lunch. I got the tacos here which were pretty good overall. Fresh, fast, and cheap this is a keeper.
Went here for a night cap and there was an amazing acoustic guitar player. The bartenders were friendly and chatted with us. Great beer list too.
Taste super delicious but the workers always have an attitude. Maybe just try not to go too late and they'll be more pleasant.
Great location, very good quality food, fun environment, and great prices.  This was an easy 5 stars to give.  Keep it Illegal Pete!

The very best falafel ever.  It is light and delicious.   My husband doesn't even like falafel,  but tried the one the owners gave him to taste, and he loved it.

The owners are such a nice couple who really care about their food.  Everything is freshly cooked when it is ordered.  They always checked that you are happy with your meal.  

If you want to order take out call ahead, or you may have to wait a while if they are busy.

Try it, you'll like it!

Friendly service (albeit hard to wade through the thick accents). The food was ... OK. I guess I'm spoiled on stronger flavors. The gyro meat was very good. The humus, rice, and chicken where pretty bland. The pita bread literally came to our table in a plastic bag... grocery store bread.

I'll stick with Garbanzo to hold me over until I can get back to Heart of Jerusalem in Manitou.

Gyros King is one of those hole-in-the-wall kind of places you'd find in Aurora, especially on Hampden. I have to say, I have not been to a strip mall in a while since living in the Bay Area, but they are pretty common in places on Hampden. 

Upon coming to Gyros King, our group of 7 people found ourselves wanting to eat some Mediterranean food. I have to say, the food was A-OK for me. 

FOOD: Falafel sandwich. I must say the falafel itself was pretty fresh. The owner did say he had to make a new batch for us since we ordered so much and there was not that much left! The falafel is not the same recipe I am used to eating here in California or what I have had in the Middle East, but it was a pretty damn tasty variety and had the right amount of crispiness to it and the right amount of chickpea taste to it. Besides that though, the rest of the sandwich was a bit bland. I wish the pita was warmed or toasted, but it came out pretty cold, which was a poor contrast against the warm falafel. The tzatziki sauce was a bit bland, which made me wonder if it was homemade or store bought. It was nothing to really rave about and the vegetables it were not proportional to the amount of falafel (too much vegetable to falafel). The sandwich as a whole was so-so, which has led me to my A-OK review. 

SERVICE: Over the top friendly! The couple who runs the place definitely takes pride in their restaurant and wants to make sure everybody has a happy experience. I must say, after living the big city lifestyle for so long, I am not used to this kind of service and can find it a bit overbearing. It is a nice refreshing change of pace though from the less friendly environment. 

Overall, come here to support the local economy and a local mom-and-pop shop instead of those chain Mediterranean restaurants in Colorado!

Authentic and awesome Greek food right next to Dry Dock Brewery. My wife and I both got the gyro plate that come with fries. Everything was GREAT! Some of the better gyros I have tried in the area. The best part is how close it is to the brewery which means you can grab one or two and take it over and have a beer or five. Don't get it confused though, they were there long before the brewery came along. At least that's what the sweet older lady who owns the place told me. Any ways, a great place whether you are eating in, going to the brewery, or grabbing one to go.

In the same strip as Dry Dock I found the Gyros King. I was a little hungry and am always looking for a good gyro restaurant so I came in. It's a very unassuming restaurant and I immediately noticed it was run (and probably owned) by a cute Greek couple that were probably in their early 70s. I ordered a gyro and baklava. It took about 10 minutes to make, which isn't bad seeing as I could watch him grill the meat and knew it was fresh. The gyro was great, and the baklava was pretty decent. They put something that almost tasted like doughnut glaze on the baklava though which was a little awkward as I'm used to it with honey. Overall though it was a pretty good experience and meal.

Small strip mall location hidden on Hampton. Owner was very friendly and chatted with me as I ate lunch. Probably one of the more authentic Gyro places around. Wish they would grill the Pita though as just taking them out of the package and barely heating them results in a chewy Pita.

Served with classic crinkle cut fries and a can of soda. This place is one of a dying breed that is not chain-owned. If you want something different, stop on in.

Recommended. This place is a small mom-and-pop restaurant. It is not five-star full-service sit down greek dining and you have to adjust your expectations appropriately. For what it is, it is a solid 4*s. Clean, if small, dining room, and small kitchen along with a friendly husband and wife team operating the restaurant.

From the reviews I thought it was going to be stellar but apparently I'm missing something? We stopped by here before grabbing a few beers at Dry Dock. This is definitely a place to grab and go with your food because the ambiance is lacking. We ordered, paid and waited for a few minutes then our food was ready. 

I don't know why but crinkle cut fries just seem to work with a gyro. The tsaziki sauce was a little too runny and bland for my taste but the gyro was packed with meat and the combo came at a reasonable price so I wasn't too concerned about hitting my wallet too hard. The pita bread was cold which was a huge letdown as well, really, what am I missing with this place?? Maybe I did it backwards and need to visit here AFTER a few beers?

If you're getting it to go, request extra ketchup packets as they are quite stingy.
Pretty tasty gyro salad, and the owners were quite nice. Only tip I would give is to toast the pita bread, otherwise I enjoyed my meal!

Hands down the best falafel I've ever had. A really sweet couple owns the place and you could tell they really care about how much you enjoyed your meal. Also had the gyros, also great. The service was quick and the food was well priced. Definitely go if you are in the area.

Surprised this place got such high reviews! 
We came here after getting recommended it for dinner while enjoying brews at Dry Dock. 

The owners are a kind elderly couple, who run the back and the front. 

The good?
1. Prices: 5.99 for a falafel, 6.99 for a gyro (the shaved meat).
2. Near the brewery
3. Nice people

The bad?
1. Food quality. My pita was cold and hard...they didn't even bother warming up the store bought pita.  Too much sauce, not enough toppings. The gyro was warmer and better flavor. 

Wouldn't return. Recommend bringing in food else where.

This little spot is hidden and I wish I had known about it before. We ordered a gyro which comes with fries and a soda. We also ordered the sampler plate which comes with hummus, baba ganoush, falafel, chicken, lamb, salad, rice, and pita bread. The falafel was the best I've had. So good and soft inside. The baba ganoush was also amazing. There wasn't one thing on the plate that we didn't devour. 

The little restaurant is run by an older couple. For one person being in the kitchen cooking, the food came out super quick. The couple was so sweet. They came out to talk to us and the kids. They also went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect. If you haven't been to this place, you HAVE to try it. I also love that it's a family run business and there aren't enough of these places around anymore. I will definitely be going back often.

This was my first time ordering from the Gyros King and I must say, I wasn't disappointed. It is a small family owned restaurant and you can tell they prepare their food with love and passion. I ordered the combination plate with chicken and gyro meat (lamb). I would have thought the combination plate would be bigger than it was with a salad on the side, I guess that is neither here not there, just my personal preference. There was plenty of hummus on the plate, the falafel was DELICIOUS, probably the best I have ever had. The only thing that I was somewhat disappointed in, the combination plate didn't come with tzatziki sauce. I thought this was a Mediterranean staple! So, next time I go (yes, I will be back) I will be sure to ask for a side of tzatziki on the side. 

Overall, good experience, good food, and I would definitely be back if the opportunity presented itself.

I don't get it. Why so many stars? 

I am a big fan of Mediterranean food. I love me some gyros and hummus, but I prefer fresh and homemade. Apart from the gyro meat that was warm and freshly sliced and the veggies, everything else we got came out of a grocery store bottle or bag. Our pita that came with the hummus was still in the darn bag from the manufacturer. And it wasn't even one of the really good brands. 

It wasn't bad, but it was in no way what I would have expected from a place with a nearly 5 star rating. Perhaps the abundance of options in my current hometown of Columbus, Ohio has me spoiled?
This place is excellent! I recently came in for lunch and the food was great. The service was great! No complaints, I would highly recommend this place !!!
