I was driving down Hampden and saw this place, had good reviews so I checked it out. No bad, I had the regular gyro it was pretty good,  it was made fresh so it took a while. It was average price, no fountain machine, so cans of soda are a bit pricey. Will definitely come back.

I have been here a couple times.  Always get the gyro with fries and a drink for a solid $8.50.  The meat is always fresh and the couple who runs this place is great.  However, the tzatziki sauce leaves much to be desired.  I always get it on the side cause it can make your gyro's quality go south if you have them put it on by default.  I would recommend this place after a fun happy hour at Dry Dock since its in the same strip.  Still an OK place to eat.  Super nice owners with OK food.  If you want something different from the norm, check it out!

We have been coming here for the past two years and have yet to be disappointed. I always get the gyros meal, and falafel. But have tried about everything on their menu. This is a mom and pop place and I always love coming here. 

The owners are super nice and the food is fantastic! This place is Aurora's little jewel!

Good, fast, friendly mom 'n' pop storefront restaurant. Shareable combination plate. No tabbouleh (didn't sell, apparently). All else good to excellent: falafels, gyros (which I loved), chicken (which my wife loved), hummus, baba ganoush, baklava. Pictures of Lebanon everywhere. Both American and "Arabic" coffee, sodas, etc. Attentive and slightly chatty hosts. If you're around the corner at Dry Dock quaffing a few, come down here (30 yards west) when you get hungry.

I don't quite understand why this place gets high reviews.  I decided to try this place based on the positive reviews but was highly disappointed.  The lady at the front counter was very nice and the customer service seems good, but the quality of the food was bad unfortunately.  Maybe I picked the wrong item to try.  I ordered a Chicken Shawama plate.  Hummus was very runny and almost looked like it was diluted with water.  I have never tasted such bad hummus.  Chicken was made fresh and the taste was okay.  The portion was rather small for the amount I paid.  I would rather want to stick to joints like Saj Grill or Garbanzo.  They have better quality food.  I wanted to like this place since the lady was nice and the place looked like mom & pop type.  Maybe better luck with sandwich instead of plate.  Not sure if I will go back though.

This is a small mom and pop place and they have the best gyros around. I've been to a few other places in the area and the amount of meat in the gyros are pathetic. Awesome hole in the wall, proud to support a local business.

Friday March 21st 2014.  Time was about 18:30hrs ish. 

YES, this is DEFINITELY a Mom and Pop establishment.  YES, you ordered at the counter.  You are welcome to seat yourself where ever you want to.  From their simple menu, we decide to order these following items :

2 order of Gyros Meals that comes with Fries and Drink ($7.50) each hence it was $15.  Hubs also decide to order the Arabic Coffee which was $2.50.  Our Dinner was about $20 with tax.  We waited for abit for our food to be ready, coz before we were there, there are like 2 other patrons waiting to have their Order To Go.

The Meals which include Fries and Drinks starts from $6.50 if you were to order the Falafel.  Then the rest will be $7.50, choices of Gyros, Chicken OR Chicken Shawarma.  Salads are between $7.25 and $8.50.  Big Plates are from $9.75 and $12.99.

The Dining area can seat about 15 to 20 people at one time.

We decide to dine in.  4 stars for the service from the staffs.  They will send your food to where you are seating.

3.5 Stars for overall experience.

3 Stars At Best For Food.  The portion with price is reasonable, and doable.  I think when we received our food, due to the cold salad that they put in the Pita Bread, with the Gyro Meat, makes the rest of the Gyro, COLD.  *Sad Face*

It DOES NOT WOW us as much as I was hoping for.  Maybe next time, if we were to return, I would order the Gyro with Plate instead.  Perhaps from there, my review could differ.

Note to SELF : Oooh NOT forgetting, I think I should brush up my Arabic Speaking skills, though the staffs definitely can communicate in English finely.

Gyros King
15102 East Hampden Avenue,
Ste B
Aurora, CO 80014
Tel : (303)-627-6070

@57/2014

First off, the couple that runs this place are SO kind. They were very sweet, and you can tell they really care about the food and their customers. That being said, I eat Mediterranean food all over the US (I travel for work), and the food here is just not very good, in my opinion! The chicken SERIOUSLY lacked flavor. That baba ghannouj was decent, but the pita was as hard as a rock (I am 90% sure it was microwaved), and the "salad" was just ice berg lettuce and tomato. The falafels were not bad, but didn't do much for me. I am not sure how this place has such an awesome rating - I mean, the owners are nice and the price is decent, but the food was not deserving of the rating, in my opinion.
Fabulous! Priced well, very cosy, and delicious. Definitely get the falafel. Will be back!
We love it here go in and have a gyro plate the kids love it! Very nice little mom n' pop restaurant!

The meal sign from 1980 lists 4 types of meals: gyros, chicken, shawarma and falafel, all under $8. You can only choose the sandwich or make it a salad. The old couple  behind the counter look like they have been married for many decades, or so I felt by listening to the way they speak Greek to each other. They cook your food after you order and it is tasty & satisfying as if you were broke in Greece and a gyro was your only choice for a meal. Support these guys, food was delicious!

This place, boys and girls, makes a good gyro!  I'm very happy about spending my money at this mom & pop place.  Good job!

So maybe I haven't scoured Denver on a quest for the ultimate gyro, but I wouldn't exactly call Denver gyro mecca, so I won't waste my time doing that. Chicago, however, has a large Greek population and it's a good place to go to get an idea of what an authentic gryo *should* taste like. Based on past Denver gyro experience, I definitely wasn't expecting much.  But, when I walked in and saw an older Greek couple manning the kitchen and counter, I thought hmmm, this could be good!  Plus, one of the tables had a Greek family waiting for their food. Another good sign! 

I ordered the gyro meal which came with a gyro sandwich, fries, and a drink for $7.50. The fries were very good - perfectly fried and great flavor. The gyro was huge!  No shortage of meat, sauce, and assorted toppings (see the picture I posted). And the gryo bread was great too. A lot of places have a regular bready pita, but Gyros King uses the real stuff, or at least it's what I call the "real" stuff.  It's hard to explain, but real gyro bread has kind of a rubbery texture and doesn't fall apart on you when you stretch it around all of that yummy goodness inside.

I sit here very full & satisfied after having lunch from Gyros King.  Thank you very much!
Great food and service;) small but cozy environment.
Love this place, great service, food and prices are very reasonable.  They make great gyros.
Worth the trip over from Dry Dock. You can take it to go and eat at Dry Dock too.

Had a great experience here last weekend. The couple that are running the place were very friendly and made sure everything was satisfactory. They cook everything to order so its not fast food, but I think that makes it better! The food was great and they also have things for kids (although my little boy likes gyros). Will definitely go back.
The food was amazing and the service was awesome. They were so kind and willing to serve! I will definitely be going back!

This place is amazing for fresh, hot fast food! It's cooked to order so they take about 10mins per order but well worth it! The place is ran by a older couple that was very polite and certainly can cook! I'll definitely be returning each time I'm in the area.
This place was delicious! The owners were so great! Fresh food made while we waited and can't wait to come back and try the baklava.

Food was good,owners nice. My family had the gyro meals and enjoyed them. I had the gyro plate because I wanted the salad, rice & hummus. Everything tastes yummy and was filling. I'd definitely come again.

Ordered gyros, ridiculous salty. Ingredients are store-bought - they served the bread in the product bag. Two stars because the food came quickly. No redeeming qualities. Will definitely not visit again.

I went to this place for the first time and no complaints. I got the gyro and fries. The gyro was great, tender and juicy meat and a very good combination of flavors. If you are looking for some flashy or trendy place, the atmosphere won't be to your liking. Then again, I am biased because I hate trendy and flashy places because they seem to draw fake and shallow people. Nice couple who own the place and they provide good service. I will be back for certain.

Next time when you visit Dry Dock Brewing, do yourself a favor and order a Gyro and fries from this place. Gyro with fries, and drink only cost $7.50 and it's made to order by these two nice owner couple. 

It might take a few minutes because it's small mom and pop shop. If you want to try something out of the box, the Baba ghanoush is made from fresh eggplants and the Hummus or Hommoss is also top notch. If you like Garbanzo, give Gyros King a try.
Best gyros we found since leaving Europe. Quaint mom and pop place, authentic food, no frills and affordable. Portions are generous and made to order. So good we came back the very next day fir more!
This is why you do not want to eat at a chain. Excellent food, nice and quiet. Good family run place to eat. Our first time here but definitely not our last!

The definition of a mom and pop shop. The two owners are a married Lebanese couple who couldn't be nicer. They treat every customer who walks in like family, and the small, one-grill restaurant has the atmosphere of a nice home cooked operation. 

The gyro sandwich meal deal is a pretty good value, and the owner cooks it up for you right on the spot. The gyro meat is served warm but the rest of the sandwich, pita included, is a cool mix of tzatziki sauce, onions, lettuce, and tomato. Overall it's more of cool, light, refreshing gyro sandwich than a lot of the grilled up piping hot (and often greasy) versions you can find elsewhere. The gyro king interpretation is a version I really enjoyed. 

I am anxious to come back and try some of the platters.
Awesome place, one of my favorites for a good solid gyro and fries.  If your looking for good folks and great gyros this is a solid place to come eat when your out in aurora.

It's open! So happy. Whenever I'm in Denver, I have to get my fix! A Mediterranean gem. 
Best gyro, falafel, hummus and chicken!
I personally like the plates ( combination to sample it all)

Service with a smile. Broken English but the food speaks for itself. Small menu (very vintage sign). The chef/ owner and his wife work together and have served the community off and on again for decades. 

Love the hot tea and coffee. If you saved room have some baklava.

The couple that used to own this sweet little restaurant have returned from "the old country" and reclaimed the space from the less than stellar BBQ joint.

Homemade baklava, meat cooked to order, amazing flavor in the gyros, delicious hummus. I cannot say enough good things about this place! 

The chicken was a little dry but the lamb was superb. This is the best gyros place I've found in the area. 

Please go try it and welcome this wonderful couple back to the area!!
Love this place. Good food, quick service, very nice owners.  So happy they came back

I can honestly say I've never been here, but my sister has picked it up in the past week. I give it a 5 star rating since I think it's a star above gyroz and sai which I also like. The fries here are ok but not crave able. I also like that their pitas don't get soggy as fast as other places that serve gyros.

This place is great. First of all, it's nice to be remembered and greeted by the owners each time you walk in. I always order the gyros sandwich. It's made fresh and quickly served. The sandwich is fully loaded with flavorful, moist meat. Gyros King never disappoints.
This little gem is amazing! Great food and the nicest owners ever. A for sure repeat.
Love the gyros and fries.  Great small business.  Get it to go and wash it down with a beer from Dry Dock Brewery next door.

Oh yeah this place is great !!!!! mom and pop restaurants are my favorite... they care about what they make, the love is in the ingredients, preparation & care... and these guys knock it out of the ballpark.
The place is clean and just what you would expect from a family owned restaurant.
Most definitely New regular.....

First visit today. Had the Gyros w/ fries and a drink. Gyros was wonderful! Very flavorful. The owner was very nice. He makes everything himself. Took some Baklava to go & it was perfect! We will be back :-)

Great family owned spot- call it in to go and take it over to eat with your beers at dry dock. Generous portions, gyros are great as well as the crispy fried falafels. I would love if they could switch over from using iceberg lettuce to better greens.
Absolutely delicious, legit Greek food. The Greek couple who own the restaurant are adorable a super sweet. We will be coming back. Often. :)
Delicious food! Very friendly, the baklava are made right there - fresh and delicious! Best customer service we've experienced in a while.

Definitly, a cute mom and pop shop! My girlfriend and I came here to try a new place for gyros. Their service was good, and personable. Plus the food was great. Just the right amount of lamb meat and the falafels were great!

I love how the owner gave me a free falafel to try becauce I wanted to order it but it was too much food for me to get a second entre. He told me he wanted me to try it so I can come back again! Such a sweet couple

I love these local restaurants!

Maybe I came here on a bad day, but I got sick off of this place. They are supposed to shave the meat right off but instead the person at the counter grabbed some off of a plate from the oven? I also had hummus, and it was spoiled! Maybe with all of there good reviews I will give it another chance.

Never had gyros before I tried this place. Can't believe what I've been missing all these years. Everything's cooked to order be prepared to wait for maybe 5-8 mins. But for authentic fresh greek food it's more than worth it. Very reasonable priced as well

Great food, great prices, friendly owners.

I have travelled the world and have had gyros/Doners in many different countries; this is as close to the real thing as you are gonna get without buying a plane ticket.

The hummus was not as good as I make at home but the owner takes great pride in it and it is not bad.

I recommend this restaurant.
Best gyro sandwiches! I have to come here again soon!! So clean, so fast, so friendly and so tasty!!

I wanted to love this place so badly from what my friends had said about the gyros, however I was let down.  It's not that they're bad, it's just that they're kind of bland and unimpressive.

It's a mom and pop organization, and the speed of service will confirm that.  For two gyros to go we waited 12 minutes and it was not busy.  We ate in the car on our way to a Rockies game, and that experiment didn't work very well.  The tzatziki sauce is runny and not very creamy, more of a vinegar based caesar as my friend put it.  Not expensive, but kind of overpriced for what I got.  Maybe I'll try them again sometime.

Stopped in to get some food after helping a friend paint his house. I was hungry and went with the gyros plate for 10.99. A good amount of food with a tasty salad, solid hummus and rice. The gyros were decent, not the best or worst I have ever had. The meals with sandwich fries and drink for 7.50 seem to be the most popular item. Good but not amazing food for a reasonable price, I'll be back.
Awesome spot! The food is AMAZING and the couple makes you feel at home. We sat and talked to them for about 15 minutes after our meal, great people. Two thumbs up!

Love this place! The gyros are delicious and the folks running it are wonderful. I would definitely recommend gyros king to anyone. The falafel is crisp and fresh, the gyros meat is savory and yummy. Everything is served quickly and in a friendly environment.
Super cute mom and pop shop!! It's tucked away and a nice Aurora secret. The food is awesome and authentic. The prices are super reasonable too! Love this place!

Today was my first day trying gyro king's food. My boyfriend and I are pretty picky. But I absolutely loved it. The couple who owns the place are so sweet and kind.  The price is also a steal. We are  bringing our good friends next time.  5 star for them , and the food.
Family owned by a wonderful couple. Authentic Greek gyros! Great stuff, only issue I have is they got rid of the tabouli ;-) Small informal restaurant

Fairly new to denver and was craving gyros this place had some good reviews so we gave it a shot! 
Cute mom and pop place. Very good food fair prices, freshly made! Gyro needed a tiny but more sauce but we just asked for some more ok big deal! Over all very good gyro satisfied my craving and I will definitely be returning!

So happy they returned!

Very broken english, but very nice people (husband and wife). 
The food is awesome, so much better then all the chain restaurants.
Did not like the chicken plate. Chicken was under-cooked and under-seasoned. Pita bread was from a store.

Yesterday my family went to Gyro King and it was delis! Not only that the owners were the kindest people I have ever met. My husband and I orders the gyro sandwich combo and it was surprisingly larger than I expected! We were both stuffed! We will return!

Being a native New Yorker I hope I know a thing or two about Gyros.  I can honestly say the gyros were as good as I get in New York  Do I need to say anything more?  The Mom & Pop who run the restaurant are so kind.  They asked me how the food was to which I answered as good as in New York City.  You should have seen their smiles.

Great people and great food.  Never was into gyros until someone dragged me in there and now I can't get enough.  I recommend the regular gyro, but the shawarma is also amazing.  Either way make sure you get their bak lava as well.

Was on the mood for a gyro and found this place close by. The food was decent. The gyro meat was juicy and had a pretty good flavor. The French fries are from the freezer. Saw the Ore-Ida red bag. The Dr Pepper is in a can. The price seemed ok at $6.99 for a gyro fries and a can of soda. The tzatiki sauce wasn't too creamy at all. Like another reviewer stated. Watered down Caesar salad dressing. May give it another shot later on

Great mom and pop shop. They had left for a while but we are very glad they are back! My in laws are Greek so my expectations are high and this places usually hits the spot when I'm looking for a gyro. It's just a little hole in the wall next to a great brewery. The owners are always friendly.

One of the best gyros I have ever had, recommend sticking with the regular one over the chicken gyro though since the chicken one is a little bland.  No soda fountain, just cans available.  Very friendly service from the 2 owners and a clean interior.   Will definitely become my regular place for gyros now.

First time I've been to this place and I loved it. The owners are generous and the food is great.

I ordered a chicken gyro meal which comes with fries and a drink and I also got a side of falafel to see how it was. With the exception of the bread, everything seems to be home made, which makes it that much better. I'll definitely be back for another dish in the future.
I love a good Gyro. This is the place where you can find one. It's great food at an amazing price.

I really like this place. The owners pretty much know me when I walk in. Maybe twice a month. They actually closed the place down for awhile because they went back home which made me a little sad so I was overjoyed when they opened back up. I will spend many a lunch hour here. Thanks
Yes, Yes, Yes!!! So happy to see this place is back. I was lost w/o it. I was so excited to see they came back. Same nice people and same bomb food. Welcome back :)
Amazing & family owned. The food is to die for and reasonably priced a meal runs you 7.99 and fresh even the fries made to order. If you haven't tried this place you're missing out.

Stopped in the other day for lunch and encountered the unpleasant old man as described by other users. Seeing the difficulties I was having with him a younger gentleman quickly came to assist me.  

The food (Gyros) was served rather quickly and presented fairly well. The gyros were just so-so and so were the sides. The decor was pretty mundane, kind of like the attitude of everyone else in the establishment.

Where I can't say I won't be back I can say I probably won't go out of my way to return. Business owners should treat their patrons with respect and show a little enthusiasm that they are spending their hard earned money with them. This guy obviously doesn't see things that way.
Great food and wonderfully friendly service at this little Mom and Pop restaurant!  Grab some carry out and head over to Dry Dock for a great craft beer compliment to you gyros!

What a nice surprise.  The stereotypical hole in the wall that ends up being excellent.  The cute couple provided great service and the food was so flavorful.  There was plenty of meat in our gyros and the price was great.  My husband liked it so much he was tempted to go back and get another one.  Can't wait to go back.
Good gyro sandwich. Meat was a little dry for my taste but the flavor was great. The fries are nothing special but it's a good value and the staff is friendly.
Best falafel I've ever had! Very kind and attentive owners. Gyro was delicious and meaty, not dry and thin and crusty like some places.

I love the fact that this place is family owned. The gyros are pretty tasty and when i am working in the neighborhood I call in my order so I can pick up my gyro.  I have been coming here for years!!!

I am enchanted by their falafel sandwiches....enough so that I hussle over during my lunch hour all the way from 25 & Colorado!  The price is right and the couple who own and work the restaurant are nice.

I agree with a previous review that the falafel are the perfect with just the right amount of crunch!

One day, out of the blue, I wanted falafels and gyros, I've been trying to cut back on meat but still wanted something flavorful so I won't go scrumming around for non-meat unhealthy snacks. This place is tucked away off of the corner of East Alameda? I believe, but it's a gem worth searching for. The place is simple and the owners are an older couple with the loveliest accents. I ordered take out and it was ready in about 10 minutes! I ordered the Falafel gyro meal ( a falafel gyro, with a side of fries and a drink). This meal was SO good to me, very filling, and the falafels were the perfect combination of soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. The only minor issue I had was that there was a lot of sauce dripping out of the gyro, which caused a bit of mess, but a delicious mess! I'm definitely hooked! (I've even become invested in making falafels for myself!) Oh, btw, I paid about 7 dollars and 55 cents total. I would recommend trying it! It supports small local business!

perfect gyro/greek food
great prcies
super nice mom and pop shop 
great for kids
try it, you'll like it
The Gyro King is back!! One of the best Gyros I've had. There gyros are good size and delicious. There falafel is also a must have. Happy they are back!

How have I not reviewed Gyros King?! 

I've picked up dinner a couple of times on the way home from work. My husband and I both love gyros and hummus. So both times, I ordered 2 gyros (they come with fries!) and hummus w/ pita. Mmm, mmm. It's locally owned by an older couple. One time I was in there, the husband was cutting up tons and tons of tomatoes right there on the counter. I like to see the freshness that goes into my food. 

It's a convenient place to stop for gyros. Also, the food is pretty tasty. Otherwise, I wouldn't have stopped a second time. I would recommend trying out the hummus and gyros here.

I have no idea why this place has that many stars and it's not even that great. People must have a bad sense of taste or something..lol..no offense. I tried their gyro, nothing special..no wow..it was more like bleh. My dad loves gyros, he went to culinary school and tasted the best of the best..so he expected high standards..we don't judge a store or restaurant by its cover but what it gives us..and this place gave us crud. The pita bread was not warm..more like dry, the meat was ok..but not the best..the tomatoes and onions in there was more like whatever...did not like it much..never goin there again :)
So good! I am sure glad i happened upon this place. a cute couple owns and runs the store; great food and great service.

Went here today based on Yelp reviews. I got the Gyro plate. It came with hummus, a tomato, cucumber, onion salad, rice, gyro meat, tzaziki sauce and pita bread. The rice was pretty forgetable, but everything else was DELICIOUS! It really is quite a bit of food for what you pay for it. 

The lady who was there is, as others have described, a stern broad! She seemed irritated. She seemed to try to be talking me out of getting the "plate" and just getting the gyro sandwich with french fries. That was weird. Also, a downer for me is that they don't serve fresh iced tea. So a star off for that and for trying to down sell me.

Another favorite corner place I was re-introduced to this weekend.
talk about bang for your buck. The prices are super reasonable and the portions are huge. The food is delicious and if you love Mediterranean you have to stop in here if you get the chance.
The family is very serious about their food and you should be serious about tasting it. Finger licking good...really.

Tried this place for the first time tonight and it didn't disappoint. I had the gyro plate and every component (gyro meat, hummus, tomato & onion salad, rice and pita were prepared perfectly. The owners were friendly and attentive. It's a small hole in the wall definitely worth checking out.

When you walk into the unsuspecting looking Wing Hut you really don't know what you would get if you didn't look at reviews ahead of time. This is probably the best wing place I have been to.

- Decent prices by pound
- Small location
- Varied beer offerings
- TONS of sauces
- Friendly staff

I doubt they have any responsibly sources, GMO free, farm raised chicken wings here so if that's your thing keep looking. By the size of the wings I ate, they probably came from some genetically modified ten winged chicken beast raised in a warehouse. You know what though? I am okay with that.

The wings tasted delicious and they offer a ton of sauces. I recommend the pesto parmesan medium heat like most people do, for layers of flavor. I ordered four pounds of wings for $30 and it was enough for three mildly hungry people. 

They also offer a nice fried desert and various beers. The apricot blonde helped wash the wings down without altering the flavor.

My new go-to wing place.

Probably one of my favorite places to grab wings in a variety of flavors

They have a full menu of sauces and dry runs to choose from so there is sure to be something to please everyone 

They also have a full Cajun menu for those that want something different. I always told myself that when I got tired of their sauces I would order Cajun, it hasn't happened yet but a buddy of mine got the gator stew one time and I tried it. Just as delicious as the wings, if not better 

We are frequent return customers here

This has become my top wing destination.  You tell me we are going out for wings, my mind will flash an image of some inferno ranch wings...and endless parade of them.  While this place has quite a large variety of wings, those inferno ranch just sing to me.  They hit the right notes and the wings are just dripping with that hot awesomeness.  I've tried a few of their other "hot" flavors, and all pack a good punch without sacrificing flavor.  If you've read my other wing reviews, you will know that that is a big thing for me.  You can make the hottest wing in the world and you'll get me attention but if it comes at the cost of flavor...no thanks.  It is possible to have both and I feel the inferno ranch, along with a few other of this places flavors, hit that mark.

  The location is spacious enough but be wary, this is a popular spot.  Hit it up at the peak time and good luck finding a seat.  In my visits, I've either been in that predicament or walked into a mildly vacant area.  Either way, I got my wings and ate happy.  Plus...holy crap...funnel cake fries.  Kiss your diet goodbye, for the night, if you want that.  It's pure decadence and carnal bliss, that is then topped with chocolate and peanut butter.  A big ol plate of "Screw it". 

  It's not hard to recommend this place to wing lovers.  They serve up meaty wings, dripping in their wide variety of sauces.  My heart lies with the inferno ranch, so give that flavor a dip.  You can buy the wings by the pound, so get a few pounds and have a mouth party...and maybe try their sandwiches and other offerings too.  Plus those deliciously sinful funnel cake fries.  Eat up, minions!

This place is legit!  We ordered 2 lbs of wings, the bee sting, some chile lime sauce, and hot.  All were so good!  The funnel fries are amazing and unlike other places the portions of ranch are huge!  I wish I lived closer so I could go all of the time.  Definitely a place I would go out of my way for!

The wings were alright were pretty darn good.  The one down side is the amount of sauce that they put on them, a little bit excessive.  The place was a pretty cool dive.  The wings were crispy and they had some really great flavors.

first time try this place it is definitely a five star the wings were amazing the customer service was great the deep fried mushrooms were my fav and I am now addicted to the funnel cake fries I tried buttercooky as a topping amazing ...I love this place I will probably be here on a weekly basis
Any place that had Jones Soda on fountain gets an automatic 5/5, no questions asked.

Seriously one of the better wing places I've tried here in Aurora! Love their teriyaki wings and they have top notch curly fries! Everything is cooked to order so it's comes out nice and fresh! The wings tasted juicy and tender while still having a nice crunch to it! The teriyaki sauce was a bit salty, but it had a nice tartness to it. 

I really like the funnel cake fries! We tried the strawberry funnel cake fries were to die for! We waited to have them served after we ate our wings so it came out warm and crunchy and we were able to enjoy them before they got cold! The strawberry sauce was not too sweet or too tangy it was just right!
It's pretty good, but also....  4 chicken wings is a pound? Really? If I order a pound of wings it should be more than 4 wings, just saying....  that's like more than 2 bucks per wing.

Coming from upstate New York I wasn't sure if I was going to find a wing joint like I had back home but I was wrong. Wing Hut has delicious wings and many unique flavors. Not to mention, they have a good variety of craft beers. I highly recommend checking out Wing Hut if you want a good atmosphere, draft beer, and tasty wings.

Wing Hut has become my go to place for wings.  They have an ish ton of flavors and let you mix match to make your own concoction. My favorite is the basic buffalo hot wings, all flats. That is my order every time I go.  I tend to try different sides such as fried zucchini, curly fries, or jalapeno poppers. This particular time however, I tried a dessert. I don't normally get dessert but the lady serving the beer convinced us to try the funnel cakes fries. The selling point was when she said chocolate and peanut butter.  Two of my favorite things together on funnel cake fries? Yes please!!
They came out glowing. Words cannot describe how delightful this dessert was. They almost melted in your mouth with better flavor than a Reese's peanut butter cup. This is the best dessert I have ever had in my whole life. Even if you don't like hot wings, or you are a vegetarian, go to Wing Hut and get the funnel cake fries! NOW!

So disappointing! We were really craving wings and decided to drive 15 min to try The Wing Hut because the reviews were that good...got home and our large order of boneless wings that we payed $10.99 for were 7 little soggy chicken pieces in over a lb of bbq sauce. We would have been better off getting precook chicken at the grocery store and poured store bought bbq sauce on them. They were thrown out after one bite.

Last night was our first time at Wing Hut and it really was an enjoyable experience.  The wings were delish, the beer selection was tasty, and the staff is a delight!  There are so many options for wing sauces as well as awesome side dish options!  This place is small but very quaint with great music in the background.  We're always on the lookout for low-key and enjoyable places to grab a beer and good eats so we will definitely be returning and soon!
I wasn't too impressed by their wings, chicken was a little rough and sauce was alright. Fries were pretty good though.

For a wing joint, can't get any better than this joint and 5 star is well worth it.  

1.  Family friendly
2.  Always revolving to something better
3.  Nice section of WING flavors 
4.  Lovely patio with hop vine covered
5.  Plenty of micro brew selection to please your appetite.  I got my fav apricot blonde but I see 7 more.
6.  Got several screens to catch your fav game.
7.  Newly remodeled dining area and also bar seating area.  Definitely up and coming layout. .

I will be back more often!
Best wings in Aurora, a must stop if you are in the area and craving wings. Love their way too hot and inferno ranch.
I don't know if they switched owners in the past year or what but this place sucks now.

A friend recommended this wing spot, and it was really good! Small place, not a lot of seats, so I would recommend getting your food to go. They do have a patio though, so it might be better in the summer. It's located in a small strip mall over by Big Lots and Dollar Tree.

Wings are very saucy and have great flavor. Fries are great too. Good selection of sizes and varieties. Really just awesome to have a great wing place close by! Definitely will be going back to get wings for football parties and quick dinners.

This past Friday was my second visit to Wing Hut and I have to say, if how packed the place on both of our visits is any indication, this place is pretty great. 
Like so many things in Aurora this place is tucked into a strip at Hampden and Chambers, pretty close to Dry Dock. 
They have a crazy amount of sauces, far more than any other wing place I have ever been to. We've tried 7 sauces now. So far my favorites are the spicy peanut, the pesto parmesan and the chili lime. On our first visit we tried the xxx-hot. It kinda melted face off but Jeff S., having burned off his taste buds long ago found the heat a wee bit lacking. I'm looking forward to going back and trying some more. It will take several visits to make our way through all of them (seriously, there's a lot). The wings are also decent sized! No sad little skinny wings here!
They have a full cajun style menu besides the wings which I am itching to try. So if you're not in the mood for wings you can definitely still find something to nosh on. I've got my on you jambalaya!
They have limited seating at the bar but we were lucky enough to find a couple of seats there during our second visit. The bartender was really friendly and new her stuff when it came to the tap beers. The beers rotate and have they have a good selection. I had a ginger lemon radler from Boulevard Brewing and a Mandarin Nectar from Alpine beer. Both were suggestions from the bartender and they did not disappoint! 
Throughout our two visits we have been impressed with the food and service. They also deliver to Dry Dock if your wetting your whistle and get a little hungry!
The hostess is so rude and doesn't explain anything. This place sucks when the customer service is this bad!

My boyfriend's food of choice are chicken wings and this is his new favorite spot for them.  He finally took me here after weeks of eating Wing Hut without me.  I do not love chicken wings as much as him, but I was really impress by this place.  

It is small, but has a nice homey vibe and staff are super friendly.  They have a lot of choices for wing sauce and flavors as well as side dishes.  Our goal is to actually try all of the wing flavors.  So far I like the pesto-paramesan and the cajun dry rub.  I also enjoy their curly cajun fries and battered mushrooms.  Wing Hut does not have the  healthiest food selection, but it is oh so good.

BIG FAN!!

It can get crowded fast, so stop by before or after lunch/dinner peak time. 

The wings come in 1/2 lbs or by how many wings. I recommend get at least 1 lbs (10 wings approx). You may mixed a couple different flavor, and talking about flavor, they have plenty!!

Some of our favorite are honey barbeque, pad thai, asian, and raging barbeque. 

It's more of a self service joint, so don't expect to be babysat. Drinks are limited to non brandname soda, tea etc. 

Great wing joint overall!

Clean
Consistent 
Tasty food 
Family owned business 
Great beer selection on tap
Expensive but worth it

Pretty cool little wing spot. I got the bee-sting and the pesto-parmesan. Both were pretty good but I preferred the bee-sting. My wife got the lemon pepper and honey BBQ. Out of all 4 I liked the bee-sting the most and the lemon pepper the least. Also, I got the chipotle coleslaw which was some of the best slaw I have ever had. Their fries were pretty dang good too. One thing I loved was they had a bunch of local micro brews on tap and all their sodas were Jones, which if you are from the Midwest you will really appreciate it. Over all a fun place and great atmosphere.

I love the Wing Hut! I happened to stumble upon on it one day while leaving Big Lots and have been a fan ever since. Wings come in half or full pound rather than wing count. Half pound sounds like a lot but it only ends up coming to 3 or 4 wings with a full pound about 8 or 9 wings. I feel like a big verbally saying a pound of wings but it's the perfect amount and you can split the order with a couple different flavors. They have a ton of flavors, sides and even salads if you're looking to counterbalance the effect of wings! They recently got a  Jones Soda fountain machine instead of Coca Cola which I think is awesome since they are supporting the little man! My only gripe is that it's freezing in there and not a lot of space. I hope one day they expand because it was standing room only the last time we went in.

Go, you won't regret it. The food is great, the customer service is better.

I went here for lunch with my dad. He ordered the larger special, and got Bee Sting bone-in wings and Jerk dry-rub bone-in wings; I ordered Bee Sting and Chili Lime boneless wings. Dad got the potato salad with his order, which is apparently homemade and was fantastic (I finished his off once he was full). I asked if I could get half sweet-potato fries and half curly fries with my combo, and Ryan was very accommodating. Each combo included a pound of wings, a side, and drinks. Dad opted for their sweet tea, and I found myself drawn to the Jones Soda(!) fountain.

The food was top-notch, ready quickly, and freshly prepared. Both types of fries were great, the potato salad was killer, and the drinks were fantastic. The bleu cheese sauce is homemade and my dad said perhaps the best he's ever had; I prefer big chunks of bleu cheese, which this didn't have, but it still tasted great. The wings were out of this world on all accounts, though a bit more sauced than I personally prefer - more on that in a minute.

Customer service was extraordinary. We dealt mostly with Ryan during our trip, though we did get a chance to tell the cook how awesome he was too. As this was our first time here, Ryan helped us out with explanations of their specials and products, made suggestions, told us the most popular dishes, and just generally made sure we had a good experience. He brought us a sample of a couple of great beers from the tap (Dry Dock's Apricot Blonde, from the brewery across the street - fruity, malty, very nice, and Dry Dock's Aprihot w/ roasted Habanero peppers - like the Apricot Blonde but sneakily spicy).

When I asked if NEXT time I'd be able to order my wings with less sauce on them, if that was something they'd be able to do, Ryan brought me a new order (which I def. wasn't asking for, he just took it on himself to make sure I was happy). Let me make it clear, I was asking because it was my mistake, I forgot to ask for lightly sauced like I usually do, and they certainly didn't have to bring me new wings - because I was going to finish the ones I had. Also, the music was good stuff, and they now have trivia nights (Tuesdays IIRC).

In summary, everything about this place is great, and I'll definitely be going back.

Oh wow.  Where to be begin!  This spot is a definite must try if you're in the Denver area.  The beer selection is was great.  The wings were crispy, seasoned perfectly, juicy and tender.  

I wish there was a location in San Diego.  I will miss this place.  You guys are great.  Keep it up!

This place is the greatest wings place I've ever been to. I'm not even eating it at the moment and decided to write a review. This small family owned business is the perfect place for positive vibes, sports, board games, and in-house made deserts! I always get the Bee Sting and Fire Ranch, it is always delicious. Recently I switched it up (it wasn't easy) but I started to get Mild Ranch and Chile Lime Ranch because the first two were a bit too spicy for me personally. Top it off with sweet potato and curly fries, and your day will be made! Don't forget to try the funnel cake fries with cookie butter, thee best way to end a highly satisfying meal. Cheers!

Tell me how they charge you 5 bucks for 4-5 wings but 7-10 is 8.49.  Got two pounds tonight and a big ranch.  12 total wings for $21.  I called and they said the pounds are 6-8 and I said your website says 7-10, and he said oh sorry I guess we haven't updated our website.  Think they need a new scale.

Nothing is really cheap here at Wing Hut. . .I can tell you that.  Though nothing is "blow you away" expensive.  I ordered the 6 boneless wings. . with combo add on a beer.   My wife got wings too. . .and kids both got kid meal with corndogs.  We hit about $30 bucks. . . I would say about average for my family on a casual outing.

I was so freaking full from my 2pm lunch at Wing Hut (with only 6 wings) that I didn't really eat the rest of the day.  So it was 6 nice size wings.    My wife and I are already making plans to split a 6 wings and fries next time, and add on a rice and beans. . .

Atmosphere. . casual.  You go up and order and sit down, and they bring the food out to you (and beers).  Small place in a stripmall, but a nice looking patio with lights (it was raining so we stayed inside)

The beer selection was solid.  Really solid local beers, including a really great beer for spicy wings (Dry Dock Apricot blonde).  In fact dry dock (a great brewery) is just down the street. Assuming delivery. . the next time at Wing Hut I may be eating at Dry Dock.


This is my "i'm on the oppisite side of the suburbs" place from our defacto standard "Wingin it".  I think its also may encourage us to go to dry dock for lunch a little more often. . .as pickup wingin it would be perfect..

I was way to full for the Funnel cake fries, though it sounded like a great idea.

I am impress that there are people that could actually give 5 star to this place because on what I had experience, this place is more like 3-4 star than the 5 star perfect place.
sweet and sour wings seems to be okay, average wings I guess but it doesnt have that wow factor that I've been looking. It has the same taste as the wings on Mcdonalds, service is also much similar. Just Average!

Ahhhhh yes. Now this may be one of the best wing places in the city. The food is incredibly messy but quite good, especially the parmesan garlic wings. Furthermore, the beer selection is wonderful, and they consistently bring in new flavors. The ambience is just right, the desserts are great, and the whole place is great fun. I'll definitely be back!

Hearing that there is a good wing place near our house made us happy.  We love wings, you see, but our favorite spots are a bit of a jaunt.  We ordered takeout from here last week and last night we came in for dinner in-house.

The inside is pretty small, the bar only has four stools. They actually have a very nice patio for a strip mall site.  The menu has quite an array of sauces, listed from top to bottom as mild to hot.  Between our two trips we sampled eight on wings, plus last night they let me have a couple samples on my own that I knew Jess wouldn't like.  Of all of them I'd say the most original and tastiest is the hot honey mustard.  Excellent flavor, although neither of us felt there was any "hot" to it at all.  In fact, all the sauces we've tried that were on their hot scale seemed closer to medium.  That's when I was offered the way too hot habenero, which was more to my level of desired spice.  They also gave me a sample of the Diablo sauce that is being made for a challenge.  This one is not messing around.  Not for the faint of tongue, I can promise you.  Excellent flavor but it will begin to melt your face from the inside out after about ten seconds.

The tap handles boast great brews from local places like Grist, Epic, and Dry Dock, which I really appreciate.  They offer a good variety of sides, salads and sandwiches.  And both times we've been here the people were very friendly. 

The wings are big, but the biggest downside is the sauces are very watery so the wings were drowning.  I feel that if they thickened the sauces up a little more then it would adhere to the wings better.  And if you're a capsaicin addict like me make straight for the bottom of the list.  

I will probably be checking them out a lot, especially knowing that they deliver to Dry Dock.  If you're a wing fan in Aurora, this is the place to be!

The Wing Hut was such great food and the staff so nice with a comfortable laid back vibe! The Cajun food was as good as in New Orleans and the wings were perfection. The owner is so friendly and we highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great beer, food and company!

Great wing place!  Went for lunch today and by the outside it looks like more of an old-fashioned restaurant, but when you go in it is very modern with a cool vibe to it.  I got their boneless wing with the garlic-parmesan sauce (towards the top of the list - so less spicy), but the sauce definitely had a huge kick to it compared to that sauce at other wing places I've been to.  I couldn't have gone hotter, but it was very tasty.  And 6 wings + fries were very filling.

My kids got the the corn dog meals (with curly fries) and enjoyed the food (nice that it came with a small treat of fruit snacks - my son's favorite).  And my husband enjoyed the mango sauce, and found it a bit spicy for his taste, but enjoyed his food.  Plus, Wing Hut has a good selection of Colorado craft beers, which always go good with wings. 

I'll definitely be back.

So disappointing lately. After my visit today I had to come change my review to "Meh. I've experienced better." because I have. And it used to be at this place. After a 4 minute hold on the phone I placed my order. Drove down after waiting 10 minutes expecting it to be ready but it wasn't. Wait wasn't long - maybe 5 minutes. I get home and this was the third time in a row there were items & the extra ranch I paid for was missing in my to go order. You would think I'd learn after a couple of times to check but nope. Inquired but the owner doesn't ever seem to be there anymore. (Where you at Jared? Your restaurant needs your attention!) Really bummed, I used to love this place but I can't keep paying for stuff I'm not getting.

We went to Wing Hut on a lark, but, damn.

WHAT a lark!

You might know some other places that have "good wings" in addition to the rest of the items on their menu, but let's not forget that those same places still treat wings as a side. An appetizer. A warmup act. If they really cracked the code, wouldn't they want those wings front and center? 

Wing Hut is home to such code crackers, dishing out heaps of perfectly cooked and seasoned wings with a smorgasbord of flavors. Favorites include Bee Sting, Swinger, and All That, but you could do worse than explore the deep selection their menu offers. 

Don't hold back on the sides, either, as you'll want something to dip into the excess sauce at the bottom of each basket. Or you can just cup it with your hands like a fresh mountain spring and slurp away. I won't judge.

Just when you think it couldn't get any better, BAM: DESSERT. The Strawberry Shortcake Funnel Cake Fries are excellent and will leave you licking your fingers for the umpteenth time.

Final side note: If you order ranch or blue cheese dressing, there's a reason they charge extra for it. You will get more than enough for even the greediest of dippers, so start with one and figure it out from there.

As promised, we went back to try Wing Hut and it was a definite improvement, but I'm not sure if I'm sold. Our food came out in 9 minutes, but it wasn't super busy. We ordered 1 lb of wings (7 wings), medium fries, 1 ranch, and 2 beers - our total was $26 (EXTREMELY expensive for a wing joint in my opinion). The wings were warm, which was a disappointment. The fries this time were not overly salty, which was a plus. If we went to Wing Stop, we could have gotten twice the amount of food and 2 beers for the same amount of money and I know that my food would be hot and fresh. Also, I could go to a pub and have table service, more food, and a similar environment. However, I will say that Wing Hut has a nice environment and friendly staff, which I think is why people come back. 

My overall opinion is that Wing Hut is overpriced, inconsistent, and just not for me. I think this time will be our last time there.

OMG SOOOO GOOOD! I definitely found my new wing place! The wings are GIANT and are cooked perfectly. I dig how they're crispy. The Cajun dry rub A++++++. I like how their hot isn't super vinegary and tangy like most places. The fried pickle slices are super delicious too. I'm so never going to Buffalo Wild Wings again! 
Their beer selection is pretty good as well. 
I wish we didn't get full off wings I really wanted to try the funnel cake fries dangit.  Next time!! 

The employees are super friendly too.

Decided to try Wing Hut today. I read some great reviews and was anxious to try it out. Ordered the Mac and cheese bite which were just so so. Girlfriend had a salad and absolutely loved it. Also ordered wings of course... We had Bee sting, honey Bbq, and fiery ranch. All of which were phenomenal! Wing hut puts BWW to shame on every level as far as the food goes. Think I just found my new wing place!

Came here for a organization social. We had probably 50 people show up at some point and we filled up the whole restaurant and the outside seating so I felt bad for all the other customers that came afterwards. I didn't try the food so can't speak on that. They don't have hard liquor which is a bit weird for having a bar. They did have beer on tap and quite a bit of variety as well. The bartenders are very nice and charming. The outside seating is very nice especially during a summer night. There are lights strung across the trees and it's very quiet and definitely a cool place to hangout. I didn't like this place as much as buffalo wild wings which is much more spacious.

Wing hut is edible yes, impressive? Not in my opinion. What's the big deal? The buffalo wings taste like Franks Hot Sauce, and the BBQ tastes like generic KC Masterpiece or Lonestar. We got three different flavors of wings and a sack of fries and it cost me $30 bucks. 

I was led to wing hut by yelp reviews, but I think it's rated so high for service and location. The food is just fine! But I prefer the more exotic flavors offered at Wingin it, BWW, or Hooters.

Well, here's the point. I want the most value and best service as a customer and I got really small and broken wings. 

I have really enjoyed Wing Hut but when I see black bones I know the wings have been frozen. That's disappointing because I'm not seeing the discount at the register.

The most thing that disappointed me today is the size of the wings. I hope the picture I post will serve my point justice.

I won't be back if Jarod (or whoever is in charge of purchasing the base of food quality) continues to sacrifice profits for quality.

Bye bye.

Great wings but make sure to ask for them to be well done if you're like me and like your wings to be on the crispy side. The beer selection is good and being a part of the mug club makes it a great place to eat wings and drink beer. 

The location is small and it's become pretty popular so it can be a challenge to get a table on busy nights. I wish they would consider taking over the space MVP's was in and becoming a full scale wing and sports bar place, they would do very well as a result.
The wings and food at the wing hut are delicious. I've recent started going here after continuously driving by it. Finally I stopped in and have been going there to get my wings ever since.

Best wings I've ever had!!! I crave them constantly! They also have a Jones Soda machine my boyfriend is crazy about! The staff is super friendly and make great suggestions! I am new to town and I was so happy I found them! You have to try them out!

Awesome beers and very tasty wing sauce selections. Jackie was my bar tender/wing slinger, lol. She was very nice, and remembered my name. Great first experience. Will absolutely go back! I had the bee stings and the dry habanero pepper chef special. I hope they make that flavor a regular menu item

Got some takeout from this place for lunch, ordered the boneless bee sting, seems to be a popular sauce. the chicken had time to soak a little bit on the way back to work I think so they were not as crispy which is expected but a few of my coworkers got dry rubs and they looked crisp so I will say the chicken was cooked well, not too much breading either. Personally I don't like my wings soaking in sauce, I prefer to dip on the side and get more crunch but I did not relay that message to the cashier so my fault on that one. The sauce was really good though, I will definitely order here again to try another one of their specialty sauces (on the side this time). Staff was friendly and the restaurant was clean.

This is an update to my review from 2013. I'm not sure what has changed exactly, but the lemon pepper dry rub that I get is now complete garbage. My wings come barely seasoned, and essentially I am paying $30+ for plain fried chicken wings. This is the 2nd time in about 2 months that this has happened, and it is very upsetting to me. Also, my order tonight was for 2 flavors: hickory hog and lemon pepper. Both were barely seasoned, and I think someone mixed 3/4 hickory hog and 1/4 lemon pepper into the lemon pepper box. I could have called to have it changed, but delivery already takes over an hour and I didn't want to be inconvenienced again.

Omg where do I begin.... this place is soooo good! Tonight my husband and I tried Wing Hut for the first time and it exceeded our expectations. The staff was so sweet and accommodating and the wings were so delicious. 

We tried the Fire Ranch, Bee Sting and Swinger wings. They were perfectly fried and sauced. And OMG the funnel cake fries were amazing. Please don't leave without trying them. 

We will definitely be back!

Great wings! Definitely one of my favorites! I personally enjoyed habanero ranch. Its a little spicy but something completely different than the rest of the chicken wing places.

Its always nice finding the hole in the wall spots.  This is definately one of them.
Great sauces but wings are not meaty enough. There's other wing places within 3 miles that make a better wing for your money and something that actually has meat to it.
First time here after reading reviews. The wings are awesome.  Staff is so friendly.  Overall great experience.  Will be a frequent customer.

I can't believe I've resided in Aurora for so long without knowing about this place!  They have a variety of flavors to choose from and they're all finger lickin' delicious!  You order up front by the pound, they also serve deep fried mac and cheese wedges, and their funnel cake fries are AMAZE BALLS!  They also have a couple of beers on tap from their neighbor across the street Dry Dock Brewery.  Good stuff if you're ever tired of Buffalo Wild Wings and Hooters.

Truest delicious! Great variety, both sauces and dry seasonings. Service is great, wings are fresh. The garlic parm are a family favorite. If they say it's "spicy" believe them. Best part is they can be crazy hot and still have a ton of flavor.

I've only ever tried their wings so I can't comment on the rest of their food.

Great place to bring your kids, they have local craft beer and deliver. It's a regular order when I'm at a local brewery down the street!

Been coming here as a regular for a while now and they continue to impress. They recently had a renovation and have a significant selection of rotating craft brews on tap. I have also attended trivia night which is super fun. For a set price you get wings, fries, one beer and funnel fries for dessert. Each round, the winner chooses the next flavor of wings and all of their many flavor are delicious so you really can't go wrong. Love this place, I will definitely continue to be a loyal customer.
Trivia with winning wings or a side or a dessert every round.  Winning!. Good food, good service, good times!

Friends and I found this restaurant using Yelp and we were generally pleased. 

The sauces we tried (4 of them) were flavorful and well balanced. There are A LOT of sauces to try! 

Our single complaint was that the bone-in wings were small. They were good but we wished they had been meatier. 

I might suggest trying the boneless wings to get the most for your money as they sell everything by the pound and even though the bone-in was less expensive by a dollar or two, there just wasn't enough chicken on the bone to constitute a full meal at one pound.

I live so far from this place and every time I drive here I point out like 10 wing places on the way. I've tried a lot of wing places and I like this one the most. Their wings are top quality.. Jambalaya and jones soda on tap, forget about it. As long as there is free refills on jones soda than i see no reason to go anywhere else.

I'm not recommending this place anymore. If the staff is allowed to drink on the job, further lose revenue by ignoring customers who want to spend money, and make comments out loud like "I would never have a wing at this place" I will and did take my business elsewhere. I don't know, maybe they were practicing bad practices so that some TV reality show would redo their interior...

While I do LOVE my fair share of hotness, I'm a baby when it comes to spicy flavors. I decided to play it safe and order the Garlic Parm bone-less wings, which were so hot I couldn't even finish them. Very disappointing for my first experience, as I have heard lot's of good things about this place!

It had been a while since I've had some good wings, so I was excited to try Wing Hut. My biggest complaint of wings places is that they don't provide enough sauce/dry spice.

Well that's not a concern at Wing Hut. My Bee Sting hot honey wings had plenty of delicious sweet and spicy sauce, while there was also plenty of dry spice for my Cajun wings. Wings were cooked perfectly and came out nice and hot. A total of a pound + a side of sweet potato fries was the perfect amount to fill me up. And those fries were also great.

Service was great, as the girl behind the order counter was super friendly and helpful in guiding me through the menu. Although I did not have a beer, they have a few on draft. I may also have to try some of their non-wing Cajun-themed items someday. In the meantime, I look forward to trying some more flavors. If they're as good as the ones I had, 5-stars might be in order.
This place is great. The outside and parking lot had me questioning, but inside is clean and modern. Lots of beer. Perfect sauce. Tons of it too. Best wings south of Denver hands down.

Love the atmosphere!  Bonus...they deliver! Honey mustard is my favorite flavor, however I have enjoyed all the flavors that I have tried.

Aurora is lucky to have such an awesome, family owned eatery like The Wing Hut. 

So much deep fried deliciousness to be had. Hot craft wings washed down with cold craft beer. Doesn't get much better than that!

I dropped by for lunch the other week and had one of the lunch specials.  I went with the pound of wings and curly fries on the side, with a drink.  A pound of wings may seem like a lot, but it is pretty easy to tear through that amount.  I know that many (if not most) wing places have moved to doing wings by the pound instead of a numerical amount.  This allows them greater consistency across skinny versus meaty wings.  And, with the wholesale price of wings exceeding that of breast meat, it makes economical sense.  But, that does not mean I have embraced the change.  My curly fries were rather good, and I am usually not impressed by these.  Wing Hut offers a hug array of sauce choices.  The guy working the counter even let me try his mango creation.  I particularly enjoyed the Inferno Ranch and the Hot Honey Mustard.  I will definitely be back.

This place is delishhhhhh!!! The wings, the sauces, the sides, the funnel cake fries, beer and of course the people!!!!!

Incredible customer service, they love the place they work at so much they come with freebies, will offer taste tests of all the sauces and will even come sit down and converse with you

I'm a foodie and wing connoisseur, and this place is the best I have had in a while!!

i wish there was a wing hut closer to where i live now. pesto mild is one of my fav sauces ever. plus the curly fires are tasty and the staff is really cool and friendly.  every once in a while they'll forget something so double check your order before you leave.

Love coming here with the family. The wings are juicy and crispy. It seems the more wing places I go, the wings become too soft once the sauce is applied. But here they keep that outside crisp! 

We usually dine in and I love their random games they play! You can win free desert!
The staff has always been friendly. I will definitely keep returning.
Friendly staff and great wings. Trivia night is always a blast. The bee sting is my personal favorite and is a must try.

Disappointing. 
The wings were small, though cooked ok.
Fries good. Gumbo flavor ok but watery.
Red beans and rice also watery. Flavor was OK but lacking.
Shrimp po boy was the most disappointing item. Seemed rather industrial with absolutely none of the charms of a real New Orleans po boy.
Certainly not the worst, it was clean, staff friendly, food cooked well. Just seemed generic and industrial. 
Oh, and only Jones soda and very sweet tea. Not a bad thing but not my taste.

Total sleeper wing joint!  Nothing fancy from the outside, but the food and service were above and beyond.  They have a ton of great flavors to choose from.  The wings on the hot end of the scale are actually hot so use caution.  

They have good beers on tap, including some local craft beers.  I liked how the place is relatively small so the servers don't get overwhelmed.  Totally worth catching a game here!

This place is alright.  i'm not completely impressed but will come back to check it out and try other flavors.  Food comes out hot and the people there are super friendly which is a huge reason why I'm returning.  I saw a couple regulars be addressed by their first name.  I will have to return and eat more.

My son was very excited to try these wings since his friend loves them.  We were less than impressed though.  We got to go orders and by the time we got home everything was soggy and lukewarm.  We spent over $70.00 on food so I expected it to be very good.  I'm not sure I will go back.  I can make better food for way less money.

This place is great. I love that it is a family run business as well, and it is such a sweet family that you can tell works very hard and wants to always please their customers. I went in with not high expectations. As a gal originally from the Buffalo NY area, I am pretty dang picky about my wings. I let them know where I was from and hoped to be impressed. I ordered the lunch special of wings and fries and a drink and I was definitely impressed. The wings were crispy as I requested, they were bigger in size than I am used to finding outside of NYS, and they were saucy with pretty close flavoring from back home. And everything came out nice and hot and fresh. I let Jared know he made my day and that I'll definitely be back. Two days later I walked back in the door with my hubby and kiddo, and was recognized and my name remembered. Great customer service! My hubby was pretty happy with his order and he even wants to try the Cajun cuisine they also feature at this restaurant. He loves po boys! The owners even sent out a free dessert for us which was funnel cake fries. Yummm. Thank you Jared for fantastic food and wonderful service. The only thing I knock a star off for is the pricing. Being from Buffalo, I am not used to the weird pricing for wings elsewhere in the states. I mean c'mon, we have like $.25 wing nights. Getting 4-5 wings for the price you pay here is kind of crazy. They're still my favorite wing place based on flavor, atmosphere and staff though.. You know you will have some more regulars for sure!

The first step to recovery is admitting you have a problem and I am seriously addicted to Wing Hut's wings. They are just too good. Not only is every flavor AH-mazing and they have local brews on tap, they also have fresh curly fries... yes, CURLY FRIES! If I didn't want my butt to get any bigger, my inner-heffer would make me eat here everyday... Don't tell her they deliver. So now I must ignore the constant cravings and wait for the weekends to get my wing fix from the best wing place in Aurora.
1st time visit.  The co -owner is such a nice guy and the food was so good we ordered more just to take home. We will be back for sure and all kinds of compliments from me!

So first off, the pin showing the map location is wrong. This place is actually on the NORTHEAST corner of Hampden and Chambers (near Dollar Tree), not southeast as the map indicates.

I walked in to place a take out order, and the guy behind the counter was really nice. The service inside the store was very prompt and I didn't have to wait very long for my food. When I asked for boneless wings with hot honey bbq sauce, he said that they didn't have a hot honey bbq (I guess I read the menu on Yelp incorrectly?); BUT, he would be happy to mix their regular honey bbq with some hot buffalo sauce! It ended up being really heavy on the buffalo sauce and I couldn't really taste the honey bbq, but they get props for offering a special solution for me.

We also had bone-in wings with fire ranch (which was too spicy for me but my husband really liked it). I thought the bone-in wings were tough and stringy; the boneless ones were much more succulent, so I'm glad I chose them for myself. For sides, we shared a large garden salad that was plenty big enough for two (really fresh, too, with very crisp lettuce and cucumber), zucchini fries, and hush puppies. Yum! The zucchini fries and the hush puppies were hands-down my favorite part. They were golden and crispy with a very flavorful breading on the outside, and perfectly done in the center. I definitely give the overall quality of the food here high marks.

My only complaints are, firstly, that the ranch for dipping the zucchini fries and dressing the salad was extremely runny, which is a pet peeve of mine. It still had the right ranch-y spices and flavor, but it was way watered down. Secondly, they did not include any cutlery in my to-go bag, even though they did include plates and napkins. This was almost a disaster because we were eating at Dry Dock, but thankfully we were able to scrounge up some forks there. So, minus one star for those two things.

It seemed like we ordered a lot of food (1 pound bone-in wings, small boneless, large salad, zucchini fries, and hush puppies), but the portions were not overly large and we shared the sides. This lunch cost $13/person (so I believe Wing Hut should be classed in the $$ range) and we were comfortably full, but not stuffed.

I just had a great experience at Wing Hut! My boyfriend and I love dry dock, since they don't serve food we decided to look for food around there. We found Wing Hut a couple weeks ago but finally made it there today. 
Immediately I was impressed by the friendly welcoming demeanor of a gentleman who I assumed was a server; he greeted us warmly and immediately took and filled our beer orders, he gave us the perfect amount of time to contemplate our wing order, and was attentive and helpful throughout the process.
Our wings were amazing, and I mean - food so good you chew extra slow to taste it better - then he insisted on bringing dessert (absolute magic) to our table on the house. At that time we discovered that this gracious , delightful gentleman is the wonder of this establishment. Cheers to Jared of Wing Hut! You are innovative, talented, and completely commited to the success of Wing Hut which I respect. Thank you for being awesome and enhancing a great night!
Cheers

This is my favorite restaurant! Me and my boyfriend drive 1.5 hours to get here about once a month!! ALWAYS quality food. Biggest, juiciest Wings I've ever eaten :) not the cheap scrawny kind.  worth the drive every single time but I miss the one in Longmont that was 5 min away. 
:( unfortunately it closed down because the previous owner retired but it wasn't until we went to this location in Aurora and discovered their funnel cake fries and better sauces!! Their sauces are made fresh daily so sometimes they can taste a little different but still delicious every single time! They took away the golden honey bbq but fatshack in Boulder has this flavor. I've never had any problems with the food here. The staff is even very nice and attentive and if anything is wrong they are always sure that they make it right. I just wish they were open later and had another location that would be a blessing! So thankful for this treat!!!

They get two stars for the cheerful staff but the tiny cramped and overall loud seating was horrible. And as far as food if you are ok with waiting 25 minutes for 5 chicken wings then you should stop by. As far as taste for the price you are better off spending your money at a B dubs. Again. Staff was fun but not a family place and not for hungry people who want the food at a fairly hasty rate.

Stop going wherever else you go for wings in Aurora.  Once again a fantastic, small, family owned business  makes the grade.  I love going here, not only for the great wings, the small but expertly chosen selection of beers on tap, but the people.  They are why I won't go anywhere else in town for wings.  I am recognized every time I go in and treated like family. From the first time I stepped into the door I felt welcome and knew I was going to love the place.  If you are a wing connoisseur you won't be disappointed.  They are cooked perfectly and the sauces are varied and always great.  I tend to lean toward the traditional "buffalo" flavor and theirs doesn't disappoint.  Stop in for some wingys and beers,  you won't ever need to think about where to go for wings or a good beer ever again!

So delicious for boneless but me and my other half had gotten sick from whatever ones we ate there... Been up all night sick to our stomachs, this disappoints me because the flavors and the staff were amazing. That's why the three stars. But overall I'm on the fence about going back.... Good staff... Hoping not to get sick again:(

Ordered during AFC game so busy. The wings weren't hot even though our order wasn't ready at pick up time. And they forgot our dessert. The funnel cake fries made the order. Wings just so so. Probably not going to order wings there again just dessert.

I got the lunch special which had more food than I thought, it came with a drink and fris and two different kinds of wings (teriyaki & Honey mustard.... the honey mustard was delicious!!) for only $13... they have 44 types of sauce, bone in and boneless wings the curly fris were good and the sweet tea was real southern style sweet tea. I found a checkers board and beat my friend terribly.... overall great food, good service, good time....

Buffalo wild what?... Delicious food.. Wings, sweet potato fries, and funnel cake fries!!!.. WHAT?! best place I have been in a while! I highly recommend this to anyone! And the staff were extremely polite and welcoming! We will definitely be coming back any time we want good quality wings! Two thumbs up!

Very rarely do I think a place is great all around but Wing Hut is a place where I can say without a doubt, they do justice to their menu. Friendly atmosphere, great food and wing flavors, and sides. Overall great service and items are made homemade.

I have been to this establishment on more than 20 occasions.  Very consistent.

The staff is awesome!
The wings are great!
The beer is fabulous!
Great place to hang out and watch games
Hands down, our third time here in 3 weeks.  Best wings, beer and service!!!  Best sauce by far with a kick is the Bee Sting.  And have leftovers for later.

Try this place if you or anyone in your party considers themselves a wing officianados!!  Also try this place if you enjoy your wings with a hankerchief  in hand to mop up your sweat!!! I mean, it's wings, if they don't burn my tongue out of my mouth what's the point!

 Have eaten here twice now. Once for dinner and once today for lunch--both times were fantastic experiences.  

My first visit I had the mango madness. These babies were delicious and had a nice heat to them.  I from Southern louisiana so I really enjoy all things spicy...these were described as hot to very hot by the host.....   My partner had the bee sting which had a great flavor... but lacked the heat I like....saying great flavor is a gross understatement...the bee sting sauce at the bottom of his tray was like sweet nectar :) and I helped myself to it, incessantly! 

Today I had the dry rub, boneless Kung pao (spelling?)  Absolutely delicious but again lacked the heat I enjoy.  I was under the impression this rub had ghost pepper but I found these to be a 2 of 10 on heat. 

The funnel cake fries with strawberry shortcake topping were absolutely delectable. Perfectly fried with all the toppings on the side, per my request.  Mmmm Mmmm sooooo good!!

Will definitely be back!  Want to try the Fire Ranch, Raging BBQ and any recommendations the host suggests for extreme heat.

Oh and their ranch dressing seems homemade and is scrumptious!!

We were here Thursday night, we also go to the wing night sometimes at dry dock, or order from these guys at dry dock. In short, we pretty much live at dry dock. But in making it over there last night, it refreshed my memory on all the great things we miss when we don't visit their location. I am pretty critical about two things aside from the food--the vibe of the restaurant and SERVICE. We walked in to an always happy crew of staff, we're so warmly welcomed, awesome music on the speakers, yummy local pints of beer were in our hands very quickly. We always order at least the bee sting and inferno ranch- they are must tries. 
  I've read that a couple people have some disappointments with to go times-keep in mind they are independent, small place AND they are feeding tons of beer drinkers at a near by brewery throughout every day. Jared has made some amazing decisions with this establishment and I love supporting good food, but even better, good people who deserve it. Keep it up guys!
The wings are a bit over priced for the quality received. I was told this place had amazing wings, however, after eating here - I would have to say that I would rather eat WingStop wings instead.
I have yet to be dissapointed with the food or the service.  Staff is great and Jared has done an excellent job og maintainibg a friendly atmosphere with consistantly, quality food.
The best wing place around! My wife and I will not go anywhere but here for wings! Good prices and great people. Fun place to just grab a bite and some good craft beer
Food was delish!!! Had my favorite sauce garlic parmesan, lots of fried snacks. 100% recommend it. Clean, friendly, and yummy!

I had a very pleasant experience. I ordered delivery and the gentleman on the phone who took my order was very pleasant, patient and thorough. 

I had the boneless bites, ordered half garlic parmesan and half salt and vinegar. I wasn't sure if I would like to salt and vinegar; I mean, it's a great flavor for chips, but I was skeptical about chicken. Turned out to be very good. There was a strong vinegar smell, but the taste was subtle and they were very lightly salted which was great. 

I had the combo which included a side and drink. I chose the pickle chips. They were perfectly crunchy and slightly spicy.

Wow! What a wonderful place. The food was delicious, very homemade and fresh. We had the quiche and yogurt granola with fruit, both of which were perfect. The quiche came with some perfectly-cooked and seasoned potatoes. I'll be full all day. 

The ambience is warm and welcoming. Almost everyone is a volunteer here, and they provide meals to anyone who needs them regardless of what they can pay. They help people in the community and are working hard to deepen relationships in the neighborhood. Go visit, you won't be disappointed!
I adore this place.  I tried the breakfast burrito this morning and thought it was delicious.

We went here for the first time and loved it. Nice atmosphere, good service and wonderful food. Plus we like the concept. 
We had the Runza and it was awesome. It came with chips which were thick and good but I wish we'd had a choice of something not fried like a side salad.

The coffee and tea are $2 and cappuccino and Americanos are $5.

I stopped by here today just because of word of mouth around here. They serve breakfast for $5 or lunch for $8. The idea behind the restaurant is that if you dont have money to feed your family then you can help out around the cafe to pay your bill.
