The food isnt bad either. I had a large homemade ham and cheese with a side and salad. Being blessed with a good job I paid extra so others may eat. Good job Heather and Rob!!
Best food I have had in downtown littleton.  A must try!  The cos is incredible and people working there are beyond friendly.   A very warm environment!

Such a great place!! I had never heard of it before and it was close to work so I thought I would check it out. After reading about their philosophy and what they do here I was immediately impressed. I had the lunch special which was delicious and it was honestly a hard choice as the salad sounded amazing too! I also had a latte, very good!! I can't wait to stop by again, hopefully for breakfast too!! Cute decor and great community atmosphere!
Tried this place out today. Absolutely adorable! The breakfast sandwich special was delicious and the hospitality is unbeatable!

This place is great! Apparently the menu changes daily, but I ordered the sweet potato hash and it was impeccable! I love that my breakfast only cost $5 and profits from this place go to charity...definitely will be back.

Great space, kind staff, & good food. I came here within their first few weeks of opening and was impressed with the setup and cuisine. The food was very tasty and brought to the table quickly. The space features a pleasant, modern, decor and the location is easy to get to in downtown Littleton. The staff were all very friendly and spent some time talking about how the business works. I have only tried the lunch options so far but have heard they have excellent breakfast offerings as well.

Love it. Hospitality at its best. A warm and inviting and very friendly breakfast and lunch spot. This is just what Littleton was lacking. Lots of seating inside and out, very reasonable prices for good meals and best of all, community-spirited. Would be great if someday they expanded their hours...

Such a cute little coffee shop in downtown Littleton. I love that it's in an old house! The outside area is so great and nicely shaded. Super friendly employees and AWESOME music. The menu is super simple (no flavors for lattes and such) but definitely give this place a shot!

Beautifully renovated cafe recently opened in down town Littleton. I get in there as often as I can for either coffee or coffee and breakfast. Super friendly staff. I always feel energized when I come out of there. I love the patio seating and comfortable indoor seating as well. Yummy food and great ambiance!
Delicious, affordable and fresh breakfast and lunch! They serve Commonwealth coffee (YUM) and you can pay a meal forward for someone who needs it. This is officially my new favorite spot!

Saw the Denver Post article on GraceFull this morning and decided to have lunch here this afternoon. Everything about GraceFull is delightful....the concept, staff, food and atmosphere!  We will most definitely be back!

This place was actually really good. They are also in the mist of extending their business into a catering and coffee business. That shows they are doing something right.

The sides are soooo good, each and every one of them. The meat was also really good.

The rice punch, to die for!!

Anyways, it was a pleaseure. My husband and I will be returning.

Their lunch specials are the bomb! I live in Boulder and also from LA. I miss good Asian food. So when I am in Aurora I like to get my Asian food fill. 
I got the Soon Tofu Soup and it was so yummy and super tasty. I went there by myself and it was a feast with all the sides. 
Can't wait to go back.

Absolutely loved this place. This is one of the few places where you can get Korean BBQ. They have many tables with grills and hoods that can be used for BBQ, they also have several small private rooms for larger parties. The restaurant has the feel of a chain although I believe it's family owned. It's a large establishments that serves the larger Denver metro area and the Korean community. Several Korean families were visiting while I was there, so that's gotta say something about this restaurant. 

The banchan were very good and I saw several new items that I had not seen in other Korean restaurants before. They also brought us back more of them once we had eaten them. That was nice. :) 

The service was very attentive when we first got in and got worse as the rush lunch hour approached. We could not get them to bring us a to go box, so I got up and got one myself from the shelf. Overall a good place where we will come back for BBQ.

Great Food! Great Korean BBQ experience ! The servers were very friendly and helpful explaining everything and very honest. Love this place and we've been there a lot and definitely coming back again and again. One of my favorite places to go in town.

This is certainly my favorite Korean BBQ in Denver. You know you are in an authentic place as well when most of the patrons are of Korean decent. Of course, the food is largely the reason you need to check this place out. I am a huge fan of the thin sliced beef and the short ribs cooked on the tabletop. You also get about 10-15 sides as well. Be adventurous, even if you skeptical. Two BBQ dishes are more than enough to feed 3 people so I would be cautious in ordering too much. The staff is very attentive and will continue to check on your meat as you are grilling them.

This should not be a review of the food, only that I do not in fact like this type of food. Nor do I like that I have to cook it. The BBQ meat was legit, every other thing on the table that looked like it was going to walk away frightened me.

I accept that I am a sissy and welcome your mockery.

Staff was kind enough to explain what some items on the menu were when I asked and were quick to take orders and seat people, lunch time special was very affordable with large portions of sides and a large entree.
I will have to come again with my friend sent time I visit.

Bibimbap was great.  Sides weren't bad either.  They even threw in a dessert which I haven't had at other Korean restaurants.  Can't comment on the BBQ since I was dining alone for business.  Other people dining seemed to be enjoying it though.  Would return if in the area and not dining alone.

I've been here many times and I'm sad to say that my last visit here was one of the worst I've had at this restaurant. Which is absolutely too bad because I love their choices of Korean BBQ. However their customer service was completely horrendous and downright rude! 

Before I start into their customer service, I'll review their food. There was 6 of us so we decided to get the combo for 5, which included 5 choices of meat, choice of soup, egg casserole, soju, and of course all the sides. 

The sides arrived first and you better believe we started digging in! I don't know the names of all the dishes but my favorite is the sweet yams. We finished several bowls by the time our meat arrived. We ordered the marinated meat combo. We grilled one set of meat at a time and had to change the grill top several times. Korean BBQ is one of my favorite kind of food and it was very appetizing and filling. I'd recommend coming here for their food alone. 

However, if your thing is service which I'm pretty big about, Seoul BBQ has one of the worst. We asked for water at the time we ordered but still didn't get it until after we cooked and ate half of our meat. We also asked for an extra bowl because they miscounted and we never got one. We also asked for more sides, but they ran out of the sweet yam dish...sad panda (that has nothing to do with their customer service but I was legit sad they ran out lol). 

The waiter was extremely rude! There were times we'd ring the doorbell because we needed something like water and he'd take 15 minutes plus to finally make it to our table. He also didn't turn on our vent so when we cooked our last set of meat, it smoked up the entire restaurant until another waiter came over to turn it on. Once receiving our bill, we waited for him to come back to check us out with the sweet rice drink. We rang the bell and had a friend stand up looking at them trying to catch a waiters attention but they just ignored her. When they finally walked over, she asked for the sweet rice drink but said they were out. So we were packing up getting ready to go then they roll over with the drinks. By the time they brought it though, we were already peeved. So a few of my friends didn't want it out of spite. 

Ok I'm done ranting, but seriously this was one of the worst customer experience I've had.

One of the best Korean BBQ in Denver! Atmosphere is always very nice and busy. Service always very nice.

We ordered Bulgogi to cook it our self that came with a lot of side plates which you can order more when you finished. It also came use radish soup in the beginning. After the meal they serve sweet rice drink for dessert.

This is place is as good as it gets as far as Korean BBQ goes in the area.

I used to come here with my family almost weekly back in the day (two years ago) and ordered off the menu (everything from appetizers to stews to BBQ to shabu shabu). From my memory, most of their items are tasty! The only thing is that their prices have shot up within the last two years. $13 for dol sot bibimbap now, say whaaaa?!

Anyway, the bbq combo option is always good if you have hungry people with you. We usually go with combo B (with bulgogi and pork bulgogi) when we have 4-5 people.

I recently got the dol sot bibimbap with no meat and asked for tofu instead, and they made it! It was awesome - enough for two people who aren't that hungry. 

Their side dishes are always yummy and they always refill whatever dish, if you ask! The sushi that came with it was questionable though... My stomach was okay after eating it though. I'm alive.

I don't know why everyone has such a terrible experience with the service here... They've been pretty spot on every time I've been here... But that could be because my mom tips them well too... Either way, good service and good food means a good rating.

The only thing, as mentioned before, is that the price point is on the higher side. But, I guess we all have to make money...

Pro tip: you can get an additional stew, if you don't get any soju or sodas with your combo.

Also, no reservations unless you have 6+ in your party.

For my first time at a Koran BBQ I was wildly disappointed. The thrill of cooking the meat table side and having countless little side dishes quite intrigued me. Maybe the excitement level was to much but I have not been so disappointed in awhile.  Overall for the amount of meat you get I think the price is high.  The meat was one of the more taster portions but when you get two different types and cannot tell the difference that isn't so good.  All the sides were cold and very unappetizing.  Plus there was no instruction whatsoever on what to do once the meat starts firing up at your table.  I decided to order a soup as well, using the servers recommendation, and yuck! I have not tasted something so bland in a very long time.

Overall none of the flavors I was anticipating.

Pretty darn expensive, but it's good stuff. Came here with family, we got a little room, no extra charge. The staff here are nice, the meats were well marinated, and the sides were all normal. They charge extra for rice so watch out, you shouldn't be eating much rice anyway, just meats and veggies. For complimentary dessert, they gave you something like sugar rice water, might not be everyone's favorite.

One of my favorite Korean spots in Colorado and probably anywhere. Probably only second to my favorite Korean spots in D.C. Great food quality and service. My friend and I shared the BBQ Combination A and thought it was a pretty good deal. Everything was delicious. Galbi is always my favorite meat to get and I remember it being particularly delicious here. I hope to return soon!

This restaurant has very authentic and tasty korean food!! I got Dae-Goo Mae-oon-tang (sea bass spicy soup) to go and it was oh so yummy! Caution: it is very spicy as the name of the dish explicitly implies. It had other seafood in the soup, including mussels and baby clams.

The soup came with some sides and of course, a bowl of rice. The kimchi was not the best I've had, so I would minus half a star for that if I could. It was bland and wasn't fermented enough. But the cucumber and soybean sprout side dishes were very good.

Come here if you enjoy great food, flavor variety, quality service, and an open atmosphere. And most definitely come if you are exceptionally hungry - the portions are quite large! I appreciated that they had pictures to accompany most of the menu items so that you could get an idea of what you were ordering! They started us off with banchan -an assortment of 14 sides ranging from spicy cucumber slices to kimchi to fish cakes. I ordered the Soon Tofu Soup while my boyfriend got the Dolsut Bibim-Bap Rice. Both were giant steaming hot bowls of deliciousness. The staff was quick, friendly, and courteous and took great care of us. A pleasurable experience all around.

Overall there is a ton of different menu choices. If you're familiar with Korean food there's things like bibimbap all the way to kimchijigae, on top of the BBQ itself. I tend to come here for lunch instead and get the bbimbap, just because I frankly don't think it's the best BBQ in the city, but if you're in Aurora and have a few friends that want to go, the combo deals (serve 3-5 people depending on which on you get) are pretty good! Come with everything you'd possibly want.

After having had Korean food in San Francisco and in K-Town in Los Angeles our standards are pretty high. We're not snobby but we've had really good Korean BBQ so we know what to look for.

Seoul checks off almost all the important boxes so it's no wonder that it's a foodie favorite:

Thick, leatherbound menu with pages and pages of delicious options. Check.

More banchan than one can count with novelties like octopus, kimchi okra and potato jello. Check.

Buckwheat noodles, cold noodles and sweet potato noodle dishes. Check.

Soon Tofu. Check. (warning, the preparation was a little odd with a sour cabbage in the broth)

In-table grills with giant overhead exhausts so your clothes don't smell too too BBQ-ey. Check.

Large form Hite bottles for under $7. Check.

Bottle of water and barley tea during the meal and sweet rice tea at the conclusion. Check.

One of the best Korean BBQ joints I've ever gone too.  They serve up soooo many banchan varieties and they all tasted delicious--of course I had my favorites and you will too. The meats were flavorful and well marinated. Service was good too, attentive to table top cooking and made sure we had everything we needed throughout the meal.

Hungry? Come on out to Seoul BBQ and they can fix that.

Yes.  Everything comes with FOURTEEN (14) little side dishes of tasty bites including Kimchi and other marinated delectables. We remember: octopus bites, tasty mini salted fishes, cabbage, gelatin bites (eew), eggplant, cabbage, lettuce, raw garlic, jalepeno, macaroni salad, chives- so much goodness!

The main course we chose was the BULGOGI and GALBI, Korean dishes of thin beef slices and boneless short ribs marinated and grilled on a barbecue.  And you get to be the cook!   Fun times.

Me and the BF split a bottle of  Bokbunja, a blackberry wine native to Korea. The wine is the color of oxblood, and its sweet, berry flavor is reminiscent more of dessert wine and was sever with little shot glasses.  Nice!

Other reviewers have mentioned that it is slightly expensive due to the fact that they require each table to order two main courses at $25- $30 a pop.  There is enough food for four people, so try to come on a double date!

Nice find!

I don't know what else I can add that other Yelpers haven't already said. This is the place to go for Korean BBQ. At dinner, you can count on a pretty long wait, but it is worth it.

The meat always tastes fresh and is well-seasoned. I love the sizzle of the bulgogi when it hits the table-top grill. And while the meat is cooking, you can enjoy any of the dozen side dishes that come with your meal.

If you are in the mood for an amazing dining experience, look no further than Seoul BBQ.

Was in Denver for work and wanted something that was close to home cooked.  Place is super clean and staff are friendly, but the food is just okay, middle of the road at best.  It's a chain and coming from Chicago where there's a dense Korean population and TONS of Korean restaurants to choose from, I would say this is somewhere I would go if I was in dire need of Korean food and had no other choice.  It's serviceable, but nothing special.

Love this place!!  My whole family loves coming here, my kids love to help cook the meat.  The food is delicious and the sides arendifferent everytime, so I always get to try something new.  The service is always quick and polite.  Its clean inside and I like that the tables aren't so close you can hear the conversation next you, giving more of a private dining experience.  You can even have a private room for your party.  Its very expensive, but worth it!

This is a better choice for Korean BBQ in Colorado. I am from LA so my standards are high. The service is bad, it's hard to get the servers attention any time I've been here. They dump all the meat on the BBQ immediately. I can't eat it fast enough. I always have to ask them to stop. I like to take my time BBQing the meat and eating it straight off the BBQ. The experience  feels abrasive and rushed. It is a pricey experience so I wish it was more enjoyable.

SUCH A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!
Got the a combo w spicy pork galbi and something else... And dokbokki. We got so much food and there was so many different things to try. It's clear that they really put a lot of effort into presenting an authentic, high quality experience. I've looked at some past reviews about poor service and poor quality, and don't really agree. I've been to other kbbq places and though the service was pretty good. Our service lady greeted us and explained how the combo works and smiled and joked. The meat quality was very good. I don't think you can compare it to American standards because the end product is not supposed to be an 8 oz New York strip. I've been to many korean restaurants and have noticed that Korean BBq is usually meat that is slim, tender, and slightly fatty, and is accentuated by the Korean marinade. The food they served was on par with the restaurants I've visited in Los Angeles and I will definitely be back.

Excellent Korean bbq with all the fixins! My first time here and it as for Father's Day lunch with my son. We had the pork and the 14 included side dishes with soon tofu stew with beef. It wasn't very spicy and I assume they did that due to our skin color (the soup spicy-ness on the menu said "hot, mild, or white" which made me laugh). Will come back with more people as its a family style feast. Thanks for the great dining experience.

My friend and I came here after a day of toiling away on our computers (you know, exercising our brains). I had bookmarked this place long ago, but since it's SO. FAR. AWAY., I needed a good nudge to get here.

We arrived around 530/545pm and the place was already pretty full... and mostly of Asian folks. GOOD SIGN. Since it was my friend's first time eating Korean food, she had me take the reins. I ordered us a seafood pajeon (savory pancake) as an appetizer, dolsot bibimbap (beef), and seafood soondubu jigae. Yes, yes, too much food. About 5 minutes after we ordered, a cart rolled up to our table with all our ban chan. FOURTEEN of them. I can not even begin to tell you how good they all were...but my friend thought I had ordered us another appetizer. She was blown away that the ban chan were complimentary.

Then the pancake came out. And her eyes rolled to the back of her head. The bibimbap and soondubu jigae were complex, flavorful, and perfect. I see what I've been missing out by not crossing to the other side of town for my fix of Korean food. 

$35 feeds four. Or, two people for two days. We were both very full, and had plenty of leftovers for each of us.

Hands down best Korean BBQ in Denver!! I love this place! Great korean food with a bountiful amount of unlimited side dishes. I may be converted because side dishes at other korean bbq places are not as good as Seoul! 

We always order the Combination meals when I come eat with family. Plenty of food and I'm always stuffed when trying to leave. 

Lunch is even cheaper! And you still get the delicious unlimited side dishes. This is a must try place for anyone coming to Denver!

Yup after today's lunch I'm done! But to be honest, I don't know who's at fault. Today I ordered kimchi jigae and their always been CHEAP with their meats! The amount of daegi Gogi (Pork Meat) in my bowl is comparable to 2 chicken McNuggets. So when I finished the I went to the front and the hostess/maybe manager? Told me it cost $12.93!  I paid that price and brought up I ordered off lunch menu. So when I was wheeling away she tried rogue me my money back I told her keep it as a tip because I'm never coming back!

My husband and I were craving Korean food so we decided to dine here since the reviews were good and the reviews were right it didn't disappoint. The food was good, our server is great she always checks on us and the place is clean. Definitely a good Korean restaurant.

This is my favorite place to get Korean bbq in Colorado.  Not only is the food delicious, but the place is elegantly decorated and staff are really friendly.  They offer three types of seating areas.  They have private rooms for large parties, the general dining area, and a semi-private back sushi dining area.  I come here so often that I ate in all three areas.  

I love variety in my food so I love that every order, even the sushi orders, comes with the Korean side dishes.  I never finish any of the side dishes because there are so many, but if you do you can always ask for more.  When I come here with my friends we always do our own cooking because it is quite entertaining to cook your own food at a restaurant.  However, if I come here with my boyfriend we always have the kitchen cook it because we are a lazy couple.  We also always order the seafood soon-tofu soup and the daeji bulgogi.  Once I have ordered sushi and surprisingly it was pretty good for a Korean restaurant.  I also really like the sweet drink they bring out after each meal; it's my dessert.

Food is ok, but the service is very annoying!  We were sitting on the second floor. We ordered kimchi toufu stew, which is like a hot pot instead of regular one. However, the waiter served us the regular one. I told him that was not my order. The waiter is unpleasant and inpatient, he said I was wrong, and said " Please don't do this!" very seriously. This particular sentence really pissed me off! That attitude sounded like I was trying to trick him for a free soup or something! Come on man! The stew I ordered was more expensive than the one he first served us. Ridiculous and rude! Funny thing is I also had bad experience in another Seoul Bbq in Thornton. Really need to pay more attention to their service.
Definitely not my favorite. The bulgogi was delicious but the sides were not appetizing. Personally, unless you're a fan of cold, odd side dishes and overly priced meat I wouldn't dine here.

First time at a Korean BBQ restaurant and very much enjoyed the experience. We ordered several types of meat we cooked ourselves at the table. 14 different sides came with the meal; everything I tried I enjoyed. Wait staff was prompt with the food and our water glasses never got below half. Not sure if it is the best around but just would go back.

I go here often because they have ~13 small side dishes that you can ask for refill if you want to eat more. The price of meat itself can be expensive, but I did enjoy a lot with my boyfriend when we were dating long back. I usually order soup. They have various soups you can try. I did not like yuk gae jang but loved gom tang, gam ja tang, and kong busy (I do not know exact spelling of each). They are a little bit sweeter than actual korean food, but they provide good amount of food and meat inside. So far, this has been the best korean restaurant in colorado for me.

I was craving for Korean food.  Picked this place because of the 4 star rating and many reviews shown.  I wasn't disappointed.  There were 15 side dishes.  I just love side dishes.  For dinner I ordered Saba.  It was grilled to perfection.

The food her is probably one of the better korean bbq resrurants. They have a decent select of meats to choose from for the grill and a variety of traditional dishes. They do pile on the side dishes for the main entrée which most of the local restaurants do not have.
 The service however, is a hit or miss. Do check if they have a wait list on the weekends or holidays though. Sometimes they don't even have space. Also not to be confused with then second store up north which has all you can eat.

I've been here twice and tried the Korean BBQ both times. I have yet to try their sushi options. 

I got spicy pork & bulgogi when I came. Each meat order comes with 12 side dishes that include things like kim chi, savory jello, pickled cucumber, macaroni salad & tofu. The meat costs around $20-$35 depending on the type that you get. Servers come and put the meat on for you & then change out the center cooking grill when you're ready to put on the other meats. 

Some people might find the concept of cooking your own meat to be foreign & unconventional because you might be thinking "I came to a restaurant so I DON'T have to cook." But think of it this way: you get super freshly cooked food & a fun experience where you can control the well-doneness of your own meat! I personally love cooking on the grill in the center. 

Reason why I am giving this place a 3 stars is because of the quality of their meat. I found the meat, both times I came here, to be (not for all cuts but for 1/2 of the ones I ordered) fatty or chewy. The quality was subpar to Korean BBQ places I've been to in the bay area & was slightly more expensive too.

In terms of ambience, this place is very clean, open and great for parties. They have private rooms and tables without the grill if you plan on ordering sushi or other dishes that don't need BBQing.

This place seems average however the service team need more people.  They had only a few people running around like crazy trying to serve everyone.  The food here is average and didn't seem like it was over the top nor is bad.  The table seems small compared to all the food we ordered.  We had about 6 people and we had an 8 person table and still not enough room to put all the food.  There was so many small plates of food plus all the other dishes we ordered.  If you have a group of friends that likes to eat and want to leave stuffed like a turkey, get a bigger table.
Great place, very fast.  First time eating Korean bbq, and it didnt disappoint at all.  Be back for sute

Right off the start, this place is a little pricey, that's the down side.  But I love the Korean dishes they bring out as part of the meal, having the little fishes is key to any Korean food.  We ordered the regular Bulgogi and it was pretty good, also had the seafood pancake (Haemul Pajeon) with sauce also good, and my wife's favorite Tteokbokki, which is super spicy and I don't particularly like, but she said it was good also.  It was nice to find a good Korean food place in Denver, since there aren't many on the west side of town and having to drive to Aurora is a about 30-45 mins, but overall 3.5 stars since it's kind of overpriced for what you get.

Disclaimer: I am not Korean and to your reading disappointment, I actually didn't try their BBQ, but from what I had and from prior experiences, this place makes the mark.

Open space and clean: Check
Good banchan: 14 of them! Check
Friendly service: Check
Quick service: Check

Highlights: 
- I really enjoyed their Haemul pa-jeon (or otherwise seafood pancake). I've had others in the past and I felt like this one had so many ingredients! Great mix of vegetables with seafood. Many times, they can be dominated by the batter, but this definitely felt more ingredient heavy, which is awesome. 
- The gamja jungol was great as well. It says for two, but really you can probably serve 3 WITH leftovers. A little on the spicy side, but that is kind of what you expect with Korean food!
- 14 banchan! Enough said.

Oh and they also serve iced sikhye, which was so good I was tempted to ask for more. Next time =)

The food was good although we were unsure of what to order. If you're not familiar with Korean food I would suggest doing some research or ask your server for suggestions. There was one dish that our neighbors ordered that smelled soooo good. 
Definitely want to come back and try the bbq at the table. We didnt  since it was just 2 of us and we felt that it was way too much food to order 2 bbq enters (have to order minimum of 2). 
We ended up getting a tofu soup in a clay pot and braised ribs, also in a soup, as well as 2 appertizers. Our food was good, but not worth the $70 we spent, I will be coming back with more questions and research next time.

First off Seoul BBQ 2 is a little different from Seoul BBQ 1. This place does not have the unlimited BBQ option.

We had the combo A bbq option and the food was really good. They had a very good variety of different banchans (side dishes) and a lot of appetizer type meal. 
The price was high (it suggests that it was for 3 people) and honestly I personally did not think it was worth the price but it was still pretty dang delicious. :)

As for service...it was ok. When the waiter first came to our table he was looking away as he was talking to us and we had to get his attention even while he was right there in front of us at our table, which is a bit rude. He didn't seem too friendly and he left before we were even done eating. We were handed off to someone else. Although the last person to take care of us didn't really serve us and only handed us our bill and dessert, I'd have preferred her as our server because she was very sweet, friendly and attentive. :)

This place is awesome. It appears to be super traditional. I'm not Korean so I don't know for sure but it was great. All the sides that come with it are amazing. Go there with some friends and get the combos. They are great and it's very fun and interactive.

I thought of you ordered BBQ to be cooked at your table, it would be full service?  At least that's what I have experienced at other Korean places.  No worries though, Chef Nyla took over and the galbi was just as good.  Seoul BBQ also provided Seoul many sides!  Other place I've gone to give maybe 7 or so sides, but we got 14!  Since they didn't give us any sukjul namul, we asked for it and we received.

At the end of our meal the owner, I think, came by and asked us how the food was.  He also suggested and brought us a pickled square side... Can't remember what it was called, but he was very friendly and said if that the sides that are brought out are supposed to compliment what we order and if we wanted anything extra to just ask.

They also gave us this sweet rice slushy drink as dessert.  I've never had it before but  perfect after the big dinner we just had.

I don't go to Aurora often...but when I do...I will be eating at Seoul BBQ every time.  What a fantastic find for lunch!  I had the Bulgogi, came with all the little sides, generous portion and absolutely delicious.  Service was very fast and attentive as well.  For the price of their lunch specials, this place simply can't be beat!  Thumbs up

We got the korean short ribs! It was incredibly delicious and tasty! I loved it! But it was over priced. We orderd 2 short ribs ( the quantity and weight of meat wasn't very much on each plate) and we had a 63$ bill! Everything was very neat and decent but it was not a classy restaurant at all! You can spend less money in another  restaurant like Surena, which is very classy and the portion is fair! Another thing was their staff! Servers were so nice and polite but they were kinda weird! They couldn't speak English. They weren't professional at all! They need to be trained.

4.5 stars

my family of 4 came here and ordered the 3-person combo meal (came out to ~$29/person). this included a bunch of banchan, a green onion pancake, a california roll (which turned out to be a spicy tuna roll instead), a steamed egg dish, a seafood/tofu soup dish, and a sake/beer/wine, in addition to galbi + a choice of 2 other meats. we got the bulgogi and this other non-marinated meat. out of the meats, the galbi was awesome (and i usually don't even like it that much), the bulgogi (usually my favorite thing and my standard for rating korean places) was average to slightly below average, and i wasn't a fan of the other meat. overall, it was a crazy amount of food and we went home with leftovers. even though they say this is for 3 people, it could feed 5-6 hungry people, especially if you actually eat the banchan! the meal also ended with a chilled sweet rice drink-- a nice finishing touch to balance out all that meat! prices are on the high side, but given that the food was pretty good quality overall, i'd be back!

Negative--First of all, the waitress did not help my friends and me when we asked her about the most popular item on the menu and what ingredients are in the food. She was the worst waitress I have ever had contact with because she ignored us the whole time and I had to constantly get her attention by waving my hand on the air. Poor consumer service. 

Positive---food was delicious. 

Overall---- disappointed with the staff and mediocre experience

It's a Wednesday. I decided to go out to a local treat which I've herd is great for lunch... Seoul BBQ. 

After exiting my car I immediately notice how wonderful it looks from the outside. They have hanging flower pots that are obviously well maintained. The flowers are bright pink and they are evenly spaced. The overall outside appearance makes the place very inviting. 

After entering the smells have already began to make my stomach growl and, even though no one is at the front, I am quickly greeted by a host that tells me there's a five minute wait ( this is lunch let's remember). Well, after just a minute or two my table is ready and I am served water immediately. I begin to look at the lunch menu and realize how much I love the prices. Specifically, I enjoy them because of what I've herd about the multiple side dishes. My mouth is now watering and I can't contain myself! I really do want to order everything haha. 

My order was taken quickly- I decide to keep it simple and order some Bibim-bap and some Korean short ribs for an additional $6. The short ribs are limited to one order per person during lunch which raised my curiosity.

Well, the short ribs were incredible. I finished them off before I got back to my review . The rest of the meal taste great as well and the service hasn't suffered yet. The bibimbap car with the egg on top cooked perfectly. After breaking it and mixing the bowl the ingredients stick together perfectly nice big bites. The red pepper past they gave on the side is a nice touch as well as the onion beef broth. 

The only thing I'd say is a little more meat wouldn't hurt... More meat never hurts though . 

Overall a great experience.

Food is inconsistent. Service is bad sometimes. Too bad there isn't a better place to get K food. Hopefully, another restaurant opens up and gives them a run for their money. This place is becoming complacent...
I've never had Korean BBQ before and I really like this place! I'm happy my friends brought me here. Very good!

I brought a large group of people to Seoul BBQ for a meet up event and they seated us in our own private room with two tables featuring BBQs. A couple people in the party (including myself) ordered the bulgogi to grill on the table and it was tons of fun! The BBQ entrees come with 14 assorted sides and I tried every single one of them. From the taro, to the fried sweet potatoes, to the cucumber, to the salad, everything was super delicious!

This was my first time going to Korean BBQ, so I don't have much to compare the experience to, but the staff was polite, the food was fresh, and delicious. I'll definitely be back!

At 6:25pm on a Saturday night, I died and went to ban chan heaven. 14 side dishes from fermented to fried. Bliss. My personal faves are the cucumber chili salad and the straight up cabbage kimchi but you can re-up on any sides you like free of charge. 

I don't know what we were thinking but what we were FEELING was mighty hungry so we ordered the combo for three. The two of us can rarely finish a normal meal between us so rest assured we took A LOT of stuff home (leftover dinner party tonight!!). This combo could easily feed four people. At least we got to sample a gamut of meals. 

Out of the ribs, the pork belly, and the beef bulgogi, the bulgogi was my favorite. So tender, marinated with sweet-sour-savory sauce. I also really liked the egg pancake. 

The tofu stew was good but not the best - nice and spicy but not as deep and meaty of a broth as I like. 

A head's up if your pocket is fairly shallow like mine - they require a minimum of two bbq orders per table - the minimum price for a bbq order is $19.99 so if there are two of you and you're not big eaters, you will end up getting way more food than you need and spending quite a bit. In the future, I'll make sure to go with at least two other people. Otherwise, I might come back here and just get a plate that doesn't require the table grill. 

Service was remarkably good considering there seemed to be ONE server assigned to at least 12 tables. He was very efficient with a phenomenal memory and a kind demeanor. They do get slammed on Saturday nights - we lucked out but everyone right after us had to wait 30-40 minutes.

As fun as this place would be for a 'date night,' the price point and portions are better to be shared amongst a group. I have left-overs for the next three days but hey, I'm not complaining!

Great idea and pretty good execution. You basically walk through buffet style and select which meats you would like to grill at your table. The prices are listed on each individualized package of meat. Some of it is fairly pricey, but everything we got was good quality. The sushi was the only item there that I thought was over priced for what it was. 

My only complaints are that if you order a soup from the menu it takes a long time. The other complaint is that you have to purchase rice separately. Most Korean restaurants offer this with your meal.
Great stuff! This place is a good intro to Korean food for families and groups. You'll need to order food to cook on the table grill if you want the full experience.  It's all good my friends!

I've been to Seoul a couple of times now, first in a large group, and then with my Korean girlfriend. Both times it was absolutely amazing. Very friendly service and an incredibly authentic experience await. It's maybe the best KBBQ I've been to, and while it falls a little on the pricey side, the experience is entirely worth it. I would recommend it to anyone, whether you are familiar with Korean food, or looking for a new experience.

Dear Seoul BBQ, I've been dinning at your restaurant for over ten years. I am very happy with the main lunch items you serve. You are the best lunch for the price of any other restaurant. Wish I could thank every employee personally  at the restaurant. Seoul BBQ is my favorite lunch spot. Thank you foe having such a great place to eat.

The service was great & the food was as well with lots of flavor but not super salty like some Korean bbq places can be.  The spicy pork was our favorite. Good sized portions also & good sides.  We recommend this restaurant.
It was really cool seeing people cooking at the tables, intense style BBQ

This place is great! I'm just visiting and saw the good reviews on here so I gave it a try! I love korean BBQ they have so much sides here and they all taste so good! 

The services here are great too! Our server was super nice she kept our waters filled! Good price good portion! Loved it!

Ok, I'm embarrassed that I haven't reviewed this restaurant yet. We drive 6 hours each way from Telluride for semi-annual appointments at the nearby Medical Center and have never failed to make time for an amazing lunch before heading home. This restaurant is extremely authentic with the best Bulgogi and all of the sides; not found in many Korean restaurants any more!
Try the fried dumplings....also freshly made and a meal in an of itself. 
I'm working my way through the hot soups and all have been great! 
The sushi used to be a lot better but, on the bright side, now I have no excuse not to focus on just the Korean food.
Just a recommendation....you can ask for the dinner size meal even during lunch. They moved to a more limited lunch menu which concerns me a bit; but the place is always packed so I won't read too much into that.
Enjoy!

I came to Seoul BBQ with my significant other on a relatively quiet Saturday night. Immediately when we were sat down we had to wait for our waiter to even come and great us. We order our food and it can out relatively quickly and started cooking it at our table. When I took my first bite of my food I quickly realized there was a piece of metal in my food. We stopped eating and tried to let the waiter know what had happened but couldn't flag him down. Finally after he stopped by we told him what happened and he acted like is was nothing and told us to keep cooking the food and left. While I will say the food was good I am going to be real honest in saying the service was terrible and that finding a piece of metal in food should result in some sort of action to resolve that problem and not act like it is nothing. I will never come here again nor will I recommend it to anyone.

I can't believe I didn't come in sooner! The BBQ is a wonderful way to get to know Korean cuisine. My two teens and I ordered the minimum order of two meats so that we could test our skills with the grill embedded in the table. Very soon a plate heaping with meat (in our case non marinated beef and pork) arrived and the fun began.
Since we had prepared beforehand by watching a few YouTube videos on how to eat Korean BBQ (which I highly recommend if you've never eaten at a place like this before), we pretty much knew what to do with the 14 saucers of condiments and tasty sauces. We asked for a refill on a few things which the waiter brought in a snap. We spent about $65 on a meal that would have served five--we took home a large box of meat and rice.
As for the quality of the food, the cuts of meat were awesome and the sides were fresh, authentic and flavorful (I've worked in restaurant management so I can spot good food.) I salted my own meat as it was grilling. The staff were friendly and attentive.
The only drawback for me was the environment which could have used some polishing and TLC. Overall it was clean and neat, but the condiment jars on the table were greasy and the waiting area was under par. I won't be too critical though, since we were there at a high volume time and splatter from grilling meat is unavoidable. We'll be back in the future.

Here comes the roller coaster review... Initially I was going to give 4 stars because the food is terrific. Then I was going to drop them to 3 stars because the service is really not that great. While they kept bringing everything we asked for, they barely helped us with the menu or asked if we needed anything without us calling them over. Then I was won over by the lady at the front desk (maybe manager or owner) when she informed me that tip was added to our tab because we had more than 8 people and handed me back the check to correct it because I had left an additional 20% on a $200 check. She didn't have to do that, but because she did I will be back!

I would give it 5 stars but I can't because of the price.  I know I can't really say anything bad on this place being from the Springs.  I can tell you why it's the best to me.  I love Korean food and been to Korea a few times, ( 10 times but who's counting) I love a spot where it has the grill and I can cook my own food.  They had plenty of side dishes and if you wanted more they gladly put out another one.  They had soju and Korea beer.  They had Hite, not OB so one is better than none.  I know I'm not in Korea anymore so I don't expect to find any 6000 won Korean BBQ but man it's a had pill to swallow.  The place was spacious and it had private rooms also.  The service was typical and I can't complain.  I know of places in the Springs that are pretty good but this place makes you feel like your in a Korean BBQ in Korea minus the k-pop blasting or the 98% Korean eating!

We were in the Denver area for a weekend business trip and craved Korean food. We chose this based on reviews. We arrived at 6pm on a Saturday night and waited for 45 minutes for a table for two. 

We enjoyed the complimentary barley tea and 14 small servings of appetizers. 

At first, we ordered the shabu-shabu but because they require a minumum of two orders of shabu-shabu and a bigger table which wasn't available, we ordered beef bulgogi and galbi jim instead. 

They serve the bulgogi with a side of lettuce leaves, spring onions, fresh garlic, jalapeño and bean paste so you can create a lettuce wrap. The galbi jim was okay, too. Both were served with a cup of steamed white rice. Steamed brown rice is available for an additional $2. The complimentary cold dessert rice tea was good.

It was a pleasant dinner experience. Now we know why there was a long queue for a table.

Really wasn't sure what to rate this place. They were very clean, but the service was awful. Food was good, but small portions for the price. They do bring lots of sides, but act as if you are inconveniencing them if you ask for refills. (Who in a Korean restaurant brings a table of five a small ramekin of kimchee and expects that to last?) AND even though the flavors may be "authentic Korean" the dining experience sure wasn't. We expected to all be sharing the entrees and sides with our own portions of rice. $30 for kalbi had us assuming it was a good amount. Not two ribs. And just one bowl of rice per entrée unless you wanted to pay $1 for $.10 worth of rice.

Our waiter was ambivalent at best, his Korean was poor and so was his English. 

Overall, I don't think I will be going back to dine in. I am capable of making my own korean BBQ that is tastier, cheaper, and friendlier. However, if you aren't able to do this, I guess this restaurant is a viable option for you. 

Oh, and since some of the reviewers are mentioning it, yes, I am Korean.

Yelpers, you didn't let me down!  
Visiting Englewood & looking for a good Korean restaurant. I tried couple of other places but I wasn't impress with the food. 
Me & my friend tried for a lunch here but it was 10-15 mins waiting.  We tried a Chinese next door and it was just okay. 
I have been craving for Sam-Gae-Tang (corn chicken or a small chicken stuffed with sweet rice, ginseng, chestnut & dates).  It was little after 3pm & it was still busy. 
Their banchan was really good especially Kimchi. Not just 4-5 but many. 
Honestly I was little surprised by how good their banchan was.
Sam-Gae-Tang... I would say it was average. 
At the end, I was very satisfied with whole experience & I thought they are good as Korean restaurants in Dallas, TX (Dal-dong Nae in Dallas, TX is still far best in my mind)
I saw many private rooms & I thought it will be nice to have meetings or gatherings there. 
As soon as I came to work, I was telling everybody about this location & trying to convince to have our dinner meeting at Seoul BBQ. 
One down part... I thought BBQ price is little too high for me. I saw the menu & for 2 people, it was about $90.  So if group of 7-10, it will get pretty expensive.

I will definitely come back & try different dish. Maybe this weekend!!  :P 
For those who seeking for a great Korean restaurant, this is where you will be happy with food & the service.

My boyfriend and I decided to come here to grab a late dinner. It was already 8:30pm and not many places were still opened but this place was still bustling when we entered. There were 3 parties before us and we even had to wait for about 20 minutes, that's how busy they were. Seoul BBQ is definitely my go to place for Korean food in the Aurora area. The waiting room is spacious and has seating for us while we waited. The entire restaurant smelled so good when we walked in as well. Beware, your clothes will probably smell afterwards so be prepared to wash it. Even if you don't choose to eat the kbbq, the smell will still get all up in your space. 

We were seated on a big table which I appreciated because I hate it when restaurants seat two people on a tiny table, where do they expect us to put all the food?! There's a grill in the middle of the table but we didn't use it as we didn't order bbq. The service is very fast as they took our order within 5 minutes of sitting down and then the side dishes (banchan) came shortly after. I personally think the side dishes are the best part of this place because they give you a whooping 14 side dishes! And it's not a lame 14 different flavors of kimchi, it's a great variety and I can honestly say I was full from the side dishes. They are even refillable which I think is amazing. Even compared to the many korean restaurants I've eaten in California, those side dishes pale in comparison to these. My personal favorite side dishes include this pickled cucumber which was absolutely delicious with my bibimbap and the spicy taste complemented so well with my rice. I also really liked the glazed sweet potato, seafood pancake, egg roll, potato salad, kimchi, and fish. Also they automatically give you this delicious hot tea which is perfect for a cold night out. 

For the entree, my bf got the soon tofu which is his favorite and it makes him very full. I usually get that as well but today I wanted to eat the bibimbap. It's a dish with rice in a HOT stone pot topped with fried egg, meat, and veggies. You mix it all up with hot sauce and it's so good and so filling. I only ate about half and even had another meal leftover. It's pretty cheap for the amount of food you get. AND on top of all this, you even get a dessert sweet drink which I don't really like but my bf loves it so he gets double. I definitely come here on a regular basis and bring my relatives and friends who visit and they all like it.

The food is not too bad,but the service there is very bad.I never saw a restaurant like that..Just give you the food,then never come back ask you is anything ok?Do you need anything Until you get the check!i

I like this place a lot and come here often, I think the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the service can be hit or miss. (Sometimes the wait staff are really friendly and attentive and at other times they don't seem to care and you have to wait forever for food or utensils to arrive).

I think the food here is pretty good. The Korean BBQ is decent, and they also have a really great selection of sushi and bibmbap rice bowls that I really like. My favorite thing on the menu were the pickled crabs, but sadly they only had them once and have never had them again since. I also love their large and tasty selection of Korean appetizers.
The spicy bulgogi was delicious! Can't wait to come back with more people for the BBQ combos.

This place is legit. I'm a big fan of Korean BBQ and have had the privilege of having some of the best Korean BBQ in Southern California and Koreatown. This place can definitely rival the best I've had. 

They serve 14 delicious side dishes which doesn't fill you up which is good because the moment you try their Galbi, then you're in for a treat. 

This place is definitely high up on my list of Korean BBQ place and I will definitely comeback again!
The concept of grilling on the table with 14 sides is great; however, I agree with all the bad reviews!! Customer service is the worst here!  Anyone know of another Korean BBQ place nearby??

Not to shabby! When you first drive up you're like I don't know, but when you walk in you're like damb!! Clean elegant and fun. Oh and don't forget the food pretty darn tasty if you ask me. Just have an open mind hahaha.

Wow, I can't believe I haven't wrote a review for this place yet - I always come here when I come to Denver! I Well, here I go: When we got there, (five-is) there weren't as many people there. Usually it's SUPER full. We were seated immediately and we ordered right away cause we knew what we wanted. We got the gamjatang and bulgogi soup. (Can't remember the exact name) The side dishes were amazing too. The employee was really nice when we asked for refills. The gamjatang was only 10.99 and it had SO MUCH meat and flavor. It was hot, had a ton of veggies and meat, and was a HUGE amount. I will definitely be ordering that again. The bulgogi soup had a lot of oil floating around but it was very delicious. The meat was really flavorful and soft. Amazing place as usual!

Holy side dishes. I have never been to a place with so many side dishes! It was very neat to see that, but I personally prefer a smaller setting. The side dishes as a whole was ok. Some dishes were better than others, but I enjoyed them overall. I ordered maewoontang, a spicy fish stew, and it was so good that I ate the whole bowl, and that bowl is enough for two people. The only thing I was disappointed with was the grilled meats. All of it was good, but it might be because the meat in KC was exceptional, but something was lacking. I mean I would still order the meat again, but it definitely wasn't the best I've ever had. I highly recommend this place because I can't wait to go back to try more of their soups

.
 ,  ,   . 
You can tell the authenticity of a korean restaurant from the quality of the side dishes. If you can happily polish off a bowl of rice from just the complementary food, you know you're in the right place. 

This rings true for this place; I hadn't expected to find a good korean restaurant in Denver, CO. We ordered ddukguk (rice cake soup), aalbap (fish roe rice), galbi jumuluk (marinated beef). All stellar. One note is that the aalbap does NOT come in a hot plate.

I went here not knowing anything about Korean BBQ, except that my wife had told me we'd be cooking our own meat on the table.  Sounded good to me, and I figured that the waitress could probably offer some guidance to a complete newcomer.

Not so much... we were thrown to the wolves and when we asked for suggestions she just pointed at the menu.  But winging it didn't turn out to be bad at all.  This is a good place for groups, if you want to to grill your own meat then there's a minimum order of two entrees, and that comes out to a lot of food (especially because the BBQ meats come with a table full of different side dishes which would be a satisfying meal unto themselves).

Great food, and a great place to bring a group of friends.  I'm looking forward to going back.

It is nice to have a korean BBQ close to me, but I miss the all you can eat ones from California.  That said the food is very good and the kimche is excellent and plenty of variety.  My only complaint is the price.  It is just too expensive for BBQ.

I have been with a group of four and fourteen and both were easy to accommodate, so I would highly recommend it for large parties, although be prepared for someone to work, it is a lot to cook for a large group.

Loved the food and they were fast!  Best Bibimbap ever. Service was a little crazy but nothing I can't handle.  Lunch prices were very reasonable. Overall I would recommend this place,  especially if you would like a traditional experience.
I loved my bibimbap and sushi..hope to come back :) everything was so awesome.. The whole ambience.perfect place for Korean food.

now hear me out, My first time I went was 2 years ago. The pork order was very little. had only 2 strips. For the price? it was a rip off. I went there again in January with my boyfriend. We both order something different. LOTS of food left. which is equally with the price. Also, the quality was great. Service was hit and miss as they were getting busy before Friday night rush. The server forgot about us quite sometime. Side dishes were amazing and for some might think overwhelmed.

This place was great for our large family dinner. We were in one of the private dining rooms and the service was great! Sometimes you can get stuck in a room and they almost forget about you but not here! It was a very unique experience and I would definitely like to go again. It was a bit expensive but well with it in my opinion. We all got a variety of drinks and were able to sit and eat, drink, and talk for several hours without feeling rushed out. We also had littles with us and it was just fine with them there. It seemed quite kid friendly.

Seoul BBQ comes to my rescue when I crave for Korean food. I used to get all the great authentic Korean BBQ in California and Seoul BBQ is just as good as the ones in California . Food is delicious  and the staff is really friendly.  They give you plenty of side dishes. My favorite dish is Spicy Beef Soup and Soon Tofu but everything they make here is delish.

Seoul BBQ is awesome! I've been meaning to come in for awhile now, and was ecstatic to have the stars finally align.  On top of it being our first time, the hubs and I brought some friends along for the experience as well.  Mind you, the last time I had Korean BBQ was over 10 years ago in China, so all of us are very new to Korean cuisine.  

I was hoping to get a lot more information about what to do and what the dishes (especially the 14 sides that comes with a bbq order) are.  Our server was very nice and polite.  She gave us a few recommendations, but we were pretty much making it up as we went along.  We ordered the Daeji Bulgogi and Bulgogi to barbecue.  Both meats were excellent. We also ordered a few sushi rolls. The fish was fresh, and the rolls were delicious.  

In case you are new to this as well, we were told that one order of bbq was a single serving.  I think that it can easily be shared.  Keep that in mind if you're going with people, order fewer items than friends. 

The restaurant was clean, food was great, and wile I can respect they didn't want to insult my intelligence, it would have been helpful to have a bit more guidance.  That said, we will be back for sure and see if we can do a better job the second time around.

Food was great but the service wasn't good. They were very forgetful and got orders wrong. The customer service was quite rude as well. They did not help us when we needed and walked away when we asked. There was no one asking if we needed refills with water or how the food was. Past visits to here were amazing but the last visit has made me very disappointed in the service that they had offered. Would definitely come again, but hopefully with different waitresses.

We stumbled upon this gem after buying some appliances for our home at a nearby hardware store. We were hungry and in an unfamiliar part of town and we found this place on Yelp and gave it a try.

The food was fantastic, authentic feeling, and the experience was unbeatable! I've never had Korean BBQ before, but this was excellent! It's a bit confusing at first if you don't know how it all works, but the payoff is well worth it! We had the chicken bulgogi with extra spice and it was delicious - cooked right in front of you at the table. Not hibachi; much more intimate.

My go-to place to get Korean BBQ in the Denver area! Never had a bad experience at this restaurant whether if it was for lunch or dinner. Great service. The staff are very responsive and nice. They're always willing to bring us more side dishes and are very accommodating to large groups (private rooms available for reservation).
I've also tried the A la carte menu and the stews and cold noodles are delicious! 
The Westminster location is just as good as the Aurora one! Except, I don't think there are private rooms for larger parties at the Westminster one.

I remember reading "14 Sides" and thinking it must be a typo or maybe they mean you have a selection of 14 sides from which you pick maybe 3 like a normal human being. 

Nope. You get all of it.

I had no idea what 90% of the items were. But I tried them anyway. Learned a painful lesson as a kid.. I avoided sweet potatoes because I didn't think orange potatoes made sense so I didn't accept it. Fast forward ten years.. I eat them all the time. 

It might look weird but it might taste amazing. 

I'm okay with all of the sides they provide except for one.. The squid. It doesn't really taste like anything but the texture makes me want to barf. Eating tentacles is not for me. 

For my entree I ordered the Dolsut Bibimbap. First time experience, and I fell in love. Perfect amount of veggies and the fried egg really complimented everything. I'll be looking for something like this again.

It was very disappointing. We wanted to cook our meat at the table and our server came out with our meat already cooked. There were a few other mistakes that were made. It was just one big mess. Our table was ignored for most of the night. Not worth the price at all.

SATURDAY May 11th 2013.

Time : 15:00hrs

Had a reservation to celebrate one of my friend's Birthday that evening.  Thankfully we managed to get 2 private rooms to accommodate 10 of us at a short notice, coz initially we wanted to have this celebration at another Korean establishment.

We were given the 2 rooms on the left wing of this establishment nearest to the Kitchen and the aisle to the washroom.  This time around, we opt to have everyone cooking.  It was indeed fun as usual.  We opt to have all cuts of BEEF, that evening.  The service was indeed prompt and efficient, and depends on who you get to assist you what nots...

There is the Gyeran jjim in a ttukbaegi (small earthen pot), aka the Korean Steamed Egg Cassarole for each table to share.  There is the Pajeon for each table to share too.  The BEEF Cuts or Beef Meat, with Kabli are over-following and NOT FORGETTING the Banchan that I wish I could have more and more in which, we did get MORE & MORE, coz my friends like it alot too.  From the Spicy Mini Shrimp heads, Japchae, Oi sobagi, Sigeumchi namul, Various kind of Kimchi offerings to name a few.

Since we are so engrossed to cook and have all the food, I did not managed to get all the food cooking pictures.  *My Bad* 

We even brought a store-bought BIRTHDAY cake for our friend, and SEOUL Korean BBQ, allow us to "refrigerate" the cake till we need by end of the Dinner.  With all the Good Food, Good Service and AWESOME Company, each person paid like $22 with tips and tax.  This include like several Bottle of Soju for the rest of my friends who drank, and also have Soda Pop, Tea and Coffee as part of their beverages too.  My tummy belly was happy indeed!  *Insert Silently Polite Burp*

Left the establishment about 17:40hrs ish, coz I have some event to attend while my other friends left at 18:10hrs ish.

@107/2013

Food is always good here. Love their sides, especially the sweet potatoes! Lunch prices are reasonable but dinner prices are quite expensive. Service isn't the best, but I go for the food. If you don't have a lot of money but like to eat, try lunch first. I do recommend this place.

I have to say Village Inn is just ok... But we had an amazing waitress and who ever made the food it was actually really good the portions were really good as well our waitress is so nice she even brought us a drink to go

Make sure you dishes are clean and your waiter/ waitress has went to the restroom before she takes your order. The first thing was a dirty glass of water and then a dirty spoon in my milkshake don't eat here ugh I took a picture I'll post it

#VillageInn #VI 550am on a Tuesday. Stood at the front to be seated for many minutes. There were three other people in the dining room. Once I was seated the service was good. I drank a pot of coffee. Yes a whole pot. 

My standard: biscuits and gravy breakfast. Something is wrong when the biscuit is so hard it is difficult to cut with a fork. So so wrong. 

I haven't had much luck with VI. Maybe it's a sign to move on?

Village inn is always a place you can rely on for the same food, same prices, and same service no matter which on you go to. I love that they always give you a pot of coffee and always let you alter items on the menu for specific needs. They are kind to kids and their kids menu is extensive. A great choice for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or late night!

Village Inn is the best, especially when you've just spent the past two days moving all your stuff and pets across town and you need a big, hearty breakfast to start your day of unpacking and settling in.

Sooooo my friend got a cheesecake from this location for an Easter party and when he opened he noticed that there were THREE slices MISSING! When he called to speak with the manager about fixing this issue, the manager was rude and not willing to make any compromise. If your employee made this mistake then you should be willing to make your customer happy. Definitely two  down!

Food is great. Service not so much. I ordered toast to go along with my breakfast/dinner. When the meal was brought out there was no toast so when I questioned about it the waiter he told me he would bring it right out. THIRTY MINUTES later and still no toast! HOW HARD IS IT TO MAKE TOAST?! not to mention we didn't see or hear from the waiter since. It was when the manager came around that we complained yet again, and guess what? 2 minutes later I had toast! The manager was very apologetic and comped the meal, but this is not the first time i have had bad customer service from this store.

Good dinner, good service.  Chicken fried steak was good, a bit dry, and took long to fill drinks.  Reuben sandwich was good as well.  Was pleasantly surprised that we ended up there on free pie night.  Hazelnut Creme was outstanding.  Spent about four hours eating and conversing, I know!  Was going to give three stars but for the free pie and great uninterrupted conversation opportunity, I give four stars. Used $5 bonus card, military discount, and had free pie which made it well worth the enjoyable evening.

I will NEVER eat here again. Let me explain....I have 2 children with me. The waiter asks what we would like to drink, before my son can finish saying what he wanted, which was a water, he turns and leaves and say "Sprite, ok". Are you kidding me???? Then I ask for a white mocha. He comes back with an iced mocha. I'm confused because I wasn't even asked if I wanted it made hot or cold!!!!!! It's FREEZING OUTSIDE!!!! When I told him the situation he turns and leaves in the RUDEST manner. I'm here now with the hot mocha and scared to drink it because I think he spat it in. I had a loooong day at work and have my two kids after and all I wanted was a relaxing dinner.  I quit.

Very unorganized. Every Time my family wants Village inn we end up coming here or getting take out orders from here because it is the closest to our house. However, every time we order, we end up getting our food cold or the wrong food comes out. When that happens the workers just tell us like nothing is wrong and we have to just accept it because "they are busy". We do understand.. But can we at least get things correct? When we order take out, they tell us 10-15 minutes and we can pick it up and then tell us the wrong order came out when we get there and wait for 20 minutes. There is no nice tones with anyone and everyone at the register look like they are forced to do their jobs. The food is nothing special anymore. IT IS NOT WORTH THE TIME AND WRONG ORDERS JUST TO EAT THEIR FOOD.
Typical VI fare. Nothing to write home about, but it fits the bill if you're looking for quick food that isn't drive-thru.

Your typical Village Inn, but I think because of where this is situated, it gets extremely crowded on the weekends around brunch time so plan accordingly. The menu is extensive with a good selection and you can't beat the cheap prices. Good for breakfasts with family or friends.

I ordered to go today and have always had good experience. Today, unfortunately that is not the case. When placing the order I was told 10-15 minutes the first rider would be ready, over 30 mins later the food was overcooked. Chicken-fried steak, eggs and hash browns were all dry and inedible, even the toast was burned. What a disappointment from all the prior times I had good experiences. Quality control is important!

We are big Village Inn fans, and came here a lot back when a soft spoken server named Brian worked here.  We stopped in 5/27/15 for dinner and a free slice of pie... We should have kept going.  It took 10 min to get approached..and when we did it was by a guy asking for our drinks because he was "covering" for a waitress.  Then another person showed up (not the waitress the guy mentioned) and asked for our drinks.. We told her the guy is getting them, so she starts to leave, and we reminded her that we would actually like to eat still, so she took our order.  Yet another person brought out our food.  We were left unattended for 15-20 min before finally getting a refill on our drinks. That was actually done by a FOURTH person.  Nobody ever came back to check on us, so after another 10 min I actually had to go to the counter and ask for a "to-go" container..and my pie slices.  The pie was handed to me packaged to go, and when I kindly said "thank you", the lady just turned and walked away.  They even tried to charge us for water ..billing it as "tea".  The food tasted good by the way... but the servers were  confused and unprofessional.   I will stick with the location near Iliff and Tower, this one is mismanaged big time.

UPDATE: manager reached out and made it right...  This experience was much better

My son & I went for a late lunch on 5/21/15.  I ordered a French Dip w/ cole slaw.  The sandwich was fine, but asking for a side of mayo was apparently a no-no.  Asking for a second side of mayo later caused my son to whisper "I wonder if she knows she has to WORK for a tip?"  But the mayo finally made its appearance.  The au jus was tasty but very salty.  The cole slaw was way too creamy, but good.  Better if less "cream".  My son ordered chicken fried steak scramble with hash browns.  He liked his scramble, but thought the hash browns sucked.  His words, not mine.  They were barely cooked - as usual.  Look, I know, well fried hash browns are not good for you, but when you only have them about 4 times a year, a good fry on them is to die for.  Let me determine what's good for me, not you.

All in all, pretty much what I expected.  Barely cooked hash browns, overly salted food, service with an attitude.  But acceptable low prices.  Ya know...ya get what you pay for!!!  This place is really good for a 2am bar closed munchies stop.  At that point you don't care about service, food quality, etc.  Just get some carbs in your system...excellent for this.

I don't even want to give them one star! Will never go back, there was no reason we should of had to wait 10 min to put our name on the list, or wait another 40 min to be seated. The place wasn't even at 20% capacity and they had so many people waiting for seats. The GM and the assistant GM were working the front and didn't even say sorry about the wait or nothing. Then finally we sat down and waited 2 min the server came over said oops I was supposed to wipe the table so he reached his arm in front of me and his ARM PITS STUNK!!! They were right in my face. Then he walks away and starts cleaning more tables. Doesn't say welcome or I'll brb to take your drink order. We waited 10 more min and they still didn't come get our drink order so we ended up walking out! And told everyone waiting they should leave to and the people walking in. The GM didn't even stop us to say sorry he just looked at us. DONT GO HERE!!!!

Ok food... Ok service, not bad not great....
On Sundays get there before church rush... Prices are fair

Very slow in all aspects.  Have zero tolerance or ability to work with people with allergies (gf, df).  Attitudes of servers less than enthusiastic.  Won't be visiting any village inns again any time soon.
The staff on Thanksgiving were great.  Thank you!
Pretty normal kinda place. Food came out alright and was cooked ok. Bacon was a little over done and we were missing some silver wear. Pretty small stuff.
Slow service, and unable to cook eggs to order.

This gem of a restaurant is tucked away in a shop petite but truly a great place

The staff tries hard to make it a great dining experience 

The pho is outstanding with an abundant amount of items to please the most discerning palate

It is certainly wirth your time to try this place

02JUL2016

3.5 We will visit again. When they have booze.

+ Friendly and competent service
+ Pork noodle bowl. Huge for $8.50 USD. Tender crispy pork. Lots of veggies. Delicious texture and flavors.
+ Clean WC.

0 Decor and ambiance.

- Greasy egg roll appetizer. Not recommended.
- Thin, almost useless paper napkins.
- No AMEX.
- No beer for you. They forgot to renew their liquor license.
- TV
Egg rolls are a must here. Ask for extra lettuce to wrap the egg rolls! They give a good amount of meat with their pho. The only thing I didn't like was the broth was pretty salty.
This place is fantastic! Cozy atmosphere and very friendly staff. The food was delicious! The pho is great, as are the spring rolls. This is our new favorite spot.
So tasty and just what I needed when I was feeling under the weather (or altitude). I ordered the meatball pho which was full of flavor and rich broth. Service was immediate and quite friendly.

I got carryout and it was awesome. Broth was flavorful and noodles/meat/fixins were packaged separately. The meat was raw but the broth was still steaming hot when I was ready to eat it. I am a huge fan of pho and this place did not let me down.

I was hesitant to try this place out, but now that I have, I need more. 

I'm used to the pho joints down on Federal. They're my haunt. It's where I'm used to. But now that I live in the foothills, a jaunt to Federal is kind of a long way away. For this reason, I couldn't be happier to have Applewood Vietnamese (sort of) near me!

Honestly, their broth is so flavorful, it rivals the Federal shops. They also load it up with meat, and their veggies are super fresh. I like that their pho menu has about 6 items on it and one size only. Keeps it real.

If I could take a quarter star away, I'd probably do that for the spring roll. Not super awesome. I've gotten them twice now, and I just can't care about them. But I'm here for the pho, not the roll. 

Service is always stunningly friendly and efficient, and whenever I go to pickup my order, the place is packed. That's a good sign. 

I'll be back once we get a cold night and I get my pho craving going.
Our new love!!!! Can't beat the service.  And the service is spot on with huge servings.  Sweet people.  Very clean and tidy.  Love
The taste of pho by it self might be little plain but overall it has a clean taste (just add hoisin sauce). They give you lots of meat!
Kelly, Grace and Hanh are always so friendly and efficient. The food is delicious and consistent. You will never leave thirsty because your glass of water will always be more than half full.
Excellent hole in the wall Vietnamese restaurant.  Special bun was perfect.  Wish I had a place like this close to my home.
Surprisingly good food tucked away in a little shopping center. Orders are prepared quickly and staff is nice and helpful. Spring rolls are amazing and the rice and noodle bowls are huge.

The service was the best here. It seems to be a family-owned place. We were seated right away and water was served immediately. The menu had a nice variety of Vietnamese dishes. We shared orders of grilled shrimp spring rolls and fried spring rolls, which were very good. The meatball pho was a huge dish with lots of sliced meatballsand rice noodles. It came with a plate of bean sprouts, fresh  basil, and lime wedges. Others in our party had the bun dac biet, recommended by the server (owner?)  which had huge shrimp, somewhat rubbery thin-sliced beef, and rubbery processed-tasting chicken. That dish was also very large, with lots of noodles but not many  vegetables. The accompanying sauces were served in small dishes to each person. The prices were quite reasonable.

What a nice surprise coming back from the mountains in route to the airport.  Portions very generous.  Mounds of basil, lime and sprouts. Staff friendly and prompt.  Plenty of gluten free options. Large spice selection on every table. Edamame included and lemon in the water which is a great sign given that entrees are only $7-10.

So far so good! A nice pho place in Lakewood that's right around the corner. The service is quick and always there. The food came out instantly and the free edamame starter is a nice touch. The condiment select is solid with a few things I have not seen at other pho places. 

It might be a small serving area but it gives off a cozy vibe and I'm excited to take more pictures of the rice and noodle bowls. 

The pho Tai was solid with great broth and the meat seems pretty standard which I only tried the steak. The prices are easy going also.

VERY DELICIOUS!!!! This place is wonderful and the food is amazing for the price. The first time I came here I ordered the rare beef pho and it was very savory with a lot of developed flavors. On my second visit I got the pork chop noodle bowl and it was made with all fresh ingredients which is the key to making this dish very good. Today I ordered the pork chop rice platter and it was so amazing that it convinced me to write about it. Perfectly cooked pork made to order with a very decent portion and fantastic flavors. The wait staff has always been pleasant and makes sure I'm never out of water and have everything I need. I really like this place, and I will be back for my forth time soon.

Not as good as the reviews indicated. Nothing wrong with it - but not as flavorful as the pho I'm accustomed to. Clean and nice people - but not a place I'd go again. 

Paper napkins were a little 50s diner.

Try it and see if you like it - but not for me.

Great spring rolls, good pho. Yummy rice bowl. Waitress was attentive and had some good menu recommendations. Food came out quick, and there was a ton of it. After we got both the rice bowl and pho we confined then for leftovers and we had a new pho bowl. :)

Found this place on Yelp and was so glad we did.  The new owners are super nice and they keep the place very clean, fresh and well lighted.  The Pho was the best we've had in the USA and we eat Pho a lot in Hawaii, New York, LA, & everywhere we travel in USA.  The Pho broth was clear and full of flavor and full of meats and vegetables.  They give lots of bean sprouts, Thai basil, jalapeño & lime to go with the Pho.  They offer only one size for $7.95 and its big, we couldn't finish either of ours.
