They also serve steamed edamame as a free appetizer to enjoy while you wait for your meal, but it wasn't long, our 2 orders of Pho came out fast.  We saw other customers orders come out fast too.  The place was busy but had lots of rooms for everyone.  For fresh, healthy food you can't go wrong here.  Enjoy!
This place is amazing! I love the noodle bowls and the pho! They give you large portions and the food is always fresh. I'm not crazy about how icy the boba is, but all of the food is delicious!
My favorite pho that I've had in Colorado! It's what I compare all pho to when I try new places.

This is our new favorite Vietnamese restaurant!!! We had a combination spring roll appetizer (the ones you roll up yourself) and a combination noodle bowl. Everything was fresh and delicious! The service was extremely friendly. And the prices are very reasonable. It's in a great location with plenty of parking. We'll definitely be back!

This is a great addition to the neighborhood. Most of the Vietnamese places are on the East side but now there is one close to me. Really friendly, fast, service and the food is way good. My family is making this a regular place to stop. It is in the somewhat run down Applewood Shopping center off Youngfield and Willow but is very nice inside.  I'm sort of working my way through the menu and have not been disappointed yet. They serve those 'bubble' drinks that are popular now; I can take them or leave them but the younger set seems to like them. Give them a try sometime.

We ordered take out.  I ordered a chicken pho and boyfriend ordered house special noodle bowl.  Both were exceptional size amount of food and both very flavorful and fresh tasting.  I would definitely go here again as we are farther away from the federal area now a days.  The only criticism I have, we ordered cream cheese wontons and they were not worth the calories.  The cream cheese leaked out of most of them and the wonton wrappers were a lot thicker than my preference.

Good food...service is hit or miss. You don't get a 'set' waiter for your section you're sitting in. Looks like whoever is there just shares the waiting responsibilities of the whole restaurant. First time I went there was last week with a friend. Food was good  for a Pho place and what I thought wasn't our waitress 'became' our waitress. She was great. Attentive, filled waters, asked us how every dish we got was good or not (appetizers, entrees and such.) Actually surprised me because that doesn't happen as often as it should these days. [I've worked in fine dining so I know what quality service is.] Yesterday was a different story. Went back and that waitress wasn't there. Just two lazy 'other' waitresses that I noticed from my first visit. The good waitress took over from those two on my first visit. Unfortunately she wasn't there last night. 

Here's what happened last night. Food was good and came quick. So quick I got my Pho before my plate of veggies and had to wait on that. Ordered a Thai tea too. Didn't want those Boba drinks so got the tea. It came with whipped cream and Boba balls in it. I wiped the cream off into a bowl and threw a crumbled napkin in it. Didn't even take a sip and pushed it to the edge of the table in effort to send it back and get it without all the fufu stuff. I was out of water before I was 1/4 through my soup. Not one refill. Not a single stop to ask if things were okay. When I was finished I just sat there and finally one of the lazy waitresses came and 'dropped' the check off. Literally dropped it off without asking how my meal was or if she could refill that empty water glass or ask me why that completely full, $3 Thai tea was sitting at the edge of the table. When went to pay, I complained about the service. One waitress tried to BS me and say she was 'so busy'. That's when I turned and counted the tables that were full in the restaurant in front of her...FIVE tables with people including myself and that's it. Five tables split between two servers is slow as sh*t. That's not busy I told her. Five per one server is the standard for 'normal' business. 7-10 tables per server is busy. I've done it. It's called caring and multitasking. Lazy service is normal these days and it sucks. I told them they need to take lessons from that other girl that knows how to wait tables. At least the meal was taken care of. 

Bottom line: pretty good Pho, but if you want good service don't expect it here unless you get the good waitress (pretty, long fake eyelashes and big boobs that she uses to help her tips...no joke.) The other two are completely terrible. Hopefully they up their service game. First visit deserves five stars for a Pho place based on service...four for food. Second visit was one star based on service. I'll round down to two because the chances of getting the good waitress are slim.

FINALLY, Pho in the neighborhood! No longer do I have to drive halfway across the city to get my fix!

I've been here a handful of times now for lunch, well, maybe a bit more often than I'd care to admit ... enough that I think my wife is starting to get jealous. They don't have as large of a menu selection as other Vietnamese restaurants in town but I have yet to be disappointed. The food is always phenomenal and fresh, service is always fast and super friendly.

This place is great. Applewood has the best Vietnamese food I have found in Colorado in many years. The ingredients are always fresh, the food flavorful, the space is clean, and the service is always spot-on. I've wavered on whether to write a review, simply because it's nice to never have a wait at my go-to Vietnamese restaurant, but it's just too good and the employees are too kind to keep it a secret.
Best Vietnamese food, so good I forgot to take a picture!  The service was great, the food was exceptional and the place was clean.  We will be back.

Great Pho.. up the street is really nice
the only downside was the thai tea was really really really sweet.

This place is inadequate at best. If you like Vietnamese food and eat it often, do not go here for you will be disappointed. Unfortunately my family enjoys it so it is something I am forced to eat quite often and of all 10+ times I've eaten here it's been almost inedible. I'm curious if it's up to health code, the meat tastes old... Extremely old. I've tried multiple dishes and not one thing has ever tasted fresh. That being said the staff are incredibly friendly, the service is great and they make great boba drinks. It's not the worst place to go... Unless you love Vietnamese food--in that case going here is an absolute sin.

Absolutely love this place!  Fresh and delicious food, prepared with care and great service. The owner is always on the floor keeping an eye of every detail. The person in charge of the kitchen apparently run New Saigon's kitchen for years so that would explain why the food is so good here. This place is full of nice generous touches: you'll be welcome by a bowl of complimentary warm edamame, you'll get fresh slices of lemon in your water, a small bowl of pho broth with your lunch meals...By the way, that pho is insanely good. Truly, best pho broth in Colorado, period.  This place is a treasure

I'm always happy when I eat here. Friendly and fast with great tasting broth, fresh veggies for the soup. The last time we were there, the place was empty at about 2pm, so we got a little bit too much attention by the three waitresses. Filing up our water every 60 seconds or so. Other than that, perfect.
The broth is full of taste! Wait was a little long but worth it.

This was a nice restaurant with wait staff coming around at least 3 times asking if everything was alright and if I was enjoying the food. They kept filling my water glass even if it was 3/4 full.  A plate of steamed soy beans(over cooked) started as a free appetizer.  The food: I ordered the seafood Pho, it came with 2 shrimp, 3 squid legs and a lot of pieces of krab(the red and white imitation variety) a few half cut seafood balls, a plate of bean sprouts, peppers, lemons and basil leaves.  Overall, the soup was rich and very good not very salty; which is a plus. I wouldn't order the seafood again thinking "real seafood" was my mistake, i'd possibly order the vegetable Pho next time i'm back in town. Try it I hope you enjoy it.

column4: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
column13: Very good food. Excellent Service. English is a second language here but the friendliness and chillness of the family owning the restaurant will make you hardly notice. My favorites: Vietnamese coffee, pho combo, rice noodle combo, and coconut juice.

Truly the best pho I've ever had! Clean and attentive service. Nice basic menu.  Enough on it to give you options.  If you want pho, this is the place to go! Large bowl, plenty of noodles and broth is amazing.  The veggie plate was also very generous with jalapeños, basil and sprouts. Get your eat on!  This place is the real deal. The egg rolls are also just the way they should be, nice wrap with minced goodness, and served with fish and hot oil dipping sauce. I'll be back when in town visiting our son in college.

I am very picky on Vietnamese noodle bowls and once I have found this place, we have been back numerous times! They give you so much food for the good price and it's yummy!  The owners are very nice and welcoming as well. We love coming here for dinner and also the boba  tea, I haven't had good luck finding a good place in town until now! One of our new favorite spots!  We live about 15 minutes away and don't mind driving here for dinner!  Also, I get the noodle bowl combination with extra shrimp ( the spices on the shrimp is out of this world!
Very very good.  We really enjoyed our meal and, it was all take out.  Impressive for the applewood area!!!!!!

I really enjoyed myself here... Love the Edamame! Loved the Crab Cheese Wontons, egg rolls were pretty nice as well... I had the house special plate and it was delicious! I think I would do double chicken though instead of the pork... But all in all really really good!!! Cannot wait to go back for more!

The amazing reviews drew me to this restaurant. It's a tiny little place in a strip mall I've never been to, yet it's only a mile from where I live. Honestly I am not big on strip mall restaurants...but this one is unbelievable. The food is fantastic. The spring rolls are amazing. The sauce to dip them in is HEAVEN. I had the combination rice noodle bowl which includes all the proteins (shrimp, chicken, pork and beef) and eggrolls. The portion is very generous and the flavors are amazing. It's the best Vietnamese food I've had in years. Don't let the strip mall and the tiny place fool you. If you love Vietnamese food, this restaurant goes on your "do not miss" list.

It is quite good food, and the owners are so very nice. My main issue is that there is no high chair. Each time we go, i ask for a high chair for my son and there is no high chair. I know from talking to some friends that people would come more often if there were high chairs. 
Please BUY 1 or 2 HIGH CHAIRS.
Both my husband and myself enjoyed everything we ordered. ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! Highly recommend. Awesome food and friendly staff. Can't wait to go back!

Great service and delicious, fast, food. I highly recommend the crab cheese wontons and any type of pho. If you request it they do a no meat pho option, veggies, tofu or both. We had a great lunch here and we were back at the office within 50 minutes!
Incredible portion sizes for the price. Some of the best tasting pho I've ever had, noodle bowls were amazing as well. An absolute must stop of you love Vietnamese food.

We came in a big group on a Monday from out of town. The food was AMAZING! The pho broth was delicious.  In addition,  the atmosphere was great with friendly and quick service!  Will be back again next time we are in town!!!

We came from out of town and wanted to try a really good pho place. Saw all the ratings and reviews and decided on this place. 

Upon the eye test, we first thought this restaurant only got 5 star ratings for TWO BIG REASONS. After trying our food, we realized the food is amazing. Pho broth is amazing. Highly recommended!
Very fast service and the food was great! The crab cheese wontons are some of the best I've ever had. English is a second language here, but delicious food and fast service knows no barriers!

We ate here for the first time this evening, and will definitely come back. We had two appetizers, pho, and a pork rice bowl, and everything was excellent. The menu wasn't huge, but there's lots on it to like. The prices were very reasonable, and the service was amazingly fast. The family who runs this place is very friendly. If you're looking for good vietnamese food on the west side of town, this is a great option!
A new favorite Vietnamese find! I LOVE this place. Good food, good service. Nice small homey place.

Best Pho in Golden hands down. Complimentary edamame was a huge plus! Spring rolls and boba were also delish. No sriracha gunk on the cap. Clean as a whistle. Tucked away in the back of an interesting shopping center so kind of easy to miss if you aren't looking hard!

Easily the best Vietnamese food in the area! Open every day which is convenient. Sort of easy to miss in the shopping center at 20th and Youngfield, but worth finding. Noodle bowls are great, service is very friendly and prices are very reasonable.

Terrible service! We used to order from them when they had the old owners, but ever since they've been applewood pho instead of ipho, they have messed up our order every time, and to make matters worse the woman argued with me about what I said! I wanted chicken pho, no numbers just chicken pho, got raw red meat pho! And I ordered my husband a rice bowl and got noodles instead, and since I've had my order messed up before I made sure that I said my order 3 times so I wouldn't be disappointed when I got home, and sure enough it was wrong, and again the woman argued with me saying I said 5C! How you get 5C and chicken pho mixed up is beyond me, but I won't be back!
Best Vietnamese food on western side of Denver metro. Great food and great friendly service.
Best Pho place around, hands down! I got take out so I can't speak to the service, but they where fast, and the pho ga is fantastic!
I drive way out of my way to eat here food is amazing.
Great food. Tip: even though the menu doesn't mention it, they do have (delicious) vegetarian options available.

The more I go to this place, the more I like it.  I keep ordering the Pho Tai or the House Noodle Bowl.  I really love the House Noodle Bowl; it comes with several different meats which are all really well prepared and tasty.  It is hard to quantify what makes a Noodle Bowl taste great but this place seems to be able to deliver the perfect blend of rice noodles, veggies, grilled meats and condiments.  The Pho is very good as well.  We really appreciate the free edamame that comes before the meal since it keeps my young son occupied until the food comes.  Service is friendly and prompt.  This is our go-to Vietnamese restaurant in the Golden/Lakewood area.
Food is very good, limited menu, but I like that. Clean, quick and friendly. For the reviewer below who is upset that they do not have a high chair, I noticed that they have one now:).
I live in New York where good pho is around... This rivals these places. The service is fast and the pho and summer rolls were delicious!!
One of the best Pho places on the west side of town. Staff is super friendly and the food is superb.

We always get the "Bun" at Vietnamese restaurants (vermicelli noodle bowl) and their special combo here was fantastic, with grilled prawns, white meat chicken, pork and egg roll.  Very generous portion for $10 and delicious with good fish sauce. Friendly service, nicely remodeled space in an obscure strip mall.  We used a restaurant.com certificate, but it's still a good value at full price.  Can't wait to return!  It's about a mile down the road from the West Lake trailhead for the lovely Clear Creek Trail, which we rode 20 miles on to work off the carbs.
Excellent pho! I was very impressed with the speed of service, I had my food less than 5 minutes after placing my order
This is a very good, tasty authentic Vietnamese restaurant. We had the combination plates and they were superb. If you want REAL Vietnamese food you won't be disappointed.
This is great!  So happy to have a neighborhood place to go where the whole family can enjoy a meal without breaking the bank! Delicious!  This is our new go to!

Delicious grilled chicken in Centennial. 

Located near Yolandas tacos and a coffee shop this is some delicious food. 

I should have come here ages ago as my office is just a few miles down on Arapahoe. I tried their lunch special, which is $7.99 for a drum & thigh, rice & beans, plantains and drink. If you have not had this roasted chicken (other options available)  get your behind over here. It's like Boston market but 100 times better. 

The employees (I believe one gentleman is the owner) were so friendly and helpful. I took my lunch to go but did sample some of the sauce options & pickled onions they have in a sauce bar to the left of the counter. The spicy cilantro has a good kick to it but not overly hot. The curry was delicious and tempered a bit of the heat of the cilantro sauce. 

Can't wait to come bock (haha) and have some more chicken.

I was very excited about this place. However, I would probably not come back.

The good, the chicken has good flavor, the rocoto sauce is good. The anticucho was also flavorful, although it was a very small portion.

The bad,  My wife got sick because the chicken was a couple of days old. You could see the bones having dark spots, pretty much a sign that the chicken has being stored after cooked. I understand that you don't sell all your chicken every day, but this chicken was definitely a couple days old.

The service was mediocre, the guy behind the counter was not very helpful. I asked for some of the Rocoto hot sauce and the he told me, "We only serve rocoto with anticuchos" he refused to give me a small container of rocoto at the end even though I bought 2 1/2 chickens. I know it comes with rocoto because my cousin ordered some chicken to go and she got plenty of it.

Overall the chicken is good as long you don't get old chicken.

I visit the denver area quite frequently for work and I typically stay in the dtc area and was really excited to try this place. My first visit was amazing. Really friendly gentleman and what I assumed to be his son greeted me. I ordered the quarter chicken with veggies and black beans.  The chicken was super moist and very flavorful and so were the black beans. My favorite part about this Restaraunt is the sauces they provide. The cilantro sauce is AMAZING!!!! I came back a second time and the chicken was a little dry and the cilantro sauce a bit salty but besides that I was still very satisfied!!! I will be def coming back again for sure!!





I came back again today and I was reminded just how amazing this place is!! This time they had a lime flavored pickles red onion mix that was out of this world!! I really hope this business becomes a success and stays around for many more years. My friend and I look forward to coming here every time we visit

Just had dinner there Friday night.  I had the quarter chicken with black beans and garlic potatoes.  I wanted the yellow rice but they were out of it. The chicken was wonderful - so tender and flavorful.  The beans were average and the potatoes had way too much garlic butter poured on them.  My husband had the weekend only special -  Lomo Saltado - steak grilled with onions, tomatoes and french fries.  It was wonderful too - and came with white rice.  The staff was really friendly and helpful and I would definitely go there again.

Pretty cool, little, Peruvian, "fast-er food", joint in the GV area.  It's not the best Peruvian restaurant in town, however, if you have a craving for some decent chicken and anticuchos (beef heart), and happen to be around these parts, it's not a bad stop.

Let's see if I can come up with the right word to describe what I just experienced here...GOT IT: OMG!!! Ordered the 1/4 chicken meal ($6.99) which comes with your choice of breast or leg and thigh. You also get to pick 2 sides. I opted for the cilantro rice, and the steamed veggies (which is a mixture of Broccoli, Cauliflower, Carrots). The flavor and seasoning of the chicken was amazing. I used a cup of the "spicy cilantro" sauce to add a little extra zing to everything (you'll need at least 2 containers). Definitely can not go wrong here.
This place has amazing food and the staff is so friendly and cater to your every need!!!

Ever since I moved from Orlando, I had a hard time finding a place that served Peruvian styled roasted chicken. Then I found Pollo Lima and now I am hooked. 

Their chicken tasted great, and it is not dry. But their sides are awesome! Their yuca and plantains are delicious and I love their spanish rice and black beans! Make sure you stop by the sauce station and pick up their curry and cilantro sauces. 

I am not a big dessert person, but I liked their flan and tres leches. It's a huge plus that Pollo Lima is about 5 minutes from work so any time I crave chicken, I can grab lunch or dinner to go. Please try it. Their staff is very friendly.

Ordered the lunch special which is rice, beans, plantains and chicken. To begin, this meal actual comes with only 1 plantain. The meal was okay, nothing to brag about. The chicken was fresh and seasoned well. The beans were undercooked. The rice was cilantro rice which complimented the chicken well. Overall the meal enough for lunch but it wasn't as tasty as I expected.

Great place.  Staff is welcoming and warm.  Food is great.  Skin was crispy and chicken cooked throughout.  Sauces.....YUM.  Yellow rice delish witout overpowering your meal.   I didnt try the yucca but will next time.  Great sunday brunch.  They open at 11am on Sunday!

We live in eastern Aurora and wanted Peruvian chicken so we headed out to Greenwood Village and Pollo Lima. It was worth the trip! Chicken was super tender and flavorful and the plantains were perfectly cooked. My yucca was a little fibrous but hub's were spot on. Yummy homemade sauces, too. Definitely take a trip and check them out! You won't be disappointed.

This place is amazing - absolutely delicious!  I have never known what Peruvian food was but now I do!  It is very similar to Cuban food.  The chicken is fantastic as are the plantains.  The spicy cilantro sauce is yummy as well.  I will be back!
Very clean and professional service. Just beware of having a conversation with the owner who is very TALKATIVE. He told me his whole life story talking for 10 minutes straight...

Amazing Peruvian chicken served in a no-frills mom-and-pop style atmosphere.  I live nearby so as soon as I saw the sign come up, I knew I had to try it.  The chicken is served simply but is incredibly flavorful.  As others have mentioned the sauces are amazing too.  I had never had the green Aji sauce until I tried it here and now I'm hooked.  The sides were nothing to write home about but complemented the chicken well.  The last time we came here, we got the whole roasted chicken with 2 sides and 3 sodas all for under $30...  For a family of 4!  Hard to beat that.  We will definitely be coming back here many times.

I really wanted to love this new local eatery, but was sadly disappointed with my meal. The chicken had no flavor and the skin was soggy (not edible). The rice and steamed veggies were both blah. Nothing special. Rotisserie chicken from the grocery store is 1/2 the cost and has way more flavor.

After weeks of driving by, wondering when it would open, it's finally here!

Peruvian roasted chicken is a lot like rotisserie chickens you've had before, but with a lot more flavor. Tender, moist meat, with a layer of crispy and flavorful skin. If you've ever been to the likes of Pio Pio in NYC, this is a solid way to get your fix in Denver. 

I really liked my half chicken, and think it's one of the best ways to go. The skinless chicken breast in the "Lima Chops" is tasty--it doesn't benefit from the tastiness of the skin, but the sautéed peppers and onion were delicious in their own right (with a little spicy kick). The sauces were a great accompaniment; one that I tried was a great curry kick, the other like a spicy thin nacho cheese. 

The plantains were amazing in taste and texture, the yucca a good example of good preparation, somewhat resembling a more flavorful potato. 

The tres leches is great, with a fluffy consistency and moistness that separates it from heavier preparations. Big fan.

The flan struck me as not as tasty as the tres leches, despite a very special preparation with a piece of fried plantain and a powder sugar dusting. The smoothness was great, but the density and sweetness were a little high for me, personally. I think this is more of a function of having eaten it after the tres leches. 

I'll be back.

The chicken was ok, but under spiced and the quartered portion was small. Didn't seem very freshly cooked either. The yucca was ok, but I wish they  served the real yucca, instead of processed yucca that was smashed, re-formed and fried. The plantains were very good. The flan needs some work, as it was a bit rubbery in texture. 

They were out of the aji sauce, which is what Peruvians  eat with pollo a la brasa, and it can really make or break the chicken. I did like the onion mixtures they had.

The whole room got smokey during our visit, which didn't help.

We'll go back in a while, to see if things improve, but otherwise we'll stick with the pollo from La Polleria....

This place is pretty solid. A good option for Paleo style and gluten free eaters. I tried the half chicken which was flavorful and even better with the spicy cilantro green sauce they have. Clean eating overall.

Apparently today was their grand opening and the chicken was fantastic! The lunch special was reasonably priced for the amount of food. I paid $7.89 for large portion of chicken, rice and beans, plantains and a soda.
Delicious, reasonably priced had a half chicken, plantains and potatoes. All three sauces and the onions were great
Love their lunch special!  Their location is close to where I work so this place is great to grab a bite to eat on the lunch hour.  Peruvian chicken is amazing.  Go already! Yum!

The chicken was excellent.  We both ordered a half chicken and the portion was huge.  Potatoes were tasty as were the plantains.   The dining room is not much to speak of, so we would probably do take-out next time.  Will be back!
Awesome place! The chicken was perfectly tender and juicy and the sides were wonderful.  Great options for gluten free and paleo.  I will go there again!
Nice place to try Peruvian chicken. Friendly and fast service. The aji amarillo is on point and desserts are delicious.

We need more places like this in Englewood Colorado! I decided to try Pollo Lima today because I had noticed them moving in over the past couple months and had looked forward to trying someplace new to grab lunch. Three things stand out about this new spot - excellent food, very friendly service and a clean restaurant. They specialize in wood-fire roasted chicken and it was really good! I got a half chicken with garlic potatoes and yellow rice; total came to just shy of $12. The value was perfect because the food was great. Although they offer a few sauces that give the chicken a more "Mexican" flavor (in my opinion), I preferred to eat this rotisserie masterpiece plain. The marinade they use is phenomenal. We need more spots that serve home-cooked delicacies like this. Five stars!
Love the chicken! Great service, very nice owner. This will be my favorite restaurant in the area.

Love that this place is now open!  We had the 1/4 chicken lunch special, which was perfectly tender and delicious with pinto beans - best ever.  We also had the Lima chops which is chicken off the bone and fresh tomatoes, cilantro rice and beans.  The best part about this meal, was the spicy ahi Amarillo sauce!  The staff was friendly as could be.  I will be back!

This is one of my favorite happy hour places. They have an amazing beer list (40 beers on tap with the majority being local/Colorado beers). I love their rooftop! This is a place I always bring out of town friends to give them a taste of colorado beer and Denver rooftop/patio life on a nice day. I have tried most, if not all, of their happy hour appetizers. They are all pretty solid. Nothing stands out but it's typical bar food...good with a drink if you're hungry. 

They have lunch and dinner food and daily specials. The hamburgers are solid and the smothered fries are delicious to share. I think the country gravy fries are the best. It's the kind of thing that my body can handle maybe once a year bc it's fries covered in sausage gravy and melted cheddar...but I enjoy the splurge when I do it.

I do not recommend the mac and cheese if you're actually wanting mac and cheese. It's more like plain pasta in a liquidy, buttery cheese-like sauce. And they say that it's bacon mac and cheese but there was not one spec of bacon in it. It still tasted okay but was not mac and cheese and in my opinion certainly was not worth the $3 extra you pay to get that as the side with your burger. 

I like that they feature a new brewery each month. They also have trivia on Monday nights and happy hour all day on Monday.

Wow. Well, I ate an early dinner here with some friends, the food was okay, the service was great, our waiter was super helpful and nice. Unfortunately 2 out of 3 of us ended up with food poisoning later that night. We were able to figure out through the process of elimination (pun intended) that the extra side of ranch we ordered was the culprit. Apparently they make their ranch in-house, perhaps we were served an old batch? Both my friend and I were up all night with the hallmarks of food poisoning, and neither of us made it to work the next day. So yeah, that sucked.

Their management leaves a lot to be desired, really rude and unprofessional. They gave my friend and I the run around (not returning calls, or calling back when they said they would). Both the asst manager Troy and the head manager Kevin initially offered to refund our money and give us gift certificates worth 20 bucks (apparently that's the going rate for making someone disgustingly ill these days). However, neither ever followed through with their promises to refund us. Finally, more than a week and a half later Troy got back to me and very rudely informed me they would not be refunding the money we paid for the meal that made us sick, but would deign to offer us a 20 gift card. Because yeah, I'm just chomping at the bit to have another round of food poisoning - thanks, but no thanks. I never write yelp reviews, but this experience was so astronomically bad and ridiculously handled, that I couldn't keep quiet.

Great place! 

Drinks were good! 

The rooftop was pretty darn social
And Nice! Our waitress was exceptional!

A co-worker suggested the Historians Ale House for lunch, and 5 of us decided to give it a try. I am glad we did!

The Historians Ale House is your normal bar, with good food and good service.
The interior is large, with a tall ceiling, dark colors, and wood floors. There are approximately 6 booths , two large (but narrow) community tables, and a large bar that has to seat at least 20 people. This is only the first floor! There is a roof top patio, which overlooks Broadway, a nice view. There are tables and a smaller bar up on top. According to the "maximum capacity" signs that are required in all restaurants, the rooftop area can hold 43 people, and the main floor area can hold 128 people, very nice. Granted, we were there at lunch, but I have the feeling that if the place were full (like in the evenings), I don't think it would feel crowded. 

The Happy Hour (and please check their website or their menu) has a bunch of good items. I had the cheeseburger and fries, which was only $5.95. 4 of the 5 of us had the cheeseburger, and everyone agreed that it was a good hamburger. Oh, the hamburgers are brought to you wrapped in brown paper and tied with strings. What you ordered is written on the wrapper. When you open up the package the hamburger and fries are inside. Nice touch, no overhead of washing those dishes either. Cool! 

Service was very good. The waitress took our order, without writing anything down, and she never missed a beat. When we were presented with our individual checks, those were correct too.  

Parking - on the street at metered parking. 

The beer offerings is quite large, actually very large. The listing is the size of a regular menu, with the listing on both sides. The beers are broken up into sections, like IPA, Stouts, etc. By each name of the beer, there is also the beer's business logo. The Historians Ale House pays attention to details. Nice touch. 

I will go back with my husband, and we are looking forward to it.

Enjoy! 
See you there!

My cousin, our friend and I popped into Historians for brunch and mimosas. We decided to go all the way upstairs to the outdoor patio, but I have to first say that I was greeted when I entered and felt very welcome despite it being pretty empty. A+! 

Upstairs we were promptly greeted and taken care of by our awesome bartender/server who quickly got some bottomless mimosas to the table! He was very very helpful in decision making and was generally an awesome server. I ordered their breakfast burrito (made veggie), Kim did a BYO burger and my cousin got the Spanish hangover, upon the servers suggestion. 

Forewarning, these are HUGE servings! My burrito was literally like 2 pounds. You should have leftovers or plan to split. Anyway, everything tastes wonderful and my cousin especially enjoyed the Spanish hangover. We will definitely be returning for brunch here. The atmosphere, food and service all hit the nail on the head for me!

Love the rooftop patio! I'll definitely come back just for that sometime.  I was here on a busy friday night a few weeks back, there were tons of people upstairs and some kind of game show on giant tvs.  I thought the service was fine, especially considering the crowds and the drinks weren't bad either.

Brunch is A+ when the rooftop is not crowded and the weather is perfect on an October Sunday! First time going here and I'll definitely be back! I got the pancakes with chocolate and cherries, I forget the name of it. Portions are huge and prices are fair, the bottomless mimosas are only $10 but I wish there was bottomless bloody Mary's too!

Dear Historians, do you ever read your customer's reviews? If so do you actually care that SO many people consistently complain about the poor service at your establishment? 

I agree completely agree with reviewer Lauren D.  Rachel who works the upper deck is so rude and inattentive. If I have her as a server next time I'm back I will literally turn around and walk out the door! The 1st time I thought it was just me. I tried being super nice hoping she'd loosen up. Not!  By the 3rd time experiencing little Miss Sour Puss, I realized it's not me...it's definitely her. And it's not just her. The service overall is totally spotty. 

And what's up with nickel and diming customers over lettuce, tomato or a tiny side of Bbq sauce?? Wow. 

4 stars for Happy hour, lunch special and burger/fries. 

Enjoy! (I hope)

Prices are cheap, food isn't. Food is amazing!!! I ordered the Spanish Hangover, so good!!! The sauce tastes like a sour cream base cream. Yummy! The Bloody Mary bar, OMG, make your own, to you liking, best idea. Love it!!! My best friend ordered the hoevos rancheros, she liked it a lot, but loved mine more. Lol. My friend ordered the breakfast burrito, it was pretty good too. Our waitress was really good, she was on point, kept our drinks filled, always. And she was super cute!  Good music, just loud enough to hear it but not too loud that you have to scream to talk to your friends.  Roof top is cool, not the best view because your looking at the roof of another building, solar manuals, dumpsters with graffiti and a parking lot. Lol. But other than that, the service is awesome, the people are cool, and the food is amazing with a Bloody Mary. YUMMMMM!!! I will for sure be back!
Shea was great! They accommodated the other football game we wanted to watch even though the Broncos were playing! Brunch was great and bottomless mimosas are always a plus!

We came here on a Sunday afternoon and sat at the bar. We had fish and chips and green chili fries. Fish was good. Fries were cold and greasy. Shae the bartender was rude and dismissive. The check arrived and we were overcharged $2.00 per beer and one extra beer we didn't have. Trevor the manager should not be in the customer service industry period. When we first brought the "mistake" to his attention, he got extremely aggressive and practically shouted "what do you want me to do about it?" I replied "fix it". He then went to the register and fixed the problem and didn't apologize for the error or seem the least bit interested in keeping us as customers. So after the bad food, horrible service, rude staff and being deliberately overcharged. I will never be back

I love Historians for many reasons..

1. Dry dock apricot blonde on tap
2. Tasteful decor
3. Great rooftop with mist on a 90 degree day
4. Full bar
5. Great bartenders
6. Delicious food

I've been here like 5 times. Finally tried their breakfast today and I was quite pleased. We got the $4 bloody mary bar and it was really good! $10 mimosas were also excellent. Both were mixed very well. For the bloody mary bar they give u a glass of vodka and u have a choice of spicy or regular along with tons of additions like pickles, the classic celery, garlic, lemons, lime, Tabasco, worcherschire, etc. Two thumbs up! The food was also delicious.
Went on a colder night and sat outside on their AWESOME patio. It was really nice sitting by the fire stand. Been was amazing and service was good too.

I like historians it's a great place but I have some issues. Service is slow. They charge extra for lettuce tomato and onions on a burger and they also charge extra for mayonnaise. 

Besides those minor discrepancies. 

It's a super well put together little bar/restaurant. Inside is rustic but with a new touch and solid lighting. It's not too bright during the day but the mood is set at night. 

The lunch special was killer a burger and a brew for around $10 if I remember correctly. It was delicious and the burger comes out cooked as you ordered it. The beers on tap are good and the selection is broad. So no complaints there.

My favorite meal is brunch on the weekends. The menu has all the breakfast classics. The huevos rancheros is the best choice. You can get it with or without pork green chili. It is fresh and flavorful. 

They have a rooftop patio with a bar and full food menu. It's perfect for sunny days. The burgers and sandwiches are all good choices. I like the hummus for an afternoon snack. There are lot of  beers on special for happy hour too.

I hate going somewhere and the service is so bad that you don't even get a chance to order. They were busy, so I guess the good people of CO think that they are doing something right, but personally I don't go somewhere to beg them to take my money.

I'm torn..
10.00 bottomless mimosa good.....french fries trying to be has browns...BAD.

Decided to hit brunch on Sunday morning.  I am allergic to eggs so it's normally a side fest for me.  Bacon, sausage, hash browns and an English muffin.  

Bacon...2 slices...nothing special...sausage patties..I'm sorry but both of them together didn't even cover English muffin.  Hashbrowns... when did cut up french fries become hashbrowns?????  

I expected a bit more for certain, guess that serves me right.

I am blown away that I've never reviewed Historians.  This place is indeed, as the rating states, as good as it gets.  I have been here for drinks, afternoon and evening meals, and most commonly these days, brunch.

So let's talk about that for a quick moment, shall we?  Bottomless mimosas.  And they do NOT mess around here.  The staff walks around with a pitcher of champagne with roughly 2 tablespoons of OJ in it.  That's my kind of action.  The food is delicious, the prime rib hash is a must!  Jess is huge fan of the Spanish Hangover, but you really cannot go wrong with anything.  If you come outside of breakfast hours the sandwiches here are phenomenal as are the accompanying house made fries.  

Beer list.  Yes.  Absolutely fantasticly humongously wonderfully awesome.  So do that.  Whatever your taste buds are they will be satisfied.

Service.  Never short of impeccable.

So in summation, I would like to simply say SWEET SONUVA MONKEY SPANK!!  Bring yo' booty down here!

Cheers!

As someone who was visiting from out of town, I was happy to go to a place with a large selection of local beers. We had a nice meal (late lunch) and enjoyed trying all of the different options. The bar tender was very helpful in suggesting what we should try and was pleasant to interact with (though I will ding him for suggested we check out the 16th street mall which was lame...but oh well).

I remember our food being good with generous portions.

We will certainly make this a stop on our next (but hopefully longer) trip up to Denver

Service was fine... minus a couple things... no one came to our table for the first 10 min we were there and then after our cards were taken to pay we didn't the server for another 10 min. 

My real problem was the quality of food. I ordered the burrito with green chile. The burrito that was suppose to be smothered in green chile didn't hardly have any so I asked for some more which I was also charged for... secondly the green chile isn't all that good. It's runny, like soup and doesn't really have anything to it ... just not my style. The kicker towards being midway through... I also found hair in my burrito.... I should have sent back or asked to have it taken off but I just wanted to be done and leave so I didn't.

This place has an amazing beer selection and I love that you can get 5, 10, or 16 oz pours. I've been here probably two dozen times over the last few years. The wait staff is hit or miss. I've had really great service, but the checking of IDs at the door at 5pm on a Thursday and the fact that they all wear ear pieces gives a weird overbearing club vibe that is far from warm and welcoming.

I never knew the bounty of goodness that was in this place until recently. Better late than never, I suppose! So let's cut to the chase. Reasons to love it: great happy hour, great selection of beverages whether you're looking for beer, wine, cocktails or food. I found myself staring at the beer menu for a long time because there were just too many good things to choose from. 

Sat on the rooftop and enjoyed the views while munching away on some happy hour goodies, mainly queso with chips, and some green chili cheese fries. Yes, I ate junk and I loved it. Sometimes a girl just has to grub on beer and bar food because it's necessary. It was chilly out with the sun setting but there are heaters, but I'll warn you they don't get too hot. There were 4 of us just huddled around the thing at one point. Bring a coat because the seasons are a-changin'! 

Last but not least, we had the most awesome waitress. She was accommodating despite our pickiness about seating and where we wanted our table. She was just awesome. 

I'll be back!

My husband I wandered in here at the suggestion of a friend. The beer selection is awesome, as are the prices and ambiance. 
The food left much to be desired and I like pub grub. 
Our chicken tenders looked like enormous fried oysters, aka burned. The cheese curds tasted like old oil too. The manager took great care of us though and I'd love to go back for the beers at least.

Atmosphere: great happy hour or dinner spot. If the weather is nice, get there before the crowd and check out the patio upstairs

Bar: great local beer selection from all corners of CO. They offer 5oz, 10oz and 16oz pours so you can have a good variety without ordering a ton of beer.

Food: had a kale and quinoa salad. Solid choice and the grilled chicken was moist and flavored well. From other food I saw around, it all looked pretty damn good!
Two words. Troy and Grace. They were so incredible to our party group and accommodated us beyond what is expected. Very fun night and I cannot thank them enough!
Hate it . Walked in and walked out because they won't serve me because I have a service animal. So much for Colorado being dog friendly or friendly for that matter .

I was surprised how attentive and fast our server was during a really intense brunch rush. He offered great beer and food suggestions, and we had a lot of fun.

I normally don't go for sweet brunches, but I ordered the french toast and it was AMAZING. The best french toast I've ever had. 

There was a table of bros next to us and they were yelling and screaming across the roof to each other. The wait staff handled it perfectly, they kept the bros boozed and happy, and got the giant and annoying crowd out quickly.

If I lived in Denver, I would definitely be back. Contrary to what Nick F thinks, I thought the wait staff was really cool.

The rooftop patio is great. If you crank your neck just right you can even get a glimpse of the mountains.  

Service is spotty - sometimes we have a great attentive bartender and sometimes they are super flakey.  

Don't eat here!  We've tried everything to like the food just because the location is so great but it's always disappointing, even the chips and salsa.  Brunch is better but not great.  

Don't get me wrong, I love this place for drinks on the patio but that's about it.

Super cool retro victorian atmosphere. Great beer menu. Great brunch menu. Service was professional and attentive. Prices were on the low end. Yeah!

We enjoyed to small/medium/large pour options for ordering drafts. The brunch menu had amazing sounding food. We ordered the Spanish Hangover and it was scrumptious. They had no problem switching out sides for us. Fresh fruit! Huzzah!

Why not 5 stars? The tables are small and really, really close together AND there are thin standing-room-only bars crammed down the center aisle (in between the dining tables and the actual bar) so walking through the restaurant is impossible. Also, you have no privacy. So, if you love eavesdropping, this place is for you. If you hate loud talkers, it is not. Since it has been raining for weeks here (!!!) we could not check out the rooftop patio. I am assuming that area is less claustrophobic, but can't verify. 

While we enjoyed our brunch, I'm not sure I would go back when it is busy. Maybe a lazy afternoon in between meals.

Love this place! We came here for happy hour and they have some great specials! Over the lunch hour, for $6 you get a cheeseburger, fries and a beer! The food is fantastic as well - perfectly cooked and presented in a paper package. They also have a special for most of their beers, $2.50 for a 10oz glass! The rooftop patio is large with a couple different levels. It has some TVs outside and heaters for cooler days/nights but get ready to climb some stairs to get all the way up there. Downstairs is really cute with some booths and hightops but I would guess at night it gets pretty crowded. 

Saw that they have a brunch menu as well so I would love to come try their brunch sometime soon.

Nice patio, didn't eat so solely basing this review on our service. Colleen was a delight. She immediately greeted us and was cheery and encouraging about the beers. The beer list is lengthy, and we told her we just wanted something light. Without asking she brought us over a sample of the pumpkin beer, and the ales they offered. Good service is hard to come by these days, so Colleen here's to you girl!

I would come back if I was on broadway just drinking. I glanced at the menu and it didn't really see anything appetizing, classic pub food. Not to say if I was hungry I wouldn't eat here, but I don't think this place advertises having amazing food by any means. They have a hundred beers to choose from!

Oh Historians.... If you weren't such a cool venue I don't think we'd ever step foot in your establishment again. 

Your rooftop patio is amazing. Your old school feel on the main level is beautiful. Your rooftop bar is so convenient during a Sunday brunch.

But your food... Work on it. 
When Someone orders a brisket sandwich, I don't think they're expecting to have to swim through a gallon of bbq sauce to find the meat, bread, and French fries. I can honestly say I threw 100% of that to-go order away last night. So gross.

Went for happy hour. Brisket sliders were dressed well and tasted good but I wanted them to have just a bit more meat. The nachos were loaded like crazy. 1$ Chicken tacos (tues, thurs) were really tasty also. Service and atmosphere were par for the course. Obligatory mention of the upstairs patio and sandwiches also.

Been here for lunch a few time and I dig it. The people behind the bar are always nice. The beer is cold and they have a decent selection. Same goes for the liquor. they have a great priced lunch special......Monday-Friday - Lunch special 11am-3pm: $4.95 Cheeseburger and fries with choices of draft beer or soda.
I believe there is an extra charge for tomatoes, but I prefer no tomatoes, so I am good. 

But, my favorite thing here is the cheese curds. They are incredible. I actually took a supplier here, who was born in Wisconsin. I wanted him to tell me if these things were authentic. He said they were the real deal. So, if you are a fried cheese fan, you must try them here. I dont understand how they are not on the list for Denver's best cheese curds. Try them and you will agree with me.

Historians is a fun place to spend a late night or a happy hour drinking affordable beer!

Happy Hour specials are 2.50 for most of their beers! (10 oz pours which is pretty chintzy but I guess I'll forgive that.)
Food-wise its all just ok. Typical bar fare. Nothing earth shattering but will fill you up when you've had one too many.
The only negative is that SOME beers are INSANELY pricey. Like crazy.

This review is only for service and drinks. We stopped in here for a couple drinks with some friends and it was a great spot. The atmosphere is nice, there are plenty of beer so tap and a healthy wine list. The service was great as well!  The server knew her beers which is a plus when trying to decide.

The biggest thing this place has going for them is the rooftop deck. It is a decent size and there is a bar up there. It could be a great bar. That said, this place wants to be cool. But the staff just isn't cool. They aren't even good at their jobs. The bartenders lack personal skills and have trouble keeping up with even the smallest crowds. They also seem to have issues making decent cocktails. Margarita, jack and coke, greyhound....they were all terrible. Now I know what you are thinking....this place is an "ale house" you can't judge them on a cocktail. Fair enough. They do have a decent beer list but it will probably take you a while to get one from this slow staff. In par for the course fashion the bouncers are pretty rude and act more like this place is located in LoDo on a busy night rather than South Broadway on a Saturday afternoon. Managers sit back and watch it all while doing nothing to correct the situation. 

2 stars. One for the beer list. One for the rooftop deck. Minus 3 stars for managers, bartenders/drinks, and bouncers. No opinions about the food.

Been here on multiple occasions, so figured it's time for a review! Great happy you - huge beer selection. The servers know their stuff too. Fun atmosphere - laid back, not a dive but relaxed. High top tables downstairs and high top at the bar on the roof and regular tables too. The roof is where it's at though. Some of the best chili cheese fries in Denver, ok prime rib nachos, good hummus plate, but needs more veggies for the amount of hummus.

I couldn't believe how cheap the owner was at this place. I understand charging for cheese or sides on a burger, but who charges for lettuce, tomato, and onions. I was surprised the bun didn't cost extra too. 

And put your burgers on a plate, the fries got cold really quick after putting that paper directly on the bar counter.

Service is very slow for whatever ungodly reason.  The upstairs patio is great to sit out on a nice, sunny day, but don't come here if you're pressed for time.  This place is also pricey for what you actually get.  We ordered the jalapeno basket for $8.95.  That was a total ripoff.  We received a really small basket of sliced, deep-fried jalapenos and onion strings.  If you put all the jalapeno strips together, it would come out to about three medium sized jalapenos.  Not worth $8.95!  

Most of our party opted for their happy hour cheeseburger special for $5.95.  It comes with a beer of choice or a soda.  That would be a great deal, but the fries that came with it were soggy and gross.  If you wanted a piece of lettuce and tomato, it would be $1.50 extra.  I also got charged for a side of ranch that never came.  The burger itself was average for store-bought, pre-formed patties.  The Pepsi I got with the meal tasted weird like they haven't cleaned the bar guns in a long time.  The only positive in this experience was the mimosas for $6 a piece. 

Overall, a very underwhelming experience.

I want so badly for this place to be my "go to" neighborhood bar... But the service sucks and the food is not much better. Not so friendly and inattentive staff, including a manager who didn't even acknowledge us coming in or leaving 20 minutes later due to no service. Like I said, I want it to be good... It's a cool location and rooftop spot but that doesn't make up for the disappointment upon nearly every visit.
Lotta cold taps, great rooftop patio, large menu and good food. Bathrooms are clean. Service was good.

I genuinely enjoy this place. Whether it's summer time or winter time, I've always had good experiences here. I am a huge fan of their lunch special... $5.95 for a burger and a small beer or fountain beverage. Their portions are honestly big enough to split, since I can never finish mine. There are other great things on their menu and I think they have weekly or daily specials. Service is generally pretty quick and professional. I will definitely continue coming back as a regular patron.

This is a wonderful place!

I've enjoyed a lunch in booths and an afternoon on the roof!
Both times the staff was great!
The food was wonderful, salad as well as cheese curds!

The beer selection is great and always changing and offering interesting new things to taste.

Definitely on the rotation!

Historians is by far my favorite spot on Broadway. The staff is amazing. Rachel the bartender rocks. Sunday bottomless mimosas are actually pretty tasty. Great beer selection with an awesome roof deck.

Usually this place is spot on and good for a night out with lots of friends! But...the last two Saturday afternoons I've been in to hang out on the patio and the same bartender has served me and my. God. She is so awful! Rachel needs a serious attitude adjustment! When asked what kind of vodka I wanted and I said well, she turned her back and got pissed and said some shit to the dude next to her. I get it, you're busy as hell and it's hot out but cmon! There's no need to be such a major bitch! She acts super annoyed and inconvenienced it's ridiculous! Give that job to someone who would appreciate it!

Sadly i don't get to this part of town much, but this place might make it more worth it! The patio, oh my goodness, the patio, so awesome.

We just went for drinks, but i couldn't pass up the cheese curds, which were amazing.  

Definitely now on my list of places to hang out this summer!

Great bar on Broadway, and it gets PACKED almost any night of the week. Their happy hour specials are 11-7, so do yourself a favor, skip the crowds, and come midday. They have different HH specials everyday too. Wednesday is Ladies Day and we get half off of any wine! Hello! Great beer selection on tap, yummy food, but the bartenders can be a bit douchey. Just make my drink, I don't care. Just don't spend all your time talking to the girls trying to get free drinks. 
But, don't miss out on the fried cheese curds!

This place is amazing! A beautiful bar/restaurant with ambiance that transports you to a different time. Oh and they have a rooftop patio complete with misters, fans, etc. 

We ordered the Cheese curds as an appetizer, and they are amazing. I would come back just for them! Good thing the food and drink are excellent to boot! I ordered the lunch special, which was a cheeseburger, fries, and a beer for $6. Burger was cooked perfectly and perfectly portioned, fries were amazing and a stellar beer selection filled with awesome CO staples and featured breweries rounded the meal out. The staff was extremely attentive and made great recommendations. Can't wait to make it back in!

I went to Historians for brunch on Saturday. Brunch is very common to all the de want places in Denver. Their brunch is pretty typical in the way of breakfast items and of course the bottomless mimosa. I think it stood out because of the rooftop patio and awesome service. A couple of my friends got the bottomless deal their glass was never empty. Our server was not only friendly and attentive, she was personable. Joked around with us and earned a nice tip I must say. Another got the burrito, huge! He finished every bite. I enjoyed the BYO eggs with quinoa. Another friend I was with got the stuffed French toast. She happily gave it a two thumbs up. I'll definitely be coming back to try the dinner menu!

Not welcoming a disabled person was offensive. It is against the law to discriminate against or treat someone unfairly on the basis of prejudice. Disrespected, disgusted & DISAPPOINTED. 1 star for our exp on 04.09.16 evening. 4stars for venue, ambiance, rooftop, selection of beers on tap & late night HH specials. We began the evening celebrating a bday@PBS w/ a lrg Grp of 30. Then we decided to venture w/ a Smler Grp of 8 to historians for drinks, rooftop views &some bar food. The disrespect, disgust &disappointment began @the door even before we entered. The bouncer named Marcin, rudely made a disgusted face& deflated hot air of annoyance as he opened the door to me. Let me preface this review by stating that I am recovering from a foot surgery so I was in a knee scooter. I was offended but didn't want to make assumptions about why he had reacted that way to my presence. I didn't know if it was because of my race, me being in a scooter/handicapped or the grp of people@the door. My gf noticed his face of disgust & shaking his head. It was awkward to say the least. She jokingly called him out on it. His annoyance & RUDENESS with me being handicapped was f***ed up. I was def in SHOCK/surprised to be treated like that at the door. At 1st I brushed it off...didn't want to be the reason why our Grp couldn't have fun@ this bar. Typically...I would have called him out on his shit as soon as we walked in & walk right out. There are tons of other bars on Broadway that deserve our business but decided it WASN'T worth causing a scene in my scooter. Ugh! It's already humiliating enough being in a knee scooter. But then he made a scene, causing most of the noisy bar to STARE at me, told me he would not allow my scooter in & I had to leave it at the door with him, & then said Inappropriate things. WHAT AN ASS! My thoughts were "Are you serious? Does he really have the nerve to tell a handicapped person to leave? & discourage them from staying? & tell them to leave their only mode of transportation/mobility@ the door?" Is it their policy to shoo away someone in a wheelchair too? Other establishments at least TRY to accommodate someone who is disabled or OFFER OPTIONS. He could have offered the OPEN Booths next to the front door instead of dismissing me because of my scooter. Not welcoming a disabled person was offensive. I did not need to climb stairs if he offered that space. What a douche. After that first impression...I decided it wasn't worth battling an idiot. Luckily I am recovering from a surgery & can actually walk... But doctors advised me to stay off my foot& use a scooter this weekend. So I told the bouncer that it's OK I can walk up the stairs. To avoid any more of a scene I told him I don't mind leaving my scooter here & headed for the stairs. I was embarrassed...w/all eyes on me &the awkward situation. I was ready to dismiss the humiliation & have a good time @this bar. But the bouncer wouldn't let it go& caused a bigger scene. Of course having great friends...They called the bouncer out on his inappropriate behavior, rudeness&discrimination on disabilities. It definitely escalated & the bouncer was in my friends' face. I was so embarrassed that my friend had to defend me& sadly the bouncer had no clue how inappropriate he was. I get that his job is supposed to help avoid of any liability issue But that is definitely not a way to greet patrons & treat people with so much disrespect. He definitely needs more training on customer service or ADA compliant laws/discrimination. After getting upstairs of course our grp of friends were so UPSET& distraught it RUINED our evening. We tried to brush it off so a few grabbed some drinks, the rest of the group just couldn't get over how incredibly rude that man was. I spoke to one of the security guys named Sky &shared our frustration/disrespectful exp. He apologized &said that they have issues with Marcin & I should mention it to a manager. I respect& appreciate that the other security staff checked in on us, notified the manager, offered me chairs & to carry my scooter up the stairs SO THAT I WOULD NOT have to stand on 1 foot. I appreciated the manager Paul Potts coming over to apologize & offering our grp complimentary drinks for the bouncers bad behavior. I understand the situation w/the scooter, the space in the bar or liability. However it definitely could have been handled differently & communicated without discriminating against someone who has a disability. The manager made a comment about him not being from around here...Poland. I am not the person who would want someone to get fired over discrimination but WOW he was very offensive & I was humiliated. Marcin def could be a reason for a LAWSUIT. He is the ambassador or 1st impression of the bar. Discrimination is a serious offense. One day that FOOL may have a disability& would not want to be mistreated.
Yeah, historians. Wow. Best beer prices in town, worst burger. Fries are good. I go there twice a week.

The beer selection here is great as is the views and cityscape of the upstairs balcony.  The heat lamps are nice too.  Overall historians does get very picked and with the shotgun building style of the first floor you are squeezing through people to get to the stairs.  The staff is always busy and doesn't seem to have enough staff to explain certain beers to customers when asked.  Will be coming back.

Worst dining experience. Chips were stale salsa and guacamole pre packaged. If you order a burger, they don't put it on a plate..veggie burger was Mush with no lettuce or onion. Just a sorry Mush roasted red pepper and a gummy pretzel  bun.  it's wrapped in parcel paper and tied with a cord. Mine was tied upside down so when I opened it my soggy fries dumped into my lap. Taco chicken seemed like it came from a can.. maybe that's why they were a dollar. the staff was miserable

Used to frequent this bar and won't go back. What an a hole. Guy at the bar last night refused us for only having A drink. A drink? Really? Just one beer. Lazy bartenders. I walked in with a group of 6 people and all of us had one drink prior to walking down to historians. Lazy piece of poop I wouldn't have been treated this way if I were a 50 year old man. I'm 25.......don't u guys want to make money?? All the other staff is Ok

Our waitress, Tory, and Nikki, the manager were amazing. We learned so much about the beers they offer! They let us have samples and then guided us through selections. We had a minor problem and they gave us a round of shots as an apology. Such incredible service! The food is excellent. Try the veggie burger and the pizza sliders! Highly recommend.

Great cheeseburger happy hour and wide local draft selection. LOADS of french fries included.

Not sure how I feel about the wrapped butcher paper the burger and fries were served in.. Unique, but it was awkward to have at the bar.

Look forward to going back to check out the night crowd.

I love this place. Came in here with a group of 28 for my birthday and they handled it flawlessly. Big groups can be tough but Carrie was great and Nikki the manager was wonderful as well. Thanks so much for a great birthday!!!!

This is a great place to take out of town guests. The rooftop is awesome. We lived in Baker when they opened and have made it back a few times. The tap lists are solid and staff is efficient. The crowd can be a bit rough with drunk industry kids.  

Local food and beers. These might be my favorite nachos in Denver. Menu includes a little bit of everything.

Saturday morning equals brunch!!!
Came here around 11 AM today in need of some food and mimosas. We were seated right away on their gorgeous, clean, rooftop on a beautiful 70 degree Denver day.
I did their bottomless mimosas, only $10! Which is an incredible deal. The waitress came around frequently and didn't even wait until the glasses were empty. Half-full glasses were filled immediately. Excellent service!
I got the eggs Benedict for my meal. The eggs were perfect but the English muffin was a little hard and the ham tasted like it was from a frozen meal. I was disappointed in the food! I did try my friends French toast and it was pretty good. Not too sweet but still yummy! Not really memorable though, to be honest. 
I would come back, but just for their killer mimosa deal and roof top. The food at snooze is far superior!
No complaints here! Great beer selection, but the best part is the varying serving sizes (5/10/16 oz) They have a huge rooftop bar. Staff were all attentive and helpful as well.

Favorite bar on Broadway, hands down. The beer menu is phenomenal (for any place that isn't a snobby beer bar... Not that I don't like a snobby beer bar from time to time). 

Everyone loves the food, but every time I go, I look at the menu, decide it's sort of overpriced when nothing really grabs my attention, and stick with the good beer. Hence 4 instead of 5 stars. 

Now, for the important part: ROOFTOP PATIO. NOT IN LODO. DON'T TELL ANYONE HOW GREAT IT IS. It will always be packed. You won't care. Because it's that nice to be outside on a warm Colorado night talking to your friends and watching the sun set over the mountains.

Historians has a great (although very crowded) rooftop deck, and they make yummy Bloodies. I felt bad for the waiters, as they were constantly struggling to get around peoples' chairs; they have a few more tables up there than they probably should. The views and atmosphere are really nice, though!

My Bloody Mary was good, friends enjoyed their beers, but our food was more miss than hit. A few orders were messed up, and some stuff tasted bad or was obscenely small - ahi salad and pork green chili, respectively. My friend said her ahi was flavourless, and my chili (photo attached) was literally the size of an espresso/tea cup. I'm talking a proper little British pinky-out teacup, not a Starbucks mega grande. Boo.

I'd come back for drinks.

I am a fan of this place for its rooftop patio and wide variety of beers. I knock it one star for lack of service attention and food quality... I had little mini pizzas one time and if you like straight marinara from a can then by all means try them out, but I suggest just sitting at the bar for quicker service and not having anything other than their nachos.

Their rooftop is awesome - it has a full bar, plenty of tables, heat lamps, and twinkle lights. It gets really crowded on weekends and the staircase opens right at the bar so it's always a log jam.

Their burgers are good! I suggest the pretzel and sausage kabobs or the PB&J burger. I do not recommend their salmon dinner. It wasn't very good, though as my friends so kindly pointed out, I ordered salmon at a bar... 

Their happy hour is great! They have various beer sizes so you can order a bunch of smaller ones rather than a full pint.

The crowd is an odd mix, but is typical for Broadway. It's definitely a casual place and most people will be in jeans and flannels. Though there are always girls in heels and bodycon dresses...on Broadway...

The ROOF is the place to be ! Don't even think about sitting downstairs . Think of it as a entryway to get to the rooftop lounge . 
Packed with after-work urban hipsters , the summer breeze and open air seating ( or standing ) make it seem less crowded than it is .Busy waitstaff hurry about , but may take awhile to get to you . You can always belly up to the bar yourself if you're"parched". 
Happy Hour runs til 7 ! $1 tacos & drink specials for an  "extra hour " than surrounding venues ! 
  Wide selection of brews ,ciders & wine !
Also good ginger brew & copper mugs for Mules or Dark & Stormys. We thought the cherry cider was real nice -- unexpectedly Tart . Also liked the raspberry wheat brew .  
The view is a bit dumpy of back alleys & dumpsters , not the BEST rooftop view.& 
it did take " forever" to get a round of drinks ,but I would like to try the food next time , and just might add that 5th star.

Historians is a great place for beer. They have a prime location on Broadway just before downtown Denver and they focus on finding great local and domestic beer. They also have a extensive food menu, even a kids menu for their day hours. They are open early enough for brunch goers craving food and mimosas and above all they have a very nice outdoor rooftop patio (also heated) with a nice view of Denver. Did I mention they do free beer college nights every first Monday of the month? They invite a featured brewery to teach about their beers. That remain on tap for the month. There's free beer tastings and the Brewers often bring free swag to give away. I highly recommend Historians Ale House!
Cool spot to hang .... sweet area also.

The beer battered cheese is a must try. Every time I come we always order more than one. The egg plant is great. I did not like they charged an extra $1 just because my boyfriend wanted only spinach in his salad, I see why someone commented that the owner is cheap.

On paper, this place seems good. The all-Colorado beer list is kind of impressive and, walking by, it seems like a well-designed, fun place to hang out. The staff has always been pretty nice and some of the happy hour deals seem appealing.

But inside it's just kind of eh. A lot of this isn't the bar's fault exactly. Maybe it's just not my scene. If you visit malls as a recreational activity, then this might be a place you'll like. Are you looking for a place that will seem urban to your friends from the 'burbs? Great, make a reservation. Otherwise, there are probably places you'll enjoy more just a block or two away.

I have been here several times, and each time everything has been consistently great. Service, food, and drinks all superb. Gets a little crowded, thus difficult to navigate in and out for a smoke. But otherwise, a perfect neighborhood hangout.

Quality neighborhood pub with an excellent draft selection and spacious rooftop deck. Unfortunately, thunderstorms chased us off the rooftop, but it was a Wednesday evening and were able to easily find a table downstairs. The wait staff and bartenders were friendly. The crowd is mostly late 20s to mid-30s young professionals. 

We only ordered a hummus plate to snack on, so I can't speak to the food but my friend says it's better than average bar food. Reasonable prices and descent happy hour deals -- I'd happily come back to Historians!

I want to give this place more stars because their upstairs patio is so nice, but unfortunately it is consistently sub par. The food seems cool but it's often badly cooked and the service is just okay. I don't blame the servers and bartenders, though. Bad service is often due to lack of assistance and enthusiasm from management (I've worked in many restaurants). The beer options are quite good but seriously over priced. If you're looking for an alternative, head north on Broadway to The Fainting Goat. Actually, don't. That place is already too busy and I need a table for me :).
Great rooftop to grab some drinks and food. Had the fish and chips which were okay, maybe I just wasn't hungry enough. The cheese curds were great and a total must have.
Beautiful spot with a wide selection of craft beer. The bar upstairs is a bit small when the garage doors are closed but it's well heated when it's cool out. A little give and take.

I am ALL about Historians Ale House! They have one of the BEST lunch specials I've came across since living here in Denver. For anyone who hasn't been here yet, the lunch special (from 11 AM-3PM) is a cheeseburger, fries and any beer or soft drink of your choice.. for $5! It's perfect for when you want a delicious and fulfilling lunch on a budget. 

They have one of the best selections of beer, and they're all on tap. I absolutely love coming here in the summertime to enjoy the upstairs patio. They have another huge bar upstairs as well as an awesome set up with a nice view. When it gets super hot in the summer, they even have misters they turn on for the hardcore lunch-break sun enthusiast. It's an awesome lunch experience for sure.

I would definitely recommend trying out Historians Ale House for lunch or even dinner sometime. The great specials, food and beer are enough to keep Historians in anyones mind for lunch time!

I have a love and almost hate relationship with this place.  Like, I'm super split.

I love the patio.
I hate the indoor part.  Bad use of space, bad acoustics, not good for groups.

I like the food.
They do it "Pittsburgh" style sandwiches and don't give you plates because they're wrapped it up in paper and just plop it on your table.  I guess this is fine, but when you've ordered a fried egg in your burger it's pretty messy-something I don't need help with as I'm clumsy by myself, thank you!

The waitstaff is usually awful.
The beer selection is better (way better) than the nearly identical establishment Irish Rover down the street.  

The menu selection is pretty big.
They add some random things in the food that don't need to be added.

Vegetarian options.
Sometimes they give everything on one plate, like street tacos, which mortified my vegetarian friends who were dining with my carnivore friends.  Plus, both parties had food allergies so they rightfully had to request a redo.

I'm torn.  My friends are torn.  We can't decide if we like this place or if we're going to divorce it, a la like we did with Punch Bowl Social.

Also, not having umbrellas on each table for a roof top patio place is an interesting choice.  (At least as of May they did not have them...).  Being annoyed at wanting the table wiped down is also a weird policy.  As is serving your food, in said paper wrapping, while being huddled up and standing at the bar because it's raining.

At best, Historian's Ale House still has some may-jah kinks to work out.  At worst it's not as great as I want it to be.

I went here yesterday evening with my boyfriend and best friend to watch the Broncos game. 

Pros:
*Very cool rooftop with fireplaces and heating lamps.
*It wasn't crowded so we were able to be right in front of the TV to watch the game.
*The food: We all shared pork sliders, chips & salsa, fish & chips, & street tacos, delicious!
*The prices, standard for the area, meals around $11, draft beers $4.50-$6
*The atmosphere of the interior, beautiful wood. Very well designed.
*Decent crowd

Cons:
*ALL ASPECTS OF THE SERVICE!

When we sat down, we waited a considerable amount of time before our brunette waitress who takes risks with eye shadow colors and wears leggings to work comes and plops our menus down (not enough menus might I add) and then runs away as if we have the ebola virus without saying so much as a word to us.

We wait another considerable amount of time. I go up to what looks like the manager and kindly mention we are ready to order drinks. To my dismay, a couple minutes later, the same girl comes up with the fakest smile & tone imaginable and takes our order. We were all  nice to her, assuming she had a rough day. I was a server for 6 years. I understand.

She barley returns to get our food order after dropping off drinks. When she does, she is walking away while we are still ordering. Turning around to barely catch what we want, her back literally faced to us as if trying to run away. It was extremely awkward and bizarre.

Our food took much longer than it should have, probably over 20 minutes. It's a good thing we were occupied watching the game & didn't just come here for dinner or we would have cancelled it and left. When it did arrive, some girl dropped it off and also ran away before I could ask for silveware and an extra plate, so I had to get up once again and find it myself.

No one came to ask how the food was. Our waters remained empty most of the night, dirty plates sitting in front of us, and constantly wanting to order more beers as we saw the bottom of our glasses all too often. 

Eventually some other girl started serving us and crazy eye shadow was no where to be seen. The next server was attentive, although she seemed very exhausted and not very lively or personable.

I won't be returning, a huge part of why people go out instead of staying in is because they are greeted and waited on in a friendly manner. If the service is this bad, it really ruins your time, no matter how good the food or atmosphere is. There is too much good competition nearby, don't waste your time checking out Histrorians.

Great atmosphere. Prompt service. My daughter ordered a 'Black and Blue" burger. Amazing. We ordered the 'Fillet.'  Came out way overcooked. But they immediately resolved it and brought a new one. Wouldn't order again the fillet is drowned (!) in a sauce, almost like a roast? Just not my idea of eating this high end cut. Flavor was very good though. Very nice staff. Great beer and cool rooftop! Needed music though.... :) Overall,definitely going back.

Great location and very nice rooftop patio. Also had a great drink selection. Their downfall is the food. First time we went, we just had the chips and guac which was fairly bland and forgettable. The second time we went for dinner. My husband had the blackened salmon Asian salad which visually was not appealing, but said it was decent and filling. I ordered the blackened chicken sandwich and got a side salad instead of fries. Could tell the lettuce wasn't super fresh but it was okay. The sandwich came in a big brown bag, which was awkward to open and eat in a restaurant.
