They ended up giving me fries as well, which I didn't want, but they ended up being luke warm so didn't end up eating many anyway. Great ambiance just not good execution on the food.
Awesome staff, Bridget was amazing! Great specials and BURGERS - THE BURGERS!! So good. Def stop in

Happy Hour all day on Monday!  Yahoo for us! Enjoying the Funkwerks Tropic King Saison - YUMMY!
Quite a few choices on tap - have to check out the latest on the menu as there are more than a few to choose from and they are more than willing to let  you have a taste before you make you firm choice.
My husband and I have been here a few times and have enjoyed it each and every time. We have noticed that the level of service is quite good. All of the bartenders seems to take an interest in giving their patrons a good vibe. They have all been very personable and attentive.
The sliders we had were delicious and the fresh cheese curds are to die for - fabulous.

Great draft beer selection, service and ambiance. Great happy hour that I will be back to when I visit. I enjoyed my time at the bar, but wish I would've tried the food. That's what next time is for though!

Beer: fairly wide selection with good happy hour prices that enable you to try a wide variety. 

Fried pickles: perhaps my favorite in Denver. Not overly greasy and with excellent flavor. Crunchy instead of soggy. 

Environment: rooftop patio is always pleasant and the inside has plenty of seating options depending on the size of your party.

I really like historians, at first glance from the storefront, it looks like a pretty typical bar with a few tables and booths set across from the bar, but the real gem here is the rooftop patio! We keep coming back and always make a beeline straight upstairs to the patio. In warm weather there is plentiful outdoor space with an upper and lower seating area as well as an upstairs bar. There is table service which is especially nice, but you also still have the bar as an option. In colder weather the bar is in a nice covered area with a few tables, and there is a fireplace and numerous heat lamps scattered across the deck making it just as pleasant.

The beer list here is expansive, with many local rotating taps, they tend to feature a local brewery for a few weeks to a month at a time, the last time we went Denver Beer Co was featured, but I've also seen Dry Dock, Lonetree, and Caution brewing all featured before. The beer menu is separated out nicely into beer categories making it easy to find just what you are looking for. The food here is also quite good, certainly above average for bar food. From the appetizers (such as cheese curds, fried pickles, and a neat brat/pretzel dish) to the burgers (of which there are several interesting preparations) all the food exceeds the bar food standard heartily, while not quite making it to gourmet status.

Historians to me is a perfect place to catch a happy hour or early evening drink, with the food as a good option for either a snack or a quick dinner. The prices are reasonable, the service quite good, and until they get crowded at night, it's easy to hold conversation and enjoy the amazing views from the rooftop.
I've tried several times, food and service is atrocious. My group of friends have sworn it off for life.

I have to say, I'm surprised by the 3.5 star rating that this place currently has. We stopped in earlier this week and absolutely loved it. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful with recommendations, which we appreciated, considering how many beers they have on tap. 

We were here for several hours, and over the course of the afternoon we split the fried cheese curds (some of the best I've had in Denver), the hummus plate (but yum - red pepper hummus), and the burger special. The burger special really is a great deal... for $4.95 you get a cheeseburger, fries, and a beer. We upgraded to the veggie patty, and even I loved it - and I'm a carnivore. It was the best veggie burger I've had in a long time, and even my sister (an actual vegetarian) was very impressed. I see there are some complaints about how they serve their burgers and sandwiches - wrapped in butcher paper and tied with string - but I loved it. It was like getting my meal as a little gift. :)

I'm so, so happy to have stopped in - and even happier that this place is only a few blocks from my house. Along with Doughtery's, it's my new favorite neighborhood bar.

My fiancé and I went for a bite to eat and drink after I got a tattoo down the street.  It was 6pm on a Monday and there was hardly anybody there.  Sat at the bar.  Had good service and there is a great selection of drinks.  One of the beers my fiancé picked was not good tasting and they offered him another choice, no charge.  

The best part of my meal was the PBJ Burger!  OMG!  It was so good and cooked perfectly. The fries were also amazing.  My fiancé had the bronco burger and said it was amazing as well.  

We would definitely go back and maybe this time try the rooftop and brunch!

My family decided on Historians Ale House for Mother's Day's brunch this year. I'll be honest, at first I was confused about the choice (I didn't know they had food, I thought we were gonna have a liquid brunch!) but then I looked up their menu and quickly got excited.
We arrived pretty much right when they opened. They were able to seat our rather large group right away. The servers and bartenders were friendly and attentive. And when I say attentive I mean I never saw the bottom of my bottomless mimosa, mad props!
I had the Spanish Hangover for breakfast and it was pretty good. I think the spicy hollandaise was my favorite part. It was spicy but not too spicy that it overpowered everything else on the plate. Jeff S. had the prime rib hash. I figure as the girlfriend it's kinda my right to try out his breakfast too. It was amazing!  When we go back that's what I'll be ordering. 
After the most of the family left a few of us hung out at the bar for a while. Again, super friendly staff and very attentive. 
Everything was reasonably priced and the vibe was nice and mellow just like Sunday brunch should be. I see another Sunday brunch here in the future.

I love Historian's. The food is good and even for my friend who came here with significant dietary concerns. (Gluten-free buns are the BEST!) I had the Southwest Chicken Burger and it was DELISH! (Southwest Burger except with chicken breast instead.) 
People have complained about the service but ownership should be proud of her and the service tonight. Tara, our server, handled everything with calm and pleasure even though it was storming outside, the rooftop was crowded with people crammed under cover and some people didn't seem to be very considerate. She made sure people enjoyed themselves and were accommodated.
From the service to kitchen, well done!

Date of Visit: 5/31/14

Stopped here on a Saturday afternoon to meet with some friends. The rooftop was a bit cramped, but offered nice views and a lot of seating. The menu is pretty simple, but everyone at our table liked their orders, so it appears they do simple well. We enjoyed various draft beers as well as the Double Layered Prime Rib Nachos, which were very tasty. The draft beer selection was quite impressive and decently priced. They offer a ton of local CO beers, as well as some unique West Coast brews. The happy hour deal ($2.50 drafts) is hard to beat as well.

Overall a solid draft house with solid bar eats.

Awesome brunch spot. Spanish hangover = the bomb!!! I already want to go back. and $10 bottomless mimosas = trouble, but awesome! Cool atmosphere. Went on a rainy day so it wasn't over crowded and had to sit inside. I hear the rooftop in nice weather is awesome so I'll need to go back. Definitely recommend this place.

Very solid place.

Good food, good beer, good vibes, and a great patio.

They have a lot of beer, and while very few of them are what I would consider great beers, or harder to find beers even, they have a very solid selection, sure to work for almost anyone.

Food was much better that I expected, and have had pretty good service every time that I have been here.

The thing that really makes this place stand out is the patio, very cool rooftop.   Great views and just a good overall feel.

I don't make it down to Historians often, but when I am in the area, it is a worth a stop.

Update:

Still not sure I'd give it the extra star, but after coming back here three or four times since my first review, i have not been dissappointed - which seems a bit surprising given many other reviews say it's hit or miss. 

The waitress (i think Jonni) said she was new, but was great. Little things that made her newness come through were more than made up for by her personability and excellent service.

Side note: they still seem to be figuring out their pricing on some things, but they've done away with the $25 pint of Matilda. Good move there. Go with the brewery of the month at $2.50  for 10 oz and you can usually have some pretty darn good beer at a reasonable price.

After passing by the brunch wait at The Hornet I came upon Historians Ale House to watch the World Cup finals. I quickly snagged two seats at the bar as other patrons eyed them. However, I quickly realized that these seats were open because the TV directly in front was out of service. We ended up turning to our right to watch the TV over the doorway instead. 

I ordered a local Scotch Ale and the fish and chips. They paired well, the dark and smooth beer along with the fried but moist fish. The chips were a little dry, but I happily doused them with malt vinegar. 

Our friend joined us about halfway through the game, famished from her morning exercising. Unfortunately, the kitchen was backed up and they would not put in her food order. They offered a free beer, but she needed something in her stomach first. With an unestimated wait time, she snacked on the remainder of my fries, lacking the much-needed protein. About 20 minutes later she departed for the grocery store and they started taking orders shortly thereafter. 

Two things you should have working smoothly on a big game day? Your TVs and your food service. What worked was good, but what didn't was definitely noticed.

My husband and I had our first date at this Applebee's location. Our first date ended up lasting a little over 5 hours. The server made no stink about us staying this long and talking. We went back at our one year dating anniversary, and the staff let us pick the table where we had our first date to sit. The service is great. The food is pretty standard, but good too. This is definitely a popular location, so it is a bit noisy, but overall definitely worth a visit.

So lately I've been going to Applebees and just getting takeout I love the fact that you could just drive up and they bring out your food however I guess they change the menu I realized that they changed the menu that is one of the worst things that can happen at a restaurant for me but I ended up getting the salmon anyway it was so dry there was no artichoke sauce and they didn't even put a lemon slice I have to say I was very disappointed

The service is horrible!
We got here and waited 15 minutes for a server to even approach us. When we got up to tell someone who worked here they were polite but when the server came to the table she looked and acted like she wasn't in the mood to serve us. Seriously the only good thing about this place is the Butter Pecan Blondie.
Service was exceptional, food was horrible...  Steak was tough, and food bland. Last time I will try eating here...

The 3 stars are for the wait staff, not the food!
Applebee's new menu is terrible! The meal I ordered was inedible as was the replacement meal I took "to go". Even the green beans were a problem as the stems were still on the beans!. Herbs are a wonderful gift unless not properly used. management  needs to convey this problem to the corporation  who manages these restaurants and correct these ASAP. I for one will eat at at Rosie's.

After several visits and several bowls of too salty french onion soup, I made a call to that location and spoke with the Manager, Michelle.  She was super nice and interested in resolving the problem.  She also emailed me a gift card for the entire amount of ticket on our most previous visit!!  When we visited again, we were very pleased when ordering our usual bowls of french onion soup.  They were perfect and have been on every visit since.  Clearly, they have changed vendors or something!!
Thank you Michelle and Applebee's.  We will continue our patronage!!!

This place is terrible. We waited one hour. In that hour we never got our appetizers and our food wasn't even on the way. Not to mention the horrible service, horrible servers and hosts. The dishes were dirty. It was a terrible experience.

I don't often go to Applebee's and I am not really sure why not.  Well that's about to change a little.  Needed a place for a quick lunch on the way to the airport this afternoon so decided what the heck.    We were quickly greeted and seated.  

It's been well over a year since I have visited this or any location so everything on the menu had changed.  Decisions decisions.   I went with the pick 2 lunch Tomato Basil soup and 4 cheese mac with Honey Glazed Chicken Tenders. 

I was beyond happy with my selections.  Everything was absolutely delicious.  I was actually floored over the Mac and Cheese.  This was certainly not something that was boil noodles and squeeze a sauce over it.  There was roasted jalapeno bits through out the cheese sauce and covered in very large pieces of REAL BACON.    

I was in a Mac and Cheese mood and this certainly hit the mark for me today.   Oh yes.. the soup.  This was a nice little cup of creamy Tomato Basil goodness. 

Their happy hour starts at 3 so this also fits into my day nicely.  

I will reurn!

I dont normally like going to applebees but could not be happier with my experience. We had the pleasure (and it was our pleasure) to have DJ as our server. Hes by far best server we have had at applebees but also probably ever. He keeps up on your needs and wants and is very informational. Also knows how to sell ; ). I also work in the industry and its so refreshing to see someone treat me the way i treat my guest. Thanks DJ your great def be seeing you soon!
Been here for 44 min...still no food... Not even that busy in here.. But I guess food is hard to come by in this joint...

I have to say the food was pretty awful. I ordered the butchers meat and potatoes which was as visually unappealing as it was unappetizing. Looked like Fancy Feast tasted like cheap frozen tv diner. My wifes salmon was passable but she thought 15 dollars as a crime for the size and flavor. Her grilled veggies were raw and the so called bed of spinach was a pathetic smear of wet mush. The kitchen was slow to get food out but our server was nice and did a good job taking care of our needs. The server picked up on our displeasure and informed the manager who seemed uncertain in his responsibilities.

Yeah, I know it's a chain, and it's next door to the hotel and we had been on the road from Durango, 7 hours!
I opted for the "Sizzling Double Barrel Whisky Sirloins" with garlic mashed taters my Mrs. had a side salad (huge, an I helped!) and French Onion soup and considering how fast she wolfed it down it must have been good!
My steak was a perfect "rare" and the sauteed peppers and onions fantastic! The potatoes were good also.
I took 1/2 of my steak with me and "nuked it" in the am and ate it with the "free" breakfast the hotel offers the next day!

Thanks Brittany, your the best!

I have always had wonderful service here and the greeter has always seated me in a comfortable spot. Especially if me and my S.O. Were on a date. The waitresses have always been polite and never flirty, but always fun. Great place for casual date nights!

This is probably the worst Applebee's I have ever been to when it comes to service (yes I know it's Applebee's). So close to our house but not worth the attitude and terrible service. This was the final straw. We went in and two employees were gossiping. A server walked by and said to them "are you girls helping anyone?"  They responded "no", then can you please seat them? We were seated and not a single person came to our table within Fifteen minutes. This would be unacceptable to me even if they were to be busy.

They don't know how to cook a steak took three times and still didn't get it right. Should have given me a discount,or taken it off the bill for having to deal with the trouble. They didn't even have the manager come talk to me.

Applebee's would just be Applebee's if it wasn't for the superb level of service received in this location. Looking for a drink and dinner after a long day of work, we wound up here. Service was spectacular from the second we walked through the door. (You know your in a good place when everyone is smiling at you.)
Steven was our server and I'm not even joking or exaggerating when I say he is the best server I've ever had. Having been a server myself, I know having just two people sit at your booth at 9:45pm is not the best case scenario. However, Steven was overly attentive and catered to our every need before we even knew we needed it! He was spot on and a rock star even helping out the host and cleaning tables, even when he had an entire section full at a late hour. 
Consider my expectations exceeded! Will definitely return back next Friday night and ask for Steven again!!!! I suggest you do the same, fellow yelper!

Came to this particular location with my family and mother in law who is visiting from California. The moment we walked in we were so called greeted by a hostess who offered us seating in the "bar area"   We declined the offer and  told the hostess we prefer not to be seated in the bar area. The hostess immediately had a attitude for some unknown reason, gave us the worst look, rolled her eyes and didn't say anything to us about finding us a table. Finally after 10 minutes she found us a table. 

We didn't have any issues with anything else, but if you decide to come to this specific location, prepare your self for a hostess with attitude. The first thing you want in any restaurant is to feel welcome and greeted with kindness. Not in this case. 

The food was great, server was great and enjoyed our meal.
I hate going to eat.  This was My best  experience in along time. Great cooks. And manager server was great. Lets see next time  it was mothers day

Service is fine, but food is horrible. Ordered the $25 for two that includes an appetizer and 2 entrees. The onion rings were so battered that you didn't get much onion taste, and they were hard. The ribs that I had were dry and overcooked and the Mac and cheese with bacon looked better in the picture than what they served. Avoid this place.

I was here having a couple drinks and grabbing something to eat. The bartender was cool as hell. I asked him about his specialty drink and he made me a couple margaritas that were to reckon with. 

My meal was pretty good - it's Applebee's ladies and gentleman. Usually when you go to a chain restaurant the food is pretty consistent. If it isn't, then you need to say something to management. 

On a lighter note, I was watching the NCAA tournament and was taking a bite of my meal when the player from Louisville had a compound fracture to his leg on national TV. Needless to say, I lost my appetite immediately.
Steak and shrimp was good. I would recommend this plate to friends and family. I. Give 4 out of 5. I personally recommended this plate to anyone

Tonight we decided to stop and have a wonderful family dinner. Our server was Kimberly F, and she was the most amazing server we had ever, and I mean EVER, HAD!!! She checked on us to make sure everything was going as we wanted.  She even made sure our glasses were always filled, that's a big, big plus for us. I will travel 45 minutes just to see her welcoming smile and receive her wonderful service. The food is great but she is even greater! I will defiantly be back and ask for her. Thank you so much Kimberly F. You surly made our night!

Ok so the food was OK but what pisses me off is that they refuse to sell alcohol to you if you have a "vertical ID". I am from California and there, if you are under 21 when the license is issued, you get a vertical license. I have never had a problem anywhere else... They said it's their policy... How can refusing to serve someone over 21 with a VALID LEGAL form of identification be a policy! Applebee's, you need to change....
Great to find a place in Aurora that is open late. Their specials were great especially five dollar cheeseburger sliders and half-price appetizers after 9 PM. Good choice for vampires like me.

We had a ladies night out last night and Stephan was awesome at seating our table of 10 at 6 pm. Steven was our server and despite the separate checks and requests for discounts of military and senior citizen he was calm and patient. Our meals were fantastic so kudos to the kitchen too. We will be coming back again. Thanks for making our night enjoyable. We had a lot of needed laughs and good conversation. Thank you!

This restaurant was fair for the price. The waiters were nice and helpful. I came with a group and most people liked the food while some were disappointed in the four cheese mac and cheese. Personally I had the chicken tenders platter and was not bad for the price. Overall this restaurant is decent. I would compare it to a slightly less quality TGI Fridays.
I found a gram of broken plastic in my 4 cheese mac & cheese it was my last bite,  no pun intended lol manager sucks at dealing with situations horrible manager,  great bartender!

Went tonight for the 2 for 20 deal. They keep changing the menu which is both good and bad. I missed some of the things I used to get but there are new things that looked good too.

Always amazing oriental chicken salad. It just takes 30 minutes to eat it. 

Also had potato chip and queso app. OMG amazing. I would eat the queso with a spoon.

Was not too impressed with the desserts. But oh well i had an app so no dessert for fatty.
New bourbon black and blue burger had excellent flavor. My wife got the blackened steak penne and loved it as well.
Nice service good food good for the buckgoin between for  4-6pm and 9pm till closing half off on app and good happy hour drinks and price s no I don't them
Food is okay. On Tues, they have trivia and happy hour from 9pm to 11pm is 2 for 1 on most drinks and appetizers.
You can tell how good this place is by how many Koreans keep eating here. Broth, vegetables and meat are all quality

I gave this one a try since I miss Bún bò Hu so much and I still haven't found a good one herein Denver.
First, a very distinctive smell (mold) as soon as I walked in. Decent time for my order to come out. Taste ok, doesn't satisfy my craving for Bún bò Hu.
Finding hair looking object through out the soup. Will not go back!!

Don't know what happened today but my pho took long time to come out.  Took so long, I had to miss the class. 
 
We ordered crab cheese wonton and two bowls of pho.  Wonton came out quick but noticed only had 5 pcs.  When I looked back at my past pictures, I had 6.  Hmm..what happened?   In addition, food portion has gone down quite a bit also. Mine didn't have much meat and the other bowl didn't have much noodles. 

Hmmm..

Nice clean restaurant.  Spring rolls in peanut sauce were the best. Delicious. Both main dishes a little light on flavor. I had beef and rice and my husband had beef pho.  Need more instruction on how to use the different sauces.  Will try this place again.

I received a recommendation from a co-worker. I ordered 2 medium Pho GAs and the viatnamese eggrolls. Ordered to go. 

We were at first were worried that the broth was so clear. Don't let that fool you, it is very delicious. The viatnamese eggrolls are a solid 3.5 stars. 

We will be back.

Tien is an absolutely hands down best server I have ever had. He was fast nice he cleaned up all my dishes as completed even boxed my items to go. The food was excellent and I would recommend the egg rolls crispy with fish sauce you roll it in the fresh lettuce and it's so decadent!! Thank you so much for such a healthy meal I did the vege pho with added steak. The meal was so good I'll recommend this place to all my friends! You can't beat excellent service and great food for this price.

"Meh. I've experienced better" sounds about right to me. We walked in and were not greeted by anyone but noted a half full restaurant. We stood at the front of the restaurant awkwardly for a few minutes before we were seated. Since no one came out to greet or said much of anything when we walked in, that's what it was. Awkward. Do we seat ourselves? There was no signage. 

Anyway, I also noticed after sitting in the booth for a bit that other people just came in and sat down on their own. Is this just something that's unspoken? This doesn't work for a restaurant...we need signage! 

We had waited a good 10 minutes before someone came out and was clearing a table behind us. I finally had enough and had to ask for menus. What also peeved me was that people who came in AFTER us seemed to get served BEFORE us. Major peeve and major thumbs down. Menus, condiments, utensils you name it. We got it last after a good other few groups sat down. 

Ordered chicken pho which was pretty decent. Overall, flavors were good but the amounts of food that are typically given at other establishments were much less. Same price, less food. You may or may not be ok with that. My friend got a grilled shrimp bun dish and he got jipped on the shrimp. 

So to sum it up, I would definitely not choose to return based on this experience. Service was completely lacking, food portions not as good as compared to other restaurants. Hence the reason I will not rave. 

The optimist in me wants to say maybe this was just a bad night and maybe they were short staffed?
Awesome crab wontons! The broth had a different spice than I am use to, but still good. We ordered to go, so not sure on the other services.

I come to this pho place a few times already. I wouldn't say that it's the best I've had but it satisfies my craving pretty well. I've the bun bo hue and it's average. Their pho is definitely better than a lot of places though. I usually go to the one off of havana (pho 95 I think), but now that I found a pho place that's close to my house and it is good, I do not need to go so far! 

We ordered their shrimp and beef salad, it was $9.95 and it is not worth it. If you've had the traditional Vietnamese shrimp salads then you would understand. It was bland and there were not a lot of ingredients mixed in.... and what I thought weird was that they added lettuce in so it looks fuller on the plate. 

I definitely recommend their pho, everything else is just alright.

Never knew it was such a good restaurant until I ordered from a really lousy pho place today. Now it is officially my go-to place for pho. Can't beat its flavor.  Luv their soup. 

Fresh spring roll is my favourite too!

I got some to go from here this evening because apparently my usual pho place is re-using leftover broth from people's bowls they don't finish. Gross. SO, I went in to this spot-it wasn't busy yet, I was immediately greeted, and started browsing the menu. I decided on the egg rolls, and the pho with flank and brisket. It was ready quickly, and the place appears clean which is always good. 
 Got home and the waiter and I apparently miscommunicated or there was a mistake because I got the shrimp spring rolls instead- but oh my gosh, one taste of that peanut sauce and I didn't even care anymore! Yum. 
 The broth was a little lighter on flavors such as star anise, but overall good and WOW! They gave big portions of meat, noodles and weren't cheap on the basil like other places. 
 Can't speak for the table service there this visit, but we will definitely be back again.
5 star crab cheese wontons for sure!  Pho is always on point-noddles, broth, everything...the spring rolls are good, too.

We deceided to have pho for dinner. A great night for it on a chilly night. The service is always top notch. The food is always steaming hot and fresh. The wait staff is always friendly.The down fall is the restrooms could use some attention. I also noticed flies in the restaurant. Not good Pho 75. Otherwise I will return.
Had the shrimp spring rolls and #1 Pho. Delicious!!  Never a bad meal here. Large portions and big flavor!
Love this place.  The Pho is very good here and it's as good there as when I get it to go.

We ordered the crab wontons because of a previous review & they were large & fabulous, & you get 6 of them!  That did dull our appetite for our noodle bowls so we took half home but  they were tasty also.  Fast, friendly service --will recommend.

Spring rolls look plain at first sight but there's a slice of beef in the middle.  Egg rolls were good too because they came with TONS of lettuce and noodles, more than you need which is usually rare.

I had the #7 pho with brisket and flank.  They are very generous with the meat but it could've been more tender.  The broth is flavorful.  

What I didn't like were the boba drinks because they were overly sweet that my teeth hurt.

Probably more like a 3.5 stars but I can't give a .5 star and i cant justify a full 4. Stopped in for a later dinner and thought we'd try a new spot. We were seated promptly as there were only 3 other occupied tables. The waiter was very nice and we immediately had water and menus. It seemed to take forever to get our Vietnamese egg rolls and when they came out it looked like we only got a half order at a full order price. They were hot out of the fryer and the veggies were very fresh but definitely not proportionate to what a normal order looks like at any  other Vietnamese restaurant or to the amount of veggies left uneaten on the plate. Disappointing. Took forever for the pho to came which was surprising considering how quickly it is served everywhere else.  The Pho was good but on the pricier side for pho. Really hot and flavorful broth with a ton of green onion. Basic veggies accompanying the soup but missing culantro. Long story short is that we will continue to go to Pho 888 on Sable for Pho in Aurora.

The service is always great and the pho is spot on.  If you are in the area, this is the best spot in town.  The to go boxes are always nicely packaged.  The brisket seems well seasoned in comparison to other places in town and the broth is great.  You can taste the difference.  This has become our go to pho place.

Good place to get Vietnamese food or pho in Aurora.

Pho broth is flavorful, fried rice is good, eggrolls are yummy and made from real rice paper (bothers me when restaurants try to pass off things in Lumpia wrappers as Vietnamese eggrolls -- big taste difference!) 

Crab cheese wontons here are the BEST! Huge, stuffed to the brim with filling, and baked til they're nice and golden brown on top... you can tell they're homemade vs the frozen things you get everywhere else!

Staff is efficient and friendly.

Parking lot can be kind of treacherous in the winter as I swear the entire thing turns to a sheet of ice, but that's not their fault.

Our go-to place for a Vietnamese fix... when we don't feel like driving all the way across town to Federal! We introduce this place to all our friends, and every one ends up changing their go-to place to here! 

Only other downside (again, not their fault!) is the crappy neighbor of the Cajun place. Sometimes blasting their loud music so the bass is thumping through the walls, sometimes smoking out the entire shopping plaza with their grill... annoying!!!

Love this place because I can walk here from my house. Pho is good, but the staff has always been super friendly. Try the crab cheese wontons! They stuff them like your dad stuffed yo mama nine months before you were born.

It's OK, is all I can say about the food. Portion sizes were decent and food tasted OK, but nothing to rave about. Our table felt sticky, as did the floor, so that kind of took away from our enjoyment of the meal. Not to mention that for some reason, it took a long time for them to get the food out to our party of 7. Lots of tables that were seated after us received their food way earlier. I didn't think we ordered anything that should have taken a long time to prepare (pho, standard rice and vermicelli dishes) so maybe the long wait was so we could all get our food around the same time...except the food came out staggered so who knows. Given the plethora of other Vietnamese restaurants in the area, I would probably try others before considering returning to this one again.

The Crab Cheese Wontons are absolutely amazing!  Possibly the best I have ever eaten.  Definitely not your ordinary Crab Cheese Wontons.

We also ordered the Chicken Fried Rice and Seafood Pho, both were good, but not fantastic.  

I'm giving this restaurant 4/5 stars because the service was incredibly slow even though it wasn't very busy.  The server was slow and the food took quite a while to get to our table.  My review and experience was saved by the Crab Cheese Wontons.

Went here with my gf and her daughter.

Very tasty! Fast service  and good taste. There was a bit of a communication issue but other than that, very good!

I'll go again

My go to pho place when I'm at my boyfriend's place. Hits the spot for pho when I need it but I'm mainly in it for the nem nuong spring rolls that aren't on their menu and the fat crab cheese wontons. Their bun bo hue is surprisingly good and definitely more on the traditional side which is awesome!

My boyfriend and I come here all the time. Its our favorite place to get pho. They remember that I want extra limes and that he wants fish sauce without us asking. Generous portions. Usually very quick service. Their crab cheese wontons are by far the best I've ever had. They really stuff and pile the filling. No other crab cheese wontons even come close.

I used to be a customer of Pho Nam (previous restaurant in this space) so I came back.  Pretty similar menu, but just a few items more limited.  

I love their combo rice noodle bowl #16 and my husband enjoys the rice combonation plate #15.  It is great to have a place close to home I can get my noodle bowl craving from (since my absolute favorite place Saigon Bowl with a huge menu is on the way other side of town - HUGE menu).  I need to really try Pho someday but can't get past the rice noodle bowl....LOL!

They were very attentive here (almost too much).  Everything is tasty and veggies are fresh.

As I was driving away with take-out from a nearby restaurant, I noticed Pho 75 in the corner of the strip mall on the southeast side of Parker Road and Quincy.  I knew there had been a Pho restaurant here before, but I had never been to it.  I saw the "Grand Opening" banner hanging above the entrance, and made a mental note to check this place out.  I am very glad that I came back a couple days later to give them a try.

I ordered my standard Pho (Rare Steak, usually a #2) with a side of meatball.  Since I wanted to check out my other favorite items, I also ordered the Vietnamese spring roll (with shrimp).  The spring rolls came out quickly, and they were quite large.  Indeed, this would have been an appetizer better suited to two people.  The lettuce was nice and crisp.  The rice noodles inside were in the proper ratio.  And the shrimp was artfully visible through the wrapper.  The peanut sauce was flavorful, and had the slowly building medium heat that I enjoy.  So far, so good.

I was by myself and I had only ordered a small, so I was a bit surprised at the large plate of Pho veggies they brought out.  These veggies were cold, crisp, fresh, and abundant.  Along with the expected bean sprouts, thai basil, lime wedges, and jalapeno slices, they also provided ngo gai (aka culantro, Mexican coriander, or long coriander).  I was glad to see this, as many of the Pho places I have been to in the suburbs do not bother including this particular green.  Or else they substitute cilantro, which is just not quite the same.  When my small bowl of Pho arrived, I gave it the once over.  The amount of rare steak was appropriate (neither stingy, nor generous).  There were more green onions floating in the bowl than I normally see, but that was fine with me.  The broth was very good, and nicely flavorful.  For those who enjoy Pho, the broth really makes or breaks the whole shebang.  Everything came together well.  My side of meatball was a reasonable serving, and tasted just fine.

My only very minor complaint would be that the noodle to broth ratio was off a bit.  There were actually too many noodles in the bowl (I know, what a thing to whine about).  This made for a very hearty serving for a small, but I was wishing for more of the tasty broth.  Service was good, and the servers were friendly.  This is now my neighborhood Pho place, and I know I will be back again.

Although I've only had Pho a few times, and .I'm no expert, I really like this place. Located at Parker and Quincy, it is somewhat obscured by a liquor store, but if drive around the back, past the 7-11 and over the hellish pot-holes of Mordor, you will see this place in the corner.

The portions are huge, and the broth is excellent! A small is generally too much to eat as they fill it with noodles and meat, and it is just filling! The Crab Cheese Wontons are not to be missed either!

A group of us went there for dinner, and while we were served OK, this feels more like a lunch place or a take-out place. It just doesn't have that dinner atmosphere, but the food... good golly miss molly, is very good!

This is a decent place for pho but not my favorite in the Denver area. They charge more for their appetizers and bowls of pho than other places and seem a little stingy with the portions as well. Both times we've gone we got the Vietnamese eggrolls with only four little pieces (as opposed to eight at other establishments I've been to) and the rare steak pho. We've had the same server both times who is on the lackadaisical side and seems to be the only server there. The first time we went he brought out all of our food at once and the second time we had to ask him to get the appetizer first and then after waiting 15 minutes after we were done, flag him down to get our bill. Is the pho good? Heck yeah. The broth is legit and that's what makes the famous bowl but there's nothing really special about this place to keep me coming back for more.

Best Pho in Aurora by far!!! The staff is actually friendly which is huge for me!! (every other Pho place I go has extremely rude service) Not only are they friendly but their food is AMAZING! We ordered crab cheese wontons for an appetizer and just the presentation of them alone was impressive and the taste was even more impressive; highly recommended to get their wontons if you come here. And the Pho broth; oh man the Pho broth, words can't even describe how delicious! Definitely our new Pho spot we will be back soon!!
One of the most authentic Pho place in Aurora, Viet's own restaurant, and most importantly it is Not an Asian fusion

Not a great experience from beginning to end. When we entered, a man across the room simply pointed at a table with a menu on it and gestured for us to sit down before leaving to do other things.  He quickly brought water. Then much later a woman came up and asked us to order. I got Chicken Pho and my husband got chicken and rice. He asked for them to hold the pickled carrot as he doesn't like them. The waitress laughed and ridiculed him for not liking carrots, which was weird. When the food came, my soup was lukewarm. The chicken was extremely dry and over cooked and chewy. The amount of noodles was plentiful, which was the one redeeming factor. My husband asked for a fork since he has problems with fine motor things like using chopsticks. They never brought alone so he used my pho spoon. Not once did anyone come by to ask how our meals were or to refill water. When we finished we waited about 1/2 hour for the check. There were only about 6 other parties in the restaurant and was by no means busy. We didn't get to even see the bill before paying. The soup was just ok; service is bad; ambiance is weird and the dining area was freezing. Pass.

Great place but lacks service.  Long wait times to even order drinks so I would recommend figure out EVERYTHING you're going to order at the table and once the waiter/waitress gets to your table to order.  Food quality is amazing.  Hot and flavorful broth for Pho.  The egg rolls are great too.  However, with the kind of service we have received the last 2-3 times, we will drive the distance to other pho restaurants.  too bad because we live so close!
Most flavourful pho chay (vegetarian with tofu) I have had. Enormous portions - the large is akin to a pot of soup. Service is great, music is a good volume and the food is exceptional.
I love going here for some quick pho or simple rice plates. I always bring my friends with me and they enjoy coming here. The guys that serve needs to be a little more perky but they're not too bad.

So we were looking for a quick place to have dinner after class! We are notoriously late and arrived at 8:50 and noticed they closed at 9. We planned to just order take-out but they are were fine with us sitting down and eating! So sweet - and I always feel bad when we do it. But there was another couple there when we arrived and then they were still there after we ate and left - so we weren't the bad guys! Yay! 

Now for the Pho - some of the best of I have had! Broth is delicious and perfectly seasoned - add a little siracha and oyster sauce and we are in business. Noodles were perfectly al dente, all white meat chick shredded. Onions and some jalapeno just made it! It also came with a big place of mint, bean shoots and more jalapeno. It was great - hot and a little spicy (or maybe that was the siracha). But perfectly satisfying and the medium was huge! We also ordered the Vermicelli noodle bowl with chicken. The chicken had great flavor and all very fresh tasting! Fresh veggies and lettuce. Last - I had to try the Vietnamese coffee and it was awesome, strong, sweet with the condensed milk - just the way it is suppose to be!
I really enjoyed their pho and spring rolls. Service was great and the restaurants were clean.

This is by far my favorite pho place. The broth is really flavorful and I get the chicken and its never dry (you would think because it's in broth it would never be dry but there's been places I've been to that were pretty bad). Their crab cheese wontons and egg rolls are pretty delicious, too. The service is pretty fast and everyone is really nice.

I've eaten at Pho 75 several times and they're really fantastic. I really didn't think I liked pho before eating here, but I just wasn't eating anything this good before.  The prices are decent and I really enjoy grabbing their delicious spring rolls or egg rolls for a quick snack.  Definitely a great place to try, even if you don't think you like pho!

Pho is as close as it's going to get to federal in these neck of the woods.  The broth is flavorful and the service is good.  Atmosphere is a little dark and not as inviting.  Boba was blah. The flavor of the pho is not Americanize so I like that and that they do give you plenty of veggies. The only thing is the small bowl is a lot smaller than federal and I can never add all of my condiments in without it spilling over or have to eat some to add more. I'm so glad we now have a decent pho closer to home though.  Been back 3 times since.

Pho 75, 
Is the local pho for me, the broth is of a genuine home cooked flavor. Which is rare to find in most pho locations. The boba is amazing i have never had a bad batch of undercooked boba pearls. Quality of service could be better, but all food items are great. You won't be upset you came to this pho.

It is at a convenient place for me as I like to grab "brunch" before I need to get to my destination.  The service is so-so but if you go in regularly enough,  it actually becomes spectacular.  Those guys work hard, I got to cut them some slack. The deco needs some serious updating (definitely not a place where you want to take your date for your "first impression" dinner). The pho is actually pretty good but my favorite is their spicy beef noodle soup.  It tastes so different and authentic,  it is a must try.  If you are feeling adventurous, ask for their special Vietnamese menu. Most pho restaurants are affected by the lime shortage so expect to see lemons with your side of vegetables...ehhhhh..

This place was absolutely sickening. Not only was everything late, but when it finally got to the table my boyfriend found a greasy zip tie in his soup. The waiter acted like this happen all the time they kinda just shrugged it off. Will not be going there ever again.

There r so many outstanding places, dont bother with this one.  They made me feel like an intruder, the spring rolls were bad (no noodles, lots of chopped lettuce) and enough peanut sauce for one. Ugh!

Inside is really open and clean. The pho is great and service is really fast and friendly. About time someone added a pho closer than pho 79 off Mississippi and Havana.

Now I know this place used to be a bar but they cleaned it up really nice and you really would never be able to tell. It has multiple big screen TVs and music playing in the background. The chairs and booths are adequate but roomy and the floor and tables are really kept clean.

Onto the food.....meat is tender and broth is super hot and not greasy.  They have the typical pho side addons that are hoisin sauce sriacha and vinegar and chili paste.  

Staff is really quick and friendly but both times I've gone in they throw around "buddy" quite a bit. Aside from that zero complaints! Nothing like a clean pleasant place to eat that takes about 5 minutes from order to table.  Will be coming back.
I like the food, but the atmosphere in the place is strip-mallesque and the music they play is something I expect from a bad video game.
First visit here and it was delicious. The portions were huge so I would order a size down from what you think you are hungry for! Good service, we would go back.

Honestly, i come in here every so ofter because i live in the neighborhood. I always sit at the bar and john is usually the bar tender. I just have to say he always brightens my day and hes super considerate. Every time he has served me, he has always made a suggestion that made my experience that much better. This is why these 5 stars are for him.
To be honest I've never had a good service here and other locations. Riblettes are very dry with too much BBQ sauce. I've had the sirloin and it was overlooked even I asked for medium rare

Whoops.  That's what I get for not reading my fellow Yelper's reviews.  It took 50 minutes to get two SALADS after ordering on a Saturday where the restaurant was not very busy.  When they did come out, the portions were smaller than you would expect.  The server was quick to greet and seat us, but then basically disappeared for an hour after we ordered.  Some kitchen dude had to run out our food. Thank goodness for that automated touchscreen payment thingy at the table so we could pay up and get the heck out of there.

Usually service is pretty good, food is either a hit or miss but tonight my visit is disappointing all around. Started with me asking for ice water with lemon when I requested more lemon the waiter rudely raised his eye brows and mimicked "more"? Mind you the cup is big and I only got one. For food I ordered the chicken tenders that came with fries and cole slaw, fries were horrible so stale in taste and the chicken were toddler size! And they forgot my cole slaw.. Stay AWAY from the chicken tenders and don't ask for extra lemon

The interior and exterior of this location were nice and modern, however the service and food could be better. Service took 20 minutes to get drinks and another 45 minutes to get one appetizer and two salads (2 for 20). All the food came out at once. Then another 45 minutes waiting on the bill.
John H is the best bartender I've had in a long time!!! He was sweet made the best margaritas I've had and even though it was busy kept on top on everything! Defenitly come in and see him!

I have been going to this location for over a year and the service has been sub par but this last time I went I was so disappointed! The server came out and specifically asked if we would want something to drink such as a lemonade, soda or water. We ordered 2 lemonade sand an iced tea. I noticed the advertisement on the table that said if they don't offer a perfect margarita that it's free. I mentioned this to the server and he swore up and down that he offered one. The other two people at the table with me never heard him offer either... He then walked away from our table without ever taking our order. He went to the bar and started talking to some other servers. We then waved him over (had been there 15 minutes at this point and hadn't ordered). He took our order and when our order came out my order was wrong... I ordered my steak medium and it was clearly burnt to a crisp. The server didn't come back so I just ate the sides and a piece of the steak. When the server came to take our plates, I let him know the steak wasn't good at all and he said "ok". No apology, just "ok". I then got the little table pay station and noticed it wasn't our bill so I let another waiter know and he found the correct one. I pulled up the pay screen and my meal had been compd so I paid... Never even saw our server again. I am so disappointed as we love eating at Applebee's but this location has been awful.

Have been here a few times hoping it would get better but today's lunch was the worst. Waiter was pretty good but the food was sub par. First my wife's chicken wrap came with a hair in it and my quesadilla burger came with a piece of plastic in it. I told the waiter and he told the manager. The waiter apologized but nothing from the manager. So needless to say we will not be back ever!

The restaurant looks nice has a good atmosphere. The servers were pretty good but the food was not great.  The food was warm and one our dishes they served uncooked chicken. Although they took care of the bill, it doesn't remove the gut wrenching feeling in my stomach.  Sorry but won't be coming here for a long time if ever.

Great food great drinks and even greater service! Will definitely be returning. Not extremely busy either so it is a nice place to chill and have drinks. The food was so on point! The atmosphere is new and clean! Can't wait for next time, thank you Applebees! You blew our minds. Brian had awesome service that will keep us coming back!

Wish I could give a negative star, but a one will do. Walked out today after our lunch order hit a 40 minute waiting time. Not once were we told why our two hamburger meals were taking so long and we were sitting there listening to other guests tell the waiter their food order was wrong. Wasted almost an hour here with empty stomachs and a grouchy kiddo who is sad he didn't get his lunch he ordered. Called GM and he wasn't helpful either. Take the extra 10 minutes to drive to chilis or TGIFridays up the street.

Received a call from manager after writing a letter to the corporate office.  He did apologize for the terrible service, told me that the waitress would be spoken to about the complaint made and sent a gift certificate to "try and get us back in the restaurant".  I probably won't go, but I'll give the gift certificate to a friend.  I was appreciative that he called to apologize, but it doesn't really detract from the way we felt/were treated while in the restaurant the night before.
We came at a VERY slow time (9 pm). It is now 10pm and we have only gotten our appetizers. It shouldn't take an hour to come out with two dishes.

I usually like Applebee's and this is a new location.  We've been here several times before, food was ok but nothing to write home about.  Today it's literally like an icebox in here I've got a shawl on and my mothers is wearing a sweater and we are still freezing.  Too uncomfortable to have a pleasant meal.

I had a very good experience here today. Our waiter, Michael, was incredibly sensitive to our dietary restrictions and kept going back and forth to inform us of foods that we ordered that had the ingredients we couldn't eat. He was one of the better waiters I've ever had and he made our experience very enjoyable. On to the food. I had the 8 oz sirloin steak with sweet potato fries and steamed broccoli. The steak was dry, but I wanted it well done so that may have contributed to the dry factor. The broccoli was good but could have had a bit more flavor to it. The sweet potato fries were my favorite. They were fried to perfection and they had a salty taste to them that was perfect for my taste buds. For drinks, I had the strawberry lemon quencher and that was easily my favorite part. It was so sweet and you could really taste the strawberry in it. I would definitely recommend that as a drink to get. Overall a great experience with reasonable prices but the steak could have been a bit juicier.

I usually only look up reviews. I try to stay away from making them. I work for a dealership in service and understand how frustrating it can be to see reviews from people who are just ridiculous and self righteous. Or they have never really given a place a chance. I gave this place two chances. First time they completely forgot a half rack of ribs. No problem.  Called to see what could be done. They said it would be refunded. OK, awesome. It never made it back to the credit card. OK whatever, the food is really good. Ordered again tonight and the salad was literally lettuce and cheese. No bacon,  cucumbers, nothing. Also,  my girlfriend and I's favorite dessert of all time,  the Blondie,  did not come with the special sauce. THAT IS WHAT MAKES THE BLONDIE!!!! come on guys. I know it's Friday,  but that has to be standard to include. We will probably be back, but you better believe the order will be triple checked before we leave. Good thing the food is delicious.

Well, I was thrilled when I saw an Applebee's being built here months ago, it used to be a wonderful chain restaurant, Hubby and I became regulars initially because its close to home and had decent food, with a good atmosphere.  Went there recently, and noticed that the serving size of the food was dramatically reduced, my piece of Salmon was very small, but still tasty.  I ordered a half slab of ribs to take home (as I usually do) I was dissapointed when I warmed them up, for $13.99 I had the smallest half slab of ribs I ever seen, I only had 4 bones, this must have been from a Pygmy Pig!  Not worth the cost, I felt ripped off and wished I would have looked at this before I left the restaurant, but I trusted that they would be honest with their portions instead of giving me a fourth of a portion instead of half.  You lost another regular customer.
Went to this location for the first time last week. Very attentive staff, surprisingly delicious appetizers and clean, Aurora themed decorations. Only bad thing is the ridiculously overpriced drinks.

Another bad experience. Sunday afternoon, 3pm, 9 months pregnant and all I want is soup and salad. I chose two items from the menu and was told I couldn't have a soup and salad combo bc it was the weekend. After confirming with her manager, I ended up purchasing the two items separately and ultimately not getting the salad I wanted bc they don't offer the combo or half sized salads. My husband asked for a strawberry limeade and received a strawberry lemonade. When he got his refill she said they made it wrong the first time and proceeded to give him a cherry limeade. This may not seem like a big deal but lemonade with fruit vs sprite with grenadine is a big difference. She didn't even ask him which he'd prefer. He would've liked to have had the same beverage for the whole meal and not have it changed hallway thru. The store manager was clearly seen asking all the other tables around us how their meal was and making small talk but he completely avoided our table. Knowing that we had a issue with the menu to begin with I would've expected him to at least stop by and see how we were doing but he didn't. He avoided us like the plague. Our booth had greasy finger prints all over the walls and our hostess was neither in a rush to seat us or thank us for dining when we left. Apparently her conversation with another employee was too important to be disrupted with a simple, hello or thank you and good bye. We will not return to say the least.

I ordered the steak and garlic potatoes with the green beans for car side to go and it was ready exactly when it was supposed to be.

The steak was perfect and taste great and so did the rest. The best meal I have had in months.
We sat at the bar and Wess was the best Bartender we have ever had! Really nice guy.  If you want to have a great dinning experience sit at the bar and have Wess show you a great time.

I rarely give 5 stars but this place deserves it. We had 35 people for soccer and I called many restaurants and they would not sit us. The management team here cut out a portion of the restaurant and got us all seated. The wait staff was great and attentive. Food was good and hit. I had the ribs which were great. Corporate will hear from me about how great a job these guys did.

Unfortunately one of the worst visits ever for me, at any Applebee's ! Saturday evening with 30 people in entire restaurant and 20 employees standing around bar and counter talking to themselves, couldn't get attention either bar tender, finally got a refill for my vodka club soda... And she used the same glass and the leftover lemon( should have been lime)  and seeds and I and straw I threw in the drink. Brought back the brand-new drink in same glass without even dumping out old remnants. All I can say is wow, unfortunately I was so pissed off I didn't say anything because I just wanted to get out of there. If you go here  be more vocal! Had whole evening to hang out, but looks like sitting by interstate watching cars go by would be better service

I came to Denver for vacation and this was my first stop off the plane. The bar tender, although sweet was very hard to understand. She was very soft spoken and seamed like she just did the bare minimum required of her job. Also, when is a margarita served in a martini glass? There was one point I looked around and there was not one employee in the floor. The managers were also counting tills in the back worn the door open.

I have eaten here many times over the years and the food is good.  The staff changes over a lot, so its hit or miss on getting a good waiter or waitress.  This time we had a good one and the place is always clean.  I am rarely in that part of town anymore, but if I am I will stop by for lunch.

Saturday November 29th 2014 - Applebee's Aurora Location...

It has been ages since we last step in any Applebee's...  Man they really "revamped" their interior looks what nots...

We went here for Dinner after work since we don't feel like travelling across town etc just to have Dinner.  Time was about 19:00hrs.  We came in, greeted by the one of the staffs, and ushered to one of the Booth Seating in the "Military Room"...  Err, this room is filled with pictures of Military Personnel, Jet Fighters what nots..

From the extensive menu they offer, we opt to order the following items :

*  Ultimate Trio ($12.99)
*  Mushroom Swiss Burger ($10.99)
*  Fish & Chips ($12.99)

Hubs opt to have Coffee ($2.49) while I opt to have Fountain Root Beer ($2.49).  

Our lovely server who is originally from Korea, her name is Kyong J.  She is indeed attentive, answers our questions and so cheerful!  

Our food came out periodically.  From what I could recall, the items we choose for the Ultimate Trio are Classic Wings with Asian Dressing, Cheeseburger Sliders and Grilled Chicken Wonton Tacos.  There is 2 Sliders each, hence Hubs can have 1 and I can have 1.  Both Hubs and I like those Ultimate Trio that we choose.  Hubs likes his Main Entrée of Fish & Chips, and so do I, for my Main Entrée of Mushroom Swiss Burger.  Portion are decent and we are indeed stuffed after that  Dinner evening.

YES, this establishment is large enough to have or bring a PARTY!  A lot more patrons with their families and kids came in, while we were there.  The area where we were seated its more "quieter" compared to the Main Bar area, where ALOT of TV Screens are showing the latest game in town etc.

All in all Decent Dining experience here and may return when needed.  Left this establishment about 20:00hrs ish.

The opening hours for this Applebee's Aurora Location is as following :
*  Monday - Thursday : 11:00 AM to 12:00 AM
*  Friday - Saturday : 11:00 AM to 1:00 AM
*  Sunday :   11:00 AM to 12:00 AM

Call them in advance to verify their operation hours in case, they might change it.

TB#84

Area Director : Angela Trice
Cell # : (720)-281-1383
Contact info : atrice@appleamerican.com

Applebee's Neighborhood Grill & Bar
16485 40th Circle
Aurora, CO 80011
Tel : (303)-371-4114

@231/2014

I tried, really tried to like this Applebees.  4 visits in the past three weeks (business trip).  

Extremely poor service as s single diner.  One night it was the 20 minute wait to have anyone ask for a drink order (while I saw multiple other tables get seated, drink orders taken, and their drinks delivered).  Two different nights I was brought the wrong food.  And another I practically had to tackle a waitperson to get my bill.  All seemed very strange given this is a restaurant surrounded by hotels with single dining business types. 

I observed a manager only once in the four visits.  The wait staff all seemed inexperienced.  And they didn't help or cover for each other.  I saw one poor gal working madly, while a couple others stood around chatting with each other for lack of anything to do. 

Mostly mediocre bar food. Heavy fried foods, greasy burgers and such.  Weak attempt at regular entrees - very low quality steak, barely cooked veggies, heavy sauces and cold hot food.  Only reason this place gets two stars instead of one is the wings.  I'm a fan of the double crunch bone in wings with spicy Asian chili seasoning.  They are excellent. Not excellent enough to make up for the other problems, but dang, I like those wings!

So, bottom line think of this place as a bar and it makes more sense.  If you're looking for a beer and some bar food, this place is okay.  If you're looking for a meal at a restaurant that happens to have bar service, it's a disappointment.  I'll only be back if I'm going to the bar for a beer.

We've only had take out one time over here and it wasn't that reserving. The taste was rather acquiring and not very direct. I think I reserved my taste at least a few times and then realized that it tasted a bit much. It is a good restaurant but I wouldn't so much return to enjoy the food.

After a long day, and staying in a hotel next door for a flight out in the morning, we had the unpleasant experience of visiting Applebee's (which we normally enjoy going to).  Tried to have a drink and watch a couple football games, we were unable to.  A very loud, intoxicated and foul-mouthed individual sitting on the other side of the bar made it impossible.  The manager, instead of approaching the person, just talked about him with the wait staff standing at the bar front.  Instead of enjoying a couple of drinks, and ordering dinner, we were so disgusted that we had to order dinner to go, finish the one drink we purchased and left.  Shame on the manager for not stepping in and asking the individual to quiet down, even though the bartender had asked him 3 times in the 45 minutes we were there.  He (manager) lost some money on this one.  The poor gentlemen next to us were leaving as well.  So, if this is your type of scene, check this place out and listen for Marcus from San Antonio who is a dental technician that is here framing houses in Castle Rock and has two BMWs (a 98 and 01).  Yes, I learned this from across the bar.  Will not visit this establishment again.  Next time we go to Ted's next door.

Had 25 minutes and a starving difficult 88 year old mother who insisted on eggs. Ted's Montana grill wouldn't make them. Nick at Applebees next door was happy to make her eggs even though they weren't on the menu. Thank you Nick. We will be back.

I've been to probably 20 Applebees locations in my life, and I have to say that this one ranks pretty average.  The service is always pretty attentive, and the food is always good.  I usually order something new each time I go, but lately I've been ordering their sirloin off the 550 calorie menu.  Most places fail at cooking a steak to my liking, but this Applebee's was spot-on with my Medium-Medium Rare.  

Due to its close proximity and my good experiences, I'll keep going back.

Unexciting food, decent service. About what you would expect from an Applebee's that is surrounded by hotels (a somewhat captive audience).

We tried to go to Ted's next door, but it was a 45 minute wait for two and the bar was already quite overloaded. We walked 50 feet to Applebee's, got seated right away, there were plenty of empty tables... So you can tell how popular it is.

Absolutely disgusting. This place fisted with roaches. I ordered my food n waiting drinking my beer. There was roach chilling on my table. I told the bus girl she looked at me like well it's just one roach. We have tons so what. N asked for the manager she said oh I'm sorry I don't see any roach, I walked the hell out  never again!!!!

The waitress was friendly but I didn't like 2 things:

1) I felt that the waitress was trying really hard to get me to pay more by ordering more or adding add ons. Obv the higher the the total goes, the higher tip that she will get.

2) I aksed for a medium well steak but I got rare. It was pink inside. 

Came to town for business and visited this place for the first time.
Your typical Applebee's. Food was decent. Service was excellent. Beer was delicious. What more could you ask for on a night out?

I came here with a co worker/friend after a long day. We came for dinner. I got the Oriental Chicken Salad. She got Chicken tenders. Mine was good, I get this dish when coming to Applebee's. She said she liked here. Our waitress was Becca she was wonderful! She  did an outstanding job. The only that could have been better was the cleanness however we got there after the dinner rush.

The service is good here. The staff knows their audience and pays attention.  There were some jerks in this evening, who got upset with being cut off, (they walked to their nearby hotel) and disputed everything on their bill. It was a spectacle to watch them, but the managers were awesome and discreetly handled the situation.  Our food was great and we will  come back.

Bad curbside experience they advertise curbside but refuse to go out to your car. I go inside after it becomes clear they don't honor the curbside pickup they advertise. Waited for about 15 minutes after estimated pickup time. When I arrived back to my house I realized they forgot some of our order. I call them to let them know and Joshua tells me "well what do you want me to do about it?" "You can come back and we can give you what your missing." So I drive back and wait another five minutes to get the rest of our food. No apology no offer to compensate us for the gas and time wasted or the fact that my meal was now completely cold and ruined or the rude waiter we had to deal with on the phone. The food is okay but the service is thee worse service I have ever experienced at Applebee's

Went here just to relax and have a cold drink and some food. Ordered a margarita pretty sure it did not have any alcohol tasted like mix and salt. My honey chicken mac and cheese was bland and tasteless but I guess what can you expect from the 2 for 25 menu. Chilis is way better

For most places I take a chance to give him a second try. I ordered curbside to go because in this part of town there's not much for healthy food and I need something easy fast. So i ordered a curbside to go and they left off the shrimp on my spinach shrimp salad. So I call back to redeem let them redeem themselves they did the next day gave me my lunch for free and that was nice. The shrimp salad wasn't that bad but the sweet potatoes that they had were actually stopped because there was no vent holes and they just ended up being like steam sweet potatoes. So today today i was ready for a better customer service experience. I  ordered curbside service again to see if I could get a good meal quick and easy to go. I order online and showed up exactly when they said that order will be ready I had to wait 15 minutes and then go in to see if the item was ready and it still wasn't ready. Not to mention my turkey sandwich was cold not hot.  Applebee's although I've never really been a huge fan I was disappointed in your lack of customer service considering you're such a corporate agency. Won't be wasting my time trying to get curbside service during lunch time when I need a quick easy fix for lunch. Wish you had your stuff together at this location.

Ordered chicken penne pasta and and the Asian chicken salad car side. Got back to the hotel to find out they didn't include the chicken in the salad. When we called to complain they gave us a couple dollars off but really they should have made it free for the inconvenience. The food didn't taste that great either. I think that's our last time going to Applebee's.

This was our first visit to Applebee's while visiting Denver (and staying in Aurora), Co. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich with artichoke and my husband had the fried fish dinner. My sandwich was plentiful but just so-so taste-wise. My husband's fish had a heavy batter. Maybe we just ordered the wrong things...who knows.

Food: 3/5
Ambiance: 2.5/5
Services: 3.5/5
Prices: $$ (avg 15/person)

Some time its good to just follow the flow and go the American way... We missed out flight out from Denver and was offered a great rate to stay at the Marriott at the Gateway Park for $79/night. This is a semi-industrial area and there's 3 restaurants just a block from the hotel, Montana Grill, Uno Pizza & Applebee's... After spending the whole afternoon skiing, then stuck in the traffic for nearly 3.5 hrs and missing our flight back to Houston, we thought, why not go crazy and eat something fattening and unhealthy...  So, Applebee's that is!

We ordered the following:

The Ultimate Trio $11.49: Choose any 3 items from about 12 choices and I picked the [1] Quesadilla tower with chunks of steak, bell peppers, onions & lots of cheese, very flavorful and taste better when you dipped into the salsa that comes with it, the best item [2] Boneless hot wing with ranch dip, get about 8 crispy chicken nuggets dipped in some sort of tabasco mixes [3] Cheese slider, you get 2 of this slightly bigger than usual slider with a generous patty. I didnt touch the 2nd one and not even finish the first. Its just OK but its sure better than the slider from Little Big!

Burger $9.99: My partner went for this huge helping of burger with fries. It came open-face with a big patty & equally sized slice of cheese and 2 slices of bacons, i didnt taste it but it does look OK!

Perfect Ritas: They uses the premium spirit and served straight up in a salt-rimmed Martini glass. Yes, this was a PERFECT rita, love it! 

Peach Sangria: Quite refreshing but lack the "fruitiness". They uses Sutter Home White Zin, so, nothing to rave about...

Overall, we had quite a satisfying meal considering the day we had. We just want to eat something and go back to our room, rest and fly back to Houston the next day. I have been to Applebee's once before about 4 years ago and the most memorable thing i had was their riblets, i'm glad they still serve that but this time, i wanted something different and i have to say, they are better than TGIF!

My husband and I went here earlier last night for some quick food. I would not recommend this place. I'm trying to continue writing my complaint about them, but their contact us page is down. Unlike my other reviews, I am not going to write a lot here, except to say that the service was horrible, the server was aggressive in her approach to us with taking our orders, and a manager who only cares about a table that he can hit on with the mom and her two young kids.

The bartender's were friendly. I ordered onion rings which tasted superp. I visited a place next door to this restaurant and didn't like the clientele and staff as much as here at Applebee's. They would bring the receipt after ordering each drink which I liked to keep track of time. I'd recommend comparing it to the other 3 or 4 restaurants in that vicinity but this one might be the best one for a visit with refreshments and food. Main reason is the people working there that I appreciated.

Service was great as service goes.  But Ordered the house salad without cheese, the waitress says salad no cheese as she put the plate on the table. It had the same amount of cheese as the other person that ordered the normal house salad. Then we both had the 7oz sirloin off of the 2 for $20 menu they came out cooked correctly but tasted like they come to the restaurant frozen with the grill marks and they just warm them up in a broth of some sort.

Ordered carry out. Very easy to order online. Was ready within 15 minutes. Food was fresh and hot. Large portions. They give you plenty of condiments. Friendly staff. Customer service was great. Price was good. My biggest complaint was the chicken fingers were a little over cooked/ hard and on the smaller side. The overall taste of the food was good.
Food quality is Applebee's (low and processed)). Drink selection bad.  Bar tender provided great service and was engaging but not annoying.

Typical Applebee's fare.  No better.  No worse.

Decent employees but nothing memorable.

This restaurant is very conveniently located to four enormous hotels all sharing the same parking lot essentially.  It can get busy the later you wait to go.  I suggest having dinner right at 5pm or so.

Personally, I'm a huge fan of the Bourbon Street Steak plate.  Total calories are 720 which isn't horrible.

Great food from great people. I've never been so satisfied from my dining experience. From the moment I walked in and was greeted by the host, I knew I picked the right place. The server was so attentive, and even the manager came by to check on me. Despite being very busy, my food came out hot, quick, and delicious. I had a steak that was cooked perfectly and was extremely juicy

My boyfriend and I come here often because it's convenient. It's also one of the chain restaurants that are open until midnight during the weekdays which is nice since my boyfriend typically works late. It's a typical chain restaurant, so nothing special. The food is good and the service is decent. I'm never wowed when I eat here, but I'm never disappointed either. We usually eat late at night since again it's one of the only restaurants that is open late, but maybe the atmosphere is different during other times of the day.

I love their selections.  However, their salad's aren't that great tasting.  I like their under 500 menu - full of flavorful meals.  Their choose 2 is awesome, plenty of food for a great price.  The atmosphere is a little divvy, but all in all a good place to go.

I live nearby and use to love this place.  At first I was not only satisfied but I was impressed.  But over the last few months the service, food and drinks have gone downhill fast.  This last visit sealed the deal for me.  I am not picky and don't like to complain!  it's embarrassing as well as risky.  But I had to send my super sugary drink back because I just couldn't drink it.  Then I ordered the shrimp scampi and it was just a big boiled mess of ick.  my son ordered the mac n cheese and also didn't like it because it seemed about a day old.  Dark orange.  Dry and gritty.  When I sent back the scampi I apologized profusely.   But upon the waitresses return she didn't ask me if I wanted anything else she just handed me check and walked away.  Then the table next to me asked about the scampi because they noticed me send mine back.  The waitress said,  " No.  It's good.  She just didn't like anything."  I've waited tables.  And i have bartender so I am sympathetic to their situation but I in this situation it is on applebees this time.  Sorry.  *I can't believe I still tipped her leaving hungry and humiliated.  Never ever again.
Applebees is terrible. We don't need more chain restaurants in this area

First time here started off fine drinks were good appetizers were good. my american blt arrived i took one bite and the bacon tasted like body odor my wife tasted it spit out and said the same thing. Wont be coming back here

An evening filled with misogyny and lame company possibly didn't help...Applebees is Applebees. I liked the fried chips with the queso sauce. Addictive and encrusted my arteries with spicy cheese and grease. My cohorts imbibed in tall beers, and I could not, rendering the conversation into levels of idiocy that sober people shouldn't try to debate in the confines of... I just wanted a shot glass full of that cheese to finally kill me off. It probably would have only taken two.

New Applebees off Havana in Aurora,CO, IS AWFUL (their location isn't on here to write a review, yet). Service was horrible. Our waitress must've had a job at McDonalds last, where she thinks it's appropriate to bring the check  and ask if you want dessert after only 15% of your meal gone, then comes back and acts appalled that we haven't paid yet. Not to mention, she took a beer that still was about 10 percent full! Didn't ask if we were done or anything. She didn't know what was in one of their signature drinks that was on the front of the menu and didn't know what beers they had on tap? Then we called down a manager, which NEVER happens with us, we're pretty laid back. But I was so upset because she came back TWICE to see if we had paid yet when we're still eating. She wanted to take my salad while I WAS STILL eating it. AWFUL. I explained all this to the manager, or assistant manager, who made it obvious he could care less. His main concern was, was our food good? Yeah, BUT even if the food is bad, you could make a customers experience better just based on service and willingness to fix it. Service is more important than food in my opinion! It was insane to me. The manager fixed NOTHING, didn't even replace the beer that was taken while 10 percent full. I would think AT least that would be taken care of. Usually, when we go to applebees about once a week, we sit at the bar, I'VE NEVER had any issues, but since this was the NEW applebees we decided to dine in.... won't be doing that. Stick with bar service. It's better. Just dumbfounded how little the manager cared. I regretfully, still tipped the waitress 10 percent of the check, just because she at least came and apologized... it just seemed her AND the manager just thought we were being "difficult" which is definitely not the case.
