We're very laid back. But I'VE NEVER had my check brought to me after one bite into the meal, and asked if I wanted dessert when I haven't even finished a meal.

The food is as good as any Applebee's Our Server when we finally got one was great, but when I asked why it took so long, her reply was I do not know, OK that is fine I can live with that, She was pleasant and kept checking on us,

Hard to fuck up a burger.  Thank God.  The beer was cold, so that made it a little more bearable that the service was slow as balls.  I would not eat here again unless I was forced to.  I just happened to be staying at the Aloft and it was the only restaurant within walking distance.   I'm glad I was drunk before I went in.

Most enjoyable beer experience yet!
I drink beer but I am not an expert so thus was a welcome environment where it's self pour as much as you'd like with over 20 options. How it works:
1. Present your ID and credit card for one of their cards.
2. Grab a glass (note there are wine and beer glasses) and browse the selection (sours, lights, IPAs, stouts, cider, wine) from all over the country
3. Tap your card and pour as much as you would like. I got pretty good at 2 oz tasters by doing a full open and immediate close
4. Order food by going to the back, requesting a dish and tapping your card
5. Close out your tab when you're done.

Theres plenty of seating indoors and outdoors and it's great for large groups. The food was tasty (see cheese spaetzle and grilled shishito peppers). I sampled at least five different beers with no pressure to commit.

Loved this place!! So chill, welcoming, unique, and fun! We decided to get a drink at this bar after reading yelp reviews and then decided to grab some food at the same time. 

The place is set up to make everything convenient for the customer. You give your credit card and ID, order food, then proceed to pour your own glass of beer. 

The food was the best part! AMAZING!! I got the chicken sliders on a biscuit and could not get over how amazing they tasted. Everyone I was with was super excited about their food as well! Great job to the owner of this place!

Super awesome spot for any craft beer lover looking for a ton of (quality) variety. IPAs, stouts, porters, sours, wine - it's all here! I was truly surprised at not just how many beers they have on tap, but the sheer quality of what they had. Beers like Sip of Sunshine, RR's Temptation, Field to Ferment, Funkwerks Saison, Jolly Pumpkin, etc have been on draft here.

And don't hesitate to try any of the food options, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of their dishes...this is more than just an awesome taproom. Check it out!

This place was recommended by some great local yelpers and it did not disappoint! Wanted a place to go and try a bunch of different beers and this is it. As you walk up there's lot's of seating, inside, outside or up in this balcony section. I wanted to sit right inside by the 40 taps of beer lining the wall so beautifully!

All you do is go up to the register get your beer glass and a checkout card.. this is how you activate each beer tap and pour just what you want. Since you pay per ounce this is perfect for trying many many different beers. All the beers have a great  description card above them, very helpful with so many options. Love that there were so many IPA's on draft and ciders for the fall.

Bathrooms are available, but they are located out the side door and down the hallway...think they are shared with some offices in the building.

 Overall such a great concept:

-serving yourself
-you pay by the ounce
-so many options
-sampling at it's best

Woah. I think I may be in love with a bar.

When visitors come to Denver, chances are they want to try a lot of beer. First Draft is a great place to start that journey. You're given a card that you can then touch to different taps, pour as much of it as you want, drink, and repeat. The cards keep track of how much you drink and when you're ready to cash out, your total is determined based on the type of beer and quantity you consumed.

I probably tried about six different types of beer (equally around 18 oz) and was so surprised when my bill was only $10. It was also an educational experience, as all the different panels let you know information on the taste of the beer, where it's from, ABV, etc., so that you can really delve into what you may like, if you're not quite sure. Oh yeah, if you have wine, cocktail, or even kombucha lovers in your party, there's a tap for that!

I was also impressed by how tame and open it was on a Saturday night. I can only assume that's because there are SO many places to get your beer on in Denver, that not everyone is tempted to head to the same place. Sadly, I think if this concept was repeated in a place like Miami, it would be swarmed. But ya know, I'm willing to give it a try!

I had a great time here. A dream come true. Being able to try among 40 different beets, all hard to find.

The place is welcoming,  clean, vibrant, full of energy and nice  people, employees and customers, I mean.

I will be back for more.

I am very impressed by this place. I love their concept and I wish there was one in LA. So basically, once you go you check in with the wait staff and they will check your ID and grab you card. You card is then paired with their high tech card that you will use to order food and drinks.

They have about 40 beers on tap and its pour your own! Its about $0.50 per ounce and their glass is about 12 ounces so about $6 a glass which is pretty standard. The cool part is that because its pour your own, you can just pour and bit and taste until you get the beer you like. You just tap the card on the beer of your choice and pour. It keeps tracks of how many ounces you've poured and whatnot. When you order food, you also use the same card so that gets rid of splitting the tab!

My only complaint is that there was only 1 person in the front of the house and she was doing everything - Greeting people, setting up the cards, cleaning tables, serving food and processing the payments. She did a great job but because she was the only one it took a bit of time to get food and checks.

Genius! Please open one in LA! Sign me up!

This is a very cool concept for a beer bar and I absolutely loved our time at First Draft! You get a swipe card tied to a credit/debit card with a limit of 32 oz per person. They have 40 taps of all different kinds of beer and a couple of wines and even a kombucha when we were there. 

To pour, just tap your card on the lower right corner of the sign above the tap and start pouring. The screen will show you how many ounces you poured and how many ounces you have left. It also tells you how much each pour is per ounce. When you're done you cash out at the register and you can pay with the credit/debit card they have on file.

Pouring your own beer is really fun! I liked being able to try just a little bit of several different beers. There is plenty of outdoor seating; my friends and I sat outside and played Yahtzee that we brought with us. They have a full kitchen and happy hour deals on food. We didn't eat anything but the food all sounded awesome! I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Denver!

LA needs a cool place like this! Self serve beer on tap where you pay by the ounce. 

How cool! Each person gets their own tap card and a cup and you're free to pour your own beer.  They have about 40 beers on rotation each with a description when you tap on the selection. They have a few ciders too.  Once you tap the card on the screen, it lights up green and you're ready to pour however much you want.  When you're ready to try something else, you can invert your glass and rinse it out.

They also have a food menu and we ordered poutine fries, wings, a burger, and bone marrow.  Food was good to munch on with the different beers on tap.

You definitely must check it out if your a beer enthusiast. They have plenty of seating down and up stairs and outside.  Parking on the street.

This place has a super interesting concept. You get to pour your own drink. So you come in, show them your ID and a credit card, and they'll give you an RIFD card which when you tap on a specific beer, it activates the "tap" system and counts it by you ounces poured. They will tally the total ounces poured at the end of your visit. It's definitely a great way to try out 50 different kinds of beer. They also have selected options for cider, wine, and kombucha drink. Beware though, this place is PACKED! Finding seating is definitely a challenge.

This is such a great idea - it takes a flight of beer to a whole new level. For people like me who suck at drinking normal quantities of beer, it gives us an option to try many different beers without having to commit to buying a whole pint. The food looks good, I got the wings, which were tasty. Prices were a bit high and the portions a bit low, so don't come here expecting a meal, they are all snack-sized.

This is also a fun place to people watch and if you are really social, meeting new people via the picnic table style seating.

I absolutely love the concept of First Draft. If we have serve yourself fro-yo, why can't we have serve yourself beer? And surprisingly, beer is not the only thing they have on tap! 

Right when you walk in, you'll see a bunch of tables/seats where you just seat yourself. When you're ready, you can walk up to the counter and grab yourself a glass and a checkout card. Your checkout card measures which drink you try and how much you get of it. So, you can totally go at your own pace and drink what you feel like you can handle. 

Their beer options are fairly unique and quite crafty (in my opinion). But, what really draws me in is the kombucha, wine, and cider. Unfortunately, their kombucha tap was down when I went. So, I didn't get to sample this. But, I will be back for sure to taste it. 

Not only do they have drinks here, they have some pretty bomb food. My inner child loves french fries, and they do it so well here. Believe me when I say they do it well! These are not your standard fast-food french fry from McDonald's. They have substance and flavor to them. But, all of their dining options are perfect for your drinking munchies. 

Like I've said, I love the concept of serving yourself quality beer (wine, cider, and kombucha). I would definitely recommend taking CO visitors here. I've traveled to a few different places and have not seen this concept yet in another city. Hope you'll find your experience here just as enjoyable as I did.

I've never been to a beer garden before. 

A very innovative idea. You see a server, they hook you up with a glass and a card. The wall is full of different beers that get dispensed out like fountain soda. You put the card up to the beer you want, it unlocks it, you pour out how much you want and it lets you know how much you poured. You pay per ounce and the price is right there. 

My favorite beer is Deschutes Fresh Squeezed IPA. Hands down. For this one, it was 50 cents an ounce, higher than some of the others, but still pretty reasonable for me. It IS my favorite beer after all. I saw some others something like 20 cents an ounce. It was definitely reasonable. 

First floor can be a little packed. Thankfully, the second floor provides relief. There were some games and stuff up there. I opted to look over the balcony and people watch.

You really can't beat the selection and price. I rather pay to drink good beer on draft than crappy beer just cause.

Pour your own beer. Simple idea but I think it's a rad place. Always rotating the beer and wine. Sometimes they've got kombucha too. 

You get a swipe card and pay for beer/wine by the ounce. They have food too but it's all about the ounces.

Taps have tablets outside telling you what it is. How much per ounce. IBUs. ABV. Where it's from etc. Good place to stop in or Bing fiends when they visit. Something for everyone.

A tap house with 40+ taps that changes by the ounce, I'm in love.  I have been here on a couple of occasions, and the beer list changes constantly.  The menu also seems to change slightly on a fairly regular basis.  The food they offer is limited, but matches perfectly with the easy going vibe.

The taproom itself is open and airy.  During the warm days they roll up the garage doors and you can walk directly to the respectable size patio.  It's an awesome concept to pay by the ounce.  It's like choose your own adventure, adult style.  Just watch the price of some beers, they can creep to upwards of $1 per ounce.

With 40 Taps lining the long wall downstairs, you'd think I would have been most excited by the vast array of beer options offered at First Draft. Well, since I only get to tast beer these days, I was pretty pumped to see every style under the sun available for sampling, from serious sours and stouts to incredibly hoppy IPAs, and even a few dedicated to vino and kombucha! You could literally spend all night standing in front of this wall!

But the food. Oh yes. The food was the perfect foil to all the liquid goodness flowing through this place.

First the pretzels. The pretzels. The pretzels! I was going to be good and only "taste" a half of one and by the end of the meal I had devoured two of these! I'm not sure if it was the salty, crusty exterior, the soft sweet doughy inside, saison cheese sauce or the fantastic whole grain mustard that made them go down so easily, but sweet baby jebus these things were fantastic! 

Then the burger. HUGE BURGER. A massive mound of colorado meat on a pillowy soft bun topped with fresh fixins, all added up to a magnificent mouthful! 

Side note: French fries were fabulous. Brussel sprouts perfectly prepared. Merguez sausage a bit of a let down (kinda bland). 

But the piece de resistance had to be dessert! Fresh baked chocolate chip cookies, warm from the oven, served alongside a tulip filled with chocolate stout infused milk. Ooey, gooey, soft and chewy, cookies, perfect for picking apart (not so much for dunking) closed out the meal in a most magical fashion.

Beer drinker or not, First Draft is fun for all. If you happen to come on trivia night, you're in for a hilarious addition to your evening. Make First Draft a first round pick for a night out in Denver!

Love the concept! I think an alternative name for the bar would be "Bartender for a Night!" Who doesn't love pouring their own beer? And with so many to choose from it can take a while...

What I love is that you can try a bunch of different beers to see which you'd like a full (or half) glass of. It's a shame they don't do a free 1/2oz/1oz taster like a lot of places will do, but the glamour of pouring your own beer ensured I didn't feel too sad about that!

We had a feast of epic proportions - I wish I'd been able to finish the loaded table of treats. My spaetzle mac and cheese was great - and apparently only a half portion! Holy moly, I don't want to know what the full looks like!! I didn't really get where the spaetzle came in - it seemed like regular macaroni to me, but it was delicious. The pretzels were another highlight for sure - hot and steaming with great dips!

A super fun spot I'd definitely return to.

Love this place! Great space with plenty of seating and dispersed crowds. You self pour a big selection of beers and are charged by the ounce. In the end you are paying more for a 16 oz of beer but it's a great way to try everything. 

The patio is great and it's a really nice area to be in, not too crowded but also close to a lot of things. I always try a few beers and then settle on the one I like best. The card system works great too, haven't tried the food yet but it's there!

I came here with my hubby and his parents. I cannot drink beer so I drank water in a fancy goblet.

My family really enjoyed this place! You leave a credit card on file and then they load a card for you. You scan the card at the tap you want and then dispense yourself. There is a limit- but once you hit the limit- you just find another employee to load more for you. They just want to make sure you're OK to continue.

They have tables inside, upstairs, outside tables, and outside stands. We went on a friday night around 8pm- we were able to snag a table. Soon after, it got suuuper crowded!

This place is located in an up and coming neighborhood. There are SUPER nice brand new apartments and restaurants- and at the same time there are really run down buildings with graffiti and homeless people hanging out on the sidewalks.

After the beer, we walked to the next street which had a nice selection of restaurants. I would definitely bring my friends here again! =)

Two words (...or is it three?): self-serve brewery.

This is a must-try in Denver (shoutout to my yelp friend Eric J. for giving me the suggestion)!! First Draft is a unique concept, in which they give you a card that allows you to access the beers, wines, and ciders on tap (against the wall) with a simple wave of your hand. 

Everything is priced per ounce, which means you can try as much (or little) of a beverage you want, without being stuck with a full glass. Once you find a favorite, fill up that glass and enjoy. I personally tried a bit of everything. In the end, I found one sour beer that I drank half a glass of.

In addition, we came during happy hour, and had the fries. Pretty good snack for beer. They had other yummy looking options like wings, etc but we were saving our appetite for dinner later that night. 

All in all, First Draft is a great stop for good brews and good times!

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who visits Denver! It's an absolutely beautiful space with both indoor and outdoor seating. The service was exceptionally nice and helpful.

I love that there's tons of self-serve drinks on tap (beer, wine, cider, coffee, kombucha). They give you a plastic card to tap at each tablet and you are charged for every ounce that you pour into your glass. Most drinks were about 50 cents an ounce. It's really neat that you can try so many different types of beer. Be careful though since your bill can add up quickly this way.

The food was equally amazing too. I got the brisket grilled cheese ($14) which came with a small arugula salad. The sandwich was amazing! It's definitely heavy but extremely flavorful and the meat was very tender.

Overall my friends and I were super impressed. I would go back next time I'm in Denver.

One of the coolest spots I've been too. Easy, flexible serving of some 30 beers, wine, cider and Kombucha!!

Loved the food - pretzels so good !  Grilled endive creatively prepared with a beautiful presentation- delicious.

Britton was great to chat with and learn about the biz.

Fun night last night.
Love the burger and maple fries!!! My dad, who is crotchety to everything that's food, loved the maple fries too. Beer's pretty awesome - of course!

Came here right before work one Friday evening, and was curious to see what it was all about. The pros: they have 40 different beers on tap, and they're all self-serve. Unique and interesting concept! Also, the cashier/hostess was extremely friendly, patient, and knowledgeable. She walked me through the entire process step by step.

Now, for the cons: there was limited food. Not much actually looked too appetizing to me, but I went with the roasted peppers they have, and wasn't too interested in finishing them. Just kind of bland and harsh on the stomach. It didn't really pair well with beer, in my opinion. And, of course, they don't serve cocktails (which is to be expected). They could also use more diversity in the beer choices they offer. There were entirely too many pale ales & IPA's in comparison to any other kind. And, for the price, they should offer a lot more choices and a lot more food. A little pricey for what they did have. Overall, I'd maybe give this place 3 1/2 stars out of 5.

My favorite place to take out of town visitors! 40 taps, so easy to please any palate. Pay by the ounce, so pour as much or as little as you like. Also have cider, wine, and kombucha in addition to any style of beer. Pro tip: touch the middle of the screen over any of the taps to read more about that particular libation. Food is legit too. Fantastic outdoor patio seating. Great location to jump off into the rest of the RINO neighborhood scene. Recommend especially taking a stroll through the alley way immediately next to this place - most amazing street art. 

And FYI - you will get automatically cut off when you get to 32 oz of pours ;-)

I had an amazing experience here. We were in Colorado celebrating my brother's 21st birthday, and I can't think of a better way for him to experience different types of beers to find what his likes and dislikes! We had a group of seven and found the entire vibe to be casual and inviting, not to mention affordable. We spent a few hours trying and rating all of the different varieties. When you walk in the person at the register explained everything, and the taps were easier to use than I imagined. Each one provides a good amount of information about the beer/cider/wine, tells you price, and how much you poured. I would definitely go back.

Being an out-of-towner, First Draft was life-changing for me. A place where I don't need to order an entire beer, but can still try exciting and unique brews in various styles - a dream come true! We tried several beers and enjoyed the outdoor seating here. The staff is also very helpful and always ready to recommend something that will suit your fancy.

What an awesome concept! As someone who isn't a huge beer lover, this place was great--even greater for beer lovers I can imagine. With the pour your own feature you're able to sample any beer and pour as much or as little as you want. They also offer ciders and wines on tap. Loved it here! The workers were also super friendly and helpful since we were first timers.

I'm basically like a 4 year old because I have a serious fascination with doing everything myself. I'm the gal you see at the self-checkout at grocery stores for example, and so, when I heard there was a place where I could pour my own beer I knew it was just a matter of time until I would be checking it out. And of course, my do-it-myself, self loves it. 

I love it because you can pour as much or as little as you'd like.
I love it because you can try so many different kinds of beer.
I love it because each tap has a little info screen so you know more about what you might drink.
I love it because even though they are a beer place they have two wines, one cocktail, and a kombucha on draft too in case anyone in your crew isn't a beer person.
I love it because there are all different shapes and sizes of glassware.
I particularly love all the different sour beers I've been able to try here.
And I love it because they have a pretty decent food selection to accompany the beer.

I have been several times now, both in really large groups and in small sets, and have always had a good time. I have eaten grilled shishitos, pretzels, Brussels sprouts, chickpea fritters, the burger, the brisket grilled cheese, the mac & cheese, and the beet salad, which is basically the entire menu. My favorite has been, by far, the grilled cheese, but it was all enjoyable. And the milk and cookies with fresh baked chocolate chip cookies & malted stout milk is a great way to end a meal, if you have room. I definitely love this spot!

As my friend put it, Yogurtland for adults. Instead of fro-yo, it's craft brews, and it's amazing.

Although previously I had heard that one could get a band and have AYCD from these fantastic flowing taps, this is no longer the case. Instead, there is a card that you tap (see what I did there) on the respective beer you want, and that records how much to charge per how many ounces you pour.

I like the freedom of choosing how much I want to try for different beers, and the ability to just take from one if I really enjoy it. My favorite is the Pineapple Express, but there are all kinds of other drinks, including wines and mixed drink that you can pour.

The garlic fries were a great pairing to the beer, and the sliders are cute and delicious. Definitely take advantage of the happy hour food. Would come again to try even more beers - but a really cool experience!

I love the concept of this place. There are tons of different beers on draft (some wines too), all self serve, and you are charged by the ounce. Most of the beers were about .50 an ounce, and went all the way to $2. You definitely end up paying a little more than you would for a 16oz beer somewhere else, but it's a great way to try different beers all in one place while visiting Denver.

If they add red wine, we can make it 5 stars. 

Great selection of beer (specifically seasonals). I love the concept of the bracelet scan. Although you probably can end up spending a lot more then you had planned. When you sign in, they connect your credit card with your bracelet. Then you're free to roam and taste up to 40 oz of beer/white wine. Typically each oz is 50 cents. The white is ~$1.50. We ended up spending 20 on drink pours. Try the garlic fries! They are crispy and super garlicky deliciousness.

OH MY GOSH.  Remember when you were a kid in that candy store where you fill the bag up as much as you want, and then your parents yell at you because you took too much and it's weighed by the ounce and then your stuck...

This place is the adult version!  A beer lovers haven.  Here's the deal-- show your ID and credit card and they set you up with a special wristband.  Then you tap the wristband on an electronic iPad like screen and it displays your profile.  You then pour yourself and it chargers you per ounce poured.  There are 30 beers and wines to pick from, most are local.  Sound good? Have fun sampling! 

Other cool things-- 

They have a unique food menu to complement the beer.

The system cuts you off after drinking a certain amount.  Love that concept because it leaves accountability so people aren't getting irresponsibly drunk.

Definitely on the pricey side BUT it's more about the experience and opportunity of trying so many different beverages.  LOVE LOVE LOVE.

The concept behind Freshcraft was cool but how it translated into a real business wasn't great. 

Freshcraft is a pay-by-the-ounce tap house. They offer a vast selection of beers and even a few ciders. Agreeing with some of the other reviewers, the accuracy of the measurement system is lacking. I was overcharged for almost every pour I got. On top of that, several of the taps were empty and the food was very overpriced. 

I hate leaving bad reviews but this just wasn't my type of place.

Really great place to come and hangout. You can pour your own beer, cider, Moscow Mule, etc. The prices range from around 50 cents an ounce up to over a dollar an ounce. They have a patio and their indoor space has an upstairs. Really good selection of beers on tap (around 30), and you can pour as much or as little as you want into your glass.  The food here is really good, serving local Denver and Colorado food products. 

If you can get past the girls wearing chokers and fedoras, and the guys wearing tight red jeans this place is awesome.

Five stars! This place was awesome! It's self served here. You pour your own drinks so the lines to the bar to get a drink were pretty much eliminated. I went on a Wednesday night though, so it wasn't too crowded.

The people that worked there were so nice and friendly. You first check in at the counter to get your access card, and then you're off! You pay by the ounce. It was typically around 0.60$ an ounce. They had 40 drinks on tap, which also included wine, iced coffee, and even kombucha.

They also have a counter for you to order food from their menu. A patio outside. And a little upstairs area.

I highly recommend this place if you're ever in the area. The beer selection was great and the experience was unforgettable.

OMG, this place is amazing. The beer converted me into a believer of the craft beer phenomenon. And the food....I regret every meal I've ever eaten in my life up until now...all those wasted calories, I could've been eating this.

The general manager Briton is a wizard, guided us on our tour.

Beer Heaven.

I LOVED the concept of the 40+ taps, self serve style. It gives the adventurous soul the opportunity to try tons of different brews without having to fully commit to a pint of just one. There's endless selection, everyone as good as the last.  They have a cool concept of giving you a card that you swipe at each tap, and every ounce poured is between 35-60 cents give or take, and you pay your tab at the end of the night at the front counter. The card is sort of a running tab that gives you access to the taps!

Although there may be standing room only, it has an awesome urban and modern feel, and the place is normally always booming. That's a good sign by the way! Great place to hang out and unwind from a long week with some friends

TIP: Keep track of the amount you get over the course of the evening. Not just so you don't leave wasted like a 16 year old at their junior prom, but the pours add up $$$!!!

Also, ATTENTION GARLIC LOVERS. They have some amazing garlic fries that pack a punch. Hot, crisp, garlicy, and simply amazing. This isn't just a great place for beer, but they have some great selections for bar food as well!

One of my new go to places for a great night out!!!!

Review #200!!!

And what better place to talk about than First Draft. One of the coolest craft beer locations that have opened up in Denver recently. I don't even like beer all that much but I am a huge fan of this place!!

Self serve alcohol how amazing is that?! When you step in, you first present your ID and credit card and open up a tab. Then you receive a wristband that has a white circle on it. The wrist band is actually quite chic looking and it's comfortable to wear since its elastic. Nice design! They have so many varieties of beer to choose from. Some of the ones I tried are ginger beer which is delicious, chocolate stout basically like drinking dark chocolate. You scan your wrist band and then the panel will light up green and then you get however much you want. It then records how much you got and at the end you pay. I got two beers and the total was only 8 dollars what a deal!!! And because it's self serve, you don't technically have to tip. 

Plenty of seating both outside, inside, and upstairs. It's definitely an awesome hangout spot for people in their 20s/30s it seemed to be the crowd there. A very good time to be had by all! Definitely coming back!

I dig this concept and wish we had a place like this back home! The CONCEPT: come in, register your ID and credit card, grab an ID bracelet, choose a beer or wine(yep, they had 3 to choose from), scan your bracelet and start pouring! Your bracelet keeps track of how much beer you pour and you pay the final amount at the end, it's as simple as that!  There are around 40 different beers on tap to choose from and each has an electronic screen that gives you a full description of that beer/wine so you can know what to expect before you pour : ) So No waiting in line for a bartender or bugging them to ask "what kind of beer is that."  Yah.....they may charge anywhere from $0.40 - $2.00 per ounce poured, which can sound a little pricey, but when you think about it, this gives you a chance to sample as many different beers as you like and pour as little OR as much as your little heart desires. 

Along with the great beer selection, First Draft offers a a very open concept with plenty of seating as well as a wonderful patio out front.....and we all know how I LOVE a good patio ; ) 

We only tried their plate of pretzels because I was craving some horseradish mustard dipping sauce : p  Three come to an order and those were the 3 most buttery and moist pretzels EVER!! If we wouldn't have been stuffed from just coming from brunch, I would have tried more off their menu. 

My friends and I were so impressed by this concept, we asked about franchising info. Unfortunately the owner was not there to ask but we will def look into it.

For a slow drinking, beer sample loving person such as myself, this place is amazing! I love half pours or even smaller, especially because my beer often gets warm if I have a full pint, and to be able to taste to my heart's content here made me a happy girl. They no longer use bracelets, now you get a plastic credit card type thingy to hold in front of the 40 (!) taps to be able to pour your beer (we had no issues, worked great). In addition to beer, they had a couple varieties of cider, tap wine and even a kombucha. On a Thursday night, it was busy but not overly crowded. A friend tried their brisket grilled cheese which was served with a massive platter of perfect looking french fries, which I was too full to even sneak a bite of, so I'll definitely be back to try their small menu of small snacks, charcuterie and cheese boards, large plates, salads, sandwiches and desserts. 

I was in a dark beer mood as usual and loved my salted caramel stout (collab with Salt & Straw ice cream in Portland, yum) and a robust porter from a brewery in SF. Speaking of ice cream, you can add scoops of Little Man ice cream to your beer for just $2 to make a float, something I love to do at home. There was a creme brulee stout I tried that would have made a super tasty beer float. More casual inside than I expected but really nice industrial interior. I saw prices from .50-.70 per ounce. They had two sizes/styles of glassware for your pouring pleasure. Such a fun place!

First Draft was cool.  It's a pretty cool concept.  I like that you don't have to wait to get a drink, but that could also be dangerous.  I'm not really a beer drinker so I tried the Moscow Mule.  It was delish!  I'm not usually a fan of them, but these were hitting the spot.  Hubby and I usually don't get down to this part of town, so not sure how often we would return, but I would be up for coming back.  Cheers!

I'm addicted to this place! I've been several times now. Avoid it at peak times as there is a line out the door, but if you go in the afternoon or late night, you'll be good. 

I love the concept of sampling beers. I'm one of those! Committing to an entire 12 oz when there are so many amazing Colorado craft beers is impossible. I'm the flight orderer! Oh! and they also have kombucha, cider, and wine on tap!

The STAFF is trained well, super helpful, super friendly! This is a BIG DEAL! The food is trendy and perfect for eating with beer! Loved the brisked grilled cheese. Order that! Also, prices won't burn your wallet. 

Cool industrial vibe, like the rest of RiNo. Love that it is 21 and over only! Check this place out. You'll probably see me there!

This is a love story out of a book that your parents tell you to stop daydreaming about- and now you can finally tell them they're wrong. 

You're telling me right now that with this magical piece of plastic I can serve myself as much craft brew I can fit into my body??? Every kind is so eclectic and the displays are so detailed. Honestly, this place is like Disneyland- you stand there in awe of the colorful bright displays and wonder exactly how many you can try in one sitting. You thought you hated school but then you start reading up on the history and art of distillation of these fancy delicious drinks and you suddenly realize- you would live to absorb this information..and alcohol content as well. They even go out of their way to cater to the Belgian lovers and provide enough options to overwhelm. I can tap a card for food too?!?! Come on... I know I must sound like an old lady and maybe I kind of am but come on- the burger was cooked perfectly with a gentle char and summoning season.... I don't really understand it. The seasoned fries too-  order them right now. The artwork and atmosphere of this place is inviting, relaxed, and overall so happy. It was so very difficult to leave... and I honestly can't wait to return when it's snowing and see them close up the wind-able windows- they really excited me.

and also, how did I only spend $6 bucks on 12 beers?!!! 

Such a magical place

What an awesome place! We came here to come for some dinner before we had to catch our flight back home. This place was recommended by some locals. We were so excited that there was such a huge selection of beers on draft that you can fill your own glass by the ounce which was really neat. The food was delicious and we had a good time here! Would definitely visit again!

This place is the WORST. The staff, particularly the management, are awful. My husband planned my surprise 30th birthday here 3 months in advance. 4 days before the party they called and said they had double booked. So my husband was left scrambling to find a place for 40+ people on very short notice. Instead of taking responsibility like they should have, they turned around and blamed it on my husband--the manager tried to say my husband didn't communicate well enough even though he had been there to meet in person with them and had several emails with plenty of communication. 

We were reluctant to give this place a try but went ahead and went with some friends last night. Same issues. The staff and managers were extremely rude to multiple people in our party. And my husband had 3 beers, myself 2 TINY glasses of wine, and somehow got charged $45!?! Would NEVER go back.

LOVE the concept. Nativ hotel in downtown has a similar concept but with an awesome patio and delicious food, First Draft is my choice.

The set up is simple, as others have mentions- walk in, get your card, and start the pours! This place gets packed sometimes so keep that in mind if you're venturing out on a weekend.

The food: we sampled the Brussel sprouts, wings, and the pretzels. The sprouts? SO GOOD!! I don't really remember the wings (which says something).

All in al, the place can get a little pricey if you aren't watching the pours (or your hubs like to go all in & only do full pours....)

First time that I've ever been to a pay by the ounce self serve beer bar.  I found two beers, the Plum Sour Stout and the Funky Gold Simcoe, two sours that they had in their selection.  After tasting them briefly with a small pour, I filled up my glasses halfway with each one and I got to decide how much to fill my glass.  Kind of a cool feeling because I like trying different beers but don't want to pay for an entire glass.  

They also have a full kitchen and menu here but since I had just already ate, I wasn't able to try the food.  The menu does look very appealing and has the typical gastropub selections of appetizers, mains, sandwiches, and sides.

For newbies, make sure to check in with the hostess/cashier person to get yourself set up and instructed on how to use their pay by the ounce system.

This place is legit amazing. I came here expecting just a normal bar/beer garden, but got so much more. To witness this technology in action is just fantastic. Basically, you go to the cashier and charge your credit card, attaching your bar tab to an RFID card or bracelet. Once you have this card/bracelet, you can go to any of the 40+ taps in the opposite side and pour your own beer, which is priced by the ounce. Each tap is equipped equipped with an LED screen telling you the name of the beer, type of beer, alcoholic content, and price per oz. You wave your RFID gadget in front of the reader, and then pour to your heart's content. After you finish pouring, the screen will read how many ounces you've poured, so you can figure out how much you've drank. Dangerous if you like to keep score with your buddies, ha. They also have ciders and even wine on tap, so if you don't drink beer, there are definitely options for you.

The space itself is pretty big, although I would personally avoid bringing massive groups here, as there are only a few communal tables, whereas the upstairs seems more suitable for small groups or couples. The front door opens like a garage during the summer, so there's even more space outside during the warm weather months. Obviously, we came during the winter, so everything was closed, but again, there actually was a considerable amount of space for our larger 10+ person party.

We ordered a few of the small plates including Brussels sprouts, Chili wings, burgers, brisket grilled cheese, shishito peppers, and fries. My favorites were the Brussels sprouts, as they had a distinct garlic butter flavor, and the brisket grilled cheese was also outrageously good with its buttered sourdough too. Ridiculous. My only qualm with the place was how salty some of the food was. As I mentioned before, the quality of the food was good, just definitely over-seasoned. In my opinion, I can actually take on more salt than most people, but the cajun fries, shishito peppers, and burger were just way over-salted. I can understand why, given that they want you to drink more beer, but it was just too much. Pretty much the only reason I'm giving it a 4-star rating instead of 5. Really, I guess it should be 4.5 stars.

Food service was really quick. They use the numbering system where you place your food order (also using your RFID card/bracelet) and then you get a number to post at your table. Pricing is pretty fair, with most beers at $0.50 an ounce, and most dishes at around $8-10. Once we were done with our tabs, we submitted our RFID cards/bracelets back to the cashier, and then all we had to do was sign the receipt and we were done. Really quick, and beats having to wait for a bartender to do all that stuff for you, while also needing to tend the bar.

Despite the salty food, I would easily recommend First Draft, and I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Denver.  Will need to try the new rotating beers, as well as the outdoor space when it's warmer weather.

The concept is simple. Grab a bracelet and a glass, fill and enjoy. Plenty of craft beers to choose from and wines and ciders! Each beer has a price per oz (.60,.55,.49,etc) and the taps go by ounces poured when you activate it. So your tab just accrues on to your bracelet. When you're ready to checkout you just scan it at the register and pay up. 

The food was enjoyable as well, we ordered the pretzel, deviled eggs, and poblano peppers. The pretzel comes with a horseradish sauce as well as a cheddar cheese dipping sauce, both were pleasing. I would definitely recommend all three. 
They had a full menu of burgers and sandwiches that looked great but we didn't try them on this day. We'll definitely have to make arrangements for lunch in the future. 

Open seating upstairs as well as downstairs and outside. Staff was friendly and helpful when deciding which beer was a good starter.

First Draft is a fun and unique concept for beer lovers! There's over 20 beers on-tap and you're charged by the ounce via a "club card". You hold the card in front of your desired beer tap and pour. It's a much-needed tap house in the heart of RiNo. The patio is spacious and the indoor area is community seating with picnic tables. I brought my cousin here on his visit to Denver and being a beer lover, he really enjoyed it! I will be bringing others back here as well!

A range of styles available from a wide range of breweries both regional & national, in a setting that's perfect for the area.  Inside & out are perfect with the industrial finishes and huge communal tables. Prices are reasonable, and the pour-your-own is done well, with easy tech that works. Friendly helpful staff.

I wasn't there for a meal, but food offerings looked minimal.

Stopped it at noon in a Tuesday right when they opened. We had the place to ourselves for a bit and the staff really gave us a great run down and tour of the place. So much fun.

Excellent selection of craft beers plus a few ciders and wine on the mix. You can pour as much or as little as you want. Thanks to the helpful staff I tried several that I loved that I would not have been drawn to otherwise. The Vanilla Java Porter was my favorite this visit. They do change them up often so we plan to come back for more.

We also decided to each lunch here... Yummo. I have the grilled cheese and brisket sandwich,side of local greens and the grilled peppers (shishitos) as an app. For the two of us our tab came to around $75 for lunch which I thought was very reasonably considering how much we "sampled".

Love that you receive a print out when you leave of all the beers you tried. That way I can buy them later also.

I was glad to try out the beer here. Unfortunately, I must not be skilled enough to do self serve tap beer. When I pulled the tap, the tap came gushing out and filled my glass wish foam. When I asked the staff if he could help, he said to wait and the foam would calm down. 

When the foam did settle, I was left with about 2oz of beer. When I talked to the staff he again, he just said "sorry". So, I only had my 2oz of beer although I was charged the full $10 for 6oz. 

The other reviews look great but I think I'll be sticking to bars with bartenders.

We had a lot of fun here. I like that the staff come over to help if you're a newbie but maybe I should have asked before I tried of pour a Nitro that was all head! Trust me, you have to commit to the tap!

It's a good system to pour your own beers, they check your ID & a copy of your credit card when you enter, then it's just swipe and pull. There's information above each of the taps telling you what they're like and you can pour as much or as little as you like (within reason). We were mixing #25 with the cider and it was delicious!!

It works out to be a little expensive at $0.50 or $0.60 an ounce but it's fun and totally worth it.

We didn't have the food here but it smelt delicious! And it was nice that it didn't get too busy on a Sunday afternoon.

Unique concept.  The girls (as well as myself) loved the fact that they served wine on tap!  

Normally when I go out for drinks with my fiance and her friends, breweries are NOT an option. This place solves that problem! They had beer, coffee, & wine to choose from.  I was happy, and so were the women!  Everyone wins.

This place loses a star due to beer selection. As I visited in October, they had pumpkin beer.  A LOT of pumpkin beer.  Too much pumpkin beer.  I don't like pumpkin beer :(   Fortunately though, they rotate the taps, so I'm eager to go back & see what new they have now!

We ordered some food, & it was overall pretty good.  Outdoor seating is recommended, as the inside of First Draft smelled weird.

This place is awesome! Check it out. End of Review.


Oh you don't trust me? Well you must not if you're still reading. Fiiiine....I'll tell you more :P

Okay so this place is a new concept for me. It's like one of those froyo places with the flavors in the wall that you fill your cup with. EXCEPT - It's refillable, you can try them all, there's like 30 different kinds, oh and the best part it's not froyo IT'S BEER! Not a beer fan? Gosh, why are you reading this? Why don't like you like beer?! I don't like to jump to assumptions, maybe you are planning on taking a new friend or group here and you don't know their preferences  - No worries, I saw wine and kombucha on tap too.

Located in a great area and a pretty cool atmosphere. When you walk in the amazing people at the counter give you a magic wizard bracelet that unleashes the almighty flood of beer. You grab a seat and grab your glass off the wall. I loved that they had the different styles of glasses depending on which beer you are drinking. Or you can do what I did and grab the coolest looking glass and watch the other more experienced beer wizards cringe as you fill your goblet up with a pilsner and obliviously cheers it with your other magical friends.

But not just any mortal can walk up and get beer! I will let you in on the real secrets. After getting your introductory wizard bracelet, make sure to use your hand as a wand and wave it around on the sign above the tap you want. Preferably between the S and T. Feel free to come up with your own spell name and confidently shout it in your best wizard voice. If you have successfully completed the spell you will be rewarded with beer! I was unaware of this on my first drink so I dumbly tried like 3 taps thinking they were out of all the beer before someone told me to use the bracelet - haha, rookie move! 

I spoke to one of the workers and they mentioned they frequently rotate taps so every visit will be a new page of adventure on your quest!

Last tip for you, you only get 30 ounces so make sure you don't use up 10 ounces on your first pour.....unlike someone I know....which totally isn't me.....

My only negative feedback is that seating is pretty limited and can be difficult to find on a busy night. The crowd does rotate regularly so you only have to wait probably 10 minutes before finding something that opens up.

Although I did not eat any of the food - It all looked amazing. I was mesmerized and seriously debated stealing a bite of a sandwich from our table. But then came to my senses and realized it was a lady with a different group of people we were sharing the table with and she might not appreciate it as much as I would! Next time we come back I will be bringing my appetite!

Pretty disappointed in this place. All four people in my party felt the beer was watered down. We each maxed our cards out for pours and didn't get a good buzz with a tab of $40!!! Tap beers from brewery's that just had no flavor. They didn't have one Oktoberfest or Pumpkin beer either. For it being 10/14 I feel they should have one. Several kegs tapped out while we were there. Interesting concept but the beer was definitely watered down.

What a great concept: get a bunch of great beverages on tap, give everyone access to pour their own via a wristband that keeps track and have decent food. 

Customer service here will never fail due to you getting your own booze but in my book that's smart. Gone are the days of waiting around for someone to take your drink order, go get the drink and bring it back 15 minutes later. You drink what you want at your own pace. 

The price is somewhat steep at .38-.60 an ounce (may not seem like much but multiple that by 16 and its pricy). 

With all this being said 5 stars and I have already made plans to come back.

Serve yourself beer cider and wine- what is not to love?! I love when this place ends up being a stop during a night out. The concept is new and fun and the crowd is always relaxed and friendly. I love it even more in the summer because they can open up their "garage door" so it becomes one big open indoor/outdoor hangout spot.

Try the grapefruit beer if they have it (menu rotates). It's fruity and refreshing!

Had a wonderful time here in First Draft with my boyfriend and our friend. The concept is simple. Drinks are self served. You get a bracelet which lets you turn on whichever tap you want and it measures how much oz you got and your total as well. I fell in love with the pear cider while i was there.

TIP: place your bracelet censor between the the letters 'ST' of the FIRST Draft sign of each tap and wait for the green light on top. 

As for the food. We came during HH and ordered the shishito pepper's, pretzels, and deviled eggs. They did not skimp on flavor and everything was delicious. Loved the shishito peppers and the added bacon on top of the eggs was also a nice touch.

Everyone was friendly and glad to help customers on how to work the bracelets. Great space, outdoors and indoors (that have a second floor as well woot!)

Can't wait to be a regular here.

I LOVE the concept here! You check in and get a card that will track the ounces you pour yourself of around 30 different draft beer/cider/wine options. Very interactive, which is always something I like. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful and the layout was wide open and had a social vibe to it. Long picnic style tables filled the building, which felt like it was built to be a garage. This place would be great for groups. There was an upstairs area that I'm sure would give a great view when the business picks up, but let's face it, why would you want to put yourself so far away from the taps?

We didn't order food, but everything coming out of the kitchen (openly visible from the tasting/dining room) smelled and looked AWESOME.  We noticed that they had a happy hour and a brunch menu as well, certainly worth a visit.  I hope to eat next time. 

Ultimately, this is a great spot to taste and try several different beers that you otherwise might not take a leap of faith on. Costs seemed to round out to roughly $5-6 per full beer, which is about what you can expect for craft brews. 5-stars because I really can't come up with a single complaint.

The concept is very unique and it's definitely worth the try. I came here a few times with my friends and we enjoyed some of the beers / wines as well as the food. I'd recommend this place as a hang out spot and enjoy it with your close friends. Cheers! 

The staff is nice a friendly and very helpful.

LOVED the concept of this place. The food was absolutely amazing, and I loved not having the pressure from a bar keep to try out multiple beers. We really enjoyed our time at First Draft and wish we had a place like this back at home!

I have to admit, I was a bit skeptical of First Draft when I first heard the idea.  I assume they would have basic micro-brews available anywhere with the selling point you were able to pour your own beer in any volume you chose allowing for multiple tastings.  

I was thoroughly impressed with the wide range of micro-brews from all over the US.  I have even been able to have a few beers from New Holland out of my home state of MI and from Sun King in Indianapolis.  My most recent visit was during the pumpkin beer tap takeover.  This was what really impressed me with the wide variety and the many different types of pumpkin beers they had!

After my first visit, I was unaware First Draft had prepared hot food on the menu.  Naturally, when I returned my friends and I had to sample some of the small plate offerings.  I had a few of the sliders and they were amazing!  I will most certainly return to First Draft for more food and drink at a later date!
Really cool place to bring visitors from out of town for a beer. Cool environment as well.

This bar is AWESOME! So when you first go in, you give them your ID and credit card. Then they give you a little bracelet that you use to pay for the beer. 

The beer is set up like how froyo is set up, all lined up across the wall.. and you can click your bracelet on the sign so you can try the beer and pour as much as you'd like. I tried 5 different kinds of beer and a whole pint for maybe $7!!!! 

I mean, it's kind of very easy to go crazy here and start just pouring one after another.. so be careful. I only resisted b/c I was DD at the end of the night. But I can imagine not having to drive... I would want a pint of all the delicious beer!!! Their sour beer was really good. Hopefully they have that again when I go back. 

I heard the food here is really good as well.. and you can pair your food with beer by trying all the different ones. :) 

They have an upstairs section that was blocked off for a birthday party.. but I think on normal nights you can go there to chill too.

I'm from Houston and this place is unlike anywhere I've ever been. 

For starters, the food was great. I recommend the pretzels and deviled eggs for your appetizer. They have other items that sound great, but I went with the aforementioned combo and was incredibly satisfied. I got the brisket grilled cheese sandwich for dinner. It was delicious. It came with an arugula salad + citrus vinaigrette that was surprisingly delightful. My girlfriend got the pork shoulder sandwich and garlic fries which were a-1. 

The best part about this place, however, is their modern approach to a bar. Basically: they have a wall of different beers and you pour your own / serve yourself. You get a wristband with some kind of magnet detector device (?), you place the magnet up to the beer selection you want, and voila. You get charged by the ounce so it works out pretty nice, and you can try a variety of beers without running up a large tab. They have a ton of good beers to choose from as well. 

You really can't go wrong with this place. It essentially uses the idea of modern self-serve froyo places and applies it to beer. Pretty fly. Highly recommend it. Rdouble.

It seems like a cool concept. Pour your own beer, TONS to choose from. On top of that, if you're hungry you can just go order some yummy pub food. You have everything you need for the makings of a great night. But, based on my experience here I don't think it's executed as well as it could be. Perhaps my experience wasn't as great because it was a busy Saturday night? But it should be great not matter what night you go, right? 

You need to check in with the front counter and provide them ID and a card for your tab and then get a bracelet. You use the bracelet to release the taps of whatever you want to pour, so you pay for what you drink. Some girl behind me had to show me that it must be placed between the "S" and the "T" on the sign. WTH? How about a little light or something on there to make that a little more noticeable. 

I won't get into all the types of beers they have, because there are so many. None are their own, but from many local breweries. It gets very crowded by the beer taps, and can be hard to try to browse what you want. It would have been nice if it was spaced out a little more to allow us some breathing room...again it was Saturday night, so it was pretty poppin'. 

When i saw buttermilk fried chicken, it seemed to be calling my name so I decided that was it! Well, the chicken and fried green tomato were delicious, as was the shishito pepper chutney. The biscuit it was served on though, was disappointing. To be frank, it was too crispy and more like toast than a biscuit. Yeah..don't make biscuits anymore, guys. Every entree comes with a side of greens unless you ask for fries. I just got the greens, which was basically an arugula salad. Boy, that was awful. It was DOUSED in salt and maybe a bit of oil. Tasted like they poured an entire salt shaker worth onto my salad; yuck. Inedible. 

My love ordered the burger and fries, and mistakenly chose the "old bay"seasoning for them. Again, salt galore. They were WAY over seasoned. It was nearly inedible. Another from our party made the same mistake and she didn't touch hers. The burger though, was the saving grace. The meat was fresh and delicious, seemed like they grind it in house. 

I'm curious what it's like on a less busy night. I probably won't be ordering food from here again, would just go for drinks if at all.

We had a lot of fun tasting at First Draft! A good variety of beers and it was nice they had cider, wine and kambucha available too for the non-beer drinkers in our party. I will be back to try the food - it smelled great!

The concept of First Draft is the BEST thing to hit Denver! They have tons of taps that they regularly change for seasonal reasons. It's great to be able to try as many beers as you want and pour your own. 

The food is also delicious, try the shishito peppers or their maple fries (seriously delicious). You can get a snack while you drink or order a full meal. They have a fairly large outdoor area with tons of open seating. A definite must try to any beer, cider, or wine drinker (yes, they have wine and cider on tap).

First Draft has a pretty impressive menu from both a beer and a food perspective. They have a great drink selection which you can have small tastes of using their cool card tap technology. When you first walk in you head to the side counter, show your ID, and grab a glass from the shelf. Then, you use your card to allow the taps to pour!

I am allergic to beer, but they have a couple wines and ciders on the far right end. I don't like the Moscow Mule concoction they have, but the Ocktopus cider and the Rosé are great! 

I also recommend their fried chicken sandwich and garlic fries. The brussel sprouts are okay, definitely not my favorite but still pretty good.

I really like this place, it's unique and the concept is refreshing! It's like an arcade for adults and it's a bonanza of beer choices and wines! In addition to that the staff are friendly especially being my first time and first stop in Colorado! 

The food looks very delicious but I settled with the pretzels only which I can say it's on point! Very comparable to TAPS brewing in socal and it's a must!

The beer choices are meh to my liking, but hey you can't please everyone but you can entertain everyone! I just hope there were more Ales and Lagers when I visited. (Only missing star)

In short, get a card, drink a lot, and eat pretzels so you can drink some more! It's affordable as long as you drink what your pour and if you're tasting be gentle on the tap or it'll cost you! They measure it by oz's you pour in case you don't know. 

My bill was a little pricey because i got carried away on a stout that was stupid pricey and I think there was also a first time card fee, just be aware because I was too buzzed at the end to care haha.

Oh and ask the staff for suggestions, they seem very optimistic with their stuff and I didn't go wrong asking them. 

Cheers! *clink*

At first i totally loved the concept. Pick the beer you want and try a little or a lot and no-one can judge your choices! 

But it's a trick to get your fancy bracelet to match up correctly to unlock the tap.
I'm not positive about it not counting foam in the pour. Pretty sure, i've paid for some foam. Obviously i need to learn to pour beer better!

The food is just ok to me. It's froo froo food. Nothing super amazing, or just pub like to eat with your beer. Hubby thinks it's fab and it's close to home, so we'll be back but it wont be a destination that i choose!

The idea of having a ton of beers to choose from is good, but they no longer provide a list, so to pick one you have to stand there looking waaay above the tap to read about it on the electronic board.

I've been wanting to try this place for the longest time, and I finally had the opportunity of the weekend. I absolutely loved it. I love the idea of pouring your own drinks, that way you can test the waters and pour an ounce or two, and if you love it pour a full glass. I can wait to come back!

If you were the kid that lived for soda fountains and times when you could fill your own cup, then this place is for you! If you were me, you took it one step further and mixed all the sodas together! While I refrained from mixing any beer together at First Draft, I was definitely in my element! I love the concept First Draft has set up. You walk into a tasting room of sorts, you get a wrist band that keeps track of how many ounces you are drinking (I know, so futuristic!), and you can taste or guzzle a little or a lot, from as many as twenty different beers.

The building is simple, with pour spouts and picnic tables. Friends and I had a wonderful time sampling different beers and hanging out. While the beer selection was good, none of them blew me away, so I do hope that they keep a good rotation going.

I love the concept: pour your own beer is a pretty neat idea.

That said, First Draft misses the mark.

The technology is iffy, with bracelets that have to perfectly line up in order to work, and beer that is often foamy.  I don't like paying for foam, come on.

Overpriced for what you get.  You could go anywhere else and pay 30-50% less on a good chunk of their selection.  You're basically just paying for the privilege of pouring your own beer.

And the staff sucks.  Just plain sucks.  When we walked in, it was loud and crowded, a typical weekend night downtown.  The sole cashier/hostess looked seriously peeved just being there, and talked in a low voice, low enough were we had to keep leaning in to hear what she was saying.  I couldn't catch anything (luckily my sister could), except "I know it's loud but I don't feel like speaking up".  Oh dangggggggggg, do your job?  Do...your...job?  Bummer.

The dude by the beer taps looked grumpy, unsmiling, and perturbed.  I think he was annoyed by how hard it is to use the bracelets, and how many dozens of hundreds of times each shift he must have to demonstrate how to use them.  I'd be annoyed too bro.

In the end, I really liked the idea.  I think it could work.  But get staff that doesn't suck, don't overcharge me for foamy beer, and stop reserving large blocks of seating for people that aren't even there on a Saturday night at 10pm.

Technology, y'all! I think this place is really cool and I thoroughly enjoyed myself. When you go in you give your ID and credit card to the ladies at the front and they give you a little bracelet thing which you use to activate the taps and keep track of what you drink. I felt like the selection was thoughtful and relatively diverse. (Just FYI the wines they had on tap while I was there were TERRIBLE.) 

The food is absolutely DELICIOUS! It far surpassed my expectations for what appeared to be a tap house that happens to have food. I would say it was much more equal parts tap house and restaurant. My group ordered a wide variety of items and each and every one was truly fabulous. 

Overall, it was a lot of fun and we would certainly go back.

This place is awesome if you want to try some new beers!  The card system they use is super user friendly and make trying all the beers extra easy.  They had a good selection of beers from sours to stouts and you can read all the details about each beer on the screens.  The seating is family style picnic benches with some inside and outside.  We also ate there, the burger was great, I also tried the Korean Pork sandwich which wasn't all that great, the meat was greasy and it wasn't that spicey.  Over all this place is super awesome and the two guys working there were super helpful and friendly!

Excellent concept--you get a card and 40 options to pour what you want. Good food section too. But what I appreciate most is that they put a few wine options in there as well. That way, if you aren't a beer fan, you can try a few samples of interesting beers and then switch over to wine.

Yum, yum, yum! Though I couldn't indulge in one of the main attractions - the 40+ taps of self-serve beer and cider - I did really enjoy their food. The delicious maple fries, shishito peppers, and brisket sliders for a shared plate menu are a testament to this place's success and could stand alone as a full-service restaurant, but fortunately compliment the awesome tap list that truly sets First Draft apart from the surrounding hip RiNo spots.

Likewise to the tap list, the food menu is always changing - making this spot a constant fun surprise with each visit. The space is perfect for a get-together any kind with an expansive patio in the heart of the vibrant RiNo district. Plus, paying for each ounce you drink is such a refreshing way to imbibe. Certainly a sophisticated way to truly evaluate each beverage instead of filling forced to chug a crummy beer you don't like, because you paid the full price of a pint. Such a clever concept that is only found at First Draft.

This place is trash.  The only positive things I have to say are the atmosphere is trendy, and you don't have to wait in line every time to get a beer.

That being said, if you want to pay $6 for a foamy Dixie cup of beer, then this place should be right up your ally!  When the cheapest beer ends up being $8/pint plus tax, you're being had.  

Lastly, if you are even slightly near-sighted, make sure to bring your glasses (unless you want to look like a mouth breathing fool as I myself looked) because the beer screens are very small and are placed at a very strange height (unless you're Dikembe Mutombo, in which case they are at a perfect height).

This place just isn't my style.  Sure you can try a lot of beers, but you have to get up and get it yourself, I know lazy.  The price is good and the food looked good, though I didn't try any.  The bracelet was tricky, but someone showed me how to do it, much easier after that.  There are a few wines and ciders too.

But, I'm a spoiled-give-me-a-drink-while-I-chill kinda gal.  Please check it out if you don't mind getting your own drink.

I am so incredibly disappointed with First Draft.  The biggest disappointment that I suffered was the $26 (excluding tip) that I paid for two (2) beers.  When I questioned the cashier, I was told that they "must've been really big pours".  Considering the sarcastic response, I responded in kind questioning how a glass can fit more fluid than what they were intended for.

The beers were okay - nothing to write home about (more about those on Untappd).  

The environment was cool and I really like this concept.  But, for the price, I will go elsewhere.

It's about time someone took this concept to the next level! There's a couple of bars that have tap tables but First Draft has the whole lineup as a self serve.  You open a tab, get a wrist band, and pour whatever you like from a massive selection of beers from across the country.  You are charged by the ounce, and each tap has a screen the describes the beer and the cost.  After 34-36 oz you are cut off, presumably so you can check in with the staff to make sure you aren't over the top.  This is a great idea too.

Although we didn't indulge, they also boast a kitchen that boasts some food that would appeal to the foodie crowd like myself.  I never got the name of the gal who was working Sunday but she was very friendly.

This is a refreshing change of pace, I'm happy to come back here.

Cheers!

The staff was super friendly, the food was good, the beer selection was great, and they've got a nice patio to hang out on. Plus whomever was DJ'ing their music selection has great taste. I've not been to a PYOD bar before, and it's definitely a fun way to try out a lot of different beer styles.

First Draft is fun. I like that you can control your portions, even if the wall of taps is essentially a beer buffet. [Those who know me know that I normally hate buffets of any type.] The food is elevated pub grub, which I like. Atmosphere is casual & friendly.

The bracelets can seem tricky at first, but staff are willing to help you get the hang of it. There is kombucha and water if you're the DD. Staff can answer questions about teh beers and guide you to one that you'll enjoy.

But let's get back to the food. Oh. Em. Gee. The spaetzle mac and cheese made my husband so happy that I got one bite before it was all gone. When we was done, he wished he could order two. The brisket grilled cheese rivals the brisket at Masterpiece. Yeah, I said it. First Draft brisket grilled cheese is pretty darn good. It came with an arugula salad that was great--especially when added to my sandwich.

I've visited for small plates, and those are good too. Deviled eggs, pickles, and more. Hearty snacks if you're sampling a lot of beer. The pretzels are VERY hearty--almost like brioche pretzels, if you can imagine. They're a little sweet, but they still have a chewy pretzel texture.

I also recommend dessert. Milk and cookies is sooo good. The cookies are warm and gooey and chewy and hearty. The malted stout milk is super-thick and delicious. A very adult milk and cookies but not terribly boozy.

This place is exceeded my expectations on all levels.

The concept is great, the neighborhood is vibrant, and the beer variety and quality is strong. People who have issues with this place seem to have problems with the transparency and cost of the beer. I think the cost of the beer is pretty reasonable: you pay a small premium for being able to pour as much/little as you like, and if you think you may hate a beer don't pour yourself 16 ounces of it. It says right what you should be charged per ounce on the tap and how much of it you've poured. Anyone who paid $26 for two beers was either pouring very small-batch or premium beers, or not paying close enough attention. Still, they could improve on the transparency front. It would have been good to have my costs itemized or offered to me, since they just threw a number at me that seemed kinda reasonable but that left me with a lingering 'Hmmm...' that shouldn't have been necessary. 
For the record, I did not tip: perhaps because I felt I paid slightly more than I should have due to lack of detail. Also, because I poured my own beer. This probably raises the question of 'what should I tip folks in a place like this': surely not zero, but also surely not nearly the normal tipping threshold since I ordered no food and poured my own beer.

This is a great place for someone like me who really is not a beer aficionado.  I am learning, and prefer tasting to wasting, meaning not having to force my way through a glass of beer that I "thought" looked good on the menu.  

Similar to wine tasting venues this places offers a wristband that tallies your drinks at the end as you roam and sample from multiple taps.  

The atmosphere is very open and just like a warehouse brewery.  

....I wonder if this can be done with liquor...logistics, logistics.

DT

Service here is fantastic. The seating is mostly long, communal tables. It's a nice place to hang out when the garage doors are open and there is patio seating as well. 

I love the concept here - serve yourself and only pay for what you pour - and the food is good. Most of the beers I tried weren't to my liking, so I never opted for a full glass, but it is still fun to taste. They also have a couple of wines on tap and even kombucha. I mostly drank wine when I was there.

The cheese board is nice. I thought the deviled eggs had too much vinegar & salt. Three of us didn't finish 6 deviled eggs. The pork sandwich was really tasty - I would order this again. 

Super chill spot for hanging out & I'll be back. Parking in this part of RiNo is not plentiful, so you may have to walk a block or two.

I'm pretty sold on this place.  I love having the ability to pour and try the nearly 40 different beers on tap.  The employees are present and happy to talk about the selection.  I like it better than the brewery taproom experience you typically find.  Serving yourself is more work than sitting down at a bar so it has some downsides and this might be better suited to small groups as a result.  Bottom line: this is a really great place to try a little of a lot of beers!

What a great experience. Trying different types of beer. The food we ordered was incredible. It was fun learning about the different types of beers and breweries. 
My only issue is that they closed the kitchen on us without notice. I didn't get my brisket grilled cheese. Will have to come back next time in Denver.

We had such a good time at this spot. We got there early, around 530 on a Friday night, so we got a great table inside. You get a bracelet and then grab a glass and you can try any of their delicious beers, wines and ciders on tap! I'm a cider lover, so it was so fun to get to try three different ciders where usually a bar or restaurant only has one option. 

But the reason for five stars? The food. So delicious. We got the brisket grilled cheese and I almost just ordered another one to go... It was that good. With a side of fries... We were licking our fingers. 

I will also note that we went with a big group that included a friend and her ten month old - it was an easy place to have a baby and super friendly. It does get packed later and there was a line to close out, but it's still well worth a visit!
Awesome spot. Love the space. Love pouring your own beers and the variety of selection. Make sure to order the pretzels....amazing.

OBSESSED!!!!
You walk in and give them your ID and credit card on the left hand side. They give you a very futuristic looking watch and you grab yourself a glass! Then have at it!
There are, I think someone said, 45 taps? This is where you should really have your observational skills heightened. You're gonna wanna watch the people in front of you make the mistakes so that YOU look like the pro.

A: you have to touch the white part of your watch to the letters on the tap. Actually touch it.
B: Then the tap turns green.
C: Then you want to hold your glass at a 45 degree angle and pull the tap toward you.
D: enjoy as many ozs of beer as you want!
E: stumble back up to the counter when you're drunk
F: give them your fancy watch
G: Flinch waiting to see how much it will cost...10 dollars an oz? 100? who knows? ahhh how many did I have??
H: BE PLEASANTLY SURPRISED AT HOW CHEAP IT IS!!!!!!!!!!!

No but seriously. I got roughly 6 ozs because I had too much earlier in the night and it was 4.00!!! 4!
Food looks awesome. Gonna try next time.

This place put us in a food coma!!! So glad we took a chance on this little hole in the wall. The ladies were really nice. The food was amazing!!! The fruit waters were so refreshing and tasty. The corn in a cup was sooooo delicious. I've had lots of corn in a cup but this is hands down my favorite. Can't wait to come back.
I ordered an asada quesadilla with onions and cilantro. It was really good! The steak was tender and seasoned perfectly. Will definitely be back to try more of the menu.
This little hole in the wall was a wonderful find! The area is a little questionable but don't steer away! Chipotle size burritos, with authenticity.

Everything about this place is good. The look and feel of this place is modern and clean. The employees working were pleasant and kind. I ordered the pullizi pizza. I always like to base a pizza joint off a more basic pizza... yet I also wanted pancetta.

Pizzas here only take about 8-10 minutes so this is still a destination even if you're in a rush. I was in and out within 30 minutes and I was taking my time. The pizza crust is very crispy and chewy on the outside and soft on the inside. I bet they use 00 flour. The sausage and marinara were all tasty. My favorite part was the pancetta though. Essentially, who doesn't like bacon or its non smokey Italian cousin, pancetta?

They also have gelato. Who doesn't like ending a savory and salty pizza with gelato? I'll tell you who. Bad people don't.

Late Sunday night we decided to order takeout from Mici just down the street. I ordered the Tortellini Alla Miceli (how could you EVER pass up prosciutto and pasta?), and my two friends ordered the Pizza Di Mora Calzone and the Caeser Salad. It took about 40 min delivery, as expected. However, when they showed up they forgot my friend's salad which was a bummer. However, the delivery person was very kind and went back to the store and came back with the salad.. Thankfully, we live just down the street from the restaurant. It would've been unfortunate if we lived a bit further. 

The Tortellini was delicious, although I wish the portion was a bit larger so I could've had leftovers. I added mushrooms to my pasts and it complimented it perfectly. 

All in all we had a good experience here. We appreciated the delivery person going back and grabbing the forgotten salad so quickly! We'll definitely be coming back here!

Looking for an early dinner and craving pizza, via delivery. While, Mici's pies are small (2 small slices from a 10"; 16" is too big for two) they are very good. The crust and sauce is really tasty and the ingredients, although a bit light in serving, are very fresh.
