Toss in a salad, pun intended, and you've got a nice meal for 2 for under $30.(inc. driver tip)

But, you know, for as much crap is out there, paying a little more for a really good meal...totally worth it.

Always a fantastic experience at Mici's - whether we get takeout/delivery or eat in.  Lasagna is spectacular and their pizzas are great too.  Service is always fantastic and staff are always very friendly and helpful. Oh, and the gelato is great too!

I came in with my sister after a VA appointment and was raving to her about their breakfast frittatas!  Sadly they are no longer serving breakfast during the weekday, only on the weekends.

Still one of my favorite local restaurants in that area. Looking forward to the patio opening up!

I had been excited to try this place for a while and was glad to see a new location open by me. Little did I know that the Cherry Creek location had moved here. I came with a large party of co-workers for lunch. The staff were very friendly, and the food came out quickly.

I was excited to see the pick 2 lunch deal. I had half of an insalata della casa and half a tacchino sandwich (turkey pesto panini). The salad had a perfect balance of sweet and savory flavors. The panini was crisp and had just the right amount of filling. I very much appreciated that it wasn't super soggy. I'll definitely be coming back for more food in the future. I'm excited to try their breakfast menu.

I have dined at Mici probably 50x's over the last 5 years. Service is ALWAYS excellent. The staff is literally always friendly and happy when helping me with my orders. 

The food quality is great. I just really appreciate this place because I usually dine here or order take out after a VERY long work week. I'm usually starving and hinging upon hangry haha - though I'm also very friendly during this time. The staff is not only happy to serve me every single time, but they are polite, kind, and professional. I appreciate these people. 

In all the years I've been there, I've never once had a negative experience. Thank you, staff, for being so wonderful!

Mici serves fantastic italian food.  They stick with mostly classics and they seem to do everything well.  

I love their spaghetti and meatball and the bread it is served with is rustic and flavorful.  The sauce is excellent and the headband are tender and flavorful.

Their pizzas are founded on a thin crust with high qualify meats and cheeses on top.  

The mini cannolis are the best I've ever had.  They are filled to order.  

Everything here tastes home made with fresh ingredients.  I love this place.

I've had dinner this Mici's location a couple of times.  I ordered their pizza Margherita once and also a pasta Alfredo.

Neither meal was particularly outstanding.  

Pizza Margherita looks really great when it is cooked with fresh mozzarella, the mixture of sauce and mozzarella can complement each other well and looks cool on the pie.  If done right it doesn't need any other flavorings.  Thing is, a basic, savory red sauce isn't difficult to make.  Mici's red sauce did not have a nice tomato/savory flavor and the result was that the pizza wasn't a particularly noteworthy version of a Margherita.  I saved a little for lunch leftovers the next day.  It did not improve overnight.  

They gave me dried Parmesan and crushed red pepper with the pizza???  C'mon, they don't do that in Naples.  That's a Domino's move.  Try harder.

I also had pasta Alfredo which was really kind of bland.  White/cream sauces can wash out other flavor, that's the risk of using a cream/butter and cheese as a sauce base.  However, Mici's Alfredo didn't even have much flavor in that context.  It was almost like I was eating a roux over pasta. I saved a little for left-overs; it had even less flavor the next day.

The interior of the restaurant is crisp and clean but seemed like an echo chamber.  There were a couple groups with kids in there when I stopped by.  It sounded like I was sitting inside a tin can after a while.

To that point, it does advertise as a kid-friendly place, and that's cool.

I'm actually a little bummed out about writing a negative review.  I was hoping something good would stick at this particular location along Colorado Blvd.  It's been a revolving door of establishments.  There's really no such thing as a convenient location along Colorado Blvd any more unless you like sitting in traffic.  And yes, in 2016, one does need to consider the ease of access of a place in Denver.  This isn't a great location unless you are walking or taking the bus.  

And while I have no ill regard toward Mici's or its employees (they were nice and polite,) I won't be going back, nor will I be recommending Mici's to anyone else.

Decided to have Sunday Night supper with friends here and honestly, I was SO impressed!! It was not that I didn't have good expectations but it really was just so good that I told my friends it should become our regular spot for Sunday dinners!

For food - the lasagna!!! I seriously think it is some of the best lasagna I have had - and considering the number of places I have been here, that says a LOT. It was just amazing! I paired it with the small side Caesar and believe me, there was nothing small about that salad! My friends had the Piatti Antipasti (which was huge and also really good) and the Tortellini Alla Miceli which was incredibly rich but also sooo good! Oh! And we decided to start with the Bruschetta Bianca which was just ridiculously good! An interesting combo with the honey and gorgonzola - but it works so definitely recommend! And to round out our already incredibly filling meal, we of course had to get Gelato because why wouldn't you?!?! I am sure the flavors rotate but if they have the Salted Caramel Oreo and Birthday Cake flavors - GET THEM! 

Overall - just a great experience! The service was awesome - they checked on us regularly and were incredibly friendly. I look forward to going back here soon and have raved about it since!

Two words:

Breakfast pizza!

So I've never been to Mici's before my visit this past weekend but somehow heard about them and signed up for their email list and have been getting offers for them. I got a BOGO breakfast entrée coupon and decided that we should be put that bad boy to use and pop my Mici's cherry. We went in around noon on Saturday and there was one other table seated and by the time we left, there were about four more dining as well so I like to think we started the lunch rush. The employees were outstanding---so friendly, inviting, smiling and asking us if we had ever been in there. You walk up, order then they bring the food out to you so it's a fast casual concept but they didn't miss a beat on the service. While we were waiting for our pizzas they gave us samples of their gelato (not made in house, but made in Boulder so close enough), the Andes Mint and Blood Orange Creamsicle had my heart but I stopped myself before filling out for the main course. I ordered the Ortolana  breakfast pizza which is a semi vegetarian option) with the egg cooked in, topped with red peppers, zucchini and cheese and it was fantastic. Tip-get a side of marinara sauce to dip it in and it will take you to a whole new level! I grabbed a slice to go, had it the next morning and topped with a fried egg and I was in heaven. Join their email club and you will get sent special offers like I did plus a free pizza on your birthday! Other places really need to take tips in service and hospitality from Mici's!

Even though they're famous for their pizza, I ate pizza the night before so my boyfriend and I ordered the tortellini and chicken pesto panini. Large portions, hardy and filling dishes, and extremely friendly staff. The chicken was a bit dry in the panini. It was tasty but nothing special in my opinion. Next time I would probably try a different sandwich and definitely will try the pizza!

This place is decent, but I can't say I share the enthusiasm of some fellow Yelpers.

Their bread is similar to a sour dough, a little firm.

The pasta dishes (From what I've had) are fine...pesto cream bow tie, alfredo, red sauce.  The house has grapes and cheese, I think gorgonzola.  But the one I had needed more fixins.

I appreciate the price point of the house wine but am especially grateful for the Monday nights  when free entrees are available to the kids.

All in all a good week night option.

Got takeout - we ordered 2 calzones and a pesto pasta dish. The calzones were enormous! They didn't skimp on cheese, meats, or veggies. Cheese was clearly very fresh and gooey. The dipping marinara was cold but I can let that slide. The pasta was a liiiiiittle disappointing. It was a bit dry but I think that's just what happens with pasta that you take to-go. The one truly unforgivable issue was that they had run out of lasagna. On a Monday. At 7pm. That is a big no-no for any Italian joint. But given the rest of the food, I will give them a second chance and go try it out.

Came in for a quick bite with a friend recently and while I fell in love with the Bruschetta Bianca, what really impressed me about this place was the service. It's an "order at the counter and they bring the food to your table" spot, but felt like a full waiting experience as they check on you and make sure you have what you need. 

I was most impressed with the way they treated the children who were there. Super friendly and went beyond to keep them smiling. This tipped the scale for me as to whether I'd return soon, despite not having kids.

Just the best.  The food is amazing and the customer service is over the top!  I didn't think it was possible to make a better lasagna than my mother's....until I went to Mici's.  Their lasagna is made the real way with ricotta cheese.  I highly recommend the lasagna in the restaurant OR take-out if you are having a group over for dinner.  Your guests will think it is homemade!  

You can't beat the quality or the price.

Not particularly flavorful pasta or sauce. I was forced to clean the table myself (with many tables non-bussed). The help brings the spaghetti 45 seconds after delivering the salad. The salad is unremarkable, consisting of lettuce with lettuce and what appears as store bought dressing. Bread is ordinary. I know we are short on ecviting Italian venues (aside from Piatti and Barolo grill), but after spending over $16, I'm frustrated at myself for committing this.  I do like Il Pastaio in Boulder, but more costly. Chaotic dining area with kids everywhere and balloons.

This review is for their delivery service only.  I haven't actually been to the restaurant yet.

My problem with most delivery pizza (and most pizza in general) is that it has too much cheese (I'm probably the only person on the planet who would complain about too much cheese on a pizza...).  I guess I'm not a fan of the traditional 'American-style' pizza, but prefer something with lighter ingredients and a good crust.  After reading reviews for Mici's (and noticing that they're close to my house), I decided to check them out.  After going to their web site, I noticed they have a loyalty program and signed up for that.  I think you get more from that program if you actually go into the restaurant, but they give you a code you can use indefinitely to get 10% off your online orders.  And speaking of online orders, I LOVE ordering online.  I like being able to order and customize my food without someone mis-hearing what I said, and I really like being able to pay with my card online.  I have found their online ordering system to be easy to use, and both times I've ordered the food has arrived sooner than the system quoted (I think both times it quoted 45 minutes, but the food arrived in about 30).  So far so good.

As to the food, both me and The Hubs liked it.  While it's not THE BEST pizza I've ever had in my life, it's pretty darn good (unless you like pizza with five pounds of cheese on it, and if you do I think their online system lets you add extra anyway).  The crust was crispy and tasty, and the toppings were fresh.  I like that they have more vegetables  and more 'gourmet' toppings than the average place.  We've also ordered salads both times and have found the ingredients in them to be fresh, as well.  My only critique/complaint about the ingredients was when I added something extra to a salad.  I was charged 50 cents or a dollar (I forget which) to add onion to one of the salads.  I don't mind the extra charge, but I did mind the fact that there were only four or five very thin slivers of onion added to a large salad.  Really?!  I took a star away for that.

All things considered, the food is good and the service is good.  And my tired self didn't have to leave the house.  Life is good (despite the lack of onion)...
Good good and good price (: my boyfriend and I were visiting from Miami and the pesto bowl was absolutely delicious.

I love Mici! I used to get takeout from their old Cherry Creek location and I am hype they are even closer to my house now. Their ingredients are very fresh, they use incredible olive oil, and the hospitality is on point. You can tell the family who owns this place really cares about their business and their customers.
Good food, very clean and excellent service. I was really impressed with the piatto antipasti.

Well, I'll start by saying that I don't usually write reviews but I can't help myself. This place is absolutely AMAZING! I've always enjoyed Italian cuisine but I can honestly say that Mici has the freshest, most authentic meals that I have ever had (in this country). I'll also add that I lived in Italy for a time and Mici could give the homeland a run for their money.
Sarah, the manager, was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. The entire staff goes above and beyond... I'm so thankful that Mici opened up shop in this neighborhood. I have been in the food and beverage industry for over 10 years and it takes a lot to really WOW but this place does it! I can't express how awesome this staff is - from the back to the front - AND, they just opened! How many newly opened establishments can provide this kind of impressive service and products? Few and far between! Go here, eat here, order from here... You will not be disappointed!

The store and the story are wonderful and the Miceli family are some of the nicest you will meet! The family recipes are so tasty - the lasagna isn't just on Tuesday any more! I highly recommend this new location, it has a great vibe. You definitely won't regret giving it a try!

Went there for our anniversary. We shrimp, tuna, chicken, scallops, filet mignon and seaweed salad all excellent.  We were skeptical based on the past reviews but food was excellent and fresh. The staff gave excellent service.

I was sad to see the former hibachi place shut down, so it was exciting to see a new restaurant take its place. And there's a Groupon deal to boot!

On our first visit, my partner got a three protein hibachi dinner (I think it was chicken, shrimp, and NY strip) and I ordered sushi since I wasn't all that hungry.  We were amused to discover that the same chef who worked at the former iteration of the restaurant had been rehired. The food was good and I was very happy with the sushi, which was a bit of surprise given that most places that don't specialize in sushi don't always do it well.  We also thought the hibachi soup and salad was a big improvement over the former establishment's offerings. 

Unfortunately, our server (who I think was also a manager or owner) nickel-and-dimed us on the Groupon, refusing to take it on what I would consider a technicality: It says "Good for $35 worth of hibachi dinner" and since I'd ordered sushi, she wouldn't accept it.  Not a great idea to upset new customers when you're first opening.  We paid our suddenly and unexpectedly large bill and left in a bit of a huff.

I considered getting our Groupon refunded after that initial experience, but we decided to give them another shot.  This time I made sure to check with the waiter IN ADVANCE to make sure our Groupon would be accepted.  We both ordered two protein hibachi dinners. His was steak and chicken, mine was scallops and calamari.  Our chef was a different guy this time and he had some pretty cool tricks that we hadn't seen before.  I was a big fan of my calamari steak and the scallops were pretty good too, through the portion was a little small for the price.

Overall, I think this place is a definite improvement over the last hibachi place and we'll likely go again sometime, but our experience on the first visit definitely tainted what would otherwise have been a solid four star dining experience.

This place was ok. 

The "monkey brain" was amazing! Everything else was mediocre hibachi food. I'm only in Colorado for a visit so I won't be coming back. If you're looking for decent hibachi in this area then feel free to give them a try. Luis was awesome.

The sushi here is very good! And it's an awesome price! We go for the sushi bar almost weekly
But more importantly the service is awesome they always remember us and are super friendly and inviting
This place has it all! Good atmosphere, incredible staff, and amazing food. The cocktail menu has a wide, impressive variety. Can't wait to come back!

Tuna tataki and salmon sashimi appetizers for lunch were great.   The place was too slow ( I was the only one there at noon) which can make for awkward service , but all in all I'll be back.   Great quality and favors

A friend was in town for the weekend, celebrating his 60th birthday. I wanted to do something nice for him and had not been to the remodeled restaurant for quite a while. It is lovely, and the staff is extremely accommodating and gracious. Just absolutely loved the day.
Amazing food amazing service everybody was so polite and the food is so good. This is literally I believe the best hibachi grill in Colorado

I'd like to say that this place is quite amazing. 
Food: Scrumptious and in great quantity. I'm 5'3" and I can eat a lot. This place left me fuller than a fat cat on Christmas. The flavors were on point. I had the Diablo sauce on the side and that spicy sauce did not disappoint. Hot in the right amounts. 5/5
Chef: This one is something that is based on customer experience. Every chef is different so imho it's not fair to leave a review based on the chefs. As a whole my chef didn't speak too much but his tricks were on point. There were definitely times where I was caught off guard and giggled like a child. 4.5/5
Service: the servers were very attentive. Always coming to see how things were doing and checking if our drinks needed to be filled. 5/5 for service 
Environment: This place has a sushi bar, fully equipped bar and tables for hibachi and regular tables. Very open so you can always see your drinks, food (besides kitchen prepared ones) and sushi all prepared right in front of your eyes. 5/5

Overall this place should be on your next family outing, party, reunion, birthday destination and more. You won't regret it :)

This place is wildly inconsistent. I have been three times and had a different experience time. My daughter loves watching the chefs do their thing so we frequent these establishments. This last time we had a really mediocre experience. The Ny Strip and Calamari was cooked to perfection, but almost everything else was bad. The fried rice was so overcooked and under seasoned that is was barely edible. The Noodles lacked any kind of flavor and were very sticky and cold. The Las Vegas sushi roll was poorly put together and was disproportionate with ingredients . We love Hibachi but will most likely have to stick with Benihana.

Where to start have been coming here on special occasions for the last three years. Went here last night I understand it was a Saturday night but seriously? The remodel is very nice however whoever owns this place needs to get it together because clearly they do not have enough staff to accommodate their customers and the number of tables they have. Waited to be seated then had to wait 40 minutes for someone to just to take our drink order. Waited another 20 minutes and still didn't receive our drinks at that point finally decided to get up and leave. We usually spend atleast $100 here.
This is by far the best sushi around! Incredibly fresh and delicious! Try the spicy Chris Roll!
The freshest fish in Colorado! Ask for Miguel, he is an AWESOME sushi chef! If you like super spicy and flavorful rolls ask for the Chris Roll. Yes, it is named after yours truly! :-) Enjoy!

The one star is for their service. Their service is passable; their servers will greet you, refill your water, etc. But the food is dreadful. We ordered hibachi sea bass, calamari, and scallops, all of which are extremely salty and flavorless at the same time - as if there were nothing else in their sauce but salt. Definitely will not go again.

I went to this restaurant expecting to be entertained by the chef and wowed by the flavored, instead I received awful service, no personality by the chef, and tasteless food. The prices are expensive for what you get. I do not recommend this restaurant under any circumstances.

Went here for the first time today, food overall was great. We arrived around 5pm and only one other family was there, the restaurant began to fill up closer to 6pm. Monkey Brain was a great appetizer and our hibachi steaks were cooked great. The fried rice was one of the best, my scallops didn't taste very fresh but with everything being so good it doesn't change my opinion much. Service was good, but of course it wasn't busy yet when we arrived. Will definitely try again as we were all happy with our meals.

We went there on Saturday May 21st, to celebrate my daughters graduation we had a big party, we took up 2 grills! I had called in advanced to make reservations for 3:30on and I called to see if we could arrive at 2pm. They were very accomdating! While we waited for the rest of the party to get there, we sat at the bar and ordered drinks. One of the guys ordered a beer that didn't have, and since they didn't have it, they have him another one on the house! After we put I  our order, 2 cooks came out at the same time, which was perfect because we all for to eat at the same time. I ordered the Hibachi Tuna, it's was so delicious (seared) minus the teriyaki. I  also had the caterpillar roll and mochi dessert. EVERYONE enjoyed the entertainment and this good  At the end, the manager came out with a few other waiters and sang to my daughter, we had a group picture taken. Service and food overall were great, definitely will come back.
Owner is awesome so is the wait staff and cooks food was delicious. Very clean and welcoming decor is very nice I would definitely recommend

Wanna be a badass? Tell your friends about this place, they'll rave about your knowledge of hidden gems. Thanks to our dear friend and fellow foodie for filling us in, we are simply wowed by the experience. Forget that we never wandered down the stairs or peeked past the rather unassuming signage-we're now in on the secret and this place is the real deal.

Flavorful food perfectly cooked and seasoned? Yes. Portion size on the mark? Yes. Reasonable pricing? Yep. Efficient, friendly service? Double check-EVERYONE exuded a welcoming presence. 

Two of us sharing, we finished one item and couldn't wait to move on to the next. Our meal consisted of a shumai appetizer (pork dumplings-oh.my.gawd), and a bento box (tempura, gyoza, teriyaki chicken, edamame, fried rice, salad, and miso soup). If these items are any indication, their sushi, shabu shabu, ramen, sukiyaki, and okonumiyaki must be out of this world!

The food alone is reason to frequent, but tatami rooms? Yup, four of them. Private event room? That too. Delivery? C'mon, you've got to be kidding yes to that, and catering too. Unreal? Unbelievable? This sort of simple, delightful, reverent experience at incredibly reasonable prices is, in my experience, rare. Exactly the reason I wrote this review. Setting amongst the big named restaurants that anchor the area, this downstairs establishment will earn your respect. 

Kudos! We can't wait to go back.

I came to Kobe An with high expectations seeing that I used to frequent the retired Lakewood location.  It did not disappoint.  
I had a great experience, where the owner, Kimi, personally greeted me and my party.  We were sat promptly in one of the tatami rooms.  After removing my shoes and getting situated, I was given a warm moist towel for my hands.  Attention to detail really impressed me.  
Shabu-Shabu.  that is all I can say.  What a fun way to enjoy a great meal at your table. Did i mention you get to cook it at your table?  I could go on and on.  
Skip the trendy Cherry Creek restaurants and hit this place.  Perfect date night or small gathering.  It was a true treat to find a place that still cares about customer service and that has the talent in the kitchen and sushi bar to back it up.  
Cheers to this place.

This place is close to my work so I'm here far too often! It's great for a nice quiet dinner or even for a group of friends since she they offer traditional tea rooms - nice and intimate.

I'm addicted to the California roll here but she has a lot more to offer than just sushi. Very traditional Japanese cuisine. 

You cannot beat her lunch prices either!

I've been trying to find a good excuse to check out Kobe An since I tried them at the Cherry Creek North Food and Wine Festival. Well you know what..? Sushi. That's a good excuse as any, right?! Here's my break down:

+ The prices are super reasonable for what you get. They have a few different options for lunch specials. I chose the Deluxe Bento Box ($16 featuring Teriyaki Chicken, Shrimp and Vegetable Tempura, Gyoza, Rice, Salad, and Miso) it was more than enough tasty food for me.
+ My server was very friendly and attentive.  
+ The Spicy California Roll was spot on! I'll be back to sample some of their other sushi offerings.
+ The restaurant was a little dark, but the decor was nice and modern. Totally what I expected for a Japanese restaurant. They even have smaller "private" rooms off the main dinning area that you could reserve for larger groups. Nice for when you want to get a group together.

Definitely going to be back when my next sushi craving strikes!

Had lunch here with my girlfriends and it was fantastic! For a $5 fee you can sit in one of the tea rooms on the floor, which was totally worth it. The sushi was all amazing, and the specialty drinks were really good. 

Service was friendly and pretty quick. And the prices weren't crazy. For as much sushi as we had, I would have expected to pay a lot more.

Itadakimasu! This place is just wow! I truly felt like I stepped into Japan during the duration of the dinner!
After hearing about this restaurant from some friends, I decided to make a reservation for it. After all, finding good shabu shabu in Colorado is next to impossible. Well, behold yelpers! This restaurant has brought successful shabu shabu to our beloved mile high!

When you first walk in you feel as though they brought a little of Japan to this place! The decorations, the ambiance, and the use of space all resembled a traditional Japanese restaurant. As we were being seated, I asked for something I saw in their photos, a tatami room! It's a small enclosed room where you sit down crisscross on the floor! Traditional indeed! This really brought some authenticity to the restaurant.

The shabu shabu and sukiyaki with wagyu beef was on point! Gotta know what you're doing as you boil your stuff so make sure you ask your server if you don't know how! It just melts in your mouth guys!

So where are we?
1 out of 1 star for ambience.
1 out of 1 star for cleanliness.
1 out of 1 star for customer service.
2 out of 2 stars for food.
Very good everyone! I would definitely return when the feel for Japan hits my appetite. Check this place out! With that, cheers everyone. Till next time!

The private rooms looked cool but I would not recommend this place to a friend. It was bizarrely empty on a Saturday night and the service seemed rush. The gyoza was overly lemony and salty, and the spicy rolls were too spicy for this spicy lover. The rest of our sushi was bland and generic. The only great thing was the miso soup. You'd be better off going to Hapa for a lively atmosphere and decent sushi selection. I was bummed to spend a meal here.

Hard to find. It is located downstairs in the building. We got yakisoba, hamachi carppacio, 9piece sushi+3 kappa+3tekka combo, vege tempura and steak.
My bf loved the matcha green tea that was served. It was somewhat quiet the night we dined here. Probably because it is too cold.
Service was great, the waitress was very attentive.

See photos for reference.

A neighborhood gem.  Quality sushi and very relaxing atmosphere.  I love taking my family.

It's also a great lunch spot.  They have numerous sushi combo specials that are reasonably priced (under $15).
loved the place great traditional sushi and ramen - great atmosphere and staff was great - easy to get to
If you're disabled, there's no way down there for you. Tried to go here with my family and disabled grandpa. We had to leave because he can't get down the stairs. No elevator access.

For Japanese in Denver, this place is not too bad. That being said, I'm not sure it does much justice to Japanese cuisine- especially having returned from Japan a month ago and missing the cuisine. Sukiyaki was the best of the dishes we had- definitely enough for two people and the quality of the meat was good (the non-"kobe" meat). Also tried the sushi which.. I hate to be so harsh.. was pretty awful. The majority of it was left on the plate- very fishy. Go to Sushi SaSa or Cherry Hills Sushi instead if that's what you're looking for. 

Also the tatami rooms are fake! You don't get to suffer like in the normal rite of passage traditional seating, they have cut outs for your feet under the table! Silly i know, but just made it seem a little too Americanized for my taste.

Great evening, with great food!  Wanted to try a new restaurant in cherry creek and saw this place. Tucked downstairs from street level and is a nice hidden gem for cherry creek. This sushi joint will not be hidden for long. They moved from Lakewood to cherry creek with a following. People are driving all they way over to eat here. And we are lucky enough to have them in our neighborhood. 

Food, conversation, staff and experience were all amazing! 

Since we were the only ones at the bar we just asked for whatever they wanted to make. And it was really good, and unique. 

I will keep the review simple this time. But put it on your list!

Really neat little Japanese place tucked downstairs in Cherry Creek North. Our food was delicious and the atmosphere is great BUT they kind of screwed us on the prices. We were sitting in a booth but saw that they had cool tea rooms available-we asked if we could sit in one instead and the waitress was happy to move us-what she didn't tell us was that it was a $5 charge per person to sit there. We ordered a bottle of wine for $20 off of their drink menu the waitress came back a minute later and said they were out of that particular wine and that we had an outdated menu. She gave us a new drink menu where every single item was the same...but $6-8 more expensive. We ordered a house wine for $25--when the check came they charged us for a $29 bottle of wine. 

TLDR: good food, nice place, be wary of them having their hands in your pockets from the get go.
Agree with Dannie M. Outstanding. Like the Sukiyaki w rib-eye and Udon. Sushi is very good. Quiet location, but is worth the trip.

Had a great evening with awesome food. My guests were my business partners from Tokyo. They were impressed with the authentic Japanese food for the entire evening. The owner was by many times conversing in her native tongue with my guests. I tried many new foods there, even though I travel to Tokyo regularly and eat authentic food for every meal I eat when I'm there.

If you want  great atmosphere, authentic Japanese style food and have time for a nice evening of truly excellent Japanese dinning, this is where to go !!!!

I've been a fan of Kobe An since it was in Lakewood off Union. I'm TICKLED that it moved to Cherry Creek within waking distanced bit didn't realize it has been here since January! My boyfriend and I came on a Friday evening, barely scooting in before happy hour ended. I imagine that we ordered after 6pm, but they honored happy hour prices for us anyway on drinks AND food. We sat at the sushi bar (which you have to sit at in order to get HH prices) and we were THE ONLY ONES IN HERE! Everyone else must have been in the dining area or tea rooms. It was like having our own personal chefs and we didn't have to whisper or watch our language. We enjoyed our date night laughing like a couple of loud idiots without feeling bad. The staff is absolutely wonderful and the sushi chefs behind the bar very knowledgable. Highly recommend if you're a sushi fan!

Had a chance to dine here for Valentine's Day in the tatami room! What an experience! We had the shabu shabu, a couple of sushi rolls, and the scallops dynamite {by far my favorite}. Service was wonderful and atmosphere was clean! Couldn't ask for a better night, must try this place!

Finally my shabu shabu prayers have been answered. It was definitely more expensive than I'm used to paying for shabu but it was well worth it. The quality of the food is exceptional and I enjoyed the restaurant thoroughly. The wait staff was friendly and accommodating to my sister and my special needs. We definitely like our fair share of green onions and goma dare sauce and they kept bringing more! Very excited to know that this is a food option for me relatively close to my house! Honestly folks there is nothing better on a snowy evening than shabu shabu!

One of my favorite restaurants in Cherry Creek. My whole family is obsessed with the sukiyaki with the ribeye and udon noodles. Sushi is good too... I had the razorback earlier tonight which is good if you like hamachi. I usually get the red dragon roll. It's never busy here but I don't know why because the food and service is always great.

My wife and I just moved to Denver from DC and have been looking for a good Japanese place. We wandered in here by chance after an afternoon shopping and wow was it worth it.

My wife got a fairly traditional bento box and enjoyed all of if. But the real star was the Sukiyaki (Japanese hot pot) that I got with thin-sliced Kobe beef. They bring out a fondue-style stove, a ton of vegetables, and the raw beef. You add in the veggies, let them cook a minute, and then start cooking the beef. It's so thin you just take a piece of raw beef, swish it around in the boiling water for a few seconds, and then eat it with some veggies. It was amazingly delicious and the serving size was very generous. My wife and I probably could have just shared it and an appetizer instead of getting two entrees.

We also bought a very nice bottle mild sake and enjoyed it.

I've eaten at Kobe An two weeks in a row - both business dinners and one was with a Japanese associate who speaks Japanese and appreciates the "Real Deal" 

I'm done with the surrounding sushi places trying to push rolls in lieu of traditional Japanese soups, veggies, seafood delicacies, etc., 

It is nice and quiet, service is exceptional, friendly and the food plain delicious

ron guillot

As always Kobe An is some of the best Sushi in town!  They were great when they were located in Lakewood and now Cherry Creek is lucky to have them there!  We have been enjoying Kobe An years and are so glad that they are back open.  The tuna or salmon Carpaccio has always been one of my favorites and Kobe An's is the best!  Don't forget to have their Lobster Dynamite too!  The sushi is top grade and never disappoints!  If you are going for a special date night, go for a Tea Room. Very cozy and romantic!  This is the perfect  romantic place to take your significant other!  

Thanks Kimi!!!

Absolutely overrated!!! The sushi was not fresh and I got DIARRHEA for a day after I ate the Lunch Sushi Special. We ordered a chocolate pie (2 small pieces of sushi and cost $8.00) and it tasted so mediocre. Do Not Recommend!!!

My family and I were regulars when Kobe An was in Lakewood and we absolutely love the vibe of the new Cherry Creek location! The sushi is top notch, the staff is extremely friendly and welcoming and I really enjoyed all of the downtempo music that they were playing (Bonobo, Emancipator, Thievery Corporation). 

If you are going for the first time, I highly suggest sitting in one of the Tatami rooms (take your shoes off).

A friendly tip: if you have trouble finding parking on the street, there is a parking lot right around the back of the restaurant where you can park for free :)

If you live in Denver and love sushi as much as we do, you have to check this place out!

Great service, wonderful  happy hour and really tasty food. My boyfriend was so happy that their spicy tuna was actually spicy. Definitely try to get there before 6:30 for their happy hour and sit in the bar. There are so many food options to choose from you never need to stray away from the HH menu.

Excellent lunch today at Kobe An. So happy to see them now in Cherry Creek. Free off street parking in the back. Restaurant located downstairs, Same great food and service as the old Lakewood location but now closer to me . Yippie. Miso is the best I have had. House salad was very flavorful. Hubby and I both ordered the Lunch Tempura Sushi Combo. Excellent value. Plus had to get the Uni. Buttery and delicious. Large seating area with plenty of Tatami rooms for special occasions or sit up front at the sushi bar. Can't wait to come back,
Kimmie the owner was wonderful to deal with. The food was exceptional. The atmosphere just what you would hope! I loved it here and can't wait to go back!

Having recently moved out of Colorado, Kobe An is one of the few things I truly miss about Denver. My wife and I started going there at their old (Lakewood) location. Once they moved, we continued to go, despite the longer commute. Their cuisine is some of the best in town, and it was well worth the drive.

The thing that continually astounded me was just how fresh their fish was, considering they're in a middle-of-the-country, landlocked location. Kimie (the owner) is from Japan, and so when they boast authentic cuisine, they mean it. Keep in mind, their cuisine isn't from the typical region we normally see here, so some flavors and dishes will be different than your typical Japanese restaurant. However, I found this to be incredibly enjoyable.

The menu has an incredible amount of variety. For lunch, I'd frequently get their bento boxes, which are just divine. For dinner, we would mix it up from time to time, but our favorite (and our main draw) were their miso soup, the to-die-for gyoza, and of course their incredible sushi rolls. They have a lot of the classic rolls, but they have their own creations too (the Kobe An roll and the Ninja roll are both amazing, if you like spicy flavors).

My wife and I already miss Kobe An so much, now that we live in a different state. We frequently say that we should visit Denver just for this restaurant, and we're only half-joking. That's how good it is. Give it a shot; you won't be disappointed!
They have beautiful little tea rooms with fake tatami mats and fake shoji screens, but I love it.  Check their website for free parking one door up many days of the week

It is in North Cherry Creek we were happy to find this place close by, and disappointed by the quality of the sushi. Let's say the food was not good enough to for us to finish it let alone return to this place.

While our server did not know the menu her attentiveness and speed made up for it and the food was great. Ordered different sushi items and reg menu items, all were some of the best we've had, even ordered to go because it was so good.

I am from LA and I have LA standards... I know this is like the only japanese shabu place in Denver. I went here with three other friends and had all you can eat shabu. The meat was chewy and sauce and broth wasn't very good. I don't think I am going back. Wasn't bad though.

Came here for my birthday dinner with several friends, and had such a great time!  Staff was great, food was amazing, drinks were on point, and had a blast from start to finish.  The tatami room was a BIT crowded with one extra person, but whatever, we made due pretty easily.
I had grown up with the Lakewood location, and was seriously bummed out when I found out they were being ushered out of their long-time and comfortable home.  Imagine my excitement when I discovered they were actually moving closer to me!  I was a bit concerned about it the quality would deteriorate in Cherry Creek, but was pleasantly surprised to find this was not an issue whatsoever.
Sushi was great and fresh, and I had a perfect meal with some great friends in a great environment.  Will absolutely be back multiple times!

Went there for lunch and ordered the lunch bento box, which turned out to be a huge disappointment. The salad and tempura were alright, but the chicken teriyaki was the worst chicken teriyaki I have ever had. The fried rice at first also tasted weird to me, until it was explained that it had a lot of white pepper, which I think was unevenly spread in the rice. Hence the strong taste. Maybe the dinner will be better, but the lunch was definitely a disappointment.

Awful!! The seafood was not fresh. I had dinner there Friday night and experienced violent diarrhea the entire next day! Just wish I had read a prior post on Yelp that had the exact same experience 3 weeks before I went there.

Kobe An is a hidden gem in Cherry Creek North.

I had the shrimp tempura and it was fantastic. This is the best tempura I have ever had; perfectly cooked and hot from the fryer. The tempura comes with tempura vegetables too, so there is an ample amount of food. Even a vegetable hater will love the tempura vegetables. The miso soup is delightful and the salad with miso dressing was delicious.

The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated; even the restrooms a worth a visit. The owner is a beautiful and gracious woman. She has had restaurants in Boulder and Lakewood. This Cherry Creek location is her most recent venture and it is worth a visit again and again.
Love the food and the atmosphere. Being from Florida, I've eaten a lot of great sushi and this place measures up. Their noodle bowls are also delicious and interactive!

This place is amazing. it is authentic japanese food that is delicious. They are more than willing to help you understand the food choices, and they also can offer great suggestions. Food is coked quickly, they even have authentic rice. I will be going back here for sure. Great lunch option.
Happy hour is bar only. This was not in the web site and we were already seated when we found out. Food was decent, but a bit over priced.

Great place!  California rolls are the bomb and Chris Loved his platter :) Originally found this place in Lakewood (years ago then they moved.) For our son's 33 bday we were back! for the Deluxe Chef Choice Sushimi - Excellent!  My husband had the Seafood Tempura, love the shrimp and fish. The Octopi was a little tough but the Scallops were Amazing! Defiantly coming back!

Love this place! Great selection between sushi, ramen, udon, or teriyaki. Something for everyone. And, the staff is sooooo nice! Lots of seating, either at the bar to watch the sushi chefs, or more private seating in booths. Last time I went there, they made me a custom-ordered sushi roll, so I was a very happy girl! And their ramen is only $9, and it's a huge portion, so it's a better deal than you can get elsewhere in town.
Had the shabu shabu. It was really good! The service was excellent. I will come back again for sure and try a new dish.

Wonderfully delicious! A delightful dining experience. We reserved one of the tea boxes and had an awesome time. The owner helped my husband when he was trying to use the chop sticks (quite hilariously, but he finally got the hang of it!) and his shabu shabu dish. He said it was so good! He really liked the sauce that Kimmie recommended and helped him put together. Their gyoza was perfection! I got the yakisoba and it honestly was the best I have ever had. Both dishes are huge portions. We tried the calamari steak for the appetizer and of course it was delicious! Even the green tea ice cream was marvelous. This is truly a gem and we will be coming back!
One of the BEST sushi places in Colorado. Amazing selection of fish. Adorable little tea rooms-perfect for a romantic, intimate date.
I went there with one of my friends because I was told it is the best in Denver.great food but a bit expensive！The environment and service are perfect.

This is our most favorite  Japanese Restaurant in Cherry Creek!  Service is excellent, food is tasty and have  great ambience.   Kime, the owner is very friendly and respectful to customers.  This restaurant is new and since it is in a basement, people may not know about it.   It is worth checking out.
First class Decore and first-class service and food. A real gem for the Cherry Creek North area. Not very busy yet but there's no reason they shouldn't be. Enjoy.

We had another great dinner here tonight. We were regulars at their Lakewood location and are loving the new Cherry Creek Location. The fish is always superb and the service fantastic. 


I can't say enough good things about Kobe An.

By far our favorite sushi place in Cherry Creek. The sushi is fresh and beautifully done, but it doesn't stop at fish. Their extensive menu of Japanese favorites like noodle bowls and teriyaki makes it one of the few restaurants in town that both adults and all four teenagers in our house can feel equally excited about the food. Everything is delicious. Bonus: they have a surprisingly decent selection Colorado craft beers.

I was excited when I heard Kobe An was moving to Cherry Creek because it is so much closer to me now. Lots of great options on the menu. The food was awesome and the price was great, especially considering it is in Cherry Creek.  

The restaurant is super cute and has a huge sushi bar and the most adorable tea rooms for private dining. 

They have great lunch specials too!

Kobe An has an amazing dessert option.  Order the tempura banana split. The banana is perfectly fried and is surrounded by two scoops of ice cream, assorted fruit, and a dollop of whipped cream in each corner of the plate. Then, atop all that is a sprinkling of cinnamon sugar. Mmmm, mmmm, mmmm!
I've had the pleasure of eating at their new place twice now. Love the new decor and the food is still fantastic! If you want really great sushi Kobe An is your place to go!

I saw Kobe An's ad in the Life on Capitol Hill newspaper and I'm so glad I did. This place is amazing!  It's gorgeous and authentically decorated interior provides an atmosphere that lends to a peaceful, calm and serene dining experience that I absolutely love. The food is literally the best sushi I've ever had. The service is always spot on and I look forward to visiting Kobe An's every time I'm in town. Kimmie, thank you for your personal attention to our experience.

We are loving this new addition to Cherry Creek North dining scene. Offering authentic Japanese cuisine, sushi and ramen! Our favorites so far include Kimie's recipe potstickers, shabu shabu and miso soups (incredibly delicious) - can't wait to try more!

Went here for dinner last night. Sushi was fresh, everything was delicious, the dynamite sauce was amazing! Service was fantastic, Gregory was great, the owner stopped by as well. We sat in a tea room, it was really cool!

Amazing! Our waiter, Rick was awesome, so professional, respectful, polite, and knowledgeable about the menu! The quality of the sushi was very good! The best sushi in Colorado! The ambiance was relaxing yet classy! Eating here makes a fun experience and is a great place to go with a group, we sat at one of the private rooms where they have pillows seats on the ground, which gives it that cultural experience. We met the owner Kimmie who was very kind and made us feel welcomed like we were in her home. The eel tasted so fresh, same with the tuna and salmon sashimi

I love sushi but not at this place. Fish was too thin and not fresh it looks few days old when compare to other high end sushi bar(Sushi Den, Blue Sushi, etc.). It didn't  stink but texture and smell of fresh fish wasn't  there. 
And we sat at the tea room and they charge $5.00 for the room we didn't know till I got the check, if I ever go back I'll eat standing up.

I was in the Cherry Creek area on a week day recently and needed lunch but did not want to pay too much money for it. I happened to walk past Kobe An with a sign for a $10 lunch special that included veggie tempura, miso soup, white or friend rice, california roll pieces, and some sushi.  That sounded like a deal so I went in!

I am allergic to shellfish and I noticed that one of the sushi pieces came with shrimp (the others were tuna and salmon).  I asked the water if I could exchange it for something else (assuming that they did not do substitutions or would charge me extras).  They happily obliged for another piece of fish at NO CHARGE!

The food and service were delicious.  I will come back again soon!

Great vibes at this place and good food. Ramen was tasty and the sushi really hit the spot. Opt for the tea room. Totally worth it. Nothing like having a relaxing meal with no shoes! Will definitely be coming back here!
Love Kobe An! The seating set up is better than the Lakewood location! So glad they moved into Denver. Not to be missed!
Really long wait for the sushi.  Sushi was not good.   I would have rather gone to Taco Bell.   Save your money.  What a disappointment.

Went there during their claimed lunch times, was given a lunch menu a few minutes after we ordered was told it was dinner pricing. Pricing was much higher and food was average. Ambience is nice but that is where it ends ... Overpriced.
Great service, soothing atmosphere, and delicious food! Their house salad is amazing, as well as their tempura chicken! I also recommend the green tea!
Great sushi spot for a group of people! Fun atmosphere. Food was pretty good too! We'll go back!

Nice! A great option for when you want really nice, flavorful fresh sushi!
As much as I love Sushi Den, it is nice to have a more low-key alternative option with comparable quality. Atmopshere is very clean and pleasant.
This will be a favorite, for sure! Can't wait to dig into more sushi soon!

A group of 5 of us went out for a birthday dinner.  I chose this restaurant based on the reviews I read. They didn't disappoint. The restaurant was slow, but it was a Tuesday and they are new to the area. The inside of the restaurant is decorated nicely and looks clean. We had some miso soup, calamari tempura, and dynamite shrimp (amazing) to start. We got a variety of 6 rolls and they were accommodating to any substitutions/ customizations our group requested. I assume who was the manager came over and talked with the table and brought us plum liquor of some sort that they make in house.   Everything we ordered tasted fresh and was presented nicely.  It was a great first experience at this restaurant and the next time I'm craving sushi, I'll be back!
Outstanding food quality with great rolls and very creative specialty rolls. One of the better spots in Cherry Creek. Large restaurant and haven't had trouble getting in.

Ordered the udon soup no chicken - got the fried Udon with chicken - not impressed with service overall - sushi was not great - the other food might have been good but  hard to taste past the service - oh and not a single comped item after such a mistake - full bill - have a nice night

This place is a true gem! I loved how quaint the atmosphere was and how friendly the staff was. The menu was great. . I loved the vegetable tempura and pickled japanese vegetables.  We also had a nato handroll to start which was great. . The sushi was great too. . We met the owner and she was amazing. I loved our experience here and I will be back for sure. If you like authentic japanese and an intimate setting I would highly recommend Kobe An.
Food was fresh and sushi was excellent. Service was prompt and courteous and the owner checked to make sure we were having a pleasant experience. The tea rooms definitely add to the atmosphere.
Sad they moved from Lakewood but worth the drive anyway. Great service and fantastic sushi. Highly recommend.
Really good sushi at a good price.  Big, beautiful place.  Great service.  Lots of small rooms available if desired.

This is a beautiful restaurant with first rate Japanese food.  The Tatami rooms are secluded and fun; overall the restaurant was clean and very comfortable.  The Shabu Shabu is HUGE, tons of fresh veg and deliciously thin cut Rib Eye.  The tempura calamari or vegetables are both a must have, light and crispy, not greasy at all; the perfect batter clung to its host food and didn't fall off after one bite.  The Sashimi is first rate and extremely fresh and the miso soup was buttery, rich and delicious!  Pork Katsu is always good, but here it's enormous and so crispy.  The Early Dinner plates are a great value if you are there before 6.  Service was great!
This the best sushi I've had in a long time! The restaurant is nice and quiet and wait staff very friendly!! Loved the Tatami room!
